headlines: India responds after Pakistan officials stop guests at Iftar party
text: After Pakistan officials turned away guests who were invited at an Iftar party organised by the Indian High Commission in Islamabad, India called it a complete violation of diplomatic norms. "The disappointing chain of events...are against all notions of civilised behaviour," the Indian High Commission in Islamabad said. Cars used by guests were lifted and removed using forklifts, it added.

headlines: BJP mixing religion, politics through Jai Shri Ram slogan: Mamata
text: WB CM Mamata Banerjee today alleged BJP is mixing religion with politics by using the 'Jai Shri Ram' slogan. "We don't respect this forcible enforcement of political slogans on others in the name of so called RSS which Bengal never accepted," she wrote. "One can fool some people sometimes, but cannot fool all the people all the time," she added.

headlines: IITian cheats hundreds with fake laptop scheme under PM's name
text: Rakesh Jangid, a 23-year-old IIT postgraduate of 2019 batch, has been arrested for allegedly cheating people with a free laptop scheme through a fake website under PM Modi's name. The website was visited by 15 lakh people within two days. Jangid aimed to earn from advertisements on the website and collect personal data of people registering there and sell it.

headlines: Madrassa teacher who sexually abused minors for 38 years arrested
text: A 63-year-old madrassa teacher, who sexually abused several students in the past 38 years, was arrested in Kerala on Saturday after a complaint by a mosque committee. "Yusuf confessed to raping kids since he was 25. A victim of sexual assault as a child, Yusuf took his revenge by raping the daughter of the man who raped him," police said.

headlines: Twitter apologises for suspending accounts critical of China
text: Twitter apologised for suspending accounts critical of China days before the 30th anniversary of the country's crackdown on pro-democracy protests at the Tiananmen Square, Reuters reported. "These accounts were not mass reported by the Chinese authorities Â— this was a routine action on our part," the company tweeted, adding, "Sometimes our routine actions catch false positives or we make errors."

headlines: 'Anti-spam challenge' to 19 crore Twitter accounts in 2nd half of 2018
text: Twitter issued anti-spam challenges to 19.35 crore accounts in 2018's second half, 17% lesser than first half, its transparency report stated. As part of 'anti-spam challenge', Twitter may require account holder to verify phone number or email address, or complete reCAPTCHA to verify human is controlling account. Accounts which fail to complete a challenge within specific period may be suspended.

headlines: Hindi not our mother tongue, do not enforce it: MNS
text: Protesting against the draft National Education Policy, Maharashtra NavNirman Sena (MNS) leader Anil Shidore on Sunday said, "Hindi is not our mother tongue, do not enforce it on us and incite us." The draft of New Education Policy prepared by the Kasturirangan Committee recommended the teaching of Hindi in non-Hindi speaking states in addition to the regional language and English.

headlines: GoI respects all languages, nothing will be imposed: Jaishankar
text: Minister of External Affairs S Jaishankar on Sunday said that Government of India (GoI) "respects all languages" and that "no language will be imposed". His comment came amid a raging controversy over the draft National Education Policy, which favours Hindi teaching compulsory up to Class 8. Jaishankar said that the draft will be finalised only after consulting the State Governments.

headlines: My family was worried over our age gap: Milind's 26 yrs younger wife
text: Speaking to 'Humans of Bombay', model-actor Milind Soman's wife Ankita Konwar revealed that when they decided to get married, her family was worried about the 26-year age gap between them. She added, "It wasn't an issue for us!... When they...saw how happy I was around him, they agreed too!" Milind and Ankita dated for 5 years before they got married.

headlines: Shakib fastest cricketer to reach 250 wickets and 5,000 runs in ODIs
text: Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan has become the fastest cricketer to reach 250 wickets and 5,000 runs in ODI cricket. The 32-year-old achieved the feat after taking his 250th wicket by dismissing South Africa opener Aiden Markram in Bangladesh's first 2019 World Cup match on Sunday. Shakib took 199 ODI matches to complete the double.

headlines: B'desh score their highest total in ODIs in their 1st 2019 WC match
text: Bangladesh recorded their highest-ever total in ODIs by scoring 330/6 against South Africa in their first 2019 World Cup match at Kennington Oval today. Bangladesh's previous highest total of 329/6 had come against Pakistan on April 17, 2015 at Dhaka. Mushfiqur Rahim and Shakib Al Hasan shared a 142-run stand for third wicket, Bangladesh's highest partnership in World Cup history.

headlines: Have to be very careful: Trump to UK over Huawei use in 5G
text: US President Donald Trump in an interview with the Sunday Times urged Britain to be "very careful" about involving Huawei in its new 5G network. When asked about reports that Britain is planning to give Huawei a limited role, he said, "Well, you have other alternatives and we have to be very careful from the standpoint of national security."

headlines: J'khand panchayat weds minors as they talked on phone for long hours
text: A 17-year-old boy in Jharkhand's Lohardaga district was made to marry a 13-year-old girl by the panchayat apparently because they talked to each other on phone for "long durations". Raj Kumar Verma, chairperson of the Child Welfare Committee, said they have taken cognisance of the matter. "Consent is immaterial in such cases and everyone involved...could be penalised," said Verma.

headlines: Wife hammers Navy man to death after years of domestic abuse, held
text: An Indian Navy personnel's wife was arrested on Sunday for murder after she allegedly bludgeoned her husband to death following years of domestic violence, Goa Police said. "In the evening he had walked in drunk and had picked a quarrel. In the night when he slept, she hammered him. Since he was intoxicated, he couldn't respond," said police.

headlines: Woman axed to death by husband after failing to have baby in Bihar
text: A man allegedly killed his wife in Bihar on Saturday by attacking her with an axe, blaming her for the couple's childless state. The police arrested him and seized the axe. They had been married for eight years, and the couple's inability to have a child had put a great strain on their relationship, said the locals to the police.

headlines: Class 12 fail claims being IPS, gives speeches on cracking UPSC; held
text: The Special Operations Group (SOG) in Jaipur arrested 20-year-old Abhay Meena, a youth who failed Class 12th examinations and was pretending to be an IPS officer. Meena used to deliver motivational speeches on how to crack IIT and UPSC exams in the first attempt. A person suspected Meena after his police card misspelt 'branch' as 'branche' and 'capital' as 'capitol'.

headlines: Man arrested in Kerala for sexually exploiting over 50 women online
text: A 25-year-old Kerala man has been arrested for sexually exploiting over 50 women he had befriended over social media by blackmailing them with their morphed obscene photos. The accused used to talk to husbands of the women posing as female on Facebook and then used to forward the chats to the women to convince them about their spouse's "illicit relationships."

headlines: British Airways resumes flights to Pakistan post 10-yr suspension
text: The British Airways on Sunday resumed flights to Pakistan, more than 10 years after a hotel bombing led to the route being suspended. The airline stopped flying to Pakistan after a bombing at the Marriott Hotel in Islamabad in September 2008, killing more than 50 people and injuring over 250. British Airways is the only western airline to serve Pakistan.

headlines: We will improve and come back stronger: Afghanistan's Zadran
text: Afghanistan's Najibullah Zadran, who was his side's top-scorer in their World Cup match against Australia on Saturday, said, "We will improve for the next game and come back stronger." "We are a good side and I think we can beat any side in the world... I am confident we can cause some upsets in this tournament," Zadran added.

headlines: Federer beats Mayer to reach French Open quarter-finals
text: Swiss tennis star Roger Federer beat Leonardo Mayer to reach the quarter-final stage of the French Open 2019 on Sunday. Federer has not dropped a set at this edition of the French Open. This is the 12th time Federer has reached the French Open quarter-finals. Federer becomes the oldest man in 28 years to reach a Grand Slam quarter-final.

headlines: Champions League win only the start: Liverpool coach Klopp
text: Liverpool coach Jurgen Klopp said that the Champions League win for Liverpool is only the start. "This is only the start for this group, it's a wonderful age group, they still have the best times in their career still ahead of them, so that's big," Klopp said after the Champions League win on Sunday.

headlines: Windies can match anybody in this competition: Clive Lloyd
text: Following Windies' win over Pakistan in the World Cup 2019, former West Indies captain Clive Lloyd, who led the team to two World Cup titles, said, "This game has proven that we have some firepower and that means we can match anybody in this competition." "I'm sure they will upset a few of the big boys," Lloyd added.

headlines: India will face England in final of the World Cup 2019: Ashwin
text: Indian spinner Ravichandran Ashwin said that according to him India and hosts England will face off in the final of the World Cup 2019. "The way Virat paces his innings and the kind of firepower that Rohit has, he is one of those batsmen who can change gears any time. Apart from that we have a balanced setup," Ashwin added.

headlines: Joshua registers first pro defeat, loses world titles to Ruiz
text: Andy Ruiz Jr registered one of the biggest upsets of heavyweight boxing to clinch British boxer Anthony Joshua's IBF, WBO and WBA world heavyweight titles by handing him his first professional defeat at the Madison Square Garden today. Joshua was supposed to originally fight Jarrell Miller but Ruiz had been roped in for this fight at six weeks' notice.

headlines: We are bad outside home: Chhetri on Indian team
text: Speaking about India's football team and new coach Igor Stimac, captain Sunil Chhetri said, "We don't generally do well outside our country. In the last 13 years, we have done alright at home but we are bad outside home." "We understand what the coach wants and he understands exactly the kind of pool he has to choose from," Chhetri added.

headlines: No question of intervening: TRAI on dip in mobile user base
text: TRAI Chairman R S Sharma said mobile subscriber base drop isn't a cause of worry and that "there is no question of (TRAI) intervening". Sharma told PTI these fluctuations are due to multiple factors like telecom operators starting monthly minimal recharge. Total wireless subscribers declined from 1,183.68 million in February end to 1,161.81 million in March end, as per TRAI.

headlines: Apple deletes all posts on iTunes' Facebook page, Instagram account
text: Apple has cleared content from its Facebook page and Instagram account for iTunes including posts, photos and videos. This comes after a Bloomberg report stated Apple plans to shut down iTunes and launch a trio of new apps - Music, TV, and Podcasts - to replace it. Reportedly, cached version of iTunes' Facebook page had content available on May 31.

headlines: PM writes to Veeru Devgan's wife after his demise; Ajay thanks him
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has written a letter to Veena Devgan, late action director Veeru Devgan's wife and actor Ajay Devgn's mother, condoling Veeru's demise. PM Modi wrote, "May he continue to inspire risk-takers...because it is those who take risks that define the direction our world takes." Thanking the PM, Ajay tweeted, "My Mother &...Devgan family are deeply touched."

headlines: Didn't attend Kapil's show for 'Bharat' as I didn't want to: Sunil
text: Actor-comedian Sunil Grover, who did not attend 'The Kapil Sharma Show' to promote the film 'Bharat', said, "I did not feel like going there so I did not go." "It was not necessary for me to go there because if you have Salman Khan and Katrina Kaif promoting a film, you don't need any other element," he added.

headlines: I wasn't defending Janhvi over Katrina's remark on outfit: Sonam
text: After media reports said Sonam Kapoor was defending her cousin Janhvi over Katrina Kaif's remarks that she's "concerned over the very short shorts that she wears to the gym", Sonam clarified she wasn't defending her. "It's an inside joke," she added. Sonam had shared a picture of Janhvi with the caption, "She also wears regular clothes and rocks it."

headlines: Neymar shares video of chat with woman who accused him of rape
text: World's most expensive footballer Neymar took to Instagram to share a seven-minute video wherein he denies the rape accusations against him and shares his WhatsApp chat with the accuser. In the chat, the woman can be seen sharing her intimate pictures. Neymar claimed he has been the victim of an extortion attempt by a lawyer claiming to represent the accuser.

headlines: US-based science publisher bars Huawei from reviewing papers
text: US-headquartered science publisher IEEE restricted listed Huawei companies and their employees from certain activities not generally open to public in compliance with US government regulations. These include some publication peer review and editorial process aspects. Reportedly, the China Computer Federation said it'll suspend collaborations with IEEE Communications Society over the development.

headlines: Cong social media head quits Twitter days post congratulating Sitharaman
text: Congress party's social media manager and actress Divya Spandana has deleted both her Twitter and Instagram accounts, however, her Facebook account is still active. In her last tweet, she had congratulated Nirmala Sitharaman on becoming the Union Finance Minister. When ANI asked her if she has parted ways with the team quoting sources, she responded, "Your source is wrong."

headlines: Elon Musk loses $4.9 billion as Tesla shares tumble 43% in 2019
text: US-based carmaker Tesla's CEO Elon Musk has lost $4.9 billion from his Tesla stake's value as the stock tumbled 43% in 2019, the worst-ever start to a year for the company. In total, Tesla's four biggest individual shareholders lost $7.8 billion. Musk is now the 46th richest person with $19.5 billion wealth, down from 29th at year's beginning, Bloomberg said.

headlines: Car sales slump in May; Maruti, Honda, Mahindra, Toyota see drop
text: Passenger vehicles sales in May continued to decline for top carmakers due to weak retail demand. Sales at Maruti Suzuki India, Mahindra & Mahindra, Honda Cars India and Toyota Kirloskar Motor India dropped up to 28% year-on-year during May. Additionally, sales of mini cars, comprising Alto and old WagonR, fell 57% y-o-y during May 2019.

headlines: Haryana man shoots wife and 4-yr-old daughter before killing himself
text: A 37-year-old man in Haryana's Jhajjar district shot dead his wife and a four-year-old daughter before killing himself at his residence on Saturday. Police said he left a suicide note in which he took responsibility for killing his wife and daughter and committing suicide. The man, identified as Dinesh Kumar, worked as a private security guard in Delhi.

headlines: Siblings die as wall of under-construction house collapses in Punjab
text: Two siblings, aged seven and four, died after a wall of an under-construction house collapsed in Punjab's Ludhiana on Saturday. The brother and sister had taken shelter there from rain and dust-storm that hit the city in the evening. The children, who were injured in the wall collapse, were rushed to a hospital where doctors declared them dead on arrival.

headlines: Folk dancer Queen Harish, 3 others die in road accident in Rajasthan
text: Famous folk dancer Harish Kumar and three other folk artists were killed in a road accident near Jodhpur in Rajasthan on Sunday. The mishap occurred on a highway in Jodhpur when the artists' SUV collided with a stationary truck. A Jaisalmer native, Kumar was popularly known as 'Queen Harish' and his shows included folk dance forms like Ghoomar and Kalbelia.

headlines: Driverless train crashes after going in wrong direction; 14 injured
text: Fourteen passengers were injured after a driverless five-car train in suburban Tokyo went in the wrong direction and crashed into a buffer stop. The train travelled in the wrong direction for about 25 metres, Japanese media reported. The company that was operating the train said three people were monitoring and controlling the operation at the time of the accident.

headlines: US says it is checking reports that North Korea executed envoy
text: US State Secretary Mike Pompeo has said the country is checking reports that a senior North Korean official involved in nuclear negotiations with the US had been executed. Reports claimed North Korea's special envoy to the US Kim Hyok-chol was executed over the failure of the recent summit between the North Korean leader Kim Jong-un and US President Donald Trump.

headlines: SpiceJet Chairman Ajay Singh elected to IATA board
text: SpiceJet's Chairman and Managing Director Ajay Singh was on Sunday elected to the board of the International Air Transport Association (IATA). The development comes less than three months after the airline joined the global group. Founder and former chairman of the now grounded Jet Airways Naresh Goyal was a member on the previous board.

headlines: INLD will rise again in Assembly polls: Om Prakash Chautala
text: Following the general polls debacle, INLD chief Om Prakash Chautala said that with "hard work and by reinvigorating" itself, the party will "rise again" in the Assembly elections. He added, "I'll visit every place in Haryana and remain in touch with party workers." Chautala further said workers are the "backbone" of the party and will bring the "old days back".

headlines: Best night of our professional lives: Liverpool coach Klopp
text: Following Liverpool's Champions League win on Saturday, coach Jurgen Klopp termed the night as "the best night of our professional lives". "Without this manager this is impossible. You go through tough times in a season, but what he has done since coming in is unbelievable," Liverpool captain Jordan Henderson said about Klopp.

headlines: Salah dances in dressing room after Champions League win
text: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah was seen dancing in the dressing room after his side won the Champions League on Saturday. Salah, who held his winners' medal between his teeth while dancing, had scored Liverpool's first goal of the match in the second minute. The video of Salah's dance was shared by Liverpool defender Dejan Lovren.

headlines: Serena may seek grass-court wildcard ahead of Wimbledon
text: Former world number one Serena Williams, who lost in the third round in the French Open 2019, said that she might seek a wildcard entry into a grass-court tournament to prepare for the Wimbledon 2019. Williams was bidding for a record-equalling 24th Grand Slam singles in Paris but the 10th seed was knocked out 6-2, 7-5 by compatriot Sofia Kenin.

headlines: Huawei decreases its phone production after US ban: Report
text: Taiwanese electronics manufacturer Foxconn has reportedly stopped several production lines for Huawei phones as the Chinese company reduced orders for new phones. The decreased production comes after Foxconn initiated a recruitment drive earlier this year due to Huawei's surging sales, the report added. In mid-May, the US blacklisted Huawei and its affiliates over alleged espionage concerns

headlines: Punjab CM seeks PM Modi's help to curb drug menace in state
text: Reiterating his demand for a national drugs policy to check the drug menace, Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh has sought PM Narendra Modi's intervention, an official said. Reportedly, Singh asked PM Modi to formulate a national policy on enforcement, de-addiction and prevention of drug abuse. Singh also urged PM Modi to advise concerned ministries to address the issue seriously.

headlines: Will never be part of NDA-led Union Cabinet even in future: JD(U)
text: Days after Nitish Kumar-led JD(U) opted out of Union Cabinet in protest of getting one ministry, JD(U) spokesperson KC Tyagi on Sunday said that in future also the party will "never be a part of the NDA-led Union Cabinet". Tyagi further asserted that this is the party's "final decision". However, Bihar CM Kumar said that "everything's fine" with the BJP.

headlines: Groupon Co-founder's healthtech startup Tempus raises $200mn
text: Groupon Co-founder Eric Lefkofsky's biotechnology startup Tempus has raised $200 million at a valuation of $3.1 billion. Founded in September 2015, the Chicago-based startup enables physicians to deliver personalised cancer care for patients through its interactive analytical and machine learning platform. As per Forbes, Lefkofsky founded Tempus after his wife was diagnosed with breast cancer.

headlines: 84 airports to install body scanners by March 2020
text: Replacing existing door frame metal detectors and hand-held scanners, the Centre has directed 84 (28 hypersensitive and 56 sensitive) airports across the country to install body scanners by March 2020. The Centre also stated the Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) that 84 airports would have to follow while using body scanners. Body scanners detect both metallic and non-metallic items, it said.

headlines: Telangana marching ahead, progressing as fruitful state: KCR
text: Addressing the public on the fifth Telangana statehood day, state CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Sunday said that it was marching ahead and progressing as a fruitful state. He added Telangana could overcome several hurdles and obstacles during the last five years. The CM further claimed that the government was successful in improving standards in education and health sectors.

headlines: I don't take Salman's comments on Priyanka seriously: Katrina
text: Actress Katrina Kaif, while speaking about her 'Bharat' co-star Salman Khan's remarks on Priyanka Chopra's exit from the film, said, "He just says it for effect, he does not mean it...I don't take it seriously." "You have to take everything that Salman (Khan) says with a big bucket of salt. I think we all know that by now," she added.

headlines: Vivek accidentally promotes Salman's Bharat, deletes tweet later
text: Actor Vivek Oberoi had mistakenly promoted Salman Khan starrer 'Bharat' on Twitter by using '#Bharat' when he tweeted to congratulate PM Modi on the occasion of his swearing-in ceremony on Thursday. In the tweet, the film's Twitter emoji was also visible. After Twitter users spotted it, the actor deleted the post and tweeted again with the correction.

headlines: She wears regular clothes too: Sonam on Janhvi after Katrina's remark
text: Sonam Kapoor has shared a photo of her cousin Janhvi Kapoor and captioned the story, "She also wears regular clothes and rocks it." This comes after Katrina Kaif said she's "concerned about the very, very short shorts that Jahnvi wears". She said this on 'BFFs with Vogue' after being asked to name a celebrity who goes over-the-top with gym looks.

headlines: Tum logon ka hisab hoga: Rangoli on clean chit to MeToo accused Bahl
text: After sexual harassment accused filmmaker Vikas Bahl was given a clean chit, Kangana Ranaut's sister Rangoli Chandel tweeted, "Tum logon ka hisab hoga, there's a world beyond this world, where a woman's cry isn't unheard." "Alok Nath ke baad Vikas Bahl gets clean chit, whereas girls will be shamed all their lives for raising their voices," her tweet further read.

headlines: Regret not believing my daughter's sexual assault story: Ellen's mom
text: US television host Ellen DeGeneres' mother Betty DeGeneres has said she regrets not listening to her daughter when she had opened up to her about being sexually assaulted by her stepfather. "If someone in your life has the courage to speak out, believe them," Betty added. Earlier, Ellen revealed she was sexually exploited by her stepfather when she was 15.

headlines: Kohli injures thumb during practice ahead of WC opener: Reports
text: India captain Virat Kohli reportedly injured his thumb during practice at Ageas Bowl stadium in Southampton on Saturday. Physiotherapist Patrick Farhart was seen applying spray on the 30-year-old's right thumb. Kohli was also seen leaving the ground with his thumb immersed in ice water. India are scheduled to play their first 2019 World Cup match against South Africa on Wednesday.

headlines: Model invades pitch in CL final wearing swimsuit, shares pic
text: A female model invaded the pitch wearing a swimsuit during Champions League final between Tottenham and Liverpool at Madrid's Metropolitano Stadium on Saturday. Kinsey Wolanski ran onto the pitch to promote her boyfriend Russian-American YouTuber Vitaly Zdorovetskiy's porn site. She later shared a picture of herself being escorted by the security, writing, "Did I distract #8 a little too much?"

headlines: World's most expensive telescope's parts cleared for use in space
text: NASA's $8.8-billion James Webb Space Telescope, the world's largest and most expensive one, has successfully passed final thermal vacuum test, making its parts cleared for use in space. The 6.5-metre diameter telescope has 18 gold-coated mirrors and a tennis court-sized sun-shield to gather light and protect its instruments. The telescope, set to launch in 2021, took 20 years to build.

headlines: How was India benefitting from US trade privileges?
text: India was the largest beneficiary of the US' Generalized System of Preferences in 2017 with around $5.7 billion in exports to US given duty-free status, according to a Congressional Research Service report. In 2018, some $6.3 billion of Indian merchandise exports to the US were covered by GSP. US will end its preferential trade treatment for India on June 5.

headlines: Former J&K CM Omar Abdullah calls terrorist Burhan Wani 'sahib'
text: In an interview, former Jammu & Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah referred to former Hizbul Mujahideen commander Burhan Wani as "sahib". Omar said this after he was asked about his views on suspension of internet services after death of J&K's most wanted terrorist Zakir Musa. Burhan Wani was killed in an encounter in J&K's Anantnag district in July 2016.

headlines: Talks with US possible only if it shows 'respect': Iran President
text: Iranian President Hassan Rouhani on Saturday suggested that his country may hold talks with the US if it shows respect, adding that Iran would not be pressured into negotiations. In recent weeks, the US hinted at military confrontation, saying it was sending extra forces to the Middle East to respond to an Iranian threat.

headlines: War with US would be a disaster: China amid rising tensions
text: Amid rising tensions between the two countries over increased US support for self-ruled and democratic Taiwan, China's Defence Minister Wei Fenghe has said that a war with the US would be a disaster for the world. He added that China would "fight to the end" if anyone tried to interfere in its relationship with Taiwan.

headlines: Work hard to dislodge Kejriwal govt: Manoj Tiwari to workers
text: Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari has asked party workers to "work hard for dislodging" the Arvind Kejriwal government in the upcoming Assembly elections in the national capital. Tiwari also felicitated party workers for winning all the seven Delhi Lok Sabha seats. Kejriwal, on the other hand, is urging AAP workers to ask votes based on the government's work.

headlines: Apple to let users download up to 200 MB apps on mobile data
text: Apple has raised the size limit of individual apps that can be downloaded from its App Store using mobile data to 200 MB from the past 150 MB. However, to download apps bigger than 200 MB in size, users will need to use WiFi. Apple had officially increased the App Store cellular download limit to 150 MB in September 2017.

headlines: President, PM greet people on 5th Telangana statehood day
text: President Ram Nath Kovind and PM Narendra Modi on Sunday extended greetings to the people on the fifth Telangana statehood day. "My best wishes to all the residents of the state for a bright and prosperous future," President said. PM Modi said, "Telangana is known for its hardworking citizens who are making great contributions to our nation's development."

headlines: Will work to increase job opportunities in MSMEs: Gadkari
text: Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) Minister Nitin Gadkari on Saturday said he would work with "full strength" to increase job opportunities in the sector. He added it's PM Narendra Modi's "expectation" that employment should increase from this sector. Gadkari, who's also the Minister for Road Transport and Highways, said he has decided to create "roadside amenities" across the country.

headlines: Muslims got their share during partition: BJP leader Bhandari
text: Referring to India's partition and formation of Pakistan, Maharashtra BJP leader Madhav Bhandari on Sunday said that Muslims were given their share in 1947. Responding to AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi's statement that Muslims are not tenants in India, he added, "It'd be good if Owaisi Sahab speaks before due consideration." Bhandari further said no one has called Owaisi a "tenant".

headlines: Shah pays tribute at National Police Memorial in New Delhi
text: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday paid tributes to martyrs at the National Police Memorial in New Delhi. "Received untamed consciousness and energy visiting the memorial and also the desire to do everything for the country was strengthened," Shah said. The Home Minister further added, "A grateful nation is indebted to them for their supreme sacrifice."

headlines: Over 50 vehicles gutted in dumping ground fire in Delhi
text: More than 50 vehicles were gutted in a fire at a police station dumping ground situated near Delhi's Sagarpur on Saturday. Reportedly, it took nearly an hour for the Delhi Fire Services personnel to douse the flames. Another fire broke out on the second floor of the NDMC building in Connaught Place yesterday, the city's Fire Service said.

headlines: 1 jawan martyred, 4 injured in Naxal encounter in Jharkhand
text: At least one jawan was martyred and four others were injured in a Naxal encounter in Jharkhand's Dumka on Sunday, police said. As per information, "four to five Naxals have been shot", Superintendent of Police, YS Ramesh, said. According to reports, the concerned authorities are monitoring the situation and all the injured are being shifted to a nearby hospital.

headlines: upGrad helps professionals earn MasterÂ’s degree in ML & AI online
text: Liverpool John Moores University (LJMU) and upGrad are offering India's first fully online MSc degree in Machine Learning and AI. Designed specially for working professionals, it offers an 11-month PG Diploma program through IIIT-Bangalore and a 7-month research and thesis submission with LJMU, providing learners with dual credentials. upGrad learners have made career transitions with up to 230% salary hike.

headlines: Liverpool beat Spurs in all-English final to win CL after 14 years
text: Liverpool defeated Tottenham Hotspur (Spurs) 2-0 in an all-English final at the Metropolitano Stadium in Spain's Madrid to win the Champions League after 14 years. Liverpool have now won the Champions League/European Cup six times and are behind only Real Madrid (13) and AC Milan (7). Forwards Mohamed Salah and Divock Origi scored for Liverpool in the final.

headlines: Warner slams 89*(114) as Australia beat Afghanistan in World Cup
text: David Warner, who was playing international cricket after 433 days, scored 89*(114) as Australia defeated Afghanistan by 7 wickets in their first match of 2019 World Cup. Afghanistan's 207 is the highest total by an Asian team in the 2019 World Cup so far. Afghanistan have now lost six of their seven matches in World Cup history.

headlines: What's wrong with pajamas? Sona after Tarek criticises Sarfaraz
text: After Pakistan-born Canadian writer Tarek Fatah criticised Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed for wearing shalwar-kameez to meet the Queen, Indian singer Sona Mohapatra tweeted, "What's wrong with Pajamas, chudidaars, dhotis?" "Authentic, true to our sub-continents roots. No need to suck up or shadow the colonial masters & of yore & their sartorial choices Mr Fatah," she added.

headlines: Lawrence back to direct Akshay's film, thanks him for sorting issues
text: Filmmaker Raghava Lawrence has announced that he is back on board as a director of Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Laxmmi Bomb' after earlier having quit the film claiming that the film's poster was released without informing him. "A big thank you to Akshay Kumar sir for understanding my feelings and sorting all issues," he tweeted. He also thanked producer Shabinaa Khan.

headlines: Pak's Hassan Ali says pizza not junk food, Sania Mirza defends him
text: Indian tennis player Sania Mirza defended Hassan Ali after the Pakistani pacer was trolled on social media for saying that pizza is not junk food and it is good for recovery. "He is actually right! It's very good for recovery especially after long and hard matches...not the full cheesy one but the gourmet ones are definitely very good," she tweeted.

headlines: I don't get Kohli, he gets angry but can't take the abuse: Rabada
text: South Africa's 24-year-old fast bowler Kagiso Rabada has said that he doesn't get Virat Kohli, saying he is a phenomenal player but he can't take the abuse. "When you give it back to him, he gets angry. Maybe he does it because it gets him going, but that comes across as very immature for me," Rabada added.

headlines: 3-time champion Serena crashes out of French Open in third round
text: Three-time champion Serena Williams crashed out of the French Open in the third round after losing to world number 35 Sofia Kenin on Saturday. The 20-year-old Kenin won the match with the scoreline of 6-2, 7-5 in 92 minutes. It was the 37-year-old Serena's first loss in the first week of any major since Wimbledon in 2014.

headlines: Wawrinka registers his 500th win, reaches French Open 4th round
text: World number 28 Stanislas Wawrinka defeated world number 46 Grigor Dimitrov on Saturday to register his career's 500th victory and reach the fourth round of the French Open. The 34-year-old won the match with a scoreline of 7-6(7-5), 7-6(7-4), 7-6(10-8) in three hours and 16 minutes. Wawrinka will next face Greek Stefanos Tsitsipas.

headlines: Tsitsipas first Greek in 83 years to reach French Open last 16
text: Stefanos Tsitsipas has become the first Greek to reach the Round of 16 at French Open since Lazaros Stalios in 1936. The 20-year-old defeated Serbian Filip Krajinovic 7-5, 6-3, 6-7(5-7), 7-6(8-6) in the third round. "I'm proud, proud to be the first one in Open Era," said Tsitsipas who would next face Stanislas Wawrinka.

headlines: Party to send 10 lakh Â‘Jai Shri RamÂ’ postcards to Mamata: BJP MP
text: The BJP will send 10 lakh postcards with 'Jai Shri Ram' written on them to West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, newly-elected BJP MP Arjun Singh said. Singh, an ex-TMC MLA who joined BJP before elections, said this after police lathicharged a group of BJP workers who were chanting 'Jai Shri Ram' during a demonstration outside a TMC meeting venue.

headlines: Saree disappearing from India: Ex-BBC journo on Mimi, Nusrat's pic
text: Tufail Ahmad, a former BBC journalist, is being criticised after he shared the viral Parliament picture of newly-elected Bengali actor-turned-MPs Mimi Chakraborty and Nusrat Jahan, and tweeted, "Saree is disappearing from India". He added, "Next generations will wear it for proms and wedding parties." He also said, "I don't see young women wearing it to offices or other public spaces."

headlines: Man murdered in broad daylight with machetes on highway in Telangana
text: A man identified as Mahboob Pasha was murdered in broad daylight on National Highway 65 near Rudaram village in Telangana's Sangareddy district by three unidentified assailants. The assailants killed the man with machetes and fled the scene on a motorcycle. Police suspect gang rivalry and a revenge plot in the murder.

headlines: 200 buildings damaged due to blasts at Russia explosives factory
text: A series of blasts rocked an explosives factory in the Russian city of Dzerzhinsk on Saturday, damaging nearly 200 buildings. The series of explosions triggered fire at the factory, injuring nearly 80 people, as per reports. The city of Dzerzhinsk has declared an emergency in the areas surrounding the factory and a criminal investigation has been launched.

headlines: Jet's widebody planes need significant maintenance work: SpiceJet
text: SpiceJet is examining the prospect of taking over widebody jets previously operated by Jet Airways, but initial studies show they need significant maintenance work, Chairman Ajay Singh said. He added SpiceJet doesn't have a plan to become a widebody operator with longer-range flights following Jet's collapse. "If it looks like it is significantly profitable, we can do it," Singh added.

headlines: Ex-MLA bribed voters to back BJP, alleges K'taka Cong leader
text: Karnataka Congress leader R Ramakrishna accused party's former MLA and his close aides of sabotaging JD(S)-Congress alliance's chances to win in the elections by bribing voters to vote for BJP. "Former MLA Rajanna, youth Congress' R Rajendra (and others)...distributed...funds given by Congress...among voters," he alleged. The alliance won two out of 28 seats in the state in Lok Sabha polls.

headlines: Djokovic cruises into French Open Round of 16
text: World number one and top seed Novak Djokovic reached the last-16 stage of the French Open 2019 after beating Italy's Salvatore Caruso in straight sets on Saturday. Elsewhere, former French Open winner Stanislas Wawrinka beat Grigor Dimitrov, who has exited the tournament in the third round on four occasions now.

headlines: NCP demands suspension of IAS over tweet 'glorifying' Godse
text: Nationalist Congress Party's Jitendra Awhad on Saturday demanded suspension of IAS officer Nidhi Choudhari for posting a now-deleted derogatory tweet against Mahatma Gandhi. She posted a tweet on May 17 thanking Nathuram Godse for the assassination of Gandhi and demanded the removal of his statues from across the world. "She gloried Nathuram Godse, this shouldn't be tolerated," Awhad said.

headlines: It's not a policy: HRD Minister on Draft National Education Policy
text: HRD Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal Nishank on Saturday said the Draft National Education Policy 2019 is only a report and not a policy. "Committee has submitted its report to the Ministry, it's not a policy. Public feedback will be sought, it's a misunderstanding that it has become policy," he said. "No language will be imposed on any state," Pokhriyal further clarified.

headlines: No intention of imposing any language on anyone: Javadekar
text: After protests on social media erupted against the proposed three-language system in schools, I&B Minister Prakash Javadekar stated that the government has no intention of doing anything like that. "There's no intention of imposing any language on anybody, we want to promote all Indian languages," he said. "It's a draft...which will be decided by government after public's feedback," he added.

headlines: Will create jobs, especially for rural India: Harsimrat Kaur
text: Food Processing Minister Harsimrat Kaur Badal said her vision is to create more jobs, especially for rural India. "A farmer's son shouldn't get out of farming because it's not viable anymore," she said. "We've to ensure we equip him with the know-how, technology and handholding to grow a better crop so that he can supplement his income," Kaur added.

headlines: All Delhi Metro lines to begin at 6 AM tomorrow to help UPSC candidates
text: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has announced that Delhi Metro services will begin at 6 AM on all lines, including the Phase-III extensions, on Sunday. This is to help the candidates appearing for Civil Services (Preliminary) Examination held by the UPSC, the DMRC said. The metro train services on Phase-III sections usually begin at 8 AM on Sundays.

headlines: #StopHindiImposition trends over Draft National Education Policy 2019
text: In protest against Draft National Education Policy 2019 submitted to the Centre a day ago, #StopHindiImposition was trending on Twitter on Saturday. The draft said, "The three-language formula will need to be implemented in its spirit throughout the country." "Children will now be immersed in three languages starting from Foundational Stage onwards,Â” it added, leading many to term it "Hindi-focussed".

headlines: Anil shares painting from 'Welcome' photoshopped in Queen's pic
text: Actor Anil Kapoor took to Twitter to share a group picture of Queen Elizabeth and captains of the 2019 World Cup with a painting of horse and donkey from his film 'Welcome' photoshopped in it. "Majnu Bhai's art has travelled far and wide @BazmeeAnees! This is literally priceless!" he captioned the picture. Majnu Bhai was Anil's character in the film.

headlines: NZ beat SL with 203 balls left, win by 10 wkts in WC for 3rd time
text: New Zealand defeated Sri Lanka by 10 wickets and with 203 balls to spare in their first match of 2019 World Cup on Saturday. This is the third time in World Cup history that New Zealand have won a match by 10 wickets. New Zealand had defeated Zimbabwe and Kenya by 10 wickets in the 2011 World Cup.

headlines: World no. 42 Siniakova knocks world no. 1 Osaka out of French Open
text: World number 42 Katerina Siniakova knocked world number one Naomi Osaka out of the French Open 2019 in the third round on Saturday. The 23-year-old Czech won the match with a scoreline of 6-4, 6-2 in one hour and 17 minutes. Siniakova will face world number 14 Madison Keys in the fourth round.

headlines: Ex-Arsenal, Real Madrid forward Reyes dies in car crash aged 35
text: Former Arsenal, Real Madrid and Spain forward JosÃ© Antonio Reyes died in a car crash at the age of 35. The accident happened in his hometown of Utrera, a province of Spain's Seville on Saturday morning. Reyes had made his professional debut for Sevilla aged 16 in the 1999/00 season and moved to Arsenal in January 2004.

headlines: Microsoft Co-founder's space firm to shut down: Report
text: Late billionaire and Microsoft Co-founder Paul Allen's space firm Stratolaunch is shutting down its operations, Reuters reported. Stratolaunch, maker of the world's largest aeroplane by wingspan weighing nearly 2,26,800 kilograms, was launched in 2011 by Allen, who passed away in October 2018. However, a company representative, responding to the report, said, "Stratolaunch remains operational".

headlines: Tourist guide drowns after saving 5 tourists from river in J&K
text: A tourist guide lost his life after saving five tourists, including two foreigners, from Lidder river at a Pahalgam resort in Jammu and Kashmir. The incident took place on Friday after gusty winds capsized a raft and all the people in it fell into the river. Officials said the guide, without caring for his own safety, rescued all the tourists.

headlines: Indian being tortured in Saudi seeks help; Jaishankar responds
text: An Indian national named Manik Chattopadhyay took to Twitter to urge External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar to help him return from Saudi Arabia, alleging he is being tortured there. He also threatened to commit suicide in his complaint. Jaishankar appreciated the prompt action of Indian Embassy officials in Riyadh and instructed them to keep him apprised of the situation.

headlines: Hinduism not blamed for LTTE blasts, why link Islam to terror: Pak PM
text: Addressing the Summit of the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation, Pakistan PM Imran Khan said that the Western World has equated radical Islam with terrorism. "Before 9/11, 80% of suicide bombings were by the Tamil Tigers (LTTE)...No one blamed Hinduism for it as religion had nothing to do with it...no one blamed the Japanese religion for Kamikaze bombers," he added.

headlines: In India, we are funding the eater, courier and restaurant: Uber
text: Uber CFO Nelson Chai has said Swiggy and Zomato, Indian competitors of Uber Eats food delivery business, are "very aggressive". "(India) is a market in which we are funding the eater, the courier as well as the restaurant in terms of building the business," Chai added. Uber said its margins in food delivery business fell sharply, mainly due to India.

headlines: China investigates FedEx after it diverted Huawei packages
text: China is launching an investigation into FedEx for the wrongful delivery of packages, state news agency Xinhua reported. Chinese telecoms equipment maker Huawei recently said FedEx diverted two packages sent from Japan and addressed to Huawei in China to the US. The US express delivery company damaged the legal rights and interests of its clients, Xinhua added.

headlines: World Cup long tournament, foolish to write off Pak: Waqar
text: Former Pakistan captain Waqar Younis said World Cup is a long tournament and it would be foolish to write off Pakistan after their opening round defeat to the Windies on Friday. "They lost heavily in their first game in 1992 and bounced back to win that tournament... But we cannot really dwell on what happened 27 years ago," Younis said.

headlines: Gautam Sawang takes charge as new DGP of Andhra Pradesh
text: Damodar Gautam Sawang, a 1986-batch IPS officer, on Saturday took charge as new Director General of Andhra Pradesh Police. His predecessor RP Thakur was transferred to the Printing and Stationery Department as Commissioner by state's CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy on his first day in office. Sawang has also worked as SP and DIG of Police of Maoist-hit Warangal district.

headlines: All internet satellites have deployed solar arrays: SpaceX
text: Billionaire Elon Musk's aerospace startup SpaceX revealed all 60 of its recently launched Starlink internet satellites have deployed their solar arrays. The satellites, aimed to provide high-speed internet globally, have successfully generated positive power and communicated with ground stations. SpaceX President and COO Gwynne Shotwell had earlier said four satellites faced unspecified issues.

headlines: All highway projects will be completed within 3 yrs: Gadkari
text: Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari on Saturday said his department will complete all highway projects within three years and increase road construction to 40 kilometres per day. "We've decided to plant 125 crore trees (on the roadside) in next three years," he added. Gadkari also said PM Narendra Modi expects his department to help increase India's growth rate.

headlines: 4 men in UP beaten for allegedly eating meat inside temple
text: Four people were beaten up allegedly for eating meat inside temple premises in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly on May 29, the police said on Saturday. "A case has been registered regarding the same and all accused will be arrested shortly," the police added. The matter came to light when the video of the assault went viral on social media.

headlines: UP government bans use of mobile phones in cabinet meetings
text: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath imposed a ban on the use of mobile phones during cabinet meetings. As per reports, the decision was taken so that ministers could focus on issues discussed in the meetings and not get distracted by their phones. Ministers will now get tokens after submitting their phones before going for meetings convened by the CM.

headlines: Germany urges its citizens to wear kippahs in solidarity with Jews
text: Felix Klein, Germany's anti-Semitism commissioner, has called on the citizens to wear kippah skullcaps in public in solidarity with Jews amid a rise in anti-Semitism in the country. Klein was earlier criticised for advising Jews not to wear kippahs in some public places to avoid anti-Semitic attacks. He cited a 20% rise in attacks on Jewish citizens since 2018.

headlines: Boris Johnson would be excellent as UK Prime Minister: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump has said that Conservative Party leader Boris Johnson would be "excellent" as the UK's Prime Minister, replacing Theresa May who will step down this month. "I have always liked him. I don't know that he is going to be chosen, but I think he is a very good guy, a very talented person," he added.

headlines: US embassy entrance set on fire in Honduras amid anti-govt protests
text: Protesters set fire to the entrance of the US embassy in the Honduran capital of Tegucigalpa on Friday amid protests against the government over its decision to privatise healthcare and education. The protesters chanted "American trash, American trash" outside the embassy, which was not being guarded at the time. The US called the fire an unacceptable act of violence.

headlines: SL captain survives as ball hits stumps but bails don't dislodge
text: Sri Lanka captain Dimuth Karunaratne survived getting bowled out after a Trent Boult delivery went onto hit the stumps but could not dislodge the bails. The 31-year-old had under-edged the 140-kmph delivery after which it clipped the stumps and the bail almost came off the groove. The incident happened in the sixth over of the match.

headlines: Sarfaraz's stomach is sticking out, his face is so fat: Akhtar
text: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar has criticised captain Sarfaraz Ahmed after Pakistan lost their World Cup opener against West Indies on Friday. "When Sarfaraz came for the toss, his stomach was sticking out and his face was so fat. He's the first captain I've seen who is so unfit," Akhtar added. "He's not able to move across," he further said.

headlines: Google Duo mistakenly sends Kohli's message to users worldwide
text: Google Duo accidentally sent a message from India captain Virat Kohli intended for Indian users to users around the world. "Who is Virat Kohli, and why did I just get a random video message showing him toasting a cup of coffee," a user tweeted. Google apologised for the gaffe, saying, "We're sorry for any confusion this may have caused."

headlines: Rename MHA as Ministry of Providing Clean Chits: Priyank Kharge
text: Targeting newly-appointed Minister of Home Affairs Amit Shah, Karnataka minister Priyank Kharge on Saturday tweeted, "Now that we have a new Home Minister, I think it is better to rename the Ministry of Home Affairs as Ministry of Providing Clean Chits." Minister for Social Welfare in Karnataka government, Priyank is the son of Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge.

headlines: NASA may send equipment to Moon from 2020, 1st time since 1970s
text: The US is planning to send equipment to the surface of the Moon starting 2020, for its 2024 human lunar mission, for the first time since the 1970s, NASA said. NASA has chosen three American commercial Moon landing service providers for the same. Each company has developed lunar landers of different sizes and shapes to deliver up to 23 payloads.

headlines: Villagers kill leopard, hang it on pole after cutting paws in Assam
text: Villagers in Assam's Charaideo district killed a leopard and hung it from a pole after cutting its paws and tail on Friday. The villagers claimed that the leopard had hid itself in a house and attacked many people and animals, following which they surrounded the leopard and killed it. A forest department official said that they are investigating the incident.

headlines: We'll rise again: Sonia at Congress Parliamentary Party meet
text: Addressing the Congress Parliamentary Party after she was chosen to continue as its Chairperson on Saturday, Sonia Gandhi said, "Undeterred by the many challenges that lie ahead, we will rise again." Sonia added, "In an unprecedented crisis, lies an unprecedented opportunity. It is up to us to grasp it with humility and self-confidence, drawing the appropriate lessons from our defeat."

headlines: Leaves used to make beedi stored in godowns of 2 MP schools
text: Two government-run schools in Madhya Pradesh's Damoh district are being used to store Tendu leaves, which are used for manufacturing beedis. Damoh Block Education Officer BS Rajput said, "No such order has been passed by the office of the District Education Officer...The schools are reopening from 10th and this would disrupt studies." An inquiry has been ordered into the matter.

headlines: Happy b'day mom, sorry: 19-yr-old GoAir employee writes before suicide
text: A 19-year-old employee of GoAir airline allegedly committed suicide after writing 'Happy birthday mummy - I am sorry' on a piece of paper, the police said on Friday. The deceased was part of the airline's ground staff at the Nagpur airport. He was on leave as he was down with jaundice for the last nearly two weeks, his father said.

headlines: Happy to help: Praful Patel on ED summon on alleged aviation scam
text: Former Civil Aviation Minister Praful Patel has been summoned by Enforcement Directorate (ED) as part of a money-laundering probe. The probe relates to losses suffered by Air India in an alleged multi-crore aviation scam during UPA government led by Manmohan Singh. "I'll be happy to cooperate with ED for their understanding of the complexities of the aviation industry," Patel said.

headlines: Didn't know she was nasty: Trump on Meghan Markle's criticism of him
text: US President Donald Trump has said that he didn't know Meghan Markle, the wife of Britain's Prince Harry, was "nasty" after he was told that she had called him "misogynistic" and "divisive" during his 2016 presidential campaign. However, Trump added that Markle would make a "very good American Princess" and that he hopes she will succeed.

headlines: Hope govt lowers 5G airwave prices, they're exorbitant: Airtel
text: Airtel CEO Gopal Vittal has called for lower 5G airwave prices in the upcoming auctions. "These are prices we can't afford and they are exorbitant, we hope the government will bring down pricing and then we would look seriously at 5G," he added. He further said the competitive intensity is stable as "we're not seeing any further reduction in pricing".

headlines: Tea tycoon and ex-Eveready Chairman BM Khaitan passes away at 92
text: Veteran industrialist and Williamson Magor Group (WMG) patriarch BM Khaitan passed away at the age of 92 at his residence in Kolkata. Khaitan had recently retired as Chairman from the boards of Eveready Industries and the world's largest producer of tea McLeod Russel, both WMG companies. West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee expressed her condolences.

headlines: Australia approves Adani's plan for rare bird at coal mine site
text: Australia's Queensland state has approved Adani's plan to protect the endangered black-throated finch at the site of the controversial Carmichael coal mine. Adani now has one outstanding state approval, for its groundwater plan, before preparatory construction can start on the project. However, the company still requires other federal environmental approvals before it can begin extracting coal.

headlines: Sanjay shares pic on late mom Nargis' 90th birth anniversary
text: On the occasion of his late mother and actress Nargis' 90th birth anniversary, Sanjay Dutt shared a picture from his childhood which features him along with his mother and one of his sisters. "Memories never fade! Happy Birthday Mom," the actor captioned the picture. Nargis succumbed to pancreatic cancer on May 7, 1981.

headlines: No one better than him: Clarke praises Jadeja's fielding
text: Former Australian captain Michael Clarke praised Indian cricketer Ravindra Jadeja's fielding, saying, "I think thereÂ’s no one better than him in world cricket, whether saving runs in the outfield or taking a difficult catch or direct hits, heÂ’s just super." Jadeja performed with the bat during India's loss against New Zealand in the first warm-up match.

headlines: Windies' Russell confident to be fit for Australia match
text: Windies' Andre Russell said he his confident that he will be fit for his side's match against Australia at the World Cup 2019. "I'm a professional. I know what to do to get back. I think I have five days before the next game so that is more than enough time to get my knee back to normal," Russell said.

headlines: Don't know if I will reach the World Cup in Qatar: Messi
text: Speaking about Qatar's 2022 World Cup, Argentina's Lionel Messi said, "I do not know if I will reach the World Cup in Qatar. God will decide whether it is given to me or not." "I want to finish my career having won something with the Argentine national team, or if not having tried as many times as possible," Messi added.

headlines: Xabi returns to childhood club Real Sociedad as B team coach
text: Former Real Sociedad midfielder Xabi Alonso has been officially announced as the new coach of Real Sociedad's B team. Alonso, who has played for Liverpool, Real Madrid and Bayern Munich, left his post as a youth coach for Real Madrid to take up the role at Real Sociedad. Alonso helped Madrid's U-13 side win the Division de Honor Juvenil title.

headlines: England's batting coach Mark Ramprakash to leave ECB
text: England's lead batting coach, Mark Ramprakash, will leave the England and Wales Cricket Board in June to pursue other career opportunities. Ramprakash, a former England international, has been involved with the England men's set-up over the past six years. "I feel the time is now right for me to move on from my role at the ECB," Ramprakash said.

headlines: China plans 'unreliable entities' list in response to US Huawei ban
text: After US President Donald Trump's administration put Huawei in its 'Entity List' which effectively banned the Chinese smartphone maker in the US, China has now said it'll prepare its own 'unreliable entities' list of foreign companies. The Chinese government didn't name entities or say how, or if, it would punish offenders. Notably, the US banned Huawei over alleged espionage concerns.

headlines: 10 lakh Windows PCs vulnerable to hacking, warns Microsoft
text: Microsoft has admitted all Windows operating systems except Windows 8 and 10 are still prone to hacking via a "wormable" vulnerability BlueKeep. "Microsoft is confident an exploit exists for this vulnerability and if recent reports are accurate, nearly [10 lakh] computers connected directly to internet are still vulnerable," it said. Fix for the bug was first released on May 14.

headlines: Progress, environment protection possible together: Javadekar
text: After taking charge of Environment Ministry, Prakash Javadekar on Saturday said environment protection and simultaneous progress will be Ministry's guiding principle. "People thought when you have to protect the environment, you can't make progress. That's untrue," he added. He further said PM Narendra Modi has a keen interest in environment and climate change and also has a vision for it.

headlines: Video shows idli vendor using water from toilet; probe ordered
text: A video of a Mumbai idli vendor has been widely shared on social media, which shows him taking tap water from Borivali Railway Station toilet to prepare food. The vendor reportedly used the water to prepare chutney that is served with idli. The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has launched an investigation, saying, "such water is not healthy for consumption".

headlines: Ex-President Pratibha Patil conferred Mexico's highest civilian honour
text: Former President Pratibha Devisingh Patil was conferred the 'Orden Mexicana del Aguila Azteca' (Mexican Order of the Aztec Eagle), Mexico's highest civilian award given to foreigners, on Saturday. The Ambassador of Mexico to India conferred the award to Patil in Pune. She's only the second Indian head of state, after late former President S Radhakrishnan, to get the award.

headlines: I promised that I'll never glorify smoking in my films: Farah
text: Speaking at an event hosted on the occasion of World No Tobacco Day on Friday, filmmaker Farah Khan said that she has taken a pledge never to glorify smoking in her films. "In my films, actors don't smoke usually," Farah added. The filmmaker further said that 'Om Shanti Om' was her only film which featured a character who smoked.

headlines: Mamata has lost her mind after LS defeat: BJP's Dilip Ghosh
text: After West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee stopped her convoy to scold people chanting 'Jai Shri Ram' slogans, BJP leader Dilip Ghosh said, "Banerjee seems to have either lost her mind or it's her reality that has come out after the defeat in LS polls." Ghosh added, "Dictators like her cannot accept defeat." Ten people were arrested for chanting the slogan.

headlines: Google DeepMind AI learns to play multiplayer game, beats humans
text: Google-parent Alphabet-owned DeepMind's AI system defeated human players in the multiplayer mode of first-person shooter video game Quake III: Arena. The system uses "AI agents" to represent its players, which were trained on 4.5 lakh rounds of the multiplayer mode. The agents successfully competed against human players even when their reaction times were slowed to match with the human players.

headlines: Apple plans to shut iTunes 18 yrs after Steve Jobs unveiled it: Report
text: Apple plans to shut down iTunes 18 years after Apple's late Co-founder Steve Jobs introduced it on January 9, 2001, Bloomberg reported. Apple will be launching a trio of new apps for the Mac - Music, TV, and Podcasts, to replace iTunes, the report said. The announcement is reportedly expected by Apple at its annual Worldwide Developers Conference next week.

headlines: Main accused in murder of Smriti's aide arrested after encounter
text: The main accused in the murder of BJP worker Surendra Singh, a close aide of Amethi MP Smriti Irani, was arrested on Friday following an encounter. The accused, identified as Wasim, sustained a bullet injury in the encounter and has been admitted to a hospital. With his arrest, all the five accused in the case have been arrested.

headlines: Owaisi gets out of vehicle, helps clear traffic in Hyderabad
text: Four-time MP and AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi de-boarded his vehicle and helped clear a traffic jam at Fateh Darwaza Road in Hyderabad on Friday evening. Reportedly, he was also seen pulling children away from the road to ensure their safety. There was a lot of traffic as it was the last Friday of the holy month of Ramadan.

headlines: India responds after US says it'll end trade privileges on June 5
text: After US President Donald Trump said that the country would end its preferential trade treatment for India on June 5, the Indian Commerce Ministry said the US decision was anticipated. The Ministry added, "India had offered resolution on significant US requests to find a mutually acceptable way forward. It is unfortunate that this did not find acceptance by the US."

headlines: Govt body ICMR recommends complete ban on e-cigarettes
text: On World No Tobacco Day on Friday, Indian Council of Medical Research recommended a complete ban on Electronic Nicotine Delivery Systems, including e-cigarettes, saying their use can initiate nicotine addiction among non-smokers. ICMR said e-cigarettes adversely affect the cardiovascular system, impair respiratory functions in a way similar to cigarette smoking and cause severe respiratory diseases.

headlines: People's security, welfare top priority: Shah takes over Home Ministry
text: Amit Shah took over the charge as Union Home Minister from Rajnath Singh on Saturday and tweeted, "I express my gratitude to Prime Minister Narendra Modi for believing in me". "The security of the country and the welfare of the countrymen is the top priority of the Modi government, I will make every effort to complete it," Amit Shah added.

headlines: US man who posed as Saudi royal for 30 years gets 18 years in jail
text: A Florida man who posed as a Saudi royal for three decades and cheated people of $8 million has been sentenced to 18 years in prison for fraud. Posing as Khalid Bin Al-Saud, he lived in a condo in Miami and drove a Ferrari with a forged diplomatic license plate. He was also accompanied by bodyguards carrying fake diplomatic papers.

headlines: Manish is always fun: Neetu on pic with Manish Malhotra, Rishi
text: Neetu Kapoor shared a picture of herself and her husband Rishi Kapoor with fashion designer Manish Malhotra, who recently spent time with the couple in New York. "The language you have with your own fraternity is so easy!!! [Manish] is always too much fun," Neetu captioned the picture. Rishi is currently undergoing treatment for cancer in New York.

headlines: Working with experienced actor like Salman was a blessing: Nora
text: While speaking about her upcoming film 'Bharat', Nora Fatehi said that acting alongside experienced actors like Salman Khan and Sunil Grover was a blessing. Nora further said that Salman was a "fabulous co-star", and added, "He is patient, supportive and a wonderful human being." "I am glad that I got this opportunity," the actress said.

headlines: I show them I can bowl 90: Russell on his bouncers vs Pakistan
text: Speaking about his bouncers against Pakistani batsmen in the side's first World Cup 2019 encounter on Friday, Andre Russell said, "A lot of people donÂ’t remember IÂ’m a fast bowler... I show them I can bowl 90 (mph)." "When my name comes on the big screen it says medium pacer. I say Â‘who you talking to?Â’," Russell added.

headlines: When we are competitive, we know we can beat anybody: Williamson
text: Speaking about New Zealand's chances at the World Cup 2019, Kiwi captain Kane Williamson said that the team knows that when they play competitive cricket, they can beat any team. "[I]t's about us playing the sort of cricket that we want to be playing," Williamson added. New Zealand begin their World Cup campaign against Sri Lanka on Saturday.

headlines: Archer the fastest bowler I have faced: England teammate Moeen
text: England all-rounder Moeen Ali said that his England teammate Jofra Archer is the fastest bowler he has ever faced. "He just makes good batters do different things, that pace he has is incredible... He gives us that something else, he can win you games even if he goes for a few runs," Ali added about Archer.

headlines: Mark Zuckerberg's security head accused of sexual misconduct
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's personal head of security Liam Booth has been accused of sexual misconduct by two former employees. Booth, a former Secret Service agent who worked under former US President Barack Obama, also allegedly made racist, derogatory remarks about Zuckerberg's wife, Priscilla Chan. Zuckerberg's private office MD has also been accused of not taking action against Booth.

headlines: If PM can visit a temple, Muslims can visit mosques: Owaisi
text: Addressing a gathering at Mecca Masjid in Hyderabad on Friday, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said, "If Modi can visit a temple... if Modi can go sit in a cave, we Muslims can also proudly say our prayers in mosques." Owaisi added, "Securing more than 300 seats is not a huge thing because India has a living Constitution."

headlines: US lawmaker returns to bartending to promote fair wages
text: US Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez returned to bartending at a restaurant in New York to promote increased wages for tipped wage-workers. Alexandria, a Democratic lawmaker from New York, worked as a bartender before getting elected to Congress last year. The federal minimum wage for tipped workers is $2.13 an hour, with Alexandria pushing for a $15 minimum wage for service workers.

headlines: Edwise helps Indian medicine aspirants to study in UK/USA
text: Edwise International, a provider of international education opportunities to students has partnered with St. George's University in Grenada, to help Indian medical aspirants fulfil their aspirations of studying in a globally renowned medical university. St. George's University's (SGU) network of over 20,000 graduates have practiced in all 50 US States and more than 50 countries around the world.

headlines: IIM graduate transitions to a Data Science career with PGP-DSE
text: Mahendra, an IIM-Trichy graduate transitioned to a Consultant role at Fractal Analytics after completing Great Learning's PG Program in Data Science & Engineering. The program is designed for fresh undergraduates and early-career professionals to become Data Science professionals, through an industry-relevant curriculum and dedicated placement assistance. Program alumni have seen an average hike of 65% with their career transitions.

headlines: Mouni quits NawazuddinÂ’s Bole Chudiyan, makers claim she was rude
text: Confirming that Mouni Roy has exited the Nawazuddin Siddiqui starrer 'Bole Chudiyan', the film's producer Rajesh Bhatia claimed that the actress was "rude", "unprofessional" and interfered with the film's script. Mouni's spokesperson denied the producer's claims, and said, "She has done many films before and...everyone has vouched for her professionalism." The film is slated to release in October 2019.

headlines: Healofy hacked devices to inflate usage, cheat investors: Report
text: Bengaluru-based parenting-focussed social networking app Healofy, recently removed again from Google Play Store, has been hacking user devices to inflate engagement numbers 7-10 times, Entrackr reported citing sources. It reportedly did so to stage fake growth to its investors. The app was also accused of copyright violations by downloading content from Youtube or by hacking competitors' servers.

headlines: Sonia Gandhi to continue as Chairperson of Cong Parliamentary Party
text: Sonia Gandhi has been chosen to continue as the Chairperson of Congress Parliamentary Party at the meeting of the party's parliamentary committee on Saturday. Former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh proposed her name. Rahul Gandhi was reportedly being considered as the candidate for the position amid rumours of him planning to resign from the post of Congress President.

headlines: Haven't received report that bombers visited India: Sri Lanka Prez
text: Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena on Friday said he has not received any report that the suicide bombers involved in the Easter Sunday bombings had travelled to India. He claimed he was not made aware of India's warning about a possible attack. He added, "Had I known about a possible attack, I would have taken necessary steps to prevent it."

headlines: Kolkata college form allows students to choose 'Humanity' as religion
text: A college under Calcutta University has added a 'Humanity' option under the Religion field, which is a compulsory section, in its admission form for the students. Other options under the category includes Hinduism, Islam, Christian, Buddhism, Sikhism, Jainism, and Others. Notably, the admission process for the undergraduate courses in the university started on May 27.

headlines: Rajnath visits War Memorial before taking over as Defence Minister
text: Rajnath Singh paid tribute to martyred jawans at the National War Memorial in Delhi on Saturday, before taking over as the Defence Minister. Army chief General Bipin Rawat, Air Chief Marshal BS Dhanoa, and Navy chief Admiral Karambir Singh were also present at the memorial. The leader served as the Minister of Home Affairs in the previous NDA government.

headlines: Man flees police custody, spotted 750 km away while having parathas
text: A 26-year-old man, who fled police custody from Uttar Pradesh's Jaunpur while travelling on a train on May 28, was spotted having parathas at a dhaba nearly 750 km away in Ghaziabad by a police informer. He was later arrested from a petrol pump. A sub-inspector and four constables were suspended after the suspect had fled custody.

headlines: US to end trade privileges for India on June 5: Donald Trump
text: US President Donald Trump has said the country would end its preferential trade treatment for India on June 5. "I have determined that India has not assured the US that it will provide equitable and reasonable access to its markets," Trump added. Notably, India is the biggest beneficiary of the US' Generalized System of Preferences (GSP).

headlines: 7k handmade bags made from waste plastic given at PM's swearing-in
text: Around 7,000 handmade paper carry bags made from waste plastic were distributed at the oath-taking ceremony of PM Narendra Modi and his Council of Ministers. Kumarappa National Handmade Paper Institute (KNHPI) at Jaipur supplied the bags, which were made by mixing waste plastic with paper raw material. They were given to the guests at the ceremony to keep water bottles.

headlines: 12 killed as employee fires at people inside US government building
text: At least 12 people were killed and several injured on Friday in a mass shooting at a government building in the US state of Virginia. Police said the suspect, a long-term and current Virginia Beach city employee, fired "indiscriminately" in a public utilities building. The gunman, whose identity was not released, was killed in an exchange of gunfire with police.

headlines: Duterte kisses women on stage, says they cured him from being gay
text: Philippines President Rodrigo Duterte kissed five Filipino women on stage during a speech in Japan, in front of his longtime partner, and said beautiful women helped him "get cured" from being "gay". The 74-year-old leader was meeting the Filipino community in Tokyo when he asked for women volunteers sitting near the stage to kiss him to end the event.

headlines: UK billionaire charged in US with spanking fitness instructor
text: British billionaire Philip Green has been charged with four counts of misdemeanour assault in the United States after an Arizona fitness instructor accused him of repeatedly touching her inappropriately. The 67-year-old is accused of spanking the instructor and grabbing her buttocks at the Canyon Ranch resort in Tucson in 2016 and 2018. However, Green has denied the charges.

headlines: North Face 'hacks' Wikipedia to promote brand on Google, criticised
text: US clothing firm North Face has apologised for manipulating Wikipedia to push images of its products higher in Google image search results. In April, its ad agency filled Wikipedia entries of Brazilian landmarks with images of models wearing North Face gear. In a video ad, the company boasted about the stunt, which led to strong criticism from Wikipedia-owner Wikimedia Foundation.

headlines: Film with big star will fail unless it's content-driven: Motwane
text: Filmmaker Vikramaditya Motwane said that he feels any film that's not content-driven will fail, even if it features a 'big star'. "Stardom can maybe pull audiences to theatres but beyond that it is all about content," he added. He pointed out that Shah Rukh Khan's 'Zero' and Aamir Khan's 'Thugs Of Hindostan' failed despite being fronted by superstars.

headlines: I wanted to remove stigma associated with cancer: Tahira Kashyap
text: While speaking about battling breast cancer, Ayushmann Khurrana's wife Tahira Kashyap said that she wished to remove the stigma and taboo associated with the disease. "[M]y doctor told me about...women who despite getting a few symptoms refuse to get themselves examined because of...humiliation associated with it," Tahira said. "If you're suffering from cancer, don't let it define you," she added.

headlines: Drone powered by kites revealed in patent filed by Facebook
text: A patent filed by Facebook for a "dual-kite aerial vehicle" has surfaced, which describes a drone attached to two kites floating at different altitudes. Each kite could be directed independently and the drone could generate its own energy using solar panels or tether movement to extend its flight time, the patent revealed. Facebook had filed the same in November 2018.

headlines: 1st-ever footage of a solar eclipse restored digitally
text: British Film Institute's (BFI) National Archive has shared a digitally restored footage of the first-ever solar eclipse filmed by British magician Nevil Maskelyne on May 28, 1900. Maskelyne had successfully captured an eclipse in India in 1898, but the film's can was stolen on his way back. He had made a special telescopic adapter for his camera to capture it.

headlines: Proud to follow on the footsteps of Sushma Swaraj: S Jaishankar
text: After taking charge of the Ministry of External Affairs, S Jaishankar wrote in his 1st tweet, "Thank you all for the best wishes! Honoured to be given this responsibility. Proud to follow on the footsteps of Sushma Swaraj ji." S Jaishankar was the Foreign Secretary from 2015 to 2018 and upon retirement, he joined Tata Sons.

headlines: Baaaaaaaaa bye: Philippines sends back 69 containers of garbage
text: The Philippines has sent tonnes of garbage loaded in 69 containers back to Canada after a weeks-long diplomatic row between the two countries. "Baaaaaaaaa bye, as we say it," Philippine Secretary of Foreign Affairs Teddy Locsin Jr tweeted. The Philippines says the rubbish was falsely labelled as plastics for recycling when it was sent to the country.

headlines: Sarfaraz criticised for wearing shalwar to meet Queen, responds
text: Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed was criticised for wearing shalwar kameez to meet Queen Elizabeth at the Buckingham Palace, while the other nine World Cup captains wore suits. "I'm surprised he didn't come in his Lungi-Banyan-Topi costume," a user wrote. "I felt very proud that the other captains were wearing suits but I was wearing national dress," Sarfaraz said.

headlines: Pakistan suffer their longest losing streak in ODI cricket
text: The defeat against Windies in their first 2019 World Cup match was Pakistan's 11th consecutive ODI defeat (completed matches). It is Pakistan's longest losing streak in ODI cricket, with their previous longest losing streak of 10 matches coming between October 1987 and March 1988. Pakistan will next face hosts England on June 3.

headlines: Pakistan cannot beat us: Suresh Raina on India-Pakistan WC match
text: Indian batsman Suresh Raina has said that Pakistan cannot beat India in the 2019 World Cup. "If India win their first three matches then I do not think our World Cup record is going to break," he added. However, he said that if India lose some matches early on, then there will be pressure on India for the match.

headlines: Warner, Smith have paid the price, don't boo them: Langer to fans
text: Australia head coach Justin Langer has urged fans in England to not boo David Warner and Steve Smith during the 2019 World Cup. "They are human beings, they are really good cricketers. They made a mistake. They have paid the price for it. Big price actually. I feel for them as people more than anything else," he added.

headlines: That wasn't my best catch: Ben Stokes on catch against South Africa
text: England all-rounder Ben Stokes has said that his one-handed diving catch against South Africa in the World Cup opener is not his "best catch". Stokes added that he was "actually in the wrong position".
