Stokes claimed he preferred his one-handed catch of an Adam Voges edge in the gully during a 2015 Ashes Test against Australia at Trent Bridge.

headlines: I was a sportsman first and Sports Minister later: Rathore
text: Former Sports Minister Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore took to Twitter to share a message for new Sports Minister Kiren Rijiju. "I was a sportsman first & Sports Minister later. I worked with an athlete's temperament to do best for Indian sports...Here's to sports, here's to India. Kiren Rijiju is best suited to take mission forward," the former Olympian added.

headlines: Nadal defeats Goffin to win his 89th match at French Open
text: World number two Rafael Nadal defeated David Goffin 6-1, 6-3, 4-6, 6-3 today to reach French Open fourth round for the 14th time. Nadal will next face Argentine Juan Ignacio Londero, who beat French wild card Corentin Moutet 2-6, 6-3, 6-4, 5-7, 6-4 in three hours and 28 minutes. Nadal has now won 89 of his 91 French Open matches.

headlines: Former first class cricketers ask BCCI to raise monthly pension
text: Former first class cricketers including Sanjay Jagdale, Ashu Dani and Vinay Lamba have approached the BCCI to raise their monthly pension by 50%. They have claimed that the amount was revised in 2015 but they haven't received it yet. BCCI acting president C K Khanna has requested the CoA to address the issue.

headlines: Who is the youngest and the oldest minister in PM Modi's Cabinet?
text: There are a total of 25 ministers in the Cabinet, including Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The average age of the Cabinet is 60.4. The youngest minister in the Cabinet is Women and Child Development Minister Smriti Irani at the age of 43, while the oldest is Minister of Consumer Affairs, Food and Public Distribution Ram Vilas Paswan at 72.

headlines: What are the key challenges facing new Finance Minister Nirmala?
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, who previously served as defence and commerce minister, will prepare the government's annual budget. She takes charge of the economy at a time of weak farm incomes, slow jobs growth and falling sales of key consumer goods including cars and motorbikes. She faces pressure from the industry for the government to provide stimulus to revive growth.

headlines: Schalke fan charged for attempted murder of a Man City fan
text: A fan of German club Schalke has been charged with attempted murder of a Manchester City supporter, who was brutally attacked at the teams' Champions League game in February. The English football fan received serious head injuries in the attack at Schalke's stadium in Gelsenkirchen on February 20.

headlines: Google's 9,000-km-long undersea cable now ready for service
text: Google and its partners have announced that the over 9,000-km-long undersea INDIGO communications cable is now ready for service. The cable, which connects Australia's Sydney and Perth with Asia's Jakarta and Singapore, will have a total design capacity of 36 terabits per second. Google said it's enough to easily facilitate a few million simultaneous video chats between Singapore and Sydney.

headlines: Some iOS apps send 1.5GB data per month to tracking firms: Report
text: A privacy experiment has revealed some iOS apps are using iPhone's 'background app refresh' feature to regularly send personal information to data tracking companies, The Washington Post reported. The iPhone used for the experiment reportedly fed nearly 5,400 data trackers, most of which were hidden inside apps. The unwanted data trackers could reportedly transmit nearly 1.5GB data in a month.

headlines: Youth are being duped: Priyanka over UPPSC paper leak row
text: Congress' Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Friday targeted BJP government in UP over Uttar Pradesh Public Service Commission (UPPSC) paper leak reports and said the government is ignoring youth's interests. "Papers were given for printing to a defaulter...Youth are...duped right under government's nose," she tweeted. She alleged that some officers have accepted bribes and corrupted the examination system.

headlines: Rajasthan govt to soon disburse paperless loans to farmers
text: Rajasthan government on Friday said that process of disbursing crop loans to farmers from cooperative banks will be made paperless. In the first phase, the application form will be made available for free to 25 lakh member farmers paying off the loan regularly. In the second phase, the registration of new farmers and farmers having overdue loans will be done.

headlines: She shattered the glass ceiling: Mufti to Nirmala Sitharaman
text: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti on Friday took to Twitter to congratulate Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman. "As the first woman to helm this crucial portfolio full time, she's shattered the glass ceiling by all means," she tweeted. Before Sitharaman, ex-PM Indira Gandhi was the only female finance minister but she held the post for a brief while as an additional charge.

headlines: We're still together: Nitish after opting out from Cabinet
text: After opting out of Cabinet on being offered one ministerial berth, JD(U) chief Nitish Kumar said they have no problem with that. "There's no need for symbolic representation but proportional representation is needed. We haven't said anything about the seats we needed. We're in an alliance and are together," he added. Kumar further said their alliance is for Bihar's development.

headlines: NASA shares X-ray pic showing 22 months of night sky data
text: NASA has released an X-ray image mapping the entire night sky over a 22-month period. The image was recorded by NASA's Neutron star Interior Composition Explorer (NICER) payload on the International Space Station. NICER's primary mission is to determine the size of dense remains of dead stars called neutron stars to a precision of 5%, NASA revealed.

headlines: Robert Vadra skips ED questioning; lawyers say he is ill
text: Robert Vadra on Friday didn't turn up before Enforcement Directorate (ED) for questioning in a money laundering case. His absence was due to an illness, his lawyers claimed and sought the next date for his appearance. On Wednesday, Delhi's Rouse Avenue Court reserved the order on Vadra's application seeking permission to travel abroad for June 3 on medical grounds.

headlines: NGT surprised over stubble burning in govt college, issues notice
text: National Green Tribunal on Friday expressed surprise over stubble burning in a government institute in Jaipur and issued a notice regarding the same. "Here's a case where...our...government and its instrumentalities are themselves taking steps which had been of serious concern for the public," NGT said. Reportedly, the institute burned agricultural residue in its campus after harvesting the crop.

headlines: WI beat Pak with 218 balls to spare as Gayle records most 6s in WC
text: West Indies defeated Pakistan by 7 wickets and with 218 balls to spare in their first match in 2019 World Cup on Friday. West Indies' 39-year-old opener Chris Gayle smashed 3 sixes in the match and set the individual record for hitting most sixes (40) in World Cup history. Gayle also completed 19,000 runs in international cricket.

headlines: India unemployment rate at 45-year high of 6.1% in 2017-18: Govt
text: India's unemployment rate rose to a 45-year high of 6.1% in 2017-18 fiscal year, the Statistics Ministry said on Friday, matching data earlier leaked to a newspaper. The data showed that 7.8% of all employable youth in urban areas were jobless, while the figure was 5.3% in rural areas. Joblessness among men stood at 6.2%, compared to 5.7% for women.

headlines: Nirmala Sitharaman to present her first Union Budget on July 5
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will present her first Union Budget for 2019-20 on July 5, the government announced today. The Economic Survey will be presented by new Chief Economic Adviser Krishnamurthy Subramanian on July 4. The first session of the 17th Lok Sabha is set to begin on June 17 and will continue till July 26.

headlines: India loses its spot as world's fastest growing economy to China
text: India lost its spot as the fastest growing major economy to China in the January-March quarter for the first time in one-and-a-half years, government data showed on Friday. India's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth rate slowed to 5.8% in the quarter, compared to China's 6.4%. This is also India's slowest growth rate in five years.

headlines: Federer marks his 400th Grand Slam match with a straight-set win
text: World number three Roger Federer on Friday became the first player in history to play 400 Grand Slam matches. The 37-year-old defeated Norway's 20-year-old Casper Ruud in straight sets with a scoreline of 6-3, 6-1, 7-6(10-8) in 2 hours and 11 minutes. This is the 14th time that Federer has reached the French Open fourth round.

headlines: Iron Maiden sue 'Ion Maiden' video game maker for $2 million
text: English band Iron Maiden is suing video game company 3D Realms, who had produced Max Payne, for $2 million over the game Ion Maiden. The band called Ion Maiden a "blatant infringement" of their trademark, adding the game is similar to Iron Maiden's own game Legacy of the Beast. 3D Realms said it'll take necessary action on receiving the lawsuit.

headlines: US DJ claims his MacBook Pro exploded during 'normal use'
text: An American DJ named White Panda has claimed that his MacBook Pro (2015 model) exploded during "normal use". "It was on my lap, plugged in, and suddenly started to spew smoke...I quickly placed it on the floor where it popped and caught fire," the DJ said. He added he submitted the laptop to the nearest Apple store after cooling it.

headlines: Uber posts $1 billion loss in 1st quarterly report since IPO
text: Uber has posted losses of over $1 billion on revenue of $3.1 billion for the first quarter of 2019 in its first earnings report as a public company. The San Francisco-based company was valued at around $82 billion during its IPO but dropped to about $67 billion, $5 billion less than the valuation it earned with its last private financing.

headlines: I can't help with visa issues, tweets new foreign minister's son
text: On the day S Jaishankar took charge as External Affairs Minister, his son Dhruva apparently received a request on Twitter regarding visa or passport issues. Dhruva responded, "Dude. Wrong Twitter handle", adding he "can not help anyone with their passport, visa, or getting-you-out-of-a-foreign-prison problems". Former foreign minister Sushma Swaraj was known for providing quick help on Twitter.

headlines: Govt forms new Jal Shakti Ministry, Gajendra Shekhawat to head it
text: The government has created the new Ministry of Jal Shakti by reorganising the Ministry of Water Resources, River Development and Ganga Rejuvenation. Gajendra Singh Shekhawat, Member of Parliament from Jodhpur, will head the ministry. Prime Minister Narendra Modi had promised during the Lok Sabha election campaign to create an integrated ministry to deal with all matters related to water.

headlines: 4 kids in coma as inflatable bouncy castle flies away due to winds
text: Four out of five children are in a coma with grave head injuries after an inflatable bouncy castle was lifted into the air by strong winds before crashing onto the ground on a road in Russia. The bouncy castle was not properly tied down and was attached to weights made of car tires and concrete, with the ropes being broken.

headlines: Putin refuses to sell S-400 missiles to Iran amid tensions with US
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin has refused to sell S-400 missile defence systems to Iran amid the Middle-Eastern country's tensions with the US, Bloomberg said quoting Russian officials. The US recently imposed more anti-Iranian sanctions and sent an aircraft carrier and bombers to the Gulf over what it described as a threat of attack from Iran on its forces and allies.

headlines: Windies' Hetmyer calls Kohli a 'great leader'
text: Windies cricketer Shimron Hetmyer called his Royal Challengers Bangalore captain Virat Kohli a 'great leader'. "It's very nice being around him, just watching him bat and hearing him talk about the game in itself is a wonderful learning curve for any young player," Hetmyer added about Kohli. "Right now, I'm in a good mental space," Hetmyer further said.

headlines: Pak arrived in Eng 38 days before WC not 38 mins, tweets user
text: Reacting to Pakistan's loss to Windies at the World Cup 2019, a user tweeted, "Worth remembering that Pakistan arrived in England 38 days before today's match and not 38 minutes before today's match." "Highlights of Pakistan's innings would be uploaded as GIF by ICC & Star Sports," read another user's tweet.

headlines: I want to retire at Real Madrid: Sergio Ramos
text: Real Madrid captain Sergio Ramos said, "I want to make my future clear, I'm a Madridista, I want to retire here and what better way than to rebuild this team?" Real Madrid head Florentino Perez had claimed in an interview that Ramos said he had an offer to move to China but the club denied the transfer.

headlines: Germany coach Loew hospitalised after accident while exercising
text: Germany national team coach Joachim Loew was taken to hospital after suffering an injury while exercising. The German Football Association confirmed that Loew was receiving treatment for a crushed artery and would not be in the dugout for the upcoming internationals. "I feel better, but I just have to look after myself for a few weeks," Loew said.

headlines: Several Spanish footballers arrested for alleged match-fixing
text: Several Spanish footballers, suspected of being part of a gang that fixed matches in the first and second divisions, were detained on Tuesday. The Spanish authorities said they were carrying out an operation to arrest 11 people in raids at different locations across the country for participating in match-fixing, money laundering and involvement in a criminal organization.

headlines: India coach releases 2nd batch of 6 footballers from camp
text: India's new coach Igor Stimac released a second batch of six footballers from the ongoing preparatory camp in New Delhi. The camp which kicked-off with 37 players on May 21, currently has a strength of 25 players. Stimac had released the first batch of six players earlier. "[It is] always difficult for the coach to take hard decisions," Stimac said.

headlines: Huawei bars staff meetings with US contacts, sends US staff back
text: Chinese smartphone maker Huawei has ordered its employees to cancel technical meetings with American contacts. Huawei's chief strategy architect revealed the technology giant had sent all American citizens working in research and development (R&D) back to the US. Huawei, the world's second-largest smartphone maker in 2019's first quarter, was banned by the US over alleged espionage concerns.

headlines: He is selfish: BJP leader after Nitish opts out of Cabinet
text: BJP's Gopal Narayan Singh on Friday targeted Bihar CM Nitish Kumar for opting out of Cabinet and said he's very selfish. "With BJP's help, he ran the government in Bihar for seven years...[when] he realised he can run it independently, he kicked out our party," Singh added. "I feel people in Bihar will point fingers at him," he further said.

headlines: India gets new Sardar Patel as Home Minister Amit Shah: BJP
text: Delhi BJP spokesperson Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga took to Twitter to praise Home Minister Amit Shah and warn stone pelters in Kashmir and illegal immigrants from Bangladesh. "Stone pelters in Kashmir, Bangladeshi pack your bag. India got new Sardar Patel as Home Minister," he tweeted. Shah won from Gandhinagar by a margin of over 5 lakh votes in the elections.

headlines: Alibaba invests $100mn in video app VMate to expand in India
text: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba has invested about $100 million in short video app VMate, launched by its subsidiary UCWeb. The app, launched in India in 2016, will use the investment to expand its presence in the Indian market. The app allows users to stream a movie online or download for later and even share them offline.

headlines: Mohana Singh becomes 1st woman fighter pilot to fly Hawk jet
text: Flight Lieutenant Mohana Singh has become the first woman fighter pilot to be qualified to undertake missions by day on Hawk advanced jet aircraft, an official statement said. Her training involved flying both air-to-air combat and air-to-ground missions. She has a total of over 500 hours of incident-free flying of which 380 hours are on the Hawk Mk 132 jet.

headlines: IMD issues 'red-colour' warning for Delhi as temperature rises
text: As heat wave conditions continue in Delhi, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Friday issued "red-colour" warning for the national capital. The IMD has four colour-coded messages - green, yellow, amber and red, where green indicates normal conditions while red denotes extreme weather conditions. On Thursday, the IMD recorded a high of 46.8-degree Celsius, the highest in five years.

headlines: Trump writes 'nice' on map showing Golan Heights as part of Israel
text: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu showed a new map that depicted the Golan Heights as part of Israel, with US President Donald Trump having autographed and written "Nice" on it. Netanyahu said the map was a gift from Trump's son-in-law and senior adviser Jared Kushner. Trump recently recognised Israel's sovereignty over Golan Heights, an occupied territory annexed from Syria.

headlines: Got what I deserve: Kareena on being highest paid actress on TV
text: Kareena Kapoor, who is being touted as the highest-paid actress on television, has said that she deserves what she's getting for her upcoming TV debut. The actress, who will be a judge on reality-show 'Dance India Dance', added, "If a male judge is getting so much, a female judge can also." The show's seventh season will premiere on June 22.

headlines: I don't cross line with Salman, we have healthy equation: Katrina
text: Speaking about her professional relationship with Salman Khan, Katrina Kaif said, "Honestly, I don't cross the line with him...Ours is a healthy equation." "When I came on the set, I was 1000 per cent prepared. Salman accorded me respect for that," the actress added. Katrina further said that Salman is very receptive towards what an actor brings to a film.

headlines: Will work closely for a safer world: France congratulates PM
text: French envoy to India Alexandre Ziegler congratulated Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the new cabinet ministers, shortly after the swearing-in ceremony at Rashtrapati Bhavan on Thursday. Ziegler tweeted, "France looks forward to working closely with India in the coming years to promote a safer, cleaner and more prosperous world for future generations."

headlines: Congress team reaches Amethi to probe Rahul's defeat: Report
text: A two-member Congress team, comprising KL Sharma and party secretary Zubair Khan, have reached Amethi to reportedly determine the reasons for party chief Rahul Gandhi's defeat in the Lok Sabha constituency. The leaders have met the District Congress Committee office-bearers. They are likely to meet party leaders of five assembly segments before submitting their report to Congress' leadership.

headlines: Pak get all out in 21.4 overs vs WI, score their 2nd lowest WC total
text: West Indies bowled out Pakistan for 105 runs in 21.4 overs in their first 2019 World Cup match today. This is the second lowest total scored by Pakistan in a World Cup match, with their lowest total of 74 having come against England in the 1992 edition. Six of 11 Pakistani batsmen got out for single-digit scores in the innings.

headlines: 10 arrested for chanting 'Jai Shri Ram' at WB CM Mamata's convoy
text: Around 10 people have been arrested for chanting 'Jai Shri Ram' slogans at West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's convoy on Thursday. Reportedly, Mamata had stopped her convoy twice and scolded the crowd who were chanting the slogans and even said that action will be taken against them. During Lok Sabha elections, Mamata had accused BJP of making the slogan political.

headlines: Rafale replica put up outside IAF Chief's home, next to Cong HQ
text: A replica of a Rafale jet has been installed by the IAF outside the residence of Air Chief Marshal BS Dhanoa in Delhi. Dhanoa lives at 23 Akbar Road, next to Congress' headquarters at 24 Akbar Road. Although Congress had repeatedly alleged irregularities in the 36-jet deal, the Supreme Court had dismissed pleas seeking a court-monitored probe into the deal.

headlines: Zomato, Swiggy can't deliver food without hygiene rating: Punjab
text: The Punjab government has made it compulsory for online food delivery apps including Zomato and Swiggy to ensure food hygiene ratings comply with FSSAI guidelines. Punjab Health Minister Brahm Mohindra has issued a direction to display all of their affiliated Food Business Operators' (FBO) hygiene ratings. The food aggregators have been given three months to comply with the same.

headlines: Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal joins Ujjivan Bank's board
text: Co-founder and ex-CEO of homegrown e-commerce giant Flipkart, Sachin Bansal, has joined the board of Ujjivan Small Finance Bank as an independent director. Ujjivan had recently also appointed HDFC Bank's former digital banking head Nitin Chugh as its next CEO. Ujjivan MD Samit Ghosh revealed the bank is trying to scale up and turn into a mass market bank.

headlines: Nirmala takes charge as Finance and Corporate Affairs Minister
text: Nirmala Sitharaman assumed the charge as the Union Minister of Finance and Corporate Affairs in New Delhi on Friday. She was greeted in her office by the Minister of State for Finance & Corporate Affairs Anurag Thakur, Finance Secretary SC Garg among others. She takes over from Arun Jaitley, who asked PM Modi not to give him a ministerial position.

headlines: 5 former IFS, IAS officers become ministers in PM Modi's new govt
text: Former Foreign Secretary Subrahmanyam Jaishankar, a 1977-batch IFS officer, replaced Sushma Swaraj as External Affairs Minister while 1974-batch IFS officer Hardeep Singh Puri was named Aviation Minister in PM Narendra Modi's new cabinet. Ex-Home Secretary RK Singh was given Minister of State (Independent Charge) portfolio and two other IAS officers Arjun Ram Meghwal and Som Parkash were named MoS.

headlines: Mukhtar Naqvi retains Minority Affairs Ministry in new Cabinet
text: Rajya Sabha MP Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi has retained charge of the Ministry of Minority Affairs in the new Cabinet. Naqvi, who was first elected to the Lok Sabha from Rampur in 1998, has served as minister of state for information and broadcasting in the Atal Bihari Vajpayee government. He has also served as vice-president, general secretary and spokesman of BJP.

headlines: What do we pay you for? US teen calls police on fleeing traffic stop
text: Nicholas Jones, a 19-year-old man in Florida, US, called 911 emergency number to brag about fleeing a traffic stop. "I ran from a cop 30 minutes to an hour ago...what do we pay you guys for?" he said on the call. Jones was arrested a day later and charged with reckless driving, fleeing and eluding, misusing 911 and violating probation.

headlines: US puts 5% tariff on Mexican goods until it solves immigration issue
text: US President Donald Trump has announced a tariff of 5% on all goods from Mexico starting June in a bid to pressure the country to resolve the issue of illegal immigration to the US through its border. The tariff will increase up to 25% until the problem is resolved, he added. The duties will gradually increase by 5% every month.

headlines: Govt to focus on privatising or closing 42 state-run firms: NITI
text: NITI Aayog Vice Chairman Rajiv Kumar has said the new government will focus on fully privatising or closing over 42 state-owned companies in the coming months. He added there will be a number of "big bang" economic reforms in the first 100 days, which will include changes in labour laws and the creation of land banks for new industrial development.

headlines: Picture abhi baki hai: Karan Johar on PM Modi's second term
text: Karan Johar took to Instagram to congratulate PM Narendra Modi after his swearing-in ceremony and shared a picture with other celebrities who attended the event at Rashtrapati Bhavan. "To those watching India, I would love to addÂ—picture abhi baki hai," Karan wrote in his caption. Rajinikanth, Kangana Ranaut and Shahid Kapoor are also seen in the picture that Karan uploaded.

headlines: Yeah, why not? 'Thor' actor Chris on acting in B'wood film
text: When asked during a recent interview with entertainment website Pinkvilla whether he would consider starring in a Bollywood film, 'Thor' actor Chris Hemsworth said, "Maybe. Yeah, why not?" The actor was further asked if he would want to star opposite a Bollywood actress like Priyanka Chopra, to which he said, "Yes, send me a script and we'll find something out."

headlines: Norway player scores 9 goals against Honduras in FIFA U-20 WC
text: Erling Haaland of Norway created history as he hit 9 goals against Honduras in the ongoing FIFA U-20 World Cup. The 18-year-old Erling is the son of former Nottingham Forest and Manchester City midfielder Alf-Inge Haaland. Norway's 12-0 scoreline against Honduras is the biggest win ever recorded in the history of the U-20 World Cup.

headlines: MIT's $10 glove with sensors helps AI identify objects by touch
text: MIT researchers have created a "scalable tactile glove" (STAG) that carries over 550 tiny sensors which help AI identify objects through touch alone, for about $10. STAG's system predicted each object's identity on touch alone with up to 76% accuracy when trained on a dataset of 26 objects. It was able to predict most objects' weight within about 60 grams.

headlines: Will bring governance to make nation look up to Andhra: CM
text: YSRCP President and newly-elected Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy on Friday said that he will bring upon good governance that will make the nation stand and look up to the state. "This mandate has put upon me a huge responsibility," he added. Thanking voters for his victory, he further said that he will live up to their expectations.

headlines: PM Modi, Sri Lankan President Sirisena hold bilateral talks
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi held a bilateral meeting with Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena at the Hyderabad House in New Delhi on Friday. The meeting took place a day after Sirisena, along with leaders from fellow member-states of BIMSTEC (Bay of Bengal Initiative for Multi-Sectoral Technical and Economic Cooperation), attended PM Modi's swearing-in ceremony.

headlines: IITians' video app Roposo to raise $5 mn from Tiger Global
text: Gurugram-based video app Roposo is raising $5 million in a new funding round from Tiger Global Management, a board resolution filed with MCA revealed. It had raised $10 million in extended Series C funding from Tiger Global and Bertelsmann India Investments in December 2018. Roposo was founded by IIT-Delhi alumni Avinash Saxena, Kaushal Shubhank and Mayank Bhangadia.

headlines: CBI moves Delhi HC for early hearing of 2G spectrum case
text: The CBI on Friday moved the Delhi High Court for early hearing in its appeal against the acquittal of the accused in the 2G spectrum case. The accused include former Union Telecom Minister A Raja and DMK's newly-elected Thoothukudi MP Kanimozhi. The court has sought replies from the accused on the plea and has posted the matter to July 30.

headlines: K'taka govt imposes ban on mechanised fishing for 2 months
text: The Karnataka government on Friday issued an order banning mechanised fishing activities off its coast for 61 days to facilitate breeding of fish in the Arabian Sea. The ban, which will come into effect from June 1, was also issued considering the safety of fishermen during monsoon. It will apply to boats having onboard or outboard engines above 10 horsepower.

headlines: Virat & Divine collaborate for PUMA's 'SockThem' cricket anthem
text: Virat Kohli and Divine have come together for a unique anthem, 'Chakravyuh Mein SockThem'. Launched by PUMA, 'SockThem' is inspired by Virat's famous gestureÂ– "let the bat do the talking" and provides Indian cricket fans a platform to show their support. Featuring several athletes including World's No.1 boxer, Mary Kom, it aims to be the biggest cricket anthem of today.

headlines: Amit Shah gets Home, Rajnath Defence Ministry in new Cabinet
text: The government has released the list of Cabinet Ministers. Debutants Amit Shah and Subrahmanyam Jaishankar have been given the charge of Ministry of Home Affairs and Ministry of External Affairs, respectively. Rajnath Singh is the new Defence Minister and Nirmala Sitharaman has been named Finance Minister. Smriti Irani has been given charge of Textiles and Women and Child Development Ministries.

headlines: PM Modi retains charge of Space, Atomic Energy Departments
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has retained the charge of Department of Space and the Department of Atomic Energy in the new government. He will also head Ministry of Personnel, Public Grievances and Pensions. The Prime Minister will also decide on all important policy issues and will be incharge of all other portfolios not allocated to any Minister.

headlines: Who's Jaishankar, who replaced Swaraj as External Affairs Minister?
text: S Jaishankar was the Foreign Secretary from 2015 to 2018 and upon retirement, he joined Tata Sons as President (Global Corporate Affairs). A 1977 batch IFS officer, the 64-year-old previously served as Indian ambassador to US and China, and is known as the architect of the India-US nuclear deal. Jaishankar holds an M.Phil and PhD in International Relations from JNU.

headlines: Javadekar gets I&B Ministry, RS Prasad to continue as Law Minister
text: Prakash Javadekar, who earlier served as HRD Minister, has been given the charge of Information and Broadcasting Ministry as well as Forest and Climate Change Ministry. Meanwhile, Ravi Shankar Prasad is incharge of three ministries, namely, Law and Justice; Communications; and Electronics and Information Technology. Dharmendra Pradhan will continue as Petroleum and Natural Gas Minister.

headlines: Want my kids to have both parents: Katrina on not having father
text: Katrina Kaif has said, "When I have kids, I want them to have the experience of being with both parents," adding, "Not having a father figure does create a certain vacuum and makes any girl feel vulnerable." Katrina and her seven siblings were raised single-handedly by their mother Suzanne Turquotte.

headlines: I'm being singled out over poll losses: Sidhu on Punjab CM's remarks
text: Punjab Minister Navjot Singh Sidhu hit back at CM Amarinder Singh for unfairly "singling" him out for Congress' performance in the recent elections and by raising questions about his department's performance. "There're 6-7 people in the government who go after me whereas I've never named anyone. This time, I'm speaking out because things have crossed all limits," Sidhu added.

headlines: UP Police takes action against Cong Sevadal for spreading rumours
text: After Chandigarh Congress Sevadal wrongly claimed that Uttar Pradesh Police have confirmed Union Minister Smriti Irani's aide Surendra Singh was murdered by BJP workers, the police responded to their tweet and called it a 'deliberate distortion of facts'. "We have forwarded your tweet to Amethi police for legal action for spreading rumour," it added. Sevadal has deleted its tweet.

headlines: Smriti helped me as I was stuck in rush post PM's oath: Asha Bhosle
text: Asha Bhosle has shared a picture along with Smriti Irani, who helped her as she was "stranded in the crazy rush post PM Narendra Modi's oath ceremony". "No one offered to help me except @smritiirani who saw my plight & made sure I reached home safely. She cares & that's why she won," Bhosle tweeted.

headlines: We were targeted as we are women: Mimi on Gambhir's Parliament pic
text: Bengali actress and newly-elected MP, Mimi Chakraborty has said that people targeted her and Nusrat Jahan on social media for wearing western clothes in Parliament as "they are women". Her remark came after a journalist shared Gautam Gambhir's picture outside the parliament and asked, "Has the fashion police attacked Gambhir yet? Or only for the women?"

headlines: Rijiju named Sports Minister, Hardeep Puri gets Aviation Ministry
text: Kiren Rijiju has been named the new Sports Minister of India, replacing Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore. Hardeep Singh Puri has been given charge of Housing and Urban Affairs, Civil Aviation. Anurag Thakur is the new junior finance minister, while Gajendra Singh Shekhawat has been named Minister of Jal Shakti. Piyush Goyal has been named Railway Minister and Commerce and Industry Minister.

headlines: Nirmala becomes first full-time female Finance Minister of India
text: Nirmala Sitharaman has become the first full-time female Finance Minister of India, replacing Arun Jaitley who had opted out of the new Cabinet because of health issues. In 2017, she had also become the first full-time female Defence Minister of India. Indira Gandhi had briefly taken additional charge of Finance and Defence ministries during her tenure as Prime Minister.

headlines: Andhra police defuse 4 IEDs planted by Naxals near outpost
text: The Andhra Pradesh police defused 4 IEDs, weighing 10 kg each, that were planted by Naxals near an armed police outpost in Visakhapatnam district on Thursday. The police have detained two people and identified 18 people, including Maoists and militia, who are suspected to be connected to the crime. Meanwhile, no casualties have been reported.

headlines: Kajol approached to star in Jayalalithaa biopic 'Sasilalithaa'
text: Kajol has been approached to star in 'Sasilalithaa', a biopic based on former Tamil Nadu Chief Minister J Jayalalithaa, the film's director Kethireddy Jagadiswara Reddy confirmed. "I'm...looking forward to Kajol's response, as I've worked with her late father-in-law, Veeru Devgan," Reddy said. Malayalam actress Amala Paul has been approached to play the role of jailed AIADMK leader VK Sasikala.

headlines: When will I get home? Rishi on 8 months of cancer treatment in US
text: Actor Rishi Kapoor, who is undergoing treatment for cancer in the US, tweeted on Friday, "Today I complete eight months here in New York. When will l ever get home?" The actor recently revealed that he is cancer free and in remission. Rishi is scheduled to undergo a bone-marrow transplant, which has delayed his return to India.

headlines: Papa lost 12 kg: Janhvi shares pic of dad Boney Kapoor
text: Actress Janhvi Kapoor shared a picture of her father filmmaker Boney Kapoor on Instagram's Story feature, and revealed that he has lost 12 kg. "Slim trim and healthy. So proud!!!" the actress captioned the picture. In the picture, Boney is seen wearing a Jodhpuri suit with a red pocket square and sunglasses.

headlines: Stalin will be sworn in as CM of Tamil Nadu: Andhra CM
text: After taking oath as Chief Minister of Andhra Pradesh, YSRCP President Jagan Mohan Reddy on Thursday said that DMK chief MK Stalin will be sworn in as CM of Tamil Nadu. This comes after DMK won 23 Lok Sabha seats in Tamil Nadu. The next Assembly elections in Tamil Nadu are scheduled to be held in 2021.

headlines: India steadfast on path of progress under PM Modi: Jaitley
text: Congratulating Narendra Modi for taking oath as Prime Minister, BJP leader Arun Jaitley on Thursday said that India is moving steadfast on the path of progress under him. "I wish the very best to all the members inducted in the Union Council of Ministers," he added. Earlier, the former Finance Minister had opted out of the Cabinet citing health reasons.

headlines: 2 die after entering borewell without safety aids in Noida
text: Two labourers died in Noida after they allegedly got stuck in a 40-feet deep borewell, police said. The two were engaged by a private company for the work and were asked by their supervisors to go down the borewell without any safety measures, police added. Their bodies have been sent for post-mortem and a probe is underway.

headlines: Students' Union President of DU college found hanging
text: Students' Union President of Ram Lal Anand College, Delhi University was found hanging at his home in Nanakpura area of the city on Thursday, police said. Police suspect it to be a case of suicide and are probing the reason behind it. However, no suicide note was recovered from the room where the body was found.

headlines: Ganga water unfit for drinking, bathing in most places: CPCB
text: The Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) said that the water of river Ganga is unfit for direct drinking and bathing at most of the places it travels through in India. Out of 86 live monitoring stations installed across India, only seven areas were found to be fit for drinking after disinfection and 18 were found to be fit for bathing.

headlines: 16-yr-old boy dies after continuously playing PUBG for 6 hours in MP
text: Furqan Qureshi, a 16-year-old boy in Madhya Pradesh's Neemuch, died while continuously playing mobile game PUBG for six hours. A student of Class 12th, he was at his ancestral home to attend a marriage. "He was brought without pulse...While playing the game a person becomes so excited that it might cause sudden cardiac arrest," Cardiologist Ashok Jain said.

headlines: PIL filed in HC for change in title of Salman's film 'Bharat'
text: A PIL was filed in the Delhi High Court seeking a change in the title of the upcoming Salman Khan starrer 'Bharat'. The petitioner claimed that the title violates the legal act, according to which the word 'Bharat' cannot be used for commercial purposes. The petitioner further sought to change a dialogue where the lead character is compared to India.

headlines: Police denies reports of arresting actors dressed as bombers
text: Mumbai Police denied reports that it arrested two men suspected to be terrorists, who later turned out to be extras dressed as militants for Hrithik Roshan and Tiger Shroff's upcoming film. Responding to a report tweeted by a Gujarati news channel, Mumbai Police wrote, "Kindly verify facts." Earlier, reports stated that the men were booked for creating panic among citizens.

headlines: Will skin you alive: Mamata scolds men chanting 'Jai Shri Ram'
text: In videos that have surfaced online, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee was seen scolding several men shouting 'Jai Shri Ram' at her convoy. Banerjee threatened the men with "Chamra gutiye debo (I'll skin you alive)" and asked police personnel in her convoy to search every house in the area. West Bengal police have arrested 10 people after the incident.

headlines: Six women among 57 ministers in PM Modi-led Council of Ministers
text: Of the 57 leaders who became part of the Union Council of Ministers in the PM Narendra Modi-led government on Thursday, six were women. Smriti Irani, Nirmala Sitharaman and Harsimrat Kaur Badal took oath as the Cabinet Ministers. Meanwhile, Sadhvi Niranjan Jyoti, Renuka Singh Saruta and Debasree Chaudhuri were sworn in as Ministers of State.

headlines: SoftBank Vision Fund seeking $4bn loan against Uber stake: Report
text: Japanese conglomerate SoftBank's $100-billion Vision Fund is looking to borrow $4 billion against its stakes in Uber, Slack and blood-testing company Guardant Health, Financial Times reported. It's reportedly in talks with banks including Goldman Sachs for the loan. Notably, SoftBank is the largest shareholder in both Uber and Guardant Health, with a 12.88% and a 30.74% stake respectively.

headlines: Indian Army organises Iftar party in J&K's Poonch district
text: The Indian Army organised an Iftar party in the Poonch district of Jammu and Kashmir on Thursday. The party was attended by a large number of people. In June 2018, the Army had hosted a similar Iftar party, and before the commencement of the feast, Army officers and attendees had offered prayers for the peace and prosperity of the region.

headlines: Video: UAE tower lit up with PM Modi's pic to mark his swearing-in
text: The UAE government lit up the ADNOC building in Abu Dhabi on the occasion of PM Narendra Modi's swearing-in ceremony. Indian and UAE flags, and portraits of PM Modi shaking hands with Abu Dhabi Crown Prince Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan were displayed. "Now this is true friendship," Indian Ambassador to UAE Navdeep Suri said after sharing the video.

headlines: Admiral Karambir Singh assumes charge as Chief of the Naval Staff
text: Admiral Karambir Singh has assumed charge as the 24th Chief of the Naval Staff. "My predecessors made sure that Navy has a solid foundation and has reached new heights," he said. "It'll be my endeavour to continue with their efforts and provide India with a Navy that's strong, credible and ready to meet security challenge in maritime domain," Singh added.

headlines: Doctor forced to chant 'Jai Shri Ram', says he was terrorised
text: Arun Gadre, a Pune gynaecologist, claims he was "accosted, cornered and forced to shout Jai Shri Ram" by 4-5 youths while on a morning walk in New Delhi's Connaught Place on May 26. "One of them said, why are you talking so slowly and asked me to give a big shout...Fortunately, they didn't harm me...I was terrorised," the 60-year-old said.

headlines: N Korea executes 5 officials over failed Kim-Trump summit: Reports
text: North Korea reportedly executed its former top nuclear envoy with the US along with four other foreign ministry officials in March after a failed summit between leader Kim Jong-un and US President Donald Trump in Vietnam. Talks between the US and North Korea have stalled since the Vietnam summit, with no plans for them to get underway.

headlines: Pakistan Army gives retired Brigadier death penalty for spying
text: Pakistan Army has sentenced Retired Brigadier Raja Rizwan to death alongside a civilian officer for spying and "leaking sensitive information to foreign agencies in detriment to national security". It also sentenced Retired Lieutenant General Javed Iqbal to life imprisonment in the same case. Pakistan Army chief General Qamar Javed Bajwa endorsed the sentences in a closed-door military trial.

headlines: Salman had nothing to do with it: Katrina on signing Bharat
text: While speaking about replacing Priyanka Chopra in the upcoming Salman Khan starrer 'Bharat', Katrina Kaif said, "Salman had genuinely nothing to do with it." "When [director Ali Abbas Zafar] sent me the script, I loved the character," the actress added. Katrina signed the film after Priyanka backed out due to her wedding with American singer Nick Jonas.

headlines: To romance Salman Khan in Bharat is a dream come true: Disha
text: Speaking about working with Salman Khan in the upcoming film 'Bharat', actress Disha Patani said, "[T]o be romancing him [in the film] is a dream come true." "It felt great...he's a star and it's a big opportunity to get a film alongside him," she added. Disha further said that Salman was a great co-star and was always helpful on set.

headlines: US startup unveils 1st of its kind hydrogen-powered air taxi
text: US-based startup Alaka'i unveiled a "first of its kind" flying taxi Skai that will run on hydrogen fuel cells. Skai's six-motor design was co-created with BMW's Designworks. It will carry up to five people or a maximum payload of about 450kg and will be able to fly for up to four hours with a nearly 644-km range, Alaka'i claimed.

headlines: Congratulations to all who took oath today: PM Modi
text: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday congratulated all the Union Council members who took the oath in the forecourt of the Rashtrapati Bhavan. He added that this team is a blend of "youthful energy and administrative experience", has people who have "excelled as Parliamentarians" and those who had "distinguished professional careers". He further said, "Together, we'll work for India's progress."

headlines: Opp'n need to do lot of 'Kapalbhati' for next 10 yrs: Ramdev
text: After Narendra Modi took oath as the Prime Minister, Yoga guru Baba Ramdev said Opposition leaders need to do a lot of 'Kapalbhati' and 'Anulom Vilom' for the next 10-15 years to control stress. He further said that all ministers who took the oath will live up to people's expectations. PM Modi-led 57-minister council was administered the oath on Thursday.

headlines: Myntra to absorb remaining Jabong employees on its payroll
text: Myntra has announced it will absorb all remaining Jabong employees on its payroll to create a unified workforce. Flipkart-owned Myntra had acquired Jabong for $70 million in 2016. Jabong reportedly had a total of 400 employees in 2018, of which 180 were fired and 100 were absorbed in Myntra after Walmart's $16-billion deal to acquire 77% stake in Flipkart.

headlines: 4 killed, 9 injured after vehicle falls into gorge in J&K
text: At least four people were killed and nine others were injured after the vehicle they were travelling in fell into a gorge in Jammu and Kashmir's Doda on Thursday. The vehicle was on its way to Bhalla when it skidded off the road and fell. This is the third such accident in Doda in 24 hours, an official said.

headlines: NALSAR University gets notice over non-implementation of quota
text: The National Commission for Backward Classes on Thursday issued a notice to NALSAR University of Law, Hyderabad over non-implementation of Backward Classes quota in admission. The notice was served on the basis of representation received from three persons and a letter from Congress. The Commission has sought the presence of NALSAR Vice-Chancellor on June 4 to address the matter.

headlines: Hosts England open World Cup with 104-run win against South Africa
text: Hosts England defeated South Africa by 104 runs in the 2019 World Cup opener at Kennington Oval in London on Thursday. England and South Africa have faced each other in World Cup seven times now, with England winning four times. As many as four English batsmen scored fifties in the match, a first for them in World Cup history.

headlines: Trolled for opposing Salman's 'walked like raped woman' remark: Sona
text: Singer Sona Mohapatra, who received death threats after criticising Salman Khan for his remarks on Priyanka Chopra, has revealed she was trolled for two months after she called out the actor over his 'walking like raped woman' remark three years ago. "There were acid attack and gang rape threats," she added. "But now, I've also received...positive feedback," said Sona.

headlines: Kangana Ranaut, Karan Johar take pics together at PM's swearing-in
text: Actress Kangana Ranaut and director Karan Johar took pictures along with celebrities including Rajinikanth, Shahid Kapoor and others at PM Narendra Modi's swearing-in ceremony at Rashtrapati Bhavan on Thursday. In the past, Kangana had called Karan Johar "flag bearer of nepotism" in the industry. "My warm wishes are with PM so that India becomes a $5 trillion economy," Kangana said.

headlines: I say Aligarh, they hear Taale: Vijay Shekhar on viral 'I say' tweets
text: After 'I say, they hear' tweets went viral, Paytm Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma tweeted, "I say Aligarh. They hear Taale." Other tweets read, "I say Nagpur, they hear 49.5Â°C," and "I say khudayi, they hear JCB." Other users tweeted, "I say Goa. They hear Feni," and "I say googly, they say wrong Â‘un."

headlines: Stokes takes one-handed catch, gives autograph to fans mid-match
text: England all-rounder Ben Stokes pulled off a one-handed diving catch near the boundary rope to dismiss South Africa all-rounder Andile Phehlukwayo for 24(25). Phehlukwayo smacked a shot through the deep mid-wicket, where Stokes launched horizontally towards the rope and timed his jump perfectly to pull off the catch. He then went towards the fans and signed autographs mid-match.

headlines: My first experience of commentary: Sachin shares pic with Harbhajan
text: Former India cricketer Sachin Tendulkar took to Twitter to share a picture of himself with off-spinner Harbhajan Singh. "My first experience of commentary," he captioned the picture. Sachin was part of the commentary team which covered the 2019 World Cup opener between South Africa and England. Virender Sehwag and Sourav Ganguly were also part of the commentary team.

headlines: Together again: Sehwag on commentating with Sachin, Ganguly
text: Former India opener Virender Sehwag took to Twitter to share two pictures of himself with his former teammates Sourav Ganguly and Sachin Tendulkar, with the caption, "Together again." In one of the pictures, the trio can be seen commentating together in the 2019 World Cup opener between England and South Africa and the other picture is from their playing days.

headlines: World no. 1 Djokovic reaches French Open third round
text: World number one Novak Djokovic defeated Switzerland's Henri Laaksonen to reach the third round of the French Open. The 32-year-old won the match with the scoreline of 6-1, 6-4, 6-3 in one hour and 33 minutes. Djokovic will play unseeded Italian Salvatore Caruso, who knocked France's 26th seed Gilles Simon out of the Roland Garros, in the next round.

headlines: Serena Williams cruises into round 3 of French Open
text: Twenty three-time Grand Slam champion Serena Williams has reached the round three of French Open. The 37-year-old defeated Japanese Kurumi Nara 6-3, 6-2 on Thursday to win her career's 801st match on tour. She will take on fellow American Sofia Kenin in the next round, with world number one Naomi Osaka as a potential opponent in the quarter-finals.

headlines: People chant 'Jai Shri Ram' at MamataÂ’s car, she steps out to respond
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee stepped out of her car and responded to people chanting "Jai Shri Ram" slogans as her convoy was passing through North 24 Parganas district's Bhatpara on Thursday. Mamata said, "These are all outsiders and BJP people, they are criminals and were abusing me." The area is the stronghold of the newly-elected BJP MP Arjun Singh.

headlines: We didn't know Dr Payal's caste, she shirked responsibility: Accused
text: The three women doctors accused in Dr Payal Tadvi's suicide case said they didn't know Payal's caste and claimed she "shirked responsibilities" as she stopped coming to hospital between November 2018-December 2018. They said this in their anticipatory bail plea submitted in a Mumbai court on Tuesday before their arrest. They added that they only had "professional interaction" with Payal.

headlines: Which ministers from previous PM Modi govt aren't part of new one?
text: Sushma Swaraj, who was External Affairs Minister in PM Narendra Modi's previous government, is not part of the council of ministers who took oath today. Maneka Gandhi, Suresh Prabhu, Vijay Goel, Arun Jaitley, Uma Bharti and JP Nadda are also not part of the new council of ministers. Manoj Sinha, Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore and KJ Alphons have also been excluded.

headlines: Rumours of Musharraf's death in Dubai surface, his party clarifies
text: After rumours of the death of Pakistan's ex-President Pervez Musharraf in Dubai surfaced, his All Pakistan Muslim League party denied it saying he's undergoing treatment at a hospital there. He's said to be suffering from amyloidosis. Musharraf, who's facing treason charges for suspending the Constitution, had left Pakistan for Dubai in 2016 to seek medical treatment and hasn't returned since.

headlines: Telangana Cong leaders hold fast urging Rahul not to resign
text: Telangana Pradesh Congress Committee (TPCC) General Secretary Bollu Kishan and former MP V Hanumantha Rao observed a day-long fast on Thursday, urging Congress President Rahul Gandhi not to resign from the post. TPCC President N Uttam Kumar Reddy said the party needed Rahul's leadership at this "crucial juncture". The fast was held at the Congress headquarters in the state.

headlines: Kumaraswamy meets Rahul Gandhi, urges him not to step down
text: Karnataka Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy on Thursday met Congress President Rahul Gandhi and requested him "not to step down from his post" following the Congress party's defeat in the Lok Sabha elections. He added that he also apprised Gandhi about the political developments in Karnataka. The meeting took place at Gandhi's residence and lasted for over 20 minutes.

headlines: Virat Kohli shares pictures after meeting Queen, Prince Harry
text: Virat Kohli took to Twitter to share pictures from meeting of 2019 World Cup captains with Queen Elizabeth and Prince Harry at Buckingham Palace. "It was an honour meeting Her Majesty the Queen and Prince Harry at the Buckingham Palace yesterday," he captioned the picture. India will face South Africa in their first 2019 World Cup match on June 5.

headlines: BJP trying to divide Bengalis and non-Bengalis in WB: Mamata
text: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday accused BJP of trying to create a divide between Bengalis and non-Bengalis in the state. "They want to destroy the communal harmony in the state. I hate a party like BJP," she said. "I would urge the people of this country to raise their voice against such communal divide," the CM added.

headlines: Honoured to serve India, tweeted PM before oath-taking
text: Minutes ahead of taking oath as the Prime Minister for the second consecutive term, PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said that he was "honoured to serve India". PM Modi also urged his followers on Twitter to watch the oath ceremony in the forecourt of the Rashtrapati Bhavan. PM Modi was administered the oath of office by President Ram Nath Kovind.

headlines: BJP worker stabbed to death in West Bengal
text: A Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) worker was stabbed to death in West Bengal on Thursday, police said. According to reports, the worker was putting up BJP flags to celebrate PM Narendra Modi's oath-taking ceremony when he was attacked. Following the incident, the worker was immediately rushed to a local hospital where he was declared brought dead, a report said.

headlines: Not opposed to Renault-Fiat Chrysler deal, says Nissan
text: Nissan on Wednesday said it does not see "any particularly negative aspect" in its French partner Renault's potential $35 billion merger with Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (FCA). A Nissan official reportedly said that "many details need to be worked out" before the Japanese automaker solidifies its position on the issue. Notably, Renault owns a 43.4% stake in Nissan.

headlines: Together, we will work for India's progress: PM after taking oath
text: After taking oath with his council of ministers on Thursday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi tweeted, "Congratulations to all those who took oath today." "This team is a blend of youthful energy and administrative experience. It has people who have excelled as Parliamentarians and those who have had distinguished professional careers. Together, we will work for India's progress," he added.

headlines: China accuses US of engaging in 'naked economic terrorism'
text: China on Thursday accused the US of provoking trade disputes and engaging in "naked economic terrorism, economic chauvinism and economic bullying". "We oppose a trade war but are not afraid of a trade war," China's Vice Foreign Minister Zhang Hanhui stated. The statements come as the US raised tariffs on $200 billion of Chinese goods, following which China retaliated.

headlines: Rajnath, Nirmala in Cabinet again; Shah debuts as Union Minister
text: Rajnath Singh, Nirmala Sitharaman, Nitin Gadkari and Smriti Irani took oath as Union Ministers again at the swearing-in ceremony being held at the Rashtrapati Bhavan today. Amit Shah, who won the Lok Sabha elections from Gandhinagar, joined PM Narendra Modi's Cabinet for the first time. Piyush Goyal, who was Railways and Coal Minister, also took oath.

headlines: Ex-Foreign Secy Jaishankar, now at Tata Sons, joins PM's Cabinet
text: Veteran diplomat S Jaishankar, who served as the Foreign Secretary from January 2015 to January 2018, was sworn into PM Narendra Modi's Cabinet on Thursday. Upon retirement, Jaishankar joined Tata Sons as President of Global Corporate Affairs in April last year. A Padma Shri awardee, the 64-year-old played a key role in the negotiation of the US-India Civil Nuclear Agreement.

headlines: England score 300+ total for the fifth consecutive time in ODIs
text: England put up a total of 311/8 against South Africa in the 2019 World Cup opener today. This is the fifth consecutive 300-plus total for England in ODI cricket. Jason Roy, Joe Root, Eoin Morgan and Ben Stokes scored fifties, marking the first time that four England batsmen have scored 50-plus runs in an innings of a World Cup match.

headlines: PM Modi's mother watches his swearing-in ceremony in Gujarat on TV
text: Heeraben Modi, the mother of PM Narendra Modi, watched the swearing-in ceremony of her son on the television in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Thursday. Four days before taking oath as PM for a second term, Modi visited his mother Heeraben Modi to seek her blessings. This morning, PM Modi paid his tributes at Mahatma Gandhi memorial at Rajghat in Delhi.

headlines: Ex-Bhutan PM corrects Indian media after it uses wrong images for PM
text: Former Bhutan PM Tshering Tobgay took to Twitter after some Indian media organisations used wrong photos, including a picture of Tobgay himself, for Bhutan PM Lotay Tshering. "India's media would be up in arms if any other country got picture of their PM wrong," tweeted Tobgay, adding that Indian media insulted Bhutan. Bhutan PM Lotay attended PM Narendra Modi's swearing-in.

headlines: KKR's Rinku Singh banned for 3 months for playing T20 event in UAE
text: Uttar Pradesh and Kolkata Knight Riders batsman Rinku Singh has been banned for three months by the BCCI for participating in a T20 tournament in UAE's Abu Dhabi without taking the board's permission. Rinku has been withdrawn from India A squad for the second four-day match against Sri Lanka A. Rinku's ban is set to begin from June 1.

headlines: Paswan, Giriraj among 24 Cabinet ministers in PM Modi's new govt
text: Narendra Modi on Thursday took oath as the Prime Minister of India along with his Council of Ministers. BJP National President Amit Shah and Subrahmanyam Jaishankar took oath as Union Ministers for the first time. Other Cabinet ministers include Nirmala Sitharaman, Ram Vilas Paswan, Arjun Munda, Dharmendra Pradhan and Giriraj Singh among others.

headlines: Trump says Russia helped him get elected, retracts comment
text: US President Donald Trump tweeted on Thursday, "I had nothing to do with Russia helping me to get elected." However, he retracted his comment telling reporters, "No, Russia didn't help me get elected...I got me elected." Trump has in the past denied any collusion between his 2016 presidential campaign and Russia, and called the Russia meddling probe "a witch hunt".

headlines: Hopeful of seeing PM Modi as PM till I'm alive: Actor Jeetendra
text: Before attending the oath-taking ceremony of PM Narendra Modi, veteran actor Jeetendra said that as long as he lives, he's hopeful of seeing PM Modi as the Prime Minister of the nation. He added, "It's a historic moment. I'm a big follower and an ardent fan of Modiji." Jeetendra further said that he thinks the country is in "beautiful hands".

headlines: Zuckerberg may face vote on stepping down as Facebook Chairman
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg may face a leadership vote at the annual general meeting to step down as Chairman on Thursday. "Zuckerberg is very unlikely to lose the vote because he has 60% of the voting power," BBC said. Trillium Asset Management, that owns Facebook shares worth $7 million, is one of those advocating for Zuckerberg to step down.

headlines: BJP trying to disturb Opposition's state govts: Ashok Gehlot
text: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Thursday accused BJP of attempting to destabilise state governments of the Opposition parties. "Even before the swearing-in ceremony...they're trying to disturb and dismantle state governments of opposition parties including West Bengal, Karnataka and MP," he tweeted. However, he also extended his wishes to the new government and wrote, "My best wishes from Jaipur."

headlines: Change in my department will be CM Singh's decision: Sidhu
text: Punjab's Local Government Minister Navjot Singh Sidhu has said that change in his department will be the decision of state CM Captain Amarinder Singh. Defending the performance of his ministry, Sidhu added he worked to the best of his "ability". Sidhu asserted that "real work" towards development in the department started only in the last two years of his tenure.

headlines: Andhra CM Jagan announces call centre in CMO to tackle corruption
text: Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy announced the opening of a call centre in the CMO to receive complaints from the people about corruption, discrimination or on not receiving government schemes' benefits. He added by August 15, four lakh jobs will be provided with the appointment of village volunteers. Reddy said, "I'll root out corruption from top to bottom."

headlines: Ferrari's 1st plug-in hybrid car is its fastest at 340 kmph
text: Ferrari unveiled its first production plug-in hybrid supercar SF90 Stradale, its fastest to-date with a top speed of about 340 kmph, which can go from 0-100 kmph in 2.5 seconds. It features a 4-litre, 769-horsepower turbo V8 engine and offers around 25 km of drive purely on electric power. It is, however, less powerful than its predecessor LaFerrari on paper.

headlines: Bira beer maker raises $4 million at $246-million valuation
text: Craft beer Bira 91's maker B9 Beverages has raised about $4.3 million in a pre-Series C funding round from Sixth Sense Ventures, as per regulatory filings accessed by business intelligence platform Paper.vc. Delhi-based B9 Beverages' post-money valuation was estimated at about $246 million. It last raised $50 million in May 2018 from Belgium-based Sofina, an investor in Flipkart and Byju's.

headlines: 217th ISS spacewalk successfully carried out by 2 cosmonauts
text: Two Russian space agency Roscosmos' cosmonauts have successfully carried out the 217th spacewalk for International Space Station's support, maintenance and upgrade. The spacewalk, fourth for 2019, was done by Expedition 59 Commander Oleg Kononenko and Flight Engineer Alexey Ovchinin and lasted six hours and one minute. This was Commander Kononenko's fifth spacewalk and the first-ever for Ovchinin.

headlines: 7 South Koreans killed, 21 missing as tourist boat sinks in Hungary
text: At least seven South Korean tourists have died and 21 others are missing after a boat sank in the Danube river in Hungary's capital Budapest on Wednesday. According to the police, seven of the victims were not wearing life jackets. The incident occurred as the tour boat collided with a larger passenger luxury boat during a rainstorm.

headlines: Not in a position to approve financial results: Jet Airways
text: Jet Airways on Thursday said it is not in a position to consider and approve its audited financial results for FY19 owing to the ongoing bidding process and resignations of employees and directors. The Mumbai-based airline has seen the exit of several top executives after Chairman Naresh Goyal stepped down in March. Jet Airways suspended its operations in April.

headlines: Narendra Modi takes oath as India's Prime Minister for second term
text: Narendra Modi, who was elected for a second term at the Centre, took oath as the Prime Minister at the Rashtrapati Bhavan on Thursday. The oath-taking ceremony was attended by leaders of the BIMSTEC member countries. Several foreign and Opposition leaders attended the ceremony including Presidents of Sri Lanka, Bangladesh and Myanmar, and Congress' Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi.

headlines: Endeavor student fights language barrier to score 99.97%ile in CAT
text: Fighting language barrier Darshak Lodhiya, an Endeavor student scored overall 99.97%ile and 100%ile in Quant, securing admission to IIM-Calcutta. He says, "I found that in CAT, the main focus should be on basics and the pedagogy of Endeavor perfectly helped." Passing CAT-18 Final, 65+ Endeavor students have secured admission in IIM ABCLIK, 175+ in NMIMS Mumbai, 40+ in SIBM Pune.

headlines: Most blessed gift on my birthday: Paresh on PM's oath-taking ceremony
text: Actor-politician Paresh Rawal, who turned 64 on Thursday, took to Twitter to write that PM Narendra Modi's oath-taking ceremony is the "biggest, happiest and the most blessed birthday gift" he could get. "Today is a very auspicious...day as our beloved PM...is taking oath for the second term," he tweeted. PM Modi will take oath at 7 pm at Rashtrapati Bhavan.

headlines: Ananya got into 2 universities, didn't go because of film: Chunky
text: Reacting to rumours that his daughter Ananya Panday lied about her college admissions, Chunky Panday said, "She got into two universities, but didn't go because she got 'Student Of The Year 2'." "I don't think she'll be going to university now," he added. Earlier, girls claiming to be Ananya's schoolmates alleged that she lied about her admission to international universities.

headlines: Sachin Tendulkar makes debut as on-air expert in 2019 World Cup
text: Former India batsman Sachin Tendulkar made his debut as an on-air expert in the 2019 World Cup, appearing in the pre-match show ahead of the tournament opener between England and South Africa. The 46-year-old represented India in six World Cups and holds the record for scoring most number of runs in the World Cup (2,278 runs).

headlines: Punjab CM Amarinder Singh to not attend PM Modi's swearing-in
text: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh will not attend PM Narendra Modi's swearing-in ceremony today in New Delhi. Earlier, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel and Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik had opted out of attending the ceremony. PM Modi's swearing-in ceremony is the biggest event at Rashtrapati Bhavan with about 8,000 guests, including several world leaders, in attendance.

headlines: Pulwama martyr's family reaches Delhi for PM Modi's swearing-in
text: Family members of Sudip Biswas, a CRPF jawan from West Bengal who was martyred in the Pulwama terror attack, on Thursday arrived in Delhi to attend PM Narendra Modi's swearing-in ceremony. Biswas' mother said, "We've been invited to attend the event. Despite being in sorrow, we have come here." Forty CRPF jawans were martyred in the Pulwama attack in February.

headlines: NDA ally JD(U) opts out of Cabinet in protest on getting 1 ministry
text: JD(U) President and Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said on Thursday that his party won't be a part of PM Narendra Modi's new government. "The offer we got wasn't acceptable," Kumar added, referring to his party being given just one ministry in the Cabinet. "We are fully in NDA and not upset at all. We are working together," he further said.

headlines: Musk says his Tesla compensation was 'net negative' last year
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said his 2018 compensation was "net negative" as he had paid for most of his company-related expenses. Tesla granted the billionaire a $2.3 billion award last year but the stock options are tied to performance goals. Musk said there was a campaign being pushed by those betting against Tesla to spread "fear, uncertainty and doubt."

headlines: Paytm COO Vasireddy, ex-Paytm Mall COO Sinha quit: Report
text: Paytm Chief Operating Officer (COO) and Senior VP of business Kiran Vasireddy and former Paytm Mall COO Amit Sinha are leaving the homegrown fintech giant, Entrackr reported. Since Sinha led Paytm Mall till February, his accountability quotient for Paytm Mall's poor performance stands high, Entrackr quoted sources as saying. "Their resignation is only a speculation," Paytm responded to the report.

headlines: Man calls IRCTC's reply on vulgar ads 'vague', asks for details
text: After IRCTC responded to man's complaint about 'obscene and vulgar' advertisements on their app saying the ads are related to the browsing history, the man termed the reply as "very vague and cryptic". He said that IRCTC should elaborate in detail, adding, "IRCTC cannot shun the responsibility without providing the details." Reacting to it, a user tweeted, "Koi samjhao isse."

headlines: Banks can use Aadhaar for KYC with customer's consent: RBI
text: The RBI has lifted a ban on bank use of Aadhaar for KYC verification, adding the banks can now do so with the customer's consent. The Union Cabinet had approved an ordinance to allow voluntary use of the Aadhaar for KYC in February. Use of Aadhaar for KYC was banned for private firms by the Supreme Court last year.

headlines: India's only orangutan 'Binny' dies aged 41 at Odisha zoo after illness
text: India's only orangutan, Binny, passed away at the age of 41 at Odisha's Nandankanan Zoological Park on Wednesday following a prolonged illness. She suffered old-age related ailments followed by respiratory tract infection and was undergoing treatment for a year. Binny was brought to Nandankanan Zoo from Pune's Rajiv Gandhi Zoological Park in November 2003, when she was 25.

headlines: Female co-host to join Salman in Bigg Boss season 13: Report
text: Salman Khan will reportedly be joined by a female co-host for the upcoming season of reality show 'Bigg Boss'. The actor, who has been the face of the show for a long time, felt that the move would add a new element to it, reports suggested. The 13th season of 'Bigg Boss' is reportedly slated to release on September 29.

headlines: PM Modi is ready with plan for the country: Hema Malini
text: BJP's Hema Malini on Thursday said PM Narendra Modi is ready with a "plan" for the country and he'll accomplish it for sure. "There are high hopes which will definitely be fulfilled. Modiji's vision...for the country...is ready in his mind," she added. In the Lok Sabha elections, Malini won from Mathura seat by a margin of over 2 lakh votes.

headlines: Viral 'dancing uncle' dances to Big B's song, Big B responds
text: Sanjeev Shrivastava, dubbed as 'dancing uncle' on social media after his video went viral, shared a video of himself dancing to Amitabh Bachchan's song 'Khaike Pan Banaras Wala', along with a message urging the actor to watch his video. Responding to Sanjeev's post on Twitter, Amitabh wrote, "Supeeerrrrrrrr." Sanjeev earlier met Govinda and Salman Khan after his video went viral.

headlines: Kangana already recorded statement: Rangoli on Pancholi case
text: Rangoli Chandel denied reports that stated her sister Kangana Ranaut was yet to record her statement to the police despite multiple reminders after accusing actor Aditya Pancholi of assault. "#Fakenewsalert statements have been recorded, please calm down Pancholi PR," Rangoli tweeted. In a complaint against Kangana, Aditya earlier claimed that her lawyer threatened him with a rape case.

headlines: Didn't ask if I could be in Bharat: Katrina denies director's claim
text: Katrina Kaif refuted director Ali Abbas Zafar's claim that she insisted on being part of 'Bharat' while they were working together on 'Tiger Zinda Hai'. "I know he's my best friend but I've to clear this...I genuinely didn't say that," the actress said. Katrina signed the film after Priyanka Chopra backed out due to her wedding with Nick Jonas.

headlines: This is the pervert Indian Idol wants? Sona on Anu's reported return
text: After reports suggested that Anu Malik will return to 'Indian Idol' as a judge, singer Sona Mohapatra shared an article quoting two women who accused Malik of sexual harassment. "This is the pervert Sony Music & Indian Idol want...around young girls & boys?" Mohapatra tweeted. Malik earlier stepped down as 'Indian Idol' judge following multiple sexual harassment allegations against him.

headlines: Cong leader writes letter in blood urging Rahul not to quit
text: Congress leader Shailendra Tewari has written a letter in 'blood' to party President Rahul Gandhi, urging him not to quit from the post. In the letter, Tewari asserted that the party workers will devote every drop of their blood to Congress. Following Congress' debacle in the general elections, Rahul offered his resignation from the post to the Congress Working Committee.

headlines: Huawei not banned from using SD Cards, clears SD Association
text: SD Association (SDA) has denied reports that the world's second-largest smartphone maker Huawei was barred from the association, effectively banning it from using SD Cards in future devices. Huawei's temporary absence from SDA's website was due to "a technical issue". Its status was temporarily "modified" in order to comply with recent orders from the US Department of Commerce, SDA said.

headlines: Avg age of Indian customer reducing: Mercedes-Benz India CEO
text: Mercedes-Benz India CEO Martin Schwenk has said the average age of the luxury car brand's customers in the country is late 30s and that this is gradually reducing. "When I joined...I was told the brand...resonated with customers in the higher age bracket," he said. Customer inputs have helped the brand remove the 'uncle' image it had in India, Schwenk added.

headlines: World's smallest surviving baby born in US, weighed 245 grams at birth
text: A US hospital on Wednesday revealed the birth of a baby girl named 'Saybie' and said she's believed to be the world's smallest surviving baby, who weighed 245 grams at birth. Born at 23 weeks and three days in December, she was in neonatal intensive care unit for five months. Initially, doctors said she would survive for only an hour.

headlines: Amit Shah to be part of PM Modi's Cabinet, tweets Guj BJP President
text: The BJP's Gujarat President Jitu Vaghani on Thursday tweeted that party President Amit Shah will be a part of PM Narendra Modi's Cabinet. He also went on to congratulate Shah in his tweet, thanking him for his leadership. PM Modi will take oath in the presence of many Opposition and international leaders at Rashtrapati Bhavan at 7 pm today.

headlines: War veteran says he saw Sarfarosh before losing leg; Aamir replies
text: Kargil War veteran Major DP Singh, who lost a leg during the 1999 Kargil War, tweeted that the last film he watched as an "intact" man was Aamir Khan's 'Sarfarosh'. "Exactly 20 years ago I watched...#Sarfarosh...and same I did just now...That time on both legs. Now one less," he wrote. Aamir wrote in response, "Your post gave me goosebumps."

headlines: Spinner bowls 1st over of WC for 1st time, takes wicket on 2nd ball
text: South African leg-spinner Imran Tahir has become the first spinner to bowl the first over of a World Cup edition, achieving the feat against England today. The 40-year-old, who is the oldest player to feature in 2019 World Cup, dismissed Jonny Bairstow for a golden duck on the second ball. He gave away just one run in the first over.

headlines: Rahul's image will fall if he's not firm on quitting: Yashwant
text: After Rahul Gandhi offered to resign as Congress chief, former Union Minister Yashwant Sinha tweeted, "If Rahul Gandhi does not stand firm on his resignation, he will lose further in public estimation." Yashwant added, "Let the party be run by a presidium or any other arrangement at least for some time." Meanwhile, several politicians have requested Rahul not to resign.

headlines: BJP's youngest MP Tejasvi Surya talks to top scientist CNR Rao
text: The BJP's youngest parliamentarian Tejasvi Surya on Thursday said he spoke to top scientist CNR Rao. "I am a resident of Bengaluru South & delighted to get young representative like you," Rao was quoted as saying by 28-year-old Surya. "Humility is the hallmark of great men," Surya wrote about Rao, who invited him to visit the Indian Institute of Science.

headlines: Dal Raisina, fruit tart in menu for guests at PM Modi's swearing-in
text: Samosas, fruit tart, paneer dishes, tea and coffee is on the menu at the high tea, which will be open to all the guests attending PM Narendra Modi's swearing-in ceremony in Rashtrapati Bhavan. The dinner, hosted for 40 people including world leaders, will have options including fish, chicken, mutton, vegetables and Dal Raisina, which takes 48 hours to cook.

headlines: My reward for serving Army: Kargil veteran who's declared foreigner
text: Kargil war veteran Mohammed Sanaullah, who was declared a foreigner and detained by Boko Foreigners' Tribunal in Assam, has said, "This is the reward I got after serving for 30 years in the Indian Army." "I am an Indian...will forever remain an Indian," the 52-year-old added. Meanwhile, Sanaullah's family has moved the Gauhati High Court against the tribunal's decision.

headlines: Man dies after setting himself on fire near White House
text: A man who set himself on fire near the White House on Wednesday, has died of his injuries. The man, identified as Arnav Gupta, had attempted self-immolation on the Ellipse, a park near White House and authorities administered first aid to him on the scene. Videos showed him walking while engulfed in flames as authorities sprayed him with fire extinguishers.

headlines: Russia may be conducting nuclear tests illegally: US
text: Russia may be testing low-yield nuclear weapons in violation of the Comprehensive Nuclear-Test- Ban Treaty (CTBT), Lieutenant General Robert Ashley, the Director of the US Defense Intelligence Agency, said. The CTBT is a multilateral agreement which bans nuclear explosions of any size, for either civilian or military purposes. However, the CTBTO said it had not detected any unusual activity.

headlines: Kangana, Shahid, Karan to attend PM Modi's swearing-in ceremony
text: Several Bollywood celebrities, including Kangana Ranaut, Shahid Kapoor and Karan Johar will attend PM Narendra Modi's swearing-in ceremony at Rashtrapati Bhavan on Thursday. Actors Anupam Kher, Anil Kapoor, Vivek Oberoi and Hema Malini earlier arrived in Delhi to attend the ceremony. Rajinikanth, Shah Rukh Khan and Kamal Haasan have also been invited for the ceremony.

headlines: Actress shares old pics of Salman from daughter's wedding
text: On the occasion of her daughter Amrita's wedding anniversary, actress-turned-politician Bina Kak shared old pictures from the wedding, in which Salman Khan is seen attending the function with no shirt on. The pictures feature Salman wearing a white ganji and jeans, along with a cap and sunglasses. Actress Katrina Kaif was also seen attending the wedding with Salman.

headlines: Google marks start of ICC Cricket World Cup 2019 with doodle
text: Google celebrated the start of the International Cricket Council's 2019 World Cup with an animated doodle. The 12th edition of the ICC World Cup begins today at the Kennington Oval ground in London. The format of the World Cup has been tweaked this time, with each team requiring to play other nine teams in the group stages.

headlines: She better not come: Manoj on Mamata skipping PM oath-taking
text: After West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee refused to attend PM Narendra Modi's oath-taking ceremony, Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari said that "she better not come". Tiwari added that after causing "bloodshed" through violence in the democracy, Mamata has no "courage" to face people in such ceremonies. PM Modi and other Union Council members will take the oath today.

headlines: Rahul congratulates Jagan Mohan Reddy on becoming Andhra CM
text: Congress chief Rahul Gandhi congratulated YSR Congress Party chief YS Jagan Mohan Reddy after he took oath as the Chief Minister of Andhra Pradesh.
