Rahul tweeted, "My best wishes to him, his new team of ministers and to all the people of the state." The YSR Congress Party won 151 of 175 seats in the Andhra Pradesh Assembly elections.

headlines: Wish to see Rahul as Congress President: Ramdas Athawale
text: Rajya Sabha MP and Republican Party of India (A) chief Ramdas Athawale said that he wished to see Rahul Gandhi as the Congress party President. Athawale's reaction comes after Rahul on Saturday submitted his resignation from the post to the Congress Working Committee. Athawale added that it's Congress' internal matter and is "completely on them to decide what to do".

headlines: 3 arrested from Agartala railway station, 5 pistols seized
text: The Railway Protection Force on Wednesday arrested three people, including a tribal woman, from Tripura's Agartala Railway Station. Assistant Commandant of RPF Abhay Kumar Singh said the woman was carrying "five pistols, six loaded magazines, some Indian currencies, two mobile sets, and an ATM card." She was supposed to hand over the items to two youths.

headlines: SpiceJet plans to add eight more planes from grounded Jet
text: SpiceJet CFO Kiran Koteshwar has said the carrier plans to add eight more Boeing 737 Next-Generation planes from the now grounded Jet Airways' fleet in next two weeks. The Ajay Singh-led carrier recently inducted 22 such planes from Jet. "The capacity vacated by Jet had to be filled...Our increased capacity will help...cater to higher demand during June quarter," Koteshwar said.

headlines: Ordering on Uber Eats can win users tickets to the ICC World Cup
text: As a part of its World Cup campaign, Uber Eats is offering users a chance to win tickets to the ICC World Cup in England. With every order, users will score runs and make their Home Advantage count. The more runs they earn, higher their chances of winning tickets, official ICC merchandise and exclusive offers on Uber Eats.

headlines: YS Jagan Mohan Reddy takes oath as Andhra Pradesh CM
text: YSR Congress Party chief YS Jagan Mohan Reddy took oath as the Chief Minister of Andhra Pradesh in Vijayawada at 12:23 pm today. The 46-year-old had offered prayers at Tirupati temple ahead of the ceremony. Notably, his party won 151 of 175 seats in the Assembly elections, nearly a decade after its launch and staying in the opposition.

headlines: From 'Slut' to 'Mam': Sona shares man's apology on his death threat
text: Singer Sona Mohapatra, who revealed on Wednesday that she received death threat from a Salman Khan fan after she criticised the actor, has now shared another screenshot of the man apologising to her and addressing her as 'Mam'. "From 'Slut I'll kill you' to 'Sona Mam'...I'm guessing he figured that #India would find & thrash him soon enough," she tweeted.

headlines: I became a sex symbol at 16, it haunted me my entire life: Lisa Ray
text: Actress-model Lisa Ray, a cancer survivor, has said she became a sex symbol at the age of 16, while adding, "To suddenly become this figure for an entire nation...that has haunted me my entire life up until now." "I hate to be labelled and put into boxes but I had to deal with it since a young age," she added.

headlines: 12 Manipur Congress MLAs tender resignation from MPCC posts
text: Twelve Manipur Congress MLAs have tendered their resignation from their posts in the Manipur Pradesh Congress Committee. MPCC president G Gaikhangam said, "Rahulji has offered his resignation to give direction to strengthening the party. So, at Pradesh Congress Committee levels we have to follow suit." The resignations do not necessarily mean the MLAs will join another party, Gaikhangam added.

headlines: Malala trolls India as Pak finishes ahead in WC opening party event
text: Nobel laureate Malala Yousafzai trolled India after Pakistan finished ahead of India in a 60-second 'gully cricket' event at 2019 World Cup opening party in London on Wednesday. India, represented by actor Farhan Akhtar and ex-captain Anil Kumble, came last after managing 19 runs. "Pakistan, we were okay, not too bad, came number 7 but India came last," she said.

headlines: Prince Harry sledges Australia captain Finch at Buckingham Palace
text: Prince Harry sledged Australia captain Aaron Finch while meeting 2019 World Cup captains at the Buckingham Palace on Wednesday. "You're getting on a bit now, aren't you? How long have you been playing?" Prince Harry asked Finch. After Prince Harry asked Finch who are favourites to win the World Cup, the Australian responded, "England and India."

headlines: Google CEO Pichai refused stock award over generous pay: Report
text: Google CEO Sundar Pichai turned down a "big new grant" of restricted stock in 2018 because he felt he was already paid generously, Bloomberg reported citing sources. Another giant payday on top of hundreds of millions of dollars in previous awards could've sparked controversy, the report added. Pichai reportedly hasn't received an equity award in over two years.

headlines: Uber to deactivate users with low ratings in US, Canada
text: Uber announced it may start deactivating users in the US and Canada if their rating falls significantly below their city's average. "Respect is a two-way street, and so is accountability," Uber said, adding riders will receive tips on how to improve ratings, such as avoiding leaving trash behind. Drivers reportedly face risk of deactivation if their rating falls below 4.6.

headlines: Himachal road transport bus veers off mountain road; all safe
text: Passengers travelling in a Himachal Road Transport Corporation (HRTC) bus had a narrow escape when the bus veered off the road in the mountainous region near Bakhela, Solan district. There were nine passengers on the bus, along with the bus driver and conductor. No casualties were reported.

headlines: Woman kills husband, walks to police station with severed head
text: A 48-year-old woman confessed to killing her 55-year-old husband after walking to the nearest police station in Assam's Lakhimpur district with his severed head in a plastic bag. The woman, who is the mother of five children, said, "He had been beating me for many years...He even injured me with an axe." She has been remanded in judicial custody.

headlines: Questioned 11 times, 70 hours: Vadra posts on FB before ED questioning
text: Before heading to the Enforcement Directorate office on Thursday for questioning in a money laundering case, businessman Robert Vadra made a Facebook post. "Till date, I have deposed 11 times with questioning of approximately 70 hours," he said. "In the future also, I will cooperate as always, till my name is cleared of all false allegations and accusations," he added.

headlines: Rohtang Pass to open to tourists on June 1
text: The 13,050-foot-high Rohtang Pass is set to open to tourists from June 1 onwards, according to district authorities. Kullu Deputy Commissioner Yunus said, "Permits to 1,300 vehicles are being issued for each day. The pass will remain closed every Tuesday for maintenance purpose." Earlier, Rohtang Pass was opened for the movement of small vehicles.

headlines: PM Modi pays tribute at Mahatma Gandhi memorial before swearing-in
text: PM Narendra Modi paid tribute to Mahatma Gandhi at Rajghat and former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee at Atal Samadhi, ahead of his swearing-in ceremony for the second consecutive term on Thursday. PM Modi also paid tribute to the martyred jawans at the National War Memorial in Delhi. The oath-taking ceremony is scheduled to start at 7 pm.

headlines: Murder angle in doctor case: Lawyer as autopsy shows neck injury
text: The post-mortem report of postgraduate medical student Dr Payal Tadvi, who was found dead in her hostel room recently, has revealed evidence of a ligature mark on her neck. Tadvi family's lawyer said, "From the circumstances of her death and bruise mark on her body, we can say that it must be a case of murder and not of suicide."

headlines: Man sues university for losing sex drive after not getting admission
text: Kuldeep Mann, a 52-year-old Indian-origin man, has sued the James Cook University in Australia, for causing him "mental torture" that affected everything in his life, including his sex drive. The university had refused to grant him admission to a PhD course, accusing him of plagiarism. He is seeking $3.125 million in damages from the university.

headlines: Ex-Tehran Mayor confesses to killing wife, sips tea on Iran state TV
text: Mohammad Ali Najafi, former Mayor of Iranian capital Tehran, confessed to killing his wife over domestic issues on national television and surrendered to police. The 67-year-old politician, who's an MIT graduate, was seen sitting unhandcuffed and sipping tea inside the police station in footage aired by news broadcasters. The 35-year-old victim's body was found in a bathtub with bullet wounds.

headlines: 16 women sue FBI over sexual discrimination: Report
text: Sixteen women have filed a lawsuit against the US' Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) accusing it of discriminating against them on the basis of their gender at its training academy, the New York Times reported. More female agent trainees were dismissed from the academy as compared to males, the lawsuit alleged. A woman also claimed instructors made repeated sexual advances.

headlines: Hero's Sunil Munjal owns 4.4% of Airtel Africa, invested $200 mn
text: Hero Enterprise Chairman Sunil Kant Munjal owns a 4.37% stake in Airtel Africa, which he bought for $200 million, according to the company's filings with London Stock Exchange for IPO. Munjal left India's largest two-wheeler maker Hero MotoCorp in an ownership split in 2016. While Airtel owns 68.31% in the subsidiary, Mittal family's Indian Continent Investment owns a 9.88% stake.

headlines: More reason to make film after Sridevi: Boney on Mr India reboot
text: Producer Boney Kapoor confirmed that he is planning a reboot of his 1987 film 'Mr India', which featured his late wife Sridevi and his brother Anil Kapoor in lead roles. "After [Sridevi], I've even more reason to make the film," the producer said. "The idea is to create a reboot first, and then make a franchise of it," Boney added.

headlines: Anil dedicates Mr India's 32nd anniversary to late Veeru Devgan
text: On the occasion of his film 'Mr India' completing 32 years of release, Anil Kapoor took to Twitter to share a post dedicating the film's anniversary to its late action director Veeru Devgan. "Mr India was made iconic by its children-friendly action scenes and Veeru's Midas touch," Anil wrote. Devgan passed away on Monday after reportedly suffering a cardiac arrest.

headlines: I'd jump at a role like Deepika's in Chhapaak: Katrina Kaif
text: Katrina Kaif was asked during an interview what sort of role she would like to take up in the future, to which she said, "[I]f a role like what Deepika (Padukone) is doing in 'Chhapaak' is offered to me, I'd jump at it." Directed by Meghna Gulzar, 'Chhapaak' will see Deepika portray the role of acid attack survivor Laxmi Agarwal.

headlines: Global Big Data software market will be worth $31B in 2019: Forbes
text: According to a Forbes report, the global Big Data software market will be worth $31B this year, growing 14% from 2018. BITS Pilani's PG program in Big Data & Analytics helps professionals learn from BITS Pilani's faculty, provides 5+ case studies with hands-on learning and 1-1 mentorship. Learners have transitioned into companies like VMWare, Infosys, KPMG, Microsoft, Oracle and more.

headlines: Hazard scores twice as Chelsea defeat Arsenal to win Europa League
text: Forward Eden Hazard scored twice as Chelsea defeated their London rivals Arsenal 4-1 to win the Europa League 2018/19. This is the second time that Chelsea have clinched Europa League after first winning it in 2012/13. Forward Olivier Giroud, who opened the scoring for Chelsea in the 49th minute, finished with most goals (11) in the Europa League this season.

headlines: Who are the world leaders attending PM Modi's oath-taking ceremony?
text: Kyrgyzstan President Sooronbay Jeenbekov and Bangladesh President Abdul Hamid have confirmed their attendance at Narendra Modi's swearing-in ceremony for a second term as Prime Minister today. Apart from them, Presidents of Sri Lanka and Myanmar and Prime Ministers of Nepal, Mauritius and Bhutan as well as Thailand's Special Envoy will also be present in Rashtrapati Bhavan for the ceremony.

headlines: Actress Tanuja diagnosed with diverticulitis; to undergo surgery
text: Veteran actress Tanuja, Kajol's mother, will undergo an operation for a condition called diverticulitis, which results in the inflammation or infection of small pouches called diverticula that develop along the walls of the intestines. The 75-year-old was admitted to Mumbai's Lilavati Hospital on Tuesday. The news comes two days after the demise of veteran action director Veeru Devgan, Kajol's father-in-law.

headlines: Queen Elizabeth, Prince Harry meet World Cup captains, share pics
text: Queen Elizabeth and Duke of Sussex, Prince Harry, met the 2019 World Cup captains a day before the tournament starts. The official Twitter account of the royal family shared a group picture of captains with the Queen and another wherein India captain Virat Kohli, England captain Eoin Morgan and Bangladesh captain Mashrafe Mortaza can be seen interacting with Prince Harry.

headlines: Cong to not send spokespersons for TV debate for a month: Surjewala
text: Congress communications in-charge Randeep Singh Surjewala on Thursday announced that the party has decided to not send spokespersons on television debates for a month. "All media channels/editors are requested to not place Congress representatives on their shows," he added. This comes amid reports of Rahul Gandhi planning to resign from the post of Congress President.

headlines: England, not India are favourites for World Cup: Sunil Gavaskar
text: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said that England and not India are the favourites for 2019 World Cup. "They have been playing outstanding cricket over the last few years and in familiar home conditions will be hard to beat," he added. England are currently the top-ranked ODI side in the world.

headlines: World number 2 Rafael Nadal races into third round of French Open
text: World number two Rafael Nadal defeated German qualifier Yannick Maden to reach the third round at French Open. The 32-year-old defeated the 29-year-old 6-1, 6-2, 6-4 in two hours and nine minutes. Nadal has now won 88 of his 90 French Open matches.The 32-year-old will next face Belgian David Goffin.

headlines: Excessive gaming officially declared as addictive disorder by WHO
text: The World Health Organisation (WHO) has officially declared excessive gaming as an addictive disorder. The WHO announced members states have agreed to adopt the 11th revision of its International Statistical Classification of Diseases and Related Health Problems (ICD-11), to which gaming addiction was added last year. The revised IDC-11 will come into effect on January 1, 2022.

headlines: 'Inspired' by Pulwama, Hizbul tried copycat attack on CRPF convoy
text: The NIA has found that terror group Hizbul Mujahideen was behind the March 30 failed car bomb attack on a CRPF convoy in Banihal, J&K. Hizbul was "inspired" by Pulwama attack and "wanted to gain international headlines so its Pakistan-based leader Syed Salahuddin is praised in that country," officials said. NIA learnt about the conspiracy while questioning arrested Hizbul terrorists.

headlines: PM Modi pays tribute to martyred jawans at National War Memorial
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited the National War Memorial in New Delhi and paid tribute to martyred jawans on Thursday. Defence Minister Nirmala Sitharaman also accompanied PM Modi, along with Army Chief General Bipin Rawat, Navy Chief Admiral Sunil Lanba and Vice Chief of Air Force Air Marshal RKS Bhadauria.

headlines: Fire breaks out at Bengaluru airport eatery, no casualties
text: A fire broke out at the food joint 'Burrito Boys' at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport in the early hours of Wednesday, triggering panic among passengers and staff. Authorities said, "No one was injured in the incident and it had no impact on airport operations. An in-depth fire-safety audit is being carried out." The joint was located away from the terminal.

headlines: Kargil war veteran, who served 30 yrs in Army, declared 'foreigner'
text: Retired honorary Lieutenant Mohammed Sanaullah, who served the Indian Army for 30 years and also fought in the Kargil war two decades ago, has been declared a 'foreigner' by the Boko Foreigners' Tribunal in Assam. The 52-year-old's family approached the Gauhati High Court on Wednesday after he was sent to a detention centre for illegal immigrants by the tribunal.

headlines: My last breakup forced me to analyse myself, my life: Katrina
text: Speaking about how things changed for her personally and professionally after her last breakup, Katrina Kaif said, "After my...relationship...I was forced to analyse many things about myself and my life." "That phase made me read a lot. I wanted to understand how...human beings function," the actress added. Katrina further said that she learnt to face the things that upset her.

headlines: Fanboy moment: Farhan on pic with ex-cricketer Viv Richards
text: Actor Farhan Akhtar took to Instagram to share a picture with former Windies captain Sir Vivian Richards, which was taken at the 2019 Cricket World Cup opening party in London. "Full fanboy moment," the actor captioned the picture. The World Cup opening ceremony was co-hosted by the actor's girlfriend Shibani Dandekar.

headlines: MS Dhoni my favourite for no. 4 batting position: Harbhajan
text: Off-spinner Harbhajan Singh has said MS Dhoni is his favourite to bat at number four for India in World Cup. "He should be brought up the pecking order as he has the ability and experience to come in and hit sixes and attack any bowler," he added. He stated he doesn't want to see Vijay Shankar bat at number four.

headlines: India pace attack potent, Bumrah rarely has a bad day: Agarkar
text: Former India fast bowler Ajit Agarkar has said that India's fast bowling attack is very potent and the balance of all-round attack is good. "We have seen what Jasprit Bumrah does, he rarely has a bad day, which is such a plus," he added. "Mohammad Shami, in my opinion, should play ahead of Bhuvneshwar Kumar," he further said.

headlines: Australia sues Sony for refusing faulty PlayStation game refunds
text: Australian regulator ACCC has sued Sony Europe for violating law by refusing refunds on faulty PlayStation games. Sony also allegedly told customers it couldn't provide refunds unless the games' independent developer confirmed it was irreparably faulty. "Sony Europe gave false and misleading information to customers about their rights in relation to games sold via PlayStation store," ACCC said.

headlines: China seeks explanation from FedEx after Huawei parcels diverted
text: China has sought an explanation from American package delivery company FedEx over allegations that it diverted some of Huawei's parcels meant for Asia to the US. The Chinese telecom giant, which was recently blacklisted by the US, lodged a complaint with China's postal regulator regarding the diversion. The US has accused Huawei's products of facilitating Chinese espionage.

headlines: China military to replace Windows OS with custom OS: Report
text: Beijing officials have reportedly decided to develop a custom operating system that will replace Windows OS on Chinese military computers. Reportedly, China is doing this in an effort to make it harder for foreign actors, mainly the US, to spy on its military operations. This comes amid the US blacklisting Huawei following which Google announced ending Android updates for it.

headlines: China accuses US of abusing WTO national security exception
text: China has accused the US of abusing a national security exception at the World Trade Organization (WTO) by blacklisting Chinese telecom giant Huawei and cutting off its links with American suppliers. It warned that the move could have grave consequences for the global trading system. China further urged the US to "immediately lift all unilateral sanction measures against Chinese companies."

headlines: Largest steelmaker Arcelor cuts production over 'market weakness'
text: The world's largest steelmaker ArcelorMittal has said it is preparing to further reduce production in Europe due to 'continuing market weakness'. This is the second time in less than a month that the Lakshmi Mittal-led company has announced production cuts in Europe. This will be a temporary measure and will be reversed when market conditions improve, a company executive said.

headlines: A solar eclipse proved Einstein right, Newton wrong 100 years ago
text: English astronomer Arthur Eddington used May 29, 1919's total solar eclipse to prove Albert Einstein's theory that gravity can bend spacetime causing light to bend. This challenged Isaac Newton's theory of space being a fixed background on which gravity acts. The eclipse helped observe stars' positions during the daytime, showing a shift from their usual position due to Sun's gravity.

headlines: If not actress, Katrina should get married & produce children: Salman
text: While appearing in an interview with Katrina Kaif, Salman Khan was asked what he felt was an alternate career option for the actress, to which he replied, "She should be married and produce children." When Katrina intervened and said that the interviewer wanted to know what profession she would take up, Salman said that both marriage and children require work.

headlines: Rahul Gandhi takes his dog for ride in car, pic goes viral
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi took his dog for a ride in his car in New Delhi on Tuesday, a picture of which has gone viral on social media drawing many reactions. "Like a common man...Congress President," a person commented on the picture. Rahul Gandhi last spoke to the media on May 23 after Congress' debacle in Lok Sabha elections.

headlines: Election Commissioners' views in files, can be known by RTI: CEC
text: Chief Election Commissioner Sunil Arora has said that the views of individual Election Commissioners are written in files which can be accessed by the public by filing RTI applications. "What is there to hide?" said CEC Arora. This comes after Commissioner Ashok Lavasa's demand to record his dissent in the public orders related to cases of model code violations.

headlines: PM Modi's oath biggest Rashtrapati Bhavan event with 8,000 guests
text: Nearly 8,000 guests will attend the swearing-in ceremony of Prime Minister Narendra Modi at the Rashtrapati Bhavan tomorrow, making it the biggest-ever event held there. The ceremony will be attended by leaders of the BIMSTEC member countries. Apart from world leaders, chief ministers, party leaders and members of Opposition, diplomats, ambassadors and celebrities will also attend the event.

headlines: Indians should be allowed to play foreign T20 leagues, suggests Lara
text: Former Windies captain Brian Lara has suggested that Indian cricketers should be allowed to play foreign T20 leagues. "It will be great to see the players from different countries coming together and playing in these leagues. It helps the game," he added. "No hiding the fact that the Indian cricketers are the most attractive players," he further said.

headlines: ABHM leader, who shot at Gandhiji's effigy, gives knives to students
text: Akhil Bharat Hindu Mahasabha National Secretary Pooja Pandey distributed knives among Class 10-12 students, who scored well in exams, to commemorate Hindu Mahasabha leader VD Savarkar's birth anniversary on Tuesday. "If Hindus want to protect themselves and their nation, they should learn how to use weapons," ABHM said. Pandey was arrested in February for shooting at Mahatma Gandhi's poster.

headlines: Tumour in intestine: Robert Vadra seeks court nod to travel abroad
text: Robert Vadra, accused in a money laundering case, on Wednesday sought court's permission to travel abroad for treatment, citing that he has a small tumour in his large intestine. A Delhi court reserved for June 3 its order on the application of Vadra. Enforcement Directorate opposed Vadra's plea over travel to the UK and two other countries citing health reasons.

headlines: Man kidnaps woman's father, makes him say 'Marry him, he's good man'
text: Delhi Police has arrested a 24-year-old man for allegedly kidnapping a 20-year-old woman's father after she had refused to marry him. The accused forced the father to call the woman and say she should marry him as "he was a good man and the best match for her". The police arrested him by tracking the location of the mobile number.

headlines: Kangana yet to record statement: Police on Aditya Pancholi case
text: After Kangana Ranaut's sister filed a complaint against actor Aditya Pancholi accusing him of assaulting Kangana, the actress is yet to record her statement despite multiple reminders, police said. A detailed statement from Aditya was recorded at Mumbai's Versova Police Station earlier this month. Responding to the actress' sister's complaint, Aditya had earlier filed a defamation case against Kangana.

headlines: Viewing point atop Delhi's Signature Bridge by June 30
text: The viewing point for tourists on the top of Signature Bridge in Delhi is likely to get ready by June 30, as per Tourism department officials. The glass box at a height of 154 metres will enable tourists to have a panoramic view of the city. However, government is yet to decide on its date of opening for the public.

headlines: Gehlot should resign over Cong's defeat in Raj LS polls: UP Dy CM
text: Uttar Pradesh Deputy CM Dinesh Sharma on Wednesday said that Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot should resign from the post following Congress' "defeat" in the state in the general elections. He added that Gehlot had no "moral authority" to remain on the post. Criticising Gehlot further, Sharma said that he couldn't make his son Vaibhav Gehlot win from Jodhpur parliamentary constituency.

headlines: KCR to attend swearing-in of PM Modi and Jagan Mohan Reddy
text: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao said he'll first attend the swearing-in ceremony of YSRCP chief YS Jagan Mohan Reddy as Andhra Pradesh CM and then PM Narendra Modi's oath-taking ceremony tomorrow. President Ram Nath Kovind will administer the oath of office and secrecy to the PM and other Union Council members. Nearly 8,000 guests will attend PM Modi's oath ceremony.

headlines: Only Rahul can lead Congress in this crucial hour: Gundu Rao
text: Karnataka Congress chief Dinesh Gundu Rao on Wednesday requested party President Rahul Gandhi to withdraw his resignation and continue on his post. "We feel that he's the only person who can lead the party in this crucial hour," he said. "The Congress Legislature Party has unanimously passed a resolution that Rahul Gandhi continues as the Congress President," Rao added.

headlines: Naidu not to attend Jagan Mohan Reddy's swearing-in ceremony
text: Telugu Desam Party's (TDP) President N Chandrababu Naidu won't attend the swearing-in ceremony of YSR Congress Party's YS Jagan Mohan Reddy on Thursday. Instead, a TDP delegation will meet and congratulate Reddy at his residence before the ceremony. Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao will be attending the event and PM Narendra Modi and BJP President Amit Shah are also invited.

headlines: Continue, otherwise it will cause us pain: Sheila Dikshit to Rahul
text: Congress leader Sheila Dikshit met party's President Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday to request him to not resign. "We want him to continue on his post, otherwise it'll cause us pain. We've conveyed that to him," she said. Lately, many other political leaders have met Gandhi to urge him to not resign and continue to lead the Congress party.

headlines: Goa CM extends greetings on eve of 32nd Statehood Day
text: Goa CM Pramod Sawant extended greetings to state people on the eve of the 32nd Statehood Day. Sawant said, "It's a day to reflect on our achievements and evolve a strategy to achieve our much-desired status of a prosperous...advanced state." Inaugurating home compost units, Sawant said everyone should buy them so that they can treat their waste on their own.

headlines: Nominations for Padma Awards 2020 to continue till Sept 15
text: Online nominations and recommendations for the Padma Awards 2020, which started on May 1, will continue till September 15, an official statement said. The awards seek to recognise 'work of distinction' and all citizens can make nominations/recommendations including self-nomination. Instituted in 1954, Padma Vibhushan, Padma Bhushan and Padma Shri are announced on the Republic Day every year.

headlines: Weatherman criticises TV show fans over tornado warning complaints
text: A weatherman in the US criticised fans of the 'The Bachelorette' show after they complained that warnings of tornadoes had interrupted the broadcast of the show. "Our job is to keep people safe...Some of you complained this is all about my ego. Stop. It's not. I'm done with you people...This is pathetic," Jamie Simpson said during the live broadcast.

headlines: Jet asks staff to extract server data before system blackout
text: Jet Airways has asked its engineering staff to extract all aircraft maintenance data from systems as IBM-supported servers wouldn't be available from June 1. It added that both Jet Airways and JetLite AMOS Production Environment, a software package for managing aircraft data, won't be available. The DGCA has reportedly de-registered 80 Jet Airways planes after it suspended operations in April.

headlines: Govt offices near Rashtrapati Bhavan to close at 2 pm for PM's oath
text: Government offices around Rashtrapati Bhavan will close at 2 pm on Thursday in view of the swearing-in ceremony of newly-elected PM Narendra Modi. These offices include those located in North Block, South Block, Rail Bhavan, Vayu Bhawan, Sena Bhawan, DRDO Bhawan and Hutments. President Ram Nath Kovind will administer the oath of office and secrecy to PM at 7 pm.

headlines: MIÂ’s Ben Cutting gets engaged to Miss World Australia Erin Holland
text: Mumbai IndiansÂ’ Australian all-rounder Ben Cutting got engaged to his girlfriend and former Miss World Australia Erin Holland after dating for four years. The duo shared their pictures on social media, with Cutting writing, Â“She said yes,Â” and Holland saying, Â“It was always yes.Â” Cutting proposed to Holland at Palm Beach on the Gold Coast.

headlines: Sonia, Rahul to attend PM Modi's swearing-in ceremony: Report
text: UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Congress President Rahul Gandhi will attend PM Narendra Modi's swearing-in ceremony at Rashtrapati Bhavan on Thursday, ANI reported. Heads of regional parties have also been invited for the swearing-in ceremony. Leaders of the Bay of Bengal Initiative for Multi-Sectoral Technical and Economic Cooperation (BIMSTEC) member countries will also attend the ceremony.

headlines: Robert Mueller, US official who led Russia meddling probe, resigns
text: Robert Mueller, the Special Counsel who was appointed to investigate alleged Russian meddling in the 2016 US presidential elections, announced that he is formally closing counsel's office and resigning from Justice Department. Mueller's report had failed to prove any meddling by Russia. "Charging US President Donald Trump with a crime was not an option we could consider," he said.

headlines: Muslim family changes son's name from Narendra Modi to Mohd Modi
text: A Muslim family in Uttar Pradesh's Gonda who had named their newborn son Narendra Modi has changed his name to Mohd Altaf Alam Modi. The boy's mother, Mehnaaz Begum, said some family members had refused to be a part of post-birth ceremonies due to the name. Further, doctors said the baby was born on May 12 and not May 23.

headlines: If I had to be an Indian bowler, I would be Ishant: Jofra Archer
text: England pacer Jofra Archer has said if he wanted to be an Indian bowler, it probably would be Ishant Sharma. "Ishant spent last summer with us at Sussex and he...reminds me of myself. He swings the ball in and doesn't swing it away too much...so I think both of us are same as he is also tall," the 24-year-old added.

headlines: Had to step over a dead body to reach Everest summit: Climber
text: As the death toll on Mount Everest reached 11 this season, climber Elia Saikaly revealed he saw dead bodies enroute and in tents during his ascent. "There were 200-plus climbers...a person's body was fixed to an anchor between two safety lines and every single person that was climbing towards the summit had to step over that human being," Saikaly said.

headlines: Rape case can be quashed if accused weds victim: Kerala High Court
text: Kerala High Court has said such rape cases can be quashed in which the allegation was that the accused had sexual intercourse with the woman's consent on the promise of marriage, if the accused later marries her legally. Justice R Narayana Pisharadi issued the order while quashing a rape case against a man from Pathanamthitta, who later married the woman.

headlines: PM Modi visits Jaitley's residence after he opts out of cabinet
text: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday night visited outgoing Finance Minister Arun Jaitley's residence after the latter requested not to be included in the new Union Cabinet over ill health. Reports said PM Modi asked Jaitley to reconsider his decision ahead of the swearing-in ceremony on Thursday. "I should be allowed a reasonable time for my treatment," the 66-year-old had said.

headlines: 'Buddhist bin Laden' charged with sedition in Myanmar
text: Myanmar monk Wirathu, also dubbed as the 'Buddhist bin Laden', has been charged with sedition over the defamatory remarks he made about State Counsellor Aung San Suu Kyi. An arrest warrant has been issued against Wirathu but his whereabouts are unknown. Wirathu has long been accused of inciting violence against Myanmar's Muslim minority, in particular against the Rohingya Muslims.

headlines: What are rare earths and how are they involved in US-China trade war?
text: Rare earths are a group of 17 elements used in the production of drugs, smartphones, military equipment and electric cars among others. Chinese newspapers reported their country, which accounts for around 70% of global production, is considering restricting rare-earth exports to the US. The US has relied on China for about 80% of its rare-earth imports between 2014 and 2017.

headlines: Tej not responsible for RJD's defeat: Raghuvansh Prasad
text: Rashtriya Janata Dal's (RJD) Raghuvansh Prasad Singh on Wednesday said party leader Tej Pratap Yadav wasn't responsible for party's defeat in Bihar. "I never blamed Tej for this defeat. One man isn't responsible...as it happened all over India," he added. In Lok Sabha elections, RJD didn't win a single parliamentary seat in the state.

headlines: BJP didn't open account in Kerala, no leader will join it: Cong
text: Congress leader Ramesh Chennithala asserted that despite several attempts, BJP couldn't open its account in Kerala in the recently concluded general elections and that no "important leader or worker" will join the BJP in the state. Speaking on Congress leader AP Abdullakutty praising PM Narendra Modi, Chennithala said suitable action will be taken after receiving his explanation on the remarks.

headlines: All 22 MPs will push for special status for Andhra: YSRCP
text: The YSRCP asserted that all the 22 MPs of the party will push for special category status for Andhra Pradesh at the Centre. MP-designate from Visakhapatnam, MVV Satyanarayana said party chief YS Jagan Mohan Reddy has taken the issue "very seriously". Thanking voters for electing him, Satyanarayana added that YSRCP is vowed to transform Visakhapatnam into a world-class city.

headlines: Don't politicise invitation to killed BJP workers' kin: Vijayvargiya
text: BJP leader Kailash Vijayvargiya said that there's "no need to politicise" PM Narendra Modi's oath-taking ceremony invitation to the kin of BJP workers allegedly killed in West Bengal violence. The BJP has invited families of around 50 such workers to the ceremony. Earlier, state CM Mamata Banerjee refused to attend the ceremony, terming reports of BJP workers' political murders "untrue".

headlines: Huawei files motion to declare US ban 'unconstitutional'
text: World's largest telecom equipment maker Huawei filed a motion in a US court to declare National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA), used by US President Donald Trump's administration to ban it, as "unconstitutional". NDAA illegally targets "without opportunity for rebuttal or escape", Huawei said. It provides no opportunity to present evidence as defence, it further added.

headlines: Google contractors work overtime without pay, allege employees
text: Some former and current Google employees told The Guardian that several subcontractors working for Pygmalion, team behind producing Assistant's linguistic data sets, have been routinely pressured to work unpaid overtime for years. Calling it exploitative, a current employee reportedly said, "I don't use the Google Assistant. I know how it's made...I canÂ’t support it".

headlines: Six teenagers start own gardening startup Phoolvari in Delhi
text: Six teenagers began a gardening startup Phoolvari in Delhi, while still in school, YourStory reported. The brainchild of 17-year-old GD Goenka Public School student Vanshaj Chhabra, Phoolvari was conceptualised at a recent pitch competition organised by the Delhi-NCR chapter of global programme TYE. Launched this May, Phoolvari offers landscaping services, and gardening tips, among other services.

headlines: Russia loses $542mn over failed rocket launches from 2010-18
text: The Russian government has revealed it incurred a total loss of around 35 billion rubles (around $542 million) owing to failed rocket launches between 2010-18. The figure is around 13 times more than what was spent on insurance, with over 10 billion rubles uncovered by insurance. "There were 11 failed launches of spacecraft during this period," Russia stated.

headlines: Fire at Park Circus area in Kolkata, no casualties reported
text: A fire broke out at a godown in Park Circus area of south Kolkata on Wednesday. "At least 15 fire tenders are functioning and the fire is under control now. No casualty has been reported yet," Fire Officer Debtanu Bose said. The godown on the Rifle Range Road in the area was stocked with bamboos and plywood.

headlines: Boeing 737 MAX may not return to service until August: IATA
text: The International Air Transport Association (IATA) has said it could take until August for the grounded Boeing 737 MAX planes to resume service. The final say on the timing rests with regulators, it added. The airline group further said it plans to organise a summit with airlines, regulators and Boeing in 5-7 weeks to discuss the aircraft's return to service.

headlines: Vedanta's Agarwal says willing to invest in Zambia amid dispute
text: Vedanta Resources Chairman Anil Agarwal has said he is prepared to invest in increasing Zambian copper production to 400,000 tonnes, creating another 10,000 jobs at Konkola Copper Mines (KCM). For this "the right framework" should be in place, he added. This comes after Zambia accused KCM of breaching its operating licence, and sought a provisional liquidator to run the company.

headlines: 4 Trinamool Congress leaders including MLA Monirul Islam join BJP
text: A day after several Trinamool Congress (TMC) leaders including Mukul Roy's son Subhranshu Roy joined the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), four more TMC leaders joined the BJP on Wednesday. TMC MLA Monirul Islam, Gadadhar Hazra, Mohd Asif Iqbal and Nimai Das joined the BJP. The BJP won 18 seats in West Bengal in Lok Sabha elections and TMC 22 seats.

headlines: T-Series becomes 1st YouTube channel with 100 million subscribers
text: Indian music label T-Series has become the first YouTube channel to reach 100 million subscribers, beating its competitor PewDiePie, who has 96 million subscribers currently. T-Series had briefly crossed PewDiePie in February and has maintained the lead over the last few weeks. The Delhi High Court had banned two of PewDiePie's videos in India over "abusive, vulgar and racist" comments.

headlines: I was sick, thought I might die: Sushmita on why she joined Instagram
text: Sushmita Sen, during an interview with Rajeev Masand, revealed the reason behind joining Instagram. "I was very very sick...I [had] hair that's falling. I [had] steroid deposits. During this time, [I thought], if this does kill me, people would never know who I was," she added. "So one night, I...got on to Instagram and opened that page," said Sushmita.

headlines: Malaika shares pic with armpit hair; receives many hateful comments
text: Actress Malaika Arora received several hateful comments on Instagram after she posted a picture of herself on Wednesday, wherein her armpit hair was visible. "At least shave ur armpits, that's f***ing disgusting," a comment read. The 45-year-old actress also received many encouraging comments like, "This pic has unedited underarm. It shows originality and confidence. Every celebrity should do it."

headlines: 100 NRIs to attend PM Modi's oath-taking ceremony
text: Over 100 Non-Resident Indians (NRIs) will attend PM Narendra Modi's swearing-in ceremony tomorrow, Vijay Chauthaiwale, In-charge of BJP's Foreign Affairs Department, said. Thousands of NRIs were involved in PM Modi's election campaign, he added. "The stature of India has gone up significantly on the global stage. Therefore, the stature of our diaspora has also gone up," he further said.

headlines: I want justice: Killed BJP worker's wife invited to PM's swearing-in
text: BJP worker Chandan Shaw's wife Aarti Devi, whose husband was shot dead in West Bengal, said, "My husband gave his life for Modiji's victory. We want justice." BJP invited the families of around 50 workers who were killed in West Bengal in recent years. "I only want my children to be well-fed, and the murderer must be punished," said Aarti.

headlines: Pleased to see a strong government come back in India: US
text: The US is pleased to see a strong government come back to power in India, David Kennedy, Counselor for Public Affairs, US Embassy in India, said. "Our (US) President (Donald Trump) has expressed his strong desire for continued strength in the US-India relations...We wish the Prime Minister all the best as he is moving to form his government," he added.

headlines: Apple wins new patent for a foldable screen iPhone design
text: Apple has secured a new patent for a foldable screen that could be used on iPhones and other devices. The patent, application for which was filed in January 2018, describes an electronic device with flexible or bendable displays and covers. Apple had won a patent that focussed on a flexible hinge and use of fabric for its housing in 2018.

headlines: IAF, ISRO partner for crew selection, training for Gaganyaan
text: The Indian Air Force has revealed that it has signed an MoU with ISRO for crew selection and training for India's spaceflight programme Gaganyaan. Air Vice-Marshal RGK Kapoor, ACAS Ops (Space) handed over the MoU to Project Director of Gaganyaan programme R Hutton, in presence of ISRO Chairman K Sivan. India plans to send three astronauts to space by 2022.

headlines: Maldives invites PM Narendra Modi to address Parliament
text: The Maldives on Wednesday invited PM Narendra Modi to address the Parliament during his upcoming visit to the country expected in June. PM Modi will visit the Maldives in his first bilateral visit post assuming office for the second term. He had visited the Maldives in November 2018 to attend the oath-taking ceremony of President Ibrahim Mohamed Solih.

headlines: Couple finds hidden camera in ceiling fan in Uttarakhand hotel room
text: A couple staying in Uttarakhand's New Tehri spotted a hidden camera attached to the ceiling fan of their hotel room. The hotel owner was arrested after a complaint was lodged by the couple, accusing him of trying to violate their privacy, said SHO Chandan Singh Chauhan. The police seized the fan, hidden camera, hotel owner's mobile phone and a laptop.

headlines: Rajasthan HC orders cancellation of driving licences of illiterates
text: A single bench of Rajasthan High Court has ordered the state government to withdraw all light motor vehicle driving licences of the illiterate. An illiterate is virtually a menace for the pedestrians as he wouldn't be in a position to understand road signs and notices of caution written on boards for human safety, the court added.

headlines: Pakistan extends airspace closure on Indian border to June 14
text: Pakistani airspace on its eastern border with India will remain closed until June 14, the country's Civil Aviation Authority said. Pakistan closed its airspace in February after the Indian Air Force strike on a Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) terror camp in Balakot. Foreign carriers using Indian airspace have been forced to take costly detours as they cannot fly over Pakistan.

headlines: Shanghvi's brother-in-law's role at Sun Pharma reduced after scandal
text: Sun Pharma's billionaire Founder and MD Dilip Shanghvi's brother-in-law Sudhir Valia has become a non-executive director from whole-time director following a governance scandal. Whistleblower complaints had alleged that Shanghvi-owned Aditya Medisales (AML), a distributor for the drugmaker, made improper loans to firms controlled by Valia. Sun Pharma discontinued its business tie-up with AML.

headlines: Ghibran replaces Shankar, Ehsaan, Loy as Saaho composer: Report
text: Music composer M Ghibran has reportedly been roped in to work on the soundtrack for upcoming film 'Saaho' after Shankar, Ehsaan and Loy backed out of the project. The composer trio opted out earlier this week as they weren't comfortable with multiple composers being involved with the film. Ghibran previously composed music for a promotional clip for the forthcoming film.

headlines: Diljit Dosanjh, Yami Gautam to star together in comedy film
text: Diljit Dosanjh will be starring with Yami Gautam in an upcoming comedy film, which will mark the directorial debut of filmmaker Aziz Mirza's son Haroon. Confirming the news, the film's producer Ramesh Taurani said, "It's a fresh pairing and we're excited because both are competent actors with impeccable comic timing." Shooting for the film will commence in August.

headlines: Post-poll violence will not be tolerated: Tripura CM Deb
text: Tripura CM Biplab Deb alleged that post-poll violence occurs in the state due to the "hangover of the long Communist rule" and warned all BJP supporters to stop the violence as it will not be "tolerated". He added that criminals have no "political identity". Deb said those who try to disturb the functioning of the system will not be "spared".

headlines: Atmosphere in nation rubbed off on Delhi: Kejriwal to volunteers
text: In a letter to AAP volunteers, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said that the reason behind the party's general election defeat was that the atmosphere that prevailed in the country "rubbed off on Delhi" as well. He added another reason is that people saw this "big election" as contest between PM Narendra Modi and Congress President Rahul Gandhi and voted accordingly.

headlines: Google to rank new websites on Search as per mobile versions
text: Google has announced it will analyse and rank all new websites on Search results on the basis of "mobile-first indexing" starting July. Mobile-first indexing means Google predominantly uses mobile version of the content for indexing and ranking, Google explained. Historically, the index primarily used the desktop version of a page's content when evaluating the relevance of a page, it added.

headlines: WhatsApp may roll out 'Dark Mode' in future updates
text: A few users have been spotting 'Dark Mode', or 'Night Mode', in WhatsApp beta version, noticeable in many parts of the app due to the presence of a lot of bugs, WABetaInfo revealed. WhatsApp is now reportedly bringing the dark mode in the next stable release of the update. It will come in the 2.19.139 beta version, as per reports.

headlines: Woman sub-inspector found murdered in police hostel in UP
text: A woman sub-inspector was found murdered in a police transit hostel in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly, police said. She was posted in the local intelligence unit and was living in transit hostel following her divorce. Bareilly SSP Muniraj G said that the assailant had ransacked the room in search of something and that only her mobile phone was missing.

headlines: 737 MAX will be back in air by July, Boeing tells SpiceJet
text: Boeing has told SpiceJet, one of the biggest buyers of the US planemaker's 737 MAX jets, that the grounded jet should be back in the air by July. The low-cost Indian carrier said it has sought compensation from Boeing following the grounding but hasn't received any yet. SpiceJet had taken delivery of 13 MAX jets before the model was grounded.

headlines: I was thrown out of class once as fee wasn't paid on time: Salman
text: Salman Khan has revealed that during his school days, he was thrown out of class by the teacher as his fee wasn't paid on time. "My father asked...what mischief I had gotten into...I confessed...even I didn't know the reason this time," he added. He added that after knowing the reason, his father paid the fee the very next day.

headlines: Tried to buy cocaine, guns in college, got robbed on way: Lalit Modi
text: In a recent interview, ex-IPL chief Lalit Modi admitted he tried to buy cocaine and guns during his college days in the US. "We were going to buy. We got robbed on the way. It was a part of my life. I've no shame about it," he added. He further said he had to do 200 hours of community service.

headlines: After Sadhvi Pragya, BJP MLA Usha Thakur calls Godse 'nationalist'
text: After BJP's Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur courted controversy for calling Mahatma Gandhi's assassin Nathuram Godse a "patriot", Usha Thakur, BJP MLA from Madhya Pradesh's Mhow, termed Godse a "nationalist". "Godse was a nationalist, who was concerned about the nation throughout his life," said Usha. "The circumstances under which he decided to assassinate Gandhiji were known to him only," she added.

headlines: Astronomers say SpaceX's satellites are too bright, Musk responds
text: Several astronomers have complained that SpaceX's recently launched 60 internet satellites are "too bright" and may disrupt observations of the night sky. SpaceX CEO Elon Musk responded that the Starlink constellation "won't be seen by anyone" unless they're going out of their way to look, however, he said he had asked his team to reduce the reflectivity of the satellites.

headlines: HD Kumaraswamy urges Rahul not to resign as Congress chief
text: Karnataka Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy on Wednesday asked Congress chief Rahul Gandhi to reconsider his offer of resigning as the party's president. Kumaraswamy said, "I will meet him tomorrow and speak to him. He should not resign." Although his offer to resign was rejected, Rahul reportedly told Congress he will continue as party chief until a suitable successor is found.

headlines: Main accused in UP spurious liquor tragedy held after encounter
text: Pappu Jaiswal, a salesman of a liquor shop who is the main accused in the Barabanki spurious liquor case, has been arrested following an encounter with UP police. Jaiswal, the fourth person to be arrested in connection with the case, suffered a bullet wound in his right leg in retaliatory firing by policemen. Sixteen people died after consuming spurious liquor.

headlines: 16 terror camps active across LoC in PoK: Reports
text: Indian intelligence agencies have received inputs that 16 terror training camps are active inside Pakistan-occupied Kashmir and terrorists are being readied for infiltration into Kashmir Valley. Army sources quoted by ANI said, "The entire exercise by Pakistan Army and ISI is under our watch and we're ready on LoC and International Border to deal with any misadventure from their side."

headlines: 12-yr-old Gujarat girl becomes Jain monk, parents say 'We are proud'
text: Khushi Shah, a 12-year-old girl from Gujarat's Surat, became a Jain monk on Wednesday. "The pleasures we enjoy aren't permanent as this world is temporary. The only way to peace and salvation is to lead a simple life," Khushi said. Both her parents supported her decision and said that it is a matter of pride for them.

headlines: Major fire breaks out in Delhi girls hostel at 3 am, 50 rescued
text: At least five girls were hospitalised and more than 50 others were evacuated safely after a major fire broke out at a girls hostel in Delhi's Janakpuri area early on Wednesday. The fire was reported at 3.05 am and was brought under control by 3.30 am after four fire tenders rushed to the spot, as per fire officials.

headlines: Pak Army opens fire at unarmed Pashtuns in Waziristan; many killed
text: The Pakistani Army allegedly opened fire at unarmed protesters belonging to the Pashtun ethnic minority in the Waziristan region last week, killing several people. Two MPs of Pashtun Tahaffuz Movement were reportedly leading a procession when firing broke out. The Army said it exchanged fire with protesters when they attacked a security post in the northwest, near the Afghan border.

headlines: India's FDI inflows decline for the first time in 6 years
text: India's Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) equity inflows declined for the first time in six years in 2018-19, falling by 1% to $44.37 billion. The two sectors where FDI inflows dropped the most are telecommunications (fell 57% to $2.7 billion) and pharmaceuticals (dropped 74% to $266 million). Singapore dislodged Mauritius as top source of FDI, accounting for $16.22 billion inflows.

headlines: Can't be in every Salman film: Katrina on being 2nd choice for Bharat
text: While speaking about replacing Priyanka Chopra in the upcoming Salman Khan starrer 'Bharat', actress Katrina Kaif said, " I cannot be in every Salman Khan film." "Doing 'Bharat' was written in my destiny and I'm happy it came to me," she added. Katrina signed the project after Priyanka left the film due to her wedding with Nick Jonas.

headlines: Sheila to stage demonstration to urge Rahul not to resign
text: Delhi Congress President Sheila Dikshit, along with party workers, will hold a demonstration outside party President Rahul Gandhi's residence today, urging him not to step down from the post. The demonstration will reportedly start at 4 pm outside Rahul's Tughlak Lane residence. So far, several top leaders have met Rahul and urged him to continue to lead the Congress.

headlines: TMC govt won't be able to continue till 2021: BJP leader
text: After reports claimed two West Bengal TMC MLAs and 50 TMC municipal councillors joined BJP, BJP leader Rahul Sinha said, "The current government will not be able to continue until 2021." Sinha added, "I think Vidhan Sabha elections will be held within six months to one year in West Bengal...There is a lot of dissatisfaction in TMC."

headlines: Google drops parenting-focussed app Healofy from Play Store
text: Pregnancy and parenting-focussed social networking app, Healofy, was removed from Google's Play Store for allegedly violating its developer policy. "We are working with Google...towards reinstating the app...We have followed the guidelines governing the store and will endeavour to stay compliant with all guidelines," CEO Gaurav Aggarwal said. App has reportedly been unavailable for over 72 hours.

headlines: Flipboard confirms database hack, resets all user passwords
text: News aggregator Flipboard confirmed hackers gained access to and potentially obtained copies of some databases containing users' information, prompting them to reset all users' passwords as a precaution. Involved information included some users' names, cryptographically-protected passwords, among other information. Attacks took place between June 2, 2018 and March 23, 2019 and April 21-22, 2019.

headlines: Facebook to roll out phone shaking feature to report bugs
text: Facebook is adding a 'shake to report' feature to report system bugs through a pop-up menu that will appear when users will shake their phones. It will also let users report when they cannot figure out how to complete an action, like how to delete a story. The feature will be a default one on both iOS and Android.

headlines: With PM Modi back in power, Ram's work will be done: Sena
text: The Shiv Sena has said that with PM Narendra Modi coming to power for the second consecutive term, Lord "Ram's work will be done" (referring to building Ram temple in Ayodhya). This comes after RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said Ram's work "has to be done and will be done". The nation has chosen the party of "Ram's mentality", Sena added.

headlines: BJP's Pema Khandu sworn in as Arunachal Pradesh CM
text: BJP leader Pema Khandu on Wednesday took oath as the Chief Minister of Arunachal Pradesh along with Deputy CM Chowna Mein. Khandu was administered the oath of office and secrecy by Governor Brigadier (Retd) BD Mishra. BJP led by Khandu won 41 seats in the 60-member Assembly, in the state elections held simultaneously with Lok Sabha elections on April 11.

headlines: Woman held at gunpoint, raped in UP's Muzaffarnagar district
text: A woman was allegedly abducted at gunpoint and raped in the Mandwara village of Muzaffarnagar district, the Uttar Pradesh police said. "We have registered a case against one person. The woman has also stated in her complaint that one unknown person was also involved," the police added. The woman will undergo medical tests.

headlines: Mia by Tanishq presents birthstone pendants
text: Mia by Tanishq has added pendants to its Birthstone collection. For the romantics, the travellers, the dieters, the cheaters, the trend setters and the rule breakers, Mia presents a Birthstone pendant for all that you are. With each Birthstone pendant, Mia celebrates diversity and drives you to discover that voice inside, that says #BornToBeMe.

headlines: Arun Jaitley opts out of cabinet citing ill health in letter to PM
text: Finance Minister Arun Jaitley has written to Prime Minister Narendra Modi asking him to keep him away from any ministerial responsibility in the new government due to health reasons. Adding that he has had some serious health challenges during the last eighteen months, Jaitley wrote, "I should be allowed a reasonable time for myself, my treatment and my health."

headlines: Mamata Banerjee not to attend PM Modi's swearing-in ceremony
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has said "untrue" reports of political murders of BJP workers in West Bengal have compelled her to not attend PM Narendra Modi's swearing-in ceremony. The deaths may have occurred due to personal enmity, she added. "The ceremony's an august occasion to celebrate democracy, not one to be devalued by any political party," she further said.

headlines: No one is giving me work: Abhay Deol on his absence from films
text: Actor Abhay Deol, while speaking about his absence from films, said, "No one is giving me work." "If you go against the mainstream narrative, you do not get the (desired) visibility," he added. "The kind of content I want to be a part of, is hardly made. At the same time, I have not closed myself to anything," said Abhay.

headlines: GoT actor Kit Harington checks into rehab over 'personal issues'
text: 'Game of Thrones' actor Kit Harington checked into a wellness centre to work on what his representative said are "personal issues." Reports said the actor was affected by the ending of the show and was being treated for stress, exhaustion and alcohol use. Harington checked into the centre several weeks before 'Game of Thrones' finale aired, reports added.

headlines: Our 6 not 50 councillors joined BJP, that too at gunpoint: TMC
text: After reports claimed 2 TMC MLAs and 50 TMC municipal councillors joined BJP, the Mamata Banerjee-led party tweeted, "One suspended MLA of Trinamool joined BJP...The others were from Congress and CPI(M)." "The number of councillors is 6. That too they were forced at gunpoint to do so," the party added in the tweet with the tag "#FactCheck".

headlines: PokÃ©mon GO maker to release sleep-based gaming app next year
text: The PokÃ©mon Company is releasing a new game next year called PokÃ©mon Sleep, which aims to "turn sleeping into entertainment", CEO Tsunekazu Ishihara announced. The game is in line with augmented reality smartphone game PokÃ©mon GO, developed by San Francisco-based Niantic, and will "reward good sleep habits as part of a healthy lifestyle".

headlines: Truecaller hires ex-Flipkart exec Sandeep Patil as India MD
text: Swedish caller ID service Truecaller has appointed former Flipkart executive Sandeep Patil as the Managing Director of its India operations. He became part of Truecaller's global management team effective May 28, 2019. The IIT-Mumbai and London Business School alumnus had served as Flipkart's head of business for home and furniture, corporate strategy and consumer and commercial lending.

headlines: Twitter to hire 'Tweeter in Chief' for Twitter's official account
text: Twitter listed a job opening to handle its own official account, saying, "Tweet Tweet. You'll be @Twitter on Twitter. Our Tweeter in Chief." "You'll set the tone of who we are and how we act and talk to people on Twitter. No big deal," the micro-blogging platform added. The official Twitter account currently has over 5.6 crore followers.

headlines: Kin of BJP workers who were killed in WB to attend PM's swearing-in
text: The families of around 50 BJP workers allegedly killed in political violence in West Bengal have been invited to PM Narendra Modi's oath-taking ceremony. The families, designated "special invitees" to the ceremony on Thursday, will reportedly stay in Delhi in the care of BJP. The decision was taken in a five-hour meeting between PM Modi and BJP chief Amit Shah.

headlines: UP police inspector found dead at his Siddharthnagar home
text: Uttar Pradesh police inspector Pankaj Shahi was found dead at his residence in Siddharthnagar on Tuesday. Shahi, who was posted as the cyber cell in-charge, had not been picking up calls for over a week, his relatives said. Circle Officer Sunil Singh said, "Prima facie, it looks like a suicide. The dead body has been sent for postmortem."

headlines: Woman tries to jump from office terrace on being fired; gets job back
text: A woman working for a consultancy firm in Gurugram allegedly attempted to commit suicide by jumping from the top of the office building after being fired from her job. The incident's video shows her standing on the terrace's edge and her colleagues and police persuading her to come down. She came down after the administration promised not to fire her.

headlines: World needs India: VP seeks permanent seat at UN Security Council
text: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu has called for renewed efforts by India to gain permanent membership of the UN Security Council (UNSC). "The world needs India because it needs a voice that speaks of peace, non-violence and peaceful co-existence," he said. "(The) vision and voice of India (are) more relevant to the world than ever before," he added.

headlines: Australian pilots hit with lasers during South China Sea exercise
text: Australian Navy helicopter pilots were hit with laser beams during a military exercise in the disputed South China Sea earlier this month. China, which claims nearly 90% of the sea, has been accused of operating a maritime militia who are known to use lasers to warn off other vessels that may be getting too close to them.

headlines: US drops India from its currency monitoring watchlist, keeps China
text: The US Treasury Department, in its semi-annual foreign-exchange report, removed India from the list of countries it scrutinizes for currency manipulation. India was removed given that it met only one of the three criteria, a "significant" bilateral surplus with US, for two straight reports. The US again refrained from labelling China a currency manipulator but kept it on the watchlist.

headlines: Mandana Karimi joins cast of Sunny Leone starrer 'Coca Cola'
text: Actress Mandana Karimi has joined the cast of the upcoming horror comedy film 'Coca Cola', which will see Sunny Leone in the lead role. Speaking about the film, Mandana said, "ItÂ’s a very interesting story and I have never done something like this before." Directed by filmmaker Prasad Tatikeni, shooting for the film will commence in June.

headlines: Ranveer to star in Yash Raj Films' 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar'
text: Ranveer Singh will star in the upcoming Yash Raj Films production 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar', which will mark the directorial debut of actor Divyang Thakkar. "'Jayeshbhai' is a film with a big heart. In its concept and appeal, it encompasses the broadest spectrum of the cinema-loving audience," Ranveer said. 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' will release in 2020 after Ranveer's upcoming cricket film '83.

headlines: No truth to it: Sonal Chauhan denies dating cricketer KL Rahul
text: Sonal Chauhan, best known for her roles in the films 'Jannat' and '3G', has denied reports which claimed that she is currently in a relationship with cricketer KL Rahul. Addressing the rumours, the actress said, "No, not at all. He is a very good cricketer, talented and nice guy." Earlier, reports suggested that the cricketer was dating actress Nidhhi Agerwal.

headlines: Rahul should go on padyatra to connect with people: Singhvi
text: Days after Congress chief Rahul Gandhi offered his resignation, senior party leader Abhishek Singhvi on Tuesday said, "I believe he should consider a 90 or 180-day-long train [tour]-cum-padyatra. It will certainly help in better connection with people." Singhvi added, "As a concerned Congressman, I feel Rahul should not resign as it would be playing into the BJP's hand."

headlines: 22-yr-old dies on job, Spanish delivery startup faces protests
text: Spanish on-demand delivery startup Glovo is facing protests from couriers following the death of a 22-year-old rider, TechCrunch reported. The Nepalese national was struck by a garbage truck in Barcelona, reports said. Glovo confirmed the person wasn't a registered Glovo distributor but the fact that he was found with Glovo backpack suggested he could've been using a third party's account.

headlines: OPPO Reno 10x Zoom with 13MP Telephoto sensor launched in India
text: OPPO has launched its Reno Series in India with 10x Zoom edition. The Reno 10x Zoom smartphone comes with a triple rear camera that includes a 48MP primary camera, an 8MP ultra wide-angle camera and the world's first periscopic telephoto lens. It is uniquely designed to support a Shark Fin Rising Camera and is available in two colours.

headlines: Naveen Patnaik takes oath as Odisha CM for fifth straight term
text: Biju Janata Dal (BJD) chief Naveen Patnaik took oath as Odisha Chief Minister for a fifth consecutive term on Wednesday. Gita Mehta, writer and the CM's sister, was also present at the swearing-in ceremony. BJD came to power in the state after winning 112 of 146 seats in the state Assembly election.

headlines: Modi has united India: TIME article after 'Divider in chief' cover
text: TIME magazine, which published a cover story before Lok Sabha elections calling PM Narendra Modi "India's Divider in chief", has published a new article titled "Modi Has United India Like No Prime Minister in Decades". Narendra Modi "can self-identify with his country's poorest citizens in a way that the Nehru-Gandhi political dynasty...simply cannot," the article posted on TIME's website states.

headlines: What a lie: Hard Kaur to Sameer on taking credit for Chaar Baj Gaye
text: Rapper Hard Kaur on Sunday shared a video clip from 'The Kapil Sharma Show' on Instagram, which shows lyricist Sameer Anjaan stating that he wrote the lyrics of the song 'Chaar Baj Gaye'. "What a f**king lie...Taking my credit and royalties is one thing. Sitting on national TV and talking s**t with such pride is...next level low," she wrote.

headlines: Sona gets death threat after criticising Salman; shares screenshot
text: Singer Sona Mohapatra on Wednesday revealed that she received a death threat after criticising Salman Khan for his remarks on Priyanka Chopra, and also shared screenshots. "Such mails come my way regularly, from the followers of this 'hero' of bad behaviour," she tweeted. Salman had earlier taken digs at Priyanka for exiting the film 'Bharat' due to her marriage.

headlines: I feel violated, embarrassed: Rapper Iggy on leaked topless pics
text: Australian rapper Iggy Azalea deactivated her Instagram and Twitter accounts after topless pictures of her from a 2016 photoshoot for GQ magazine were leaked online. "I feel blindsided, embarrassed, violated, angry...and a million other things," Iggy said in a statement shared earlier. The rapper clarified that the pictures in question were never supposed to be released publicly.

headlines: Chose to appear on red carpet even when I was 18 kg overweight: Lisa
text: Model-actress Lisa Ray, who is a cancer survivor, has revealed that she chose to appear on the red carpet even when she was 41-pound (18 kilograms) overweight because of the steroid used for her cancer treatment. She added, "Appearance at the red carpet, which in present time, is considered as a big achievement, but no, it is not!"

headlines: Woman says Arjun hated Sridevi but is dating Malaika; actor responds
text: Arjun Kapoor has responded to a woman on Twitter who said he "hated" his father Boney Kapoor's second wife Sridevi but is dating Malaika Arora who has a teenage son. "I don't hate anyone...If I did I wouldn't have been there for...dad, Janhvi, Khushi at a sensitive time," he replied. The woman later deleted her tweet and apologised to Arjun.

headlines: Dhoni, Rahul smash hundreds as India beat B'desh in warm-up match
text: India defeated Bangladesh by 95 runs in their final warm-up match ahead of 2019 World Cup on Tuesday. Driven by MS Dhoni's 113(78) and KL Rahul's 108(99), India put up a total of 359/7 in their 50 overs. Indian spinners Yuzvendra Chahal and Kuldeep Yadav took six wickets between them as Bangladesh were bowled out for 264 in 49.3 overs.

headlines: MS Dhoni stops bowler, sets field for Bangladesh while batting
text: Wicketkeeper-batsman MS Dhoni asked Bangladesh's Sabbir Rahman to stop bowling midway and advised him to move his fielder from mid-wicket to square leg during India's 40th over in the warm-up match on Tuesday. The bowler listened to Dhoni and did as he said. "Dhoni involves himself so much...so he can decorate field for opposition too!! Incredible Dhoni," a user tweeted.

headlines: BJP's product was Mr Modi, they marketed him very well: Tharoor
text: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has claimed BJP "decided early that their product was Mr Modi and they marketed him very well." He added, "They built up the most extraordinary personality cult in modern Indian political history." Discussing BJP's win in the LS polls, Tharoor added, "We may have underestimated the impact of national security on the psyche of the voter."

headlines: New traffic light system detects when people want to cross street
text: Austria-based researchers have developed a new system with camera-equipped traffic lights that automatically detects when people want to cross the streets. The computer vision scans a 26-by-16 feet area for the system, which is flexible and thus can also extend green lights for a larger group of pedestrians. The GÃ¼nther Pincher company is rolling out the system in Vienna.

headlines: Alwar gang-rape survivor appointed as Rajasthan Police constable
text: Rajasthan government on Tuesday issued an order to appoint the Alwar gang-rape survivor as a police constable in the state. The survivor, a Dalit woman, was allegedly raped by five men in front of her husband last month, while a sixth man shot a video. "She will soon get the appointment letter," said Rajeeva Swarup, Additional Chief Secretary (Home).

headlines: 2 suspected spies held near J&K Army camp with maps, photos
text: The Indian Army on Tuesday detained two suspected spies who were found moving suspiciously and taking videos near a military station in Ratnuchak, Jammu and Kashmir. Videos, maps and photographs were recovered from their possession, while their call records showed they had been in touch with people from Pakistan. It's suspected that they were conducting a recce of the location.

headlines: India, Japan sign deal with Sri Lanka to build container terminal
text: Sri Lanka has entered into a partnership with India and Japan to construct a container terminal at the Colombo port. The terminal will come up next to a Chinese-run terminal built as part of the Belt and Road Initiative. Sri Lanka will own 51% of the company that will run the terminal, with India and Japan jointly controlling the rest.

headlines: After Fortune & Time, Meredith sells Sports Illustrated for $110 mn
text: US media company Meredith has agreed to sell Sports Illustrated to entertainment company Authentic Brands for $110 million. Meredith last year sold Time magazine to Salesforce's billionaire Founder Marc Benioff for $190 million and Fortune magazine to Thai businessman Chatchaval Jiaravanon for $150 million. It had acquired these brands when it bought Time Inc for $1.8 billion in January 2018.

headlines: Chris Brown skips hearing in Paris over rape allegations
text: Rapper Chris Brown failed to appear at a hearing in Paris on Tuesday, where he was summoned for a face-to-face meeting with a woman who accused him of rape. The accuser claimed that Brown along with his bodyguard and a friend assaulted her at a hotel in January. After being held for questioning in January, Brown was released without charge.

headlines: Biggest rumour ever: Madhuri denies reports of biopic on her
text: Actress Madhuri Dixit has denied reports that suggested she is in talks for an upcoming biopic based on her life. "It's the biggest rumour I've ever had. I don't know from where it came," the actress said. Madhuri further said there was more she wanted to do with her life than have a biopic based on her.

headlines: Sanjay, Raveena to feature in Kannada film 'K.G.F 2': Report
text: Sanjay Dutt and Raveena Tandon will reportedly feature in the upcoming sequel to the 2018 Kannada film 'K.G.F: Chapter 1', which saw actor Yash in lead role. While Sanjay will play the role of a Dubai-based don, Raveena will be seen as former Indian PM Indira Gandhi, reports further suggested. Shooting for the forthcoming sequel commenced in March this year.

headlines: Osaka breaks down and loses 1st set 0-6 in 1st Rd win
text: Japan's Naomi Osaka broke down in tears in her first round match at the French Open, where she lost the first set 0-6. Osaka eventually took an hour and 54 minutes to beat AK Schmiedlova. Notably, Osaka has won back-to-back Grand Slam titles at the US Open and Australian Open and will next face former world number one Victoria Azarenka.

headlines: Walmart names IIT graduate and Google VP Suresh Kumar as CTO
text: Walmart announced it has appointed Suresh Kumar to new elevated Chief Technology Officer and Chief Development Officer role reporting directly to CEO Doug McMillon, effective July 8. Kumar most recently worked at Google as VP and GM of display and video ads, apps and analytics. The IIT Madras and Princeton University alumnus has also worked at Amazon, Microsoft and IBM.

headlines: Jet staff appeal to Uddhav Thackeray for airline's revival
text: Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray on Tuesday met a delegation of employees belonging to the now grounded Jet Airways. The delegation appealed to Thackeray, whose party is part of the BJP-led government at the Centre and in Maharashtra, to take steps for the private airline's revival. "[Thackeray] has assured us that he'll try his best to help," an employee said.

headlines: What age gap, I'm working with 17-yr-old: Salman on Disha's remark
text: After actress Disha Patani said that she may not get to work with Salman Khan again because of the age difference between them, Salman Khan has reacted to her remark. "What age difference is she saying [about]? I'm doing a film with a 17-year-old now," he added. Disha will be seen opposite Salman in the film 'Bharat'.

headlines: Priyanka knows Salman has wicked sense of humour: Ali on his remarks
text: 'Bharat' director Ali Abbas Zafar, while speaking about Salman Khan's recent comments on Priyanka Chopra's exit from the film, said, "I don't think Salman is dragging Priyanka into anything." "Everyone, even Priyanka, knows that he has a wicked sense of humour," Ali added. "Priyanka is a very close friend of ours, there's nothing against her," he further said.

headlines: My stepdad groped me when I was 15 claiming to examine breast: Ellen
text: American TV show host Ellen DeGeneres has revealed her stepfather groped her multiple times claiming to examine her breast when she was just 15 years old. "He told me that he'd felt a lump in [my mom's] breast and needed to feel my breasts because he didn't want to upset her, but he needed to feel mine," she added.

headlines: Good for BJP if Rahul continues as Cong chief for 50 yrs: Assam Min
text: BJP leader and Assam Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has said that it would help his party if Congress President Rahul Gandhi continues to remain at the helm for the next 50 years. Biswa's statement comes amid reports that Rahul has submitted his resignation from the post. Biswa also said that there can be a vibrant opposition if Rahul Gandhi resigns.

headlines: Marriage has improved my captaincy and me as a human being: Kohli
text: Team India captain Virat Kohli has said that marriage has improved his captaincy and him as a human being and a player. "You become more responsible [after marriage]. It's very different from the responsibility you had in your life. You start understanding things much better and you start putting things into perspective a lot more," he explained.

headlines: Karlovic becomes oldest man to win a French Open match since 1973
text: Croatia's 40-year-old tennis player Ivo Karlovic has become the oldest player to win a match at French open since Torben Ulrich (44) in 1973. Karlovic defeated 37-year-old Feliciano Lopez 7-6(4), 7-5, 6-7(7), 7-5 in three hours and six minutes to reach the second round at Roland Garros for the sixth time. "It means a lot," Karlovic said about his record.

headlines: Depressed man cuts his private parts out of tension in Chennai
text: A 47-year-old man, who was in an inebriated condition, reportedly cut his own genitals in Chennai's Madhavaram on Sunday. The man, who was found unconscious under the Rettai Eri flyover, took the step as he was depressed and under tension, a police officer said. Police added the man was an alcoholic and has been in rehabilitation for last six months.

headlines: Did it, I'm coming home: Climber texted wife before dying at Everest
text: Irish climber Seamus Lawless, who died just hours after successfully climbing Mount Everest, had sent a text message to his pregnant wife saying, "I did it and I'm coming home." The 39-year-old, a professor at Trinity College Dublin, was part of an eight-member Irish team. "My friends are joking...climbing Everest is my mid-life crisis," he had earlier said.
