headlines: Philippine students to plant 10 trees to graduate under proposed law
text: The Philippines has proposed a law under which students will be required to plant at least 10 trees before they are allowed to graduate from primary school, high school and university. Lawmakers said 525 billion trees could be planted in a generation if the law is properly implemented. The trees shall be planted in forest lands and mangroves, among others.

headlines: Fire destroys 115-year-old hotel in US; no casualties reported
text: A fire broke out at the 115-year-old Ambassador Hotel in Dallas, US, on Tuesday, completely destroying the structure. The five-storey building was empty due to a redevelopment project to transform it into apartments and retail space and no casualties have been reported so far. The building will now reportedly be demolished for safety reasons.

headlines: Rats abandoning ship sensing danger: TMC after MLAs join BJP
text: After two Trinamool Congress (TMC) MLAs and over 50 municipal councillors in West Bengal joined the BJP, the TMC on Tuesday said that they are nothing, but "rats who abandon a ship sensing danger". Senior TMC leader Firhad Hakim added that people will give them a "befitting reply". He further said that the party is "not bothered" about such "opportunists".

headlines: Lost polls due to Congress-JD(S) alliance: Veerappa Moily
text: Congress' Veerappa Moily on Tuesday claimed that party's alliance with Janata Dal (Secular) in Karnataka was responsible for its electoral losses in the state. "Alliance is not a strategy for building a party," Moily said. He alleged that JD(S) cadres didn't support Congress in elections and the strategy that JD(S) votes will get transferred to Congress' candidates also didn't work.

headlines: Pant shares pic wearing India jersey, wishes team killer run in WC
text: Wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant took to Twitter to share a picture of himself wearing India jersey and wished the team good luck for the 2019 World Cup. "Donning the blue for the nation is a feeling nothing else can even come close to...Wishing Team India a killer run...Bring it home boys !! Good luck," wrote Pant.

headlines: Ex-French Open champ Ostapenko ousted in 1st Round
text: Former French Open champion Jelena Ostapenko got knocked out of the 2019 edition of the tournament after losing to former world number one Victoria Azarenka on Tuesday. This was Ostapenko's second successive first-round exit at the French Open, where she won the title in 2017. Notably, the two players traded 13 breaks of serve.

headlines: IndiaÂ’s search for no 4 is over: Manjrekar after Rahul's ton
text: Reacting to KL Rahul's ton in India's second warm-up match on Tuesday, Indian commentator Sanjay Manjrekar tweeted, "India's search for no 4 is over. It's K L Rahul!" "Rahul's form....or perhaps, the lack of runs from the openers in both the warm-up matches will seal the deal for him at Number 4," tweeted former Indian cricketer Aakash Chopra.

headlines: Huawei accuses FedEx of diverting packages to the US
text: Huawei said it is reviewing its relationship with FedEx after it claimed the US package delivery company diverted two parcels destined for Huawei addresses in Asia to the US and attempted to reroute two others. Huawei said the four packages only contained documents and "no technology". This comes amid the US blacklisting Huawei and its affiliates over espionage concerns.

headlines: Flexible Textile Lithium Battery for wearable devices made
text: The Hong Kong Polytechnic University researchers created a highly flexible, high-energy Textile Lithium Battery that they claim offers durable and safe energy supply for wearable electronics used in areas like healthcare monitoring. The under 0.5-mm-thick battery with a bending radius of under 1 mm has fast charging and discharging capability. It demonstrates high energy density of over 450 Wh/L.

headlines: In a first, Pune to use chemical concrete to fill potholes
text: In a first-of-its-kind initiative, the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has decided to use cold mix tar and chemical concrete to fill the city's potholes and repair roads during monsoon. PMC building construction department has also issued warnings to owners of decaying buildings to bring down the structures to avoid mishappenings. So far, the PMC has brought down 125 worn-out structures.

headlines: Founders differ over only 'one issue', says IndiGo CEO
text: IndiGo CEO Ronojoy Dutta has said the carrier's founders, Rahul Bhatia and Rakesh Gangwal, are debating "one issue", adding that it will be resolved soon. There are absolutely no differences on strategy, international expansion or management selection, he added. Dutta's statement comes after shares of IndiGo dropped earlier this month following reports of disagreements between the promoters.

headlines: Don't fall in trap: Kher after Gambhir condemns attack on Muslim man
text: A day after cricketer-turned-politician condemned the attack on a Muslim man in Gurugram, Anupam Kher tweeted, "Not that you've asked for my [advice] but still- Don't get into a trap of getting popular with a section of media." "It's your work that will speak. Not necessarily your statements," he added. Kher also congratulated Gambhir for his win in the elections.

headlines: Olonga auditions for singing show in Aus 16 yrs after retirement
text: The first black cricketer to represent Zimbabwe, Henry Olonga, auditioned for 'The Voice Australia', 16 years after ending his international career. The 42-year-old ex-pacer sang 'This is the Moment' and qualified for next round of the show. Olonga was forced to retire in 2003 after wearing a black armband during World Cup to "mourn the death of democracy" in Zimbabwe.

headlines: Salman is not dragging Priyanka into anything: Ali on his remarks
text: 'Bharat' director Ali Abbas Zafar, while speaking about Salman Khan's recent comments on Priyanka Chopra's exit from the film, said, "I don't think Salman is dragging Priyanka into anything." "Everyone, even Priyanka, knows that he has a wicked sense of humour," Ali added. "Priyanka is a very close friend of ours, there's nothing against her," he further said.

headlines: Can't believe some people didn't want Dhoni in World Cup: Warne
text: Ex-Australia spinner Shane Warne has said he can't believe that "some people questioned that ex-India captain MS Dhoni shouldn't have been there for 2019 World Cup". "Dhoni has been a terrific servant for Indian cricket, he has given his everything to Indian cricket," he added. "Dhoni can retire whenever he wants because he has been that good," he further said.

headlines: Classic: Papa CJ as Kohli uses cuss word after Dhoni reaches ton
text: Comedian Papa CJ took to Twitter to share a video of Team India wicketkeeper-batsman MS Dhoni reaching his hundred in the warm-up match against Bangladesh with a six on Tuesday. In the video, Virat Kohli can be seen applauding Dhoni's feat and using a cuss word. "Classic Dhoni and classic Virat," Papa CJ captioned the video.

headlines: Apple not just a luxury: Apple exec on Google CEO Pichai's remark
text: Apple's software chief Craig Federighi, responding to Google CEO Sundar Pichai's remark on privacy, said, "I don't buy into the luxury good dig". "Privacy cannot be a luxury good offered only to people who can afford to buy premium products," Pichai had said. "We love...to sell Apple products to everyone we possibly could, certainly not just a luxury," Federighi said.

headlines: Zomato gifts e-vehicle to differently-abled worker after viral video
text: Zomato Founder Deepinder Goyal on Tuesday tweeted that the company gifted an electric tricycle to a differently-abled delivery man. A video of Ramu Sahu using a hand-pulled tricycle to deliver food had gone viral a few days ago. Goyal also shared a video of Sahu trying out the vehicle with the caption, "Ramu getting a hang of his new ride."

headlines: BSP leader tries to leak MBA paper to help girlfriend in UP, arrested
text: Uttar Pradesh's Feroz Alam alias 'Raja', whose SUV bore the nameplate 'BSP coordinator Patiyali', was arrested with three others for trying to get Aligarh Muslim University's MBA entrance exam paper leaked. On arrest, he confessed that he wanted to get the paper leaked to help his girlfriend who was taking the exam. His girlfriend, however, is currently absconding.

headlines: Karnataka policeman turns lathi into flute, video goes viral
text: A 52-year-old head constable named Chandrakant Hutgi posted at Hubli Rural police station in Karnataka has turned his lathi into a flute. IPS officer Bhaskar Rao, the additional director general of police in Bengaluru, on Tuesday shared a video of Hutgi playing the instrument on his official Twitter handle which has received more than 16,000 views and over 1,900 likes.

headlines: BSP leader and his nephew shot dead in Uttar Pradesh
text: Bahujan Samaj Party leader Haji Ahsan and his nephew Shadab were shot dead in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor district on Tuesday. According to the police, the unknown attackers brought a sweets box to Ahsan's office purportedly to celebrate BSP's win in the Lok Sabha election. However, when Ahsan inquired about them, they revealed a gun from the box and opened fire.

headlines: 1 of 3 accused of harassing Dr Payal leading to her suicide arrested
text: One of the three women doctors accused of abetting Dr Payal Tadvi's suicide at a state-run hospital in Mumbai has been arrested. While Bhakti Mehare was arrested on Tuesday after Payal's husband Salman accused the police of not taking any action, the other two doctors, Ankita Khandelwal and Hema Ahuja, filed for anticipatory bail. Payal was found hanging last week.

headlines: MacKenzie Bezos to donate half her $37 billion wealth after divorce
text: MacKenzie Bezos has committed to giving away at least half of the $37 billion she'll receive in her divorce from Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos. She signed "Giving Pledge", started in 2010 by Bill and Melinda Gates and Warren Buffett. "In addition to whatever assets life has nurtured in me, I have a disproportionate amount of money to share," MacKenzie said.

headlines: Ice-cream parlour in Surat introduces 'Modi Sitafal Kulfi'
text: An ice-cream parlour in Gujarat's Surat has introduced "Modi Sitafal Kulfi" to celebrate the BJP's victory in the Lok Sabha elections. The kulfi, which features PM Narendra Modi's face on it, is completely handmade, the owner of the parlour said. The owner further added that workers took nearly 24 hours to prepare 200 "Modi Sitafal Kulfis".

headlines: This is just first phase: BJP leader as TMC MLAs join party
text: As two TMC MLAs and 50 municipal councillors joined Bharatiya Janata Party on Tuesday, party's General Secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya said, "Like elections were held in seven phases...joinings in BJP will also happen in seven phases." "Today was just the first phase," he added. Earlier today, BJP's Mukul Roy also said West Bengal has made its mind to support the party.

headlines: Those who doubt Tejashwi's leadership can leave RJD: Tej
text: After RJD MLA Maheshwar Prasad Yadav demanded party's leader Tejashwi Yadav's resignation, Tejashwi's elder brother Tej Pratap Yadav on Tuesday said that those who doubt Tejashwi's leadership can leave the party. Tej added he'll always stand by Tejashwi. He said, "Many videos have gone viral on how EVMs are manipulated, even the Japanese company that manufactured EVMs doesn't trust them."

headlines: Thanks for the concern: Mathews on Jayawardene's politics advice
text: Reacting to Mahela Jayawardene's comments about having advised him to not give in to 'cricket politics', Sri Lanka's Angelo Mathews tweeted, "Thanks for the concern guys everyone has their opinion and MJ (Mahela Jayawardene) has his too." "[S]urprised to see some of his comments while denying them my top priority now is the World Cup," read Mathews' tweet.

headlines: NIA to join Sri Lanka Easter Sunday bombings investigation
text: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) will join Sri Lanka in the investigation into the Easter Sunday serial blasts that claimed a total of 257 lives. As per reports, the NIA team will probe the role of the Islamic State's Kerala unit in the bombings. The Islamic State had claimed responsibility for the blasts that rocked Sri Lanka last month.

headlines: North Koreans survive by paying bribes to officials: UN
text: The North Korean public is forced to pay bribes to officials to survive in their country, a UN report said. Many pay bribes of cash or cigarettes in return for not having to turn up at their state-assigned jobs for which they receive no salary. Officials take advantage of vaguely-worded laws to threaten citizens with jail and prosecution, it added.

headlines: IndiGo COO given additional role of airline's President
text: IndiGo has said its Chief Operating Officer (COO) Wolfgang Prock-Schauer has been given additional charge as the low-cost airline's President. He will now be responsible for operational aspects such as flight operations, maintenance and engineering, inflight services and other management functions. Prock-Schauer, who has served as the CEO of Jet Airways, joined IndiGo in January 2018.

headlines: Airtel Africa plans to list on London Stock Exchange
text: Airtel Africa, a subsidiary of Bharti Airtel, on Tuesday said it was planning to float an Initial Public Offering (IPO) on the London Stock Exchange. The company is reportedly aiming to raise around $1 billion in a June equity offering. In October, it raised $1.25 billion in an initial round of pre-IPO funding, plus a further $200 million in January.

headlines: Veteran actress Ranjeeta Kaur booked for assaulting her husband
text: Veteran actress Ranjeeta Kaur, who had starred in the film 'Laila-Majnu', has been accused along with her son for assaulting her husband Raj Masand. Raj had approached Pune police through senior citizen's helpline and lodged a complaint against them. As per reports, there was a dispute in the family after Raj didn't give his son money to start his business.

headlines: Actress-turned-MPs Mimi, Nusrat share pics of 1st day at Parliament
text: Bengali actresses and newly-elected MPs of Trinamool Congress (TMC), Mimi Chakraborty and Nusrat Jahan, on Monday posted photos of their first day at the Parliament. "And it's us again...1st day at Parliament," Mimi Chakraborty tweeted as she shared the pictures of the two. Chakraborty and Jahan won from Jadavpur and Basirhat seats respectively in the recently-held 17th Lok Sabha elections.

headlines: I'll try my best: Mamata on attending PM Modi's swearing-in ceremony
text: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has said that she will try her best to attend the oath-taking ceremony of Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Adding that she had a word with few other Chief Ministers as well, Mamata said, "As a Chief Minister, when there is a Prime Ministerial oath-taking ceremony, I should attend the ceremony."

headlines: Delhi Congress urges Rahul to take back resignation as party President
text: The Delhi Pradesh Congress Committee (DPCC) on Tuesday released a statement appealing to Congress President Rahul Gandhi to take back his resignation from the post. "In the past too, Congress has bounced back from challenging situations to triumph," Sheila Dikshit said. The DPCC also said that its members were standing firmly in support of Rahul Gandhi.

headlines: Bangladesh President to attend PM Modi's oath-taking ceremony
text: Bangladesh President Abdul Hamid will attend Prime Minister Narendra Modi's swearing-in ceremony on May 30, Bangladesh's presidential palace said. India has invited leaders of BIMSTEC (The Bay of Bengal Initiative for Multi-Sectoral Technical and Economic Cooperation) nations, the Prime Minister of Mauritius and President of the Kyrgyz Republic for the oath-taking ceremony.

headlines: Dhoni smashes hundred off 73 balls in warm-up match vs Bangladesh
text: Former India captain MS Dhoni smashed a hundred off just 73 balls in the warm-up match against Bangladesh on Tuesday. The 37-year-old, who reached the three-figure mark with a 90-metre six, scored a total of 113 runs off 78 balls including 7 sixes and 8 fours. India have set a target of 360 runs for Bangladesh.

headlines: KL Rahul smashes ton batting at no. 4 in warm-up match vs B'desh
text: India batsman KL Rahul smashed a hundred off 94 balls batting at number four against Bangladesh in their final 2019 World Cup warm-up match on Tuesday. Rahul came to bat when India were 50/2 in 13.3 overs and went on to score 108(99) including four sixes and 12 fours. He shared a 164-run fifth-wicket partnership with MS Dhoni.

headlines: Former SP MP Kamlesh Balmiki found dead at his UP residence
text: Former Samajwadi Party MP Kamlesh Balmiki was found dead under mysterious circumstances in Khurja in Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr, police said. Prima facie it appeared to be a case of poisoning but details would be known only after the post-mortem report comes in, Khurja circle officer Gopal Singh said. Balmiki, 52, had won from Bulandshahr parliamentary constituency in 2009 general elections.

headlines: I want to enjoy small things in life: B'luru South DCP on resignation
text: DCP (Bengaluru South) K Annamalai, who resigned today, wrote a letter to friends, saying "I want to enjoy the small things in life". He added he wants to be a good father and get into farming. "I had missed too many functions to count, couldn't be there for people who stood with me during my time of need," wrote Annamalai.

headlines: Payal may have been murdered by 3 women doctors: Husband
text: Dr Salman, husband of Dr Payal Tadvi who allegedly killed herself after facing casteist slurs from three senior women doctors, on Tuesday said it was possible that his wife was murdered by the three doctors. He further accused the police of not taking any action and demanded the government to intervene in the case. The three accused doctors are absconding.

headlines: Horse hit with stones in Gujarat Dalit wedding succumbs to injuries
text: The horse who was caught in the stone-pelting at a Dalit wedding procession in Gujarat this month has succumbed to his injuries. A mob of around 150 people, including 16 women, from the Patidar community was booked on 12 May for allegedly stopping the procession. This was the first time a Dalit groom was riding a horse in the village.

headlines: Improve discipline, punctuality to compete with China: Murthy
text: Infosys Co-founder Narayana Murthy on Tuesday said that Indians need to improve their discipline and punctuality levels in order to compete with countries like China and Vietnam. "These are some of the areas that we are weak in, it[has nothing to do with the government but it [has] something to do with the Indian culture," Murthy further said.

headlines: Am I worthy? Gully Boy's Siddhant on pic with Thor actor Hemsworth
text: 'Gully Boy' actor Siddhant Chaturvedi took to Instagram to share a picture with Hollywood actor Chris Hemsworth, who plays superhero Thor in 'Avengers'. In a reference to the hammer wielded by the actor's character in 'Avengers', Siddhant wrote, "Am I worthy? #ChrisSaidYes." Siddhant has lent his voice for the Hindi dubbed version of Chris Hemsworth's film 'Men In Black: International'.

headlines: Salman Khan to star in upcoming biopic on BSF jawan: Reports
text: Salman Khan has been approached to star in an upcoming biopic based on the life of a Border Security Force (BSF) jawan, as per reports. Set in Kashmir, the film will see Salman play a soldier who single-handedly eliminated a Mujahideen militant camp over a decade ago, reports further suggested. Shooting for the film will reportedly begin in June 2020.

headlines: TDP will play constructive Opposition's role: Ex-Andhra CM Naidu
text: Former Andhra Pradesh CM and TDP chief N Chandrababu Naidu has said that the party will play the role of a constructive Opposition and extend co-operation to the new YSRCP government in Andhra. He added that TDP will watch the performance of the new government for some time. Naidu said, "They (YSRCP) promised certain things, let them fulfil those promises."

headlines: Dale Steyn ruled out of SA's opening WC match vs England
text: South African pacer Dale Steyn has been ruled out of the side's opening match of the World Cup against England. Steyn is recovering from a shoulder injury he sustained in the Indian Premier League (IPL) while playing for the Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB). Steyn will reportedly be fit for South Africa's match against India.

headlines: 'Team's backbone' Dhoni has solution to every problem: Kuldeep
text: Indian spinner Kuldeep Yadav called MS Dhoni the Indian team's 'backbone', saying, "He has a solution to every problem. Mahi bhai understands a batsman's body language quickly." "[Virat] Kohli and Dhoni are the backbones of our team. Dhoni gives us freedom and Kohli boosts our confidence," Kuldeep added about the duo.

headlines: Seeing us succeed will give whole region a huge lift: Holder
text: Windies captain Jason Holder said, "It would mean a lot to us if we were to win it [World Cup]... Success on the cricket field puts a smile on West Indian faces. Seeing us succeed and even dominate again gave the whole region a huge lift." "Hopefully we can continue to bring the people of the region closer," Holder added.

headlines: US college students secretly used to train face recognition
text: Researchers used photos of over 1,700 US college students and others, captured between 2012 and 2013, without their permission for a US military and intelligence-sponsored facial recognition study, reports said. A camera was reportedly set up at a public place in the University of Colorado Colorado Springs campus. They combined images to create a dataset named "UnConstrained College Students".

headlines: Shifting narrative from livelihood helped BJP win: Yechury
text: CPI(M) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury on Monday said BJP changed the narrative from jobs and livelihood to Pulwama and Balakot for winning the elections. "Narrative built around communal nationalist jingoism, along with issues of fighting terrorism, brushed aside all other issues of day-to-day concern," he added. Yechury alleged that EC also had a critical role to play in BJP's win.

headlines: CARS24 fires 300 workers, downscales consumer financing: Report
text: Gurugram-based used car-buying startup CARS24 has fired over 300 workers after failing to expand its $50-million funding round to $100-150 million, Entrackr reported. The entire consumer finance team of about 125-150 people was reportedly fired. Calling the numbers "unreal", Co-founder and CEO Vikram Chopra said the firing was over performance assessments, adding, "No lay-offs have taken place."

headlines: Elon Musk's SpaceX raised over $1 billion in last six months
text: Billionaire Elon Musk's SpaceX has raised over $1 billion in financing in the last six months, Reuters reported citing SpaceX's filings. It raised $486.2 million in an equity offering, starting December, and another $535.7 million in an offering that began in April, filings revealed. Recently, SpaceX had launched its first 60 internet-beaming Starlink satellites to low-Earth orbit.

headlines: Chennai Metro turns off AC as city faces severe water crisis
text: The Chennai Metro Rail Limited (CMRL) has begun turning off air-conditioning at stations and in trains to reduce water consumption. This measure was taken as water level in the four lakes in Chennai's periphery slumped to one of the lowest levels in 70 years. The CMRL reportedly consumes 9,000 litres of water daily with nearly 80% going towards operating ACs.

headlines: 40 inmates strangled to death in Brazil prison riots
text: At least 40 prisoners in Brazil were found strangled to death in four jails in the Brazilian state of Amazonas on Monday. The victims belonged to the same drug trafficking group and they had been killed due to internal gang conflict, prison officials said. This comes after at least 15 prisoners were killed in jail clashes in Manaus last week.

headlines: India's economy is a big worry, needs stimulus: FICCI
text: Industrial body FICCI has said India's slowing growth is of serious concern, and tax and interest rates need to be cut urgently to revive the economy. The recent signs of economic slowdown arise from slow growth in investments, subdued exports and weakening growth in consumption demand, it said. If not addressed urgently, the repercussions would be long term, FICCI added.

headlines: 2 TMC MLAs, 50 councillors join BJP as it wins 18 seats in WB
text: Two Trinamool Congress MLAs and over 50 municipal councillors from the party joined the BJP on Tuesday. This comes as the BJP won 18 of the total 42 Lok Sabha seats in West Bengal. PM Narendra Modi had earlier said that 40 TMC MLAs were in touch with him and will leave the party once the BJP wins polls.

headlines: I'll be first to protest if China acts against Apple: Huawei CEO
text: Huawei Founder and CEO Ren Zhengfei, commenting on a potential Chinese retaliation against Apple, said, "That won't happen, first of all. And second of all, if that happens, I'll be the first to protest." "If there was no Apple, there would be no mobile internet," he said, adding, "Apple is my teacher...As a student, why should I oppose my teacher?"

headlines: Modi charismatic leader, will attend PM's swearing-in: Rajinikanth
text: Actor-politician Rajinikanth has said that he will be attending the swearing-in ceremony of Prime Minister Narendra Modi on May 30. "This victory is a victory for Modi...He's a charismatic leader. In India, after Jawaharlal Nehru, Rajiv Gandhi and Atal Bihari Vajpayee, he is now a charismatic leader," he added. He further said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi should not resign.

headlines: Electric 2-wheeler startup Ather Energy gets $51M led by Sachin Bansal
text: Bengaluru-based electric two-wheeler making startup Ather Energy raised $51 million in its latest round of funding, led by Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal. Bansal invested $32 million in the startup, with Hero MotoCorp converting its convertible debt of $19 million and InnoVen Capital extending an $8-million venture debt. Ather Energy was founded in 2013 by Swapnil Jain and Tarun Mehta.

headlines: Ola Electric appoints ex-Vodafone Group CEO Arun Sarin to board
text: Bengaluru-based Ola's newly-formed company Ola Electric has appointed former Vodafone Group CEO Arun Sarin as an independent director on its board. Sarin also currently serves on the boards of Cisco Systems, Accenture, Charles Schwab and Ola's parent company ANI Technologies. The IIT- Kharagpur alumni had received an Honorary Knighthood from Queen Elizabeth II at Buckingham Palace in 2010.

headlines: Is heavy workload ragging, ask 3 accused in Dr Payal's suicide case
text: The three women doctors, accused of harassing Dr Payal Tadvi and abetting her to commit suicide, have written to Maharashtra Association of Resident Doctors denying the allegations. "If heavy workload is given the name of ragging, then we all have been ragged or ragging someone while performing our basic duties," wrote the doctors, who have been suspended and are absconding.

headlines: Untrained climbers should be barred: Indian survivor in Everest rush
text: Ameesha Chauhan, a 29-year-old Indian who survived the over-crowding on Mount Everest that claimed at least 11 lives, has said that climbers without basic skills should be barred from scaling the world's highest peak. "I saw some climbers without basic skills fully relying on their Sherpa guides," she stated. Chauhan is currently hospitalised and recovering from frostbite.

headlines: Snake found in shopping cart at Walmart in US; police shares pic
text: An attendant at a Walmart outlet in US' Texas found a rat snake inside a shopping cart, while collecting carts from the supermarket's return area on Saturday. Police said the attendant had let out a scream, which caught attention of a policeman. The police shared pictures of the snake inside the cart and the man who relocated it.

headlines: Man hides inside car dashboard to enter Europe; police shares pic
text: Spanish police has shared a picture of a man hiding inside the dashboard of a car to enter illegally into Europe. Two other people were also found hiding, one inside the dashboard and other under a rear seat, in two separate cars. In recent years, thousands of migrants seeking a better life in Europe have tried to enter Spain.

headlines: Environment is precious: Kotak shares pic of glass jar, paper cups
text: Kotak Mahindra Bank MD Uday Kotak on Monday shared a picture of a glass water jar and disposable paper cups used at the bank's Mumbai offices. "Working to make it national. Environment is precious," the 60-year-old tweeted. Reacting to Kotak's post, a user said that paper cups are a "disaster for environment," while some recommended using steel and glass tumblers.

headlines: Actor Karan Oberoi approaches Bombay HC for bail in rape case
text: Actor Karan Oberoi, who was arrested for allegedly raping and blackmailing a female astrologer, has approached the Bombay High Court for bail. This comes after a Mumbai sessions court rejected his bail application, submitted a day after he was sent to judicial custody. Karan has stated that his relationship with the woman was consensual and he is being falsely implicated.

headlines: We have to move on: Madhuri on Kalank's box office failure
text: While speaking about her film 'Kalank' and its performance at the box office, actress Madhuri Dixit said, "[I]t doesn't bother me much when a film doesn't work." "Ups and downs are a part and parcel of our work [as actors]...We have to move on," she added. Madhuri further said that despite its performance in India, 'Kalank' was received well overseas.

headlines: 20-25 MLAs unhappy, govt may fall: BJP on Rajasthan Congress
text: Rajasthan BJP leaders said that around 20-25 state Congress MLAs were "unhappy" following the party's performance in general elections and the state government "might fall". The remarks came after CM Ashok Gehlot and Deputy CM Sachin Pilot met party President Rahul Gandhi reportedly after unrest within Congress. Congress itself is "making efforts to topple" its government, a BJP leader said.

headlines: Google to invest Â€600 million in new data centre in Finland
text: Google said it has planned to invest about Â€600 million in a new data centre in Hamina, Finland. Google already has a data centre in Hamina, where it earlier invested Â€800 million. "The demand for Google services is growing daily and we are building our data centre infrastructure to match this demand,Â” GoogleÂ’s Finland Country Director Antti JÃ¤rvinen said.

headlines: Candy Crush maker King's Co-founder quits as CEO after 16 yrs
text: Riccardo Zacconi, Co-founder of video game developer King, known for developing the Candy Crush Saga game, has stepped down as the CEO, its parent firm Activision Blizzard's regulatory filings revealed. Zacconi, an Italian businessman, led King for around 16 years after it was founded in 2003. However, he will stay on as King's Chairman, the filings further revealed.

headlines: Removal of Article 370 will solve all issues of J&K: Anupam
text: Actor Anupam Kher, who is a Kashmiri Pandit, on Monday said that removal of Article 370 will be a solution to all problems in Jammu and Kashmir. Talking about BJP getting majority in Lok Sabha polls, Kher added, "It's not a small majority, it's a huge mandate." Removal of Article 370 and 35A was part of BJP's 2019 manifesto.

headlines: Rahul shouldn't resign, he should prove he can do it: Rajini
text: Actor-turned-politician Rajinikanth on Tuesday said Congress President Rahul Gandhi doesn't lack leadership qualities and he shouldn't resign. "He should prove he can do it. In a democracy, the Opposition should also be strong," he added. Rajinikanth's statement comes amid reports that after facing defeat in the Lok Sabha election, Rahul Gandhi has been wanting to give up his post.

headlines: UrbanClap, RentoMojo may list services on govt e-marketplace
text: Home services startup UrbanClap and furniture and appliance rental startup RentoMojo held talks to potentially list goods and services on GeM, the government's e-marketplace. GeM facilitates online procurement of common use goods and services needed by various government departments, organisations or PSUs. Earlier in January, the government decided to let startups list goods and services on GeM.

headlines: Malaysia's last surviving male Sumatran rhino dies
text: Malaysia's last surviving male Sumatran rhino has died, an official stated. About 30 years old, the rhino named Tam lived at a wildlife reserve in Sabah state since his capture in 2008, Christina Liew, state minister for tourism, culture and environment, said. Iman, a female rhino captured in 2014, is the only surviving member of the subspecies left in Malaysia.

headlines: Woman falls off scooter after hitting pothole in Bengaluru
text: A woman had a narrow escape after her scooter fell off hitting a pothole on the road in Bengaluru. In a video, the woman can be seen riding the scooter wearing a helmet and making a sudden swerve after hitting the pothole. After falling, the woman's helmet came off her head and struck an auto plying a few metres away.

headlines: US Army asks 'How has serving impacted you?', responses go viral
text: The responses to the US Army's question asking how serving in the military impacted people's lives have gone viral. The responses highlighted the issues of post-traumatic stress disorder, suicide and sexual assault, among others. "We're mindful of the fact that we've to take care of those who came back home with scars we can't see," the US Army tweeted later.

headlines: Alibaba plans to raise $20 bn through HK listing: Reports
text: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba is considering raising as much as $20 billion through a second listing in Hong Kong, following its 2014 record $25-billion float in New York. The company is working with financial advisers on the offering, reports said. It aims to file an application confidentially in Hong Kong as early as the second half of 2019, reports added.

headlines: Irani walks 14 km to Siddhivinayak Temple barefoot post election win
text: Producer Ekta Kapoor has shared a story on Instagram with Smriti Irani during their journey to Mumbai's Siddhivinayak Temple and revealed that Irani walked 14 kilometres without shoes to the temple. "I can't believe 14 kilometres without shoes," says Ekta after which Irani replies, "That's how God willed it." This comes after Irani's victory in Amethi in Lok Sabha elections.

headlines: Oscar's head attends Maharashtra Film Awards, praises India's cinema
text: John Bailey, President of the Academy of Motion Pictures Arts and Sciences on Sunday attended the 56th Maharashtra State Film Awards in Mumbai as chief guest. "Congratulations on your wonderful cinema culture," Bailey said at the event. This is the first time a president of the body that awards Oscars has attended an Indian awards ceremony, the event's organisers said.

headlines: #JCBkikhudai memes go viral, company says 'we are truly humbled'
text: Memes on JCB machines digging roads along with #JCBkikhudai have gone viral across the country. The memes are being made over millions of views on random videos of JCB excavators on YouTube. Following this the company tweeted, "We are truly humbled by the love shown for JCB in India...Thank you to our customers and fans for your enthusiasm and support!"

headlines: Vijay Shankar fit as India face Bangladesh in final warm-up match
text: All-rounder Vijay Shankar has recovered from his injury and has been included in the Indian team that is facing Bangladesh in their final 2019 World Cup warm-up match today. Kedar Jadhav, who had sustained an injury in an IPL match, won't be featuring in the match. Bangladesh have won the toss and have opted to bowl first.

headlines: No time to lick wounds, Rahul best person to lead Congress: Tharoor
text: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has said Rahul Gandhi "undoubtedly" remains the best person to help rally Congress party out of the predicament it finds itself in. Adding that Congress party members have no time to sit and lick their wounds and must instead pick up again immediately and effectively, Tharoor said, "It's far too premature to write Congress' obituary."

headlines: Paytm to lead $15M funding in foodtech startup HungerBox: Report
text: Noida-based Paytm is reportedly set to lead a $15-million investment in Bengaluru-based foodtech platform HungerBox alongside its existing investors. HungerBox raised $4.5 million in a Series A funding round led by South Korea-based Neoplux and Sabre Partners in 2018. Founded in 2015, HungerBox is a B2B technology startup delivering food solutions for corporates through a customised mobile app.

headlines: Spark in AC between 1st & 2nd floor led to Surat centre fire: Probe
text: The fire in the Surat coaching centre was triggered by a spark in the compressor of the air conditioner fixed between the first and second floors, a preliminary probe report has revealed. The report also stated that the structure where the coaching classes were being operated was prone to fire incidents. As many as 22 people died in the fire.

headlines: 8 die after drinking spurious liquor in UP's Barabanki district
text: Eight people have died and several others have fallen sick after consuming spurious liquor in the Ramnagar area of Barabanki district, Uttar Pradesh. The state's Excise Minister Jai Pratap Singh said, "One district administration official, 5 police personnel and 3 head constables have been suspended with immediate effect." Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has ordered an inquiry into the incident.

headlines: Pakistan-origin Sajid Javid launches bid to become UK's PM
text: Pakistani-origin UK Home Secretary Sajid Javid has launched his bid to run for the post of the leader of the Conservative Party and the next Prime Minister. "We need to restore trust, bring unity and create new opportunities across the UK. First and foremost, we must deliver Brexit," Javid said. Incumbent PM Theresa May will step down next month.

headlines: Chemical locha in Congress leaders' minds: Ex-member Alpesh Thakor
text: Gujarat MLA and OBC leader Alpesh Thakor has said that the Congress leaders who reiterate that scams have taken place during the NDA government are suffering from a "chemical locha" (chemical imbalance) in their minds. "Congress failed to understand what people actually want. They only repeatedly shouted 'ghotala hua, ghotala hua'," Thakor said. He quit the Congress party last month.

headlines: K'taka CM must resign over LS polls performance: BJP leader
text: BJP leader and former Karnataka CM Jagadish Shettar on Monday said that incumbent CM HD Kumaraswamy must resign over the ruling JD(S)-Congress coalition's performance in the Lok Sabha elections. He said that Kumaraswamy has no moral right to continue as CM after his party JD(S) won only one seat. BJP won 25 out of 28 seats in the state.

headlines: Afghanistan is in the WC not just because of me: Rashid Khan
text: On being asked whether he is the key player who helped Afghanistan qualify for the 2019 World Cup, spinner Rashid Khan said, "No, not really. We have got a good team. We fought back really well in the qualifying round." "For us, every match is very important... The whole of Afghanistan will be praying for our success," Rashid added.

headlines: Kannada daily editor booked for report on K'taka CM's son
text: An FIR has been lodged against Vishweshwar Bhat, editor of Kannada daily 'Vishwavani', for publishing a report on Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy's son Nikhil Kumaraswamy. The complaint was filed by JD(S) state secretary SP Pradeep Kumar. It said that the "false report" on an alleged altercation between Nikhil and his grandfather Deve Gowda, was meant to tarnish Nikhil's political career.

headlines: AP CM-designate Jagan invites ex-CM Naidu for swearing-in
text: Andhra Pradesh CM-designate and YSR Congress Party President YS Jagan Mohan Reddy has invited former Andhra CM N Chandrababu Naidu for his swearing-in ceremony. Jagan will take oath as Andhra CM on May 30. Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao will be attending the event and Jagan has also invited PM Narendra Modi and BJP President Amit Shah for the ceremony.

headlines: Asaduddin Owaisi has a habit of sowing hatred: Giriraj Singh
text: BJP MP from Begusarai, Giriraj Singh on Tuesday said that AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has a habit of sowing hatred. "Begusarai is filled with peace," he added. Giriraj said this after Owaisi said, "we're not human in their eyes", responding to reports of a Muslim man from Begusarai being shot at and asked to go to Pakistan over his name.

headlines: Yuvraj Singh-backed Healthians acquihires Mumbai's Healthy Labs
text: Yuvraj Singh-backed online diagnostics service provider Healthians has acquihired Mumbai-based health logistics startup Healthy Labs. "As part of [the acquihire], we have given undisclosed equity to [Healthy Labs'] founder," Healthians CEO Deepak Sahni said. Incubated in 2014, Gurugram-based Healthians is currently in the process of raising fresh funds of about $15 million, Sahni revealed.

headlines: Anaconda gets pregnant, gives birth without male contact in US
text: A female 10-foot-long Anaconda named Anna at New England Aquarium in Boston, US has given birth without any male contact. DNA testing has confirmed that the two juvenile anacondas of multiple birthed that have survived are the product of nonsexual reproduction, the aquarium said. Called parthenogenesis, the process allows a female organism to replicate itself without fertilization from a male.

headlines: PM Modi pays tribute to Veer Savarkar on his birth anniversary
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi paid tribute to Vinayak Damodar Savarkar on his 136th birth anniversary on Tuesday, and tweeted, "We bow to Veer Savarkar on his Jayanti." PM Modi added, "Veer Savarkar epitomises courage, patriotism and unflinching commitment to a strong India. He inspired many people to devote themselves towards nation building."

headlines: boAt signs Bumrah, Dhawan, Shaw & Pant as boAtheads
text: Lifestyle brand boAt signs Shikhar Dhawan, Jasprit Bumrah, Rishabh Pant and Prithvi Shaw on board as their brand ambassadors and kickstarted their Sound of the Champions campaign along with existing boAtheads Hardik Pandya and KL Rahul. The ambassadors were seen promoting boAt Sports, a sports audio category with athleisure products like neckband style earphones for fitness enthusiasts.

headlines: Rahul Gandhi's offer to resign 'suicidal': Lalu calls it BJP 'trap'
text: RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav has called Rahul Gandhi's decision to step down as Congress President "suicidal", saying his resignation will "amount to falling into the BJP's trap". Soon after someone else beyond the Gandhi-Nehru family takes over as Congress chief, the BJP "will paint the new leader as a puppet remote-controlled by Rahul and Sonia Gandhi", he added.

headlines: Duke CE launches Product Management certification course in India
text: Duke CE has partnered with upGrad to launch the globally recognised product management certification course in India. This course will be lectured by Duke CE faculty and experts from Amazon, Hotstar, Goibibo, BookMyShow with 15+ case studies and live simulations. Along with 1-1 mentoring, career support, learners get 24X7 access to discussion forums to learn from peers and teaching assistants.

headlines: South Korean film 'Parasite' wins top award at Cannes Film Fest
text: Director Bong Joon-Ho became the first South Korean to win the Palme d'Or, the top prize at the Cannes Film Festival for his film 'Parasite'. Filmmaker Mati Diop, the first black woman director to be considered for the Palme d'Or, won the Grand Prix, the runner-up prize for her film 'Atlantics'. Belgium's Dardenne brothers won Best Director for 'Young Ahmed'.

headlines: 57-year-old Pune man booked for obscene post on Urmila
text: A 57-year-old man from Pune has been booked for allegedly posting obscene content on actor-turned-politician Urmila Matondkar on social media, police said. The case was filed after a female worker of Maharashtra Navnirman Sena complained about the post. This comes after the actor-turned-Congress leader contested her first elections from Mumbai North seat but lost to BJP's Gopal Shetty.

headlines: Riteish shares videos of locked exit at Hyd airport; airport replies
text: Riteish Deshmukh shared videos taken at Hyderabad airport lounge after the elevator shut down due to a power cut, and pointed out that the only exit was locked. "Incase of FIRE it's...tragedy waiting to happen," he tweeted. Hyderabad airport authorities responded that glass doors can be broken during emergency and the key is in a box next to the door.

headlines: Might not get to work with Salman again over age difference: Disha
text: Disha Patani, who will be seen opposite Salman Khan in 'Bharat' has said she might not get to work with Salman Khan again because of the age difference between them. "Even [director] Ali sir told me this while narrating the script," she added. "In 'Bharat', it's acceptable because that portion shows Salman sir in his 20s and 30s," said Disha.

headlines: Odisha CM Patnaik invites PM Modi for swearing-in ceremony
text: Odisha CM and BJD president Naveen Patnaik has reportedly invited Prime Minister Narendra Modi to his swearing-in ceremony on Wednesday. Earlier, during campaigning, PM Modi had announced that he would visit Odisha again to attend the BJP government's swearing-in ceremony. Responding to him, Patnaik had said, "I humbly invite him to attend the oath-taking ceremony of the new BJD government."

headlines: 9-month-old girl raped by minor boy in Rajasthan village
text: A nine-month-old girl was allegedly raped by a minor boy in Rajasthan's Jatnagla village on Monday. The accused took the girl to his home and later dropped her back to her house. Stating that no FIR has been filed yet, the police said, "There was bleeding from the girl's private parts...Hospital board has conducted a medical examination of the child."

headlines: Allegedly denied ambulance, terminally ill 9-yr-old dies in UP
text: A terminally ill 9-year-old boy died after UP's Shahjahanpur district hospital allegedly refused to provide him with an ambulance. His parents said, "We told the driver and other staff that we hardly have any money, after which they refused to carry our child." Meanwhile, the hospital denied the allegations and said they had referred the child to Lucknow for treatment.

headlines: 4 arrested for leaking AMU's MBA entrance exam paper
text: Four people have been arrested in connection with a leak of AMU's MBA entrance examination paper. An absent student's exam paper was allegedly picked up by a water boy and given to a question paper solver who forwarded the answers to his girlfriend on WhatsApp. The leak was reported as the water boy was unable to return the exam paper.

headlines: Sikkim CM announces 5-day work week for govt staff hours after oath
text: Hours after taking oath, Sikkim CM PS Tamang on Monday announced a five-day working week for the state government employees. "We have fulfilled one of our election promises to reduce the working week for government employees from six days earlier to five days," Tamang said. This comes after Tamang-led SKM defeated PK Chamling-led SDF after five terms in assembly elections.

headlines: Gas cylinder explodes at MLA's house in Bihar; MLA, wife injured
text: A gas cylinder exploded at a Janata Dal (United) MLA's house in Bihar on Monday, injuring the lawmaker and his wife. Tarapur MLA Mewa Lal Choudhary and his wife and former MLA Neeta Choudhary were taken to a hospital in Bhagalpur following the explosion. The two have been referred to Patna by the hospital.

headlines: Schoolgirl killed as man stabs 18 people at Japan bus stop
text: A schoolgirl was killed and 17 others were injured in a stabbing carried out by a man in his 50s at a bus stop in Japan on Tuesday. The alleged attacker had stabbed himself in the neck and was later confirmed dead. Police officials said the attacker was seen holding knives in each hand during the attack.

headlines: Confirmed my relationship with Malaika as media was respectful: Arjun
text: While speaking about publicly confirming his relationship with Malaika Arora, actor Arjun Kapoor said, "We've come out because we feel the media has given us dignity." "[T]hey've been respectful, kind, honest and decent about it," the actor added. The couple confirmed their relationship at a recent screening of Arjun's film 'India's Most Wanted', where they were photographed holding hands.

headlines: Shankar, Ehsaan, Loy opt out of 'Saaho' over row with music company
text: Music composer trio Shankar, Ehsaan, Loy opted out of the upcoming film 'Saaho', which will see 'Bahubali' actor Prabhas and Shraddha Kapoor in lead roles. "The music company wanted to add a few songs from external composers. We are not very comfortable with that," composer Shankar Mahadevan explained. "[W]e feel one composer retains the identity of the film," he added.

headlines: I feel more attractive at 47 than I did at 16: Lisa Ray
text: Speaking about dealing with insecurities, model-actress Lisa Ray said, "I think I am most attractive at 47 rather than when I was 16-years-old." "I had a great body [at 16] but I had such a distorted view of my body that I felt...ugly," she added. Lisa further said that she often felt guilty endorsing unrealistic beauty standards during her career.

headlines: Ronit to make Tamil acting debut with Nidhhi Agerwal: Report
text: Bollywood actors Ronit Roy and Nidhhi Agerwal will make their acting debut in the Tamil film industry in an upcoming film starring Tamil actor Jayam Ravi, as per reports. Directed by filmmaker Lakshman, the untitled film will see Ronit play the role of a villain, reports further suggested. Ronit earlier featured in the Telugu film 'Jai Lava Kusa'.

headlines: Digital entertainment is changing the face of cinema: Tisca
text: Actress Tisca Chopra has said that she feels the internet and digital entertainment have changed the face of Indian cinema. "The way the web space is booming, films have to be reinvented by the makers," Tisca added. "In the web space, makers are not looking for a hero-heroine story. They're looking for stories that are engaging," she further said.

headlines: Punjab Cong chief's resignation totally unnecessary: CM
text: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh on Monday said that Sunil Jakhar's resignation from the post of Punjab Congress chief was "totally unnecessary". "Under Jakhar's leadership, Punjab Congress had defied all electoral trends at the national level and that of the majority of states," he added. Terming Jakhar's resignation an "emotional reaction", he asked party high command to not accept it.

headlines: I have no plans to join BJP: Gujarat MLA Alpesh Thakor
text: Gujarat MLA Alpesh Thakor, who resigned from Congress last month, dismissed rumours of him joining BJP. "I meet several BJP leaders as I am an MLA and I have to work for my constituency but I have no plans to join BJP," Thakor said. This comes after Thakor met BJP leader and Gujarat Deputy CM Nitin Patel on Monday.

headlines: 10 killed, 6 injured after 2 cars collide in Rajasthan
text: At least 10 people were killed and six others were injured after two cars collided in Rajasthan's Aagolai on Tuesday morning. Police officials reached the spot and admitted the injured to the hospital with the help of locals. Talking about the incident, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said, "My heartfelt condolences to the families who have lost dear ones."

headlines: Hardik detained after threatening strike over Surat fire
text: Congress leader Hardik Patel was detained by police on Monday after he threatened to hold a hunger strike at the site of Surat coaching centre fire. Police said Patel was denied permission to hold the strike because of security reasons. Patel had threatened to sit on hunger strike if Gujarat government didn't take action against Surat mayor and other officials.

headlines: LG Linear CoolingÂ™ Refrigerators promise to keep your food fresh
text: LG Frost Free Refrigerator with Linear CoolingÂ™ promises to keep your food fresh, as if its straight from the farm. The double-door refrigerator comes with Inverter Linear Compressor and Door cooling+Â™ along with other technologies, specially designed to keep your food fresh for up to 14 days *.

headlines: Actor hits salon worker for allegedly touching friend inappropriately
text: TV actor Abhimanyu Chaudhary, along with his friend, was arrested for thrashing a salon employee in Mumbai and attacking him with a knife. The duo went to the salon after a female friend of the actor accused an employee of the salon of touching her inappropriately while massaging her head. A complaint has also been lodged against the salon employee.

headlines: England thrash Afghanistan by 9 wickets, with 195 balls remaining
text: England defeated Afghanistan by 9 wickets and with 195 balls remaining in a World Cup warm-up match in London on Monday. Afghanistan were dismissed for 160 in 38.4 overs, with Joe Root and Jofra Archer taking three wickets each. England opener Jason Roy smashed an unbeaten 89 off 46 balls including 11 fours and four sixes to help England win.

headlines: Fasting during Ramadan a great mental and spiritual exercise: Amla
text: South Africa batsman Hashim Amla has termed fasting during Ramadan as great mental and spiritual exercise, expressing his pleasure that the World Cup is starting during the month of Ramadan. "Fasting is something I always look forward to. It's the best month of the year. It really helps with my conditioning," he added.

headlines: Conflict of interest charges against Sachin Tendulkar dismissed
text: BCCI Ethics Officer DK Jain has dismissed the conflict of interest allegations against Sachin Tendulkar after the latter refused to be part of the Cricket Advisory Committee (CAC) unless furnished with the terms of reference. Jain termed the allegations as "infructuous". An MPCA member had filed a complaint, citing Sachin's dual role as member of CAC and mentor of MI.

headlines: Djokovic beats Hurkacz in 96 minutes, reaches French Open 2nd round
text: World number one Novak Djokovic, who is trying to win his fourth consecutive Grand Slam title, defeated Hubert Hurkacz 6-4, 6-2, 6-2 on Monday to reach the second round of French Open. Djokovic won the match after one hour and 36 minutes. It was the Serbian's 22nd straight victory at a major.

headlines: I questioned whether or not I wanted to be alive: Michael Phelps
text: Talking about his battle with depression, 23-time Olympic gold medallist Michael Phelps said he questioned whether or not he wanted to be alive anymore after struggling with anxiety and depression. "It was when I hit this low...I decided to reach out and ask for the help of a licensed therapist. This decision ultimately helped save my life," he added.

headlines: In a first, Ice Age seawater pockets found in Indian Ocean
text: A study led by a University of Chicago scientist has found pockets of seawater dating back to the Ice Age some 20,000 years ago, tucked inside rock formations in the Indian Ocean. This is reportedly the first-ever discovery of direct remnants of that ocean. The discovery was made on a months-long scientific mission exploring limestone deposits that form the Maldives.

headlines: 11 security personnel injured in IED blast in Jharkhand
text: As many as 11 security personnel were injured in an improvised explosive device (IED) blast by suspected Maoists in Kuchai area of Jharkhand on Tuesday morning. The injured include eight men of the CRPF's CoBRA unit and three policemen, who were out on a special operation. After the blast, the suspects reportedly fired at the personnel and then escaped.

headlines: Doctor takes her life, Maharashtra women commission writes to Dean
text: After a second-year resident doctor in Mumbai's BYL Nair Hospital took her life, Maharashtra State Commission for Women has written to the Dean asking for a report on the action taken after her suicide. Payal Tadvi, who hailed from a Muslim tribal family and was studying gynaecology, allegedly killed herself after facing harassment and casteist slurs from three senior doctors.

headlines: Woman clears Class 10 exam with son 18 yrs after leaving school
text: Odisha's 36-year-old Anganwadi worker Basanti Muduli cleared her Class 10 examination conducted by Odisha State Open School last week, 18 years after she dropped out of school after her marriage. "I realised that without clearing the matric, I possibly could not get any promotion," she said. She passed the exam with her son, whose books she used for studying.

headlines: Potential fraud at Jet led to lookout notice against Goyal: Official
text: A potential fraud detected by investigative agencies at Jet Airways led to the issuance of a lookout circular against Founder Naresh Goyal and his wife Anita Goyal, an official said. They were stopped from flying out of India by immigration authorities on the basis of the notice. The circular was issued by the Ministry of Home Affairs.

headlines: J'khand Cong chief offers to quit after party won 1 seat in state
text: Jharkhand Congress President Ajoy Kumar resigned from his post after his party managed to win only one Lok Sabha seat in the state. Kumar took responsibility for the party's performance in the state, however, his resignation is yet to be accepted by the party. Congress state chiefs of Maharashtra, Odisha, Uttar Pradesh and Assam had earlier tendered their resignation.

headlines: Mamata sets 5-member panel to probe Vidyasagar statue vandalism
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has formed a five-member committee led by state Home Secretary Alapan Bandyopadhyay to probe the incident of vandalism of Bengali reformer Ishwar Chandra Vidyasagar's statue. The statue was damaged during a roadshow of BJP President Amit Shah in Kolkata. Mamata-led TMC government had earlier appointed a Special Investigation Team (SIT) to investigate the incident.

headlines: TikTok owner ByteDance plans to launch own smartphone: Report
text: TikTok owner ByteDance is planning to launch its own smartphone, a Financial Times report stated. The smartphone would reportedly be preloaded with the startup's apps including newsfeeds, short video platforms and games. The project comes after ByteDance acquired certain patents and some employees from China-based phone maker Smartisan earlier in January, the report added.

headlines: Dalai Lama congratulates Sikkim CM on Assembly elections win
text: Tibetan spiritual leader the Dalai Lama congratulated Sikkim CM Prem Singh Tamang on his party's win in the recent state Assembly elections. He said, "A great responsibility...lies ahead of you and I trust that under your leadership the people of Sikkim will see prosperity and progress." Tamang ended over a 24-year reign of former CM Pawan Chamling in the state.

headlines: PIL filed in Delhi HC against Paytm Postpaid Wallet ops
text: The Delhi High Court issued a notice to the RBI and Paytm Payments Bank seeking their stand on a petition filed against the payments bank. The petition alleged Paytm Payments BankÂ’s Postpaid Wallet operation is illegal and contrary to banking regulations. It reportedly alleged Paytm's Postpaid service is sharing customers' personal information with an unauthorised third party.

headlines: Payal's death 'murder of constitutional protection': Akhilesh
text: Samajwadi Party President Akhilesh Yadav on Monday said that the death of post-graduate medical student Payal Tadvi is "murder of constitutional protection". "The suicide of Dr Payal Tadvi belonging to Scheduled Tribe is a result of comments against her caste and reservation system," he added. Tadvi allegedly killed herself after facing harassment and casteist slurs from three senior doctors.

headlines: US is not ready to make a trade deal with China, says Trump
text: US President Donald Trump has said the country is not ready to make a trade deal with China. "I think they probably wish they made the deal that they had on the table before they tried to renegotiate it," he added. American tariffs on Chinese goods could go up "very, very substantially, very easily", Trump further said.

headlines: Japan will buy 105 F-35 US stealth warplanes, says Trump
text: US President Donald Trump on Monday said Japan plans to buy 105 US-made F-35 stealth warplanes. Trump, who is in Tokyo for a state visit, said, "This purchase would give Japan the largest F-35 fleet of any US ally." The deal, which may reportedly cost Japan over $9 billion, has been discussed by the Shinzo Abe government since December 2018.

headlines: 1st person who knew I was getting married was Sabyasachi: Deepika
text: Deepika Padukone, during an appearance at an event, revealed that the first person to even know she was getting married was fashion designer Sabyasachi. "I orchestrated the whole wedding. Ranveer was quite busy and there was just so much to be done," she added. "Once we had most of the organisation under control, we made a public announcement," said Deepika.

headlines: Picture of bald eagle with symmetrical reflection in water goes viral
text: A picture of a bald eagle taken by amateur Canadian photographer Steve Biro has gone viral for capturing the bird and its reflection in water in perfect symmetry. Biro took the picture during his visit to the Canadian Raptor Conservancy. He said that he took a "few hundred" shots of the bird as it was gazing at him.

headlines: Friend, mentor and fantastic human being: Kohli wishes Shastri
text: Wishing Team India coach Ravi Shastri on the occasion of his 57th birthday, Team India captain Virat Kohli tweeted, "A friend, mentor and above all a fantastic human being. Happy birthday Ravi Bhai." "Thank you, Captain. Means a lot," Shastri responded. "Happy Birthday @RaviShastriOfc! Wishing you all the best for the World Cup," wrote Sachin Tendulkar.

headlines: May 23 should be celebrated as 'Modi Diwas': Baba Ramdev
text: Yoga Guru Baba Ramdev on Monday said that May 23 should be celebrated as 'Modi Diwas or Lok Kalyan Diwas'. "This was a historic day when people of the country elected Narendra Modi as Prime Minister with a brute majority," he said. "This is an unprecedented event in Indian politics," he further said.

headlines: Hardik Pandya Googles himself the most: Rohit Sharma
text: During a question-and-answer session with ICC, Rohit Sharma revealed that out of the Indian team members, Hardik Pandya Googles himself the most. He further jokingly added that Shikhar Dhawan is the worst room-mate as he keeps everything untidy. Further, he said that Virat Kohli is always at the gym, while Hardik loves selfies the most and is the worst dancer.

headlines: Shooter Saurabh breaks own world record to win 2nd World Cup gold
text: India's 17-year-old shooter Saurabh Chaudhary broke his own junior and senior world record to win his second World Cup gold medal. Saurabh won 10m Air Pistol event with 246.3 points, breaking his own senior record of 245 points and junior record of 245.5 points. Saurabh had booked a quota for 2020 Olympics during his maiden World Cup in February.

headlines: Shooter Rahi Sarnobat wins gold in WC, seals Olympic quota
text: Indian shooter Rahi Sarnobat on Monday won the gold in 25m Pistol event at the ISSF World Cup in Munich. With this, the 28-year-old also sealed a quota place for India in the event for the 2020 Tokyo Olympics. Rahi scored a total of 37, beating Ukraine's Olena Kostevych, who was champion at the 2004 Athens Olympics.

headlines: Referee accidentally scores goal in a football match, awards it
text: A referee accidentally scored a goal in a football match in Netherlands and awarded it to the team. The referee diverted the ball over the line after accidentally flexing his leg toward it after the ball hit the front post following a shot by HSV Hoek midfielder against Harkemase Boys. The referee awarded the goal to Hoek despite protests.

headlines: Manmohan won't be nominated to Rajya Sabha from Assam after 28 years
text: Former PM Manmohan Singh, who has represented Assam in the Rajya Sabha for the last 28 years, will not be nominated to the Parliament's Upper House this time. Congress leader Apurba Kumar said that the party will not nominate anyone because it does not have the numbers in the Assam Assembly. Manmohan's current term will end on June 14.

headlines: Clouds prevent radar from detecting accurately: Air Marshal Nambiar
text: Air Marshal Raghunath Nambiar has backed Army chief General Bipin Rawat's statement that radar can't see through clouds. "Very strong clouds and very strong convective conditions in clouds prevent radar from detecting accurately," he added. Earlier, PM Modi said he gave a go-ahead to Balakot air strikes despite bad weather as he assumed clouds could help jets escape Pakistan's radar.

headlines: Ready to be Congress leader in Lok Sabha: Shashi Tharoor
text: Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has said that he is ready to take the responsibility of the Leader of the Congress party in the Lok Sabha if party offers him the job. He, however, insisted that Rahul Gandhi should continue as the Congress President. "The party could consider appointing a series of regional working presidents to assist him," he added.

headlines: After Surat fire tragedy, Delhi orders to inspect coaching buildings
text: After the Surat fire tragedy claimed 22 lives, Delhi government has directed the Director of fire services to inspect all buildings housing coaching centres in the capital and take strict action as per fire safety standards and guidelines. As a precautionary step, buildings that have more than four floors will be closed down immediately if found violating the safety norms.

headlines: Sheila sets up committee to study Delhi Congress' LS defeat
text: Delhi Congress President Sheila Dikshit has formed a five-member committee to introspect the party's loss in all the seven Lok Sabha seats in the national capital. The committee will also suggest steps to strengthen the party to ensure its victory in 2020 Assembly elections, a party spokesperson said. Dikshit has asked the committee to submit its report within 10 days.

headlines: LS poll result has changed political discourse: Sahasrabuddhe
text: BJP Vice President Vinay Sahasrabuddhe has said that after the Lok Sabha poll result, the political discourse of the country which was confined to "socialism, welfarism and patronage" has changed to "development" and nationalism. He added the BJP is no more "untouchable" and is the "preference of every section of society". Sahasrabuddhe said the election's result is a "watershed mandate".

headlines: Hailing mother India and spitting in public isn't acceptable: PM
text: Addressing BJP workers in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi, PM Narendra Modi on Monday said that saying "Bharat Mata Ki Jai" and in the same breath, spitting in public after having "Banarasi paan" isn't acceptable. He asked, "What kind of 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' is this?" Further asserting that government properties belong to everyone, PM Modi appealed to people to preserve them.

headlines: Chemistry defeated arithmetic in 2019 LS elections: PM Modi
text: Addressing BJP workers in his Lok Sabha constituency Varanasi, PM Narendra Modi on Monday said that chemistry managed to defeat arithmetic in 2019 Lok Sabha polls. "Elections are all about arithmetic but there is chemistry that goes beyond arithmetic," he added. Thanking BJP workers for their support, PM Modi further said, "I'm a party worker first and then PM."

headlines: India's new football coach releases 6 players from team camp
text: The Indian football team's new coach Igor Stimac on Monday released six players from the list of 37 who had assembled for the preparatory camp in New Delhi, which began on May 21. "Each one of them has been given an individual working programme which is to be executed in the future by themselves," Stimac said about the six players.

headlines: Sarri wasn't a player, he is learning a lot this year: Alonso
text: Speaking about Chelsea coach Maurizio Sarri, Chelsea's Spanish footballer Marcos Alonso said, "The gaffer is still learning, he was not a football player either so he is learning a lot this year." "It's never easy in the first year, to come to a new country and new league, new football, new culture," Alonso said.

headlines: Would be great to have an experienced coach: Chinappa
text: Speaking about India's coaching setup, Indian squash player Joshna Chinappa said, "[I]t would be great to have an experienced coach based here or even a part-time coach to work with the juniors and seniors." "I hope we can get a coach to travel with us on the pro tour as it makes a huge difference," Chinappa added.

headlines: Nadal begins French Open campaign with straight-set win
text: Defending champion Rafael Nadal began his French Open campaign with a straight-set opening round win against Germany's Yannick Hanfmann on Monday. Nadal, who is chasing a record-extending 12th French Open title, saved four break points in the first game. The 32-year-old Spaniard will next face German qualifier Yannick Maden in the second round.

headlines: Gay dating app Grindr's owner gave staff access to user data
text: Last year, LGBTQ dating app Grindr's owner Beijing Kunlun Tech gave some China-based engineers access to millions of Americans' personal data, Reuters reported. This had reportedly caused US officials to ask Kunlun to sell Grindr. Reportedly, the Committee on Foreign Investment in the US was worried the database may have military and intelligence personnel data which Chinese government may get.

headlines: Priyanka has real men to hang out with: Sona on Salman's remarks
text: Singer Sona Mohapatra took a dig at Salman Khan after the actor commented that while many people would leave their husbands for the film 'Bharat', Priyanka left the film to get married. "Cus @priyankachopra has better things to do in life, real men to hang out with & more importantly, girls to inspire with her journey," she wrote.

headlines: AAP will break 2015 Delhi Assembly poll record in 2020: Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said that AAP will break all records in the 2020 Assembly polls in Delhi. In the 2015 Assembly elections, the party had won 67 out of 70 seats and set a new record. However, in the recently-concluded Lok Sabha elections, AAP stood third behind BJP and Congress and three AAP candidates lost their deposit.

headlines: Rumours of Jayasuriya's death in Canada go viral, he clarifies
text: After rumours of his death in an accident in Canada went viral on social media and cricketers like Ravichandran Ashwin sought clarification, ex-Sri Lanka captain Sanath Jayasuriya revealed he's in Sri Lanka and has not visited Canada recently. He added the hoax has his family and friends deeply disturbed and urged his fans to ignore any such news.

headlines: Pema Khandu to be sworn-in as Arunachal Pradesh CM on May 29
text: Pema Khandu will be sworn-in as the Chief Minister of Arunachal Pradesh on May 29, Kiren Rijiju, Minister of State for Home Affairs informed on Twitter. This comes after Arunachal Pradesh BJP MLAs on Monday unanimously selected Pema Khandu as the leader of BJP Legislature Party. BJP had won 41 seats in the 60-member Arunachal Pradesh Assembly.

headlines: Being 3rd child, PM shouldn't lose right to vote: Owaisi to Ramdev
text: Responding to Baba Ramdev's comments on population control, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Monday said that PM Narendra Modi shouldn't lose his right to vote just because he is the third child. "Why do Ramdev's ideas receive undue attention?" Owaisi asked. Ramdev had earlier said that to control population growth, the third child should be devoid of rights.

headlines: PMO has no records of income tax refunds of former PMs: RTI reply
text: The Prime Minister's Office has no records of income tax refunds of former prime ministers, the PMO said this in a reply to an RTI application filed by PTI. It further refused to share information regarding PM Narendra Modi's income tax refunds, saying it was exempted under the RTI Act. "The information sought is personal in nature," said the PMO.

headlines: IAF chief flies 'Missing Man' formation in tribute to Kargil hero
text: IAF chief Air Chief Marshal BS Dhanoa paid tribute to Squadron Leader Ajay Ahuja, who was martyred during Kargil conflict in 1999, by flying a 'Missing Man' formation in a MiG-21. He led MiG-21 'Missing Man' formation flypast at Air Force station in Bathinda. He was accompanied by Air Officer Commanding-in-Chief Western Air Command Air Marshal R Nambiar.

headlines: India, Pak officials meet, discuss modalities for Kartarpur corridor
text: Officials from India and Pakistan met on Monday to discuss the modalities for a corridor linking Dera Baba Nanak in Punjab to Gurdwara Darbar Sahib in Kartarpur in Pakistan. The two nations had agreed to set up the corridor last year to link the historic Gurdwara Darbar Sahib, the final resting place of Guru Nanak Dev, to Dera Baba Nanak.

headlines: UP Police arrests 3 suspects in Smriti Irani aide's murder case
text: UP Police today arrested three suspects in connection with the murder of Smriti Irani's close aide Surendra Singh, who was shot dead at his home two days after Irani won the Amethi Lok Sabha seat. The police also recovered a country-made pistol, a blood-stained towel and a mobile phone from their possession. Police said that two suspects are still absconding.

headlines: IAS sends daughter to 'Anganwadi' for pre-school, MP Guv responds
text: Madhya Pradesh's Katni district Collector, IAS Pankaj Jain, enrolled his daughter to 'Anganwadi' for pre-schooling, claiming it's better than private play schools. Governor Anandiben Patel wrote to Jain, "When responsible officers send their kids to these places, the condition improves." "Public servants inspire society...Your efforts will increase government servants' responsibility," she added.

headlines: Cong directionless, Rahul surrounded by pensioners' club: Sena
text: In its mouthpiece 'Saamana', the Shiv Sena called the Congress "directionless" and said that while BJP has its chief Amit Shah's organisational abilities, Congress chief Rahul Gandhi is surrounded by "pensioners' club". It added that Rahul's "personality doesn't attract people" and his speeches aren't "impressive". It also criticised Congress' Priyanka Gandhi for failing to have an impact in the elections.

headlines: Tejashwi should quit as Bihar Assembly's LoP: RJD MLA
text: RJD MLA Maheshwar Prasad Yadav demanded the resignation of party leader Tejashwi Yadav from Leader of Opposition (LoP) post in Bihar Assembly after RJD failed to win even a single Bihar Lok Sabha seat. He added Tejashwi should take "moral responsibility" of RJD's loss. Criticising RJD's senior leadership, Maheshwar said that the party will break if "dynastic politics" doesn't end.

headlines: Hamilton's talent saved us from defeat: Mercedes boss
text: Mercedes' Formula One head Toto Wolff praised British driver Lewis Hamilton's win at Monaco, saying, "We thought the tyre would make it to the end. But, of course, it didn't. He saved us. His driving saved us." Wolff admitted that the decision to fit 'mediums' instead of 'hards' at Hamilton's pit-stop after only 10 laps was a wrong decision.

headlines: That no-ball made me: Zaman on 2017 CT final vs India
text: Speaking about his no-ball reprieve off Jasprit Bumrah's bowling in the Champions Trophy 2017 final, Pakistan's opener Fakhar Zaman said, "That no-ball made me. I had a dream before the final that I will be dismissed off a no-ball and it proved to be true." "I was very lucky and ever since that century I have become famous," Zaman added.

headlines: He is a player with enormous hunger: Jonty praises Hardik
text: South Africa's Jonty Rhodes, who was part of Mumbai Indians' coaching staff, praised Hardik Pandya, saying, "He is a player with enormous hunger." "I was worried about Hardik's focus. He came across as someone who would take a selfie with a guy or a girl in the stands. Or someone who is worried about his hat or hair," Rhodes added.

headlines: Ex-world no. 1 Wozniacki out of French Open in 1st Rd
text: Former world number one Caroline Wozniacki was ousted out of the French Open first round after losing 6-0, 3-6, 3-6 to Russian world number 68 Veronika Kudermetova on Monday. Dutch fourth seed Kiki Bertens, French Open semi-finalist in 2016, reached the second round at Roland Garros on Monday with a 6-3, 6-4 win over French player Pauline Parmentier.

headlines: Local political rivalry led to Surendra Singh's murder: UP DGP
text: Uttar Pradesh Director General of Police (DGP) OP Singh on Monday claimed that a "local level political rivalry" was behind the murder of Smriti Irani's close aide and BJP worker Surendra Singh. He said three suspects have been arrested so far and two are still absconding. Surendra Singh was shot at by unknown assailants in Uttar Pradesh's Amethi on Saturday.

headlines: Flipkart says GOQii deep discounting allegations baseless: Report
text: Flipkart reportedly approached DPIIT and CCI and said it hasn't violated norms after smart wearables startup GOQii sent a legal notice to the e-tailer over alleged deep discounting of its products. Flipkart reportedly called the allegations baseless claiming productÂ’s resale value is decided by online resellers not Flipkart. GOQii CEO Vishal Gondal refuted Flipkart's lack of control over pricing.

headlines: Government exempted 541 startups from Angel Tax so far
text: Ramesh Abhishek, Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade's Secretary, tweeted, "541 startups have been granted angel tax exemption by CBDT so far." "Rest 36 applications were incomplete, [Startup India] team is working with concerned startups to address...deficiencies," he added. Earlier, the CBDT announced startups complying with February 19 DPIIT notification would get exemption.

headlines: We are not a 'fintech' but a 'techfin' company: PhonePe CEO
text: Online payments platform PhonePe CEO Sameer Nigam in an interview said, "I keep telling my teams that we are not a Â‘fintechÂ’ company but a Â‘techfinÂ’ company". Nigam explained, "[W]e are building technology with a view to [transform] financial services...as opposed to a fintech company which uses technology to manufacture financial products." Previously, Nigam worked as SVP Engineering at Flipkart.

headlines: Greaves Cotton to foray into e-vehicle battery manufacturing
text: Engineering company Greaves Cotton's CEO Nagesh Basavanhalli has said the Mumbai-based company is looking to invest in battery manufacturing and supply chain for electric vehicles in the coming years. The 160-year-old firm has been known for manufacturing diesel engines, generators and pump sets. Notably, Greaves had in August 2018 acquired a 67% stake in electric scooter maker Ampere Vehicles.

headlines: Lord Ram's work has to be done and will be done: RSS chief
