text: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Monday said that Lord Ram's work "has to be done and will be done". "If we surrender it to someone else, then there will be a need to monitor that person," he added. This comes 3 days after BJP, whose manifesto talks of construction of Ram temple in Ayodhya, gained majority in Lok Sabha polls.

headlines: Please get India free education, medical care: Rishi to PM Modi
text: Actor Rishi Kapoor on Monday appealed to PM Narendra Modi and other BJP leaders including Smriti Irani and Arun Jaitley to work upon getting India free education, medical care and pension among other things. "After all this is the India we Indians want to see," he added. "Please excuse me if I have over stepped," Rishi further tweeted.

headlines: Only SRK, Aamir, Akshay, I pulled off stardom for so long: Salman
text: Salman Khan has said that besides him, only Shah Rukh Khan, Aamir Khan and Akshay Kumar have been able to pull off stardom for a long time. "It'll always fade away. It's a huge task to keep it going for such a long time," he added. "We'll try our best to keep it going for another few years," said Salman.

headlines: Ajay Devgn's father, action director Veeru Devgan, passes away
text: Actor Ajay Devgn's father, veteran action director Veeru Devgan, passed away on Monday morning after reportedly suffering a cardiac arrest. He was admitted to a hospital in Mumbai this morning after he complained of breathlessness. Veeru Devgan is known for his work in films like 'Dilwale' (1994), 'Himmatwala' (1983) and Shahenshah (1988) among others.

headlines: If Trump calls me, I may not answer: Huawei CEO on US sanctions
text: Reacting to the US sanctions, Chinese technology company Huawei's CEO Ren Zhengfei said, "If Trump calls me (to negotiate), I may not answer. But he doesn't have my number." Zhengfei added, "I see his tweets...it's laughable because they're self-contradictory." However, he admitted that Huawei's growth may slow down if US companies continue to restrict their use of chips and software.

headlines: Stay away from rumours: Congress to media over CWC meet
text: Congress has asked media to respect the sanctity of a closed door meeting of Congress Working Committee (CWC). "Various conjectures, speculations, insinuations, assumptions, gossip and rumour mongering in a section of the media is uncalled for," it added. This comes after various sections of media reported that Rahul Gandhi accused three senior Congress leaders of placing their sons above party.

headlines: Gambhir demands action after Muslim man in Gurugram beaten up
text: Cricketer-turned-politician Gautam Gambhir has demanded "exemplary action" from Gurugram authorities after reports came out that a Muslim man in the city was beaten up, forced to remove his skullcap and made to chant 'Jai Shri Ram'. Gambhir further said, "I am not limiting myself to Gurugram incident alone, any oppression based on caste or religion is deplorable."

headlines: Lenskart in talks with SoftBank for $350M, to turn unicorn: Report
text: Lenskart is reportedly in talks with SoftBank's Vision Fund to raise $350 million in funding. If the deal goes through, the valuation of Lenskart will rise to $1.3 billion, marking its entry into the billion-dollar (unicorn) startup club. A report further stated that SoftBank wanted to invest a higher amount in the startup, but Lenskart didn't agree to it.

headlines: Muslim man shot at allegedly over his name, told to go to Pak
text: A Muslim man was allegedly shot at in Bihar's Begusarai district on Sunday after he was asked his name. In a video that has gone viral on social media, Mohammed Qasim says, "I was stopped by Rajiv Yadav and he asked my name. When I told him my name he fired at me and said you should go to Pakistan."

headlines: Kerala policeman falls while singing on daughter's wedding eve, dies
text: P Vishnuprasad, a 55-year-old Sub-Inspector in Thiruvananthapuram, collapsed while singing on stage on the eve of his youngest daughter's wedding on Saturday. He was rushed to the hospital immediately after but he could not be saved and passed away at around 9.30 pm. The bride wasn't told about her father's demise and got married to her groom the next day.

headlines: Myanmar soldiers jailed for killing 10 Rohingya released early
text: Myanmar granted early release to seven soldiers jailed for the killing of 10 Rohingya Muslim men during a 2017 military crackdown in the Rakhine State. The soldiers were freed in November last year, meaning they served less than one year of their 10-year prison terms for the killings. "Their punishment was reduced by the military," officials said.

headlines: Everyone became Narendra Modi and led BJP campaign: PM
text: Appreciating Varanasi people for spearheading the election campaign, PM Narendra Modi on Monday said that everyone became Narendra Modi and led the campaign for the BJP in the general elections. During the visit to his constituency Varanasi, Modi added the entire Uttar Pradesh is "worth praising". Modi said the state is showing the direction to the country and national politics.

headlines: PM Narendra Modi transformed Kashi in 5 years: Amit Shah
text: Addressing BJP workers in Varanasi, BJP President Amit Shah on Monday said that PM Narendra Modi has transformed Kashi in the last five years. He added that it is the "good fortune" of the Varanasi people that PM Modi represents them in Lok Sabha. Shah said, "Perhaps it's the only election where the candidate hasn't visited constituency after filing nomination."

headlines: Surendra Singh's murder shouldn't be politicised: Pramod Tiwari
text: The murder of Smriti Irani's close aide and BJP worker Surendra Singh in Amethi shouldn't be politicised, Congress leader Pramod Tiwari said. He added it shouldn't be equated with politics as Singh had earlier visited SP's stage and he had seen Singh in Congress' office before. Tiwari said that "strict action" as per laws should be taken against the culprit.

headlines: None of our Karnataka MLAs will switch to BJP: Congress
text: Congress leader MB Patil ruled out any tension between Karnataka's ruling Congress-JD(S) coalition government and said that none of his party's MLAs will switch to the BJP. He added the BJP has tried to topple the coalition government in the past. Patil further said BJP will also try it in the future but this government will complete its full term.

headlines: With Smith, Warner in, I think Aus will win WC: Warne
text: Former Australian spinner Shane Warne has said that with the return of Steve Smith and David Warner he believes that Australia will win the World Cup title this year. "However, they have to get past a very strong India and England side. If you ask me who are the favourites, it is India and England," Warne added.

headlines: India have great variety and trio of fast bowlers: Ian Chappell
text: Speaking about India's bowling, former Australia captain Ian Chappell said, "India do have great variety and a trio of fast bowlers who can be exceptional in favourable conditions." "Wicket-taking is going to play a crucial role in deciding this World Cup... [T]he best-balanced attacks will likely come to the fore, and they belong to England, India and Australia," Chappell added.

headlines: Petra Kvitova withdraws from French Open due to injury
text: Two-time Wimbledon champion Petra Kvitova has withdrawn from the French Open 2019 due to a forearm injury. Petra was supposed to play her first round match against Sorana Cirstea but she has been replaced with 'lucky loser' Kaja Juvan from Slovenia. Kvitova's best run at the clay-court Grand Slam came in 2012 when she reached the semi-final stage.

headlines: I won't panic at all as of now: Sachin on India's loss vs NZ
text: Speaking about the Indian team's loss against New Zealand in the team's first warm-up match, former Indian cricketer Sachin Tendulkar said, "I will not judge the team after each and every game... I won't panic at all as of now." "India should make most of the practice matches leading to the World Cup," Sachin added.

headlines: Concept headphones made using 'microbe-grown' materials
text: Nordic design agency Aivan has made concept headphones using "microbially-grown materials". Named 'Korvaa', the rigid plastic frame of the headphones was reportedly 3D-printed using a bioplastic created as a byproduct of yeast processing lactic acid. Made in collaboration with scientists, the headphones that don't work, feature six different microbially grown substances, a media report stated.

headlines: Lupin shares down 5% after USFDA observations on Goa plant
text: Shares of Mumbai-based drugmaker Lupin fell up to 5% on Monday after the USFDA made two observations following the inspection of its Goa plant. The US health regulator further cautioned that the facility may be subject to regulatory action. The inspection classification will not affect the disruption of supplies or the existing revenues from operations of the facility, Lupin said.

headlines: Give names of big loan defaulters: Information Commission to RBI
text: The Central Information Commission has directed RBI to disclose the list of big loan defaulters it had sent to banks for resolution. This came following an RTI application based on a statement made by RBI Deputy Governor Viral Acharya in 2017. Acharya had said accounts of 12 defaulters, comprising 25% of total bad loans, were sent to banks for resolution.

headlines: I'm blessed that my daughters have accepted my girlfriend: Rampal
text: Speaking about girlfriend Gabriella Demetriades, Arjun Rampal said, "It was of prime importance that my daughters should accept her as part of the family. I'm blessed that they have." Rampal, who has two daughters aged 13 and 17 with ex-wife Mehr Jesia, added that they met through common friends. Arjun announced in April that he's expecting a child with Gabriella.

headlines: Punjab Congress chief Jakhar resigns after losing to Sunny Deol
text: Punjab Congress chief Sunil Jakhar has resigned from his post after losing to Bollywood actor and BJP candidate Sunny Deol from Gurdaspur Lok Sabha seat. Jakhar said that he had resigned three days ago but has not heard from the party yet. The Congress won 8 out of 13 seats in the state.

headlines: FIR against 'PM follower' who threatened to rape Kashyap's daughter
text: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap took to Twitter to share that an FIR has been filed against the social media troll who had threatened to rape his daughter. Kashyap earlier claimed that the man is a follower of PM Narendra Modi. Thanking Mumbai Police, Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis and PM Modi, Kashyap wrote, "As a father I am more secure now."

headlines: After Smriti's close aide's murder, BJP worker shot dead in WB
text: A BJP worker, identified as Chandan Shaw, has been shot dead in West Bengal's North 24 Parganas district. Shaw was attacked by men on a bike who first hurled bombs at him and then shot him from close range. This comes after BJP's newly elected MP from Amethi Smriti Irani's close aide Surendra Singh was shot dead at his residence.

headlines: PhonePe in talks to raise $1 bn from Tencent, Tiger Global: Report
text: Bengaluru-based online payments platform PhonePe is reportedly in talks to raise about $1 billion from investors like China's Tencent and Tiger Global. PhonePe is looking at a valuation of at least $7-8 billion and will not take transaction forward at a lower valuation. It could take another 2-3 months for the investment talks to close formally.

headlines: Fiat Chrysler submits proposal for merger with Renault
text: Fiat Chrysler has made a "transformative" merger proposal for French carmaker Renault in a deal to create a new third largest global Original Equipment Manufacturer, the Italian firm said. The combined business would be 50% owned by Fiat shareholders and 50% by Renault shareholders. The carmaker said the tie-up would create a global automotive leader, with 8.7 million vehicle sales.

headlines: Sex racket busted in rented Gurugram house; police shares video
text: The Gurugram Police has busted a sex racket being run from a rented house and arrested 24 people including 6 women. The police shared a video of those arrested and said a team raided the spot after a woman officer of Durga Shakti Rapid Action Force received a tip-off. All the arrested women are Delhi natives.

headlines: U'khand auto driver gives free ride to celebrate PM Modi's win
text: Auto driver Jamuna Prasad from Uttarakhand's Haldwani is offering free rides till the swearing-in ceremony of PM Narendra Modi to celebrate his return to power. "I am extremely happy that PM Modi is taking the oath again. He speaks for all," Prasad said. The BJP-led NDA won 353 out of 542 Lok Sabha seats that were contested in the elections.

headlines: Assam Cong chief resigns after 'humiliating defeat' in LS polls
text: Assam Pradesh Congress Committee (APCC) President Ripun Bora on Sunday submitted his resignation from the post. "Whatever may be the reasons for this humiliating defeat in Assam, my conscience doesn't allow me to continue as president of APCC," Bora wrote in his resignation letter. Taking responsibility for the defeat, he added that a new successor should take his place.

headlines: Rahul's personality doesn't attract people: Shiv Sena
text: Shiv Sena on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi's personality doesn't attract people and his speeches are not impressive. "Is there anything that can inspire a person or the country from whatever Rahul Gandhi says?" it asked. Analysing Congress' Lok Sabha polls performance, Sena further said that although the party has leaders, it lacks party workers.

headlines: Lewis Hamilton wins Monaco GP, extends championship lead
text: Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton extended his lead at the top of the Formula One championship table after winning the Monaco Grand Prix on Sunday. Ferrari's Sebastian Vettel finished second while Hamilton's teammate Valtteri Bottas was third. Red Bull's Max Verstappen had finished the race in the second position but was placed fourth due to a five-second penalty.

headlines: Facebook may launch own crypto 'GlobalCoin' in 2020: Report
text: Facebook is finalising plans to launch its cryptocurrency, internally named 'GlobalCoin', in about a dozen countries next year, BBC reported. Last month, CEO Mark Zuckerberg reportedly met Bank of England governor Mark Carney to discuss opportunities and risks involved in launching a cryptocurrency. Facebook reportedly sought advice on operational and regulatory issues from US Treasury officials.

headlines: Will keep reminding PM of special category for Andhra: Jagan Reddy
text: YSR Congress Party president and Andhra Pradesh CM-designate YS Jagan Mohan Reddy on Sunday said that he will keep reminding PM Narendra Modi of special category status for the state. "As long as we keep reminding, things will change," Reddy said. This comes after Reddy met PM Modi and BJP President Amit Shah on Sunday.

headlines: PM Modi visits Varanasi, offers prayers at Kashi Vishwanath temple
text: PM Narendra Modi on Monday arrived at his Lok Sabha constituency Varanasi and offered his prayers at the Kashi Vishwanath temple. He was accompanied by BJP President Amit Shah and Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath. PM Modi was re-elected from Varanasi by a margin of 4.79 lakh votes in the recently concluded Lok Sabha elections.

headlines: Rare all-white panda photographed in Chinese reserve
text: A rare all-white panda was photographed in mid-April in Southwest China's Wolong National Nature Reserve, state media reported citing reserve management authorities. Photographed in the wild at an altitude of about 2,000 metres above sea level, it's about one or two years old and strong, a researcher said. Judging by the picture the panda is Albino, the researcher added.

headlines: NASA asks people to give names that will fly to Mars in 2020
text: NASA invited people to submit names which will fly aboard its 2020 Mars rover, scheduled to launch by July 2020. An electron beam will be used to stencil the submitted names onto silicon chip or chips with lines of text smaller than one-thousandth the width of a human hair. Over two million names flew on NASA's InSight mission to Mars.

headlines: CBI summons ex-Kolkata police chief Rajeev Kumar on Monday
text: The CBI has summoned former Kolkata Police Commissioner Rajeev Kumar to the agency's Kolkata office on Monday for questioning in connection with the Saradha chit fund scam case. CBI had earlier issued a lookout notice against Kumar to prevent him from leaving the country. Kumar is accused of destroying evidence related to the case.

headlines: No taxes owed by GMR for $271mn arbitration award: Maldives
text: The Maldivian government has decided not to levy taxes on GMR Group for the $271-million compensation it received from the island nation for premature termination of Male airport's contract. Maldives had in 2018 sought over $20-million in tax and fines from a GMR Group company that won arbitration against the contract's premature termination. The company had refuted the tax claim.

headlines: First 300-run partnership came after 28 years of ODI cricket
text: Sourav Ganguly and Rahul Dravid shared ODI cricket's first ever 300-run partnership after notching 318 runs against Sri Lanka in the ICC World Cup on 26 May 1999, nearly 28 years after first ODI was played. Ganguly, who went on to score his career-best 183 in the match, contributed 157(146) for the second wicket partnership while Dravid scored 145(129).

headlines: Woman who accused actor Karan Oberoi of rape attacked in Mumbai
text: The woman who accused actor Karan Oberoi of raping and extorting money from her was attacked by two bike-borne men on Saturday, police said. The police also said a letter was thrown at the victim asking her to take back the case. "Oshiwara police station has taken note of FIR and the investigation is underway," a senior police officer said.

headlines: Control: Johar to Gurung after he says 'Pyar kiya toh darna kya'
text: Fashion designer Prabal Gurung on Saturday shared a picture with filmmaker Karan Johar to wish him on the occasion of his 47th birthday and wrote, "Pyaar Kiya To Darna Kya. Happy birthday KJo." Responding to the post, Johar commented, "Control yourself bhaiya!" followed by laughing emojis. While some users speculated that they are dating, another user wrote, "Two unapologetic stunners."

headlines: I think Cong didn't like us celebrating: Son of Irani's killed aide
text: The son of Surendra Singh, the close aide of Smriti Irani who was shot dead in Amethi two days after Irani's victory from the constituency, has said, "After [Irani] became MP, Vijay Yatra was carried out." "I think some Congress supporters didn't like it, we have suspicions on some people," he added.

headlines: 43% new Lok Sabha MPs have criminal record, 26% more than 2014: ADR
text: Around 233 MPs (43%) elected to 17th Lok Sabha have criminal charges against them, according to Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR) which analysed 539 out of 542 winning candidates. The BJP has 116 such MPs, followed by 29 MPs from Congress, 13 from JDU, 10 from DMK and 9 from TMC. In 2014, 185 Lok Sabha MPs had criminal records.

headlines: Yogi sets 12-hour deadline for arrest of killers of Irani's aide
text: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has set a 12-hour deadline to arrest the people behind the murder of Smriti Irani's close aide Surendra Singh. "CM has directed DGP to take severe and effective action and show results...in the next 12 hours and catch the culprits. IG Lucknow has been dispatched for monitoring on the ground," said CM Adityanath's office.

headlines: Watch Man Utd score twice in injury time to win CL in 1999
text: Manchester United scored twice in injury time to register a 2-1 comeback victory in the Champions League final against Bayern Munich on May 26, 1999. Teddy Sheringham (91') and Ole Gunnar Solskjaer (93') scored to help United complete the treble, after having won Premier League and FA Cup. "Football...bloody hell!" said then United boss Sir Alex Ferguson after the match.

headlines: Hundreds of students skip school in India to protest climate change
text: Hundreds of students in India skipped schools and colleges on Friday to demand action on climate change from the government. The Indian students joined thousands of students from 1,664 cities in 125 countries to participate in 'Fridays for Future' movement started by Sweden's 16-year-old Greta Thunberg. Fridays for Future India said protests were held in 57 places in the country.

headlines: MP school teachers to take exams after poor performance of students
text: Madhya Pradesh government has decided to test the knowledge of school teachers in about 700 schools by making them appear for an examination similar to class 10 and 12 board exams. This comes after 30% of the students in these schools failed in the board examinations. Teachers could face demotion or even forced retirement if their performance is extremely poor.

headlines: Woman demands police action after cock's crowing disturbed her sleep
text: Claiming that a cock's crowing at dawn disturbed her sleep, a woman in Maharashtra's Pune district demanded police action against the bird and its owner. The police revealed that the woman had come to her sister's house and left the place after submitting the application. When the police approached her sister, she claimed that her sibling was a little "eccentric".

headlines: Some radar can't see through clouds: Army chief on PM's remark
text: Army chief General Bipin Rawat has said some radar cannot see through clouds because of the manner in which they operate. General Rawat was responding to a question on PM Narendra Modi's 'radar' comment. PM Modi had said he gave a go-ahead to Balakot air strikes despite bad weather as he assumed clouds could help Indian jets escape Pakistan's radar.

headlines: Anuj Sharma reinstated as Kolkata police commissioner
text: Anuj Sharma, who is currently posted as ADG and IGP Operation, has been appointed as Kolkata's Commissioner of Police again. Sharma will immediately take charge from Rajesh Kumar, as per government's official notification. Last month, the Election Commission had directed the Chief Secretary of West Bengal to appoint Kumar, the then ADG Pollution Control Board, as the commissioner.

headlines: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das meets Arun Jaitley
text: Reserve Bank Governor Shaktikanta Das met Arun Jaitley on Sunday. "Had a courtesy meeting with Hon'ble Union Minister Arun Jaitley this evening," Das tweeted as he shared a picture of the two from the meeting. His tweet came amid speculations in some media on the state of Jaitley's health.

headlines: Jharkhand Adivasi professor arrested for 2-year-old FB post on beef
text: Jeetrai Hansda, an Adivasi professor and activist, was arrested on Saturday in Jharkhand, allegedly for a two-year-old Facebook post defending his community's right to eat beef. Police said the complaint was filed by Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP), the student's wing of the RSS. Hansda is reportedly arrested for insulting religious feelings and attempts to promote enmity between people.

headlines: 11 Indians get Swiss govt notices to share bank account info
text: At least 11 Indian clients of Switzerland-based banks were last week served notices by Swiss authorities, giving them a last chance to appeal against sharing of their details with India. The Swiss government has in its notifications redacted individuals' full names, making public only their initials, nationality and date of birth. The individuals can file their appeals within 30 days.

headlines: Mamata's offer to resign nothing but drama: Mukul Roy
text: BJP leader Mukul Roy on Sunday said that TMC chief Mamata Banerjee's offer to resign as West Bengal CM was nothing but a drama to stay in the headlines. Roy added, "Whom did she give her resignation to?" Roy further said that TMC will slowly get "finished" and Mamata's government in the state will come to an "end soon".

headlines: Steve Smith terms 'cheat' chants by England crowd as white noise
text: Australian batsman Steve Smith termed the 'cheat, cheat' chants directed at him and David Warner by England crowd during Australia-England World Cup warm-up match on Saturday as white noise. "ItÂ’s water off a duckÂ’s back and it doesnÂ’t bother me. I try to black it out," he added. Smith scored a century in the match, helping Australia win.

headlines: MacOS security flaw could let malicious apps run: Researcher
text: A security researcher detailed a macOS version 10.14.5 and prior vulnerability that could let attackers bypass Gatekeeper security mechanism to execute untrusted code without warning or explicit user permission. Gatekeeper verifies downloaded applications before letting them run. He said a user can reportedly be tricked into mounting network share drive that Gatekeeper considers as safe location.

headlines: Surendra Singh was killed to terrorise Amethi: Smriti Irani
text: After the murder of her close aide and BJP worker Surendra Singh in Amethi, Smriti Irani on Sunday said that Singh was killed so that Amethi could be "terrorised, disintegrated and bowed down". She further requested BJP workers to "exercise restraint". Irani asserted that she'll not hesitate to move the Supreme Court if necessary to bring the perpetrators to justice.

headlines: Video shows SpaceX's launched Starlink satellites in sky
text: Astronomer Marco Langbroek captured a video of billionaire Elon Musk's SpaceX's Starlink satellites moving across the sky in a "train" after the first 60 were recently successfully launched to low-Earth orbit. The event, which Langbroek states resulted in UFO reports, was sighted over Northwest Europe. "I had calculated a search orbit and stood ready with my camera," Langbroek said.

headlines: India rejects bid by US, others to deny policy space at WTO
text: India has rejected attempts by the US and other countries to bring in "differentiation" to deny policy space to India and other developing countries in multilateral trade pacts, trade ministers said. India said it "cannot agree to any approach which undermines the centrality of development dimension in the WTO." South Africa and the Africa-Caribbean-Pacific coalition supported India's position.

headlines: Jet Airways Founder offloaded over lookout notice: Officials
text: Jet Airways Founder Naresh Goyal, along with his wife Anita, was on Saturday stopped from leaving the country due to a lookout circular issued by the Home Ministry, officials said. The couple was offloaded from a Dubai-bound Emirates flight by immigration authorities at Mumbai airport. Both of them had stepped down from the Jet Airways board in March.

headlines: UK company switches to 4-day work week after giving everyone raise
text: Portcullis Legals, a law firm in UK's Plymouth, has switched its entire workforce to a four-day work week after giving the entire staff a pay raise. "The initial results have been heartening Â– our team is happier and our customers are receiving better service," the company's Managing Director said. The four-day work week was introduced permanently after a five-month trial.

headlines: Was offered Mannat, dad said what will I do with big house: Salman
text: Salman Khan has revealed that during the beginning of his career, he was offered the chance to buy the bungalow 'Mannat' but he passed on the opportunity after his father asked what he'll do with a big house. Eventually, Shah Rukh Khan became the bungalow's owner. Salman further asked jokingly, "Shah Rukh, what do you do in this big house?"

headlines: I offered to resign as MP Cong chief last year, not now: Kamal Nath
text: A day after the reports said Madhya Pradesh CM Kamal Nath has offered to step down as the state's Congress chief, he clarified that the offer was made during the Assembly elections held last year. Congress General Secretary Dipak Babaria on Saturday claimed that Kamal Nath offered to resign after Congress won only one Lok Sabha seat in the state.

headlines: What Junaid did after WC snub wrong but I would've done same: Afridi
text: Reacting to pacer Junaid Khan tweeting a picture of himself with his mouth taped after being omitted from Pakistan's World Cup squad, ex-captain Shahid Afridi said what Junaid did wasn't right. "There was no need to do that, you can protest while remaining silent as well," he added. "But probably I would have done the same," he further said.

headlines: PM must stop cow vigilantes if he feels Muslims live in fear: Owaisi
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Sunday said, "If PM feels Muslims live in fear, will he stop mob lynching gangs, who in the name of cows, are killing and beating Muslims, taking our videos and demeaning us?" This comes after PM Narendra Modi on Saturday said that the minority has been made to live in "imaginary fear" for vote-bank politics.

headlines: PM Modi meets his mother, seeks blessing after win, pics surface
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met his mother Heeraben Modi at her residence in Gujarat's Gandhinagar to seek her blessings after winning the 17th Lok Sabha elections. Earlier today, PM Modi addressed a public meeting in Ahmedabad to express gratitude to the people of his home state. He will be taking oath as the Prime Minister at Rashtrapati Bhavan on Thursday.

headlines: Andhra inspector-turned-MP salutes his former boss, pic goes viral
text: A picture of former Andhra Pradesh police inspector Kuruva Gorantla Madhav, who is now the MP-elect from Hindupur in Anantapur district, saluting his former boss, CID Deputy Superintendent of Police Mahboob Basha has gone viral. Madhav revealed that the picture was clicked during the counting day. "I adore him. It was mutual respect between us," he added.

headlines: Kept thumb on oxygen cylinder leak to survive: Woman who scaled Everest
text: Madhya Pradesh's Bhawna Dehariya, who scaled the Mount Everest on May 22, said that her oxygen cylinder's regulator started leaking while scaling the summit. "I had to keep a thumb on the leak for about 90 minutes to survive," she added. The 27-year-old woman hails from Tamia in Chhindwara and is pursuing her Master's in Physical Education from Bhopal.

headlines: Woman jumps into canal with son after pic with ex-lover goes viral
text: A 30-year-old woman jumped into a canal with her five-year-old son in Khatauli town of Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar district after a picture of her with her former lover had gone viral on social media. The woman had tied the knot with another man in 2012. The minor has been rescued but the woman is still untraceable, the police said.

headlines: Muslim man allegedly beaten up, asked to chant 'Jai Shri Ram'
text: A Muslim man was allegedly beaten by a group of men in Gurugram on Friday while he was returning after offering namaz. The man, identified as Barkat Ali, was allegedly told to remove his skullcap and chant 'Jai Shri Ram' and 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai'. Barkat added he tried to escape, but the men held him and tore his kurta.

headlines: Tyres were used as chairs at Surat coaching where 22 died in fire
text: Presence of inflammable materials including tyres that were used as chairs at the Surat coaching class hampered the fire fighting operation at Takshashila Complex where 22 students died on Friday, Gujarat Chief Secretary JN Singh said on Sunday. The ceiling of the institute was just five feet high. This is why the owner used tyres instead of chairs for seating.

headlines: Man arrested for stalking ex-classmate who rejected his proposal
text: A 23-year-old Hyderabad man has been arrested for cyber stalking and sexually harassing his ex-intermediate classmate on social media after she rejected his proposal. The woman blocked him on WhatsApp for sending 'unscrupulous messages' after which the man created a fake Facebook account and posted photos of her with sex soliciting comments. The man is employed in a private firm.

headlines: All 3 RLSP legislators join Nitish Kumar's JD(U)
text: After Upendra Kushwaha-led RLSP failed to win even a single Lok Sabha seat, all the three members (2 MLA, 1 MLC) of the party in the bicameral legislature joined Nitish Kumar-led JD(U) in Bihar. "The legislators had also appended letters of approval from...JD(U)," officials said. Notably, the legislators had earlier revolted against Kushwaha's decision to snap ties with the NDA.

headlines: Coming 5 yrs have to be of Jan Bhagidari and Jan Chetna: PM
text: Addressing his first rally after the general elections, PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said that the coming five years have to be years of "Jan Bhagidari and Jan Chetna". He added the next five years will have to be utilised to solve issues of the common citizens. PM Modi said, "We've to further enhance India's position at the world stage."

headlines: Roger Federer makes winning return to French Open
text: Swiss tennis player Roger Federer made a winning return to the French Open after he beat Lorenzo Sonego in straight sets on Sunday. Federer, who was playing on the French Open clay for the first time since 2015, registered his 343rd Grand Slam win. Rafael Nadal is set to begin his French Open campaign on Monday.

headlines: Want to create our own legacy: Windies captain Holder
text: Speaking about the West Indies teams' World Cup history, current Windies captain Jason Holder said, "It's just a case of us creating our own legacy." "We obviously know our history what the past players have done. We will take it stage by stage, step by step, not get too far ahead of ourselves," Holder added.

headlines: Pakistan-Bangladesh WC warm-up match called off due to rain
text: The pre-World Cup warm-up match between Pakistan and Bangladesh got called off due to rain on Sunday. Pakistan have failed to win a match since arriving in England for the series against England. Bangladesh will face India in their second warm-up match before the World Cup on May 28.

headlines: 2% Amazon shareholders vote to ban face recognition tech sale
text: Amazon shareholders rejected a proposal to stop selling its facial recognition technology to government agencies, getting some 2.4% votes in favour, Reuters stated. A second proposal for a study of the extent to which the technology harmed civil rights and privacy reportedly garnered 27.5% support. Earlier, an MIT study claimed Amazon's facial recognition technology showed gender and race bias.

headlines: Chinese chip giant SMIC to delist from NYSE after 15 years
text: Chinese chipmaker Semiconductor Manufacturing International (SMIC) will apply for 'voluntary delisting' of its American depositary shares (ADSs) from the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) after about 15 years. It cited administrative costs of maintaining ADSs' listing on NYSE, among other reasons for the development. "It has nothing to do with trade war and Huawei incident," the chipmaker told CNBC.

headlines: Xi seeks global cooperation on technology after Huawei block
text: China President Xi Jinping has said countries should cooperate in developing the Internet, big data and artificial intelligence. China attaches great importance to the development of the big data industry and is willing to explore a growth path with other nations for new technologies, he added. Xi's comments come against the backdrop of the US blacklisting Huawei over espionage concerns.

headlines: Boring Company holds race between Teslas on road and in tunnel
text: Elon Musk-led tunnel digging startup The Boring Company tweeted a video of a race it staged between a Tesla car travelling in normal road traffic and one reportedly using its California test tunnel. The car in tunnel finished race in over a minute travelling at top speed of about 200 kmph, as compared to the on-road car's over four minutes.

headlines: DPIIT aims to cut startup compliance time to 1 hour a month
text: The Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT) has proposed to reduce compliance time for startups to one hour per month, an official said. Currently, startups comply with requirements like GST filings, tax returns and local laws every month, the official stated. Reduction in compliance time can enable startups to focus on their core work, the official added.

headlines: Single authority may sanction, process GST refunds by August
text: A single authority for sanctioning and processing refunds for Goods and Services Tax (GST) may be constituted by August as the Finance Ministry looks to speed up and simplify the process for exporters, an official said. The current mechanism entails a twin refund sanctioning authority of the central and state tax officers. The process leads to liquidity crunch among exporters.

headlines: Narendra Modi to take oath as Prime Minister at 7 pm on May 30
text: Narendra Modi will take oath as the Prime Minister for a second straight term at 7 pm on May 30 (Thursday). The members of Union Council of Ministers will also be sworn in along with Modi at the Rashtrapati Bhavan. The BJP-led NDA won 353 out of 542 Lok Sabha seats that were contested in the elections.

headlines: Minority of nation has been betrayed the same way as poor: PM Modi
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday said, "The minority of this nation has been betrayed the same way as the nation's poor." He added that minority has been made to live in "imaginary fear" for vote-bank politics. He asked his MPs to gain the minority's trust, saying, "They cannot be handed over to Opposition, who benefit because we keep quiet."

headlines: Pak PM Imran calls PM Modi to congratulate him on election victory
text: Pakistan PM Imran Khan called PM Narendra Modi on Sunday to congratulate him on winning the 17th Lok Sabha elections. The two leaders discussed fighting poverty together among other things. Prime Minister Narendra Modi stressed that creating trust and an environment free of violence and terrorism were essential for fostering cooperation for peace, progress and prosperity in our region.

headlines: Foreign nations behind BJP's victory in Lok Sabha polls: Mamata
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Saturday claimed that foreign nations were behind BJP-led NDA's victory in Lok Sabha polls. "There is the hand of foreign nations also. I don't want to say more in the interest of the nation," said Mamata. She added that EVMs were programmed in places where her party lost by less than one lakh votes.

headlines: Jaitley recovering from heavy medication, still in terrific form: MP
text: Rajya Sabha MP Swapan Dasgupta has tweeted that Arun Jaitley is recovering from a bout of heavy medication but is still in terrific form. "His wit is firmly intact. Needs a little rest to get back his strength," he added, saying questions about his health are understandable. The government today said reports of Jaitley's deteriorating health are "false and baseless".

headlines: Will find out Surendra's killer even if he is hiding in hell: Irani
text: Following the murder of her close aide and BJP worker Surendra Singh two days after she won the Amethi Lok Sabha seat, Smriti Irani said that they will find out the murderer even if he is hiding in hell. She added that she will knock on the Supreme Court's door to get the culprits a death sentence.

headlines: Alka Lamba claims being removed from AAP WhatsApp group, shares pic
text: AAP's Chandni Chowk MLA Alka Lamba has claimed she was removed from the party's MLA WhatsApp group after she praised Naveen Patnaik for winning a fifth term as Odisha CM. She shared a screenshot purportedly showing her being removed by AAP's Dilip Pandey. Lamba tweeted, "Anger is being expressed on me in this manner. But, why am I alone?"

headlines: Nonsense: Elon Musk on report of no toilet paper at Tesla to cut cost
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has refuted a report by Electrek that claimed that several Tesla facilities are taking extreme steps to cut costs, including skipping on ordering office supplies, even toilet paper. "This is complete nonsense," Musk responded to the report. Replying to Musk, Electrek's Editor-in-Chief said, "I wish it wasn't true too, but reliable employee sources are reporting it."

headlines: 2-foot-long plastic shower found in dead dolphin's stomach in US
text: A 2-foot-long plastic shower's hose was found in the stomach of a dolphin recovered from Fort Myers Beach in Florida, US. This is the second stranded dolphin found in the last month in the area with plastic in stomach. "Your actions can make a difference Â– secure and properly dispose of trash," the FWC Fish and Wildlife Research Institute said.

headlines: Man steals Delhi Police bike, goes on patrolling in Noida
text: A 32-year-old man was detained for stealing a patrolling bike of Delhi Police from Preet Vihar police station. Police said the accused, a resident of Chandigarh, was "mentally unstable" and had stolen the bike to go on patrolling himself. He was caught riding the bike in Noida's Sector 126, with the hooter and the blue beacon on.

headlines: Want to work for Congress' ideology, not any post: Rahul
text: While offering to resign as Congress President during the Congress Working Committee meeting, Rahul Gandhi said that he wanted to work for the party's ideology and not for any post. Hitting out at senior party leaders, Rahul accused them of pressurising him to give tickets to their sons in the elections. However, Rahul's resignation was 'unanimously' rejected during the meeting.

headlines: EVMs didn't register many AMMK supporters' votes: Dhinakaran
text: AMMK leader TTV Dhinakaran on Sunday said that he will file a complaint with the Election Commission regarding non-registration of votes by EVMs during the elections. "Many of our supporters voted for our party but their votes haven't been registered," he said. However, he added he cannot approach any court as he has no evidence to ascertain his claim.

headlines: People will forgive Gambhir if he doesn't cheat using duplicate: AAP
text: AAP's spokesperson Saurabh Bharadwaj took a dig at East Delhi MP-designate Gautam Gambhir saying that the people will forgive Gambhir for cheating them by using his duplicate if he meets them on "dusty and sunny" Delhi roads. During general polls campaigning, AAP alleged that Gambhir was using his duplicate to avoid heat. Bharadwaj also congratulated all seven Delhi BJP MPs.

headlines: If we win Champions League, I might cry for a week: Pochettino
text: Tottenham coach Mauricio Pochettino has said that he might cry for a week if the side manages to win the Champions League. "My mother says to me, 'You are a 'llorona'', which means blubberer, a person who cries often and a lot," Pochettino revealed. Tottenham face Liverpool in the final of the Champions League on June 2.

headlines: Sourav Ganguly praises Shami ahead of World Cup 2019
text: Speaking about pacer Mohammad Shami, former Indian captain Sourav Ganguly said, "He has not only been good in the IPL but has been brilliant throughout the year for India." "I'll want, at least in the initial stage of the tournament, to have Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammad Shami and Hardik Pandya in the pace attack," Ganguly added.

headlines: Dhoni's inputs will be crucial for Kohli at WC: Tendulkar
text: Former Indian batsman Sachin Tendulkar has said that former Indian captain MS Dhoni's inputs will be crucial for current captain Virat Kohli at the World Cup 2019. "[H]is experience of standing behind the stumps is going to help because that is possibly the best view anyone could ask for... [H]e can see the entire ground [like] the batsman," Sachin added.

headlines: FB held talks for own crypto with twins who sued it: Report
text: Facebook reportedly held talks with Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss to discuss the possibility of using their cryptocurrency exchange Gemini to store and distribute planned Facebook cryptocurrency. The twins had claimed Mark Zuckerberg stole their idea for Facebook and received a $65-million settlement for the lawsuit. Facebook reportedly also held talks with cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase.

headlines: SpiceJet inducts Boeing 737, takes fleet size to 100
text: Low-cost airline SpiceJet on Sunday announced the induction of a Boeing 737 plane, taking its fleet size to 100 aircraft. The Ajay Singh-led carrier is the fourth domestic airline to achieve the feat after Air India, IndiGo and the temporarily suspended Jet Airways. SpiceJet said it has added around 23 planes in the last month alone.

headlines: Smriti lends a shoulder to remains of her aide who was shot dead
text: BJP's Smriti Irani reached Amethi and lent a shoulder to mortal remains of her close aide Surendra Singh who was shot dead by unknown assailants at his residence. Singh was frequently seen with her during her Lok Sabha elections campaigning. Family members of the deceased have put the blame on Congress workers, saying, "BJP got many votes from our booth."

headlines: Karan Johar tells artists whom to sleep with, alleges Rangoli
text: Replying to a tweet by Kamaal R Khan which said Karan Johar "threw out" Ishaan Khatter from Dharma as he was "rude", Kangana Ranaut's sister Rangoli alleged that Karan tells artists "what to wear and [whom] to sleep with". "Always forcing actors to patch up & break up based on his brand propaganda requirements will not be acceptable," she added.

headlines: Stalker holds actress hostage over marriage; fires at police officer
text: A man in his late twenties held a Bhojpuri film actress hostage at gunpoint in a hotel room in Robertsganj, Uttar Pradesh on Saturday and tried to coerce her to marry him. He opened fire at Superintendent of Police, Sonbhadra, when the officer tried to get her freed, said police. The police later arrested the man, identified as Pankaj Yadav.

headlines: I politely declined an offer which I got: Sonu on joining politics
text: Singer Sonu Nigam, on being asked about his interest in joining politics, revealed that he "politely declined" an offer from a political party. He added that he is not "ready for politics". The singer is known for being outspoken on several issues including playing national anthem in public places, the #MeToo movement and azaan loudspeakers.

headlines: Everyone who voted is happy with result: LK Advani on BJP's mandate
text: Senior BJP leader LK Advani has said everyone who participated in elections is really happy. He added, "It was being said numbers are over 300 but now it stands at 353", referring to the seats won by NDA. Advani was present at NDA's Parliamentary Board meeting, during which Narendra Modi was elected as NDA's leader for the second straight time.

headlines: US not powerful enough, had tea at 10 Downing Street: Huawei CEO
text: Talking about the US restrictions and the country urging European allies to put pressure on Huawei, the Chinese company's CEO Ren Zhengfei said the US campaign against Huawei isn't powerful enough. "I used to have afternoon tea at 10 Downing Street," said Ren. "We have been communicating with leaders of different countries. Every country has its own interests," he added.

headlines: 15-yr-old Dubai-based Indian boy enters Google Science Fair finals
text: Shaamil Karim, a 15-year-old Indian boy living in Dubai, has ranked among top 100 regional finalists for Google Science Fair for his project to make street lights smarter. Karim's project detects if a car or person is passing by and makes the next street light brighter and the previous light dimmer. The project is aimed at saving energy.

headlines: To contain population, 3rd child should be devoid of rights: Ramdev
text: Yoga guru Baba Ramdev has said that to control population growth, the government should make a law that third child is devoid of rights. "Third child shouldn't be allowed to vote, neither contest election nor he/she should enjoy any type of privileges and facilities," he added. "India's population shouldn't be more than 150 crore in next 50 years," he stated.

headlines: Govt merges NSSO, CSO in a major overhaul of statistical system
text: The Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation has decided to merge Central Statistics Office (CSO) and National Sample Survey Office (NSSO) to form a National Statistical Office (NSO) in a major restructuring move. While NSSO comes out with sample surveys on consumption, expenditure, employment and unemployment, the CSO releases data on GDP, inflation and IIP.

headlines: North Korea's 'small weapons' didn't disturb me: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump on Sunday dismissed concerns about recent missile launches from North Korea. "North Korea fired off some small weapons, which disturbed some of my people, and others, but not me. I have confidence that [North Korean leader Kim Jong-un] will keep his promise to me," he said. Notably, the Trump-Kim summit in Vietnam ended without any deal.

headlines: TN CM must resign over AIADMK's defeat in LS polls: Dayanidhi
text: After the AIADMK managed to secure only one seat in the general elections, DMK MP Dayanidhi Maran on Sunday asked Tamil Nadu CM EK Palaniswami to resign from the post. He alleged that the AIADMK won only one seat in the elections because of "money power". Maran said that Palaniswami must take moral responsibility of AIADMK's defeat in the elections.

headlines: PM Modi meets Vice President Venkaiah Naidu at his residence
text: A day after being appointed PM for a second term, PM Narendra Modi on Sunday met Vice President Venkaiah Naidu at his official residence in New Delhi. Naidu tweeted, "Over breakfast, we discussed many issues including accelerating development and strengthening Parliamentary institutions." PM Modi was on Saturday unanimously elected the NDA leader, to head the government for the second term.

headlines: Hackers using stolen NSA tool to attack US cities: Report
text: Hackers are using a tool developed by the US National Security Agency to conduct ransomware attacks on US towns and cities like Baltimore, NYT reported. Named EternalBlue, it was reportedly leaked in 2017 by unidentified group and used in WannaCry ransomware attack. It reportedly exploits an unpatched software flaw letting hackers spread malware faster and farther than they otherwise could.

headlines: Andhra CM-designate Jagan Reddy meets PM Modi in Delhi
text: YSR Congress Party (YSRCP) president and Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister-designate YS Jagan Mohan Reddy met PM Narendra Modi at his Delhi residence on Sunday. Reddy discussed issues of special category status to Andhra Pradesh and the state's financial situation, reports said. YSRCP won the Assembly polls in Andhra Pradesh, with victory in 151 of the 175 constituencies in the state.

headlines: Manjit Singh GK expelled from Shiromani Akali Dal
text: Former Delhi Sikh Gurdwara Management Committee president Manjit Singh GK was expelled from Shiromani Akali Dal, two days after he questioned the party's leadership over its performance in Punjab Lok Sabha polls. Rajya Sabha MP Balwinder Singh Bhunder said that the step was taken after the Delhi court recently directed to investigate corruption charges against Manjit.

headlines: Congress worker killed by suspected Naxals in Chhattisgarh
text: A local Congress worker was killed by suspected Naxals in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district, police said on Sunday. Sahdev Samrat was attacked with sharp-edged weapons on Saturday night when he went to attend a wedding. "It was not clear why he was killed as no Maoist pamphlet or note was recovered from the spot," police added.

headlines: CBI issues lookout notice against ex-Kolkata Police chief
text: CBI on Sunday issued a lookout notice against former Kolkata Police Commissioner Rajeev Kumar in connection with the Saradha chit fund scam case. The lookout notice prevents Kumar from leaving the country. This comes after Supreme Court dismissed his plea seeking an extension of his protection from arrest, which ended on Friday.

headlines: NHRC issues notice to Gujarat govt over Surat fire
text: National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) issued a notice to Gujarat government on Saturday, seeking a detailed report on the fire at a Surat coaching centre which claimed at least 22 lives. "Mere announcement of compensation...can not be a solution to such kind of hazards," NHRC said. It has asked the state government to submit the report within four weeks.

headlines: AirAsia not to take Jet's grounded Boeing 737 planes: Reports
text: Bengaluru-headquartered AirAsia India has reportedly dropped its plan to lease the grounded Boeing 737 planes of Jet Airways as it wants to continue with a single aircraft type. Induction of a new model was seen adding complications given the different seat configuration, maintenance and skill requirement, reports said. The airline is set to continue adding A320 planes to its fleet.

headlines: upGrad's Data Science program enables 200+ career transitions
text: upGrad's PG Diploma in Data Science, with IIIT-Bangalore, helps working professionals to transition to Data Science. "upGrad has been instrumental in helping us in finding candidates with key skill sets in Data Science and Analytics," says Val S, Director at Animaker. With 250+ hiring partners and faculty experts, upGrad's rigorous data science program makes upskilling in data science more accessible.

headlines: Maha Cong chief Chavan resigns after party wins 1 seat in state
text: Former Maharashtra CM Ashok Chavan on Saturday submitted his resignation from the post of Maharashtra Congress Committee President. Chavan said that Congress' defeat in the Lok Sabha elections was the collective responsibility of state heads and not that of party chief Rahul Gandhi alone. This comes after Congress won just one Lok Sabha seat in Maharashtra.

headlines: Priyanka introduced me to cricket, rooting for India at WC: Nick
text: Singer Nick Jonas, on being asked by a fan if his wife Priyanka Chopra introduced him to cricket, said, "Priyanka has introduced me to cricket, mostly her uncles." When asked which team he's supporting for the World Cup, Nick added, "I don't know about the team I support yet as I don't know much...But I'll be rooting for India."

headlines: Make me speak to him on phone: Kher's mom to actor as PM thanks her
text: Anupam Kher on Saturday shared a screenshot of PM Narendra Modi thanking his mother after the actor shared his mother's congratulatory video to the PM on the election results. "Mom is over the moon from the time I told her...Prime Minister @narendramodi has thanked her...But...she got over ambitious & said, 'Make me speak to him on the phone'," Kher wrote.

headlines: Will reconsider directing Akshay's film if I get respect: Director
text: Filmmaker Raghava Lawrence, who had earlier quit Akshay Kumar starrer 'Laxmmi Bomb' claiming that the film's first look poster was released without informing him, has said he will think about reconsidering his decision to step down if he is "given proper respect for [his] job". "The producers are coming to meet me. It's completely in their hands now," Raghava added.

headlines: Anurag Kashyap trolls Rahul, Mamata after resignations rejected
text: After Congress President Rahul Gandhi and West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's resignations were rejected by their respective political parties, Anurag Kashyap trolled them and tweeted, "We wanted to act dumb and believe it but our intelligence rejected it." The filmmaker further wrote, "I didn't want to tweet this but [twitterati] rejected my intention."

headlines: Kamal Nath offers to resign as MP Cong chief: Cong Gen Secy
text: Madhya Pradesh CM Kamal Nath on Saturday offered to resign from the post of Madhya Pradesh Congress Committee President, Congress General Secretary Dipak Babaria said. This comes after Congress won only one Lok Sabha seat in the state. Earlier, Uttar Pradesh Congress chief Raj Babbar and Odisha Congress chief Niranjan Patnaik resigned after the party's performance in their states.

headlines: Smriti Irani's close aide shot dead in Amethi 2 days after her win
text: Smriti Irani's close aide Surendra Singh has been shot dead by unknown assailants in Uttar Pradesh's Amethi two days after the BJP leader won the Lok Sabha constituency. Singh was former head of an Amethi village and was frequently seen with Irani during her campaign. He reportedly succumbed to his injuries while he was being taken to a hospital.

headlines: Do educated people talk like this: Afridi on Gambhir's remark
text: Ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi has criticised cricketer-turned-politician Gautam Gambhir over his remark that India shouldn't play against Pakistan in World Cup even if both the teams meet in the final. Terming Gambhir "bewakoof" (fool), Afridi said, "Do you think Gambhir used his wits? Does this look like something which a sensible person would say? Do educated people talk like this?"

headlines: Sprinter Hima Das secures first division in Assam class XII exam
text: India's first-ever athlete to win a track gold at world championships, sprinter Hima Das secured first division in Arts stream of the exams conducted by Assam Higher Secondary Education Council. Hima aggregated 349 marks out of 500. She scored 63 in English, 84 in Assamese, 60 in Advanced Assamese, 75 in Political Science, 67 in Education and 46 in Geography.

headlines: Abhishek uses Kohli's old Chelsea pic to troll him for pic with Kane
text: Actor Abhishek Bachchan, who is a Chelsea fan, trolled Team India captain Virat Kohli for his selfie with Tottenham forward Harry Kane by sharing a picture of Kohli holding Chelsea jersey. Kohli had himself posted an image with a Chelsea jersey on Facebook in 2014. Kohli had last year also posed with Southampton striker Danny Ings holding a Saints jersey.

headlines: 2 of my team members died in front of me: 20-year-old scales Everest
text: After scaling Mount Kilimanjaro, a 20-year-old man from Telangana has now reached the peak of Mount Everest. "I started my journey on April 6 and two of my team members died in front of me due to bad weather, but it didn't stop me," Amgoth Tukaram said. "My aim is to climb seven highest peaks in seven continents," he added.

headlines: Blame should rest with some US politicians, not firms: Huawei CEO
text: Huawei Founder and CEO Ren Zhengfei, commenting on US President Donald Trump's administration blacklisting the Chinese firm, said, "We shouldn't blame US companies...the blame should rest with some US politicians". "US companies must abide by the laws and so must the real economy," Zhengfei added. The world's second-largest smartphone manufacturer was banned in US over alleged espionage concerns.

headlines: 2020 iPhones may have full-screen Touch ID: Report
text: Apple's 2020 iPhones may feature full-screen in-display Touch ID fingerprint authentication system that uses acoustic waves, MacRumors reported. The 2020 iPhones will also feature 5G network technology and 3D sensing through the rear camera system, the report added. Notably, Apple removed the fingerprint authentication system altogether starting from its iPhone X model and up.

headlines: Elon Musk trolls Audi over e-tron car as it means 'shit' in French
text: Tesla Co-founder and CEO Elon Musk trolled German luxury automaker Audi over its first full-electrical car model, 2019 Audi e-tron, after a Twitter user noted, "In French Ã©tron literally means shit." Retweeting the comment, the billionaire entrepreneur wrote, "'Stop sending me this Ã©tron' - Audi." Musk had retweeted a video of the e-tron SUV shared by Audi, saying, "Great ad."

headlines: Newly elected MP to donate his 5-yr salary to Cyclone Fani victims
text: BJD's Pinaki Misra who was elected as an MP from Odisha's Puri after he defeated BJP's Sambit Patra in the Lok Sabha elections has said he will donate his salary for the next 5 years to Cyclone Fani victims. Earlier, Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik donated one year's salary to the Chief Minister's relief fund in the wake of the cyclone.

headlines: I wanted to give up: Woman found 17 days after being lost in forest
text: Amanda Eller, a 35-year-old US yoga instructor who went missing more than two weeks ago on a hike in a Hawaii forest was found alive on Friday. "I wanted to give up. But the only option I had was life or death," said Amanda. She survived 17 days by sleeping in a boar's den and eating wild fruit and moths.

headlines: Video shows 83-year-old performing CPR on 96-year-old in China
text: A video showing an 83-year-old man performing CPR on a 96-year-old man suffering a heart attack in China's Zhejiang has surfaced online. A relative of the patient came to thank the man, who is a retired doctor, at his home. Reacting to the video, a Twitter user wrote, "Need more people like him to make the world a better place."

headlines: Mamata's offer to quit as CM nothing but drama: Vijayvargiya
text: BJP General Secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya on Saturday said that Trinamool Congress (TMC) chief and West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's offer to quit as CM is nothing but drama to garner sympathy. "It's good that at least she has accepted defeat," he added. Vijayvargiya further claimed that Mamata's government will fall on its own and BJP won't need to topple it.

headlines: Minorities misled by deceit, we've to gain their trust: PM Modi
text: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday while talking about the minority communities said there'll be no discrimination against anyone and gave a new slogan of "trust towards all". "(Minorities) were kept in illusion, climate of fear and insecurity," he added. "For the sake of vote bank politics, they were kept away from everything...We've to gain their trust," PM Modi further said.

headlines: Change with the times, shun VIP culture: PM Modi to MPs
text: Addressing newly-elected MPs of NDA, PM Narendra Modi on Saturday asked them to change with times and shun VIP culture. "Why shouldn't we stand in line for an airport security check? There's nothing wrong in it," he added. PM Modi further asked them to avoid giving media statements merely for publicity as these statements often cause trouble for the party.

headlines: Over 700 stranded in relief camps in Tripura due to rains
text: At least 739 people lost their homes and took shelter in relief camps across Tripura due to heavy rain and thunderstorms since Friday. As per reports, over 1,000 houses were damaged due to heavy rainfall. Also, a total of 40 rescue boats were pressed into service to evacuate people from affected areas.

headlines: A Hindu cannot be 'kattar': RSS leader Manmohan Vaidya
text: RSS leader Manmohan Vaidya on Saturday said, "A Hindu cannot be kattar, because a Hindu can never be fundamentalist." Claiming that the word 'kattar' comes from the English word fundamentalist, he added that some people use it without thinking. Vaidya further said that terms like 'Hindu fundamentalist' were coined by "those opposing Hindutva and forces working to break the nation".

headlines: Teen falls to death during parasailing in Maha's Murud beach
text: A 15-year-old boy was killed and his father was injured in a parasailing accident in Maharashtra's Murud beach on Saturday, police said. Assistant police inspector Kishore Sali said that the accident occurred after the victim accidentally rolled up the parachute instead of opening it. He added that police have booked the parasail operator for negligence which led to the death.

headlines: President Kovind appoints Modi as PM, swearing-in likely on May 30
text: NDA leader Narendra Modi met President Ram Nath Kovind today and staked claim to form new government. President Ram Nath Kovind appointed Modi to the office of Prime Minister and asked him to advise about the names of others to be appointed members of the Union Council of Ministers. The swearing-in ceremony is likely to take place on May 30.

headlines: Our Indian man owns it totally: Taapsee on WC captains' group pic
text: After the official Twitter account of 2019 World Cup shared a picture of all the 10 captains, actress Taapsee Pannu tweeted, "This is such a cool picture! Needless to say our Indian Man owns it totally! Captain with swag." "Kohli posing like a king, with World Cup at his feet. Hope it becomes a reality soon!" a user wrote.

headlines: Muslim family in UP names newborn son 'Narendra Modi'
text: A Muslim family in UP named their newborn son after PM Narendra Modi to commemorate his Lok Sabha election victory. "After he was born his mother called his father in Dubai, who asked whether PM Modi's leading. He then asked to name his son Narendra Modi," infant's grandfather said. The child was born on May 23, when results were announced.

headlines: Get off you cheat: England fans boo Warner, Smith at warm-up match
text: English fans booed David Warner and Steve Smith during Australia-England World Cup warm-up match on Saturday. When Warner was going towards the crease, one of the fans shouted, "Get off Warner you cheat." Fans were heard chanting, "cheat, cheat, cheat" when Smith came to bat. Warner and Smith are playing in England for the first time since the ball-tampering scandal.

headlines: India all out for 179 in 1st WC warm-up match, NZ win by 6 wickets
text: New Zealand chased down the 180-run target with 77 balls remaining to hand India a six-wicket defeat in their first 2019 World Cup warm-up match today. All-rounder Ravindra Jadeja top-scored for India with 54 runs off 50 deliveries, while 2015 World Cup's joint-highest wicket-taker Trent Boult took 4/33. Kane Williamson and Ross Taylor scored fifties to take New Zealand home.

headlines: Goyal predicted in 2018 that BJP would win 303 LS seats on its own
text: BJP leader and Union Minister Piyush Goyal, during ET Awards 2018, had predicted that BJP will win 303 seats on its own in 2019 Lok Sabha elections. "The BJP looks to be between 297 and 303 seats by itself in 2019," he had said. Notably, BJP won 303 seats in 17th Lok Sabha elections, 21 more than their 2014 tally.

headlines: Shankar cleared of fracture, set to be fit for India's WC opener
text: Team India all-rounder Vijay Shankar's scans have revealed that he has not suffered any fracture after sustaining an injury on his forearm during practice. The all-rounder is likely to feature in India's warm-up match against Bangladesh on May 28. India will face South Africa in their 2019 World Cup opener on June 5.

headlines: Manoj Tiwari meets Sheila Dikshit after beating her by 3.6L votes
text: Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari met Delhi Congress chief Sheila Dikshit and sought her blessings after defeating her by 3.6 lakh votes in the North East Delhi Lok Sabha constituency. "The two leaders acknowledged that political rivals can have friendly and harmonious relations and Tiwari told Dikshit he treated her like his mother," Delhi BJP media co-convener Neelkant Bakshi said.

headlines: Spirit of cricket: ICC on Kohli shaking hands with Pak's Sarfaraz
text: The ICC took to Twitter to share a picture of Team India captain Virat Kohli shaking hands with Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed and captioned it, "Spirit of Cricket". The picture was from the captain's meet before the beginning of the warm-up matches ahead of the 2019 World Cup. "For us, it's just another game," Kohli said about India-Pakistan clash.

headlines: Nike says it will end financial penalties for pregnant athletes
text: American sportswear giant Nike said the company will waive performance-based targets for 12 months for any of their pregnant athletes. Sponsorship agreements with athletes typically include clauses that reduce payments if they do not meet specific performance thresholds. Nike's decision comes after several current and former Nike-sponsored runners revealed they had their payments frozen.

headlines: I was stressed, took me a week to get over Nidahas final: Shankar
text: Recalling Nidahas Trophy 2018 final wherein he missed four straight deliveries in the 18th over and was trolled for it, all-rounder Vijay Shankar said it was quite embarrassing for him. He added he was under a lot of stress and couldn't sleep for a few days. It took me a week to come out of that, he stated.

headlines: I used sunscreen, trousers' zip, mints for ball tampering: Panesar
text: Spinner Monty Panesar has revealed when he came into the England side, he was asked by pacers to prepare the ball for them. He said he'd use sunscreen and mint to tamper with the ball. He also revealed he used his trousers' zip to tamper, adding, "That was probably a hairline fracture of the spirit of the game."

headlines: India-born footballer to give up UK passport for India selection
text: Jalandhar-born Tanvie Hans, a former Tottenham Hotspur and Fulham women's team footballer, is looking to give up her British passport for possible India selection. The 28-year-old said she went to England to develop her skills given there's a league for every level. "With Indian citizenship, I'll be able to play more here," said Hans, currently playing for Bangalore United FC.

headlines: Don't hate Modi govt, Chetan Bhagat tells Kunal Kamra; he responds
text: Addressing comedian Kunal Kamra and YouTuber Dhruv Rathee, Chetan Bhagat tweeted, "The best thing you can do to help our democracy is not hate Modi govt, but force opposition to change." Kamra responded, "I don't agree with you...I don't admire your work", while Rathee said Opposition must prepare a new PM face and let Rahul Gandhi resign as Congress President.

headlines: 2 Assam Rifles jawans martyred, 4 hurt in Nagaland militant ambush
text: Two Assam Rifles personnel were martyred and four were injured when a truck they were travelling in was ambushed by militants in Nagaland's Mon district on Saturday. The convoy encountered an IED explosion followed by an exchange of gunfire between security personnel and the militants. The party was travelling to relieve another party involved in operations on the Myanmar border.

headlines: Man unzips pants after air hostess asks him not to smoke on plane
text: A 24-year-old Kerala man unzipped his pants in front of a female cabin crew member who tried to stop him from smoking on the plane. The accused Abdul Shahid Shamsudeen was travelling from Jeddah to Delhi on a Saudi Arabian Airlines flight when he attempted to smoke. He also verbally abused the crew member and made obscene gestures at her.

headlines: 26-week pregnant 16-year-old moves High Court seeking abortion
text: A 16-year-old girl has moved a plea in the Rajasthan High Court seeking to abort her 26-week foetus. Hearing the plea, the HC directed the state government to form a medical board to give opinion that allowing the victim to terminate her pregnancy will be dangerous to her life or not. Medical board has to submit its report by Monday.

headlines: Unequal ticket distribution led to defeat: Bihar Cong chief
text: Bihar Congress chief Kaukab Qadri on Saturday said unequal ticket distribution among allies was the reason for Congress-RJD alliance's defeat in the state. "We weren't given tickets to contest from...where Congress has had a strong support base for long," he added. While the Congress party won one seat, RJD failed to win any seat in the 2019 Lok Sabha elections.

headlines: Kohli calls Jofra Archer England's 'X-Factor' at World Cup
text: Speaking about England pacer Jofra Archer, Indian captain Virat Kohli said, "He has the X-Factor and bowls a skill set that is very different from everyone." "He (Archer) is a world-class bowler and there's a good reason why he's been fast-tracked into playing for England at the World Cup," Kohli added about the Rajasthan Royals pacer.

headlines: Archer, Wood suffer injury scares in warm-up match vs Aus
text: English pacers Jofra Archer and Mark Wood suffered injury scares in the side's warm-up match against Australia on Saturday. Wood pulled up midway through his fourth over and headed to the pavilion after experiencing discomfort in his run-up. Archer was sent as Wood's replacement but later left the field after he seemingly injuring himself while fielding at the deep.

headlines: Mumbai players call for DRS technology in Ranji Trophy
text: Senior Mumbai players including Suryakumar Yadav and Aditya Tare have called for the introduction of DRS in Ranji Trophy. "[I]t is the need of the hour. If you have the technology, you might as well use it," Tare said. "[I]n domestic cricket there are lots of decisions that can sometimes go against you because of umpiring errors," Tare added.

headlines: Instagram's IGTV to now support landscape videos too
text: Facebook-owned Instagram has announced its vertical video platform IGTV will now also support videos in landscape mode. It said landscape offers help to videos featuring a handful of people in a single frame. "Opening IGTV to more than just vertical videos is similar to when we opened Instagram to more than just square photos in 2015," the photo-sharing platform added.

headlines: Tesla set to make record Q2 deliveries: CEO Musk in leaked email
text: Tesla is set to deliver a record number of cars in the second quarter as per its billionaire Co-founder and CEO Elon Musk's leaked email, Reuters reported. Tesla had delivered its record 90,700 cars in last quarter of 2018. However, it had reported a 31% fall in first-quarter deliveries and warned profit would be delayed until second half of 2019.

headlines: Drought situation in Maharashtra very serious: Sharad Pawar
text: Nationalist Congress Party President Sharad Pawar on Saturday took cognizance of Maharashtra's drought situation and said it was "very serious". "Meteorological department has predicted a delay in monsoon, so people should be ready for proper water management," he added. Last year in October, the Maharashtra government announced drought in over 150 of 358 tehsils following a bad monsoon.

headlines: Told party I want to quit as CM, they rejected: Mamata Banerjee
text: After BJP won 18 out of the 42 constituencies in West Bengal in 17th Lok Sabha elections, CM Mamata Banerjee said she told her party that she doesn't want to continue as CM, but the party rejected her resignation. "Election Commission had taken over state administration for last five months," she added. "I believe EVM setting was done," she alleged.

headlines: Jet Airways founder, wife offloaded; stopped from leaving India
text: Jet Airways founder Naresh Goyal and his wife Anita were stopped from leaving the country by immigration authorities at Mumbai airport. They were offloaded from a Dubai-bound Emirates flight, which was called back after it had reached the taxiway in Mumbai airport. Both of them had quit Jet board in March, nearly a month before the airline suspended operations indefinitely.

headlines: 25-yr-old mechanical engineer Chandrani to become youngest MP ever
text: BJD's Chandrani Murmu, a 25-year-old mechanical engineer who won Odisha's reserved Keonjhar seat by defeating two-time BJP MP Ananta Nayak, will become the youngest member in Lok Sabha history. Chandrani won the seat by 66,203 votes. She will replace JJP founder Dushyant Chautala, who had become the youngest parliamentarian at 26 after being elected to 16th Lok Sabha from Hisar.

headlines: NDA elects Narendra Modi as its leader for 2nd time in a row
text: The BJP-led NDA has elected Narendra Modi as its leader for the second time in a row at NDA parliamentary board meeting today. Modi will meet President Ram Nath Kovind later today to stake claim to form government. "I thank all allies and MPs who unanimously chose NDA leader Narendra Modi as the new PM," said BJP President Amit Shah.

headlines: Mughal descendant congratulates PM Modi, says 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai'
text: Prince Yakub Habeebuddin Tucy, a self-proclaimed descendant of last Mughal Emperor Bahadur Shah Zafar, wrote a letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi to congratulate him over the victory in the Lok Sabha elections. He also expressed his willingness to work under PM Modi in the service of the nation. He ended the letter with the slogan 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai'.

headlines: Old selfie of ex-Cong worker who now defeated Scindia goes viral
text: An old selfie of former Congress worker KP Yadav showing Jyotiraditya Scindia has gone viral after Yadav defeated the four-time Guna MP with a BJP ticket. Yadav, a former aide of Scindia, had joined BJP after being denied a Congress ticket for 2018 Madhya Pradesh Assembly by-polls. Since 1957, Scindia family had never lost an election it contested from Guna.

headlines: Vijay Shankar responds to Ambati Rayudu's '3D' tweet on WC selection
text: All-rounder Vijay Shankar, who is part of India's 15-member squad for World Cup, has responded to Ambati Rayudu's 'Just ordered a new set of 3D glasses to watch the World Cup' tweet. "I know how a cricketer would feel if he is not picked. He didn't mean anything bad. He just tweeted for the sake of it," Shankar said.

headlines: England coach fields as player gets injured in WC warm-up match
text: England's assistant coach Paul Collingwood came on as a substitute fielder during his team's World Cup warm-up match against Australia on Saturday. The 42-year-old replaced Jofra Archer, who had come on the field after fast bowler Mark Wood got injured while bowling. Collingwood, who had last played an ODI for England in 2011, retired from county cricket in 2018.

headlines: Huawei banned from using SD cards in all future devices
text: The SD Association has barred the world's second-largest smartphone manufacturer Huawei, effectively banning it from using official SD or microSD card support in all future devices. Huawei has said its customers will be able to purchase and use SD and microSD cards with its products for time being. This comes over US' ban on China's Huawei over alleged espionage concerns.

headlines: God punished Chandrababu Naidu for his misdeeds: Jagan Reddy
text: YSR Congress Party (YSRCP) President Jagan Mohan Reddy said that "God punished" TDP chief N Chandrababu Naidu "for his misdeeds", referring to his defeat in the Assembly elections in Andhra Pradesh. Jagan claimed that Naidu had "purchased" 23 YSRCP MLAs after the elections in 2014. "Now TDP got only 23 seats...God has written a beautiful script with 23," he added.

headlines: Naveen Patnaik to be sworn in as Odisha Chief Minister on May 29
text: Biju Janata Dal (BJD) chief Naveen Patnaik will be sworn in as Odisha Chief Minister on May 29 for a fifth consecutive term. The BJD won 112 of the 146 Assembly seats for which elections were held. The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) won 23 seats, Congress bagged nine seats, the CPI(M) one and an Independent candidate was also elected.

headlines: NASA exec quits weeks after getting to lead 2024 Moon landing plan
text: NASA executive Mark Sirangelo has quit around six weeks after being hired to lead the US' 2024 Moon landing's strategy. Sirangelo was named as Special Assistant to NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine. His departure came after US lawmakers rejected NASA's proposal for a separate department within the agency to oversee future lunar missions and ultimately develop a human exploration of Mars.

headlines: If US commits stupidity, will sink their warships: Iran
text: Amid the military build-up by both the countries due to tensions in the Gulf, Iran has warned that it will sink US warships in the region using missiles or new secret weapons if it "commits the slightest stupidity". The US has also sent an aircraft carrier and bombers to the region citing the threat of an attack by Iran.

headlines: India, Japan may build container terminal at Colombo port
