text: India and Japan are in advanced talks with Sri Lanka to build a container terminal at the port in Colombo, a Sri Lankan official said. The terminal would come up next to a Chinese terminal built as part of the Belt and Road Initiative. Sri Lanka will control 51% of the project with India and Japan jointly controlling the rest.

headlines: Reverse swing shouldnÂ’t decide this World Cup: NZ's Elliott
text: After witnessing reverse swing in the Afghanistan-Pakistan warm-up match, former New Zealand cricketer Grant Elliott tweeted, "Reverse swing shouldn't decide this World Cup. Pace and spin yes, but not reverse swing". "With 2 new balls it should not reverse swing after 25 overs. If it does the ball should be replaced by the umpires," read the rest of Elliott's tweet.

headlines: Victory of 'Modivaad' over dynasty, terrorism: Shivraj Singh
text: BJP's Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Saturday credited PM Narendra Modi for BJP's victory in Lok Sabha elections and said it's a victory of "Modivaad" over "dynasty, casteism, terrorism and hooliganism". "There was a Modi wave which favoured BJP," Chouhan added. BJP-led NDA won 352 seats in the elections and will form government at the Centre for a second consecutive term.

headlines: Violence expected in WB areas where BJP won: BJP leader
text: BJP's Roopa Ganguly on Saturday warned that violence may erupt in parts of West Bengal where her party has got more votes compared to Trinamool Congress (TMC) in the Lok Sabha elections. "Police is also with the state government. I'm only concerned about the security of the people there," she said. "Politics in West Bengal is very dirty," Ganguly added.

headlines: Still thinking about Liverpool: Messi on winning golden shoe
text: Speaking about the European Golden Shoe award, Barcelona's Lionel Messi said, "Honestly I am not even thinking about the European Golden Shoe. What happened at Liverpool is in my head." "Like I said it was a big blow and I am not thinking about personal things, just getting to this Copa final and winning another trophy," Messi said.

headlines: Spanish police detain 23 before Copa del Rey final
text: Spanish police have detained 23 people following incidents in the southern city of Seville ahead of the Copa del Rey final between Barcelona and Valencia. Local media reported that the people detained belong to the 'Boixos Nois', a group of 'ultra supporters' of FC Barcelona. Notably, five police personnel reportedly suffered injuries.

headlines: Customers sue Apple, claim private iTunes data being sold
text: Three US customers have sued Apple claiming it's unlawfully disclosing and selling people's iTunes purchase information and personal data. The lawsuit called the claims as contrary to Apple's 'What happens on your iPhone, stays on your iPhone' advertising. They are seeking $5,000 for each iTunes customer in Michigan whose information was disclosed and $250 for each one in Rhode Island.

headlines: Want to make PMO efficient rather than effective: PM Modi
text: PM Narendra Modi on Friday interacted with Prime Minister's Office (PMO) staff and thanked them for their support. "My thoughts are to make PMO efficient rather than effective, as efficiency speeds up the work process and improves quality," he said. "The whole world thinks a PM is successful but without a team, good results can't be obtained," PM Modi added.

headlines: TMC will be finished in assembly polls: BJP's Saumitra Khan
text: After BJP got 18 seats in West Bengal in the Lok Sabha election, 16 seats more than 2014 polls, BJP's Saumitra Khan asserted that Trinamool Congress (TMC) will be "finished in state assembly elections". "They'll only be able to get as less as 60 seats out of 295," Khan said. Assembly elections in West Bengal will take place in 2021.

headlines: Russia ordered by UN tribunal to release 24 Ukrainian sailors
text: Russia must immediately release three Ukrainian naval vessels and free the 24 sailors it detained last year, the International Tribunal for the Law of the Sea (ITLOS) said. Russia had detained the sailors claiming they illegally entered its territorial waters. It has refused to recognise the jurisdiction of ITLOS, the body established by the UN to settle maritime disputes.

headlines: UP faces by-polls on 11 assembly seats as 11 MLAs win LS elections
text: A total of 11 MLAs have been elected to the Lok Sabha from Uttar Pradesh, following which by-elections are expected to be held in their assembly constituencies. From BJP, three UP ministers including Rita Bahuguna Joshi and six MLAs have won. SP MLA Azam Khan won from Rampur LS seat while BSP MLA Ritesh Pandey would also vacate his seat.

headlines: We need Rahul as President: Congress on rejecting his resignation
text: Congress spokesperson Randeep Surjewala, during a press conference, said that Rahul Gandhi offered his resignation as party president but it was rejected unanimously by the Congress Working Committee (CWC) members. The CWC said that the party needs his leadership and guidance in these "challenging times". The committee has authorised Rahul Gandhi to restructure the party, Surjewala added.

headlines: It was disheartening, unnecessary: Hina on Chandivali remark
text: Speaking about Filmfare Editor Jitesh Pillai's remark following her debut appearance at Cannes Film Festival, TV actress Hina Khan said, "Coming from somebody sitting at such a huge position, it was disheartening." "I did feel that it was not necessary," the actress added. Pillai earlier shared a picture of Hina at Cannes and wrote, "Cannes has become Chandivali studios kya?"

headlines: I'd campaign for Atishi, Kanhaiya even if they were losing: Swara
text: Swara Bhasker, who campaigned for six politicians including CPI's Kanhaiya Kumar in Begusarai, AAP's Atishi in Delhi and Congress' Digvijaya Singh in Bhopal tweeted, "I'd campaign all over again for these candidates, even if I knew in advance that they'd lose." "They represent the true spirit of democracy, the values of (our) constitution and the fight against hate," Swara added.

headlines: I don't agree: Mamata shares poem as BJP wins 18 seats in WB
text: A day after TMC won 22 seats and BJP won 18 seats in West Bengal, Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee shared a poem titled 'I Do Not Agree'. The poem read, "The colour of communalism, I do not believe in... I am a humble servant of the gentle renaissance raised in Bengal. I don't believe in selling religious aggression."

headlines: Congress worker shaves head after losing bet to BJP worker
text: Congress worker BL Sen shaved his head after losing a bet to a BJP worker in Madhya Pradesh's Rajgarh. "We had a bet that if Narendra Modi becomes Prime Minister (again), I'll shave my head and if Rahul Gandhi becomes PM, he (BJP worker) will shave his head. Now that my party has lost, I shaved my head," said Sen.

headlines: NOTA performs better than 159 of 229 candidates in J'khand LS polls
text: Ballot option NOTA (None Of The Above) performed better than 159 out of total 229 candidates that contested from 14 Lok Sabha constituencies in Jharkhand. A total of 1,49,62,473 votes were cast in state, of which 1,89,367 votes went to NOTA option, which amounts to around 1.27% vote share. Koderma seat registered the highest NOTA votes of 31,164.

headlines: How much vote share jump did BJP and Congress witness in LS polls?
text: The BJP's vote share in 17th Lok Sabha elections jumped to 37.5% from 31.34% in 2014, while Congress' vote share jumped from 19.3% to 19.6%. The total number of votes for BJP rose by over 5.8 crore from 17.1 crore in 2014, whereas Congress got 11.86 crore votes this year as compared to 10.69 crore in last Lok Sabha elections.

headlines: My victory shows that caste politics is now over: Ravi Kishan
text: BJP leader Ravi Kishan, who won the Lok Sabha elections from Gorakhpur seat, on Friday called his victory "reflective of the fact that from now onwards caste-based politics is over." He added, "I also thank Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath, BJP President Amit Shah and Prime Minister Narendra Modi for their belief in me."

headlines: BJP ally AIADMK's only MP from Tamil Nadu is Deputy CM's son
text: Tamil Nadu Deputy Chief Minister O Panneerselvam's son Raveendranath Kumar, who won the Theni Lok Sabha constituency, is the sole winner from BJP ally All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK). Raveendranath defeated Congress' EVKS Elangovan by a margin of 76,693 votes. In the 2014 Lok Sabha polls, the party won 37 of the 39 seats in the state.

headlines: Houses vandalised, party offices captured in WB after LS results
text: Several incidents of violence, including clashes between TMC and BJP activists, were reported from several districts in West Bengal, said the police on Friday. Incidents of houses being vandalised and party offices being captured were reported in Cooch Behar's Tufanganj and Mathabhanga. Meanwhile, a police officer said, "Sporadic incidents have been reported... but nothing major occurred."

headlines: Indian Army officer appointed head of UN Mission in South Sudan
text: Lieutenant General Shailesh Tinaikar has been appointed as the new Force Commander of the United Nations Mission in South Sudan (UNMISS) by UN Secretary-General AntÃ³nio Guterres. He served in the UN Angola Verification Mission III from 1996 to 1997, and in the UN Mission in Sudan from 2008 to 2009. Lieutenant General Tinaikar is currently Commandant of The Infantry School.

headlines: Fire engines took 45 min to travel 2km: Survivor's dad on Surat fire
text: The father of a girl rescued from the Surat coaching centre that caught fire on Friday said the fire brigade took almost 45 minutes to reach the spot from the fire station, which is around 2 km away. "Even though my daughter got saved, she is in a state of trauma," he added. The fire claimed lives of 20 people.

headlines: Spoke about family, friends, future: Anil on meeting Danny Boyle
text: Actor Anil Kapoor took to Twitter to share a picture with filmmaker Danny Boyle, and wrote, "Catching up with Danny Boyle in London!" "We spoke about family, friends & the future...Conversations with him are always so insightful!" the actor's tweet further read. Anil featured in Boyle's 2009 Oscar-winning film 'Slumdog Millionaire'.

headlines: Congress has to reinvent itself or it's over: BJD's Pinaki
text: BJD MP Pinaki Misra, who won Puri constituency against BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra, on Saturday said, "The Congress will have to reinvent itself, otherwise Congress, like the left movement, is over." Misra added, "I think Rahul Gandhi led an absolutely negative campaign. The people simply were not convinced with the Congress narrative this time."

headlines: IÂ’ll be there whenever Kohli needs help: Rohit Sharma
text: Speaking about captain Virat Kohli and his own role as the vice-captain, Rohit Sharma said, "I will be there to play my part whenever he needs my help." "I'm happy to play a part in that space. Whatever matters for the team is priority No. 1. I'll be happy to do whatever is asked of me," Sharma added.

headlines: Messi finishes as Europe's top scorer for 3rd straight year
text: Barcelona's Argentine forward Lionel Messi has become the first player to win Europe's Golden Shoe award for three straight years. Messi scored 36 times for Barcelona, while PSG's French forward Kylian Mbappe ended at the second spot after finishing the campaign on 33 goals. Messi's Barcelona is set to face Valencia in the final of the Copa del Rey.

headlines: Apple buys US asthma-monitoring startup for children: Report
text: Apple has reportedly acquired US-based startup for asthma-monitoring in children, Tueo Health, for an undisclosed amount. Tueo COO Anura Patil and CEO Bronwyn Harris changed their employers from Tueo to Apple in late 2018 on LinkedIn, the report revealed. Notably, Apple CEO Tim Cook had said earlier this month that the technology giant buys a company every few weeks.

headlines: Instagram denies private data leak of 4.9 crore influencers
text: After an initial investigation into reports that about 4.9 crore Instagram influencers' and celebrities' data was leaked by Mumbai-based social media marketing firm Chtrbox, Instagram denied the same. "We found that no private emails or phone numbers of Instagram users were accessed," the platform said. Chtrbox had also said exposed data had contained only publicly-accessible information.

headlines: India made 2nd-most govt requests for private user data: FB
text: The Indian government made the second-highest requests to get access to users' private data after the US in the second half of 2018, Facebook revealed in its latest Transparency Report. Facebook was asked to provide data for 20,805 users, including 861 emergency requests, by the government. The social networking giant said it provided some data in 53% of the cases.

headlines: BJP is celestial nymph, my MLAs are Vishwamitra: JD(S) leader
text: Karnataka JD(S) chief AH Vishwanath on Friday likened BJP to a celestial nymph and JD(S) MLAs to 'Vishwamitra'. "I assure you, all my MLAs are Vishwamitra, who would not fall for the charms of a celestial nymph. The celestial nymph is BJP," he said. "[BJP] has failed in their attempts to destabilise the government on many occasions," Vishwanath claimed.

headlines: Rahul offers to quit as Cong chief; resignation rejected: Reports
text: Rahul Gandhi reportedly offered to quit as Congress President during Congress Working Committee meeting on Saturday over the party's performance in the 17th Lok Sabha elections but his resignation was rejected. Rahul Gandhi, who contested the elections from two Lok Sabha constituencies, lost from UP's Amethi and won from Kerala's Wayanad. The Congress has secured 52 seats in the elections.

headlines: Owner of Surat coaching centre where fire killed 20 arrested
text: Bhargav Bhutani, the owner of the Surat coaching centre where a fire killed at least 20 people has been arrested. Surat police had filed an FIR against three people including builders of the complex and the owner of the coaching centre. "The fire started near the staircase, so they could not get down," senior police officials had said.

headlines: Priyanka can help promote Bharat as she liked script: Salman
text: While speaking about his upcoming film 'Bharat', Salman Khan said, "[Priyanka] isn't there in the film but she can help in the promotion of the film because...she...loved the script." Katrina Kaif earlier replaced Priyanka in 'Bharat' after the actress quit the film due to her wedding with Nick Jonas. The film is slated to release on June 5.

headlines: Grief beyond expression: Big B on Surat coaching centre fire
text: Following the fire at a coaching centre in Gujarat's Surat in which as many as 20 people were killed, Amitabh Bachchan tweeted, "Grief beyond expression...prayers." "We really need to be more diligent about our security and safety rules and conditions," wrote Bhumi Pednekar. "Deeply shocked and saddened to hear about the Surat fire tragedy," Shraddha Kapoor wrote in a tweet.

headlines: Lovely to see old friends: Rishi on pic with Anil, Tina Ambani
text: Reliance Group Chairman Anil Ambani and his wife Tina Ambani recently visited actor Rishi Kapoor, who is undergoing treatment for cancer in New York. Sharing a picture with the couple, Rishi tweeted, "How lovely to see my old friends." Earlier, Anil's brother and India's richest person Mukesh Ambani and his wife Nita had also visited Rishi in New York.

headlines: Faced defeat twice as ex-PM, LS defeat not big issue: Deve Gowda
text: After losing Karnataka's Tumkur constituency by 13,339 votes, former PM HD Deve Gowda said, "As a former PM, I have been defeated twice. This is not a big issue." Stating that he will take responsibility and proceed forward, Gowda added, "I am not going to blame anybody for the loss. How it happened is not to be discussed in media."

headlines: Can't write off Congress from Delhi's politics: Sheila Dikshit
text: After Congress lost all seven Lok Sabha seats in Delhi by more than two lakh votes each, its Delhi chief Sheila Dikshit said there is "no chance of writing off Congress from Delhi's politics". However, she added, "The margins of loss have been very huge, which means something did not work. We will see what needs to be corrected."

headlines: Uber's 1st employee resigns from board after becoming billionaire
text: Uber's first employee and one-time chief executive Ryan Graves will step down from the company's board of directors, Uber said on Friday. Graves, who turned billionaire after Uber's recent IPO, was hired through a tweet. He is no longer working at Uber but had remained on the board.

headlines: Muslim couple beaten up over suspicion of carrying beef in MP
text: A Muslim couple was beaten up by a group of men in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni district over suspicion of carrying beef. A video of the incident shows two accused men holding the man against a tree while two other hit him with a stick. Meanwhile, a man could be seen hitting the woman with slippers on her head.

headlines: BSF jawan shoots self with rifle inside bus in Tripura
text: An Assistant Sub Inspector of BSF committed suicide inside a bus by shooting himself with a rifle in Tripura on Friday. The deceased, 50-year-old Ashwini Kumar of 86 battalion, was originally from Jammu and Kashmir but had come to Pancharatan in Dhalai district for some election work. Ashwini was carried to a hospital but was declared brought dead.

headlines: Bullet-ridden bodies of 3 missing kids found floating in UP well
text: Bullet-ridden bodies of three children, who went missing from Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr on Friday, have been found floating in a well. A senior official said that police didn't take immediate action when the children's parents filed a missing report. A constable and an SHO have been suspended over inaction and four teams have been formed to work on the case.

headlines: 8 spoons, 2 toothbrushes, 1 knife removed from man's stomach
text: Doctors removed 8 spoons, 2 screwdrivers, 2 toothbrushes and 1 kitchen knife from the stomach of a 35-year-old man at a hospital in Himachal Pradesh's Mandi. Stating that the man is stable now, doctors said, "Our team of surgeons immediately operated him. The patient is affected with psychiatric illness as a normal person can't eat spoon or knife."

headlines: US man who attacked Sikh told to attend Sikh parade as punishment
text: A US man has been ordered to attend an annual Sikh parade and report to the court what he learned about Sikhism, as part of his sentence for attacking a Sikh man earlier this year. Andrew Ramsey had assaulted Harwinder Singh Dodd after he refused to sell him cigarettes without an ID. Ramsey was sentenced to 180 days in jail.

headlines: Trump bypasses US Congress to sell $8-billion arms to Saudi, UAE
text: US President Donald Trump, declaring a national emergency because of tensions with Iran, bypassed Congress on Friday to complete the sale of over $8 billion worth of weapons to Saudi, the UAE and Jordan. Members of Congress had been blocking sales of military equipment to Saudi and the UAE because of huge civilian toll from their air campaign in Yemen.

headlines: US woman watches execution of man who raped her at the age of 17
text: A US woman watched the execution of a man who raped her for over 26 hours at the age of 17. Bobby Joe Long, who kidnapped Lisa McVey Noland in November 1984 as she rode her bicycle home from a shop, blindfolded and repeatedly raped her. After his arrest, Long confessed to killing 10 women and raping several others.

headlines: 'Sonic The Hedgehog' release postponed after character design row
text: The release date of the animated film 'Sonic The Hedgehog' was postponed after the design of the lead character was widely criticised online following the release of the film's trailer. "Taking a little more time to make Sonic just right," director Jeff Fowler tweeted. The film is based on a video game of the same name, which released in 1991.

headlines: Salman isn't doing cameo in Prabhas, Shraddha's 'Saaho': Director
text: Director Sujeeth has denied reports that suggested actor Salman Khan would feature in his upcoming film 'Saaho', which will see 'Bahubali' actor Prabhas and Shraddha Kapoor in lead roles. "I donÂ’t know where the news came from," the director said. The film will also feature Neil Nitin Mukesh, Mandira Bedi, Jackie Shroff and Chunky Panday, among others.

headlines: I don't have any friends in B'wood other than Tiger: Disha
text: While speaking about her rumoured boyfriend Tiger Shroff, Disha Patani said, "He's my best friend...Besides him, I don't have any pals in the film industry." "Both of us are hardworking...He never gives up, he's so intense. I admire that about Tiger," she added. Disha further said that she is more "chilled out" than Tiger.

headlines: Manmarziyaan was liberating experience for me as actor: Vicky
text: While speaking about his 2018 film 'Manmarziyaan', actor Vicky Kaushal said, "'Manmarziyaan' has been one of the most liberating experiences for me as an actor." "I believe the character...to be my alter ego and to completely surrender to that character...was one of the most learning experiences for me," he added. The film also featured Taapsee Pannu and Abhishek Bachchan.

headlines: My kids turned my 40s around: Karan Johar on his 47th b'day
text: Filmmaker Karan Johar, who celebrated his 47th birthday today, said, "It has been a new life with my babies; they have changed my 40s around." "At 47, I have two emotions. One of excitement that I am heading towards the mid-point of my life...And the second is anxiety," he added. Karan is the father of 2-year-old twins, born via surrogacy.

headlines: I relate to his all-consuming passion: Ranveer on Kapil Dev
text: While speaking about preparing for his role as Kapil Dev in the upcoming film '83, Ranveer Singh said that he relates to the former Indian cricket team captain's "all-consuming passion". "I've found some clues along the way...that'll help me construct my performance," the actor added. Ranveer spent 10 days living with the former cricketer to prepare for his role.

headlines: Need to work on our bowling: Sarfaraz after defeat to Afghanistan
text: Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed admitted that the Pakistan team needs to work on their bowling after the team's loss against Afghanistan in their first World Cup warm-up match. "It is very tough when you are losing the matches. We are trying very hard and hopefully, we will do well very soon," Sarfaraz added about the Pakistani team.

headlines: Heat was getting unbearable: Woman who coated car with cow dung
text: The Ahmedabad woman who coated her car with cow dung has said, "The heat was getting unbearable." "I have used cow dung in my house for flooring and from that experience I thought of doing something with my car," Sejal Shah added. Pictures of her car went viral on social media after being shared by a Facebook user.

headlines: I failed to live up to ideals that I propagated myself: AIB's Tanmay
text: After being removed as the CEO of All India Bakchod (AIB) over the sexual harassment row, Tanmay Bhat apologised and said, "I realise that in the past, I've failed to live up to ideals that I've propagated myself." "In any leadership capacity in the future I will strive to build spaces in which women feel safe and nurtured," he added.

headlines: I will build spaces where women feel safe, valued: AIB's Tanmay
text: After being removed as the CEO of All India Bakchod (AIB) over the sexual harassment row, Tanmay Bhat apologised and said, "In any leadership capacity in the future I will strive to build spaces in which women feel safe and valued." "I'm deeply sorry for the distress I've caused to my friends, and anyone affected by my actions," he added.

headlines: Shah Rukh Khan congratulates PM Modi, says democracy is a winner
text: Actor Shah Rukh Khan took to Twitter to congratulate Prime Minister Narendra Modi on winning the 17th Lok Sabha elections, saying the electoral mandate and democracy is a winner. "We...as proud Indians...have chosen an establishment with great clarity and now we need to get behind it and work with it to have our hopes and dreams fulfilled," he added.

headlines: Indians 'lucky' to have Modi: Trump calls PM a great leader
text: Stating that Indians are "lucky" to have Narendra Modi, US President Donald Trump called the Prime Minister a "great man and leader". Trump tweeted this after a telephonic conversation with PM Modi. He had earlier tweeted, "Great things are in store for the US-India partnership with the return of PM Modi...I look forward to continuing our important work together!"

headlines: Pandya shares pic celebrating WC win as fan, says dream comes true
text: All-rounder Hardik Pandya, who is in India's 2019 World Cup squad, shared a throwback picture of himself celebrating 2011 WC win with friends. He also shared a selfie with MS Dhoni, Shikhar Dhawan and Jasprit Bumrah. "From cheering and celebrating India's WC triumph in 2011 to representing India in WC 2019, it has been a dream come true," he wrote.

headlines: A great guy and a brilliant sportsman: Harry Kane on Virat Kohli
text: England footballer Harry Kane took to Twitter to share a picture of himself with Virat Kohli. "After a few tweets in last couple of years good to finally meet @imVkohli...A great guy and a brilliant sportsman," he tweeted. Kane had lauded Kohli for his performance against Australia on social media, while Kohli had wished Kane for FIFA WC last year.

headlines: Candidate, who cried on TV for getting 5 votes, ends up with 856
text: Independent candidate from Jalandhar Lok Sabha seat, Neetu Shutteran Wala, who broke down on live TV for receiving just five votes in the elections, ended up with 856 votes. During an interview on the day of counting on Thursday, Neetu said he'd never fight elections again as he received just five votes despite having nine registered voters in his family.

headlines: 65,14,558 voters opt for NOTA in 2019 Lok Sabha elections
text: A total of 65,14,558 voters opted for NOTA, none-of-the-above option, in 2019 Lok Sabha elections. In 2014, as many as 60,02,942 voters had opted for NOTA. The highest percentage of NOTA was recorded in the state of Bihar with 2% voters (8,17,139) opting for it. In Uttar Pradesh, which has 80 Lok Sabha seats, 7,25,079 voters opted for NOTA.

headlines: 17th Lok Sabha set to witness 78 women MPs, highest in its history
text: Seventy-eight seats have been won by women candidates in the 17th Lok Sabha elections, the highest since the first Lok Sabha in 1952. Uttar Pradesh and West Bengal are sending the highest number of women to the house, 11 each. A total of 724 women candidates contested, with Congress fielding the maximum 54 women, followed by BJP at 53.

headlines: Afghanistan beat Pakistan in last over in World Cup warm-up match
text: Afghanistan defeated Pakistan by three wickets at Bristol on Friday to win their first 2019 World Cup warm-up match. Batting first, Pakistan were dismissed for 262 in 47.5 overs, with Afghan spinner Mohammad Nabi taking three wickets for 46 runs. Afghanistan chased down the target in the last over, driven by Hashmatullah Shahidi's 74*(102).

headlines: Fungi that draws gold particles from its surroundings found
text: Australia's national science agency CSIRO has discovered new thread-like fungi that oxidise tiny particles of gold from their surroundings and attach the gold to their strands. The fungi, Fusarium oxsporum, were found to grow larger and spread faster than those that don't interact with gold. "Gold is so chemically inactive that this interaction is both unusual and surprising," researchers said.

headlines: After jumping off, I thought I was dead: Survivor in Surat fire
text: Happy Panchali, a 15-year-old survivor in the Surat fire tragedy that claimed lives of 20 people, said, "What I experienced was hell...After jumping off, I thought I was dead." "All I remember was everyone was crying for help," Panchali added. Several students had jumped off the window of a coaching centre of the building's fourth floor to escape the fire.

headlines: Most of the 20 Surat fire tragedy victims students aged 17 or below
text: Most of the 20 people who died in the Surat fire tragedy were students aged 17 years or below. Several students jumped off the third and fourth floors of the Takshashila Complex building in Sarthana area. While some reports suggested they were from a coaching class, some reports said students were attending extracurricular activities for summer vacations at the venue.

headlines: Had no option but to jump off 4th floor: Survivor in Surat fire
text: Recalling the incident, 15-year-old Urmila Patel, who survived the fire in a Surat coaching centre on Friday, said, "We had no option but to jump. I saw others jumping off and followed them." Patel added the students were on the fourth and top floors and the staircase was engulfed in fire. The fire claimed lives of around 20 people.

headlines: Thousands attend J&K's most wanted terrorist Zakir Musa's funeral
text: A day after terrorist Zakir Musa was killed in an encounter in Tral, protests broke out across Kashmir Valley. Although curfew was imposed in major towns and roads leading to Tral were sealed, thousands of people assembled in Tral's Noorpora to participate in Musa's funeral procession. Meanwhile, police said Musa was involved in the September 2018 serial blasts in Jalandhar.

headlines: Bodies of 4 members of Indian family that went missing in Oman found
text: The Royal Oman Police has said that it has found the bodies of four out of the six members of an Indian family that went missing in the flash floods in the country. The family of Sardar Fazal Ahmed, an Indian expatriate working as a pharmacist in Oman, went missing when their car was swept away by flash floods.

headlines: US to send 1,500 troops to Middle East amid tensions with Iran
text: The US will deploy 1,500 American troops to the Middle East to provide protection to the service members already there. The deployment of the troops comes in light of the rising tensions between the US and Iran. Citing intelligence, the US said that Iran may target American troops in the region and the oil infrastructure belonging to American allies.

headlines: Mary Kom, Sarita Devi win gold at India Open
text: Six-time world champion MC Mary Kom and Sarita Devi won gold medals at the second India Open boxing tournament, which concluded on Friday. India won medals in 52 kg, 81 kg, 91 kg and +91 kg men's categories and 51 kg, 57 kg and 75 kg in women's to conclude the campaign with 12 of the 18 gold medals available.

headlines: Xiaomi fires Africa head for violating Chinese 'decency' law
text: Chinese smartphone manufacturer Xiaomi fired its Africa division head Wang Lingming for allegedly violating a Chinese law pertaining to indecent public behaviour. Wang was detained for 5 days by public security bodies as per Article 44 of China's public safety law, Xiaomi confirmed. Article 44 applies to obscenity against another person or deliberately exposing one's body in a public place.

headlines: President Kovind hosts dinner for the outgoing Union Cabinet
text: President Ram Nath Kovind on Friday hosted a banquet for the outgoing Union Council of Ministers, led by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, at the Rashtrapati Bhavan. Earlier today, PM Modi met the President and tendered his resignation along with the resignation of his cabinet ministers. President accepted the resignation and asked him to continue till a new government assumes office.

headlines: SoftBank-backed US food delivery startup DoorDash gets $600M
text: US-based food delivery startup DoorDash has raised $600 million in a Series G round of funding at a valuation of around $12.6 billion. Investors including SoftBank Vision Fund, Sequoia Capital and Temasek Holdings took part in the round. DoorDash had last raised $400 million in a Series F funding round at a valuation of over $7 billion in February.

headlines: What were the biggest & lowest margins of victory in 17th LS polls?
text: BJP's CR Patil recorded the biggest margin of victory in 17th Lok Sabha elections, winning Gujarat's Navsari constituency by a margin of 6,89,668 votes. Patil had won the seat in 2014 by 5,58,116 votes and in 2009 by 1,32,643 votes. The lowest margin was recorded by BJP's BP Saroj (Bholanath), who won Uttar Pradesh's Machhlishahr seat by 181 votes.

headlines: How did Indian newspapers report PM Narendra Modi's victory?
text: Hindustan Times called PM Narendra Modi's victory "NaMoment", while the headline on the front page of The Times of India, read, "Chowkidar's Chamatkar". The Telegraph explained the victory with three words: "He is back" and The Indian Express' headline read, "Modi 2.024". The BJP became the first party since Congress in 1984 to win at least 300 LS seats.

headlines: Irani, Gambhir, Pragya, Sunny Deol among first-time Lok Sabha MPs
text: Amit Shah, Ravi Shankar Prasad, cricketer-turned-politician Gautam Gambhir, Smriti Irani, singer Hans Raj Hans and Sadhvi Pragya are among 300 first-time winners in 2019 Lok Sabha polls. DMK's Kanimozhi won in Tamil Nadu and Madhya Pradesh CM's son Nakul Kamal Nath won from Chhindwara. Actor Sunny Deol won Gurdaspur and BJP's youngest candidate, 28-year-old Tejasvi Surya, won Bangalore South seat.

headlines: SP removes all media panellists after winning only 5 LS seats in UP
text: Akhilesh Yadav-led Samajwadi Party on Friday removed all its media panellists after winning only five seats in Uttar Pradesh, which has 80 Lok Sabha seats. SP also asked news channels to not invite any of the panellists for debates. SP fought the elections in alliance with Mayawati-led BSP, which won 10 seats, and RLD, which failed to open its account.

headlines: Mufti-led PDP loses all 3 Kashmir LS seats to Farooq Abdullah's NC
text: Former J&K CM Mehbooba Mufti-led PDP, which won all three Lok Sabha seats in Kashmir Valley in 2014, has lost them in 2019 to former CM Farooq Abdullah's National Conference. "Today I would trade a thousand wins just for him to be by my side," Mufti tweeted remembering father and PDP founder Mufti Mohammad Sayeed, who passed away in 2016.

headlines: 9 former Congress CMs lose in 2019 Lok Sabha elections
text: As many as nine former Congress Chief Ministers lost in 17th Lok Sabha elections, results of which were declared on Thursday. Former Delhi CM Sheila Dikshit lost the North Delhi seat, while ex-Haryana CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda lost the Sonipat constituency. Other CMs include Harish Rawat, Digvijaya Singh, Ashok Chavan, Sushil Kumar Shinde, Mukul Sangma, Veerappa Moily and Nabam Tuki.

headlines: How did foreign media report PM Narendra Modi's victory?
text: The New York Times' headline on the front page read, "Modi Wins Second term, Routing Gandhi Party", while the Washington Post carried the title, "India's Modi wins in landslide with Hindu nationalist message." The Financial Times said PM Modi's victory "clears way for BJP's New India reform drive". BJP-led NDA won 352 of 542 Lok Sabha seats that were contested.

headlines: Carried champagne in my bag when we went to play WC final: Kapil Dev
text: Kapil Dev, who led India to 1983 World Cup victory, has revealed he carried a champagne bottle in his bag when the team went to play World Cup final. "I had the belief that we can win. I was the captain and if the captain doesn't have confidence then how will he inject the same into other members," he added.

headlines: Killed 2 days before counting, Arunachal MLA wins assembly seat
text: Tirong Aboh, National People's Party (NPP) candidate who was killed by suspected NSCN militants two days before counting, won from the Khonsa West assembly constituency in Arunachal Pradesh for the second time. He defeated BJP's Phawang Lowang by a 1055-vote margin but the seat will go for re-election now. Aboh's son and nine others were also killed in the attack.

headlines: Police fire in air as ShahabuddinÂ’s wife refuses to accept poll defeat
text: Police fired in the air on Thursday to disperse supporters of Hena Shahab, an RJD candidate and wife of mafia don-turned-politician Mohammad Shahabuddin, who refused to accept the poll results from Bihar's Siwan Lok Sabha seat. Hena lost to JD(U) candidate Kavita Singh by 1,16,958 votes. She had lost the seat to BJP's Om Prakash Yadav in 2014 general elections.

headlines: Huawei CEO reveals he buys his family rival company Apple's iPhones
text: Chinese company Huawei's Founder and CEO Ren Zhengfei said, "iPhone has a good ecosystem and when my family is abroad, I still buy them iPhones." He explained, "It's so one canÂ’t narrowly think the love for Huawei should mean loving Huawei phones." His statement comes amid the US blacklisting Huawei, disallowing US firms like Google to work with the company.

headlines: 102-year-old woman suspected of killing 92-year-old neighbour
text: A 102-year-old woman is suspected of having murdered her 92-year-old neighbour in a French retirement home, prosecutors said. The suspected killer told one of the carers at the home that she had killed someone. She's been taken to a psychiatric hospital and tests are being done on her to determine whether she was criminally responsible for her action.

headlines: SpiceJet adds 21 planes in last 21 days, to induct 100th in a week
text: SpiceJet MD Ajay Singh on Friday said that India's third-largest airline added a plane each in the last 21 days and will induct its 100th aircraft in a week. "Nowhere in the world has an airline expanded at this pace, increased capacity and added new stations and flights as SpiceJet has done in the last one month," Singh added.

headlines: Wishes from a friend of India like you invaluable: PM thanks Ivanka
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday thanked Ivanka Trump for her wishes on his electoral victory. Congratulating PM Modi, Ivanka had said, "Exciting times ahead for the wonderful people of India!" "Thank you @IvankaTrump. Wishes from a true friend of India like you are invaluable," PM Modi tweeted in response to her congratulatory message.

headlines: Local BJP leaders plotted my defeat: BJP's Jaya Prada
text: BJP's Jaya Prada on Friday claimed that local party leaders "plotted" against her Lok Sabha election defeat. "Our party leaders from Rampur are to blame for my defeat. I'll complain about them to the central leadership. They'll take strict action against them," she said. Prada lost to Samajwadi Party's Azam Khan by over one lakh votes from the Rampur seat.

headlines: Bill Gates congratulates PM Modi, calls win 'remarkable'
text: World's second-richest person Bill Gates took to Twitter to congratulate PM Narendra Modi for BJP-led NDA's victory in the 2019 Lok Sabha polls. "Congratulations @NarendraModi on a remarkable win in #IndianElections2019," he wrote. "Your continued commitment to improve health, nutrition and development will significantly improve lives of many," the Microsoft Co-founder added.

headlines: Bihar sees highest number of NOTA votes in Lok Sabha polls
text: In the 17th Lok Sabha elections, Bihar witnessed about 8.17 lakh voters opting for None of The Above (NOTA) option, the highest in the country. Bihar's Gopalganj constituency topped the tally where 51,660 voters opted for NOTA. In 2014 Lok Sabha polls, when NOTA was first introduced in any parliamentary election, over 60 lakh voters in India opted for it.

headlines: Kyrgios pulls out of French Open after he said the event 'sucks'
text: Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios has pulled out of the French Open after having earlier said that the event 'sucks' in comparison to the Wimbledon tournament. Kyrgios also withdrew from the French Open last year and has never reached the second week in the tournament. Kyrgios will be replaced by a 'lucky loser' from qualifiers.

headlines: Chhetri needs to fight for a place in team: Coach Stimac
text: Indian football team's new coach Igor Stimac said, "Sunil (Chhetri) is very valuable to our team... But just like the others, he needs to fight for a place in the team." "He is a role model to these young players who are knocking on the door. He has played so many games, he is so experienced," Stimac added.

headlines: Video: Doglike robot weighing 130kg pulls 3,300-kg aeroplane
text: Italian Institute of Technology (IIT) has released a video of a doglike four-legged robot HyQReal pulling a 3,300-kilogram aeroplane across an airfield. The robot, weighing around 130 kilograms, has a 48 Volt battery and is dust and water resistant. It was built by IIT in collaboration with US-based motion control products and systems manufacturer Moog to support humans in emergencies.

headlines: Snap employees used internal tools to spy on users, see pics: Report
text: Several Snapchat employees reportedly have access to an internal tool that lets them abuse user data including saved Snaps, phone numbers and email addresses. Multiple employees have abused their privileged access to spy on users, the report claimed. "Unauthorised access of any kind is a clear violation...results in immediate termination," Snapchat responded without confirming the tool's abuse.

headlines: President accepts PM Modi's resignation ahead of second term
text: President Ram Nath Kovind on Friday accepted PM Narendra Modi's resignation and asked him to continue till a new government assumes office. The PM also tendered resignation of the council of ministers. Earlier today, the Union Cabinet adopted a resolution for the dissolution of the 16th Lok Sabha, paving way for the formal launch of the new government forming process.

headlines: SpaceX supplier charged for faking 38 inspection reports
text: US federal investigators charged a 41-year-old SpaceX supplier for forging signatures on at least 38 inspection reports for parts meant for SpaceX's Falcon 9 and Falcon Heavy rockets. Authorities found at least 76 parts that were rejected or not inspected but shipped to SpaceX anyway, affecting up to 10 missions. SpaceX said it has cut ties with the supplier's firm.

headlines: BJP-led NDA returns to power after winning LS polls with 352 seats
text: The BJP-led NDA has returned to power after winning the 17th Lok Sabha elections with 352 seats, bettering its tally of 336 in 2014 elections. It is the highest mandate since the 1984 Lok Sabha elections, which Congress won with 414 seats. PM Narendra Modi has become the first non-Congress Prime Minister to return to power after completing full term.

headlines: Actor Sumalatha defeats K'taka CM son as Independent by 1.25L votes
text: Actor and Independent candidate Sumalatha Ambareesh defeated Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy's son Nikhil by 1,25,876 votes in the Mandya constituency. The 55-year-old, who is the widow of popular actor-turned-politician MH Ambareesh, is first independent MP from Karnataka in 52 years and only third in its history. She was backed by Kannada actors Darshan, Yash and producer 'Rockline' Venkatesh.

headlines: 10 students killed in massive fire at Surat building, many jump off
text: At least 10 students were reportedly killed after a fire broke out at a commercial complex in Gujarat's Surat. Several students, who were attending coaching classes, were seen jumping off the balcony of the building. As many as 20 students are reported to be trapped, while 18 fire tenders are on the spot.

headlines: Naidu's son loses in Andhra assembly, Pawan Kalyan loses both seats
text: Nara Lokesh, son of TDP chief and former Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu lost his first election by 5,337 votes to a YSRCP MLA as the YS Jagan Mohan Reddy-led party won 151 seats out of 175 in the Assembly elections. Meanwhile, actor-turned-politician Pawan Kalyan lost from both the seats he contested while his JanaSena Party won one seat.

headlines: India to reach greater heights with your vision: Kohli to PM Modi
text: Team India captain Virat Kohli took to Twitter to congratulate Prime Minister Narendra Modi after BJP-led NDA won the 17th Lok Sabha elections. "Congratulations @narendramodi ji. We believe India is going to reach greater heights with your vision. Jai hind," he wrote. Various former cricketers including Sachin Tendulkar and Virender Sehwag also congratulated PM Modi on social media.

headlines: BJP clean sweeps Haryana, wins all 10 seats with 73.57 lakh votes
text: The Bharatiya Janata Party won all the 10 Lok Sabha seats in Haryana for the first time in general election history. BJP received a total of 73,57,347 votes in the state, with a vote share percentage of 58.02%. BJP also won all the seats in Himachal Pradesh, Delhi and Uttarakhand, among others.

headlines: 3 senior Cong leaders send resignations to Rahul a day after defeat
text: Three senior Congress leaders from Uttar Pradesh, Odisha and Karnataka have tendered their resignations to party President Rahul Gandhi, a day after the Lok Sabha election results were announced. Uttar Pradesh chief Raj Babbar, Karnataka Congress' HK Patil and Odisha Congress chief Niranjan Patnaik have tendered their resignations. A Congress leader said the party may not rush into accepting resignations.

headlines: 4 Indians among 7 dead on Everest in a week amid overcrowding
text: Four Indians among seven climbers have lost their lives on Mount Everest in a week, taking the death toll above last year's total. 52-year-old Kalpana Dash and 27-year-old Nihal Bagwan died while descending on Thursday. Bagwan faced exhaustion as he had to wait for over 12 hours. Nepal issued a record 381 permits costing $11,000 each for this climbing season.

headlines: Man dies on Everest after climbing highest peak of all 7 continents
text: Donald Lynn Cash, an American who had completed his goal of climbing the tallest mountain on each continent after scaling Mount Everest, died while descending from the peak. Cash, 55, fainted due to high altitude sickness and was helped by Sherpa guides. While being taken to a camp, Cash fainted again and the Sherpa guides were unable to revive him.

headlines: Facebook deletes record 220 crore fake accounts in 3 months
text: Facebook has said it deleted nearly 220 crore fake accounts in the first three months of 2019 and about 120 crore fake accounts in the last quarter of 2018. "We estimated that 5% of monthly active accounts are fake," Facebook added. The social media giant also revealed it deleted around 40 lakh hate speech posts in first quarter of 2019.

headlines: Jeff Bezos' space colony plan 'makes no sense': Elon Musk
text: Billionaire entrepreneur and SpaceX Founder Elon Musk on Twitter said world's richest man and Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos' plan to build space colonies housing a trillion people "makes no sense". "To grow the colony, you'd have to transport vast amounts of mass from planets/moons/asteroids. Would be like trying to build US in middle of Atlantic Ocean," Musk added.

headlines: DRDO tests India-made 500 kg Guided Bomb, hits target at 30 km
text: The Defence Research and Development Organisation on Friday successfully test-fired an indigenously-developed 500 kg inertially Guided Bomb at the Pokhran test firing range in Rajasthan. The bomb hit its target at 30 km with high precision. This comes after IAF jets fired Israel-made self-guided Spice-2000 bombs, which hit targeted Jaish-e-Mohammed camps in Pakistan's Balakot, 60 km away from LoC.

headlines: Extremely anguished: PM Modi on Surat building fire that killed 15
text: PM Narendra Modi has tweeted, "Extremely anguished by the fire tragedy in Surat. My thoughts are with bereaved families." "Have asked the Gujarat Government and local authorities to provide all possible assistance to those affected," he added. A massive fire broke at a commercial complex in Surat on Friday, killing reportedly at least 15 people including students.

headlines: HDFC Life worker seeks referendum to send Muslims to Pak, suspended
text: HDFC Life suspended an employee after he called for a "Brexit-style referendum" to decide if Muslims should be allowed to stay in India. "If majority of Hindus vote against Muslim citizenship, Muslims should accept mandate and move to Pakistan and Bangladesh," the man wrote on Facebook. However, many threatened to boycott HDFC Group if any action was taken against him.

headlines: Concerned that ideology of Gandhiji's killer won: Digvijaya
text: After his defeat in Bhopal, Congress' Digvijaya Singh said, "I accept people's mandate but I'm worried...that today in (India), ideology of Mahatma Gandhi's killer won." He further asked what "magic wand" does BJP have that they predict results so accurately. "In 2014, they predicted 280-plus and achieved it. This time, it was 300-plus and they achieved it too," Singh added.

headlines: BJP ideology supported by people across India: Pragya Thakur
text: BJP's Pragya Singh Thakur on Friday said that people voted for country's betterment and BJP's ideology was supported by everyone across India. "(As a result), BJP...got more than a simple majority on its own in the Lok Sabha," she said. Thakur defeated former Madhya Pradesh CM and Congress leader Digvijaya Singh by more than 3 lakh votes from Bhopal seat.

headlines: Odisha Cong chief resigns after party's defeat in LS polls
text: Odisha Pradesh Congress Committee President Niranjan Patnaik on Friday announced his resignation after the party's defeat in the state. "I've sent my resignation to Congress President (Rahul Gandhi) owning moral responsibility for party's poor show in Lok Sabha and Assembly polls in (Odisha)," he said. "While Congress faced defeat in the state, I too lost at the hustings," Patnaik added.

headlines: We can't live with Pakistan in enmity: Farooq Abdullah
text: A day after BJP's victory in Lok Sabha elections, National Conference President Farooq Abdullah stressed upon the need for better relations with Pakistan. "We've to live peacefully with our neighbouring country. We can't live with them in enmity," he said. "We should think about making our nation prosperous. For this, we've to come to a solution with Pakistan," Abdullah added.

headlines: People's votes silenced leaders who abused PM: Ravi Shankar
text: After BJP secured a majority in the Lok Sabha elections, BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad on Friday said, "This is a historic win... People with their votes have silenced those leaders who used to abuse Modi ji." Prasad defeated Congress' Shatrughan Sinha to win the Patna Sahib constituency.

headlines: People want BJP to be in power in Delhi too: Manoj Tiwari
text: After BJP's victory in the Lok Sabha elections, party's Delhi chief Manoj Tiwari said final phase of the "battle" (Delhi assembly elections) is still to be won. "We've been in exile in the Assembly for 22 years. People now understood...BJP should...be in power in Delhi," he added. Tiwari further said he's confident people will vote for BJP in assembly elections.

headlines: Saddened by loss of precious lives: Rajnath on Surat fire
text: Union Minister Rajnath Singh on Friday took to Twitter and wrote he's deeply saddened by the loss of life in the fire in Gujarat's Surat. "My thoughts are with the families of the deceased. I pray for the speedy recovery of the injured," he tweeted. At least 15 people died after a fire broke out at Takshashila Complex in Surat.

headlines: Brunei's Sultan returns Oxford degree over anti-gay laws backlash
text: Brunei's Sultan Hassanal Bolkiah has returned an honorary degree awarded by Oxford University after he faced backlash over the new anti-gay laws in his country. Brunei had initially introduced death by stoning for gay sex, but later backtracked on it following criticism. Over 1.18 lakh people had signed a petition calling on the university to revoke the honorary degree.

headlines: Pak offers to mediate between US and Iran amid rising tensions
text: Pakistan has offered to mediate between the US and Iran amid the escalating tensions between the two countries. This comes as Iran's Foreign Minister is on a visit to Islamabad for talks with the Pakistani leadership. The latest tensions follow reports of Iran planning an attack on American forces in the Middle East.

headlines: BJD wins 112 seats in Odisha, Patnaik set to be CM for 5th time in row
text: BJD won 112 seats out of 146 in 2019 Odisha Assembly polls, with party President Naveen Patnaik set for a fifth consecutive term as CM. Patnaik becomes only the third CM after SikkimÂ’s Pawan Chamling and West BengalÂ’s Jyoti Basu to achieve the feat. BJP won 23 seats, Congress 9, and CPI(M) and an independent candidate won one seat each.

headlines: US criminal promises to surrender if 'wanted' post gets 15K likes
text: A US criminal has negotiated a deal with the police to surrender himself. Jose Simms told a police officer on Facebook that he will surrender if his 'wanted' post on the police department's page gets 15,000 likes. However, the police said, "Regardless of the number of "Likes"...we'll continue to utilise resources to locate suspects and take them into custody."

headlines: Looking forward to miraculously progressive united India: Rahman
text: Oscar-winning composer AR Rahman on Friday congratulated Prime Minister Narendra Modi and BJP on winning the Lok Sabha elections. "Looking forward to a Miraculously Progressive United India," Rahman tweeted. The BJP, which won 303 seats, is the first party since 1984 to have a back-to-back majority in the lower house of parliament.

headlines: Absolutely bogus: David on rumours of son Varun's wedding
text: Denying reports that his son Varun Dhawan will be tying the knot with his girlfriend Natasha Dalal in Goa this December, filmmaker David Dhawan said, "[T]his news is absolutely bogus." "There is no question of a wedding this year," he added. David further said that given Varun's film commitments, he'll only be able to get married next year.

headlines: Kim files trademark protection for newborn son's name: Report
text: Kim Kardashian filed for trademark protection for her newborn son Psalm West's name one day after publicly announcing his name online, entertainment website E! News reported. Filed by Kim's company, the trademark protection covers potential business ventures that may use Psalm's name, including books and clothes. Kim and her husband Kanye West welcomed their son via surrogacy on May 9.

headlines: Congress loses all seats in Haryana but its vote share up by over 5%
text: Congress failed to secure even a single Lok Sabha seat in Haryana as BJP won from all the 10 constituencies. However, Congress' vote share increased by over 5% in this election - from 22.99% in 2014 to about 28.4%. Congress had won one seat in the previous Lok Sabha elections while BJP, which currently has 58% vote share, won seven.

headlines: Can't win by saying desh ke tukde-tukde: Ravi Kishan to Kanhaiya
text: Actor and BJP leader Ravi Kishan took a jibe at Kanhaiya Kumar on Friday, stating, "When you say 'desh ke tukde-tukde', you'll never win the confidence of the people." Kishan added, "By being anti-national and speaking against the nation...you'll never be able to win." Kanhaiya lost Begusarai to BJP's Giriraj Singh by a margin of over 4 lakh votes.

headlines: BJP's Shripad Naik secures 5th consecutive win from North Goa
text: BJP leader Shripad Yesso Naik defeated Goa Congress chief Girish Chodankar by a margin of 80,247 votes to secure a fifth consecutive win from North Goa Lok Sabha seat. Naik said, "It was Congress' dream to send Prime Minister Modi home but people were happy with his work and gave mandate in our favour."

headlines: Ex-J&K CM Farooq Abdullah dances on winning Srinagar seat
text: National Conference chief and former J&K CM Farooq Abdullah danced with his supporters after winning the Srinagar Lok Sabha seat by a margin of 70,050 votes. Farooq, whose party has won all three seats in Kashmir Valley, also said that he hoped the new government at the Centre would do justice with Jammu and Kashmir.

headlines: Jaitley unlikely to stay Finance Minister over poor health: Reports
text: Finance Minister Arun Jaitley is unlikely to continue in his current role due to poor health, Reuters reported citing sources. Jaitley may not accept any offer to continue as Finance Minister as his health has deteriorated over the past few months, it added. BJP swept the general elections by winning 302 out of 542 seats so far.

headlines: SpaceX successfully launches, deploys 60 internet satellites
text: SpaceX has successfully launched and deployed the first 60 satellites of its planned 12,000-satellite network Starlink, aimed to provide high-speed internet globally, to low-Earth orbit. "All 60 Starlink satellites online," the aerospace startup's Founder Elon Musk tweeted. The satellites were deployed at an altitude of about 440 km in the third flight of one of its reusable Falcon 9 rockets.

headlines: Kashmir schools, colleges shut after terrorist Zakir Musa killed
text: Schools and colleges were shut and a curfew was imposed in parts of Kashmir on Friday, a day after Jammu and Kashmir's most wanted terrorist Zakir Musa was killed in an encounter in Tral. Further, internet services were suspended for a day in Kashmir Valley as a precautionary measure. Musa was believed to be the chief of Al-Qaeda's Ansar Ghazwat-ul-Hind.

headlines: US files 17 new charges against WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange
text: The US Justice Department on Thursday filed 17 new charges against WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange, accusing him of receiving and unlawfully publishing the names of classified sources. Assange was previously charged with conspiring with Chelsea Manning to hack a government computer system. He is currently serving a jail sentence in the UK for skipping bail.

headlines: I served country I love: UK PM breaks down announcing her exit
text: UK PM Theresa May broke down on Friday as she announced her resignation. "I'll leave the job that's been the honour of my life...I do so with gratitude to have had the opportunity to serve the country I love," she said. "It'll remain a matter of deep regret to me that I've not been able to deliver Brexit," she added.

headlines: Mexico to sell luxury cars seized from criminals to help poor
text: The Mexican government will auction luxury cars, homes and other assets seized from criminals and former politicians and will use the proceeds to help the poor. As many as 82 vehicles with a total starting price of around $1.5 million will be sold in the first auction on Sunday. The move is part of Mexico's new 'Robin Hood' programme.

headlines: We've prepared but WC is a different kettle of fish: Morgan
text: Speaking about England's chances at the upcoming World Cup, captain Eoin Morgan said, "[W]e've prepared pretty well but the World Cup is a different kettle of fish. You still have to play against some of the best sides in the world." "We're as best prepared as we possibly could be. We want the first game to be tomorrow," Morgan added.

headlines: It is time for us to deliver something: Rashid ahead of WC
text: Speaking about Afghanistan's maiden appearance at the upcoming World Cup, spinner Rashid Khan said, "I think this World Cup is about beating big teams and playing good cricket... It is time for us to deliver something." "We have the skills, everything. We need to show the world we are not only good on paper," Rashid added.

headlines: Wherever there was Congress, BJP claimed victory: Owaisi
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Friday said that BJP's onslaught was not stopped by Congress, rather wherever there was Congress, BJP has claimed victory. "There is more importance of regional parties now," he added. Owaisi further said that BJP will now have to work on their promises because of the massive mandate given by people.

headlines: Coalition govt in Karnataka will survive 100%: Siddaramaiah
text: Karnataka Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Friday dismissed speculations about threats to the Congress-Janata Dal (Secular) coalition government in the state and said that it will survive 100%. "Parliamentary election results won't affect the coalition," he added. This comes amid speculations that several ministers will quit the government after BJP won 25 out of 28 Lok Sabha seats in the state.

headlines: After raising $58M in 8 yrs, Craftsvilla up for sale: Report
text: Eight years after being launched in 2011 and raising about $58 million to date, Mumbai-based ethnic wear e-tailer Craftsvilla is looking to get acquired, Entrackr reported. Craftsvilla reportedly approached Snapdeal for the same, which is "highly unlikely" to do so. "The company is now looking at Future Group or Reliance Industries as possible avenue of acquisition," Entrackr quoted its sources.

headlines: Amazon-backed Shuttl to get up to $6M in ongoing $20M round
text: Gurugram-based bus aggregator startup Shuttl is raising up to $6 million in its ongoing $20 million funding round, TechCircle reported citing regulatory filings. The funding commitment has come from an entity called MUGH 2, TechCircle added. Amazon-backed Shuttl was launched by IIT alumni and former Jabong executives Amit Singh and Deepanshu Malviya in the year 2015.

headlines: BJP wins 62 of 80 Lok Sabha seats, SP-BSP 15 in Uttar Pradesh
text: BJP secured victory in 62 of the 80 Lok Sabha seats in Uttar Pradesh, which is nine less than the number it secured in 2014 Lok Sabha elections. Meanwhile, Samajwadi Party and BSP won five and 10 seats respectively and Congress won in one constituency. SP chief Akhilesh Yadav won from Azamgarh seat, while BSP supremo Mayawati didn't contest elections.

headlines: In a repeat of 2014, BJP-Shiv Sena wins 41 LS seats in Maharashtra
text: The BJP-Shiv Sena alliance won 41 of 48 Lok Sabha seats in Maharashtra, while Congress-NCP managed five seats in the western state. The NDA alliance had won 41 Lok Sabha constituencies in Maharashtra in 2014 as well, while UPA had won six seats. The NDA alliance received 50.9% of the total vote share in the state.

headlines: UP Cong chief Raj Babbar resigns after party wins 1 seat in state
text: Uttar Pradesh Congress Committee President Raj Babbar today sent his resignation to Congress President Rahul Gandhi over the party's performance in the 17th Lok Sabha elections. This comes after Congress managed to win just one seat in Uttar Pradesh in this election. Babbar lost from the Fatehpur Sikri Lok Sabha seat against Rajkumar Chahar by 4,95,065 votes.

headlines: Theresa May to resign as the Prime Minister of UK on June 7
text: Theresa May on Friday said she will step down as the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom on June 7. This comes as May faced backlash by her own MPs against her latest Brexit plan. Since January, the UK Parliament has rejected the withdrawal agreement that May negotiated with the European Union (EU) three times.

headlines: Vivek serves tea at 'PM Narendra Modi' screening in Mumbai
text: Actor Vivek Oberoi, who stars in the recently released film 'PM Narendra Modi', was seen serving tea at the film's premiere in Mumbai. The actor's father and film's producer Suresh Oberoi as well as co-producer Anand Pandit also served tea at the screening. Vivek was earlier seen serving tea outside his residence ahead of his film's release.

headlines: John Abraham suffers muscle tear while filming action scene
text: Actor John Abraham suffered a muscle tear in his arm while shooting an action sequence for his upcoming film 'Pagalpanti' at Mumbai's Mehboob Studios, the film's producer confirmed. "It was a simple shot, but mistiming caused the injury," producer Kumar Mangat said. John was shooting the scene aboard a truck when the incident occurred, as per reports.

headlines: People ask me if I'm Modi bhakt, but I'm desh bhakt: Vivek
text: While speaking about portraying PM Narendra Modi in a film based on the Prime Minister's life, Vivek Oberoi said, "People ask me if I've become a Modi bhakt, but I'm a desh bhakt." "[T]here are some characters that leave an impact and this role was that for me," he added. Titled 'PM Narendra Modi', the film released on Friday.

headlines: Thrilled, humbled: Aishwarya confirms film with Mani Ratnam
text: Actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan has confirmed that she will be starring in an upcoming film directed by filmmaker Mani Ratnam. "I will always be more than thrilled, excited, overwhelmed, humbled and just happy to work with my guru Mani, so yeah, that is happening," the actress said. Aishwarya made her acting debut in 1997 in the Mani Ratnam directorial 'Iruvar'.

headlines: Axis My India chief cries on TV as agency's exit poll proven right
text: At a panel on a news channel, Axis My India's Chairman Pradeep Gupta broke down on live TV after the leads in Lok Sabha polls were similar with what his agency's exit polls had predicted. "Yeh khushi ke aansu hai (These are tears of joy)," the anchor could be heard saying. The agency had predicted 339-365 seats for the NDA.

headlines: Jayant Sinha retains Hazaribagh by margin of 4.79 lakh votes
text: Union Minister Jayant Sinha won the Hazaribagh Lok Sabha constituency by a margin of 4.79 lakh votes. Sinha, who had a vote share of 67.42%, defeated Congress candidate Gopal Sahu and CPI candidate Bhubneshwar Mehta. In 2014 Lok Sabha elections, Sinha had won the Hazaribagh seat by a margin of 1.59 lakh votes.

headlines: India the 'single best place' to put money: Fairfax's Prem Watsa
text: Canadian billionaire and Fairfax CEO Prem Watsa on Thursday said that India is the "single best place" to put money. "We created Fairfax India because of Modi getting elected the first time and we just think the next five years are going to be transformative," Watsa said. The 68-year-old said his companies have invested about $3.7 billion in India.

headlines: Will send AMU's Jinnah portrait to Pak: BJP's Satish after win
text: After winning Lok Sabha elections from Aligarh for the second time in a row, BJP's Satish Kumar Gautam said, "Among my priorities is to send the portrait of Muhammad Ali Jinnah which is locked inside a room in Aligarh Muslim University to Pakistan." Satish added, "I'll also work for reservation of SC/ST students. 'Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas' is our motto."

headlines: My God, she's beautiful: James Anderson on when he first saw Broad
text: England fast bowler James Anderson, in his book, recalled the moment he first saw his fellow paceman Stuart Broad. "The first time Stuart Broad walked into the dressing room, with his flowing blond hair, striking blue eyes and perfect figure, I thought: 'My God, she's beautiful'," he wrote. "It's surreal weÂ’ve taken more than 1,000 wickets between us," he added.

headlines: Supreme Court attains full strength as 4 new judges sworn in
text: The Supreme Court attained its full sanctioned strength of 31 as four new judges were sworn-in on Friday. Justices Aniruddha Bose, AS Bopanna, Bhushan Ramkrishna Gavai and Surya Kant were administered the oath of office by Chief Justice Ranjan Gogoi. Earlier, a five-member Collegium led by Gogoi overruled the Centre's objection to the appointment of Justice Bose and Justice Bopanna.

headlines: Arjun Kapoor starrer 'India's Most Wanted' hits theatres
text: Arjun Kapoor starrer 'India's Most Wanted', which released today, is "a well-meaning thriller too restrained to be memorable," wrote Hindustan Times (HT). "Arjun Kapoor is sincere but is unable to engage you fully," Times Of India (TOI) said. "The second half is extremely racy and edgy," SpotBoyE wrote. It was rated 2/5 (HT), 3.5/5 (TOI) and 3/5 (SpotBoyE).

headlines: Negative campaign against PM Modi backfired: Cong leader
text: Congress leader and former PM Lal Bahadur Shastri's son Anil Shastri on Thursday said that excessive negative campaign against PM Narendra Modi didn't go down well with the public. He added that the "chowkidar chor hai" slogan was not accepted by the public. "A better performance in Congress-ruled states would have yielded better results," Shastri further said.

headlines: Had Naidu worked hard, TDP would've won more seats: Shah
text: BJP President Amit Shah on Thursday said that had TDP chief N Chandrababu Naidu worked hard to gain votes, then maybe TDP would've won more seats. Shah further mocked the Opposition for doubting the exit poll predictions. Currently in Andhra Pradesh, YSR Congress Party has won 151 out of 175 Assembly seats.

headlines: Hope India is governed in secular, democratic manner: Vadra
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi's brother-in-law Robert Vadra on Friday congratulated PM Narendra Modi and said that he hopes India is governed in a secular and democratic manner. "No doubt, it's (poll results) disheartening but let's keep the fight on," he added. Congress has won 52 seats, while BJP has won 302 Lok Sabha seats so far.

headlines: Brazil sues top tobacco firms to recover public health costs
text: Brazil is suing the world's largest cigarette makers, British American Tobacco and Philip Morris International, the country's solicitor general's office said. The suit seeks to recover public health treatment costs of tobacco-related diseases over the last five years. Tobacco kills over 1.56 lakh per year in Brazil, costing the healthcare system over $14 billion, as per Bloomberg Philanthropies.

headlines: BJP first single party since Congress in 1984 to win 300 LS seats
text: The BJP has become the first single party to win 300 seats in Lok Sabha elections since Congress in 1984. In 1984, Congress had won 414 seats, while BJP had won just two seats. BJP has won 302 Lok Sabha constituencies in 2019 elections till now, while Congress has won 52, eight more than their 2014 tally.

headlines: RJD fails to secure any seat for 1st time, NDA wins 39 of 40 in Bihar
text: Lalu Prasad Yadav-led RJD failed to secure even a single seat in Bihar in the Lok Sabha elections for the first time. Meanwhile, NDA, which comprises of BJP, JD(U) and Lok Janshakti Party, won 39 of the total 40 Lok Sabha seats in the state. Congress, which had formed grand alliance with RJD in the state, won from one constituency.

headlines: Upskill with BITS Pilani's Big Data & Analytics program
text: BITS Pilani's Big Data and Analytics program, in collaboration with upGrad, helps professionals obtain fundamentals knowledge through 200+ hours of learning and 5+ hands-on case studies. Learners work on projects sponsored by Saavn and get access to $100 worth of free AWS Cloud to deploy their projects. The program offers 360-degree career support, dedicated student mentor and BITS Alumni status.

headlines: BJP registers best result by any party since 1989 in Karnataka
text: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) registered best result by any party since 1989 in Karnataka by winning 25 out of the 28 Lok Sabha seats. Congress had won 27 out of 28 seats in 1989. The BJP garnered 51.3% of the vote share, the highest by any party in the state since the Congress got 57.63% in 1984.

headlines: BJP's Sambit Patra loses from Odisha's Puri by 11,714 votes
text: Bharatiya Janata Party's Sambit Patra has lost to Biju Janata Dal's Pinaki Misra by a margin of 11,714 votes from Odisha's Puri Lok Sabha constituency. Patra contested the Lok Sabha elections for the first time. In the 2014 Lok Sabha Elections, BJD's Pinaki Misra beat Sucharita Mohanty of Congress by receiving 50.30% of the votes cast in the constituency.

headlines: India's election is an inspiration around the world: US
text: US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo congratulated PM Narendra Modi and said, "India's election is an inspiration around the world." He also congratulated the "Indian people for casting their votes in such historic numbers". Earlier US President Donald Trump congratulated PM Modi and said, "Great things are in store for the US-India partnership with the return of PM Modi."

headlines: Kashyap claims PM's follower threatened daughter, shares screenshot
text: Congratulating PM Narendra Modi over BJP-led NDA's victory in the Lok Sabha elections, filmmaker Anurag Kashyap shared a man's comment on social media using abusive language and threatening his daughter Aaliyah. "Sir please also tell us how do we deal with these followers of yours who celebrate your victory by threatening my daughter...for me being your dissenter," Kashyap wrote.

headlines: Daniel Craig to have surgery on ankle injured on Bond 25 set
text: Daniel Craig, who plays the role of British spy James Bond, will undergo minor ankle surgery after sustaining an injury on the sets of the film 'Bond 25'. "Production will continue whilst Craig is rehabilitating for two weeks post-surgery," the film's makers tweeted on Thursday. The actor had reportedly slipped during the shooting of an action sequence in Jamaica.

headlines: SAD's Harsimrat Kaur dances on winning Bathinda LS seat
text: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) candidate Harsimrat Kaur Badal danced with her supporters after winning Punjab's Bathinda Lok Sabha seat by a margin of 21,772 votes. Following her win, she tweeted, "I thank the people of Bathinda for rewarding development... I will continue to strive to get even bigger projects to Bathinda." Harsimrat defeated Congress' Amarinder Singh Raja Warring.

headlines: Will take everyone along, even opponents: PM Modi on LS results
text: Addressing BJP supporters at the party headquarters in New Delhi on Thursday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "We have to move ahead. We have to take everyone with us, even our opponents." He added, "I will not do anything for myself. I will devote every moment of my time and every fibre of my being for my countrymen."

headlines: I'll surely give you a shout to collaborate: Gambhir to AAP's Atishi
text: After AAP's Atishi congratulated BJP's Gautam Gambhir for winning the East Delhi Lok Sabha seat, he tweeted, "I'll surely give you a shout to collaborate for all things constructive." Atishi had tweeted, "I'll always be available for help and collaboration for betterment of East Delhi. All the best! " Atishi had earlier accused Gambhir of distributing pamphlets calling her "prostitute".

headlines: A new morning for Amethi: Smriti Irani after defeating Rahul
text: After defeating Congress President Rahul Gandhi in Amethi, Union Minister Smriti Irani tweeted, "It is a new morning for Amethi, a new determination." Thanking the people of Amethi, she added, "You put your trust in development and let the lotus bloom." This is the first time since 1999 that BJP has won the Amethi constituency.

headlines: PM Modi takes blessings from LK Advani after win in Lok Sabha polls
text: PM Narendra Modi and BJP chief Amit Shah on Friday met senior party leader LK Advani at his residence to seek his blessings as BJP secured clear majority in the Lok Sabha elections. "BJP's successes today are possible because greats like him spent decades building the party," PM Modi tweeted. He's also likely to meet ex-BJP President Murli Manohar Joshi.

headlines: Scientists break record for highest-temperature superconductor
text: International researchers have broken the record for superconductivity at the highest temperature recorded to date at around -23Â°C, about 50 degrees higher than the previous confirmed record. They created a new material, called lanthanum superhydrides, to achieve the same. The material was, however, placed under extremely high pressure ranging between 150-170 gigapascals to reach the new record.

headlines: It's default setting for me to pick novel content: Ayushmann
text: While speaking about his film choices, actor Ayushmann Khurrana said, "It's a default setting for me to choose novel content." "I'm always known for middle-of-the-road cinema, where there is a collaboration of critical and commercial success. It's also my intuition," the actor added. He further said that when it comes to selecting films, his gut has never let him down.

headlines: I'm sensitive, negative Instagram comments affect me: Jacqueline
text: Jacqueline Fernandez said that mean Instagram comments affect her as she is a sensitive person. "I can't imagine someone being so rude...so it does affect me that I could...have such a negative, hateful impact on someone," she added. "I...want to get to that point where I'd be like, you know what, 'who are you to say that?'" Jacqueline further said.

headlines: My insecurities drive me to seek appreciation, approval: Tiger
text: Tiger Shroff said that while he is insecure as an actor, his insecurities drive him to seek appreciation and approval. "[I]t's natural...there's not much you can do to black that out," he added. "I wanted to do holistic films and I'm a sucker for heroes...I look up to superheroes, and films my father used to do," Tiger further said.

headlines: Karan gave tightest hug: Neetu Kapoor on pic with Karan, Rishi
text: Neetu Kapoor took to Instagram to share a picture of herself and her husband Rishi Kapoor with filmmaker Karan Johar, who visited the couple in New York. "[Karan] gave the tightestttt Hug and the longesttt kiss n said half of this love is from his mom," she captioned the picture. Rishi is currently undergoing treatment for cancer in New York.

headlines: My failure to direct party led to our defeat: Goa Cong chief
text: Goa Congress chief Girish Chodankar on Thursday said that it was his failure to give direction to party workers that led to Congress' defeat in the state. "I congratulate all winners, thank people of Goa and accept the mandate given by them," he added. While Congress won from the South Goa seat, Chodankar lost from the North Goa seat.

headlines: Respect the mandate given by people: MP CM on poll results
text: Congress leader and Madhya Pradesh CM Kamal Nath on Thursday said that although the results were not as per Congress' expectations, he accepts the mandate given by people. "It seems we weren't able to take our message and agenda to the people," he added. Congratulating BJP for its victory, he added that Congress will always stand with the people.

headlines: People have disregarded politics of nepotism: Haryana CM
text: After BJP won all 10 Lok Sabha seats in Haryana, BJP leader and Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar said that the outcome shows that people have disregarded politics of nepotism. He added that the victory will be a morale boost for the party workers and leaders. BJP had won 7 seats in Haryana in 2014 Lok Sabha polls.

headlines: BJP hijacked the electoral process by EVMs: Mayawati
text: BSP chief Mayawati on Thursday accused BJP of hijacking the electoral process with the help of EVMs. "The seats where we (BSP-SP-RLD alliance) won were deliberately not manipulated in order to fool the public," she added. Mayawati further said that the Supreme Court should seriously consider conducting elections through ballot paper.

headlines: It's just start, will continue politics: Urmila after loss
text: Congress' Mumbai North Lok Sabha candidate Urmila Matondkar, who lost her maiden election to BJP's Gopal Shetty, said that it's just a start and she is going to continue politics. "I'm standing defeated in front of you but do I look like a lost person?" she asked. Urmila added that she looks at the current situation as a "humble beginning".

headlines: V-Nourish promises wholesome nutrition with real ingredients
text: V-Nourish is a scientifically designed nutrition supplement that helps support growth and development of children, to keep them healthy and active. It promises a unique product experience with the presence of real fruit chunks and nuts with every sip and has no artificial flavours, no synthetic colors, no added preservatives.
