It is available across India in four different flavours.

headlines: BJP's Hema Malini wins Mathura seat by 2.9 lakh votes
text: BJP candidate Hema Malini won the Mathura seat for the second time in a row, defeating SP-BSP-RLD candidate Kunwar Narendra Singh by a margin of 2,93,471 votes. In 2014, she had defeated RLD's Jayant Chaudhary by 3,30,743 votes. Congress' Mahesh Pathak got a total of 28,084 votes from the seat and came third in this year's election.

headlines: Bhagwant Mann wins AAP's only seat in 17th Lok Sabha elections
text: Aam Aadmi Party Punjab chief Bhagwant Mann won the Sangrur Lok Sabha seat, beating Congress' Kewal Singh Dhillon by 1,10,211 votes. This was the only seat that AAP managed to win in the 17th Lok Sabha elections. Bhagwant Mann had won the 2014 elections from the Sangrur seat as well.

headlines: BJP wins all 7 Lok Sabha seats in Delhi for 2nd time in a row
text: The BJP has won all the seven Lok Sabha seats in Delhi for the second time in a row. Parvesh Sahib Singh Verma won the West Delhi seat with a margin of 5,78,486 votes, the highest victory margin in Delhi in 2019 Lok Sabha elections. East Delhi candidate Gautam Gambhir, fighting his first elections, won with a margin of 3,91,222.

headlines: BJP's VK Singh wins from Ghaziabad for 2nd time by 5 lakh votes
text: BJP candidate and Union Minister VK Singh has won the Ghaziabad Lok Sabha seat by over 5 lakh votes against Samajwadi Party's Suresh Bansal. The former Army chief had won the constituency by a record 5.67 lakh votes in 2014. Singh had said that with the "help of citizens and media, Ghaziabad can be a number one city in cleanliness".

headlines: Smriti Irani beats Rahul as BJP wins Amethi seat after 20 years
text: BJP leader and Union Minister Smriti Irani defeated Congress President Rahul Gandhi by a margin of 55,120 votes to win the Amethi Lok Sabha seat. This is the first time since 1999 that BJP has won the Amethi constituency. In 2014 Lok Sabha elections, Rahul had won the Amethi seat, beating Irani by over one lakh votes.

headlines: Congress wins 8 Lok Sabha seats in Punjab, BJP 2, SAD 2 and AAP 1
text: The Congress party on Thursday won eight of the 13 seats in the 17th Lok Sabha elections in Punjab, clinching the Amritsar, Jalandhar, Ludhiana and Patiala seats among others. The BJP's candidates Sunny Deol and Som Parkash won from Gurdaspur and Hoshiarpur respectively. Shiromani Akali Dal's Harsimrat Kaur Badal and Sukhbir Singh Badal won from Bathinda and Firozpur respectively.

headlines: Congress' Urmila loses to BJP's Gopal Shetty in Mumbai North
text: BJP candidate Gopal Shetty won from the Mumbai North Lok Sabha constituency and defeated Congress candidate Urmila Matondkar by a margin of 4,65,247 votes. The actress-turned-politician was contesting the elections for the first time. Meanwhile, BJP's Poonam Mahajan won the Mumbai North central seat by defeating Congress candidate Priya Dutt with a margin of 1,30,005 votes.

headlines: BJP crosses majority mark in Lok Sabha polls for 2nd straight time
text: The BJP has crossed the majority mark on its own in Lok Sabha elections for the second straight time. BJP, which won 282 seats on its own in 2014 general elections, has won 274 seats so far and is heading towards the 300-seat mark, as per the latest data by Election Commission. Congress has won 47 seats so far.

headlines: BJP sweeps MP, Raj, Chhattisgarh in LS polls after assembly loss
text: BJP has won 28/29 seats in Madhya Pradesh, 24/25 in Rajasthan and 9/11 seats in Chhattisgarh in the 2019 Lok Sabha elections after losing the three states in the 2018 Assembly elections. BJP has ruled MP and Chhattisgarh for 15 straight years before the 2018 loss while Rajasthan has seen alternating BJP and Congress governments for the last two decades.

headlines: SP's Akhilesh wins Azamgarh seat which his father won in 2014
text: Samajwadi Party President Akhilesh Yadav defeated BJP candidate Dinesh Lal Yadav 'Nirahua' to win the Azamgarh seat, which his father Mulayam Singh had won in 2014. Akhilesh had won his first Lok Sabha election as a candidate from Kannauj in 2000 and was re-elected in 2004 and 2009. In 2009, he also won from Firozabad and chose to represent Kannauj.

headlines: Nitin Gadkari wins Maharashtra's Nagpur Lok Sabha seat by 2L votes
text: Union Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari won Maharashtra's Nagpur Lok Sabha seat by defeating Congress' Nana Patole by a margin of 2,16,009 votes. Gadkari had ousted four-time Congress MP Vilas Muttemwar in 2014 Lok Sabha elections. He had then won the seat with a margin of over 2.8 lakh votes.

headlines: Zakir Musa, J&K's most wanted terrorist, killed in encounter
text: Jammu and Kashmir's most wanted terrorist Zakir Musa, who's believed to be the chief of Al-Qaeda's Ansar Ghazwat-ul-Hind, has been killed in an encounter in Tral, police said. A joint team of Army's 42 RR, SOG and CRPF launched a cordon and search operation after receiving intelligence input about Musa's location. He'd been hiding there for a couple of days.

headlines: Wish you an even more successful second term: Akshay Kumar to PM
text: Actor Akshay Kumar on Thursday took to Twitter to congratulate PM Narendra Modi and tweeted, "Heartiest congratulations Honourable Prime Minister Narendra Modi ji on the historic win." He added, "All your efforts to advance the nation and put it on the global map have been acknowledged." "Wishing you an even more successful second term," the actor further said.

headlines: PM Modi expresses gratitude to Pak PM Imran Khan for good wishes
text: PM Narendra Modi, who claimed victory in 17th Lok Sabha elections, took to Twitter to express his gratitude to Pakistan PM Imran Khan for his good wishes. "I have always given primacy to peace and development in our region," he wrote. "Look forward to working with him for peace, progress and prosperity in South Asia," Pakistan PM Khan had tweeted.

headlines: The nation is with you: Sachin Tendulkar congratulates PM Modi
text: Former India cricketer Sachin Tendulkar took to Twitter to congratulate Prime Minister Narendra Modi as BJP-led NDA took a majority lead in the 17th Lok Sabha elections. "My heartiest congratulations to @narendramodi Ji & @BJP4India for winning the #LokSabhaElections2019...The nation is with you in building a brighter and stronger New India," he added.

headlines: May the second innings be even better: Sehwag to PM Modi
text: After PM Modi claimed victory in the 17th Lok Sabha elections, former Team India opener Virender Sehwag took to Twitter to congratulate him. "India has won. The world's largest democracy has given its mandate. May the second innings be even better and India continue to progress and reach greater heights. Jai Hind," he wrote.

headlines: Rajyavardhan beats Poonia by 3.93 lakh votes, wins Jaipur Rural seat
text: Union Minister Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore defeated Krishna Poonia by 3.93 lakh votes to win the Jaipur Rural Lok Sabha seat. The former Olympian got a total of 8,20,132 votes, 1,87,202 votes more than he received in 2014 elections. Krishna Poonia, who is a Commonwealth Games gold medallist, had won the Sadulpur constituency seat in Rajasthan Assembly elections in December 2018.

headlines: SP's Azam Khan beats Jaya Prada in UP's Rampur by 1 lakh votes
text: Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan today defeated actor-turned-politician and BJP candidate Jaya Prada by over one lakh votes in Uttar Pradesh's Rampur seat. Azam Khan had made controversial statements during his election campaign, saying he recognised Jaya's association with the RSS as the colour of her underwear was "khaki". Notably, Jaya had joined the BJP in March this year.

headlines: Woman tries to return product to Amazon CEO in meeting: Report
text: World's richest person, Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos was reportedly asked by a woman to accept the return of a product at the annual shareholder meeting on Wednesday. She reportedly said she tried to return it four times unsuccessfully. "My apologies you had to use this unusual venue to accomplish what should've been a routine task," Bezos reportedly replied jokingly.

headlines: Not EVMs, but Hindu minds rigged: Owaisi on LS poll results
text: After the poll trends showed BJP scoring majority in Lok Sabha, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Thursday said, "EVM hasn't been rigged, but Hindu minds have been rigged." He claimed that BJP created fear over the issue of national security and used it to their advantage. "They created the narrative of nationalism, they created fear of Muslim minority," he added.

headlines: Triumph of national forces: RSS welcomes BJP's victory
text: The Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) welcomed BJP's victory in the Lok Sabha elections, calling it "the triumph of the national forces". "Crores of people of Bharat are fortunate to once again have a stable government," RSS general secretary Bhaiyyaji Joshi said. "Many compliments to each and everyone who have contributed to this victory of democracy," he added.

headlines: People wanted to give PM Modi 2nd chance for development: Nitish
text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Thursday said that the Opposition has failed to read the people's aspirations, who wanted to give another chance to PM Narendra Modi for development. He added, "The people's mandate expressed today in favour of NDA shows deep electoral emotion of people." Kumar said, "The people are lord in democracy and we should honour their verdict."

headlines: Bottle caps measure alcohol left inside using sound waves
text: US-based consumer good solutions startup Nectar has developed bottle caps that measure the amount of alcohol and other liquid left inside of a bottle using sound waves. The caps measure the time taken by the waves to bounce back from the liquid to calculate the quantity. Nectar has announced it has raised $10-million Series A funding led by Dragon Capital.

headlines: 18 Earth-sized planets discovered outside solar system
text: German scientists have discovered 18 Earth-sized planets beyond solar system, one of which is smallest known so far while the other could offer life-friendly conditions. Scientists re-analysed part of NASA's Kepler Telescope data using new method developed by them. They estimate the method may lead to over 100 more exoplanet discoveries from entire Kepler dataset.

headlines: China source of banned ozone-depleting CFC emissions: Study
text: A study by international researchers has pinpointed Eastern China as the source of about 40%-60% of the global rise in emissions of banned ozone-layer depleting chemical CFC-11 since 2013. Findings from air monitoring stations in South Korea and Japan revealed CFC-11 rose in that region, particularly Shandong and Hebei provinces, by around 7,000 tonnes annually after 2012, a researcher said.

headlines: Prada to stop using animal fur in its collections
text: Italian fashion house Prada has announced it will stop using fur in its collections. The ban will be effective from September for its spring/summer 2020 women's collections, although items that have already been made will continue to be sold. The decision comes after a "positive dialogue" with the Fur Free Alliance (FFA) comprising 50 associations in 40 countries, Prada said.

headlines: BJP's Pragya beats Cong's Digvijaya by 3.64 lakh votes in Bhopal
text: BJP candidate Pragya Singh Thakur beat Congress leader and two-time Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Digvijaya Singh by 3.64 lakh votes to win the Bhopal constituency in 17th Lok Sabha elections. BJP has never lost in a Lok Sabha election in Bhopal since 1989. BJP's Alok Sanjar had won from the seat in 2014.

headlines: Shah wins in Gandhinagar by 5.57L votes, breaks Advani's record
text: BJP National President Amit Shah won the Gandhinagar seat held by veteran party leader LK Advani, beating nearest rival Congress' CJ Chavda by 5.57 lakh votes. With this, Shah broke the record of Advani, who had won the seat in 2014 by a margin of 4.83 lakh votes. Notably, Amit Shah was contesting Lok Sabha elections for the first time.

headlines: BJP's Maneka Gandhi wins from Sultanpur, son Varun wins Pilibhit
text: Union Minister Maneka Gandhi won by a margin of 14,526 votes against Bahujan Samaj Party's Chandra Bhadra Singh (Sonu) in Uttar Pradesh's Sultanpur constituency. Meanwhile, Maneka's son Varun Gandhi won from the Pilibhit seat by defeating Samajwadi Party's Hemraj Verma by over 2.55 lakh votes. Maneka is a six-time MP from Pilibhit while Varun had won in Sultanpur in 2014.

headlines: Tharoor wins Thiruvananthapuram LS seat for 3rd time in a row
text: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor won the Thiruvananthapuram Lok Sabha seat by defeating BJP's Kummanam Rajasekharan by a margin of 99,989 votes. This is the third time that Tharoor has won the Thiruvananthapuram Lok Sabha constituency. In the 2014 general elections, Tharoor had defeated BJP candidate O Rajagopal by a margin of 15,470 votes.

headlines: Former PM HD Deve Gowda loses Tumkur seat by 13,339 votes
text: Former Prime Minister and JD(S) chief HD Deve Gowda lost from Karnataka's Tumkur constituency by 13,339 votes. BJP's GS Basavaraj won the seat after receiving 5,96,127 votes, while Deve Gowda got 5,82,788 votes. The third best candidate, CPI's N Shivanna, received 17,227 votes. Deve Gowda had won the 2014 Lok Sabha elections from the Hassan LS constituency.

headlines: BJP clinches all 4 seats in Himachal, Anurag wins by 3.99 lakh votes
text: The BJP won all the four seats in Himachal Pradesh, with all its candidates winning by a margin of over 3 lakh votes each. Anurag Singh Thakur won the Hamirpur seat for the fourth straight time by a margin of 3,99,572 votes. Kishan Kapoor, Ram Swaroop Sharma and Suresh Kumar Kashyap won the Kangra, Mandi and Shimla constituencies respectively.

headlines: Rahul wins Wayanad by 4.31L votes, highest margin in Kerala ever
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi has won Wayanad Lok Sabha constituency, beating his nearest-rival CPI's PP Suneer by 4.31 lakh votes. This is the highest margin by which any candidate has won a Lok Sabha seat from Kerala. The previous record was held by IUML's E Ahamed, who won Malappuram seat in 2014 by a margin of 1,94,739 votes.

headlines: 2-time MP from Patna Sahib Shatrughan loses to Prasad by 2.84L votes
text: BJP leader and Union Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad defeated Shatrughan Sinha, who had defected to Congress from BJP last month, by 2.84 lakh votes to win the Patna Sahib Lok Sabha constituency. Shatrughan had won the seat both times (2009, 2014) since it was created in 2008. Ravi Shankar Prasad was contesting Lok Sabha election for the first time.

headlines: SP founder Mulayam Singh Yadav wins Mainpuri seat for 5th time
text: Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav won Mainpuri Lok Sabha seat for the fifth time, beating BJP's Prem Singh Shakya by 94,389 votes. Mulayam earlier won from Mainpuri in 1996, 2004, 2009 and 2014 but vacated it in 2014 as he had won from Azamgarh too. His son and party president Akhilesh is the candidate from Azamgarh this time.

headlines: After 17 years, Congress' Jyotiraditya Scindia loses to BJP in Guna
text: Congress MP Jyotiraditya Scindia has lost from his Guna Lok Sabha constituency in Madhya Pradesh to BJP's Dr KP Yadav by over 1.25 lakh votes. Guna seat was held by Jyotiraditya's father Madhavrao Scindia from 1971-84 and 1999-2001 until his demise, following which Jyotiraditya won four straight times. Interestingly, Madhavrao's mother Vijaya Raje was a Guna BJP MP from 1989-99.

headlines: Great things in store for US-India ties: Trump congratulates PM Modi
text: US President Donald Trump on Thursday congratulated PM Narendra Modi over the electoral victory. "Congratulations to Prime Minister @narendramodi and his BJP party on their BIG election victory! Great things are in store for the US-India partnership with the return of PM Modi at the helm," he tweeted. "I look forward to continuing our important work together!" he further said.

headlines: Telangana CM's daughter Kavitha loses to BJP candidate in Nizamabad
text: Nizamabad's sitting MP K Kavitha, who is also the daughter of Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao, lost her seat to BJP candidate Arvind Dharmapuri by 70,000 votes. Kavitha was also contesting against more than 175 turmeric farmers who filed nominations in protest. The TRS leader defeated Congress candidate Madhu Goud Yaskhi by more than 1.5 lakh votes in 2014.

headlines: Cong's Ramya Haridas becomes Kerala's second-ever Dalit woman MP
text: Ramya Haridas, Congress' Lok Sabha candidate from Alathur constituency in Kerala is set to become the second-ever Dalit woman MP from the state. She defeated senior CPI(M) leader and sitting MP PK Biju with a margin of nearly 1.59 lakh votes. The 32-year-old, who has a habit of breaking into songs during rallies, recited a poem to thank the voters.

headlines: Israel PM calls PM Modi to congratulate, shares video of conversation
text: Israel's PM Benjamin Netanyahu on Thursday called PM Narendra Modi to congratulate him and said, "Narendra, my friend, congratulations! What an enormous victory!" A video of the call was shared by Netanyahu, where he says, "I hope we can see each other as soon as you form the government." He added, "You don't need a coalition, I do."

headlines: Salman Khan, other B'wood celebs congratulate PM on Twitter
text: After trends showed NDA getting a majority in the general polls, actor Salman Khan and other Bollywood celebrities including Shilpa Shetty and Twinkle Khanna congratulated PM Narendra Modi on Twitter. Calling it a "decisive victory", Salman tweeted, "We stand by you in building a stronger India." "Dekha Yoga se hi hoga! Isse kehtey hai. Bhoomi Bhanjan election Pradarshan!" Shilpa tweeted.

headlines: We accept peopleÂ’s verdict, congratulate PM Modi: Priyanka
text: Congress General Secretary for eastern Uttar Pradesh, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, on Thursday congratulated PM Narendra Modi. "We accept people's verdict and congratulate PM Modi and BJP workers," she said. Congress President Rahul Gandhi also congratulated the PM and said that he takes full responsibility of Congress' defeat in the Lok Sabha elections.

headlines: PM Modi, Shah architects of this stupendous win: Hema Malini
text: BJP leader Hema Malini won the Mathura parliamentary seat by over 2.9 lakh votes and said that PM Narendra Modi and BJP President Amit Shah are the architects of this "stupendous win". Thanking BJP karyakartas for her win, she added that their "committed, tireless hard work" has made all this possible. She said, "The Opposition and Congress [are] silenced totally."

headlines: No one can counter PM Modi for next 25 years: Shiv Sena
text: The Shiv Sena praised PM Narendra Modi as the trends showed a majority for NDA in the general elections and said, "Today's mandate is such that no one can counter (PM Modi) for the next 25 years." Sena MP Sanjay Raut added that the entire country is "Modi-may". He said the people have given a "befitting reply" to the Opposition.

headlines: Barcelona goalkeeper Ter Stegen to miss Copa del Rey final
text: Barcelona goalkeeper Marc-Andre ter Stegen has been ruled out of the Copa del Rey final against Valencia as he is experiencing discomfort in his right knee and will continue to receive treatment. In the current season, the 27-year old goalkeeper played in 49 games, including both legs of the Copa del Rey semifinals against Real Madrid.

headlines: Ajinkya Rahane scores ton on county debut for Hampshire
text: India's Test vice-captain Ajinkya Rahane scored a ton on his county debut for Hampshire. Rahane came into bat at 9 for 2, after which he and Hampshire skipper Sam Northeast struck a 257-run stand. Rahane, who has gone 17 Tests without a century, is the first Indian to represent the Hampshire county side.

headlines: Instagram celebs' data was already public, Chtrbox denies leak
text: Mumbai-based Instagram influencer marketing platform Chtrbox denied reports that it leaked data of over 4.9 crore influencers, adding they've never even had data of over 3.5 lakh users. The platform alleged data found online was already public. Chtrbox CEO said a fraction of their database was exposed for a few hours adding that it did not contain any private information.

headlines: Spotify asks users to reset passwords over security concerns
text: A Spotify spokesperson told TechCrunch that in an effort to combat fraudulent activity on its service, it "shared a communication with select users to reset their passwords as...precaution". Reportedly, some users got email from Spotify informing them their passwords had been reset Â“due to detected suspicious activity". Spotify recommended users to not use same credentials across various services.

headlines: Sikkim CM Chamling wins both the Assembly seats he contested
text: Sikkim CM Pawan Chamling on Thursday won both the Assembly seats he contested in the state Assembly elections. State CM for five consecutive terms, Chamling won the Poklok-Kamrang Assembly seat by 2,899 votes over Sikkim Krantikari Morcha's (SKM) Kharka Bahadur Rai. Sikkim Democratic Front (SDF) supremo, Chamling also won the Namchi-Singhithang Assembly seat by 377 votes over SKM's Ganesh Rai.

headlines: Ex-Nissan boss Ghosn to ask for monitored visit with spouse
text: Sacked Nissan Chairman Carlos Ghosn will ask a Japanese court to allow him one monitored visit with his wife Carole, his legal team said on Thursday. This comes after the Supreme Court on Monday upheld restrictions on contact with his spouse, part of his $4.5 million bail. The 65-year-old is currently awaiting trial on charges of financial misconduct.

headlines: Morgan Stanley sets Sensex target at 45,000 by June 2020
text: US' Morgan Stanley has set a Sensex target of 45,000 by June 2020. The brokerage firm expects PM Narendra Modi's administration to continue with its "inflation framework, fiscal consolidation, infrastructure spending, FDI focus and strong external affairs policies." It further added Asian Paints and InterGlobe Aviation to its 'Focus List' and removed Adani Ports and Eicher Motors.

headlines: Sonia Gandhi wins Rae Bareli seat for the 5th time in a row
text: UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi defeated BJP's Dinesh Pratap Singh by a margin of 1.67 lakh votes to win the Rae Bareli seat for the fifth straight time including once in a by-election. In 2014, she had defeated BJP's Ajay Agrawal by around 3.52 lakh votes. She had become MP for the first time in 1999 from the Amethi constituency.

headlines: BJP wins in Indore for 9th straight time with highest-ever margin
text: BJP's Shankar Lalwani defeated Congress leader Pankaj Sanghvi in Indore by 5,47,754 votes, the biggest ever margin for the Madhya Pradesh Lok Sabha seat. Previously, Lok Sabha Speaker Sumitra Mahajan won the seat eight times in a row from 1989-2014. The 76-year-old who won 2014 elections by a margin of 4.66 lakh votes, announced she wouldn't be contesting in 2019.

headlines: Shiromani Akali Dal's Harsimrat Kaur Badal wins Bathinda LS seat
text: Shiromani Akali Dal's (SAD) Harsimrat Kaur Badal on Thursday won Punjab's Bathinda Lok Sabha seat by a margin of 21,772 votes. She defeated Congress party's Amrinder Singh Raja Warring. Harsimrat Kaur Badal had won the seat in 2014 Lok Sabha elections too with a margin of 19,395 votes.

headlines: MP CM Kamal Nath's son Nakul wins father's Chhindwara seat
text: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Kamal Nath's son Nakul Kamal Nath won the Chhindwara Lok Sabha seat on Congress ticket on Thursday by a margin of 37,536 votes. He defeated Bharatiya Janata Party's candidate Nathansaha Kawreti from the seat. Nakul's father Kamal Nath had won the seat in 2014 Lok Sabha elections by a margin of 1,16,537 votes.

headlines: AIMIM chief Owaisi wins Hyderabad LS seat for 4th straight time
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has won the Hyderabad Lok Sabha seat for the fourth straight time, beating BJP's Bhagavanth Rao by a margin of 2,82,186 votes. Asaduddin's father Sultan Salahuddin Owaisi had won the seat in 1984, 1989, 1991, 1996, 1998 and 1999. Asaduddin won the seat for the first time in 2004 and then in 2009 and 2014.

headlines: BJP's Gautam Gambhir wins East Delhi LS seat by 3.91 lakh votes
text: BJP's Gautam Gambhir, fighting the Lok Sabha elections for the first time, defeated Congress' Arvinder Singh Lovely by 3,91,222 votes to win the East Delhi Lok Sabha seat. AAP's Atishi, who was also fighting the general elections for the first time, received 2,19,328 votes and came third. In 2014, BJP's Maheish Girri had won the seat, defeating AAP's Rajmohan Gandhi.

headlines: BJP wins Gulbarga seat after 20 years as Congress' Kharge loses
text: Leader of Opposition for Congress in Lok Sabha Mallikarjun Kharge has lost the Gulbarga seat in Karnataka to Umesh Jadhav, a rebel Congress leader who joined BJP, by 95,452 votes. Kharge, 76, had a track record of 11 straight wins, nine times for Assembly and twice in Lok Sabha. The BJP had won the Gulbarga seat only once in 1998.

headlines: Manoj Tiwari defeats Sheila Dikshit by a margin of 3.66 lakh votes
text: Bharatiya Janata Party leader Manoj Tiwari has defeated former Delhi Chief Minister and Congress' Sheila Dikshit from North East Delhi Lok Sabha constituency by a margin of 3.66 lakh votes. Manoj Tiwari won the seat in 2014 with 45.23% of the vote. Dikshit did not contest the 2014 Lok Sabha elections.

headlines: Actor Sunny Deol wins Gurdaspur Lok Sabha seat in his political debut
text: Actor Sunny Deol, who made his political debut on BJP ticket from PunjabÂ’s Gurdaspur Lok Sabha seat, has won with a margin of 82,459 votes. He defeated Congress' Sunil Jakhar, who won the seat in the 2017 by-poll, necessitated after sitting MP Vinod Khanna's demise. Gurdaspur was represented by late actor Khanna four times - 1998, 1999, 2004 and 2014.

headlines: Cong's Milind Deora, endorsed by Mukesh Ambani, loses in Mumbai
text: Shiv Sena's Arvind Ganpat Sawant defeated Mumbai Congress President Milind Deora from the Mumbai South Lok Sabha seat by a margin of 1,00,067 votes. In April, Mukesh Ambani and Uday Kotak had endorsed Deora for the elections. Meanwhile, Congress candidates Urmila Matondkar and Priya Dutt are trailing in Mumbai North and Mumbai North Central seats respectively.

headlines: Rajnath records BJP's 8th consecutive win in Lucknow constituency
text: Home Minister Rajnath Singh received 6,33,026 votes and won the Lucknow Lok Sabha seat by a margin of 3,47,302 votes, recording his second successive win from the constituency. Lucknow seat has been a BJP stronghold for around 28 years. SP's Poonam Sinha, wife of Congress' Shatrughan Sinha, won 2,85,724 votes, while Congress' Acharya Pramod Krishnam got 1,80,011 votes.

headlines: This govt will ensure we shed 'developing' nation tag: SpiceJet MD
text: SpiceJet MD Ajay Singh on Thursday said this government will ensure that we shed the 'developing' country tag and "proudly take our place in the big league of economic superpowers". Congratulating PM Narendra Modi on his victory, Singh added that India must grow at 10% for the next ten years. He called the election verdict a big win for India.

headlines: I'll be available for help & collaboration: AAP's Atishi to Gambhir
text: AAP leader Atishi on Thursday congratulated Gautam Gambhir after the trends showed him winning the East Delhi Lok Sabha seat, and said, "I will always be available for help and collaboration." According to the trends, BJP's Gambhir is leading with a margin of almost four lakh votes against Congress leader Arvinder Singh Lovely, while Atishi is a distant third.

headlines: Lagta hai picture baaki hai: Gambhir as Harbhajan congratulates him
text: After off-spinner Harbhajan Singh praised Gautam Gambhir on winning East Delhi Lok Sabha seat, the cricketer-turned-politician tweeted, "Thanks a lot Bhajji paa...Ur wishes mean a lot to me." "Just hoping to make a difference to as many lives as possible. Saw a glimpse of you in IPL...the turn, the bounce everything is there...lagta hai picture abhi baaki hai," he added.

headlines: Sushma ji said we talk bitterly, so she brought sweets: Pak Minister
text: Pakistan's Foreign Minister Shah Mahmood Qureshi on Wednesday said, "Sushma ji had a complaint that we sometimes talk in a bitter manner. She brought sweets today so we could also speak sweetly." Pakistan media reported External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj met Qureshi on the sidelines of a meeting in Kyrgyzstan, a day before the announcement of Lok Sabha election results.

headlines: Bangladesh PM sends congratulatory message to PM Modi
text: Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina sent a congratulatory message to PM Narendra Modi on his election victory. She said this "emphatic verdict is a reflection of the trust and confidence reposed on you by the people of the world's largest democracy". "My best wishes for your good health, continued success and long life," Hasina added.

headlines: Union cabinet, Council of Ministers meet to be held tomorrow
text: The Union Cabinet and Council of Ministers meeting will take place tomorrow (May 24) to recommend the dissolution of the 16th Lok Sabha. After the Cabinet's recommendation is passed in the form of a resolution, President Ram Nath Kovind will dissolve the present Lok Sabha. The 17th Lok Sabha will be constituted before June 3.

headlines: Raj Thackeray terms LS poll results 'beyond rationale'
text: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray on Thursday took to Twitter and said that the Lok Sabha poll trends suggesting a victory for the ruling party are "beyond rationale". In another tweet, Thackeray said the results were "anakalniya" (incomprehensible). As per the trends in Maharashtra, BJP and allies are leading in 41 seats out of 48.

headlines: It was 'wrong' to call PM Modi a 'thief': Nitin Gadkari
text: After the trends of the Lok Sabha poll results showed NDA getting a majority, BJP leader Nitin Gadkari said that it was "wrong" to call PM Narendra Modi a "thief". He added that the PM doesn't belong to a party but the nation. Gadkari further said that people have shown faith that PM Modi's rule can "change the nation".

headlines: Ancient ice found buried 1.6 km under Mars north pole
text: US-based scientists have discovered layers of ancient ice buried around 1.6 kilometres under the Martian north pole after studying data gathered by NASA's Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter. Scientists said if melted, the polar ice would result in Mars being covered by at least five-foot-deep water. "That likely makes it the third largest water reservoir on Mars," researchers said.

headlines: Fortis investors move SEBI over delay in IHH open offer
text: Some minority shareholders of Fortis Healthcare have moved SEBI to direct Malaysia's IHH Healthcare to pay them interest for the delay in the open offer to buy additional 26% stake in Fortis Healthcare. The offer was to open for subscription from December 18, 2018, to January 1. However, IHH had to put the offer on hold following Supreme Court's order.

headlines: India's crude oil imports jump 14% in April to 6-month high
text: India's crude oil imports jumped 14% year-on-year in April to 19.72 million tonnes, the highest since October 2018, government data showed. Oil imports from Iran had fallen 57% year-on-year in April after waiver from US sanctions on Iran ended recently, Reuters reported. The government had earlier this month said it will decide on Iranian oil imports post elections.

headlines: Giriraj Singh defeats Kanhaiya Kumar by 4.22 lakh votes in Begusarai
text: BJP's Giriraj Singh has won the Begusarai Lok Sabha constituency, defeating CPI's Kanhaiya Kumar by 4.22 lakh votes. BJP's Bhola Singh had won from the seat in 2014 Lok Sabha elections, while JD(U)'s Monazir Hassan had won the seat in the 2009 elections. Giriraj had won the 2014 elections from the Nawada seat.

headlines: PM Narendra Modi wins Varanasi Lok Sabha seat by 4.79 lakh votes
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today won the Varanasi Lok Sabha seat by defeating Samajwadi Party candidate Shalini Yadav by a margin of 4.79 lakh votes. This is the second straight time that PM Modi has won the parliamentary seat from Varanasi. In 2014, he had won the seat by a margin of around 3.7 lakh votes against Arvind Kejriwal.

headlines: BJP's Sakshi Maharaj wins from Unnao by a margin of 4 lakh votes
text: The Bharatiya Janata Party's candidate from Uttar Pradesh's Unnao, Swami Sakshi Maharaj won from the constituency by a margin of 4,00,956 votes on Thursday. The Samajwadi Party had fielded Arun Shanker Shukla from the constituency. The BJP's Sakshi Maharaj had won the constituency in 2014 too with a margin of 3,10,173 votes.

headlines: BJP's Ravi Kishan wins Gorakhpur constituency by 3 lakh votes
text: Bhojpuri actor and Bharatiya Janata Party's Ravi Kishan has won Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur Lok Sabha constituency by over 3 lakh votes. Kishan fought against Congress' Madhusudan Tripathi and Samajwadi Party's Rambhual Nishad. In the 2014 Lok Sabha Election, UP CM Yogi Adityanath beat Rajmati Nishad of SP by receiving 51.80% of the votes.

headlines: BJP's youngest candidate wins Bangalore South seat by 3.3 lakh votes
text: The youngest candidate of Bharatiya Janata Party, 28-year-old Tejasvi Surya has won the Bangalore South constituency by a margin of 3,31,192 votes. Surya, who got 7,39,229 votes defeated Congress' BK Hariprasad, who managed to get 4,08,037 votes. Surya is the General Secretary of the BJP's youth wing in Karnataka.

headlines: PM addresses BJP workers, says 'logon ne fakir ki jholi bhar di'
text: PM Narendra Modi arrived at the BJP headquarters in New Delhi and said, "Logon ne fakir ki jholi bhar di," adding, "I bow to the 130 crore citizens of the country for today's mandate." The BJP had asked 20,000 party workers from across the country to reach its headquarters. Meanwhile, PM Modi has won from Varanasi by 4.79 lakh votes.

headlines: N Chandrababu Naidu resigns as CM of Andhra Pradesh
text: N Chandrababu Naidu has resigned as Andhra Pradesh CM after trends showed his Telugu Desam Party (TDP) leading in only 23 Assembly seats and winning two. YS Jagan Mohan Reddy-led YSR Congress Party (YSRCP) is leading in 138 Assembly seats and has won 12. The Legislative Party meeting of YSRCP is set to take place on May 25.

headlines: How are celebrity politicians performing in 17th LS elections?
text: BJP's Hema Malini and Sunny Deol are leading in their respective seats in the 17th Lok Sabha elections. Meanwhile Shatrughan Sinha, who defected to Congress from BJP last month, is trailing from the Patna Sahib constituency. BJP's Jaya Prada and Congress' Urmila Matondkar are also trailing from their respective constituencies. Further, Prakash Raj has received 28,822 votes till now.

headlines: Kaun kehta hai aasmaan mai suraakh nahin ho sakta: Smriti Irani
text: After Congress President Rahul Gandhi conceded defeat in UP's Amethi, his rival BJP candidate Smriti Irani tweeted, "Kaun kehta hai aasmaan mai suraakh nahin ho sakta (Who says sky can't be pierced)". This is the first time since 1999 that BJP has won the Amethi constituency. Rahul won the Amethi seat in 2014, beating Irani by over one lakh votes.

headlines: Kejriwal lost reputation, will lose power after 8 months: Gambhir
text: BJP leader Gautam Gambhir, who is leading East Delhi Lok Sabha seat against Congress' Arvinder Singh Lovely and AAP's Atishi, tweeted, "In this election, Arvind Kejriwal has lost his reputation and faith, he'll lose his power after 8 months." Gambhir was referring to Delhi Assembly elections scheduled for 2020. He added that people supported BJP's 'Gambhir' (serious) ideology in elections.

headlines: I accept the mandate: Digvijaya concedes defeat to Pragya in Bhopal
text: Two-time Madhya Pradesh CM and Congress Lok Sabha candidate from Bhopal, Digvijaya Singh, conceded defeat to BJP's Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur and said, "I accept people's mandate". This comes as Sadhvi Pragya is leading by over 3 lakh votes as per the Election Commission website. Singh was also spotted sitting with Sadhvi Pragya at the counting centre on Thursday.

headlines: Rahul Gandhi's 'offer to resign' not true, Congress clarifies
text: The Congress party denied reports that Rahul Gandhi has offered to resign as Congress President. When asked during his press conference about fixing responsibility for loss in the 2019 Lok Sabha elections, Rahul Gandhi said, "This is between my party and I." Rahul had congratulated PM Narendra Modi as BJP won majority in the leads tally.

headlines: PM congratulates Odisha CM for winning Assembly polls for 5th time
text: PM Narendra Modi today congratulated Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik for winning the state Assembly elections for a record fifth time in a row. "Congratulations to Naveen Babu for yet another victory in Odisha. Wishing him the very best for the next term," PM Modi tweeted. Patnaik-led Biju Janata Dal is leading in over 100 seats in the 147-member Odisha Assembly.

headlines: Have to pay the price for mistakes committed: AAP's Alka Lamba
text: Reacting to BJP leading in all the seven seats in Delhi, AAP's Alka Lamba said that it's time to learn from the mandate and celebrate the votes garnered by each party, adding that a certain price has to be paid for the mistakes committed. "Congratulations to those who won and no sympathies for those who lost," she added.

headlines: Thank you India! Faith you put in our alliance humbling: PM Modi
text: After claiming victory in the 2019 Lok Sabha elections, Prime Minister Narendra Modi tweeted, "Thank you India! The faith placed in our alliance is humbling and gives us strength to work even harder to fulfil people's aspirations." "I salute every BJP Karyakarta for their determination, perseverance & hardwork. They went home to home, elaborating on our development agenda," he added.

headlines: Voice of the people is the voice of God: Navjot Singh Sidhu
text: As the trends showed BJP-led NDA all set to form a second consecutive government at the Centre, Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu tweeted, "Voice of the people is the voice of God." As per trends, Congress will win eight of the 13 LS seats in Punjab. However, Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh said Congress is paying for Sidhu's Pakistan visit.

headlines: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal congratulates PM Narendra Modi
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday congratulated PM Narendra Modi for BJP-led NDA's "historic win". "I look forward to working together for the betterment of the people of Delhi," Arvind Kejriwal added. The Bharatiya Janata Party was leading in all seven seats in Delhi as per the trends.

headlines: Gopal becomes first HIV-infected climber to scale Everest
text: Gopal Shrestha, a 56-year-old from Nepal's Pokhara, on Wednesday became the first HIV-infected climber to scale the world's highest peak, the Mount Everest. Shrestha, who used to play football for Nepal, climbed the peak in his second attempt after being forced to abandon his first attempt due to the deadly earthquake in Nepal in 2015.

headlines: AI system creates fake videos from single face pic, painting
text: Samsung AI Center researchers have built a new AI system that creates lifelike motion by looking at people's faces from images or even paintings. The new system doesn't require training on videos and works even with a single image or painting, researchers revealed. The method applies facial landmarks from a video of a real face to the image or painting.

headlines: Modi wave became tsunami this time: Devendra Fadnavis
text: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis has said that "Modi wave" of 2014 polls turned into "tsunami" this time. "People have put their trust in PM Narendra Modi and BJP, and the efforts taken to resolve the issues before the country," he added. "Going by the current trends, I think our seats in Maharashtra are likely to go up," Fadnavis further said.

headlines: Opposition should learn lessons from debacle: CPI leader
text: Communist Party of India (CPI) National Secretary D Raja on Thursday said Opposition parties must learn lessons from the Lok Sabha elections' defeat. "Opposition parties...couldn't provide a credible, viable alternative by uniting...each other in every state," he added. Raja further said Congress President Rahul Gandhi shouldn't have contested from Wayanad and his "decision was shortsighted".

headlines: Indian climber passes away while descending Mount Everest
text: Indian climber Anjali S Kulkarni passed away while descending the Mount Everest on Wednesday. The Mumbai-based 54-year-old passed away near Camp IV, which lies roughly at the 8,000-metre point. Notably, a few days ago, another Indian climber Ravi Thakar passed away at the Camp IV while returning from the 8,848-metre-high summit last week.

headlines: PSG chief Nasser Al-Khelaifi charged with corruption
text: French football club Paris Saint-Germain's chief Nasser Al-Khelaifi was on Thursday charged with corruption in connection with the bidding process for the 2017 and 2019 editions of the World Athletics Championships. The authorities are investigating two payments of $3.5 million made in 2011 by Oryx Qatar Sports Investment, a company jointly owned by Al-Khelaifi and his brother Khalid.

headlines: NDPPÂ’s Sharingain Longkumer wins Nagaland's Aonglenden by-poll
text: Nationalist Democratic Progressive Party (NDPP) candidate Sharingain Longkumer on Thursday won the by-poll to the Aonglenden Assembly seat in Nagaland's Mokokchung district. A total of 10,997 votes were cast and Longkumer won by 6,245 votes over Congress candidate Alem Jongshi. The by-poll was necessitated following the death of sitting NDPP MLA Imtikumzuk Longkumer last September.

headlines: Rahul Gandhi concedes defeat in Amethi while counting still on
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi conceded defeat in UP's Amethi while the counting is still on. Gandhi contested against Bharatiya Janata Party's Smriti Irani, who is till now leading by over 35,000 votes. Rahul also accepted the people's decision and congratulated Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his party as trends showed BJP winning with a majority.

headlines: Which Union Ministers are trailing behind in Lok Sabha elections?
text: Union Minister of Communications, BJP's Manoj Sinha, is trailing behind BSP's Afzal Ansari in UP's Ghazipur by 65,000 votes. Union Minister of State for Tourism, BJP's KJ Alphons is trailing behind Congress and CPI(M) candidates in Kerala's Ernakulam. MoS in Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs, BJP's Hardeep Singh Puri, is trailing in Amritsar by over 98,000 votes.

headlines: Pyaar kabhi nahi haarta: Cong President Rahul Gandhi as BJP leads
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said, "Pyaar kabhi nahi haarta hai (Love is never defeated)." He added, "Today is not the day for me to go into the details of this mandate...a new Prime Minister has been elected...hopefully, he'll look after the interests of the people of India." The BJP-led NDA is leading in 354 seats, as per trends.

headlines: Pak PM congratulates PM Modi, says look forward to working for peace
text: Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan has congratulated Prime Minister Narendra Modi as trends showed BJP winning with majority in the 17th Lok Sabha elections. "Look forward to working with him (PM Modi) for peace, progress and prosperity in South Asia," he tweeted. BJP has till now won 15 seats and is leading on 288 seats.

headlines: Rahul Gandhi congratulates PM Modi, tells Cong workers 'Ghabrao mat'
text: After BJP-led NDA won majority in the leads tally in 17th Lok Sabha elections, Congress President Rahul Gandhi, in a press conference, congratulated Prime Minister Narendra Modi. "I had said that during the campaign 'janta maalik hai' and today people have clearly given their decision," he added. He further asked Congress workers, "Ghabrao mat (Don't be scared)".

headlines: People have taught Congress a befitting lesson: BJP's Yeddyurappa
text: Three-time Karnataka CM and BJP state president BS Yeddyurappa said the electorate has "taught Congress a befitting lesson" by supporting the BJP. "Many stalwarts, including former PM HD Deve Gowda, leader of Opposition Mallikarjun Kharge, former Union Ministers Veerappa Moily and KH Muniyappa, have lost terribly. This shows Karnataka people have believed in Narendra Modi," Yeddyurappa added.

headlines: Afghan President, Nepal PM, Bhutan King congratulate PM Modi
text: As PM Narendra Modi claimed victory in LS poll, leaders of many countries including Afghanistan, Nepal and Bhutan congratulated him. "Afghanistan looks forward to expanding cooperation in pursuit of peace and prosperity," tweeted President Ashraf Ghani. Nepal's PM KP Sharma Oli tweeted, "I look forward to working with you," while Bhutan King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck called to congratulate PM.

headlines: PM Narendra Modi removes 'Chowkidar' from his Twitter name
text: PM Narendra Modi has removed the prefix 'Chowkidar' from his Twitter name, urging all others to do the same. "Now, the time has come to take the Chowkidar Spirit to the next level... The people of India became Chowkidars... Chowkidar has become a powerful symbol to safeguard India from the evils of casteism, communalism, corruption and cronyism," he tweeted.

headlines: Rahul's Wayanad lead down to 4 lakh from 8 lakh votes, says EC website
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi's lead margin from Kerala's Wayanad Lok Sabha constituency was down to 4,30,488 votes from over 8 lakh votes as updated earlier on Thursday, the Election Commission of India's website showed. In Uttar Pradesh's Amethi, Rahul Gandhi was trailing behind BJP's Smriti Irani by 38,345 votes. Overall, the BJP-led NDA is leading in 354 seats.

headlines: PM Modi to be most powerful, democratically elected leader: Mahindra
text: Mahindra & Mahindra Chairman Anand Mahindra on Thursday said that PM Narendra Modi is about to become the most powerful, democratically elected leader in the world. He earlier tweeted that two new power blocs are overthrowing the establishment. "Not talking about political parties but women and young, new voters. Increasingly, they will shape India's future," the billionaire said.

headlines: Hardik tweets 'unemployment lost' instead of employment
text: As trends revealed BJP-led NDA's victory in the Lok Sabha elections, Congress leader Hardik Patel mistakenly tweeted that "not Congress, but unemployment has lost" instead of writing "employment". "To tell you the truth, it's the people of India who have lost. I salute the fight of all the Congress workers. We'll fight and win," he added.

headlines: Google faces indexing issues, displays old Search results
text: Google said it experienced some indexing issues which led to a few users seeing old links on Search results for a few hours on Wednesday. Google didn't reveal the cause of the issue but has now said it has been resolved. Notably, Google had faced similar indexing issues twice in April, once for Search and the other time for News.

headlines: Oldest fungi fossil aged 1bn yrs found, 600mn yrs older than last
text: Canada's Liege University scientists have discovered fossils of a fungus that lived roughly one billion years ago, making it about 600 million years older than last such discovery. "Fungi are, in 'tree of life', the closest relative to animals," researchers said. This indicates the possibility that animals too were present on Earth around the same time, they added.

headlines: Bahubali director calls GoT final season disappointing, shares meme
text: Sharing a meme of the character Ramsay Bolton from 'Game of Thrones', 'Bahubali' director SS Rajamouli tweeted, "Yes [Season 8] was disappointing, But I guess you were hinting...from the beginning." The meme featured a dialogue from the third season of the TV show, and read, "If you think this was a happy ending, you haven't been paying attention."

headlines: I accept the verdict, time for UPA to introspect: Kushwaha
text: Rashtriya Lok Samata Party (RLSP) chief and former Union Minister Upendra Kushwaha, who is trailing from Bihar's Ujiarpur and Karakat Lok Sabha constituencies, said that he accepts people's verdict with grace. He added that it is time for UPA to introspect instead of making accusations against anyone. RLSP quit NDA and joined UPA in December 2018.

headlines: It's people's victory: Jagan Mohan Reddy as YSRCP leads in Andhra
text: After trends showed YSR Congress Party leading in 149 of 175 Andhra Pradesh Assembly seats, party chief YS Jagan Mohan Reddy on Thursday said that it's the victory of Andhra people. Thanking the people for their blessings and support, Reddy added he'd try to live up to the people's expectations. Notably, this is Andhra's first Assembly elections since its bifurcation.

headlines: Millennium mandate by millennium generation: BJP's Sudhanshu
text: BJP leader Sudhanshu Trivedi on Thursday said that in its first election, the millennium generation has voted and given a millennium mandate. He further said BJP's three-point formula worked really well. "There are three hallmarks of our approach, the rise of the person sitting on the last pedestal of the society, good governance and development, and nationalism," Trivedi added.

headlines: Hope new govt at Centre will do justice with J&K: Farooq
text: After trends showed NDA getting a majority in 17th Lok Sabha, NC President Farooq Abdullah expressed hope that the new government at the Centre would do justice with Jammu and Kashmir. He added hope the new government engage in a dialogue with Pakistan to resolve the Kashmir issue. Notably, Abdullah on Thursday won the Srinagar parliamentary constituency by 70,050 votes.

headlines: I am hungrier than before: Hashim Amla ahead of World Cup
text: Speaking ahead of the World Cup 2019, South African batsman Hashim Amla has said, "I am hungrier than ever before, there is no doubt about that." Amla was not a part of South Africa's five-match ODI series versus Sri Lanka at home and was also not a part of the recently-concluded Indian Premier League (IPL) 2019 edition.

headlines: Favourites tag won't help India, England win the WC: B'desh's Shakib
text: Speaking about India and England's World Cup favourites tag, Bangladesh's Shakib Al Hasan said, "India and England are obviously favourites, but that doesn't get you the crown." "You need to do the hard yards to win a tournament like the World Cup...To be honest, all the teams look like they are ready for a fight," Shakib added.

headlines: Eden Hazard's brother joins Dortmund on 5-year deal
text: Chelsea star Eden Hazard's younger brother Thorgan Hazard has joined German club Borussia Dortmund on a five-year-long deal. "I am grateful for five great years at Borussia MÃ¶nchengladbach and have some wonderful memories... I am proud to be able to play for Borussia Dortmund, it is a top club with unbelievable fans," Thorgan said.

headlines: Amazon's wearable device may read human emotions: Report
text: Amazon is making a voice-assisted wearable wrist device that can recognise human emotions, Bloomberg reported. Reportedly designed to work with a smartphone app, the "health and wellness" device has microphones paired with software that can recognise the wearerÂ’s emotional state from their voice's sound. It could later reportedly advise wearer how to interact more effectively with others.

headlines: Govt proposes electrifying two wheelers in 6-8 yrs: Reports
text: Government think-tank NITI Aayog has reportedly proposed electrifying most motorbikes and scooters within next six-eight years to curb pollution and reduce dependency on fossil fuels. The draft proposal also recommends electrifying autorickshaws, reports said. The cabinet had in February approved a scheme to spend $1.4 billion over three years to subsidise sales of electric and hybrid vehicles.

headlines: PM Modi congratulates Jagan Mohan Reddy for Andhra win
text: PM Narendra Modi today congratulated YSRCP chief YS Jagan Mohan Reddy, whose party is leading in 148 of 175 seats in the Andhra Pradesh Assembly elections. PM Modi tweeted, "Congratulations on the remarkable win in Andhra Pradesh. Best wishes to you for a successful tenure." Jagan will take oath as the state's CM on May 30, said a YSRCP leader.

headlines: Result of first LS seat declared with BJP winning K'taka's Haveri
text: The Election Commission has declared the result for the first seat in the 17th Lok Sabha elections, with BJP retaining Karnataka's Haveri constituency. BJP's Shivkumar Chanabasappa Udasi defeated Congress' DR Patil by 1,40,882 votes. Shivkumar Chanabasappa Udasi had won the seat in 2014 with a margin of 87,571 votes against Congress' Saleem Ahmed.

headlines: YSR Congress leads in 22 of 25 Lok Sabha seats in Andhra Pradesh
text: YSRCP is leading 22 of the 25 Lok Sabha seat in Andhra Pradesh, while TDP is leading in three. In the 16th Lok Sabha, YSRCP had four seats from the state while TDP had a hold on 15 seats. Notably, in the state Assembly elections, the YS Jagan Mohan Reddy-led party has crossed the majority mark in leads.

headlines: I feel like batsman who scored century but his team lost: Tharoor
text: As the Congress leads on just 51 out of the 542 Lok Sabha seats, Congress' Shashi Tharoor has said, "As my lead nears 50,000 with 72 per cent counted, I feel like a batsman who has scored a century while his team has lost!" "It's a bittersweet emotion I will take some time to reflect on," he added.

headlines: How's the hate? Great sir: Siddharth on Pragya, Atishi results
text: In response to BJP's Pragya Thakur leading from Bhopal, and AAP's Atishi trailing in East Delhi, actor Siddharth tweeted, "How's the hate? Great sir!" "If Pragya Thakur wins and Atishi loses in their respective contests, it is a clear sign where our priorities lie," he said. Siddharth also congratulated PM Narendra Modi for a "historic" win.

headlines: Result of PM Modi's leadership, Shah's organisational skills: Yogi
text: As the trends showed BJP-led NDA leading in almost 350 Lok Sabha constituencies, Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath tweeted, "The stupendous victory of BJP is a result of visionary leadership of PM Narendra Modi and excellent organisational capabilities of President Amit Shah." Adityanath also gave credit to BJP workers for the victory. NDA is leading on 59 seats in UP.

headlines: Indians won't tolerate hugging Pak Army chief: Punjab CM on Sidhu
text: Taking a dig at Punjab minister Navjot Singh Sidhu as trends show BJP-led NDA's victory in the General elections, Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh said, "Indians especially servicemen will not tolerate hugging the Pakistani Army chief." Sidhu had hugged Pakistan Army chief Qamar Javed Bajwa during his visit to the country for PM Imran Khan's oath-taking ceremony.

headlines: Congratulate Narendrabhai over unprecedented victory: LK Advani
text: Veteran BJP leader LK Advani on Thursday congratulated Prime Minister Narendra Modi and BJP President Amit Shah. "Heartiest congratulations to Narendrabhai Modi for steering BJP towards this unprecedented victory in elections. Amitbhai Shah as BJP President and all dedicated workers of the party have put in enormous effort in making sure that BJP's message reaches every voter," he said.

headlines: Chinese President Xi Jinping congratulates PM Narendra Modi
text: Chinese President Xi Jinping sent a letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday to congratulate him as trends showed the BJP-led NDA leading in 349 seats. "Xi noted the great importance he attached to the development of India-China relations and his desire to work with PM Modi to take the [ties] to a new height," an MEA statement read.

headlines: Who knows what would've happened if Balakot hadn't happened: Omar
text: Amid trends showing BJP-led NDA leading in 349 seats in Lok Sabha polls, National Conference leader Omar Abdullah said, "Who can say what would've happened if Balakot had not happened. But it is the truth that post-Balakot, Opposition lost most of its steam." He said they could have focused on highlighting unemployment and rural distress, instead of questioning Balakot strikes.

headlines: Bohot dukh ho raha hai counting achchi nahi ja rahi: TMC's Moon Moon
text: TMC's Lok Sabha candidate from Asansol Moon Moon Sen on Thursday said, "Bohot dukh ho raha hai counting achchi nahi ja rahi (I'm very upset that the counting is not going in my favour)". Sen is trailing behind by over one lakh votes against BJP's Babul Supriyo. The TMC and its allies are leading on 22 seats in West Bengal.

headlines: Amit Shah arrives at BJP headquarters, welcomed by party workers
text: BJP chief Amit Shah was welcomed by party workers as he arrived at the BJP headquarters in New Delhi on Thursday. BJP workers distributed sweets in celebration, amid trends showing BJP leading in 350 seats. Prime Minister Narendra Modi is expected to reach the BJP headquarters at 5 pm today, following which he will address party workers.

headlines: PM Modi will further strengthen India-Russia friendship: Putin
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin congratulated PM Narendra Modi on Thursday as vote count showed BJP-led NDA leading in 350 seats. "I am convinced that, as the Prime Minister of India, you will further strengthen the centuries-old friendship between our peoples and the all-round development of a particularly privileged strategic partnership between Russia and India," Putin said in a message.

headlines: I accept mandate, but people doubted EVMs a fact too: Sharad Pawar
text: Nationalist Congress Party's President Sharad Pawar today said, "I accept people's decision but this is also a fact that people had their doubts about EVMs." He added, "Congress had performed really well in Rajiv Gandhi's time, but nobody doubted elections then, same when Atal Bihari Vajpayee won." Pawar didn't contest elections but his daughter Supriya Sule contested from Baramati.

headlines: Siri says I'd blush, Alexa says thanks when told 'You're a slut': UN
text: A UNESCO report claims digital assistants including Apple's Siri and Amazon Alexa are enforcing damaging gender stereotypes. Female voice assistants have been programmed to "greet verbal abuse with catch-me-if-you-can flirtation", the report said. It is titled "I'd blush if I could" after Siri's alleged response to "You're a slut", to which Alexa reportedly replied with, "Thanks for the feedback".

headlines: Feel a lot more at home now: Kriti on completing 5 yrs in B'wood
text: While speaking about completing five years in Bollywood, Kriti Sanon said, "I feel a lot more comfortable, a lot more at home now." "At times, I still feel like a newcomer. It's my good fortune that I got the right kind of opportunities...and reached where I am today," she added. Kriti made her Bollywood debut opposite Tiger Shroff in 'Heropanti'.

headlines: We knew GoT final season would be divisive: HBO head on criticism
text: Addressing the criticism the final season of 'Game Of Thrones' received, television network HBO's programming president Casey Bloys said, "[T]o a certain extent it was expected that for a show this big, there's no way you're going to please everybody." "But youÂ’re never going to make everybody happy, nor should that be the goal," he further added.

headlines: Urmila alleges discrepancy in signatures on EVM form
text: Congress' Mumbai North Lok Sabha candidate Urmila Matondkar on Thursday alleged that there was a mismatch in signatures on an electronic voting machine (EVM) form. The actor said that a complaint has been filed with the Election Commission in this connection. Urmila is trailing against BJP's Gopal Shetty by over 3.5 lakh votes.

headlines: BJP set to make major gains in LS polls in Karnataka: Trends
text: BJP is set to make major gains in the Lok Sabha polls in Karnataka where it is leading in 25 out of the 28 seats, according to Election Commission trends. Congress leaders who are trailing in the state include Mallikarjun Kharge and Veerappa Moily. Former PM Deve Gowda of JD(S) is trailing behind BJP's GS Basavaraj from the Tumkur seat.

headlines: Poll result will compel parties to respect Indian culture: Paresh
text: BJP MP Paresh Rawal on Thursday said that results of 2019 Lok Sabha polls will compel political parties to respect the "5,000 years old Indian culture". He further said that the result will compel them to change their opportunistic ideology and respect the sentiments of the majority. Trends show that BJP-led NDA is leading on 350 Lok Sabha seats.

headlines: Rahul's decisions opened doors for PM Modi's victory: CPI
text: CPI National Secretary Atul Kumar Anjaan on Thursday said that the "policies and decisions" of Congress President Rahul Gandhi have weakened Opposition's unity and opened the doors for PM Narendra Modi's victory. He alleged that the BJP fought general elections on the basis of "social and religious divisive policies". Anjaan further said Rahul's decisions led to divisions within the Opposition.

headlines: KCR congratulates PM Modi, Jagan Mohan Reddy on poll leads
text: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Thursday congratulated PM Narendra Modi after trends showed BJP-led NDA leading in the Lok Sabha polls. He also congratulated YSR Congress chief YS Jagan Mohan Reddy over his party's performance in Andhra Pradesh. Rao further said that under PM Modi's leadership the country will progress further and march ahead.

headlines: Sachin Tendulkar predicts the World Cup 2019 semifinalists
text: Former Indian cricketer Sachin Tendulkar chose India, England and Australia as three of the four semifinalist nations at the upcoming World Cup 2019 in England and Wales. Sachin additionally said that he expects either New Zealand or Pakistan to make it to the semifinals stage of the tournament. England begin their World Cup campaign against South Africa on May 30.

headlines: FIFA drops plans for 48-team World Cup in Qatar
text: FIFA has dropped the plan to include a total of 48 teams at the 2022 World Cup in Qatar. The 2022 edition will remain as originally planned with 32 teams. FIFA said that following a "thorough and comprehensive consultation process" it was concluded that the "proposal could not be made now". UEFA's head had earlier called the 48-team plan 'unrealistic'.

headlines: Netflix hires its first India content IP lawyer: Report
text: Netflix has reportedly appointed Priyanka Chaudhari as director and senior counsel for content and Intellectual Property (IP) in India. Chaudhari, who worked at Balaji Telefilms as VP-Group Legal for around two years, will be Netflix's first content IP lawyer in India, the report said. Reportedly, in her new role, Chaudhari will report to Netflix's Los Angeles office.

headlines: SpaceX sues US Air Force over rocket-building contracts
text: Elon Musk's SpaceX has sued the US Air Force alleging it "wrongly awarded" contracts under Launch Service Agreement program to a portfolio of three "unproven rockets" based on "unstated metrics". Under LSA program, Jeff Bezos' Blue Origin, Northrop Grumman and United Launch Alliance had last year been awarded combined contracts worth over $2 billion. The complaint was filed last week.

headlines: Solid slap on my face: Prakash Raj concedes defeat in Bengaluru
text: Actor-turned-politician Prakash Raj conceded defeat in his first election, which he contested from Karnataka's Bangalore Central constituency. "Solid slap on my face. As more abuse, trolling and humiliation come my way. My resolve to fight for a secular India will continue," tweeted Raj as he got 28,000 (2.4%) out of over 11 lakh votes so far.

headlines: Smriti Irani leads by 11,200 votes against Rahul Gandhi in Amethi
text: BJP's Smriti Irani is leading by over 11,200 votes against Congress President Rahul Gandhi in UP's Amethi. Meanwhile, Rahul is leading by over 5,79,000 votes from Kerala's Wayanad Lok Sabha constituency. Smriti Irani had contested and lost to Rahul Gandhi in the 2014 Lok Sabha election but had managed to reduce his winning margin to one lakh.

headlines: Who all are leading in key constituencies in Lok Sabha elections?
text: Union Minister Smriti Irani is leading against Congress President Rahul Gandhi in the Amethi constituency, while BJP leader Giriraj Singh is winning the Begusarai seat by over 3 lakh votes against CPI's Kanhaiya Kumar. Meanwhile, Congress' Urmila Matondkar is trailing against BJP's Gopal Shetty in Mumbai North. Cricketer-turned-politician BJP's Gautam Gambhir is in lead in Delhi East.

headlines: India wins yet again: PM Narendra Modi as BJP leads in 300 seats
text: As the Bharatiya Janata Party leads in 300 seats in the early trends, Prime Minister Narendra Modi tweeted, "India wins yet again!" He also wrote, "Together we grow. Together we prosper. Together we will build a strong and inclusive India." PM Modi, who contested from Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi Lok Sabha constituency is leading by over 3,30,000 votes.

headlines: It's India's mandate against Opposition propaganda: Amit Shah
text: Reacting to BJP-led NDA leading in 346 constituencies, BJP President Amit Shah on Thursday said the Lok Sabha election results are India's mandate against "Opposition's propaganda, lies, personal attacks and baseless politics". "Today's mandate also shows that the people of India have chosen development and nationalism," said Shah. "Naman to India," he added.

headlines: AAP congratulates PM Narendra Modi as BJP leads in all 7 Delhi seats
text: Aam Aadmi Party on Thursday congratulated the BJP, as the trends showed the BJP leading in all seven seats in Delhi, and said it hopes that PM Narendra Modi would do "good work" in his future tenure. AAP spokesperson Saurabh Bharadwaj said, "Nothing in the democracy is as pure, sacred and powerful as public mandate. We respect the public mandate."

headlines: Hema Malini leads in Mathura, Sunny Deol ahead in Gurdaspur
text: BJP leader Hema Malini is leading in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura by 1,55,531 votes, while Sunny Deol, who had joined the party in April, is leading in Punjab's Gurdaspur by 77,825 votes. Hema is leading against SP-BSP-RLD alliance candidate Kunwar Narendra Singh, while Sunny is leading against Congress' Sunil Jakhar. BJP-led NDA is leading in 343 seats across 542 constituencies.

headlines: Adani Group stocks rally up to 15% as PM Modi set to retain power
text: Shares in various Adani Group companies surged on Thursday after leads showed PM Narendra Modi is set to return to power. The billionaire Gautam Adani-led group's flagship Adani Enterprises rose as much as 15% during the day. Other Adani stocks such as Adani Power, Adani Ports and SEZ, Adani Gas, and Adani Green Energy rose up to 11%.

headlines: Confident ties with India will flourish: Maldives congratulates PM
text: The Maldives' Foreign Minister Abdulla Shahid congratulated Prime Minister Narendra Modi and External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj on Thursday as early trends showed the BJP and its allies leading in 348 seats. "I am confident that Maldives India relations will continue to flourish," he tweeted. Meanwhile, the Congress and its allies are leading in 87 seats.

headlines: All that's left is to congratulate BJP & NDA: Omar Abdullah
text: Amid trends showing BJP-led NDA leading in 345 seats in the 17th Lok Sabha polls, National Conference leader Omar Abdullah tweeted, "All that's left is to congratulate the BJP & NDA for a stellar performance." Omar added, "PM Modi Sahib & Mr Amit Shah put together a winning alliance & a very professional campaign. Bring on the next five years."

headlines: Sensex erases 1000-point gain, ends 299 points lower as NDA leads
text: Sensex erased its 1,014-point gain on Thursday and ended 299 points lower at 38,811. The index touched 40,000-mark for the first time in early trade after leads indicated PM Narendra Modi will return to power for a second term. "Together we grow. Together we prosper. Together we will build a strong and inclusive India. India wins yet again!" PM tweeted.

headlines: TsuNAMO TsunAMI, NaMo 2.0, Dhanyawad Bharat: Irani as BJP leads
text: As BJP-led NDA crossed majority in leads according to the trends, Union Minister and BJP's Amethi candidate Smriti Irani tweeted, "TsuNAMO TsunAMI, NaMo 2.0, Dhanyawad Bharat #VijayiBharat." Smriti Irani is leading by 14,030 votes against Rahul Gandhi in the Amethi constituency. The trends show BJP-led NDA leading in 347 seats, while Congress and its allies are leading in 89 seats.

headlines: India rejects dynasty, caste politics: BJP's Giriraj Singh
text: BJP leader Giriraj Singh, who is leading by over 3.7 lakh votes against CPI candidate Kanhaiya Kumar in Bihar's Begusarai, on Thursday tweeted, "The country has rejected dynasty politics, regional politics, caste politics and politics of pseudo-secularism." Giriraj added, "Sabka saath sabka vikas... Modi hai toh mumkin hai."

headlines: I thank the people for once again giving a decisive mandate: Rajnath
text: Home Minister Rajnath Singh on Thursday tweeted, "I thank the people of India for once again giving a decisive mandate to BJP-led NDA and reposing faith in PM Narendra Modi's astute leadership." Rajnath's tweet came as the trends showed NDA leading in nearly 350 seats. Rajnath added that the victory was the result of millions of BJP workers' hard work.

headlines: You made it: Rajinikanth to PM as leads show NDA set to retain power
text: After the leads showed that BJP-led NDA is set to retain power, actor Rajinikanth took to Twitter to congratulate Prime Minister Narendra Modi. "Respected dear @narendramodi ji...hearty congratulations...You made it!!! God bless," he wrote. As per the trends, BJP-led NDA is currently leading in 342 seats, while Congress and its allies are leading in 91 Lok Sabha constituencies.

headlines: Time for Congress to get an Amit Shah: Mehbooba Mufti
text: After the trends showed BJP-led NDA crossing majority mark in the 17th Lok Sabha elections, PDP president Mehbooba Mufti tweeted, "Congratulations to Narendra Modi ji for a historic mandate. Today surely belongs to BJP and its allies. Time for Congress to get an Amit Shah." Mufti has dropped to the third position in Anantnag seat.

headlines: After 25 yrs, BJP loses Parrikar's Panaji Assembly seat to Congress
text: Ending a 25-year legacy, the BJP has failed to retain the Panaji Assembly seat in Goa, held by late CM Manohar Parrikar. BJP's Sidharth Kuncalienker lost to Congress' Atanasio Monserrate by 1,758 votes in the by-poll. The constituency, first won by Parrikar in 1994, was represented twice by Kuncalienker after Parrikar was elevated to PM Narendra Modi's Cabinet in 2014.

headlines: Suniel to play villain in Rajinikanth's 'Darbar': Reports
text: Actor Suniel Shetty will play the role of the villain in the upcoming cop-drama film 'Darbar', which will see Rajinikanth in the lead role. Suniel will reportedly be seen playing a businessman in the forthcoming film, which will be directed by AR Murugadoss. The film will also feature actors Prateik Babbar and Nayanthara.

headlines: Huma Qureshi walks red carpet at Cannes Film Festival 2019
text: Actress Huma Qureshi walked the red carpet at the 72nd Cannes Film Festival on Wednesday, where she was seen attending the 'Women in Film and Television' event. The actress wore a printed crop top and black skirt with a sheer beige floor-length cape by Anamika Khanna. Huma was earlier seen on the red carpet in a grey Gaurav Gupta gown.

headlines: Dishonesty made BJP win, people aren't happy: Hardik Patel
text: Amid trends showing the BJP-led NDA leading in 347 seats in the Lok Sabha polls, Congress leader Hardik Patel tweeted, "There is no happiness on the face of Indians." Hardik added, "It is not people who have made BJP win, it is dishonesty." He added that Congress and party chief Rahul Gandhi fought the elections with honesty.

headlines: There is a tsunami of BJP, not a wave: Shivraj Singh Chouhan
text: BJP leader and former Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Thursday said that Lok Sabha elections results indicate that there is a tsunami of BJP and not a wave. "PM Narendra Modi resides in the people's hearts and he is blessed with God-like powers," he added. This comes after early trends show BJP-led NDA is leading in 347 seats.

headlines: PM Modi's work defeated Opposition's negative politics: BJP
text: After trends showed NDA leading in 347 seats, the BJP said that PM Narendra Modi's work has defeated the "negative politics" of Opposition. BJP spokesperson Shahnawaz Hussain added that this is an "era of development politics" and whoever will bring development, will win. BJP Vice President Vinay Sahasrabuddhe said the trends indicate "unambiguously" that grammar of politics is under transformation.

headlines: Bohot bahdiya, mere dost: Israel PM congratulates PM Modi
text: PM of Israel, Benjamin Netanyahu took to Twitter to congratulate PM Narendra Modi and tweeted in Hindi, "Bohot bahdiya, mere dost!" "The election results further reaffirm your leadership of world's largest democracy. Together we'll continue to strengthen the great friendship between India & Israel," he added. His tweet comes as BJP and allies lead in 346 seats, as per trends.

headlines: Trends show Mufti at third position in J&K's Anantnag seat
text: People's Democratic Party (PDP) chief Mehbooba Mufti has dropped down to the third position from Anantnag in Jammu and Kashmir in the 2019 Lok Sabha elections, as per the trends. National Conference's (NC) Hasnain Masoodi is leading from the constituency while Indian National Congress' Ghulam Ahmad Mir is in the second spot. BJP is leading in Jammu and Udhampur seats.

headlines: Mamata's TMC leads in 24 seats, BJP in 17 in West Bengal
text: Mamata Banerjee's TMC is leading in 24 seats in West Bengal, while, Bharatiya Janata Party is leading in 17 seats in the state. BJP is leading in key constituencies such as Asansol where BJP MP Babul Supriyo is contesting against TMC's Moon Moon Sen. In 2014, TMC won 34 seats while the BJP secured two seats.

headlines: Trends show BJP leading in 52 out of 80 seats in UP, BSP-SP-RLD 25
text: BJP, which had won 71 seats in Uttar Pradesh in the 2014 general elections, is leading in 52 seats in the 17th Lok Sabha elections, as per the early trends. Meanwhile, BSP-SP-RLD alliance is leading in 25 seats, while Congress is winning one seat, the trends further showed. Congress had won two seats in UP in the 2014 elections.

headlines: Trends show BJP leading in 24 of 25 Lok Sabha seats in Rajasthan
text: Trends have revealed that BJP is leading in 24 of the 25 Lok Sabha constituencies in Rajasthan, while Rashtriya Loktantrik Party is leading in one seat. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot's son Vaibhav Gehlot is trailing from Jodhpur seat, where BJP's Gajendra Singh Shekhawat is in lead by over 1.8 lakh votes. Shekhawat won from the seat in 2014 as well.

headlines: BJP, JD(U) leading in 16 LS seats each in Bihar, Congress 0
text: BJP and JD(U) are leading in 16 Lok Sabha seats each in Bihar, which has 40 Lok Sabha constituencies, as per the trends. Further, RJD is leading in two seats, while LJP is leading in six seats. BJP's Ravi Shankar Prasad, who is fighting LS elections for the first time, is leading in Patna Sahib seat against Congress' Shatrughan Sinha.

headlines: Patna Sahib's 2-time MP Shatrughan Sinha trailing behind RS Prasad
text: Congress leader and two-time MP from Patna Sahib Shatrughan Sinha is trailing behind Union Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad from the seat by over 70,000 votes. Sinha, who had recently joined Congress, won from the seat in 2009 and 2014 General elections on BJP ticket. Earlier, Sinha had claimed it would be "soopda saaf" (whitewash) for BJP in Bihar and UP.

headlines: Shashi Tharoor leads, Congress ahead in 15 Lok Sabha seats in Kerala
text: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor is leading the Thiruvananthapuram Lok Sabha seat by 21,411 votes (after 50% counting) as Congress is winning 15 out of 20 seats in the state, as per the trends. Indian Union Muslim League are leading in two seats, while KC(M), RSP and Left Front are winning one seat each, the trends further showed.

headlines: All BJP candidates lead by over 3 lakh votes in Himachal Pradesh
text: All four Bharatiya Janata Party candidates are leading by over 3 lakh votes in Himachal Pradesh. In 2014 Lok Sabha elections, BJP made a clean sweep in Himachal, winning all four Lok Sabha seats with a massive margin. The BJP has fielded Kishan Kapoor from Kangra, Anurag Thakur from Hamirpur, Suresh Kashyap from Shimla and Ram Swaroop Sharma from Mandi.

headlines: BJP leading in 28 Lok Sabha seats, Congress in 1 in Madhya Pradesh
text: Bharatiya Janata Party is leading in 28 Lok Sabha seats out of 29 in Madhya Pradesh, while Congress is leading in the remaining one seat of Chhindwara in the state. The BJP's Bhopal candidate Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur is leading against Congress party's Digvijaya Singh by over 1 lakh votes. The BJP's Alok Sanjar won the Bhopal seat in 2014.

headlines: BJP's Giriraj Singh leads against Kanhaiya Kumar in Begusarai
text: Bharatiya Janata Party's Giriraj Singh is leading by over 1,70,000 votes against Kanhaiya Kumar in Bihar's Begusarai. Kanhaiya contested on a CPI ticket and is making his Lok Sabha elections debut. In 2014 Lok Sabha elections, BJP's Bhola Singh had won the seat by defeating Rashtriya Janata Dal's Tanweer Hassan by over 58,000 votes.

headlines: Meri vijay mein dharm ki vijay hogi, adharm ka naash hoga: Pragya
text: Bharatiya Janata Party's Sadhvi Pragya Thakur has said "Nischit meri vijay hogi (I will win for sure)" from Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal. "Meri vijay mein dharm ki vijay hogi, adharm ka naash hoga," she added. Sadhvi Pragya said this as early trends showed that she was leading by over 90,000 votes against Congress' Digvijaya Singh.

headlines: Congress leader dies of heart attack at counting centre in MP
text: Congress leader Ratan Singh Thakur died of a heart attack in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal parliamentary constituency on Thursday. According to reports, he was present at one of the counting centres in the constituency when he suffered the heart attack. Thakur was rushed to a hospital where he failed to recover.

headlines: Congratulations to PM Modi on magnificent victory: Sri Lanka PM
text: Sri Lanka's Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe on Thursday took to Twitter to congratulate Prime Minister Narendra Modi and tweeted, "Congratulations to Narendra Modi on a magnificent victory! We look forward to working closely with you." His tweet comes as BJP leads in 348 seats, as per trends. Congress is leading in 84 seats.

headlines: BJP supporters in Australia celebrate as party leads in early trends
text: Photos of BJP supporters in Australia's Sydney and Melbourne celebrating the party's lead in nearly 300 Lok Sabha constituencies have emerged online. The BJP and its allies are leading on 340 seats, while the Congress and allies have a lead on 87 seats. According to trends, BJP is set to win more seats than the 2014 Lok Sabha elections.

headlines: With you all the way, good luck: Robert Vadra to Rahul, Priyanka
text: Businessman Robert Vadra wished his wife Priyanka Gandhi Vadra and his brother-in-law Rahul Gandhi good luck on Thursday morning, the day of the counting of votes for the Lok Sabha elections. Sharing photographs with the leaders, Vadra tweeted, "R all the best. With you all the way, no matter what... good luck ! P, best best."

headlines: We have lost the battle: Punjab CM Amarinder Singh
