text: After trends showed BJP-led NDA crossing the majority mark in 17th Lok Sabha elections, Punjab CM and senior Congress leader Captain Amarinder Singh said, "We've lost the battle." As per the trends, BJP-led NDA is leading in 348 seats, while Congress and its allies are leading in 85. A party or an alliance needs 272 seats to form the government.

headlines: PM Modi's mother greets the media outside her Gujarat residence
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's mother Heeraben Modi greeted the media outside her residence in Gujarat's Gandhinagar on Thursday as the BJP was seen leading at 348 seats in the 17th Lok Sabha elections. The BJP-led NDA has crossed the 2014 mark, set for biggest mandate since 1984, as per trends. The NDA achieved 336-seat mark in the 2014 general elections.

headlines: Trends show PM Modi leading by 2 lakh votes, Amit Shah by 3 lakh
text: As per early trends, PM Narendra Modi is leading in Varanasi by over two lakh votes, while BJP President Amit Shah is leading in Gujarat's Gandhinagar by over 3 lakh votes. Shah, who is contesting his first LS election from Gandhinagar, was fielded by BJP after replacing six-time MP LK Advani. Moreover, BJP is leading in Gujarat's all 26 seats.

headlines: All losers are not losers: Mamata as BJP leads in 19 seats in WB
text: After trends showed that BJP+ is leading in 19 seats in West Bengal, the state CM Mamata Banerjee tweeted, "Congratulations to the winners. But all losers are not losers." "We have to do a complete review and then we will share our views with you all. Let the counting process be completed fully and the VVPATs matched," she added.

headlines: Historic victory outcome of Modiji's visionary leadership: Rajnath
text: Home Minister Rajnath Singh on Thursday tweeted, "This historic victory in the General Elections is the outcome of Modiji's visionary leadership, Amit Shahji's dynamism and the hard work of millions of BJP karyakartas." He added that he called PM Modi and Amit Shah and congratulated them. Rajnath himself is leading from Lucknow Lok Sabha constituency by over 2 lakh votes.

headlines: Time for India's transformation, congrats to Modi: Uday Kotak
text: Billionaire Kotak Mahindra Bank MD Uday Kotak congratulated PM Narendra Modi, Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and the NDA after trends showed the party is set for a victory. "Time for transformation of India. Time for deep reform. I dream of us as a global superpower in my lifetime. Heartiest congratulations to Narendra Modi, the BJP, and the NDA," Kotak tweeted.

headlines: 'Bharat' will make people sit up and notice my acting: Nora
text: Speaking about her role in the upcoming Salman Khan starrer 'Bharat', Nora Fatehi said, "It's a small role, but it'll make people sit up and take notice of my acting for a change." "To be a part of a Salman film is a big deal in this industry," the actress added. The film is slated to release on June 5.

headlines: BJP will come to power with over 350 seats: Manoj Tiwari
text: Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari on Thursday said that BJP will come to power with over 350 seats in the 2019 Lok Sabha elections. He added that this time people will vote for BJP as they are happy with PM Narendra Modi's performance. Early trends show that BJP-led NDA is leading with 345 Lok Sabha seats.

headlines: BJP would've won over 30 seats in WB if fair polls happened: MP
text: BJP MP Roopa Ganguly on Thursday said that BJP would have won over 30 seats in West Bengal had elections been held in a fair manner. Ganguly said this while blaming the ruling TMC for poll violence in the state. She further said that BJP will win Lok Sabha elections in states where it had recently lost the Assembly polls.

headlines: Nationalism narrative worked for BJP in north, K'taka: CPI
text: CPI General Secretary Suravaram Reddy on Thursday said BJP's poll narrative centered on nationalism worked for them in northern states and Karnataka. "Points raised by Opposition of unemployment, price rise, and omissions and commissions of BJP didn't stand before nationalism," he added. Reddy further said that lack of understanding between Left parties and Congress helped BJP in West Bengal.

headlines: Amazon to get '.amazon' domain name after 7-year dispute
text: Jeff Bezos-led Amazon is close to winning a seven-year dispute over the '.amazon' domain name, Reuters stated. The Amazon Cooperation Treaty Organisation (ACTO), a group with member countries including Brazil backed the dispute. The Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (ICANN) decided to proceed with designation requested by Amazon pending a 30-day period of public comment.

headlines: Uber offers riders free tickets to ICC World Cup in England
text: As part of its World Cup campaign, Uber is giving free tickets to the ICC World Cup in England. Users can now score runs with every Uber ride, making them eligible for winning World Cup packages that include match tickets, travel & stay, along with ICC merchandise.

headlines: Urmila trailing from Mumbai North seat by over 80,000 votes
text: Trends have revealed that Congress candidate Urmila Matondkar is trailing from Mumbai North seat by over 80,000 votes. BJP's Gopal Shetty, who won from the seat in the 2014 elections by a margin of over 4 lakh votes, is leading from the constituency. The actress-turned-politician is contesting elections for the first time.

headlines: Sensex hits 40,000 and Nifty 12,000 for the 1st time ever as BJP leads
text: The Sensex hit 40,000 and Nifty zoomed beyond the 12,000-mark for the first time ever today as trends showed BJP leading in 288 seats, crossing the majority mark of 272 on its own. Sensex was up over 900 points at 40,054 while Nifty rose over 290 points at 12,029. Congress is leading in 52 seats, according to EC trends.

headlines: NDA crosses 2014 mark, set for biggest mandate since 1984: Trends
text: The BJP-led NDA is leading in 342 seats in the 17th Lok Sabha elections, according to the trends in the counting of votes. The NDA has crossed the 336-seat mark it had achieved in the 2014 general elections. It is the biggest mandate since the 1984 elections, which Congress had won with 414 seats.

headlines: BJP's youngest candidate leads by 1 lakh votes in early trends
text: The youngest candidate of Bharatiya Janata Party, 28-year-old Tejasvi Surya is leading by over 1 lakh votes from the Bengaluru South Lok Sabha constituency, according to early trends. Surya is the General Secretary of the BJP's youth wing in Karnataka and was part of its national social media campaign team for 2019. He contested against Congress' BK Hariprasad.

headlines: BJP leading in all 26 seats in Gujarat, had won all seats in 2014
text: According to the trends, BJP is leading in all 26 Lok Sabha seats in Gujarat, where it had won all the seats in 2014. BJP National President Amit Shah is leading the Gandhinagar seat by over 3 lakh votes against Congress' CJ Chavda. In 2009, BJP had won 15 seats in the state, while Congress 11.

headlines: Congress leading on 8 seats, SAD & BJP on 2 each, AAP on 1 in Punjab
text: Congress is leading in eight seats in Punjab while BJP and Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) are leading in two seats each and Aam Aadmi Party is currently ahead in one seat. Congress candidate Manish Tewari is leading from Anandpur Sahib, SAD's Harsimrat Kaur Badal from Bathinda and BJP's Sunny Deol from Gurdaspur. Congress' Gurjeet Singh Aujla is leading from Amritsar.

headlines: YSR Congress crosses halfway mark in leads in Andhra Assembly polls
text: Amid the counting of votes for the Andhra Pradesh Assembly elections, YSR Congress is leading in 134 seats in the state, crossing the majority mark of 88. Meanwhile, the ruling TDP is leading in 26 constituencies. YSR Congress' President and CM candidate YS Jagan Mohan Reddy is leading from Pulivendla constituency, while CM Chandrababu Naidu is leading from Kuppam seat.

headlines: BJD crosses halfway mark in leads in Odisha Assembly elections
text: Trends show that BJD is leading in 80 assembly seats, crossing the majority mark of 74 in the Odisha Assembly elections. Meanwhile, BJP is leading in 25 seats and Congress in 10. Notably, BJD had come to power in the state in 2014 with 117 seats. CM Naveen Patnaik is leading from his current Hinjili constituency.

headlines: Arnab Goswami calls Sunny Deol as Sunny Leone, she responds
text: Republic TV's Editor-in-chief Arnab Goswami on Thursday mistakenly addressed actor Sunny Deol, the BJP's candidate from Punjab's Gurdaspur, as actress Sunny Leone during a live telecast. Following Arnab's goof up, the actress herself took to Twitter to respond to him and tweeted, "Leading by How many votes ????" Notably, Sunny Deol is leading from Gurdaspur by over 50,000 votes.

headlines: Poster in Uttar Pradesh thanks people for BJP's 'victory'
text: A poster thanking people for BJP's "victory" has surfaced in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow. "Thanks for giving historic majority to the Prime Minister Narendra Modi-led BJP in the country," the poster read. This comes as trends in the counting of votes in 17th Lok Sabha elections showed Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) crossing the majority mark of 272 on its own.

headlines: Khamba explains why he withdrew from #MeToo inquiry post AIB split
text: After AIB confirmed his exit from the comedy group, comedian Gursimran Khamba issued a statement explaining why he withdrew from an inquiry into the sexual harassment allegation against him. "[T]his process which lasted 4 months...didn't follow principles of natural justice," Khamba wrote. He further said that his request for a fresh committee to be constituted for the inquiry was denied.

headlines: Everything cannot be correct just because EC says so: Sisodia
text: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Wednesday said, "Everything cannot be correct just because EC says so." Sisodia's statement came after EC rejected the demand made by Opposition parties to verify the VVPAT slips before counting the votes. Sisodia added that if all the arguments of EC were accepted in the past, then no election reforms would have taken place.

headlines: Sushma Swaraj congratulates PM Modi on 'election victory'
text: After the trends showed BJP-led NDA crossing the majority mark in the 17th Lok Sabha elections, External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj took to Twitter to express her gratitude to Prime Minister Narendra Modi. "Many congratulations to PM Narendra Modi for delivering such a massive victory for the BJP. I express my gratitude to the people of the country," she wrote.

headlines: You wrote AAP as 'AAAP', what's wrong with you: AAP's Somnath to EC
text: After Election Commission's website showed Aam Aadmi Party's abbreviation as 'AAAP', party leader Somnath Bharti tweeted, "[Election Commission] what's wrong with you? In results on your website, you are showing AAP as AAAP." "It's not correct to follow BJP's tale so much," he added. Notably, trends show that BJP is leading on all seven seats in Delhi.

headlines: Vijender trails AAP's Chadha and BJP's Bidhuri in South Delhi
text: Olympic bronze medallist boxer Vijender Singh is trailing against AAP's Raghav Chadha and BJP's Ramesh Bidhuri in the South Delhi Lok Sabha seat. Bidhuri leads the South Delhi seat by over 90,000 votes, while Chadha is in the second position. The BJP is leading in all the seven seats in Delhi.

headlines: Election Commission will lead India to mass riots, civil war: AAP
text: AAP has said the Election Commission's decision to verify VVPAT slips after vote counting can lead to mass riots and civil war in India. AAP spokesperson Saurabh Bharadwaj questioned the commission, saying what can the EC do when winner sets aside elections in case of VVPAT mismatch, if it first tells political parties the "winner and loser" of the elections.

headlines: Will delete Twitter if PM Modi doesn't get 2nd term: Siddharth
text: On the day of counting for Lok Sabha elections, actor Siddharth tweeted, "I hereby solemnly swear that if Narendra Modi ji does not get a second term, I will delete my Twitter account permanently." He added, "Jai Hind. #AayegaToModiHi." Early trends showed BJP-led NDA leading in 340 seats and Congress and its allies leading in 90 seats.

headlines: Sooraj Pancholi to star in biopic based on famous boxer
text: Actor Sooraj Pancholi will star in an upcoming sports biopic which will be based on a famous Indian boxer. Speaking about the film, the actor said, "I actually auditioned for this role...I begged for them to let me take on this film because I was a huge fan of this script." Shooting for the film will commence this year.

headlines: Divya Khosla Kumar to star with John in Satyameva Jayate 2: Report
text: Actress Divya Khosla Kumar will star opposite John Abraham in the upcoming sequel to the 2018 film 'Satyameva Jayate', as per reports. The film will be directed by Milap Zaveri, who also helmed the first instalment of the series. The script for the film has reportedly been finalised and shooting will commence after the release of Zaveri's forthcoming film 'Marjaavaan'.

headlines: Rahul will be our PM if we get numbers in our favour: Stalin
text: Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) President MK Stalin on Wednesday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi will be the next Prime Minister if the numbers are in their favour. He further said that the Central and the Tamil Nadu government would change after the results are declared. DMK is contesting the Lok Sabha polls in alliance with Congress.

headlines: We won't be able to form govt on our own: Odisha Cong chief
text: A day before counting of votes began, Odisha Congress chief Niranjan Patnaik on Wednesday said that the party will not be able to form government in the state on its own. "However, our performance will be better than in 2014," he added. Congress in 2014 had bagged 16 out of 147 seats in Odisha Assembly polls.

headlines: People laughing at Opp'n over EVM allegations: Harsh Vardhan
text: Union Minister Harsh Vardhan on Thursday said that people are laughing at the Opposition for their allegations on discrepancies in EVMs. "Even those who have less knowledge of technology are laughing," he added. Harsh Vardhan further said that Congress didn't question EVMs when they were in power but now with their imminent defeat, they are giving excuses for their loss.

headlines: It's welcome news that I took lead from the start: Tharoor
text: As early trends suggest that sitting MP and Congress candidate Shashi Tharoor is leading from Thiruvananthapuram, Tharoor took to Twitter on Thursday and said that it's welcome news that he took lead from the start. However, he added that he isn't getting excited as "just 4% of votes" have been counted. The two-time MP is contesting against BJP's Kummanam Rajasekharan.

headlines: Early trends show NDA leading in 23 seats in Karnataka
text: Early trends showed the BJP-led NDA leading in 23 seats in Karnataka, and the Congress and its allies leading in four seats. Meanwhile, early trends showed BJP's youngest candidate, Tejasvi Surya leading by over 1 lakh votes from the Bengaluru South Lok Sabha constituency. Twenty-eight-year-old Tejasvi is the General Secretary of the BJP's youth wing in Karnataka.

headlines: Congress workers organise hawan outside AICC office in Delhi
text: Congress workers organised a hawan outside the AICC office in Delhi on Thursday. A Congress worker said, "Our result will be out today and we will form the government. To mark that event, we have organised a hawan." However, early trends showed BJP-led NDA leading in 342 seats and Congress and its allies leading in 89 seats.

headlines: Early trends show NDA ahead in 177 LS seats, Congress & allies in 56
text: Early trends in the counting of votes for the 17th Lok Sabha elections show BJP-led NDA ahead in 177 seats, while Congress and its allies are leading in 56 seats. The counting is taking place for 542 of the 543 constituencies and at least 272 seats are required by a party or an alliance to form the government.

headlines: Early trends show NDA crossing halfway mark in LS polls
text: According to the trends in the counting of votes in 17th Lok Sabha elections, BJP-led NDA has crossed the halfway mark and leads in 279 seats. Congress and its allies are leading in 92 seats, the trends further showed. Prime Minister Narendra Modi is leading in Varanasi. Notably, NDA had secured 336 seats in 2014 Lok Sabha elections.

headlines: BJP crosses majority mark on its own in LS polls as per trends
text: According to the trends by Election Commission of India in the counting of votes in 17th Lok Sabha elections, the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) crossed the majority mark of 272 on its own. Meanwhile, the trends show Congress leading in 51 seats. In the 2014 elections, BJP had won 282 seats, while Congress clinched 44 seats.

headlines: Trends show BJP leading in all 7 Lok Sabha seats in Delhi
text: The BJP is leading in all seven Lok Sabha seats in Delhi, as per the trends in the counting of votes in 17th Lok Sabha elections. All the BJP candidates are leading by a margin of over 10,000 votes, the trends further showed. The BJP had won all the seven seats in Delhi in 2014 Lok Sabha elections too.

headlines: Counting of votes for Lok Sabha, 4 state assemblies begins
text: Counting of votes for 17th Lok Sabha and four state assemblies - Andhra Pradesh, Arunachal Pradesh, Odisha, and Sikkim has begun. Voting had taken place for the Lok Sabha in 542 out of 543 constituencies across seven phases from April 11 to May 19. Lok Sabha elections 2019 recorded a voter turnout of 67.10%, the highest ever in election history.

headlines: Sensex, Nifty open at record high as trends show NDA's lead
text: Indian shares surged to record high on Thursday morning, as early trends showed BJP-led NDA crossing 300 seats in 17th Lok Sabha elections. Nifty was up 1.54% at 11,919.20, while Sensex was at 1.61% higher at 39,741.30. As per the trends, NDA leads in 313 seats, while Congress and its allies are ahead in 90 seats.

headlines: BJP asks 20,000 workers to reach headquarters in Delhi
text: The BJP has asked 20,000 party workers from across the country to reach its headquarters in Delhi to receive Prime Minister Narendra Modi in the evening in anticipation of a victory in the 17th Lok Sabha elections. Counting of votes for 542 out of 543 Lok Sabha seats is underway. In 2014, NDA had won the elections with 336 seats.

headlines: Trends show BJP-led NDA leading in 336 seats, Congress+ in 92
text: As per the early trends, the BJP-led NDA is leading in 336 Lok Sabha seats while Congress and its allies have a lead in 92 seats. NDA formed the Central government in 2014 with victory in 336 seats. A party or an alliance needs to win at least 272 seats to form the government.

headlines: 82 companies of Central forces guarding 379 counting halls in WB
text: Around 25,000 officials have been deployed in West Bengal to count votes in 379 halls, which are being guarded by 82 companies of Central forces. Further, there is a three-tier security cordon and only authorised persons are being allowed to enter counting venues. Earlier, the Centre warned states and UTs of a possibility of violence on the day of counting.

headlines: Verdict will make BJP's arrogance disappear: Akhilesh Yadav
text: Amid counting of votes for the 17th Lok Sabha, Samajwadi Party President Akhilesh Yadav said, "When the mandate comes, all the arrogance of the BJP will disappear." Samajwadi Party is in alliance with Mayawati-led BSP in Uttar Pradesh. Meanwhile, the early trends show BJP and its allies are leading in 26 seats in UP.

headlines: Confident about fairness, integrity of Indian elections: US
text: Praising India for executing such a massive exercise peacefully, US State Department spokesperson Morgan Ortagus said, "We are very confident in the fairness and integrity of Indian elections." Ortagus added, "Someone pointed out to me today that India's election is the largest exercise in democracy in human history." The US sends election observers to several countries but not to India.

headlines: Votes garnered, J&K martyrs forgotten: Cong as Swaraj meets Pak Min
text: After External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj met Pakistan Foreign Minister Shah Mahmood Qureshi during a Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) meeting in Kyrgyzstan, the Congress said, "Election over, votes garnered, Pulwama martyrs forgotten!" Swaraj and Mahmood sat next to each other during a joint call on Kyrgyzstan President Sooronbay Jeenbekov.

headlines: Parents of dead US cadet allowed to use his frozen sperm
text: A US judge has ruled in favour of the parents of a dead US Military Academy cadet saying they can use his frozen sperm to produce a child. The ruling gives Peter Zhu's parents the ability to attempt conception with a surrogate mother using their late son's sperm. Zhu's parents have not decided whether they will use it.

headlines: Indra Nooyi receives honorary doctorate from Yale University
text: Former PepsiCo Chairman and CEO Indra Nooyi was presented with the Honorary Doctorate of Humane Letters by Yale University, her alma mater, for her achievements in business. "To receive this recognition is a profound honour," Nooyi said in a tweet. "It's made all the more meaningful coming from a university that instilled in me...values that drive my work," she added.

headlines: Dimple Kapadia to feature in Christopher Nolan's 'Tenet'
text: Actress Dimple Kapadia will feature in Oscar-winning filmmaker Christopher Nolan's upcoming action-epic film 'Tenet', the film's makers confirmed on Wednesday. The film will also feature actors John David Washington, Elizabeth Debicki and Robert Pattinson, among others. 'Tenet' will reportedly be a follow-up to Nolan's Oscar-nominated film 'Dunkirk', and will be shot across seven countries.

headlines: PM Modi biopic is like Slumdog Millionaire based on hard work: Vivek
text: Speaking about his upcoming film 'PM Narendra Modi', Vivek Oberoi said, "[T]his story is like 'Slumdog Millionaire', but that was based on luck, and this is based on hard work." "[W]hatever [PM Modi] is, it's purely based on his hard work," he added. The film is slated to release one day after the results of the general elections are announced.

headlines: Jawan deployed at strongroom dies of heart attack in Chhattisgarh
text: A CRPF jawan deployed at a strongroom in Chhattisgarh's Kondagaon passed away on Wednesday after he suffered a heart attack. Kondagaon is an Assembly constituency and is a part of Bastar Lok Sabha constituency. The elections for the 17th Lok Sabha were conducted on April 11 in the Bastar parliamentary constituency.

headlines: Congress will form government, Rahul will be PM: Ajay Maken
text: Congress' Ajay Maken, who is contesting for New Delhi constituency, on Thursday said, "Congress will win and form the government. Rahul Gandhi will be the Prime Minister." Ajay added, "The fight in Delhi is between BJP and Congress." However, early trends showed BJP and its allies ahead in 177 seats, while Congress and its allies are leading in 56 seats.

headlines: Ford robot folds up in car after delivering packages at door
text: American multinational automaker Ford along with US startup Agility Robotics has built a bipedal robot 'Digit' that folds up in the back of a self-driving vehicle before and after it completes a doorstep delivery. Digit, capable of lifting around 18 kilograms, works through a detailed map of the surroundings built by the autonomous car, which is wirelessly shared with it.

headlines: US Postal Service tests delivery via self-driving trucks
text: The US Postal Service started a two-week test to transfer mail between its Phoenix and Dallas distribution centres using self-driving trucks in collaboration with San Diego-based startup TuSimple. The pilot program involves five round trips, each totalling over 3,200 km. A safety driver will sit behind the wheel to intervene if necessary and an engineer will ride in passenger seat.

headlines: San Francisco-based AI startup People.ai raises $60 million
text: San Francisco-based startup People.ai has raised $60 million in Series C funding round led by ICONIQ Capital. Y Combinator, among others, also participated in the round, which reportedly values the startup at around $500 million. People.ai leverages artificial intelligence to help companies capture contacts, activity and engagement and drive actionable insights across all their revenue generation.

headlines: Jamie Oliver to continue to expand India restaurant business
text: British celebrity chef Jamie Oliver's restaurants will continue to expand in India, through local franchise partner Dolomite Restaurants. Jasper Reid, MD of Dolomite, said the company plans to open six new restaurants as the brand is showing strong growth here. This comes a day after Oliver's restaurant chain went into administration in UK, leading to the closure of 22 restaurants.

headlines: Hope to re-open Tuticorin plant in next few months: Sterlite
text: Sterlite Copper CEO Pankaj Kumar has said the company hopes to re-open its Tuticorin plant in next couple of months. The plant was shut last year after anti-Sterlite protests turned violent and 13 were killed in police firing. Kumar denied pollution concerns at the plant, and said, "High current was created by...vested interests to show...we aren't complying to the environment."

headlines: The Viral Fever raises $5 million from Tiger Global
text: Youth-focused original video content platform The Viral Fever's (TVF) parent firm, Mumbai-based Contagious Online Media Network has raised nearly $5 million from Tiger Global Management in a Series D funding round. TVF's post-money valuation grew by at least 13.8% to $82 million, as compared to its previous Series C round, according to Paper.vc. TVF YouTube channel was launched in 2011.

headlines: Gul Panag says cab driver cancelled over destination, Ola responds
text: Actor Gul Panag tweeted she had to walk half-a-kilometre to get an auto-rickshaw after her Ola driver cancelled the ride during peak time. Ola said her cancellation fee was waived, to which Panag replied, "The point isn't the cancellation fee...your driver partners choose customers [based on] where they feel like going". Ola also apologised and promised action against the driver.

headlines: Hosts England unveil 2019 World Cup jersey inspired by 1992 WC
text: Hosts England have unveiled their jersey for the 2019 World Cup, which has been inspired by the 1992 World Cup. England had last reached a final of the World Cup in the 1992 edition. "EnglandÂ’s World Cup kit makes me want to support Australia. #CWC19," a user tweeted reacting to the jersey.

headlines: 500 masked men with guns attack poll team in Arunachal, steal EVMs
text: About 500 masked men carrying guns and machetes attacked a polling team in Arunachal Pradesh on Sunday. The polling team was on its way to Nampe in Kurung Kumey district, where a re-poll was scheduled for Tuesday, when they were attacked and EVMs were snatched from them. The election happened on Tuesday after a new team was sent on Monday.

headlines: There's no bigger motivation than Indian Army: Kohli ahead of WC
text: Ahead of the 2019 World Cup, Team India captain Virat Kohli said there's no bigger motivation for the team than Indian Army. "When you talk about Indian Army, the role they play, there is no comparison with that," he added. Kohli further said if every player kept Indian Army in mind, the side will "get an extra boost".

headlines: Squash club awards vibrators to female winners, apologises
text: A Spanish squash club awarded vibrator, hair removal kit and electric foot file to female winners of Asturias Squash Championship. The winners filed a complaint with the federation for sexism and discrimination, after which the club apologised, saying "it was never our intention to offend anyone". "We were very shocked...We think it's very sexist," one of the winners had said.

headlines: David Hussey appointed head coach of BBL side Melbourne Stars
text: Big Bash League (BBL) franchise Melbourne Stars on Wednesday appointed former Australian batsman David Hussey as their men's team head coach. Hussey, who succeeds Stephen Fleming, has signed a two-year deal with Stars, said the club. Hussey played 48 matches for the Stars, scoring 855 runs. "David is a quality person," Stars president Eddie McGuire said.

headlines: Bumrah responds to IIT professor's analysis of his bowling
text: Team India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah took to Twitter to indirectly respond to IIT Kanpur professor Sanjay Mittal's analysis of his bowling, wherein he had attributed reverse magnus force to his dominance. "Nothing can replace hardwork (not even reverse magnus force)," Bumrah tweeted. Bumrah, who will play his first ever 50-over World Cup, has taken 85 wickets in 49 ODIs.

headlines: Woman drowns son, goes to sleep, joins husband in finding son later
text: A 35-year-old woman in Rajasthan's Kota was arrested after she allegedly drowned her six-month-old son in a water tank in her deep sleep and went back to sleep, the police said on Tuesday. The incident came to light when her husband found the boy missing. The woman joined him in the search operations without disclosing the crime, police added.

headlines: 52-yr-old man held for raping 19-yr-old Brazilian in 5-star hotel
text: A 52-year-old man running a charitable institution has been arrested for allegedly raping a 19-year-old Brazilian student who had come to Mumbai as part of a youth exchange programme, police said on Wednesday. The accused raped the woman at a suburban five-star hotel after inviting her to dinner and spiking her drink. A probe is underway in the case.

headlines: Doctor operates 7-yr-old for hernia instead of nose surgery, suspended
text: A government doctor in Kerala was suspended on Wednesday after he performed a hernia surgery on a seven-year-old boy instead of treating his nose. The surgeon defended himself, saying the boy also had a hernia. However, an inquiry revealed his files were mixed up with that of another boy, with a similar sounding name, who was suffering from a hernia.

headlines: British Steel collapses after failing to secure funding
text: The London High Court on Wednesday ordered compulsory liquidation of British Steel, the country's second-largest steel producer, after the company failed to secure emergency government funding. British Steel's staff will continue to be employed as the liquidator oversees operations at its main site, the court said. The company employs 5,000 people while 20,000 more depend on its supply chain.

headlines: IndiGo clocks record market share of 49.9% in April
text: Budget carrier IndiGo has clocked its highest-ever domestic market share of 49.9% during April as it flew a record 54.81 lakh passengers during the month, according to the latest DGCA data. At present, IndiGo has a fleet of about 227 aircraft. Air India came in second after recording a 13.9% market share while SpiceJet recorded a 13.1% market share.

headlines: Gujarat family wakes up to find crocodile in the kitchen
text: A family in Raval village, Gujarat woke up to find an over 4-feet-long crocodile in their kitchen on Wednesday morning. One of the family members, Radhaben Gohil, said the reptile was trying to drink water from a pot kept inside the kitchen. "It might have come from a small lake located behind the house," she added.

headlines: I&B Ministry issues advisory to news, non-news channels
text: A day before the general poll results, the I&B Ministry has issued an advisory to news and non-news channels asking them to adhere with their respective undertakings of carrying news or non-news content. The news channels are mandated to carry news and current affairs content while non-news channels aren't mandated to carry news and current affairs content, the advisory said.

headlines: Cong will accept general poll results with humility: Gehlot
text: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot has said that whatever be the general election results, the Congress party will accept it with "humility". He added that the exit poll predictions have gone wrong several times in the past. "The results will be in our favour," he further said.

headlines: There is no place for violence in democracy: Giriraj Singh
text: Union Minister Giriraj Singh has said that there's no place for violence in democracy and the society had neglected those who raised weapons. His remark came after ex-MLA Ramchandra Singh Yadav displayed his licensed weapon at a press meet. Singh further criticised RLSP President Upendra Kushwaha's 'pick up weapons to protect vote' remark, terming it a voice of "impending defeat".

headlines: Rattled by probable defeat, Opposition questioning EVM: Shah
text: BJP President Amit Shah on Wednesday criticised opposition parties, saying that rattled by their probable defeat, the Opposition is raising questions on EVM and this, in turn, is "tarnishing" country's democracy in the world. He added that opposition to EVM amounts to "disrespecting people's mandate". He said Opposition's demands have "no rationale and are driven by selfish interests".

headlines: US judge rules Qualcomm's practices violate antitrust law
text: A US judge ruled Qualcomm unlawfully suppressed competition in phone chips market and used dominant position to exact excessive licensing fees. Qualcomm was ordered to renegotiate deals with customers, without threatening to halt supplies, at fair prices. In 2017, US FTC sued Qualcomm alleging it used Â“anticompetitiveÂ” tactics to maintain monopoly on a semiconductor used in products like phones.

headlines: Netflix India director Simran Sethi quits in 2 years: Report
text: Netflix's international originals director Simran Sethi has reportedly quit, leaving the role of overseeing original content in India, within two years. This reportedly came over Sethi's unwillingness to shift from the US to Mumbai, as Netflix is looking for an India-based director. Notably, Sethi was responsible for commissioning or acquisitions of series Delhi Crime, Leila and Bard of Blood.

headlines: New government should ease land acquisition rules: CEA
text: Chief Economic Adviser Krishnamurthy Subramanian has said the new government should make it easier for companies to acquire land. It should reduce the cost of land, labour and capital for Indian companies and enhance their ability to compete globally, he said. The government should also scrap archaic laws around hiring workers as part of its first reform measures, Subramanian added.

headlines: Vedanta wins bids for two copper blocks in Maharashtra
text: Mining and metals conglomerate Vedanta on Tuesday said it has been declared the preferred bidder for two copper mining blocks in Maharashtra's Chandrapur district. The blocks, located in Thanewasna and Dubarpeth, are spread over 768.62 hectares and 816.29 hectares, respectively. The mines require extensive exploration and the process will commence in due course, the company said.

headlines: AIB posts update after 7 months, says had to fire everyone overnight
text: The All India Bakchod (AIB) on Wednesday posted an update after seven months since the sexual harassment row surfaced, saying it had to let its office space and entire team go overnight due to lack of revenue. AIB said all of its partners pulled out of future associations. AIB YouTube channel is dead for the foreseeable future, it added.

headlines: Been through it: Celina on Pak cricketer Asif's daughter's death
text: Celina Jaitly has mourned the demise of Pakistani cricketer Asif Ali's 2-year-old daughter, who passed away recently after battling cancer. "The loss of a child transforms a person for...rest of their life, @peterhaag [husband] & I've been through this," she wrote. Celina, who's mother to two sets of twin boys, earlier lost one of the babies to a heart defect.

headlines: I want children, but I don't want the mother: Salman Khan
text: Salman Khan, when asked about having kids, said, "I want children, but with children comes the mother. I don't want the mother, but they need one." "But I have a whole village to take care of them. Maybe I can work out a win-win situation for everyone," he added. When asked about marriage plans, Salman said, "Not for some time."

headlines: AIB's Tanmay Bhat to no longer be CEO, Co-founder Khamba fired
text: In an update over #MeToo allegations after seven months, All India Bakchod (AIB) has said Co-founder Tanmay Bhat's suspension has been lifted but he'll no longer be serving as CEO. Co-founder Gursimran Khamba, who stepped away from sexual harassment investigation, would be working independently. Rohan Joshi and Ashish Shakya would be managing AIB and also pursue solo interests in future.

headlines: Our YouTube channel is dead for the foreseeable future: AIB
text: All India Bakchod (AIB) on Wednesday said that "for all intents and purposes", their YouTube channel is "dead for the foreseeable future". "There'll be no new sketches any time soon. It sucks, but it is what it is," the comedy group said. It added users will be informed if other content such as stand-up clips is uploaded on the channel.

headlines: Varun Dhawan, Natasha to have destination wedding in Dec: Report
text: Actor Varun Dhawan will be marrying his girlfriend for years Natasha Dalal in December this year, the couple's families have decided, a Pinkvilla report quoting a source close to Varun claimed on Wednesday. "In all probabilities, it will be a destination marriage," the report said. "They're looking at getting the entire contingent to Goa for a beach wedding," it added.

headlines: EVMs can't be hacked by any means: Ex-Chief Election Commissioner
text: Former Chief Election Commissioner OP Rawat has said that an EVM cannot be hacked at all and if someone tries tampering it, it stops working and goes into factory mode. He added that EVMs are stand-alone machines which don't connect to internet or Bluetooth. Rawat said that EVMs cannot even be connected to electricity, and they work on in-built battery.

headlines: Team India reaches London for 2019 World Cup, BCCI shares pic
text: Team India on Wednesday reached London for the 2019 World Cup in England and Wales. The BCCI shared a group picture of the team and the support staff, writing, "Touchdown London." India will open their World Cup campaign on June 5 against South Africa, while they will face Pakistan on June 16. The final will be held on July 14.

headlines: Bowlers are scared of me but won't admit it on camera: Chris Gayle
text: Windies' 39-year-old opener Chris Gayle has said that the bowlers across the world are "scared" of him but they would not admit it on camera. "They know what the Universe Boss is capable of," he added. "I'm always enjoying the battle against fast bowlers," he further said. Gayle would retire from ODI cricket after the 2019 World Cup.

headlines: Delhi IPS officer's wife alleges being beaten 'like animal' for dowry
text: A 32-year-old woman named Namrata Singh approached Meerut Police alleging her IPS officer husband was regularly beating her "like an animal" for dowry. Police registered an FIR against IPS officer Amit Nigam, currently posted as assistant commandant in sixth Nagaland Armed Police Battalion and deployed in Delhi. Singh approached the police with red eyes and a swollen face.

headlines: Risk of nuclear war now higher than at any time since WWII: UN
text: The risk of a war involving nuclear weapons is at its highest since World War II, Renata Dwan, Director of the UN Institute for Disarmament Research (UNIDIR), said. Dwan added that all nuclear weapons states have nuclear modernisation programmes underway and called the risk an urgent issue that the world should take seriously.

headlines: Germany's Wirecard to work with India to issue PAN cards
text: German payments company Wirecard on Wednesday said it would work with India to simplify the process of issuing PAN cards. The deal was signed with state-owned UTI Infrastructure Technology and Financial Services. Wirecard said its network of 15,000 retail agents in 350 cities would help collect and digitise the documents that people need to apply for a PAN card.

headlines: Oriflame's founding family makes $1.3 bn offer to buy out company
text: Oriflame's founders have made an offer to buy out the shares in the Swedish cosmetics company they don't already own, valuing the company at $1.3 billion. The Jochnick family, which controls 31% of Oriflame, said it wants to take the company private for "a repositioning in key geographies". The company has lost nearly half its value in the past year.

headlines: Today Congress blame EVMs, tomorrow they'll blame voters: BJP
text: Targeting Congress party over its criticism of EVMs, BJP spokesperson Ram Madhav on Wednesday said they're looking for excuses for their impending defeat tomorrow (May 23). "They've blamed EC, now they're blaming EVMs, tomorrow they'll start blaming voters," he added. Madhav claimed that people want PM Narendra Modi back and they'll "form strong government again, together with NDA partners".

headlines: Afraid of losing: Javadekar on Opposition doubting EVMs
text: Union Minister Prakash Javadekar criticised the Opposition for doubting the EVMs and said that they are "afraid of losing" in the general elections. He added that for the Opposition, if they are winning then EVMs are good but if they are losing, then EVMs are bad. Javadekar said that because of this behaviour, people are "irritated" with the opposition parties.

headlines: Microsoft stops online sale of Huawei laptops after US ban
text: Microsoft has removed the Huawei laptops it sold on its online store after US President Donald Trump's administration blacklisted the Chinese firm, spotted first by The Verge. Microsoft has declined to comment on the issue and also on reports of a potential Windows ban on Huawei. However, some offline Microsoft stores are reportedly still selling stocked Huawei laptops.

headlines: Watching if US-China trade war becomes tech war: Tencent CEO
text: Tencent CEO Pony Ma said, "As the ZTE and Huawei cases have intensified...we are also constantly watching whether the [US-China] trade war will turn into a tech war". "[China's] digital economy will be...hard to sustain if we donÂ’t continue to work hard on basic research and key knowledge," he added. Recently, Google banned Huawei from some Android operating system updates.

headlines: Snapdeal may buy rival ShopClues for up to $250 mn: Reports
text: Snapdeal is reportedly in advanced talks to acquire rival ShopClues in all-stock deal which could be pegged at $200-250 million after earlier discussions ended over disagreement with financial terms. Deal is reportedly expected to be a 100% buyout with all of ShopClues' investors including Tiger Global Management moving to Snapdeal. ShopClues' Radhika Aggarwal and Sanjay Sethi may get cash exit.

headlines: Humans cooked, ate plant starches 1.2 lakh years ago: Study
text: An international team of researchers found charred food remains in a South African cave which serve as earliest evidence that anatomically modern humans roasted and ate plant starches as early as 1.2 lakh years ago. Genetic and biological evidence previously suggested early humans would have been eating starches, but the proof of the same hadn't been found yet, researchers said.

headlines: 2 infants died as J'khand hospital gave wrong vaccine: Families
text: Families of two infants alleged that the two lost their lives after they were given a wrong vaccination at a government hospital in Jharkhand's Giridih. Following the deaths, the families of the deceased resorted to violence against the doctors and the staff. The deceased weren't the only infants who were administered the vaccines, a Civil Surgeon at the hospital said.

headlines: Pulwama, SL attacks made us more determined to fight terror: Swaraj
text: External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj on Wednesday said after Pulwama and Sri Lanka terror attacks, India is more determined to fight terrorism. "We're open to ideas on how we can make work of Regional Anti-Terrorism Structure, which specifically deals with security and defence issues, more effective," she added. She said this at Shanghai Cooperation Organisation's (SCO) meeting in Kyrgyzstan.

headlines: Rape and murder of 10-year-old girl sparks protests in Pakistan
text: The alleged rape and murder of a 10-year-old girl in Pakistan has triggered protests by her family members and locals in the capital Islamabad. The family alleged that the police refused to file an FIR initially and posed insensitive questions to the family. Three individuals, including the prime suspect, have been arrested, according to police.

headlines: Inshorts is looking to hire writers, proofreaders
text: Inshorts is looking to hire people to work as writers and proofreaders in its English Editorial team. Eligibility criteria include bachelors/masters in English or bachelors/masters in Mass Communication with an experience of 2-5 years in the media industry. Interested candidates can send their CV at englishhiring@inshorts.com.

headlines: What happens to the EVMs after the last vote is cast?
text: After the last voter casts his/her vote, the presiding officer presses the 'close' button, following which EVMs don't accept votes. The officer prepares an account of recorded votes which he shares with polling agents, following which EVMs are sealed and signed by agents. The central paramilitary forces take EVMs to strongrooms which are also sealed by EC and polling agents.

headlines: Tejashwi claims children transported EVMs in Bihar, shares pic
text: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav has tweeted, "In Bihar, EVM transportation was also being done by child labourers", with a photo that shows children carrying what appears to be boxes containing EVMs on their head. He added, "EVMs were transported in unregistered vehicles against the rules." Tejashwi alleged that an EVM was seized at a Muzaffarpur hotel in presence of magistrate.

headlines: Govt alerts states and UTs about possible violence on May 23
text: The Home Ministry has alerted all states and Union Territories about possible violence in different parts of the country on Thursday, when the EC will announce Lok Sabha poll results. This comes after Bihar MP Upendra Kushwaha threatened of bloodshed if attempts were made to steal the peoples' votes. Meanwhile, Opposition has asked cadres to closely watch the counting centres.

headlines: What if all exit polls are wrong, will that purify EVMs: Ex-RAW head
text: After 22 Opposition parties met the Election Commission raising questions on transparency and fair functioning of EVMs, ex-chief of Research and Analysis Wing Vikram Sood tweeted, "What if all exit polls are wrong? Will that purify the EVMs?" He further wrote, "EVMs cannot be hacked. They are individual counting machines and not linked to the internet or any other circuit."

headlines: Kohli alone can't win World Cup, others will need to step up: Sachin
text: Former India cricketer Sachin Tendulkar has said that Team India captain Virat Kohli alone can't win the 2019 World Cup for India. "Without team support, you can't do much. Just because of one individual, you can't win a tournament. No way. Unless, others chip in at every crucial stage. If that doesn't happen, there will be disappointment," he added.

headlines: Musk hires man behind viral sheep meme to run Tesla's social media
text: Adam Koszary, the man behind a viral tweet about a giant sheep, has said he would be joining Tesla as social media manager. Koszary, who works at a UK museum, posted the sheep's photo last year with the caption, "Look at this absolute unit". Tesla CEO Elon Musk briefly changed his Twitter profile picture to the same image last month.

headlines: 22-yr-old Delhi man kills father, chops body in 25 parts after argument
text: Delhi's 22-year-old Aman Kumar was arrested after he allegedly killed his father and chopped his body into 25 pieces, following an argument over a property dispute on Tuesday night. He was reportedly arrested along with his friend outside his house while they were trying to dispose of the body. Aman wanted his father to register a property in his name.

headlines: Man held for raping 7 cows at shelter in Ayodhya, act caught on CCTV
text: A man has been arrested for raping seven cows inside a cattle shelter in UP's Ayodhya. The accused was caught red handed by volunteers of the shelter after they came across the CCTV footage showing the man rape the cows. "I was drunk, I do not know what I did. I only remember that I was beaten," the accused said.

headlines: Break-in attempted at IAF's Rafale facility in Paris: ANI
text: A break-in was attempted into a facility of Indian Air Force Rafale Project Management Team in Paris on Sunday night, ANI reported citing sources. The IAF team in France is headed by a Group Captain to oversee the 36 Rafale aircraft's production and training of Indian personnel. The Defence Ministry has been briefed about the incident by IAF, ANI added.

headlines: IAF successfully fires BrahMos missile from Su-30 MKI fighter aircraft
text: The IAF on Wednesday successfully fired the BrahMos air version missile from frontline Su-30 MKI fighter aircraft. The launch from the aircraft was smooth and the missile followed the desired trajectory before directly hitting the land target. BrahMos provides IAF with the capability to strike from large stand-off ranges on any target at sea or on land with pinpoint accuracy.

headlines: Inflatable 'Tank Man' to mark Tiananmen crackdown anniversary
text: Taiwanese artist Shake has created inflatables of a tank and the 'Tank Man' to mark 30 years since China's crackdown on pro-democracy protests at the Tiananmen Square. The 'Tank Man', never officially identified, had stood in front of a convoy of tanks at the square. "As a Taiwanese, I hope I can help China achieve democracy one day," Shake said.

headlines: Studied dictators like Hitler for speech in GoT finale: Emilia
text: Emilia Clarke, who plays Daenerys Targaryen in 'Game Of Thrones', revealed that she studied dictators and world leaders, including Hitler while preparing for her speech in the series' finale. "I watched...videos of....dictators...speaking a different language to see if I could understand what they were saying," she explained. "I was...worried that I was going to f*** it up," Emilia further said.

headlines: Opposition wants to discredit democracy: Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi
text: Targeting Opposition parties for raising concerns about EVMs, BJP's Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Wednesday said they want to "discredit" democracy as they're unable to digest "defeat of the dynasty". "Their failure and embarrassment on providing evidence against EVMs...was like khoda pahad nikli chuhiya," he added. "They approached Supreme Court but they didn't succeed there too," Naqvi further said.

headlines: Will EC make EVMs Electronic Victory Machines for BJP? Cong
text: Criticising the Election Commission (EC) for rejecting Opposition's demand of counting 100% VVPATs in case of even single mismatch with the selected sample, the Congress asked will the EC make EVMs "Electronic Victory Machines" for BJP? Questioning its credibility, Congress asked does EC stand for "Eradicated Credibility"? Congress said it has no formal communication from the EC rejecting Opposition's demands.

headlines: SC grants BJP candidate protection from arrest till May 28
text: The Supreme Court on Wednesday granted BJP candidate Arjun Singh protection from arrest till May 28 in 20 criminal cases lodged against him. The SC said the protection will cease after May 28 and the leader can seek bail from an appropriate forum subsequently. Singh is the party's candidate from West Bengal's Barrackpore.

headlines: Apple says it fixed issues on MacBook Pro butterfly keyboard
text: Weeks after apologising for its keyboard's 'butterfly' mechanism issues, Apple has announced it has fixed them in the new MacBook Pro. Several users had complained about stuck, unresponsive keys, or double or missed key presses. Apple said it's changing the material used in the mechanism to tackle the issues, further announcing it's extending the standard one-year warranty for keyboard issues.

headlines: Sony to stop selling its smartphones in India
text: Japanese technology giant Sony has revealed it will stop selling its smartphones in several countries including India. Sony added it presently considers Japan, Europe, Taiwan and Hong Kong as the "focus regions" for its smartphone business. "We see smartphones as hardware for entertainment and a component necessary to make our hardware brand sustainable," Sony CEO Kenichiro Yoshida said.

headlines: TikTok parent hires former Google executive Sameer Singh as VP
text: TikTok owner ByteDance has appointed media agency GroupM's South Asia CEO Sameer Singh in the role of VP, monetisation, for India. The IIM Calcutta alumnus, who has earlier worked as Director Agencies Business at Google India will join new role in August. In his new role, Sameer will lead the advertising, sales and marketing strategies across ByteDanceÂ’s products in India.

headlines: England to ban plastic straws, cotton buds, drink stirrers
text: England will introduce a ban on single-use plastic items including straws, cotton buds and drink stirrers from April 2020 over environmental concerns. There will be a complete ban on plastic drink stirrers' supply, however, registered pharmacies will be permitted to sell plastic straws, over the counter or online. Eateries won't be allowed to display plastic straws or provide them automatically.

headlines: Centre clears names of 4 judges for elevation to SC: Report
text: As per a report, the Centre has cleared names of four judges for their elevation to the Supreme Court. Once the appointments formally come through, the top court will have its full sanctioned strength of 31 judges, including the Chief Justice. The four names cleared by the government are justices Aniruddha Bose, AS Bopanna, BR Gavai and Surya Kant.

headlines: Protests in Indonesia after election results announced; 6 killed
text: Six people were killed and over 200 injured during protests in Indonesia after the results of the presidential elections were announced on Tuesday. The protests were started by supporters of Prabowo Subianto after the results confirmed the victory of incumbent president Joko Widodo. Subianto has rejected the result, alleging cheating.

headlines: CCI probe finds Monsanto abused dominant position: Reports
text: A CCI probe has reportedly found Mahyco Monsanto Biotech abused its dominant position as a supplier of genetically modified (GM) cotton seeds. The company, a JV between Maharashtra's Mahyco and German drugmaker Bayer, was found charging unreasonably high royalty fees for its GM technology, reports said. The probe was ordered following complaints by Agriculture Ministry and local seed companies.

headlines: Celebrity chef Oliver's restaurant empire collapses, 1,000 jobs lost
text: British celebrity chef Jamie Oliver's restaurant chain went into administration on Tuesday, leaving 1,000 people without jobs. Twenty-two of the 25 UK restaurants in Oliver's restaurant group, which includes Jamie's Italian chain, Fifteen London and Barbecoa, have now closed. "I'm deeply saddened by this outcome and would like to thank all of the staff and our suppliers," the 43-year-old said.

headlines: After vandalising store over hotdog, actor booked for murder attempt
text: TV actor Aansh Arora, who earlier vandalised a Ghaziabad convenience store after being asked to wait for a hotdog, has been booked for attempt to murder. This comes after six masked men allegedly claiming allegiance to him fired gunshots at the store on May 20. The complainant said the assailants fled after the store's security guard fired in the air.

headlines: BJP will keep open mind if parties want to join us: Jay Panda
text: On being asked if BJD will support NDA, BJP leader Baijayant Jay Panda responded, "If other parties, seeing the national mood, also want to join in, I think BJP will keep an open mind." Panda, who earlier quit BJD, added, "Amit Shah said we are confident of getting more than 300 seats. We will form the government with NDA allies."

headlines: SP-BSP workers set up tent, use binoculars to keep check on EVMs
text: Amid allegations of EVM rigging, SP-BSP workers have set up makeshift tents near Election Commission strongrooms in Uttar Pradesh and are using binoculars and walkie-talkies to keep a check on EVMs. The tents are said to be equipped with bedding arrangements, coolers and television screens. Several camps have been set up since April 11, the first phase of General elections.

headlines: Naidu meets Deve Gowda, Kumaraswamy for post-poll alliance
text: Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu met JD(S) supremo HD Deve Gowda and Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy in Bengaluru on Tuesday, two days before the Lok Sabha results are due. JD(S) official Ramesh Babu said, "Naidu... sought JD(S)' support for forming a non-BJP alliance." Reportedly, JD(S) agreed to the alliance and endorsed Congress President Rahul Gandhi for the PM's post.

headlines: I am struggling to believe you are gone: Hamilton on Lauda's death
text: Five-time Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton dedicated an Instagram post to three-time world champion Niki Lauda, who passed away at the age of 70 on Monday. "My buddy, I am struggling to believe you are gone. I'll miss our conversations, our laughs, the big hugs after winning races together. It's truly been an honour working alongside you," he wrote.

headlines: Google stored some passwords in plain text for 14 yrs, apologises
text: Google has apologised after revealing some G Suite users' passwords were stored in plain text for around 14 years due to a bug which it recently discovered. The technology giant said it hasn't found evidence that anybody's password was improperly accessed. "This is a G Suite issue that affects business users only...no free consumer Google accounts were affected," it added.

headlines: Drunk Kerala man hangs self with lungi in police station's toilet
text: A 27-year-old man was found hanging from the window of a police station's toilet in Kerala's Kottayam, hours after being taken into custody for a drunken brawl. The deceased, who allegedly hung himself using his lungi, had been taken into custody after his brother filed a complaint against him. A magisterial inquiry will be conducted into the alleged suicide.

headlines: 5-yr-old beaten to death in Tamil Nadu; mother and lover arrested
text: Tamil Nadu Police has arrested a 36-year-old woman and her partner for killing her five-year-old daughter near Trichy. The man had beaten the child with a tree branch and a PVC pipe, following which the girl succumbed to injuries, police said. The woman's estranged husband accused the couple of killing the girl because she was a hindrance to their relationship.

headlines: Engineer held after Class 6 student tells teacher he molested her
text: A Class 6 girl was allegedly molested by a 45-year-old engineer, who's her neighbour, for over a year. The incident came to light after the girl narrated her ordeal to her school teacher, who then informed her parents. The accused was arrested on Tuesday after the girl told her parents that he kissed her and touched her private parts.

headlines: Nuclear-capable Russian bombers intercepted near Alaska: US
text: US F-22 fighter jets intercepted four nuclear-capable Tu-95 Russian bombers and two Russian Su-35 fighter jets off the coast of Alaska on Monday. "The Russian bombers and fighters remained in international airspace and at no time did the aircraft enter US or Canadian sovereign airspace," the US military said. Russia said its planes were in the region on scheduled sorties.

headlines: McDonald's hit with 25 new sexual harassment lawsuits by workers
text: McDonald's was hit with 25 new lawsuits concerning sexual harassment of workers at its US restaurants. A mother of a two-year-old making $9.60 an hour alleged McDonald's transferred but did not fire her harasser, while her boss cut her weekly hours to seven from 25. CEO Steve Easterbrook said they've redefined harassment policies and will set up a complaint hotline.

headlines: Salman to feature in Shraddha, Prabhas' 'Saaho': Reports
text: Salman Khan will feature in the upcoming film 'Saaho', which will see actress Shraddha Kapoor and 'Bahubali' actor Prabhas in lead roles, as per reports. Reports further suggested that actor Neil Nitin Mukesh, who is playing the villain in the film, suggested Salman's name for the cameo appearance. The film will also feature Mandira Bedi and Chunky Panday, among others.

headlines: Question of Mr India sequel doesn't arise without Sridevi: Director
text: When asked about a potential sequel to the 1987 Anil Kapoor and Sridevi starrer 'Mr India', the film's director Shekhar Kapur said, "[W]ith Sridevi no more, the question doesn't arise." "I don't know what's happening with that project...I was never going to direct the sequel," he added. Shekhar and Anil had earlier shared tweets joking about a possible sequel.

headlines: 1st PM Modi will come to power, then his biopic will release: Vivek
text: Speaking about the upcoming film 'PM Narendra Modi', actor Vivek Oberoi said, "First on May 23, Modi will come to power...then on 24th he'll come in theatres." "The special screenings...in Delhi and Mumbai saw an excitement among the audience," he added. The film is slated to release one day after the results of the general elections are announced.

headlines: Political funeral of anti-BJP gathbandhan on May 23: UP Dy CM
text: Ahead of counting of votes for LS polls, UP Deputy CM Dinesh Sharma today said, "May 23 will witness the political funeral (rajnitik antim sanskar) of the anti-BJP 'gathbandhan' of SP, BSP, RLD and Congress." Claiming the parties will level allegations and counter-allegations against each other, Sharma added, "With mercury rising every day, the temperature of 'gathbandhan' is also rising."

headlines: This general poll was about people vs Opposition: Irani
text: Union Minister Smriti Irani has said that this general election was about the people versus the Opposition. She added she'd like to thank the people who stood firm against the "anarchists who screamed Bharat ke tukde honge" and "unabashedly believed in Bharat". Irani added that in the last five years, the nation stood by PM Narendra Modi through every "endeavour".

headlines: Siddaramaiah not doing well as coordination head: JD(S) leader
text: Karnataka JD(S) chief AH Vishwanath criticised coalition's coordination committee head Siddaramaiah and said that he's not doing well at the post. "My point is as chief, Siddaramaiah should've both the parties together...We haven't understood policies, rules and regulations of the coalition yet," he added. However, he also said despite all issues, "coalition government will stay for a long term".

headlines: You seem unaware of welfare schemes: Kamal Nath to BJP's Bhargava
text: After BJP leader Gopal Bhargava claimed welfare schemes had stopped under the Congress-led MP government, CM Kamal Nath listed his government's achievements and responded, "You seem unaware of all this." Nath claimed, "Within 73 days, we've completed 85 promises." Earlier, Bhargava appealed Governor Anandiben Patel to convene a special assembly session to discuss urgent issues of welfare schemes.

headlines: Flipkart may open stores to sell food like Walmart: Report
text: Walmart-owned Flipkart is reportedly planning to tap into the food retail business, where 100% FDI is allowed, with physical stores. "Globally, around 50-60% of WalmartÂ’s sales come from food. The strategy of opening offline stores falls into WalmartÂ’s overall scheme of things," the report stated citing sources. Recently, Flipkart launched its fifth online grocery store 'Supermart' in Mumbai.

headlines: 5 dead, 2 injured after car collides with truck in Odisha
text: As many as five people of a family were killed and two others were severely injured on Wednesday after their car collided with a truck in Odisha's Kalahandi district, police said. As per a report, the police immediately rushed to the spot after receiving the information of the incident. The injured have been admitted to a nearby hospital.

headlines: Debt-ridden farmer in Rajasthan commits suicide
text: A debt-ridden farmer in Rajasthan's Hanumangarh allegedly committed suicide by hanging himself from a tree on Tuesday. As per the police, the body of the farmer was found hanging from a tree in the premises of Collectorate office. A note about a bank loan was recovered from him, police added.

headlines: US' ex-Vice President Biden a 'fool of low IQ': North Korea
text: North Korea has called US' former Vice President Joe Biden "an imbecile" and a "fool of low IQ" after he called Kim Jong-un a tyrant. "What he uttered is just sophism of an imbecile bereft of elementary quality as a human being, let alone a politician," North Korea's state media said. Biden had commented on Kim at a campaign event.

headlines: Tarun Tahiliani showcases his Pride at Blenders Pride Fashion Tour
text: Designer Tarun Tahiliani created a look that was a celebration of Indian sensibilities fused with a western outlook. His couture mirrored his pride and was donned by the actress Disha Patani, who walked the ramp at the Blenders Pride Fashion Tour 2018-19.

headlines: 2019 Lok Sabha polls record highest ever voter turnout in history
text: The 2019 Lok Sabha elections witnessed a voter turnout of 67.10% (interim), which is the highest ever voter turnout in the history of general elections, as per Election Commission of India. The previous highest voter turnout of 66.44% was recorded in 2014. The seven-phase 2019 elections began on April 11 and concluded on May 19, with counting scheduled for Thursday.

headlines: Not a single student passed Class 10 exams in 63 schools in Gujarat
text: In the results announced on Tuesday, not a single student from as many as 63 schools managed to clear the Secondary School Certificate examinations conducted by the Gujarat Secondary and Higher Secondary Education Board. The overall pass percentage was 66.97%, with total 8,22,823 regular candidates appearing in the exam. Meanwhile, 366 schools posted 100% pass percentage.

headlines: No changes in vote counting process, EC rejects demands of Opposition
text: The Election Commission on Wednesday refused to make any changes to the counting process as demanded by 22 Opposition parties. They had demanded the VVPAT of an entire assembly segment be counted even if one of the five samples doesn't match the EVM. They also demanded that the EVM-VVPAT tally should be done at the beginning of the counting process.

headlines: OnePlus 6, 6T OxygenOS update to get new India-specific features
text: OnePlus announced that it is planning to introduce new OxygenOS features, specially made for Indian users. These features include Work-life Balance, a Smart SMS app, Caller Identification, OnePlus Roaming, and alert for Cricket Scores. They will be released in the Open Beta build by the month of June for the OnePlus 6 and OnePlus 6T smartphones.

headlines: GoT series finale worst rated episode on IMDb in show's history
text: 'Game of Thrones' series finale is the worst-rated episode in the show's history on IMDb. It's also the second worst-reviewed episode in the show's history on Rotten Tomatoes. On IMDb, the worst rated episode prior to season eight was season five's 'Unbowed, Unbent, Unbroken'. Meanwhile, the worst rated episode on Rotten Tomatoes is the fifth episode of season 8.

headlines: Rahul calls exit polls 'fake', asks workers not to believe them
text: Addressing Congress workers a day before counting of votes for the Lok Sabha polls commences, Congress chief Rahul Gandhi tweeted, "Do not be scared, you are fighting for the truth. Do not be disheartened by fake exit polls." Stating that their hard work will not go waste, Rahul added, "Next 24 hours are important. Be alert."

headlines: Is Supreme Court also involved in rigging polls: Cong's Udit Raj
text: Congress leader Udit Raj has tweeted, "Why does the Supreme Court not want all the VVPAT slots to be counted? Is it also involved in rigging?" How does it matter if it takes 2-3 days to count the votes, Raj added. This comes after the apex court dismissed a petition seeking to match 100% EVM votes with VVPATs.

headlines: Team India leave for WC, play PUBG at airport before departure
text: Team India departed from Mumbai on Tuesday night for 2019 Cricket World Cup, which will be held in England and Wales. The BCCI took to Twitter to share pictures of the squad from Mumbai airport, showing some members including former captain MS Dhoni and spinner Yuzvendra Chahal play PUBG. The World Cup will begin on May 30.

headlines: Zuckerberg should hire a new Facebook CEO: Ex-security chief
text: Facebook's former security chief Alex Stamos said CEO Mark Zuckerberg should step down as he "has too much power" and could hire Microsoft President Brad Smith for the role. "Facebook needs to have an internal revolution on the culture of how products are built," Stamos said, adding Smith could be a good fit as an "adult who's been through this".

headlines: Ola denies Foodpanda shutdown report, says staff not fired
text: Bengaluru-based Ola turned down a report claiming it's shutting down its Foodpanda business, adding it has been scaled down significantly to improve efficiency. Responding to claims that it has fired about 40 employees, the Bhavish Aggarwal-led startup said the team is only being restructured. "We're focused on building a portfolio of own food brands and curated food offerings," Ola added.

headlines: Brothers living under 1 roof have issues: China on ties with India
text: Speaking on the Doklam standoff in 2017, China's Ambassador to India, Luo Zhaohui, said that issues between two neighbouring countries are natural just like issues between two brothers of a family living under one roof. "We worked together and resolved the problem, which ensured that bilateral relations were back on normal track," he added.

headlines: Mumbai restaurateur seeks permit to serve 'herbal' hookah from HC
text: A Mumbai-based restaurateur has approached the Bombay High Court seeking permission to serve "herbal" hookah at his three rooftop restaurants. In his petition, he said the provisions of Cigarettes and Other Tobacco Products Act, 2003, aren't applicable to tobacco-free hookah. He said his outlets were shut after fire at a rooftop restaurant in Kamala Mills claimed 14 lives.

headlines: 2 labourers die after inhaling poisonous gas at Delhi flour mill
text: Two labourers working at a flour mill in Delhi died after getting stuck inside a tank. Fire officer Ashok Kumar Jaiswal said, "The victims got inside the tank to clean it. Since the tank had been closed for a while now, they might have inhaled the poisonous gas that was formed inside the tank."

headlines: Bike-borne man stalked, slapped me in Goa: Russian woman
text: A Russian woman has claimed she was stalked and slapped by an unidentified man on a two-wheeler in Goa after she refused his offer for a lift. She said, "He was following me and stopping every five-ten metres and asking me...can he drop me home." She claimed the police have "done nothing" while police said they are verifying the matter.

headlines: Call our Prime Minister Abe Shinzo, not Shinzo Abe: Japan
text: Japan's Foreign Minister Kono Taro has urged international media organisations to call the country's Prime Minister Abe Shinzo, not Shinzo Abe. Writing surnames first is standard in the Japanese language. "As many news organisations write Chinese President Xi Jinping (in the surname, first name order), it is desirable for Abe's name to be written in a similar manner," he said.

headlines: Zambia plans to 'divorce' Vedanta, seize its copper assets
text: Africa's second-biggest copper producer Zambia said it is planning to seize copper assets of billionaire Anil Agarwal's Vedanta Resources. President Edgar Lungu threatened to "divorce" Vedanta and strip its local unit Konkola Copper Mines (KCM) of its mining licence and bring in new investors. The decision follows breaches of the terms of KCM's mining licence, the presidential spokesman said.

headlines: Mallika Sherawat walks the red carpet at Cannes Film Festival
text: Mallika Sherawat walked the red carpet at the Cannes Film Festival on Tuesday. The actress was seen wearing a silver embellished gown with cutouts, a plunging neckline and a long train from designer Tony Ward's fall 2018 collection. The actress was earlier seen wearing a turquoise blue lace dress with keyhole neckline which she last wore at Cannes in 2014.

headlines: Don't know if I fell asleep due to puzzle or Tabu: Ajay on old pic
text: Ajay Devgn took to Twitter to share a behind-the-scenes picture of himself with Tabu from the sets of their 1994 film 'Vijaypath', in which Ajay appears to be asleep. "Still haven't figured if the reason to fall asleep was the puzzle or Tabu," he captioned the picture. Ajay can be seen having a puzzle in his hands in the picture.

headlines: Not taking action against man who kicked me: Arnold on attack
text: After he was kicked from behind by a man at an event, Hollywood actor Arnold Schwarzenegger has said that he won't take legal action against his attacker. "I hope this was a wake-up call, and he gets his life on the right track," Arnold tweeted. His attacker was escorted off the premises by security soon after the incident occurred.

headlines: Dissent in MCC violation cases would not be made public: EC
text: A meeting of the full Election Commission on Tuesday decided by a 2-1 majority that dissenting opinions in the cases of Model Code of Conduct (MCC) violations wouldn't be made public though it will remain part of the official record. It added the dissent cannot be made part of the order since the MCC violation cases aren't quasi-judicial in nature.

headlines: IIT alumnus-led healthtech startup Biofourmis raises $35 mn
text: Singapore-headquartered healthtech startup Biofourmis has raised $35 million in Series B funding round led by Sequoia India and US-based MassMutual Ventures. Singapore's EDBI and China's Jianke also participated. Founded by Kuldeep Singh Rajput, who was a Research Associate at IIT Madras, and Wendou Niu, Biofourmis offers a patented AI-based platform for therapeutic decision support to patients.

headlines: Thieves rob UP police station, police remain unaware for over a day
text: Several valuables were stolen by thieves from Sahibabad Police Station store in Uttar Pradesh, while the police personnel in the station were unaware of the theft for over a day. The stolen items included seized mobile phones, four high definition CCTVs, accessories from cars parked at the complex. Police have arrested two women in connection with the case.

headlines: 4 Noida students killed in accident on way back from holiday
text: Four students from Greater Noida's Sharda University were killed and another was critically injured after a car they were travelling in rammed a stationary mini-truck near Baghpat-Ghaziabad border on Tuesday. The students are believed to have been on their way back from a holiday in Himachal Pradesh. The car was travelling at a speed of 120-130 kmph, said an eyewitness.

headlines: DHFL shares down 18% as firm stops fresh deposits, renewals
text: Dewan Housing Finance (DHFL) shares plunged up to 18% on Wednesday after the company said it will not accept new deposits while stopping renewals of existing ones. The financier added it won't allow premature withdrawals to "help reorganise its liability management". The move comes after CARE Ratings downgraded some of the company's instruments, including its fixed deposit programme.

headlines: Many might leave husbands for Bharat, jokes Salman on Priyanka's exit
text: Speaking about Priyanka Chopra quitting 'Bharat' due to her marriage, Salman Khan jokingly said, "While many would give anything for the film or maybe even leave their husbands, Priyanka left the film." He added he finds it commendable that she chose her marriage over the film. Salman said he'd definitely work with Priyanka in future if he loves a script.

headlines: Critics can go f**k themselves: Kit on GoT season 8 criticism
text: 'Game of Thrones' actor Kit Harington, while speaking about the criticism received by the show's last season, said, "Whatever critic spends half an hour writing about this season and makes their judgment on it, in my head they can go f**k themselves." "Because I know how much work was put into this," he added.

headlines: Mumbai Mahila Congress seeks FIR against Vivek for Aishwarya meme
text: The Mumbai Pradesh Mahila Congress on Tuesday wrote to police seeking an FIR against Vivek Oberoi for sharing an 'election meme' at the expense of Aishwarya Rai Bachchan. The committee wrote that an FIR be filed against Oberoi under Section 509 of the IPC for his "obnoxious statement on women in a meme which has insulted the modesty of women".

headlines: Ex-wife Amber or her friend defecated on my bed as a prank: Depp
text: Hollywood actor Johnny Depp has alleged in a newly submitted lawsuit that his ex-wife Amber Heard or one of her friends defecated on his bed as part of a "sick prank" in 2016. He added the incident took place just before the two left for Coachella. "I resolved to divorce Ms Heard [after that]," Depp further stated in the documents.

headlines: It's disrespectful: Sophie on petition demanding GoT Season 8 remake
text: 'Game of Thrones' actress Sophie Turner has reacted to fans signing a petition demanding a remake of the show's final season. "It's disrespectful to the crew, the writers, and the filmmakers who've worked tirelessly over 10 years, and for 11 months shooting the last season," she said. "When [the ending] doesn't go to [people's liking], they start to...rebel," Sophie added.

headlines: Poll team forgets to erase mock data in Himachal, deletes actual votes
text: Twenty election officials in Himachal Pradesh allegedly forgot to delete mock votes which got added to the actual votes at five booths during Lok Sabha elections on Sunday. When the officials realised their mistake, they deleted some votes, but their error was noticed, said state's chief electoral officer. He added that the erring officers are likely to be suspended.

headlines: ISRO launches cloud-proof radar satellite months after IAF strike
text: ISRO on Wednesday launched RISAT-2B radar satellite, capable of observing Earth during the day, night and even under rainy and cloudy conditions. ISRO launched two RISATs in 2009 and 2012 and plans to launch four more this year. This comes after Balakot airstrikes on February 26, following which PM Narendra Modi claimed cloud cover helped IAF jets escape Pakistan's radars.

headlines: Taj Mahal to be 1st Indian monument to have breastfeeding room
text: A breastfeeding room will be set up in Taj Mahal by July, making it the first Indian monument to have the facility. Archaeological Survey of India official VK Swarnkar said it'll help the "millions of mothers who visit with their babies". Swarnkar said he got the idea when he spotted a mother hiding under a staircase to breastfeed her baby.

headlines: Terrorists hurl grenade at CRPF post in Pulwama, no injuries
