text: Terrorists lobbed a grenade at a CRPF post situated near an SBI branch in Pulwama district, Jammu and Kashmir on Tuesday. The grenade exploded by the roadside, and there were no reports of any loss of life or injuries from the explosion. Following the incident, security forces launched a cordon and search operation to nab the terrorists.

headlines: Gym trainer popular on TikTok dies after being shot at 13 times
text: Mohit Mor, a 27-year-old gym trainer who had 5 lakh followers on TikTok, was shot dead by three men at a shop in Delhi on Tuesday. Mor was talking with his friend inside the shop when three armed men barged inside and indiscriminately fired 13 bullets at him, police said. Two attackers were seen wearing helmets in CCTV footage.

headlines: 2 terrorists killed in encounter in J&K's Kulgam district
text: Two terrorists were killed in an encounter with security forces in the Kulgam district of Jammu and Kashmir on Wednesday. The security forces had launched a cordon and search operation after receiving a tip-off about the presence of militants in Gopalpora village. Meanwhile, as a precautionary measure, mobile internet services have been suspended in Kulgam district.

headlines: Priyanka didn't call me even after Bharat's trailer: Salman
text: When asked whether he spoke to Priyanka Chopra after she quit his upcoming film 'Bharat', Salman Khan said, "No, even after the release of the trailer, Priyanka didn't call me." "Now, if she had some genuine problem then it's alright. I believe, whatever happens, happens for the good," he added. Katrina Kaif was signed for 'Bharat' following Priyanka's exit.

headlines: Sonam Kapoor walks the red carpet at Cannes Film Festival
text: Sonam Kapoor walked the red carpet at the Cannes Film Festival on Tuesday. The actress was seen wearing a white tuxedo with a long train by Ralph and Russo, paired with emerald jewellery by luxury jeweller Chopard and ivory heels by Jimmy Choo. Sonam wore gowns by Valentino, Elie Saab, and Abu Jani and Sandeep Khosla at events held yesterday.

headlines: I didn't find it funny: PM Modi biopic maker on Vivek's meme
text: Reacting to the election meme Vivek Oberoi shared which featured Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, the director of Vivek's upcoming film 'PM Narendra Modi' Omung Kumar said, "I didn't find it funny." "He deleted the post and apologised for it. It happened by mistake," he added. Omung further said that it wasn't a big deal, adding that more disastrous things have happened.

headlines: Alia is focussed & quiet, doesn't jump around on set: Mom Soni
text: Speaking about working with her daughter Alia Bhatt in the film 'Raazi', actress Soni Razdan said, "I found Alia to be very instinctive and a sensitive actor." "She is completely focussed on set...She is quiet and doesn't jump around, neither does she talk too much," Soni added. She further said that Alia was a lot like her as an actor.

headlines: AAP ke saath: Akhilesh tweets after meeting party's leader
text: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Tuesday held a meeting with AAP leader Sanjay Singh following which he posted a picture on Twitter with a caption, "AAP ke saath." After the meeting, Singh said their strategy is to stop BJP from forming government at the Centre. Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal responded to Yadav's tweet, saying, "We're also with you Akhilesh Ji."

headlines: Freshworks acquires US customer success software firm Natero
text: Freshworks (formerly Freshdesk), which provides businesses with Software-as-a-Service customer engagement solutions, has acquired US-headquartered Natero, a customer success management software firm, for an undisclosed amount. As per Crunchbase, Natero had raised $3.3 million in disclosed funding till date. Freshworks was founded in 2010 by Girish Mathrubootham and Shan Krishnasamy.

headlines: New low cost lens making method uses liquid mould, magnets
text: Researchers from Washington State University and Ohio State University have developed a new low-cost method to make custom lenses. They developed a liquid mould from droplets that they can manipulate with magnets to create lenses in a variety of shapes and sizes. "This novel process allowed us to...create lenses without having to fabricate expensive moulds," a researcher said.

headlines: Govt to sell up to 25% in RailTel, seeks merchant bankers for IPO
text: The government is looking to divest up to 25% stake in RailTel Corporation through an IPO. It will further appoint up to three merchant bankers to manage the listing process and has invited bids for the same by June 11. RailTel is one of India's largest neutral telecom infrastructure providers and has created optic fibre network alongside railway tracks.

headlines: RBI to create specialised supervisory and regulatory cadre
text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Tuesday said its central board has decided to create a new cadre of officials to facilitate supervision and regulation of lenders. The board also reviewed the current economic situation, and global and domestic challenges of the central bank. It further discussed issues in currency management and banker to government functions of the RBI.

headlines: Bimal Dayal to lead merged entity of Indus Towers, Bharti Infratel
text: Bharti Airtel and Vodafone Group have announced Bimal Dayal, who is currently CEO of Indus Towers, will be appointed CEO of the merged entity of Indus Towers and Bharti Infratel. Dayal, who joined Indus Towers as its Chief Operating Officer in 2010, previously worked with Ericsson. The tower companies further named Indus CFO Hemant Ruia as the combined entity's CFO.

headlines: I was slapped 30 times for questioning director: Taiwanese actress
text: Taiwanese actress Ke-Xi Wu has revealed that she was once slapped 30 times in the face during the shoot of an advertisement for questioning the director. She said that even the crew started bullying her afterwards. "I had nightmares and the director's voice was in my head all the time. I'd experience this humiliation over and over again," she added.

headlines: Upset by exit polls, Muslim cleric in UP calls for special namaaz
text: After the exit polls predicted a second term for BJP-led NDA, a senior cleric at a Muslim seminary in Uttar Pradesh asked all mosques to recite special prayers for "favourable" results on May 23. "In the prevailing scenario it is very important to pray very hard for peace and prosperity...and for the protection of Muslims," said Mufti Mehmood Hasan Bulandshahri.

headlines: MS Dhoni will be a big player in 2019 World Cup: Ravi Shastri
text: Team India head coach Ravi Shastri has said that wicketkeeper and former captain MS Dhoni will be a big player in the 2019 World Cup. "There's no one better than him when it comes to keeping and also dealing with those tight situations in matches. It was great to see the way he was moving in this IPL,' he added.

headlines: Kuldeep, Chahal are pillars of IndiaÂ’s bowling attack: Virat Kohli
text: Captain Virat Kohli has said spinners Yuzvendra Chahal and Kuldeep Yadav are the two pillars of Team India's bowling lineup. "In hindsight, if you look at it, someone like Kuldeep who has had so much success, it's important to see a period where things donÂ’t go your way. We're glad it happened in IPL rather than in WC," he added.

headlines: Account hacking platform gets hacked, data of 1 lakh users exposed
text: Hacking platform OGUsers, which enables trading stolen Instagram and Twitter accounts, was itself hacked on May 12, exposing private data of over 1 lakh users, cybersecurity platform KrebsOnSecurity said. The forum's administrator had claimed a hard drive failure had wiped out the information. However, rival platform RaidForums publically uploaded OGUsers' data on May 16 to be downloaded for free.

headlines: Ola driver strips outside Hyderabad office after cab taken off road
text: An Ola driver named Arjun staged a nude protest for 30 minutes outside the ride-hailing platform's office in Hyderabad's Kukatpally on Monday. The company was allegedly preventing him from taking his cab while expecting him to pay the daily rent for the vehicle. Arjun resorted to the protest reportedly after Ola executives delayed solving the issue for over 10 days.

headlines: 6,800 people who invested $27 billion get UAE permanent residency
text: The UAE on Tuesday said it had launched a "Golden Card" permanent residency programme, granting 6,800 permits to foreigners who together had invested 100 billion dirhams ($27 billion). People with "exceptional skills" in medicine, engineering, science and arts are also eligible under the programme. Last year, the UAE announced plans to grant long-term visas to investors, senior scientists and entrepreneurs.

headlines: Pakistan rupee continues to fall, reaches another low after IMF deal
text: Pakistan's rupee reached a new record low of 153 per dollar on Monday in the wake of a $6 billion loan accord with the International Monetary Fund (IMF). "A market-determined exchange rate" will help Pakistan's economy, the IMF had said. The country's central bank, the State Bank of Pakistan, lifted interest rates by 150 basis points on Monday to 12.25%.

headlines: We were expecting 5: Woman after giving birth to 6 babies in Poland
text: A 29-year-old woman gave birth to Poland's first-ever sextuplets, two boys and four girls, on Monday with each newborn weighing around one kilogram. "We were expecting five babies...It was a shock at first but after delivery I could touch one of the babies...then happiness came," the mother said. The sextuplets were delivered in the 29th week of pregnancy.

headlines: 53-yr-old man put plane on autopilot for sex with 15-yr-old, faces jail
text: US-based 53-year-old millionaire businessman Stephen Bradley Mell put his private plane on autopilot mode in July 2017 to have sex with a 15-year-old girl and is facing five years in jail, police said. Mell came into contact with the girl after her mother approached him to give her flying lessons. He's currently out of jail on a $1 million bond.

headlines: Men in PM Modi masks make 3,000 kg laddoos for poll results
text: Ahead of poll results, a sweet shop in Mumbai received an order for preparing 3,000 kilograms of laddoos by BJP's Gopal Shetty. "After exit polls, we think [Shetty] will win. Also, since our workers are PM Narendra Modi's supporters, they're making sweets wearing his face masks," the shop owner said. Exit polls predicted majority for BJP-led NDA in the elections.

headlines: Upset over exit polls, Cong MLA calls party leader 'buffoon'
text: Karnataka Congress MLA, R Roshan Baig, held AICC General Secretary KC Venugopal and others responsible for exit poll outcomes and said, "Venugopal is a buffoon. I feel sorry for my leader Rahul Gandhi ji." "Buffoons like Venugopal, arrogant attitude of Congress Legislature Party chief Siddaramaiah and flop show of Karnataka Congress President Dinesh Gundu Rao...The result is this," he added.

headlines: I don't think I am competing with Hardik Pandya: Vijay Shankar
text: All-rounder Vijay Shankar has said that he doesn't think that he is competing with compatriot Hardik Pandya. "He is a terrific cricketer. Yes, we are all-rounders but we are different from each other. And why do we need to compete? It would be great if both of us can contribute in India's victory," he added.

headlines: Rahul punished Sheila, fielded her against me: Manoj Tiwari
text: Delhi BJP President Manoj Tiwari said Congress President Rahul Gandhi punished party's North East Delhi candidate Sheila Dikshit by fielding her against him. "Making her contest against me and that too at her age. I can sympathise with her," Tiwari added. He further said that since a Purvanchal leader has been handed BJP in Delhi, the party's popularity has grown.

headlines: This election's campaign was like pilgrimage for me: PM Modi
text: Addressing the members of his Council of Ministers, PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that he has seen many elections but this election's campaign was like a "pilgrimage" for him. The PM also congratulated the members for successfully working as a team for the last five years. The PM further termed completion of the NDA's tenure as a "successful experiment".

headlines: EC could have taken decisions in time: Ex-CEC Krishnamurthy
text: Former Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) TS Krishnamurthy has said that the Election Commission has done a "good job" in conducting the general elections but could have taken decisions on certain complaints in time. He added that the EC could also have given reasons for its decisions on MCC violations' complaints. Krishnamurthy further said it's in "fairness to record" one's dissent.

headlines: Uttarakhand CM asks PM's critics to spend day at Kedarnath cave
text: Uttarakhand CM Trivendra Singh Rawat termed Opposition's criticism of PM Narendra Modi's Kedarnath visit "extremely unfortunate" and asked the critics to spend a day at the cave where the PM meditated. He added the Opposition was criticising PM Modi as they were upset over the exit poll results. He claimed the NDA would get over 300 seats in general elections.

headlines: BJP candidate from WB's Barrackpore in danger: Vijayvargiya
text: BJP General Secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya on Tuesday claimed that life of Arjun Singh, the BJP candidate from West Bengal's Barrackpore Lok Sabha constituency, is in danger. He alleged that state CM Mamata Banerjee has instructed Commissioner of Police, Sunil Choudhary, to arrest Singh. Vijayvargiya said, "He (Arjun Singh) might get killed in an encounter as well."

headlines: Pixel 3a users complain their new phones randomly shut down
text: Some users have complained on platforms like Reddit and Google's support page that their Google Pixel 3a and Pixel 3a XL phones were "randomly shutting down", reports said. Some users alleged they had to perform a hard reset to bring their phones back to working state, however, later, the problem still persisted. The new phones were launched earlier this month.

headlines: Twitter is really a typewriter for me: US Prez Donald Trump
text: US President Donald Trump during an interview with Fox News Channel said, "Twitter is really a typewriter for me". Trump explained, "[A]s soon as [a tweet] goes out, it goes on television, it goes on Facebook, it goes all over the place and it's instant". He further added that Twitter to him really is a modern way to communicate.

headlines: Gas layer could be protecting an ocean inside Pluto: Study
text: A global research team claimed an insulating layer of gas hydrates could be protecting an ocean on Pluto. A Texas-sized, white-coloured basin with an icy surface, named Sputnik Planitia, was revealed in Pluto's first-ever close-up images. Scientists said the gas layer could exist beneath the icy surface, backing their claim with computer simulations covering a timescale of 4.6 billion years.

headlines: NCLAT to hear vendors' plea against CCI order on Flipkart
text: The National Company Law Tribunal (NCLAT) has admitted the petition submitted by an online vendors' body against the Competition Commission of India's (CCI) ruling in favour of Flipkart in November 2018. The fair trade regulator had absolved Flipkart of unfair practices using its dominant position. It held that the e-commerce major's business practices are not in violation of competition norms.

headlines: Loudest ever underwater sound produced, instantly vaporised water
text: Stanford University researchers have produced the loudest possible underwater sound with intensity equivalent to directing a city's electrical power onto a single square metre. The sound above 270 decibels was created using powerful X-ray pulses which instantly vaporised water jets to create shockwaves, whose pressure approached its breaking point, wherein water breaks into vapour-filled bubbles.

headlines: H'wood actress faints at Cannes Film Fest, says dress was too tight
text: Hollywood actress Elle Fanning fainted during the Chopard TrophÃ©e dinner party at Cannes Film Festival and fell off her chair. She was sitting at a table next to sister Dakota, who helped her before security escorted them. Elle later wrote on Instagram, "Oops, had a fainting spell tonight in my 1950's Prada prom dress but it's all good!! #dresstootight #timeofthemonth."

headlines: PM Modi, Amit Shah meet Union council of ministers in New Delhi
text: Ahead of the Lok Sabha election results on May 23, PM Narendra Modi and BJP chief Amit Shah on Tuesday met the Union council of ministers at the party headquarters in Delhi. According to reports, Shah is also hosting a dinner at The Ashok hotel in Delhi for the top leaders of the BJP-led National Democratic Alliance for further discussions.

headlines: Allegations baseless: EC on unescorted EVMs in UP, Bihar
text: Election Commission has responded to multiple reports of EVMs being transported without security in parts of UP and Bihar. The poll body called the reports baseless and clarified that in all cases, the EVMs and VVPATs were sealed properly in front of candidates. The aspersions in clips merely pertain to the storage or movement of reserve unused EVMs, it added.

headlines: Commander accused of harassing pilot barred from Air India premises
text: An Air India commander, who was accused of sexually harassing a female pilot in Hyderabad, has been barred from the airline's premises. According to an official document, he can't enter the offices without a written permission till an inquiry is over. The female pilot had said that the commander had asked her whether she didn't "need sex every day".

headlines: 3 transgenders arrested for chopping off manÂ’s genitals in UP
text: Three transgenders were arrested on Monday after a 22-year-old man accused them of chopping off his genitals in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur, police said. The victim performs in a band in marriages. The three accused had allegedly kidnapped him from a wedding using sedatives and after cutting off his private parts, they kept him in chains but he managed to escape.

headlines: 4-year-old girl dies after falling into borewell in Rajasthan
text: A four-year-old girl died after she fell into a 440-feet deep borewell in a village in Rajasthan's Jodhpur district on Monday. She was playing near the borewell when she fell into it and got stuck at a depth of 260 feet. Rescue workers pulled out her body after a 14-hour operation and handed it over to her family on Tuesday.

headlines: People walk on track, travel on truck to office post Delhi Metro glitch
text: Several Delhi Metro commuters walked on tracks to reach their offices after the Yellow Line developed a technical snag between Sultanpur and Qutub Minar metro stations on Tuesday morning, videos of which were widely shared online. Commuters from two trains were evacuated. Thousands of passengers were stranded at stations, while some were ferried in a truck arranged by the police.

headlines: Anil Ambani to drop defamation suits against Cong leaders, Herald
text: Anil Ambani's Reliance Group has decided to withdraw the civil defamation suits filed in an Ahmedabad court against Congress leaders and the National Herald newspaper for an article on the Rafale fighter jet deal. Reliance companies filed the suits against a few journalists and Congress leaders like Randeep Singh Surjewala, Oommen Chandy, Ashok Chavan, Abhishek Manu Singhvi and Sanjay Nirupam.

headlines: CPI(M) demands re-polling in West BengalÂ’s Diamond Harbour
text: Communist Party of India (Marxist) has written to Election Commission demanding re-polling in West Bengal's Diamond Harbour. CPI(M) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury alleged there were "large-scale irregularities" in May 19 polling held at Diamond Harbour. He said the scale of irregularities was such that EC should invoke Article 324 and "ensure free and fair elections by ordering re-polling".

headlines: Still in favour of Bihar's special category status: CM Nitish Kumar
text: Ahead of attending a dinner meeting being hosted by BJP President Amit Shah, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said that the JD(U) is still in favour of the special category status to the state. He added that the issue is "very important" for the party and it'll continue to raise it. He also expressed confidence in NDA's victory in general polls.

headlines: Genius Dhoni can be India's trump card at WC: Zaheer Abbas
text: Former Pakistan captain Zaheer Abbas said, "India has a genius called Mahendra Singh Dhoni in the team. He is the brain of cricket in the team... [H]e can be their trump card." "He understands the game so well and has experience of leading India in two World Cup wins," Abbas added about the former Indian captain.

headlines: He was an Austrian treasure: Arnold Schwarzenegger on Niki Lauda
text: Following F1 racer Niki Lauda's death, Hollywood actor and American politician Arnold Schwarzenegger tweeted, "Niki was a champion. He was an Austrian treasure. He was one of my dear friends. I'll miss this generous, trailblazing hero with my whole heart." "Thank you for everything that you did for me... Learned so much from you," former F1 driver Nico Rosberg tweeted.

headlines: Facebook uses AI to build 3 maps aimed at disease prevention
text: Facebook has built three new detailed maps using machine vision AI and satellite imagery aimed at helping public health workers tackle diseases efficiently. The maps anonymously show patterns of where people live, where they're moving to and whether they're connected to the internet. Facebook is partnering with over 15 organisations including Direct Relief and UNICEF, COO Sheryl Sandberg said.

headlines: Stem cells regenerate heart cells post heart attack in mice: Study
text: A study by researchers including Hina Chaudhry and Sangeetha Vadakke-Madathil showed that placental stem cells Cdx2 can regenerate healthy heart cells in animal models. Mice injected with Cdx2 treatment after heart attack showed improvement and regeneration of healthy heart tissue. Chaudhry said the team had isolated Cdx2 cells from term human placentas also and hoped to design better treatment.

headlines: 13 students injured in violence in Muzaffarnagar college
text: At least 13 students, including three girls, of Bhagwant Institute of Technology, Muzaffarnagar, were injured after an attack by another group over old enmity on Monday. An FIR regarding the incident was filed by the college authorities. According to the complainant, students were in class when another group of students entered college and beat them up with sticks.

headlines: Government seeks to recover tax dues from IL&FS group firms
text: The CBIC has asked officials to take "suitable action" to recover dues from 169 India-based subsidiaries of cash-strapped IL&FS, BloombergQuint reported. The department reportedly used PAN and GST identification numbers of firms and segregated them based on jurisdictions. CBIC's regional offices have been asked to recover tax from firms that fall under their respective jurisdictions, reports said.

headlines: Scoot's Vinod Kannan named Vistara's Chief Strategy Officer
text: Vistara on Tuesday appointed Vinod Kannan as its Chief Strategy Officer, as the carrier prepares to fly overseas. He will be taking over from Sanjiv Kapoor, who will continue to serve as Vistara's Chief Commercial Officer. Kannan has been working as the Chief Commercial Officer at Scoot, the low-cost carrier of Singapore Airlines.

headlines: Soaps are harsh on pimple, switch to Himalaya Neem face wash
text: Consumers often use soap on pimples, unaware that it can be harsh, and it can lead to increase in pimple problem, says Himalaya. Advocating that one should not use soap on pimples, Himalaya presents Purifying Neem Face Wash which is Soap-free, hence not harsh. It is enriched with the antibacterial goodness of Neem and Turmeric that helps to remove pimples.

headlines: Man asks Chinmayi to 'send nudes', she shares her response on Twitter
text: Singer Chinmayi Sripaada on Monday took to Twitter to share the response she gave to a man who messaged her on Instagram asking for her nude pictures. The 34-year-old singer sent the man a picture of nude shade of lipsticks and wrote, "some of my favourite nudes". "Savage reply" and "That's not what he expected", people reacted to her response.

headlines: I am so proud of her: Ellen on India's 1st openly gay athlete Dutee
text: American TV show host Ellen DeGeneres took to Twitter to praise India's fastest female sprinter Dutee Chand for publicly revealing that she is in a same-sex relationship. "She's the 100m record holder and the first openly gay sportsperson in India. I guess she knows a thing or two about being first. I'm so proud of her," Ellen wrote.

headlines: It's nuisance: SC dismisses petition for verifying all votes with VVPAT
text: Supreme Court on Tuesday dismissed a petition that sought matching of all voter-verifiable paper audit trail (VVPAT) slips with EVMs during the counting of votes on May 23, calling it a "nuisance". It had earlier dismissed a plea filed by Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu-led Opposition seeking that random matching of VVPAT slips with EVMs be increased to 50%.

headlines: 22 Opposition parties meet EC, keep 2 demands over EVM issues
text: Twenty-two Opposition parties met Election Commission on Tuesday, demanding that the verification of VVPAT slips of five randomly identified polling booths per Assembly constituency should be done before the counting of votes and not after. They also said if any discrepancy is found, 100% counting of the paper slips of all polling stations in that Assembly segment should be done.

headlines: US underestimates Huawei, conflict with them inevitable: Founder
text: Huawei Founder and CEO Ren Zhengfei has said the US "underestimates" the Chinese telecom equipment maker's capability. "In terms of 5G technologies, others won't be able to catch up with Huawei in two or three years," he said. Zhengfei added that conflict with the US is inevitable in the quest to "stand on top of the world".

headlines: Sherpa climbs Everest twice in a week, completes record 24 climbs
text: Only six days after making a record 23rd ascent to Mount Everest, Nepalese Kami Rita Sherpa bettered his record on Tuesday while guiding a team of Indian police. He first summited the 8,848-metre peak in 1994 while working for a commercial expedition. The 49-year-old guide has made 35 summits on five 8,000-metre peaks, including K2, the world's second-highest mountain peak.

headlines: Why be MP when you can be PM on-screen: Vivek on joining politics
text: Replying to questions of joining politics, actor Vivek Oberoi, who features as PM Narendra Modi in leader's biopic, said, "Who wants to be an MP when you can be PM on-screen." Oberoi added he was first offered an MP ticket in 2004. He further said he's been offered the MP ticket from regional and national parties, but had denied them.

headlines: Mallika Sherawat repeats Cannes 2014 outfit at Cannes 2019
text: Actress Mallika Sherawat was seen at the 72nd Cannes Film Festival in a turquoise blue lace gown, which she was last seen wearing on the Cannes red carpet in 2014. The actress paired the gown with a tan-coloured trench coat with faux fur sleeves during an interview yesterday. Her gown is by Parisian designer Francois Joseph Graf.

headlines: Very shameful: Anupam on Vivek sharing meme featuring Aishwarya
text: Reacting to the controversy surrounding Vivek Oberoi sharing an election meme that featured actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, Anupam Kher said, "It's very shameful." "It's as simple as that. He shouldn't have done that. It's absolutely not cool," the actor further said. The meme also featured Vivek, Salman Khan, Aishwarya's husband Abhishek Bachchan as well as their daughter Aaradhya.

headlines: Reports of unescorted EVMs in Bihar 'bogus': Nitish Kumar
text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Tuesday said that the Opposition's allegation that the movement of EVMs in the state was unsecured and unescorted is "bogus". He added that he believes that after the introduction of the EVMs, the elections in India have become transparent. Nitish said that Opposition's such statements show that they're "nervous" ahead of the general poll results.

headlines: All exit polls wrong, real result on May 23: Sharad Yadav
text: Reacting to the exit polls prediction that the NDA will return to power with a majority, LJD leader Sharad Yadav said that all the exit polls are "wrong". He added the real result of polls would be known to all on May 23. Yadav further said the mahagathbandhan's decision on the PM candidate will be taken after the poll results.

headlines: At least 10 Cong MLAs being offered money, posts: Kamal Nath
text: Madhya Pradesh CM Kamal Nath on Tuesday alleged that Congress MLAs are being lured by money and posts. "At least 10 MLAs have told me now that they're getting phone calls where they're being offered money and posts," Nath said. He, however, maintained that the MLAs will not desert the Congress party and said he has "complete trust" on them.

headlines: Ex-Aus pacer Bichel credits Dhoni for Kohli's finishing
text: Former Australian pacer Andy Bichel has credited former Indian captain MS Dhoni for helping current Team India captain Virat Kohli develop his finishing ability. "I think back to Sachin (Tendulkar) and taking nothing away from him, Kohli has changed the mindset and fulfilled the role of being a finisher and being there in the end during big chases," Bichel said.

headlines: Diego Maradona to undergo shoulder surgery
text: Former Argentine footballer Diego Maradona will travel to Buenos Aires for surgery on his left shoulder. The 58-year-old was due to fly from Mexico, where he is currently coaching the nation's second division side Dorados. Notably, Argentina's former World Cup-winning footballer has suffered a series of health problems since his retirement.

headlines: Mkhitaryan will miss Europa League final due to safety concerns
text: Arsenal's Armenian midfielder Henrikh Mkhitaryan will not be travelling to Azerbaijan for the UEFA Europa League final against Chelsea due to security concerns. "We've thoroughly explored all the options for Micki to be part of the squad but after discussing this with Micki and his family we've collectively agreed he will not be in our travelling party," Arsenal's statement read.

headlines: Video: Robot transforms from flying to crawling on land
text: A video shows a robot prototype, conceived by researchers at Israel's Ben-Gurion University, that can fly like a quadcopter, land and tilt its arms downwards to crawl on four wheels. Named 'FSTAR', it uses the same motors to fly and crawl. It can also sprawl to drive under low passages and could help in search and rescue missions.

headlines: Stanford's $3,000 robot Doggo does backflips without springs
text: Stanford students have developed a four-legged, dog-like manual robot 'Doggo', built under $3,000, that can jump, trot and perform backflips without using springs. It uses force-sensing external motors that continuously determine the force and torque levels needed for each movement. The team said they made Doggo open-source so that people could build it themselves on a relatively small budget.

headlines: TikTok owner launches new interest-based social app Feiliao
text: TikTok owner ByteDance has launched a new interest-based social app named 'Feiliao', which is a hybrid of an instant messenger plus interest-based forums. "We hope Feiliao will connect people with the same interests, making peopleÂ’s life more diverse and interesting," ByteDance said. The app, which also offers video calls, is reportedly only available in China.

headlines: PNB may take control of 2-3 small state-run banks: Reports
text: State-run Punjab National Bank (PNB) could take control of two-three small state-run banks, according to reports. These small lenders could include Oriental Bank of Commerce, Andhra Bank and Allahabad Bank, reports added. The country's third-largest public sector lender could start the process of taking control of the banks in the next three months, reports further said.

headlines: Virat unveils limited edition PUMA one8 gold spikes
text: Indian Cricket team captain Virat Kohli has just revealed his special spikesÂ–the PUMA one8 Gold Spike 19.1, made exclusively for the most awaited cricket tournament of the year. With only 150 pairs available, this is a part of the limited edition Virat Collector's Series. The gold & white spikes are available at puma.com, select PUMA stores, Myntra and Flipkart.

headlines: Cricket match was once delayed due to life-sized tiger toy
text: On May 21, 2011, a cricket match between South Wiltshire and Hampshire Academy at Rose Bowl in Hampshire was interrupted for 20 minutes after members of the public reported sighting a white tiger in a field nearby. Local police launched a large-scale operation involving a helicopter and discovered it to be a life-sized stuffed toy tiger.

headlines: GoT actress Maisie Williams' startup raises $2.5 million
text: London-based talent discovery platform Daisie has closed $2.5 million in seed funding, led by Founders Fund, which contributed $1.5 million. Co-founded by film producer Dom Santry and Game of Thrones actress Maisie Williams, the app hit 100,000 members on its platform 11 days after launch. On Daisie, artists can seek projects based on location, activity, or other factors.

headlines: No fatigue due to IPL, it'll be the most challenging WC: Virat Kohli
text: While addressing the media ahead of the team's departure for World Cup, Team India captain Virat Kohli said that the tournament will be the most challenging out of the three he has been part of because of the round-robin format. He added that all the World Cup-bound players look fresh and no one is fatigued due to the IPL.

headlines: Concerned at reports of alleged EVM tampering: Pranab Mukherjee
text: Former President Pranab Mukherjee on Tuesday raised concerns over the reports of alleged EVM tampering and said, "There can be no room for speculations that challenge the very basis of our democracy." He added, "The onus of ensuring institutional integrity, in this case, lies with the Election Commission." "They must do so and put all speculations to rest," he said.

headlines: 74-year-old Samoa PM qualifies for archery at Pacific Games
text: Samoa's Prime Minister Tuilaepa Sailele Malielegaoi has qualified for the archery competition at the Pacific Games. The 74-year-old last fired an arrow competitively when Samoa held the Games 12 years ago, earning himself a silver medal. "We need to practice as often as possible to improve our shooting style...we need to perfect our techniques," he said.

headlines: New definitions adopted for units of mass, current, temperature
text: Scientists worldwide adopted new hyper-accurate definitions for units of mass (kilogram), electric current (ampere), and temperature (kelvin) on World Metrology Day this Monday. Last November, the kilogram was redefined after 129 years and will now be derived from the Planck constant instead of referring to the metal cylinder stored near Paris, mass of which could vary due to surrounding dust.

headlines: Journo poses as customer, helps DCW bust sex racket in Delhi mall spa
text: The Delhi Commission for Women has said it has busted a sex racket operating from a spa at a mall in the National Capital's Rohini area. The commission stated they received a call from a journalist, who had gone to the spa pretending to be a customer and "was offered girls at different rates". The journalist also recorded the incident.

headlines: NZ police file country's 1st terror charge against man who killed 51
text: New Zealand police have charged the man accused of murder in shootings at two Christchurch mosques in March with engaging in a terrorist act, the first time such a charge had been brought in the country's history. In an attack broadcast live on Facebook, the lone gunman targeted Muslims attending Friday prayers, killing 51 worshippers and wounding dozens of people.

headlines: Hinduja Group says it is looking to bid for Jet Airways
text: Indian conglomerate Hinduja Group, the owner of Ashok Leyland, has said it is evaluating a possible bid for debt-laden Jet Airways. The news sent shares of the grounded carrier as high as 14% in afternoon trading on Tuesday. Etihad, which already holds a minority stake in Jet, earlier said it's interested in re-investing in the airline subject to certain conditions.

headlines: #MenToo movement can embolden harassers, rapists: Tanushree
text: Tanushree Dutta has urged the Indian public not to support the #MenToo movement which seeks to protect men who claim they've been framed by women. "[It] can...embolden real harassers...rapists...into forming organisations to shield themselves from law and justice," she said. "[T]his additional threat of men's rights organisations can further threaten the safety of women," Tanushree added.

headlines: TikTok owner gets rights from T-Series for new music app: Report
text: TikTok owner ByteDance has reportedly secured music rights from T-Series and Times Music as it is developing a paid music service app. China's ByteDance reportedly expects to launch the app in certain territories later this year. The app will reportedly include a catalogue of songs available on demand, along with videos, and isn't a Spotify or Apple Music clone.

headlines: Opposition leaders meet ahead of Lok Sabha poll results
text: Ahead of the Lok Sabha poll results on May 23, opposition leaders held a meeting at Delhi's Constitution Club of India. TDP chief N Chandrababu Naidu, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, along with leaders of Congress, BSP, Left, TMC, SP, RJD and others were present at the meeting. The meeting was reportedly organised to discuss the possibility of a non-NDA alliance.

headlines: Experienced New Zealand no longer dark horses: Mike Gatting
text: Former England captain Mike Gatting spoke about New Zealand's chances at the upcoming World Cup, saying, "You can no longer call them dark horses as their players are so experienced." "They play some great cricket, they always play as a team and they are well led by Kane Williamson," Gatting added about the Kiwis.

headlines: Intel, Qualcomm, others cut off supplies to Huawei: Report
text: American chipmakers including Intel and Qualcomm have told their staff they will cut off parts supply to Chinese smartphone manufacturer Huawei till further notice, Bloomberg reported. This comes over the US government's global call to blacklist the world's second-largest smartphone maker Huawei over alleged espionage concerns. Notably, Google has also cut off some software services to Huawei.

headlines: CCI probes anti-competitive conduct by Maruti: Reports
text: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) is reportedly looking into allegations that Maruti Suzuki engaged in anti-competitive practices. The regulator is reportedly looking into allegations that Maruti forces its dealers to limit the discounts they offer, stifling competition among them. The CCI has been reviewing the allegations for about 10 months, reports added.

headlines: Tiger Global may invest $20M in CRED's $100M funding: Report
text: Tiger Global Management may reportedly invest up to $20 million in FreeCharge Founder Kunal Shah's credit card bill payment startup CRED's $100 million funding round. The Bengaluru-based startup is reportedly looking to raise $100 million at a $400-million valuation from China-based VC firm Hillhouse Capital alongside existing investors. CRED was announced by Shah in 2018.

headlines: Red colour found in an ancient fossil for the first time
text: A global team of researchers has detected chemical traces of red-coloured pigment in a well-preserved fossil of a 3-million-year-old extinct field mouse species for the first time ever, using X-ray spectroscopy. The around seven-cm-long field mouse, nicknamed "Mighty Mouse", was found to have brown to reddish colour fur on its back and sides while its stomach-area was white, researchers revealed.

headlines: Ayodhya's Shri Sita Ram temple hosts Iftar in its premises
text: In the holy month of Ramzan, Shri Sita Ram temple in Ayodhya hosted an Iftar meal on Monday in its premises. "This is the third time we've organised an Iftar party. I'll continue to do the same in...future as well," the temple's priest Yugal Kishor said. During Ramzan, the devout break the day-long fast with Iftar in the evening.

headlines: 2 security personnel injured in blast by Maoists in Chhattisgarh
text: Two District Reserve Guard personnel were injured on Tuesday after Maoists detonated an IED in Sukma district, Chhattisgarh, said the police. The security personnel had launched an anti-Maoist operation when the incident occurred, following which there was an exchange of fire between the forces and Maoists. The injured personnel were evacuated from the spot.

headlines: GoT finale gets over 19.3 mn viewers in US, sets new record
text: The final episode of 'Game Of Thrones' drew in over 19.3 million viewers in the US, setting a new series record, television network HBO announced. The record was previously held by last week's episode, which was watched by over 18.4 million viewers. The final season of the show had an average of 44.2 million viewers per episode, HBO further said.

headlines: BJP, Congress leaders livestream voting on FB in Punjab; booked
text: Youth Congress leader Rahul Kalia and BJP councillor Bhanu Partap were booked in Mohali after they shot a video on Facebook Live while voting in the seventh and final phase of Lok Sabha elections on Sunday. Police immediately asked them to remove the videos from Facebook and presiding officer of the area Joginder Singh was removed from his duty.

headlines: MP govt to reopen RSS pracharak murder case involving Pragya Thakur
text: The Madhya Pradesh government has decided to reopen the murder case of RSS pracharak Sunil Joshi in which BJP's Bhopal candidate Pragya Singh Thakur and seven others are accused. Joshi, who was said to be Thakur's aide, was shot dead on December 29, 2007. All the accused in the case were acquitted in 2017 due to lack of evidence.

headlines: The Congress must die, says Yogendra Yadav
text: Swaraj India head Yogendra Yadav has said, "The Congress must die...If it couldn't stop BJP in this election to save the idea of India, it has no positive role in Indian history." After his remark created controversy, he said, "This isn't an off the cuff angry remark...Congress is redundant for (is actually an obstacle to) defending the idea of India."

headlines: Hosts England name final squad for WC, 3-ODI old Archer included
text: Hosts England today named their final squad for 2019 World Cup, making three changes from the preliminary squad which was announced last month. Barbados-born all-rounder Jofra Archer, who made his debut earlier this month and took three wickets in three ODIs, has been included. All-rounder Liam Dawson and opener James Vince have also been added to the squad.

headlines: Ex-Aus cricketer Slater thrown out of plane after argument with women
text: Former Australian cricketer Michael Slater was thrown out of a Qantas flight from Sydney to Wagga Wagga on Sunday after a heated argument involving two women. The eyewitnesses claimed the 49-year-old delayed the flight after locking himself in the toilet and refused to come out following the argument which included yelling and swearing. Slater later apologised for the "inconvenience caused".

headlines: MLA, his son shot dead by unknown assailants in Arunachal
text: Sitting National People's Party (NPP) MLA from Khonsa West Assembly constituency, Tirong Aboh, and his son were among the 11 people shot dead by unknown assailants in Arunachal Pradesh on Tuesday. Aboh was seeking re-election. "The NPP is extremely shocked and saddened by news of the death of Aboh and his family," Meghayala CM and NPP President Conrad Sangma tweeted.

headlines: Former Infosys CEO Vishal Sikka's AI startup raises $50 mn
text: Former Infosys CEO Vishal Sikka's California-based artificial intelligence (AI) startup Vian Systems has raised $50 million from two unnamed investors, US regulatory filings revealed. Sikka had quit as the MD and CEO of Infosys in 2017 in just three years after a clash with Founder NR Narayana Murthy over corporate governance issues. He obtained his PhD from Stanford in AI.

headlines: Delhi Police sub-inspector assaulted by criminal, dies later
text: Raj Kumar, a Delhi Police sub-inspector died after he was allegedly assaulted on a street near his East Delhi house on Sunday night by a man who's involved in at least 21 cases of robbery, assault and stalking, police said. The 58-year-old, a cardiac patient, died of cardiac arrest soon after. The accused has been charged with murder and arrested.

headlines: You'll always be my hero: Priyanka pays tribute to father Rajiv
text: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Tuesday paid tribute to her father and former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi on his 28th death anniversary. Priyanka tweeted an old photograph with her father, and shared the poem 'Agneepath' by Amitabh Bachchan's father Harivansh Rai Bachchan. She tweeted, "You will always be my hero."

headlines: 6 of Indian family go missing in flash floods during visit to Oman
text: As many as six members of a family from Maharashtra's Beed district have gone missing after being swept away in flash floods in Oman where they had gone on a visit, Mumbai Police said. A massive gush of water had thrown the entire family out of their car, which they had stopped due to heavy rainfall, a police officer stated.

headlines: Upset over poor board results, Haryana villagers lock govt school
text: Upset over poor results of Class 10 students in the state board exams, residents of a village in Haryana locked the government high school's gates on Monday and demanded that the headmaster is changed. They claimed that only 25 of the 81 students who appeared for the exams had passed. "Their demand was forwarded to higher authorities," an official said.

headlines: Amitabh Bachchan to star in Marathi film 'AB Ani CD'
text: Actor Amitabh Bachchan will star in the upcoming Marathi family-comedy film 'AB Ani CD', which will also feature Marathi actor Vikram Gokhle in a lead role. Speaking about the actor's role in the forthcoming film, the film's producer Akshay Bardapurkar said, "Mr Bachchan plays himself, a superstar in his 70s." The film will be directed by filmmaker Milind Lele.

headlines: I plan to start my own production house this year: Katrina
text: Katrina Kaif revealed that she plans to start her own production house towards the end of this year. "I really hope to put my name as a producer to one of the projects I've been in discussions with," the actress further said. Katrina earlier tried to buy the rights of a French film, but was unable to pursue the project.

headlines: Filmmaker and film historian Vijaya Mulay passes away at 98
text: Filmmaker and film historian Vijaya Mulay passed away on Sunday at the age of 98. "She was not in pain, and it was an easy passage," Vijaya's daughter Suhasini Mulay said. The filmmaker was best known for her 7-minute animated film 'Ek Anek Aur Ekta', which was first aired on Doordarshan in 1974.

headlines: Cong will be successful as strong Opposition this time: Sena
text: Shiv Sena in its mouthpiece 'Saamana' on Tuesday said that Congress will be successful as a strong Opposition after the Lok Sabha polls. "This time the Leader of Opposition will be from Congress party, this should be termed as (Congress President) Rahul Gandhi's success," it added. Sena further expressed confidence in its ally BJP winning the Lok Sabha elections.

headlines: We as coaching staff hate 'unpredictable' tag: Pak coach Arthur
text: Speaking about Pakistan cricket team's 'unpredictable' tag, coach Mickey Arthur said, "Unpredictable is a word that we as a coaching staff hate." "[T]hey say Pakistan are going to be in the top four because of their unpredictability. I say 'no, Pakistan are going to be in the top four because of the work we have put in'," Arthur added.

headlines: West Indies was not the strongest team in my time: Brian Lara
text: Speaking about not having won a World Cup in his career, former West Indies batsman Brian Lara said, "[W]e have to accept that in our time, West Indies was not the strongest team. We tried, we gave our best shot." Lara praised the West Indies team that won the first two editions of the ICC Cricket World Cup.

headlines: Google's lung cancer predicting AI outperforms 6 radiologists
text: An AI model could detect malignant lung nodules on LDCT scans with performance meeting or exceeding that of expert radiologists, a study including Google scientists said. It predicts lung cancer risk using a patient's current and prior computed tomography volumes. When prior scans were unavailable, it outperformed six radiologists with an 11% reduction in false positives and fewer false negatives.

headlines: Mumbai's Chtrbox exposes 49 mn Instagram celebs data: Report
text: A database with over 49 million Instagram influencers, celebrities and brand accounts' records was left unprotected and exposed, TechCrunch learned. Reportedly traced to Mumbai-based social media marketing firm Chtrbox, it had public and private data like phone numbers and email addresses. Facebook said it's inquiring with Chtrbox to learn where data came from and how it became publicly available.

headlines: Complaint filed against minister for 'cut Haasan's tongue' remark
text: Actor-turned-politician Kamal Haasan's party Makkal Needhi Maiam (MNM) on Monday lodged a police complaint against Tamil Nadu minister KT Rajendra. MNM alleged that Bhalaji threatened violence against Haasan by saying that his tongue should be cut for his remarks on Nathuram Godse. The complaint further alleged that Bhalaji defamed Haasan with baseless allegations of nexus between MNM and ISIS.

headlines: I miss him: Rahul on Rajiv Gandhi's 28th death anniversary
text: Congress chief Rahul Gandhi paid tribute to his father and former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi on his 28th death anniversary on Tuesday. Rahul tweeted, "My father was gentle, loving, kind & affectionate. He taught me to love & respect all beings. To never hate. To forgive. I miss him." Rahul added, "I remember my father with love & gratitude."

headlines: Delhi Metro Yellow Line disrupted due to glitch; thousands stranded
text: The Delhi Metro's Yellow Line developed a technical snag on Tuesday morning, following which the train movement was suspended between the Qutab Minar and Sultanpur stations. This led to thousands of commuters from Delhi and Gurugram being stranded. Several videos and images show commuters getting out metro's emergency exits and many others on roads looking for other modes of transportation.

headlines: I've no issues with Akshay sir: Director who quit actor's film
text: Filmmaker Raghava Lawrence, who stepped down as the director of Akshay Kumar's 'Laxmmi Bomb' after the first look poster was released, has said he has no issues with Akshay. "I don't want him to feel bad as he has been preparing intensely for the character," Raghava added. "That's the reason I'm willing to give my script to them," he said.

headlines: Felt like fool after poster release: Director who quit Akshay's film
text: Filmmaker Raghava Lawrence, who had stepped down as director of Akshay Kumar's 'Laxmmi Bomb', has said it made him feel like a fool when he got to know about the release of the first look poster from a third person. "All I wanted was...they keep me updated," he added. Raghava earlier said the poster was released without informing him.

headlines: NCW rejected Kangana's complaint but fighting in Vivek row: Rangoli
text: Kangana Ranaut's sister Rangoli Chandel has criticised the National Commission for Women (NCW) for sending a notice to Vivek Oberoi after he shared a meme featuring Aishwarya Rai. "I will never forget how they refused to take Kangana's complaint against a big star, but come to fight for these childish jokes when so many rape...cases are lying unaddressed," she tweeted.

headlines: Perfect elections: Pranab Mukherjee praises EC amid Opp'n criticism
text: Amid Opposition parties criticising the Election Commission over its alleged inaction against violations of the Model Code of Conduct, former President Pranab Mukherjee praised the poll body for the "perfect" elections. "If democracy has succeeded, it is largely due to perfect conduct of elections by Election Commissioners starting from Sukumar Sen to the present Election Commissioners," Mukherjee said.

headlines: Results for Delhi Lok Sabha seats may get delayed by 5-6 hrs: CEO
text: With VVPAT counting to be introduced in this Lok Sabha election, the results on May 23 may get delayed by 5-6 hours, Delhi Chief Electoral Officer Ranbir Singh said. He stated that five VVPATs will be randomly selected for counting from each of Delhi's 70 Assembly segments. "This'll delay the formal results but trends will be already out," Singh added.

headlines: Booth in Kolkata to go for re-polling on May 22
text: The Election Commission on Tuesday ordered re-polling at a booth in the Kolkata Uttar parliamentary constituency on May 22. BJP's Rahul Sinha, TMC's Sudip Bandyopadhyay and CPI(M)'s Kaninika Bose Ghosh are among the candidates in the fray from the constituency. Large-scale violence was reported from different constituencies across West Bengal during the seventh phase of the Lok Sabha elections.

headlines: PDP worker shot 5 times after his family cast 5 votes in J&K
text: A Jammu and Kashmir Peoples Democratic Party worker was allegedly shot five times after his family, who defied a poll boycott call, cast five votes on April 29. Jamal, who succumbed to his injuries, was shot five times last week while he was at his home. Two bullets pierced his abdomen, two hit his arms and one hit his nose.

headlines: Videos show unescorted movement of EVMs; EC responds
text: After videos showing unescorted movement of EVMs surfaced online, the Election Commission has called them frivolous. A video showed EVMs stored at local shops, while in other videos EVMs were seen stacked in the boot of private vehicles. The EC further said that protocol was being followed to secure the voting machines ahead of the vote count on May 23.

headlines: Haryana man loses lakhs in IPL betting, kills father over money
text: A man from Haryana's Rohtak who lost lakhs in betting on the recently concluded Indian Premier League was arrested along with his juvenile son for killing his father, a prominent furniture trader. The victim had refused to loan his son more money. After killing his father, the accused called his son who helped him dispose of the body.

headlines: Niki Lauda, 3-time Formula One world champion, passes away at 70
text: Former Formula One driver Niki Lauda passed away at the age of 70 on Monday, after receiving a lung transplant last year. Lauda, who had suffered serious burns in a near-fatal crash at German Grand Prix in 1976, won three championships (1975, 1977 and 1984). The Austrian competed in a total of 171 races, winning 25.

headlines: Don't call me at odd hours over prisoners' escape, death: Kerala DGP
text: In her third such notice, Director General of Police (Prisons) in Kerala R Sreelekha has asked officers to not call her at odd hours for "petty issues" in prisons. The issues include inmates' escape, law and order issues in jail and serious illness of inmates and deaths. In her first notice, she instructed subordinates to report problems through their officers.

headlines: Branch goes through man's neck in car crash, he makes full recovery
text: A middle-aged man has made a full recovery months after a tree branch pierced his neck by entering from one side and exiting through the other during a car crash in Karnataka. Doctors had removed the branch and repaired major structural damages. "I never thought I'd speak again, but now I am back to normal," the man said post recovery.

headlines: Pakistan appoints Moin-ul-Haque as High Commissioner to India
text: Pakistan on Monday appointed Moin-ul-Haque as the High Commissioner to India. Haque's appointment comes after Sohail Mahmood left the High Commission to take over as Pakistan's Foreign Secretary. He earlier served as Pakistan's Ambassador to France. Besides India, Pakistan also announced appointments of High Commissioners to China, Japan and Brussels.

headlines: Rohtang Pass reopens to locals after 6 months
text: The Border Roads Organisation reopened Rohtang Pass on Monday for the movement of small vehicles and vehicles belonging to residents of Lahaul and Spiti. Kullu Deputy Commissioner Yunus said, "Tourists will have to wait a bit longer to see Rohtang Pass as work is underway to ensure basic amenities in the area including parking, toilets, food outlets and dustbins."

headlines: Canadian police installs cutouts of officers to slow down speeders
text: The Royal Canadian Mounted Police detachment in Lloydminster, Alberta, is deploying four lifelike cutouts of officers as an initiative to encourage motorists to slow down. The cutouts are built with an aluminium composite, and the officer depicted on them has a jacket with reflective tape. The initiative is inspired by a pilot program in British Columbia.

headlines: Taco Bell employee tells Muslim man you're terrorist, suck my d*ck
text: A Muslim man in the US has posted a video of his experience at a Taco Bell drive-thru, where he was subjected to Islamophobic abuse by an employee while she served him. "Muslims are terrorists," she told the man. Later in the video the woman says, "Until you call me and change my mind, Muslim motherf**kers can suck my d**k."

headlines: Fresh notices issued to Saif, Tabu, others in blackbuck case
text: The Rajasthan High Court on Monday issued fresh notices to actors Saif Ali Khan, Tabu, Sonali Bendre and Neelam Kothari in the 1998 blackbuck poaching case. This comes after an appeal by the Rajasthan government against their acquittal by a local court on April 5, last year. The court directed the case to be listed for hearing after eight weeks.

headlines: Sonam Kapoor attends Cannes Film Festival 2019
text: Actress Sonam Kapoor, who arrived in Cannes on Monday, took to Instagram to share some of her looks from the 72nd Cannes Film Festival. For her first appearance, Sonam wore a red sheer multi-tiered gown by Valentino and was later seen in a purple Elie Saab creation. The actress also wore a cream-coloured strapless Abu Jani and Sandeep Khosla gown.

headlines: Maths, equations of my career improved after 'Sonu Ke...': Nushrat
text: Nushrat Bharucha said the "maths and equations" of her acting career changed for the better after the success of her film 'Sonu Ke Titu Ki Sweety'. "[T]his is the first time..two of my films are releasing in the same year," she explained. "Otherwise, it used to be one film in two years...And I am getting interesting offers too," Nushrat added.

headlines: TV channels showing NDA win known for 'Raag Darbari': Sinha
text: After majority of exit polls predicted victory for BJP-led NDA, Congress leader Shatrughan Sinha on Monday said that TV Channels showing such exit polls are famous for their "Raag Darbari". "They (TV channels) haven't given any details about the sample size or the agencies which have done surveys," he added. Sinha further said that such TV channels have no credibility.

headlines: Will support party that settles Odisha's pending issues: BJD
text: Biju Janata Dal (BJD) Spokesperson Amar Patnaik on Monday said BJD would support the party or combination at the Centre, which agrees to settle some of the long pending issues of Odisha. "We have several long-pending demands including special category status," he added. He further said that the results of the exit polls seem to be far fetched.

headlines: Chandrababu Naidu meets Mamata Banerjee in Kolkata
text: Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu met West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee at her Kolkata residence on Monday. According to reports, the two discussed the importance of uniting all the anti-BJP parties and constituting a common agenda before the results of Lok Sabha polls are declared on May 23. This comes after majority of exit polls predicted BJP-led NDA's victory.

headlines: BSP suspends senior leader Ramveer Upadhyay
text: Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) on Tuesday suspended senior leader and former minister Ramveer Upadhyay for his 'anti-party' activities. BSP General Secretary Mewalal Gautam said that Upadhyay openly opposed party candidates in Agra, Aligarh and other seats during Lok Sabha polls and backed Opposition candidates. Upadhyay has also been removed from the post of BSP's chief whip in Uttar Pradesh assembly.

headlines: Leading Data Scientists join Springboard's course as mentors
text: Springboard has launched Data Science Career Track in India after meeting 100% job guarantee for 3 years in the US. Data scientists from companies like PayTm, Flipkart, Swiggy, Myntra, InMobi have joined Springboard as mentors to provide learners with practical insights and industry perspectives. Learners also get personal mentors with whom they have weekly online calls to discuss project progress.

headlines: Vivek deletes meme on Salman, Aishwarya; apologises after criticism
text: Vivek Oberoi on Tuesday apologised for sharing an election meme featuring Aishwarya Rai, Salman Khan and Abhishek Bachchan after receiving criticism. "Even if one woman is offended by my reply to the meme, it calls for remedial action. Apologies...tweet deleted," he wrote. Earlier, Vivek had said, "What wrong have I done? Somebody tweeted a meme and I laughed at it."

headlines: Tejashwi Yadav fails to cast vote; RJD blames it on wrong photo
text: The NDA attacked senior RJD leader and Lalu Prasad Yadav's son Tejashwi Yadav over his failure to cast his vote. BJP spokesman Nikhil Anand said Tejashwi stayed away from voting since no member of family was in the race for PM's post. RJD national vice-president Shivanand Tiwary said Tejashwi didn't vote due to his wrong photograph on voters' list.

headlines: Getting ready for next step: Akhilesh after meeting Mayawati
text: A day after the Lok Sabha elections ended, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav met BSP supremo Mayawati at her residence in Lucknow on Monday. Akhilesh tweeted a photograph from the meeting, and captioned it, "Now, getting ready for the next step." The two leaders reportedly discussed the likely political scenario in view of the exit poll results.

headlines: Galti ho gayi: Nitish Kumar's son on not voting before 2019 LS polls
text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's son Nishant cast his vote for the first time ever on Sunday in the Patna Sahib Lok Sabha seat. Nishant revealed this himself, and said, "Galti ho gayi", on being asked the reason for never voting before. Nishant, who is reportedly in his 30s, also said that PM Narendra Modi is like an uncle to him.

headlines: PM Modi wants to get me killed, not my security officer: Kejriwal
text: After BJP leader Vijay Goel said Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal should have the personal security officer of his choice if he doubts him, Kejriwal tweeted, "Not my PSO, it's [PM Narendra Modi] who wants to get me killed." This comes after the Delhi CM said he will be assassinated by his personal security officer, like former PM Indira Gandhi.

headlines: Misunderstanding: MJ Akbar on CNN reporter's sexual harassment claim
text: Former Union Minister MJ Akbar on Monday admitted in a Delhi court that US-based CNN reporter Majlie de Puy Kamp interned under him at The Asian Age in 2006-2007, however he denied sexually harassing her. "There was some misunderstanding, which was resolved," said Akbar. Kamp had alleged that Akbar forcefully entered his tongue into her mouth when she was 18.

headlines: Booth in Amritsar to go for re-polling on May 22
text: The Election Commission has ordered re-polling at a polling booth in Amritsar parliamentary constituency on May 22 due to negligence during the polling process. The EC said necessary arrangements have been made and political parties and contesting candidates have been informed. It added, "Election material, EVMs, security and poll staff in adequate numbers have been deputed for this task."

headlines: NaMo TV channel disappears as Lok Sabha elections end
text: NaMo TV, a BJP-sponsored channel for PM Narendra Modi's rallies and poll messages, disappeared as voting for the Lok Sabha elections ended. A report quoting a party source said that the channel went off air on May 17 when campaigning ended. In April, the Election Commission asked Delhi Chief Electoral Officer to get NaMo TV content cleared by certification panel.

headlines: Going to give 100%: Mohammad Amir on being added to Pak WC squad
text: Fast bowler Mohammad Amir, who was included in Pakistan's World Cup squad after having failed to make the cut in the provisional squad, has said that he is going to give his 100%. "We all will try and make our nation proud, thank u all for ur support and endless duas we all need them more now," he tweeted.

headlines: 8 dead as boat carrying football team capsizes in Uganda
text: As many as eight people died, while several others are missing, after a boat carrying a football team and its fans capsized amid a thunderstorm on Lake Albert in Uganda. Fishermen and a marine unit have rescued more than 30 people from the scene, as per officials. The exact number of people on the boat is unknown.

headlines: Married CRPF jawan weds girlfriend, remarries wife at the same time
text: A married CRPF jawan, Anil Paikra, got married to his girlfriend and his wife of four years at the same mandap in a village in Chhattisgarh's Jashpur district. The village sarpanch said the reason Paikra gave for the marriage was "not having a baby from his first marriage". Meanwhile, a CRPF spokesperson said the service rules prohibit multiple spouses.

headlines: Sensex, Nifty hit all-time high; Rupee trades at 69.73 a dollar
text: The Sensex gained over 200 points to hit a new high of 39,565 while Nifty rose to 11,883, also a new high. On Monday, Sensex and Nifty saw their biggest single-day gain in 10 years after exit polls showed Prime Minister Narendra Modi was set to win a second term. Meanwhile, the Rupee traded at 69.73 a dollar.

headlines: Aloo, Grilled Chicken wrap among items dropped by McD in Delhi-NCR
text: US-based fast food chain McDonald's has permanently removed many items from the menu at 13 stores it reopened in Delhi-NCR after settlement with partner Vikram Bakshi to acquire Connaught Plaza Restaurants Pvt Ltd (CPRL). These items include Aloo Wrap, Chicken McGrill, Egg Wrap, Grilled Chicken Wrap, and Maaza beverage. The removed items were the least popular, McDonald's said.

headlines: At least show decency to delete it: Urmila to Vivek on meme row
text: Reacting to Vivek Oberoi sharing an election meme, which took a dig at Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, Urmila Matondkar tweeted, "Very disgraceful and in...bad taste." "At least show the decency to pull off the post if not apologise to the lady and her little girl," she added. The meme also featured Vivek, Salman Khan, Abhishek Bachchan, and Aishwarya's daughter Aaradhya.

headlines: Eng captain Morgan admits he is unsure about final 15 for WC
text: England captain Eoin Morgan has said that he is unsure about the final 15-member squad for the upcoming World Cup 2019. "Every one of these guys should be proud of what we've achieved so far. The continuous improvement of performances makes the selection meeting extremely difficult," Morgan said about the squad, which is expected to be announced on Tuesday.

headlines: Thought I'd never play again: Ex-world no.1 Azarenka on pregnancy
text: Ex-world number one Victoria Azarenka has said that she thought her "career was over" when she discovered that she was pregnant with her son Leo. "I was scared...It wasn't easy," she stated. "I'm sure a lot of women won't be able to relate to me but I felt so much better after [pregnancy]," the two-time Grand Slam champion added.

headlines: Tried to copy Smriti Mandhana: RR's 17-yr-old Parag
text: Rajasthan Royals' 17-year-old batsman Riyan Parag has said that he tried to copy Indian women's cricketer Smriti Mandhana's style but failed to replicate it. "I've followed Smriti Mandhana since she used to wear glasses and play with a BAS bat. I was really young then. I love the way she times the ball and caresses it through point," Parag said.

headlines: Lenovo denies reports that it stopped supplying to Huawei
text: Chinese technology company Lenovo has denied online speculation that it has stopped supplying its products to Huawei, adding that supply is proceeding as usual. Huawei is an important client for Lenovo's PC and service sectors, it said. The company will continue to sell its products and services to Huawei based on regional regulations, the computer maker added.

headlines: Delhi firm sues Royal Enfield in US over patent infringement
text: Auto component manufacturer Flash Electronics on Monday said it has filed a suit against premium motorcycle manufacturer Royal Enfield in the US for patent infringement. The Delhi-based company alleged Royal Enfield infringed its patent on a component known as the regulator rectifier device. The device converts the AC voltage in engines into DC voltage to power the motorcycle's electrical systems.

headlines: 13 killed after truck overturns on tempo in Maharashtra
text: As many as 13 people were killed and three were critically injured after a truck overturned on a tempo in Maharashtra's Bhuldana, police said. The truck driver lost control after a tyre burst, following which the vehicle overturned on the tempo in which the victims were travelling, the police added. The truck was carrying bags of salt, the police said.

headlines: Pak agencies using social media to radicalise youths: Army
text: The Army alleged that the Pakistan agencies are trying to radicalise and exploit the youths through social media. Lieutenant General Ranbir Singh said Pakistan wants to increase local recruitment as infiltration from across the LoC is "virtually becoming very difficult". Singh, however, said the youths are realising that they don't want to become fodder for Pakistani agencies to promote terrorism.

headlines: Overact less in films, overreact less on Twitter: Vivek to Sonam
text: Actor Vivek Oberoi has responded to actress Sonam Kapoor calling him 'disgusting and classless' over an election meme he shared on Twitter which involved Aishwarya Rai and Salman Khan. The actor said that Sonam should overact less in films and overreact less on social media platforms including Twitter. "I don't think [the meme] hurt anyone's sentiments," he further said.

headlines: Priyanka Chopra introduced me as a star at Cannes Film Fest: Hina
text: Actress Hina Khan has shared pictures with Priyanka Chopra from Cannes Film Festival after-party and wrote it was "an unexpected invitation by a world star". She added Priyanka introduced her as a "star" to the guests. Hina further wrote, "Your...attempt to lift up people around you not for their backgrounds but their talent is one of a kind."

headlines: Just laughed at a meme, what wrong have I done: Vivek on meme row
text: Reacting to sharing the election meme which included Aishwarya Rai, her husband Abhishek Bachchan and Salman Khan, actor Vivek Oberoi said he hasn't done anything wrong. "Someone sent me a meme which made fun of me. I laughed," he added. "[Mamata] Didi put someone behind bars for a meme, people are saying I be put behind bars too," he stated.

headlines: I can't play victim, I'm self-confident: Hina on Chandivali remark
text: TV actress Hina Khan has said she felt disheartened after hearing Filmfare Editor Jitesh Pillai's "Cannes has suddenly become Chandivali studios kya" remark on her Cannes appearance. "I've worked hard to be where I'm. But, I can never play a victim as I have confidence in myself and I will prove my worth with time, with God's grace," she added.

headlines: After coffee cup, GoT fans claim spotting water bottles; share pics
text: Days after a coffee cup was spotted in a 'Game of Thrones' episode, the show's fans have claimed that they spotted plastic water bottles in the series finale. "Even the most important lords of the seven kingdoms need to stay hydrated," a user commented. Other comments read "This show is a joke" and "Writing [and] Editing...Being the worst GoT departments".

headlines: Didn't offer drinks to Priya, never met her in hotel: MJ Akbar
text: Former Union Minister MJ Akbar on Monday told a Delhi Court that he never met journalist Priya Ramani at a Mumbai hotel for a job interview in 1993. He also denied offering alcoholic drinks and singing old Hindi songs to Ramani. The court was hearing a defamation case against Ramani filed by Akbar after she accused him of sexual harassment.

headlines: MMA fighter suffers 8 fractures from punch, undergoes 9-hr surgery
text: American MMA fighter Sage Northcutt suffered as many as eight fractures in his face after getting knocked out after just 29 seconds on his One Championship debut against Cosmo Alexandre. The 23-year-old underwent a nine-hour surgery, after which he shared pictures on Instagram, writing, "My Terminator face is not too Shabby...I'll be back! Next post is catheter removal...stay tuned...JK."

headlines: I can't accept Dutee marrying girl who is like her daughter: Mother
text: A day after India's fastest female sprinter Dutee Chand revealed she's in a same-sex relationship with her 19-year-old relative, her mother said she can't accept the relationship. "Dutee wants to marry a girl, who is daughter of my niece, so she is my granddaughter. In this relation, Dutee will be like a mother of that girl," she added.

headlines: Players impress Ponting like 8-year-old girls around Bieber: Finch
text: Aaron Finch, who will lead Australia in the 2019 World Cup, has said that all the players want to impress former captain Ricky Ponting, who is the team's specialist coach. "You should see them, it's like eight-year-old girls around Justin Bieber when Punter's around the dressing room," he added. "It's embarrassing, but it's great," he further said.

headlines: Dutee blackmailed by same sex partner, her life in danger: Sister
text: India's fastest female sprinter Dutee Chand's sister Saraswati Chand has accused the sprinter's same-sex partner of "pressurising and blackmailing" Dutee for wealth and property. "It's Dutee's decision whether she wants to marry a girl or a boy. But Dutee has been forced to speak all this," she added, referring to the sprinter going public with her relationship.

headlines: Hanuma Vihari gets married to fashion designer Preethi, shares pic
text: Indian batsman Hanuma Vihari tied the knot with his longtime girlfriend and fashion designer Preethiraj Yeruva on Sunday. The 25-year-old took to Instagram to share a picture, writing, "I promise to keep that smile on you forever! I love you. Thanks everyone for your love and wishes," he added. As many as 1,500 friends and family members attended the wedding.

headlines: Are we cartoons? Karnataka CM says media satires belittle politicians
text: Karnataka Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy on Sunday alleged that news channels are 'belittling' politicians in their satires and that he was thinking of bringing in a law to regulate them. "Do we look like cartoon characters to you?" he questioned. We're not surviving because of media but because of 6.5 crore people of the state, he further said.

headlines: Frenchman sentenced to death for smuggling 3 kg drugs into Indonesia
text: FÃ©lix Dorfin, a 35-year-old man from France, has been sentenced to death by an Indonesian court for smuggling 3 kg drugs into the holiday island of Lombok. He was arrested carrying a suitcase filled with ecstasy and amphetamines, after flying into Lombok airport from Singapore. Prosecutors had requested 20 years in jail and $700,000 fine or an extra year's imprisonment.

headlines: Appears that 'foreign power' set to attack India: Azam Khan
text: After most exit polls forecast a majority for the BJP-led NDA in general elections, SP leader Azam Khan said that the exit polls have given an appearance as if a "foreign power" is set to attack the country. Khan added the people are in "fear" because of the exit poll results. He said it appears that this is democracy's end.

headlines: NDA will win all 14 seats in Jharkhand, says CM Raghubar Das
text: After most exit polls predicted six to eight seats for the NDA in Jharkhand, state CM Raghubar Das asserted that the alliance would win all the 14 Lok Sabha seats in the state. He added that Congress President Rahul Gandhi and other opposition leaders have "understood that they've lost the poll". He said the people have rejected Opposition's "negative politics".

headlines: 31-year-old referee dies after collapsing during football match
text: Victor Hugo Hurtado, a 31-year-old referee, died after collapsing during a Bolivian league match between Always Ready and Oriente Petrolero at Municipal Stadium in El Alto, which sits around 12,795 feet above sea level. Always Ready doctor revealed Victor suffered a heart attack on the field in 47th minute and then a fatal one as he arrived at the hospital.

headlines: Pak chief selector Inzamam reveals why Riaz made it to WC squad
text: Speaking about the inclusion of Wahab Riaz in the Pakistani World Cup squad, former Pakistan captain and current chief selector Inzamam-ul-Haq said, "Riaz is an experienced bowler and knows how to use the old ball and reverse swing." "He [Mohammad Amir] has vast experience of playing in England. He also has a good economy rate in England," Inzamam added.

headlines: Huawei to support existing devices as Google bars Android updates
text: Huawei said it'll continue to provide security updates and after-sales services to existing Huawei and Honor smartphones and tablets after Google announced it has banned it from some Android operating system updates. Support will cover devices that were sold and that are still in stock globally. New Huawei smartphones are unlikely to have access to some Google apps like YouTube.

headlines: Open to partnership to bring Tesla cars to India: Ashok Leyland
text: Venkatesh Natarajan, Senior VP of Information Technology at Ashok Leyland, told IANS the company was open to partner with Elon Musk to bring Tesla cars to India. He added there will be multiple agencies which will be involved in contributing to electric car dream in India. "We will be lucky to be part of that consortium," he further added.

headlines: IKEA's largest franchise partner buys stake in Bengaluru's Livspace
text: Bengaluru-based interior design marketplace Livspace has raised an undisclosed amount from the investment arm of INGKA Group, which is a strategic partner in IKEA franchise system, for a minority stake. Last year, Livspace raised $70 million in Series C funding round led by private equity firm TPG Growth and Goldman Sachs. The current deal is reportedly pegged at $10-15 million.

headlines: Ford to cut 7,000 jobs as part of restructuring, save $600mn
text: Ford Motor has said it will eliminate about 10% of its global workforce, cutting 7,000 jobs by August-end, as part of larger restructuring. The move will save about $600 million a year, CEO Jim Hackett stated.
