The changes aim to shrink management structure by 20% and streamline the number of organisational layers from 14 to nine or less, he added.

headlines: It's up to government to take a call on Huawei issue: TRAI
text: TRAI Chairman RS Sharma has said the issue of whether India must take a stand on Huawei is a "larger question" and it's up to the government to take a call. Localised manufacturing of telecom equipment would be strategically significant for India, he added. This comes after the US recently blacklisted Huawei, restricting it from doing business with American companies.

headlines: Sad one's success is judged by social media following: Jacqueline
text: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez has said it is sad that social media following has become a measure of success, while adding, "It's becoming more of a race and competition [of] who has more following and engagement." "People have those numbers as they work towards it. It doesn't happen naturally," she added. "It is time and energy consuming," Jacqueline further said.

headlines: Exit polls are imposed opinion: Tamil Nadu CM Palaniswami
text: After the Lok Sabha exit polls predicted that the DMK-led front is set to win majority seats in Tamil Nadu, AIADMK leader and state CM Edappadi K Palaniswami on Monday said, "Exit polls are imposing of opinion". The BJP and AIADMK had formed an alliance in February to contest the Lok Sabha elections in Tamil Nadu and Puducherry.

headlines: Anil Rajbhar gets dismissed minister OP Rajbhar's departments in UP
text: BJP MLA and Minister of State Anil Rajbhar was given the additional charge of departments in Uttar Pradesh, which were previously seen by Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party chief OP Rajbhar. OP Rajbhar, who headed the departments for backward classes welfare and disabled development, was on Monday dropped from UP CM Yogi Adityanath's cabinet for his outbursts against the BJP.

headlines: Pakistan pacer shares pic with tape on mouth after World Cup snub
text: Pakistan pacer Junaid Khan took to Twitter to share a picture of himself with tape on his mouth after being omitted from 2019 World Cup squad. "I don't want to say anything. Truth is bitter. (Sach karwa hotha hai)", the 29-year-old wrote. Junaid was selected in the provisional squad but was omitted from the final squad for the quadrennial tournament.

headlines: Eiffel Tower closes after man found climbing the 1,063 ft monument
text: The Eiffel Tower in Paris was evacuated and closed until further notice after a man was spotted climbing up the 1,063 feet tall monument on Monday. "To avoid a long wait, we advise our visitors to postpone their visit," the monument's official Twitter account posted. Initial reports suggested the man had climbed more than 980 feet up the landmark.

headlines: Indian man's charity sets Guinness record with Iftar distribution
text: PCT Humanity, a charity run by an Indian man in the UAE, has set the Guinness World Record for 'Longest Line of Hunger Relief Packages'. The attempt saw Iftar meals containing seven items spread in a line without keeping any gap between the packages for a kilometre. "This is an incredible moment," founder Joginder Singh Salaria said.

headlines: Who said there is Opposition meeting on 23rd: MK Stalin
text: Dismissing reports of UPA conducting opposition parties meeting in Delhi on May 23, DMK chief MK Stalin said, "Who said there's an opposition parties meeting on the 23rd." He added the meeting will be useful only after election results. Earlier reports claimed that UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi has called for Opposition's meeting ahead of the poll results on May 23.

headlines: Voters no longer willing to trust coalition of rivals: Jaitley
text: Union Minister Arun Jaitley on Monday said that the voters are no longer willing to trust "coalition of rivals" as their alliances are "untenable". He added that the voters ain't willing to elect a "hung Parliament" where "ugly" coalitions have a role to play. He further hoped that the exit polls results and final results are in the same direction.

headlines: Kylian Mbappe voted best top-flight player in France
text: Paris St-Germain's Kylian Mbappe, who has already scored 32 goals this season, was named both the best player and best Under-21 player for the 2018-19 season on Sunday. German midfielder Dzsenifer Marozsan, who helped Olympique Lyonnais' women's team to a record-extending 13th consecutive league title and fourth straight Champions League crown, was named the best first division female player.

headlines: India blessed to have numerous match-winners: Anshuman Gaekwad
text: Former Indian cricket team coach Anshuman Gaekwad has said that Team India squad for the 2019 World Cup is a "very balanced side" and is blessed to have numerous match-winners in all the departments. "[T]he kind of option the Indian team has today, I don't think we have ever had this kind of options," Gaekwad added.

headlines: Every side will be wary of Australia: Steve Waugh
text: Former Australian captain Steve Waugh has said that following the return of Steve Smith and David Warner, every team at the upcoming World Cup 2019 will be wary of Australia. "There's been turmoil in Australian cricket over the last 12 months, but that has been put aside now," Waugh said about the Australian team.

headlines: Air India stops direct flights between Mumbai and New York
text: Air India has decided to discontinue its direct flights from Mumbai to New York. This comes after services on the route were causing huge losses to the cash-strapped national carrier, as per reports. The Mumbai-New York flights, which were suspended in February due to the closure of Pakistan airspace, had been set to resume flying in June.

headlines: Keralites are educated so BJP never won there: Udit Raj
text: Congress leader Udit Raj criticised the BJP saying that the party failed to win even a single seat till date in Kerala because the people there are "educated" and not "blind followers". Raj, who was denied BJP ticket to seek re-election from North West Delhi constituency, joined the Congress in April 2019. Raj had alleged that the BJP was anti-Dalit.

headlines: BJP trying to destabilise MP govt through corrupt practices: Cong
text: The Congress has alleged that the BJP is attempting to destabilise CM Kamal Nath-led Madhya Pradesh government through the use of "corrupt practices". It said that the BJP is trying to "negate" the people's mandate given in favour of Congress in Assembly elections. The MP BJP on Monday asked the state Congress government to prove majority in the Assembly.

headlines: Karnataka says Ola Prime Play convenience fee violates law
text: Karnataka's transport commissioner told ET the convenience fee Ola charges its Prime Play cab users for using value-added services is in violation of the law. He said, "Motor Vehicles Act and the Karnataka On-Demand Transportation Technology Aggregators Rules don't allow convenience charges." The State Transport Authority's secretary said it'll write to Ola, asking them to stop such charges.

headlines: Tariffs making companies move production out of China: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump has said companies are moving their production out of China to Vietnam and other Asian countries due to US tariffs, adding that any agreement with China cannot be a "50-50" deal. The US and China had a "very strong deal" but China changed it, he said. China is getting "totally killed" by the tariffs, Trump added.

headlines: Google bans 2nd largest phone maker Huawei from some Android updates
text: Google has banned the world's second-largest smartphone maker, Huawei, from some Android operating system updates. New Huawei smartphones are set to lose access to some Google apps like YouTube and Maps and the next version of Android to be launched later this year. This comes after the US government sought to blacklist Chinese company Huawei around the world.

headlines: Sensex posts biggest one-day gain in 10 years, closes at record high
text: A day after exit polls predicted BJP-led NDA's win in Lok Sabha elections, Sensex on Monday posted the biggest one-day gain in 10 years and rose 1,421 points to close at a record high of 39,352. Nifty surged 421 points to hit 11,828, its highest close ever. The rupee rose to 69.6 against the US dollar.

headlines: Vivek shares poll meme showing him, Salman, Aishwarya; criticised
text: Vivek Oberoi on Monday shared a meme on the 2019 Lok Sabha elections, which featured him, his ex-girlfriend Aishwarya Rai, her rumoured ex-boyfriend Salman Khan and husband Abhishek Bachchan along with daughter Aaradhya. "Haha! Creative! No politics here....just life," he wrote. Many Twitter users criticised him for sharing the meme, with actress Sonam Kapoor writing, "Disgusting and classless."

headlines: Watch GoT with earphones, don't spoil it: Delhi Metro to passengers
text: Delhi Metro's Twitter handle has shared a meme asking people watching the 'Game of Thrones' finale in the metro not to spoil it for co-passengers. "Last stop of the season! Catch up on the Train of Thrones, but don't go spoiling it for others. If you're watching it on the metro, please be sure to use earphones," the tweet read.

headlines: Sadhvi Pragya announces 'maun vrat' till poll results are declared
text: BJP's Bhopal Lok Sabha candidate Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur announced she'll undertake a nearly three-day-long 'maun vrat' or a vow of silence till election results are declared on May 23. Seeking an apology for several remarks, she said her move is to atone for her comments. Earlier, she was criticised for calling Mahatma Gandhi's assassin Nathuram Godse a 'patriot'.

headlines: Asif, whose 2-yr-old daughter died on Sunday, added to Pak WC squad
text: Pakistan on Monday announced their final 15-member squad for the 2019 World Cup, making three changes from the provisional squad. Batsman Asif Ali, whose two-year-old daughter died from cancer on Sunday hours after Pakistan-England ODI, has been included along with fast bowlers Mohammad Amir and Wahab Riaz. Abid Ali, Junaid Khan and Faheem Ashraf were omitted from the squad.

headlines: 2 killed, 20 injured after buses collide on Mumbai-Pune expressway
text: Two people were killed and 20 others injured after a minibus crashed into a stationary sleeper coach on the Mumbai-Pune expressway on Monday, police said. "The driver of the coach from Gujarat had parked the bus on the side lane as he wanted to answer nature's call. The minibus that was coming from behind crashed into it," said an official.

headlines: Man chokes throat, spits blood after eating burger with glass in it
text: A 31-year-old man was hospitalised after he choked his throat and spat blood after eating a burger filled with glass pieces at a Burger King outlet in Pune. His friend revealed that when they approached the outlet, they accused them of mixing the glass pieces to "encash on it and defame them". An FIR has been registered against the outlet.

headlines: One-armed man sues police after officers handcuff wrist to ankle
text: A one-armed US man has sued a police department after an officer handcuffed his wrist to his ankle. Randy Schoonover, a former West Virginia state senator, said Clay County sheriff's department used excessive force and subjected him to cruel and unusual punishment during the arrest in 2018. The 65-year-old said his constitutional rights had been violated.

headlines: War would mean Iran's official end: Trump amid rising tensions
text: Amid rising tensions between the two countries, US President Donald Trump on Sunday tweeted that a war with Iran would mean the country's "official end". "Never threaten the United States again!" Trump said in the tweet. The US has deployed additional warships and planes to the Gulf in recent days.

headlines: Man caught with 3 kg drugs sentenced to death by firing squad
text: Indonesia on Monday sentenced a French drug smuggler, who was caught with 3 kg drugs in September last year, to death by firing squad. Prosecutors had asked for a 20-year jail term plus another year unless he paid a huge fine equivalent to about $700,000. Notably, Indonesia has some of the world's strictest drug laws.

headlines: Kerala CM Vijayan dismisses exit polls, says LDF will win big
text: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan dismissed exit polls findings and claimed that the Left Democratic Front (LDF) will "win big" in the state. Most of the exit polls have predicted that the CPI(M)-led LDF would win around five of the 20 seats in Kerala. Vijayan said, "Let's...wait for May 23. Don't you know that previous exit polls have gone haywire."

headlines: 1000% confident that TDP will win elections: Andhra CM Naidu
text: Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu on Monday asserted confidence that he's 1000% sure that the Telugu Desam Party (TDP) will win the elections. He, however, added that there are problems in the counting process and the Election Commission should take measures to resolve all those problems. He further said, "I don't even have 0.1% doubt, we're going to win."

headlines: Mamata Didi is now Mamata Dadagiri: Manoj Tiwari
text: Delhi BJP President Manoj Tiwari on Monday said that West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee is not "Mamata Didi" anymore but is now "Mamata Dadagiri". "During polls, she attacked our workers and did not allow people to vote," he added. Alleging that Mamata ruined West Bengal's culture, Tiwari further said that the days of her government are numbered.

headlines: Welcome decision to sack me, it was delayed one: OP Rajbhar
text: SBSP chief OP Rajbhar welcomed the decision by Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath to sack him as a state cabinet minister and said that Adityanath's decision was a "delayed one". Rajbhar added it'd have been better if the decision was taken around 20 days ago. Rajbhar also alleged that Adityanath didn't have time to implement the Social Justice Committee's recommendations.

headlines: Those incapable of being Sarpanch will be MPs on May 23: BJP MLA
text: BJP MLA Gopal Bhargava on Monday said those who are incapable of becoming Sarpanch or ward member will become MPs after results of general elections are declared on May 23. "PM Narendra Modi has become 'paras patthar'. If he touches a stone, it will become gold," he added. This comes after several exit polls predicted a majority for BJP-led NDA.

headlines: Efforts to form strong Opp'n commendable: Sena taunts Naidu
text: Following a series of meetings by Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu with various opposition leaders, the Shiv Sena taunted Naidu saying his efforts for creating a strong Opposition are commendable. In its mouthpiece 'Saamana', it said that Naidu's meetings for stitching a Grand Alliance of non-BJP parties are "entertaining". Sena also expressed confidence in forming a government after poll results.

headlines: Facebook, Google refuse to make mails to EC public: Report
text: Facebook, Google and Twitter, among other technology firms, have reportedly not agreed to share details of their correspondence with Election Commission with RTI applicants over privacy concerns. Applicants reportedly sought correspondence details about misinformation on social media during general elections and content takedown requests. EC has reportedly not decided if it'll share the details.

headlines: GOQii to take Flipkart to court, alleges deep discounting
text: California-headquartered smart wearables startup GOQii said it will take legal action against Flipkart due to deep discounting of its products which allegedly violate the sales agreement between the two. In a legal notice sent to Flipkart, GOQii alleged its products were being sold at an "unauthorised 70-80% discount", which it deemed "predatory pricing". GOQii also approached DPIIT and CCI.

headlines: Warburg Pincus, Runwal to set up $1bn shopping mall platform
text: An affiliate of global private equity firm Warburg Pincus and Mumbai-based real estate firm Runwal Group have formed a joint venture to set up a retail mall platform. Both partners will commit $200 million each and raise another $600 million to create a corpus of $1 billion. The parties will each hold a 50% stake in the platform.

headlines: TCS veteran Pratik Pal moves to Tata Sons: Reports
text: TCS President Pratik Pal, who ran the software giant's multi-billion-dollar retail and consumer goods business, has reportedly moved to Tata Sons. He will lead the salt-to-software services conglomerate's digital initiatives, as per reports. Group Chairman N Chandrasekaran has been looking to create business opportunities using technology such as robotics, analytics and AI, reports added.

headlines: India to add 3 million tech jobs including data science by 2023
text: Indian tech industry will add another three million jobs in the next five years including data science roles, said Indian Staffing Federation. Therefore, upGrad presents PG Diploma in Data Science in collaboration with IIIT-Bangalore, helmed by professors from IIIT-Bangalore and India's leading data professionals. Its rigorous curriculum has helped learners attain significant success in their careers with 48% average hike.

headlines: Scarlett Johansson gets engaged to boyfriend after 2 yrs of dating
text: Actress Scarlett Johansson, known for playing 'Black Widow' in Avengers, got engaged to comedian Colin Jost after dating for two years. This will be the first marriage for Jost while it will be Johansson's third. Johansson was previously married to Ryan Reynolds and journalist Romain Dauriac, with whom she has a 4-year-old daughter.

headlines: No surgical strike carried out before 2016: Army on Congress claim
text: The Indian Army has rejected Congress party's claim that 6 surgical strikes were carried out during its regime. General Officer Commanding-in-Chief Northern Command, Lieutenant General Ranbir Singh, has said the first surgical strike was carried out by armed forces in 2016 to avenge the Uri attack. Commenting on the Balakot air strikes, Singh said, "It was a major achievement."

headlines: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan walks the red carpet at Cannes Film Festival
text: Actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan walked the red carpet at the 72nd Cannes Film Festival on Sunday. She wore a metallic golden-yellow one-shouldered by Jean-Louis Sabaji. Her daughter Aaradhya also accompanied her to the film festival. Meanwhile, actress Sonam Kapoor has also reached Cannes and will be walking the red carpet soon.

headlines: People said 'She's from Kapil's show, let's take film actor': Sumona
text: TV actress Sumona Chakravarti, while speaking in the light of Hina Khan being allegedly mocked for her Cannes appearance, revealed she got rejected from several projects because of the TV actor tag. "[People said] Arre that girl na from Kapil [Sharma's] comedy show. Let's take film actor," she added. "An artist is an artist, irrespective of the medium," Sumona wrote.

headlines: Hours after playing for Pak, Asif loses 2-yr-old daughter to cancer
text: Cricketer Asif Ali's daughter Noor Fatima, who was undergoing treatment for stage four cancer in the United States, passed away aged two on Sunday, hours after Asif represented Pakistan in the fifth ODI against England at Leeds. "Asif is a great example of strength & courage. He is an inspiration to us," the cricketer's PSL team Islamabad United tweeted.

headlines: US Navy sailors created 'Rape Lists' of female colleagues: Report
text: Male US Navy sailors aboard USS Florida created "Rape Lists" which ranked "female colleagues on the basis of appearances, characteristics and various sexual acts the creators of the lists wished to perform with them", according to a report. The lists also included "aggressive sexual activity", the report added. The lists were reportedly uncovered through a Freedom of Information Act request.

headlines: Sensex rises 979 points after exit polls predict NDA win
text: Indian equity benchmark Sensex rose by nearly 979 points to 38,909 on Monday as exit polls predicted NDA win in the Lok Sabha elections. The Rupee rose to a two-week high of 69.36 against the US dollar, as compared to its Friday's close of 70.23. The results of the Lok Sabha elections will be declared on Thursday.

headlines: Opposition in political ICU after exit polls: Giriraj Singh
text: Union Minister and BJP leader Giriraj Singh on Monday said that the entire Opposition is in an ICU politically after seeing the results of exit polls. He added that after the results of Lok Sabha elections are out, all these leaders must repent politically to attain political salvation. Various exit polls predicted a majority for BJP-led NDA in the elections.

headlines: Every exit poll can't be wrong, time to switch off TV: Omar
text: After several exit polls predicted a majority for the BJP-led NDA in general elections, National Conference Vice President Omar Abdullah on Sunday said that every exit poll cannot be wrong. "Time to switch off the TV, log out of social media & wait to see if the world is still spinning on its axis on the 23rd (May)," he added.

headlines: 64% voter turnout recorded in 7th phase of Lok Sabha polls
text: Nearly 64% voter turnout was recorded till 9.30 pm in the seventh phase of Lok Sabha polls which was held on Sunday. A total of 59 Lok Sabha constituencies went to polls across eight states and Union territories in the seventh phase. Madhya Pradesh recorded the highest voter turnout at 75.38% while Bihar saw the lowest voter turnout at 53.36%.

headlines: Insect-like four-winged robot that weighs only 95 mg created
text: University of Southern California, Los Angeles engineers have created an insect-like four-winged robot named Bee+, which weighs 95 mg and flies while tethered to a power source. Roughly the size of a penny, Bee+ is capable of perching, landing, following a path, and avoiding obstacles. Earlier, Harvard University researchers created a two-winged flying robot named RoboBee, which weighed 75 mg.

headlines: Does PM Modi want to turn LS into Kirtan Sabha? Sharad Yadav
text: Talking about PM Narendra Modi's visit to Kedarnath, Loktantarik Janata Dal (LJD) leader Sharad Yadav on Sunday asked if PM Modi wants to convert Lok Sabha into a "Kirtan Sabha". "What has he achieved by sitting inside the cave? Did any invention take place?" he added. PM Modi on Saturday meditated inside a cave in Kedarnath for over 15 hours.

headlines: Drone delivery startup Zipline raises $190M, becomes unicorn
text: US-based startup Zipline, which delivers medical supplies via drones, has raised $190 million and become a unicorn or attained an over $1-billion valuation. The capital came in two closes, one in 2018 and another earlier this year, from Katalyst Ventures, AlphabetÂ’s investment arm GV, The Rise Fund, among others. Founded in 2014, Zipline claims to have made 14,017 lifesaving deliveries.

headlines: Delhi NCR on track to have best startup ecosystem: Report
text: Currently listed second, behind Bengaluru on StartupBlink's startup ecosystem rankings in India, Delhi NCR is on track to become India's startup capital, Inc42 said. An Inc42 DataLabs' report stated 782 Delhi NCR-based startups got $15.83-billion investment from 2014-2018. The report said funding amount secured by Delhi NCR startups has grown by 29.68% annually, higher than Bengaluru's 15.11%.

headlines: Can't change my hero, Mahatma Gandhi is a superstar: Haasan
text: Calling Mahatma Gandhi a "superstar", Makkal Needhi Maiam chief Kamal Haasan on Sunday said, "I cannot change my hero, can't accept the villain as hero." Haasan further said that he has been repeatedly reading about Gandhi and his life. This comes days after Haasan had said that free India's first extremist was a Hindu, naming Gandhi's killer Nathuram Godse.

headlines: AstraZeneca sues Aurobindo Pharma over patent infringement
text: Pharma major AstraZeneca has moved a US court alleging that Hyderabad-based Aurobindo Pharma is attempting to produce the generic version of its patented drug Daliresp. AstraZeneca has requested the court to pass an order against manufacturing, importing and selling the drug in the US. Daliresp is a prescription medicine used in adults with severe Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)

headlines: I was thrown out of films by producers without any reason: Shilpa
text: Actress Shilpa Shetty, while speaking to Humans of Bombay, revealed, "I remember there were producers, who without any reason, threw me out of their films." "I reached a point where after a few films my career hit a lull," she added. Shilpa further said this was the time when she decided to enter the reality show 'Big Brother'.

headlines: Had to sell off house, property: Actress on not being paid for show
text: Opening up about the struggle she faced while working on a show during her initial days, television actress Rubina Dilaik revealed she wasn't paid her dues for the last three months which were in lakhs. "For nine months, I pleaded for my money...I had to sell off my house and property because I couldn't pay off my EMIs," she added.

headlines: Prince Harry, Meghan share unseen wedding pics on 1st anniversary
text: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex, Prince Harry and his wife Meghan Markle, released unseen pictures from their wedding to mark their first anniversary. The couple took to social media to share the photo montage, accompanied by the song 'This Little Light Of Mine'. They had exchanged vows at St George's Chapel at Windsor Castle on May 19, 2018.

headlines: Exit polls all wrong, will wait till May 23 for results: Tharoor
text: After most exit polls predicted BJP-led NDA will come back to power with around 300 seats, Congress leader Shashi Tharoor tweeted, "I believe exit polls are all wrong." "In Australia...56 different exit polls proved wrong. In India many people don't tell pollsters the truth fearing they might be from the government. Will wait till 23rd for real results," he added.

headlines: 59-year-old woman on oxygen support travels 330 km to cast vote
text: A 59-year-old woman, whose lungs were damaged following acute bronchitis and survives on continuous oxygen support, travelled over 330 km from Kolkata to Dumka in Jharkhand to cast her vote. "As long as I am alive, I will be using my democratic right to contribute towards nation building," Renu Mishra said.

headlines: Himachal records its highest ever voter turnout in LS polls history
text: Himachal Pradesh has recorded its highest ever voter turnout of 71.73% in the general elections since Independent India's first Lok Sabha elections in 1951-52. The seven-phase polling for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections concluded on Sunday in 542 out of 543 parliamentary constituencies. The results of the 17th Lok Sabha elections will be announced on Thursday.

headlines: 909 social media posts removed, 647 cases of paid news in polls: EC
text: Election Commission has revealed 647 cases of paid news were registered and 909 social media posts were removed during the Lok Sabha elections. Of the 909 social media posts, 650 were taken down by Facebook, including 482 political posts during 'silence period' and 73 political advertisements. The poll body added that 1,297 social posts were taken down during 2014 elections.

headlines: No road, no vote: Bihar village boycotts Lok Sabha polls in protest
text: Bihar's Chiriyawan village on Sunday boycotted the Lok Sabha polls and protested outside the polling booth over lack of roads and water. The protestors carried banners, reading, "No road, no vote". The polling officer tried to convince the protestors to at least press NOTA button, but the locals decided to not touch the EVM, not even to vote for NOTA.

headlines: ECÂ’s surrender before Mr Modi & his gang is obvious: Rahul Gandhi
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Sunday attacked the Election Commission, saying its "capitulation before Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his gang is obvious". Rahul tweeted, "From Electoral Bonds & EVMs to manipulating the election schedule, NaMo TV, 'Modi's Army' & now the drama in Kedarnath". He added that the poll panel was once feared and respected but not anymore.

headlines: Best thing about IPL 2019 was rebirth of Dhoni's batting: Pietersen
text: Former England captain Kevin Pietersen has said that the best thing about IPL 2019 was the rebirth of former India captain MS Dhoni's batting. "He took out all the bowling attacks in front of him," Pietersen added. "He is just one of those guys who you know would hold onto the ball when thrown at him," he further said.

headlines: 23-year-old Mumbai man drowns in Savitri river while urinating
text: A 23-year-old Mumbai bank professional died after drowning in Savitri river while urinating in it. Prahlad Varvatkar was attending the wedding of one of his friends along with eight others, when the group went to urinate and he fell in the river pit and drowned. A case of accidental death has been registered.

headlines: Delhi airport uses scrap material to build 4 cafeterias
text: Four cafeterias have been constructed out of recycled material at Delhi airport's international and domestic terminals for airport staff and visitors. The cafeterias were built completely using scrap which was generated from the renovation of Terminal 1D and Terminal 3. Scrap from the airport building, dismantled parts of machines and plastic structures and recycled material has been used.

headlines: 2 shot dead inside car in busy traffic in Delhi gang war
text: Two suspected criminals Parveen Gehlot and Vikas Dalal were killed following a shootout between two rival gangs in busy traffic near Delhi's Dwarka Mor metro station on Sunday, police said. While one of them sustained fatal injuries in the crossfire, another was reportedly killed by police who had intervened. The shootout was an outcome of property dispute, police added.

headlines: Punjab CEO thanks people for peaceful polls in all 13 LS seats
text: Punjab's Chief Electoral Officer (CEO) Dr S Karuna Raju thanked the people of the state for coming out in large number and voting peacefully in all the 13 Lok Sabha seats. He said that 117 all women polling stations also saw large numbers of voters. He added that overall three cases were registered for posting videos and photographs while voting.

headlines: Can't believe exit polls and their accuracy: Punjab CM Singh
text: After most exit polls forecast a majority for the ruling BJP-led NDA in general elections, Punjab CM Amarinder Singh said, "I saw no reason to believe the exit polls, which just couldn't predict the results with accuracy." Singh added even if he goes around Punjab to "gauge the voter swing", he wouldn't be able to do it with "complete accuracy".

headlines: Ashwin to play six county games for Nottinghamshire
text: Indian spinner Ravichandran Ashwin is set to play for English county side Nottinghamshire ahead of the ICC Test Championship. This will be AshwinÂ’s second stint in English County, having played four games for Worcestershire during the 2017 season. The World Test Championship will begin after the ICC World Cup 2019 with the Ashes 2019 in England starting the event.

headlines: India has best bowling attack at the World Cup: Lalchand Rajput
text: Speaking about the Indian team's bowling attack, former Indian cricketer Lalchand Rajput said, "I think India has got best bowling attack and we have got a very well balanced team." Rajput, who is now the Zimbabwe cricket teamÂ’s head coach, added, "I think we have got a very good chance and I think we should be in the top four.Â”

headlines: Google to shut Jump VR platform in June over declining use
text: Google will shut its VR platform Jump, which was first launched in 2015, next month. "We will deactivate Jump account access and begin deleting your Google Cloud Storage data on June 28," Google said. Google cited declining usage of Jump Assembler, which stitches raw footage into 3D-360 videos and photos, with the emergence of alternative solutions as the reason.

headlines: Facebook opens payments, blockchain focused firm in Switzerland
text: Facebook set up a new firm named Libra Networks focusing on blockchain and payments along with data analytics and investing, in Switzerland, as per Geneva's commercial register quoted by Reuters. Earlier a report had stated Facebook is developing a cryptocurrency 'stablecoin', to first be tested in India. Libra Networks was registered on May 2 with Facebook Global Holdings as stakeholder.

headlines: 3 northeast insurgents arrested in Arunachal Pradesh
text: The ninth regiment of the Assam Rifles has arrested three northeast insurgents from Arunachal Pradesh's Changlang district. One assault rifle with its 20 live rounds, one pistol with its 14 live rounds, three mobile phones and some objectionable documents have been recovered from their possession. The three insurgents are the members of National Socialist Council of Nagaland (Khaplang).

headlines: Fully engaged in Mindtree buyout; will make firm big: AM Naik
text: L&T Group Chairman AM Naik has said L&T is currently "completely occupied" with the acquisition of Mindtree. Eventually, the mid-sized IT firm is going to be transformed into a big company, he added. L&T, which has taken its overall holding in Mindtree to about 26%, will launch the open offer to buy additional stake in around 10 days, Naik said.

headlines: I have gone deaf in one ear: Actress who gave birth in 10th month
text: Television actress Chhavi Hussein, who gave birth to a baby boy in the 10th month of her pregnancy, has said she has gone deaf in one ear due to spinal tap. "My feet are so swollen that even flip flops don't fit. So is the rest of my body. My head hurts like it'll explode," she further wrote on Instagram.

headlines: 34 people vote at world's highest polling booth in Himachal Pradesh
text: Thirty-four registered voters exercised their franchise at the world's highest polling booth, located at more than 15,250 feet above sea level in Himachal Pradesh's Tashigang village, on Sunday. The temperatures were below freezing point when the polling began at 7 am. A polling team had reached there on Friday and EVMs were brought in helicopters by the Indian Air Force.

headlines: Once fell sick on boat while fishing, felt I was going to die: ABD
text: Ex-South Africa captain AB de Villiers has revealed he once fell sick on boat during a 10-hour fishing trip with Albie Morkel and Morne Morkel in Sydney. "I got sick after two hours and for eight hours I was lying on top deck...feeling...I was going to die," he added. He further said he could feel God's presence at that moment.

headlines: Cameras catch golfer urinating next to tree during tournament
text: Spanish professional golfer Jon Rahm was caught on cameras urinating next to a tree at the PGA Championship at Bethpage Black in Farmingdale, New York. Rahm's playing partner Dustin Johnson was lining up his shot when the 24-year-old dashed off towards the tree. "When you gotta go, you gotta go," a user tweeted reacting to the incident.

headlines: WI pick Bravo in WC reserve squad despite him retiring 7 months ago
text: All-rounder Dwayne Bravo, who retired from international cricket in October last year, has been named in Windies' 10-man reserve squad for the 2019 World Cup. All-rounder Kieron Pollard and fast bowler Keemo Paul have also been selected in the reserve squad. The reserves will participate in a four-day camp in Southampton from May 19 to 23.

headlines: Rajputs beat Dalit groom for riding horse in Rajasthan
text: A Dalit groom was allegedly beaten for riding a horse at a village in Napasar area in Rajasthan's Bikaner this week, the police said. According to the police, people from Rajput community in Belasar village raised objection when the groom belonging to the Meghwal community rode the horse. One of the vehicles in the groom's convoy was also vandalised.

headlines: 'Soopda saaf' for BJP in UP and Bihar: Shatrughan Sinha
text: Actor-turned-politician Shatrughan Sinha on Sunday said that for the BJP it would be "soopda saaf" (whitewash) at the hands of the "Mahagathbandhan" in Bihar and Uttar Pradesh. He also expressed confidence that he would retain Bihar's Patna Sahib Lok Sabha seat for the third consecutive term. Ending decades of association, Sinha last month quit the BJP and joined the Congress.

headlines: Exit poll gossip is 'game plan' to manipulate EVMs: Mamata
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Sunday said that she doesn't "trust" exit poll gossip, as the "game plan" is to manipulate or replace thousands of EVMs through this gossip. She added, "I appeal to all Opposition parties to be united, strong and bold." Most exit polls forecast a majority for the ruling BJP-led NDA in 17th Lok Sabha elections.

headlines: 1 injured in firing at polling booth in Punjab's Bathinda
text: A man was injured in firing on Sunday after clashes between two groups erupted outside a polling booth in Punjab's Bathinda constituency during the seventh phase polling of the general elections. "We have registered a case under 307 of IPC after recording the statement," police said. The polling at the booth was resumed after the violence ended, the police added.

headlines: BJP influencing voters through WhatsApp: Shashi Tharoor
text: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Sunday said that the BJP is influencing voters through social media in the Lok Sabha elections and WhatsApp has been their favourite medium. He added BJP chose WhatsApp because of its massive reach and because it is target specific. Tharoor said BJP has mastered this technique and "running an estimated half-million WhatsApp groups across India".

headlines: Aus coach Langer compares Steve Smith to Sachin Tendulkar
text: Australian cricket team coach Justin Langer compared former Australian captain Steve Smith to former Indian cricketer Sachin Tendulkar after witnessing Smith hit a shot off Nathan Coulter-Nile. "[W]atched Steve Smith batting against New Zealand in those three practice games, he's literally a master of the game, so it's nice to have him back," Langer said about Smith.

headlines: Positive signs for Goa mining to be visible in 6 months: CM
text: Goa CM Pramod Sawant has said that positive signs will be visible in the next six months towards the resumption of the mining industry in the state. In March last year, the Supreme Court quashed the second renewal of 88 iron ore mining leases in the state. Sawant said "things are changing" in Goa since he took over as CM.

headlines: India's forex reserves up by $1.3 billion to $420 billion
text: India's foreign exchange reserves rose by $1.36 billion to $420.05 billion in the week to May 10 on account of a rise in foreign currency assets, RBI data showed. Foreign currency assets, which are a major component of the overall reserves, rose by $1.35 billion to $392.22 billion. The reserves had touched a life-time high of $426.02 billion last month.

headlines: McD reopens 13 Delhi NCR outlets after settlement with partner
text: Connaught Plaza Restaurants (CPRL), which operates McDonald's chain in northern and eastern India, on Sunday said it has reopened 13 outlets in Delhi NCR. The outlets will have refreshed menu, merchandising and packaging. The burger chain temporarily shut over 160 outlets after McDonald's India reached a settlement with former partner Vikram Bakshi, acquiring full ownership in their joint venture.

headlines: J&J's largest India plant idle three years after completion
text: US-based Johnson & Johnson's biggest manufacturing plant in India remains idle three years after its completion, Reuters reported. Production at the 47-acre site in Hyderabad never began because of slower growth in demand for the products, as per reports. The plant, which was to produce cosmetics and baby products, was expected to employ at least 1,500 people.

headlines: BoB looks to rationalise 800-900 branches following merger
text: State-owned Bank of Baroda (BoB) is looking to rationalise 800-900 branches across the country, following its merger with Dena Bank and Vijaya Bank. Certain branches of the three banks are at one location and this duplication is a drain on efficiency, a senior official said. The lender could opt for relocation and in some cases, closure, the official added.

headlines: Polling for 17th Lok Sabha concludes in 542 constituencies
text: The Election Commission has announced that the polling for the 17th Lok Sabha elections has concluded in 542 parliamentary constituencies across states and union territories. A voter turnout of 60% was recorded in the seventh phase till 6 pm. While 543 MPs are elected to Lok Sabha, voting was cancelled in Tamil Nadu's Vellore constituency after a cash haul.

headlines: Kapil Sharma named among world's most viewed comedians
text: Kapil Sharma has been recognised as one of the most viewed stand-up comedians in India and abroad and for promoting animal rights by World Book of Records London. Sharing the news, the official Twitter handle of Sony TV wrote, "It's a proud moment for all of us. We congratulate the King Of Comedy."

headlines: Priyanka, Nick walk the red carpet at Cannes Film Festival
text: Actress Priyanka Chopra and her husband Nick Jonas walked the red carpet together at the 72nd Cannes Film Festival. While Priyanka was seen in a white tulle gown by Lebanese fashion designer Georges Hobeika, Nick sported a white suit. The couple had earlier attended the Chopard party held on Friday.

headlines: Farhan responds after being trolled over Bhopal election goof up
text: Farhan Akhtar has responded after being trolled for asking people of Bhopal to vote a week after polling ended in the constituency. "Humne taareek galat samjhi toh galaa pakad liya, Jisne itihaas galat samjha use galey laga rahe ho. #priorities," he tweeted. In his previous tweet, Farhan had appealed to Bhopal to vote against Bhopal BJP candidate Sadhvi Pragya Thakur.

headlines: EC to review clean chits to PMO, NITI after 1 commissioner dissents
text: Election Commission will re-examine its clean chits to PMO and NITI Aayog over an alleged MCC violation after commissioner Ashok Lavasa's dissent. This comes after Lavasa recused himself from all MCC cases till his dissent was recorded. The case pertains to PMO reportedly seeking information from Aayog about Union Territories' local culture and history where PM Modi was to visit.

headlines: Air-conditioned polling booth in Indore offers tea, coffee to voters
text: A polling booth in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, where polling is taking place on Sunday, is air-conditioned and offers facilities like RO drinking water, cafeteria, medical desk and special services for the differently-abled. Booth number 215, located at Jall Auditorium, has been developed jointly by the Indore Management Association and the district administration. It also has a play zone for kids.

headlines: 103-year-old Independent India's first voter casts vote in Himachal
text: Shyam Saran Negi, the 103-year-old retired school teacher who had cast the first ever vote during Independent India's first general elections in 1951-52, on Sunday cast his vote at the same booth in Himachal Pradesh's Kalpa village. The local administration accorded a red carpet welcome to Negi, who has voted in all 17 Lok Sabha elections and 13 Assembly elections.

headlines: Conjoined twins vote as separate individuals for 1st time in Bihar
text: Conjoined twins, Saba and Farah, cast their votes as separate individuals for the first time in Bihar on Sunday. During the 2015 assembly polls in Bihar, the 19-year-old sisters had cast their votes on a single voter identity card. They were enrolled in the electoral roll for Digha assembly segment under Patna Sahib Lok Sabha seat.

headlines: Sister said she'll send me to jail: Dutee on same-sex relationship
text: India's fastest female sprinter Dutee Chand, who revealed she's in a same-sex relationship with her 19-year-old relative, has said her eldest sister has threatened to send her to jail. She added her sister feels her partner is interested in their property. The 23-year-old further said her sister threw out her elder brother from home because she didn't like his wife.

headlines: Lawmaker from Trump's political party calls for his impeachment
text: A lawmaker from Donald Trump's political party has called for the US President's impeachment. Justin Amash, who has become the first Republican congressman to call for Trump's impeachment, claimed Trump had "engaged in specific actions" that "meet the threshold for impeachment". Mash said the report on Russian interference established "multiple examples" of Trump committing obstruction of justice.

headlines: Trump backs abortion in cases of rape amid row over new laws
text: Amid the row over strict new abortion laws passed in several states, US President Donald Trump on Saturday backed abortion in cases of rape and incest, however, he declared himself "strongly pro-life". Trump said abortion will be a major issue in his re-election campaign. Notably, the law passed in the US state of Alabama bans abortion in almost all cases.

headlines: After Amazon, US firm Wayfair sells bath mats with pics of Hindu Gods
text: American e-commerce platform Wayfair is facing criticism for selling bath mats depicting Lord Shiva, Lord Ganesha and the Om symbol. The platform described the items as 'Yoga Asian Lord with Third Eye Bath Rug by East Urban Home' and 'Asian Face of Elephant Lord Bath Rug.' This comes less than a week after Amazon faced criticism for selling similar items.

headlines: Lady Gaga performs for Apple staff in US, pays tribute to Steve Jobs
text: Singer-songwriter Lady Gaga recently performed a special private concert for Apple employees to mark the formal opening of the Apple Park campus in Cupertino, US. She also paid tribute to Apple's late Co-founder Steve Jobs, who conceptualised the spaceship-like design of the main building. Apple CEO Tim Cook thanked Lady Gaga for making the celebration "unforgettable".

headlines: TMC shouldn't cry like baby over PM's Kedarnath visit: Supriyo
text: After Trinamool Congress (TMC) approached Election Commission over the media coverage of PM Narendra Modi's visit to Kedarnath, Union Minister Babul Supriyo said that TMC shouldn't behave like a crying baby. "It depends on the importance of a person on how much media covers him," he added. Supriyo further said that TV channels should decide what they want to cover.

headlines: Central forces should remain in WB till MCC ends: Sitharaman
text: Union Minister Nirmala Sitharaman asserted that the Central forces deployed in West Bengal should remain in the state till the Model Code of Conduct (MCC) is in place. She added that the BJP fears that there could be a "massacre" after polling ends in Bengal. Sitharaman said that the Election Commission must take "cognisance" of the violence in Bengal.

headlines: Unlike WB, violence wasn't reported in UP during polls: Yogi
text: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Sunday said that unlike West Bengal, violence was not reported in Uttar Pradesh in the last six phases of Lok Sabha polls. "BJP will achieve the target of more than 300 seats in the country," he added. Yogi further said that BJP will get over 74 seats in Uttar Pradesh.

headlines: Vincent Kompany to leave Man City after 11 years at club
text: Belgian defender Vincent Kompany is set to leave Manchester City this summer after having spent 11 years at the club. The 33-year-old, who joined the club in the summer of 2008 and has made 358 appearances, leaves the club after completing a domestic treble this season. Kompany won four Premier League titles, two FA Cups and four League Cups.

headlines: Boeing admits flaws in 737 MAX simulator software post crash
text: Boeing on Saturday admitted its 737 MAX's simulators, used to train pilots, were incapable of replicating certain flight conditions. The US company said it has provided additional information to operators to ensure the simulator experience is representative across different flight conditions. The statement comes after two deadly crashes involving the aircraft killed 346 people within five months.

headlines: BJP writes to Delhi Police to withdraw Kejriwal's security
text: Following Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's claim that his PSO may assassinate him, Delhi BJP spokesman Praveen Shankar Kapoor wrote a letter to the Delhi Police demanding the withdrawal of Kejriwal's security cover if he doesn't seek an apology. He said Kejriwal's security squad must be facing "mental depression" after his remark. Kapoor said Kejriwal's personnel should be given "psychological counselling".

headlines: Sidhu probably wants to replace me as Punjab CM: Amarinder Singh
text: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh on Sunday said that state minister Navjot Singh Sidhu probably wants to replace him as CM and that's his (Sidhu's) business. "If he's ambitious, it's fine, people have ambitions," he added. This comes after Sidhu said his wife Navjot Kaur Sidhu would never lie after she claimed that she was denied party ticket by Amarinder.

headlines: PharmEasy closing its $100 million Series D round: Report
text: Mumbai-based online medicine delivery platform PharmEasy is closing its $100 million Series D funding round, Inc42 reported. A Korean venture capital firm will join as new investor and existing investors including Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani co-founded Fundamentum, among others, will also participate, the report said. Launched in 2015, PharmEasy raised $50-million funding in September 2018.

headlines: Article suggests Tesla to advertise, CEO Elon Musk responds
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Twitter responded to an article which said, "It's time for Tesla to advertise, and Autopilot should be first on the list". Musk said, "Tesla does not advertise or pay for endorsements. Instead, we use that money to make the product great." Musk said Tesla may advertise eventually but for "information & entertainment, not trickery".

headlines: NASA finishes 1st hardware tests on cube-shaped robot in space
text: NASA has completed initial series of tests of Bumble, one of its cube-shaped Astrobee robots during hardware checkout in space. The Astrobee is a free-flying robot system that'll help astronauts reduce time spent on routine duties. Working autonomously or via remote control by astronauts, flight controllers or researchers on the ground, they are designed to complete tasks like taking inventory.

headlines: India to be in top 3 markets outside Japan in 8 yrs: LIXIL
text: Japanese multinational firm LIXIL expects India to be among the top three global markets outside Japan for its water technology business in next seven-eight years, a top company official said. The water and housing products major is set to enter the pre-fabricated bathroom vertical in India. The firm currently sells products under GROHE and American Standard brands in India.

headlines: Had to make out with someone I didn't know during audition: Aditi
text: Actress Aditi Rao Hydari, during her appearance on 'Feet Up With The Stars' season 2, revealed she had to make out with someone she didn't know during the audition of her 2011 film 'Yeh Saali Zindagi'. She was referring to actor Arunoday Singh, who was eventually cast opposite her. "But at that point, I didn't know him," said Aditi.

headlines: Mukesh and Nita Ambani visit Rishi Kapoor in NY, Neetu shares pic
text: India's richest person Mukesh Ambani and his wife Nita Ambani visited actor Rishi Kapoor in New York recently, who has been undergoing treatment for cancer. Rishi's wife and actress Neetu Kapoor shared a picture of the four, and wrote, "Some people just come to give you assurance and mental peace!" She further thanked the Ambanis for "all the support".

headlines: My generation failed you: Apple CEO Tim Cook on climate change
text: Addressing graduates at Tulane University in New Orleans on Saturday, Apple CEO Tim Cook while talking about the climate change said, "In some important ways, my generation has failed you." He explained, "We have spent too much time debating...and not focused enough on progress." "You don't need to look far to find an example of that failure," he added.

headlines: Always humbling to return to mountains: PM shares pic from Kedarnath
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter to share a picture of himself meditating wearing a saffron robe against the backdrop of the mountains. "Majestic and magnificent. Serene and spiritual. There is something very special about the Himalayas. It is always a humbling experience to return to the mountains," he wrote. PM Modi also visited the Badrinath Temple earlier today.

headlines: Blast near Congress MLA's house in Bengaluru, one killed
text: A man was killed in a blast outside Congress MLA Munirathna Naidu's residence in Vyalikaval in Karnataka's Bengaluru on Sunday. The victim was identified as 45-year-old Venkatesh, who worked as a washerman. Police said they are investigating the cause of the blast which occurred at around 9:15 am on Sunday.

headlines: Girl stripped, killed inside tunnel by gang she was about to expose
text: A 14-year-old US girl who was found dead inside a tunnel earlier this week was stripped before being stabbed and beaten by a group of teenagers. Ariana Funes-Diaz had been lured to the tunnel in Maryland on April 18 by the gang members. The gang believed she was going to inform police about a crime they'd committed a day earlier.

headlines: Mamata handed over Bengal's charge to goons: Vijayvargiya
text: West Bengal BJP in-charge Kailash Vijayvargiya on Sunday said that state CM Mamata Banerjee has handed over the charge of the state to the goons. Criticising Mamata-led TMC government in the state, he added that there is "hooliganism" and no democracy in Bengal. Vijayvargiya further said that Bengal government and police have together "murdered" the democracy of the region.

headlines: Publicity of PM's Kedarnath visit violates MCC: TMC to EC
text: Trinamool Congress (TMC) on Sunday wrote to the Election Commission saying that the wide-scale coverage of PM Narendra Modi's visit to Uttarakhand's Kedarnath violates Model Code of Conduct. The complaint said that even though election campaigning is over, his visit is being publicised with "ulterior motive to influence voters". Campaigning for last phase of polls got over on May 17.

headlines: 2 booths in Arunachal to go for re-polling on May 21
text: The Election Commission has ordered re-polling at a booth in Koloriang constituency and a booth in Tali constituency of Arunachal Pradesh on May 21 following complaints of electoral malpractices. The two stations had already gone for re-polling earlier when re-polls were held for 18 booths in the state. However, several allegations of electoral malpractices were raised in the re-polling too.

headlines: Cristiano Ronaldo wins Serie A Player of the Year award
text: Juventus forward Cristiano Ronaldo was given the 'Serie A Player of the Year' award on Saturday. With this win, Ronaldo has now won the domestic player of the year award in England, Spain, and Italy. The 34-year-old joined Juventus in 2018, leaving Real Madrid as the club's all-time goalscorer, and after having won three consecutive Champions League titles.

headlines: Djokovic to meet Nadal in the Rome Masters final
text: Serbia's Novak Djokovic beat Argentina's Diego Schwartzman to reach the Rome Masters' final, where he will face Spain's Rafael Nadal. This will be the 54th meeting between the rivals, who are both at 33 Masters 1000 titles. The Serbian leads the head-to-head scoreline between them 28-25, having won nine of their last 11 matches.

headlines: 25,000 Linksys WiFi routers leaking sensitive info: Report
text: Over 25,000 Linksys Smart Wi-Fi routers globally are found to be vulnerable to remote exploit by attackers, leading to leak of sensitive information, security research firm Bad Packets said. The information reportedly includes MAC address of every device thatÂ’s ever connected to it, device name and operating system. Linksys responded to the finding saying they couldn't reproduce the vulnerability.

headlines: US curbs may slow growth, but only slightly: Huawei CEO
text: Huawei Founder and CEO Ren Zhengfei on Saturday said the growth of the company "may slow, but only slightly" due to US restrictions, adding that the company's revenue growth may undershoot 20%. He reiterated that the Chinese telecom giant has not violated any law. The US recently put Huawei on a blacklist, restricting it from doing business with American companies.

headlines: Pragya's Godse remark should not be tolerated: Nitish Kumar
text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Sunday condemned BJP's Bhopal Lok Sabha candidate Pragya Singh Thakur for calling Mahatma Gandhi's killer Nathuram Godse a "patriot". "We should not tolerate such a statement," Nitish said. "Bapu is the father of the nation and people will not like if anyone talks about Godse in this manner," he added.

headlines: Quit NDA if you didn't like Pragya's remark: Rabri to Nitish
text: RJD leader Rabri Devi on Sunday said that Bihar CM Nitish Kumar should leave NDA if he was hurt over BJP's Lok Sabha candidate Sadhvi Pragya Thakur's comment on Nathuram Godse. She made the statement hours after Nitish said that Pragya's statements on Godse were condemnable. Nitish had left the JD(U)-RJD-Congress alliance in Bihar and joined the NDA in 2016.

headlines: Odisha govt to distribute 24L sanitary pads in Fani-hit Puri
text: The Odisha government has provisioned over 24 lakh sanitary napkins for free supply in Cyclone Fani-hit Puri district. This would "ensure health, hygiene and dignity of women and girls in this critical period," an official release said. Over 1.65 crore people of the state have been adversely affected due to the cyclone which hit Puri coast on May 3.

headlines: Jauhar should be considered different from Sati: Raj CM
text: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Saturday said that the practice of Jauhar, or self-immolation by women facing capture by invaders, should be considered different from Sati. He added that wherever BJP ruled in the country, they attempted to distort history. This comes after a picture in Rajasthan Class 8 textbooks suggesting self-immolation was replaced by picture of a hill fort.

headlines: upGrad learner transitions from Software to Big Data role
text: BITS Pilani offers first-of-its-kind Big Data Engineering PG Program in India, in collaboration with upGrad. It has served 1000+ learners with hands-on expertise on tools like Hadoop, Scala, Hive along with 1-1 Industry mentorship and interactions with BITS Faculty. One such learner, Anugna, transitioned from a Software Engineer at HCL into a Big Data role through upGrad.

headlines: Voting begins for 7th and final phase of 17th Lok Sabha elections
text: Voting for the seventh and final phase of 17th Lok Sabha elections has begun. The phase covers 59 constituencies across Himachal Pradesh, Punjab, Chandigarh, Bihar, Jharkhand, MP, UP and West Bengal. Around 1.12 lakh polling booths are in place for smooth conduct of polls, while 10.02 crore registered voters will decide the fate of 918 candidates including PM Narendra Modi.

headlines: Cave where PM Modi meditated had WiFi, telephone and toilet: Report
text: The cave in Kedarnath, where Prime Minister Narendra Modi meditated, was WiFi and telephone-enabled, according to a report. It also had an adjoining toilet with basic facilities, the report added. PM Modi emerged from the cave on Sunday after meditating overnight. After offering morning prayers at the Kedarnath temple, the PM will head towards the Badrinath shrine.

headlines: I feel disrespected: Director quits Akshay's film after poster out
text: Filmmaker Raghava Lawrence has announced he has decided to step down as director of Akshay Kumar starrer 'Laxmmi Bomb', citing that the first look poster of the film was released without informing him. "I feel very disrespected," he wrote. "More than money and fame, self-respect is the most important attribute to a person's character," Raghava tweeted.

headlines: Farhan asks Bhopal to vote a week after polling ends, trolled
text: Actor Farhan Akhtar was trolled after he tweeted on Sunday, encouraging Bhopal to vote a week after polling ended in the constituency. "Dear electorate of Bhopal, it's time for you to save your city from another full-of-gas tragedy. #SayNoToPragya #SayNoToGodse #RememberTheMahatma #ChooseLoveNotHate," he wrote. Commenting on this, a user wrote, "Sir, [it's] a bit early...please retweet this [in] 2024."

headlines: US basketball player admits using fake penis to pass drugs test
text: American basketball player Lamar Odom has revealed in his book that he used a fake penis with his trainer's urine to pass drug test for 2004 Olympics. Odom added he had been smoking weed every day and was paranoid about getting caught. The 39-year-old wrote the drug tester was satisfied the pee was his and said, "Welcome to Team USA!"

headlines: Man City become first team to complete English domestic treble
text: Manchester City defeated Watford 6-0 on Saturday to win their sixth FA Cup title. With this, Manchester City, who also won League Cup and Premier League this season, became the first men's team to complete the English domestic treble. Raheem Sterling scored a hat-trick, while David Silva, Kevin De Bruyne and Gabriel Jesus netted one goal each in the final.

headlines: Amazing how Kohli translated potential to become top batsman: Upton
text: Team India's ex-mental conditioning coach Paddy Upton has said that it is amazing how Virat Kohli translated his potential to become the number one batsman in the world. "Like Kohli, many other cricketers had the potential [in 2011]...but itÂ’s just amazing to [see Kohli achieve what he has]," he added. Upton was in Team India's support staff under Gary Kirsten.

headlines: We may reach Mars by 2060s: NASA scientist on Trump's 2033 target
text: NASA scientist Robert Howard has said it would be impossible to make the 2033 deadline for Mars, set by NASA under US President Donald Trump's administration. "I think in our current approach, we're going to be lucky to do it by 2037," Howard said, adding if he were to be pessimistic, and assume political constraints "it could be the 2060s".

headlines: Red carpet welcome for 103-yr-old voter at Himachal Pradesh booth
text: Shyam Saran Negi, 103-year-old man who had first cast his vote in 1951, will cast his vote in 17th Lok Sabha elections at a polling booth in HP's Kalpa village on Sunday. Pratham Prathmik Vidyalaya, where the polling booth is located, will accord a red carpet welcome to Negi, who had cast his vote in 1951 at the same booth.

headlines: 3-year-old girl dies after Telangana MLA's convoy hits bike
text: A three-year-old girl was killed on the spot after a convoy vehicle of Mulugu MLA Danasari Anasuya, known as Sitakka, hit the bike on which she was travelling. Her mother and uncle suffered minor injuries and were shifted to a local government hospital. A sub-inspector said Sitakka was not in the SUV during the accident, however, some reports claim otherwise.

headlines: I have no desire to take control of IndiGo: Co-founder Gangwal
text: IndiGo Co-founder Rakesh Gangwal has said that he has no desire whatsoever to take control of the airline. Meanwhile, CEO Ronojoy Dutta said there may be differences currently on certain matters but the company has a great track record of resolving issues. "I wish to dispel all attempts to portray us as a fractured team at IndiGo," he added.

headlines: Nandan Nilekani's panel on digital payments submits report to RBI
text: The high-level committee on deepening digital payments, headed by Infosys Co-founder and Chairman Nandan Nilekani, submitted its report to Reserve Bank of India Governor Shaktikanta Das on Friday. Besides Nilekani, former RBI Deputy Governor HR Khan and former Steel Secretary Aruna Sharma were also part of the five-member panel. The team was formed in January this year.

headlines: NPF to 'pull out' from BJP-led Manipur government post polls
text: Naga People's Front (NPF) has decided to withdraw support from BJP-led Manipur government after elections. "This decision...is necessitated due to the indifferent attitude of BJP towards us, its coalition partner in Manipur and also in the state of Nagaland," NPF leader TR Zeliang tweeted. "Decision was taken after a review meeting with party functionaries and NPF's Manipur MLAs," he added.

headlines: Nadal beats Tsitsipas to reach his 50th ATP Masters 1000 final
text: World number two Rafael Nadal defeated world number seven Stefanos Tsitsipas 6-3, 6-4 to reach the final of the Rome Masters. The final will be Nadal's first clay court summit clash of 2019 and also his 50th ATP Masters 1000 final. Last week at the Madrid Open, 20-year-old Tsitsipas had become the youngest player to defeat Nadal on clay.

headlines: China's Baidu reports 1st-ever quarterly loss since 2005 IPO
text: Chinese internet giant Baidu has reported its first quarterly loss in nearly 14 years since it went public in 2005. Nasdaq-listed Baidu also reported a net loss attributable to shareholders of about $47.5 million for the quarter ended March 31, 2019. The Chinese search engine operator warned of a "challenging environment" ahead, saying Q2 revenue could decline up to 3%.

headlines: Video: Robot actually hits people when they get hit in VR game
text: Robotics engineer and YouTuber James Bruton, along with UK's Portsmouth University students, has co-developed a robot that fights humans in real life while they're playing a custom-made Virtual Reality (VR) game. The robot, mounted on a wooden base, is made with 3D-printed parts and foot pumps. Trackers in the room track the robot's arms and player's headsets and foam bat.

headlines: Cold War-era 'coffin' leaking nuclear waste into Pacific: UN chief
text: A 40-year-old "coffin" built to contain nuclear waste could be leaking radioactive material into Pacific, UN Secretary-General AntÃ³nio Guterres has warned. The US dumped waste from 67 nuclear tests it conducted from 1946-1958 during the Cold War into the crater, capped with an 18-inch-thick concrete dome. Its bottom was never lined as it was intended to be a temporary measure.

headlines: T'gana Prisons Dept to open petrol pump run by transgenders
text: Telangana DGP Prisons and Correctional Services Vinoy Singh said that transgender people will be hired to run a petrol pump operated by the Prisons Department in the state. The department intends to open 20 petrol pumps across Telangana in the coming three months, he added. The department already operates 18 petrol pumps run by prison inmates in the state.

headlines: 1.64 lakh engineering seats cut in colleges across India
text: All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) has cut down 1.64 lakh engineering seats nationwide in UG and PG courses. "While some colleges didn't achieve even 30% admissions in last five years, others have applied to reduce seats or shut down," AICTE Chairman Anil D Sahasrabudhe said. "Action was taken against some institutions for not maintaining quality standards," he added.

headlines: 24-yr-old tourist dies in paragliding accident in Himachal
text: A 24-year-old tourist from Punjab's Mohali was killed and a paragliding pilot was injured in a paragliding accident in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu district on Saturday, police said. The incident reportedly occurred after the pilot lost control over the paraglider. A case has been registered and the tourist's body will be handed over to his family after the autopsy.

headlines: Actor vandalises store over hotdog, says police beat him all night
text: CCTV footage of TV actor Aansh Arora vandalising a convenience store in Ghaziabad has surfaced online. According to the store manager, Aansh vandalised the store after being asked to wait for a hotdog he had ordered. Aansh later claimed the police arrested and brutally thrashed him all night after he had gone to the store to apologise for his behaviour.

headlines: Arnold Schwarzenegger kicked from behind during event in S Africa
text: Hollywood actor Arnold Schwarzenegger was kicked from behind by a man during an event in Johannesburg, South Africa on Saturday. Schwarzenegger was filming a video of children skipping when the man jumped and kicked the 71-year-old. Schwarzenegger fell over a crowd of people while the man who kicked him was held down by security.

headlines: Bayern thump Frankfurt on last day to win 7th straight Bundesliga
text: Bayern Munich on Saturday defeated Frankfurt 5-1 on the last day of Bundesliga 2018/19 to secure their seventh straight Bundesliga title. French winger Franck Ribery and Dutch winger Arjen Robben scored in their last appearances for the German champions. It was the first time since 2009 that Bundesliga title was decided on the last day.

headlines: Kohli looks after everyone, scared of saying anything to him: ABD
text: Ex-South Africa captain AB de Villiers has said his RCB teammate Virat Kohli looks after everyone. "I'm scared of saying anything to him...because if I say like, 'Oh, I like your shoes', the next minute he organises me those shoes," he added. "I told him I like coffee the other day. Now I'm getting an espresso machine," he further said.

headlines: Olympian rower Dattu Bhokanal booked for allegedly harassing wife
text: Olympian and Asian Games medallist Dattu Baban Bhokanal has been booked for allegedly harassing his wife physically and mentally, a police official said. Bhokanal and his wife had a secret wedding ceremony, but he now refuses to formally marry her, police added. Bhokanal's family maintains they know nothing about the marriage.

headlines: Brad Hodge criticised for his 'money' remark on Kohli, Pant's ad
text: Ex-Australia batsman Brad Hodge took to Twitter to comment on Indian cricketers Virat Kohli and Rishabh Pant rapping in an anti-pimple product commercial, writing, "Amazing what people do for money." Hodge was criticised by several social media users, with one writing, "Amazing how it bothers you so much." "I was not speaking in a negative tone," Hodge later said.

headlines: 26 dams hit zero water storage level in Maharashtra
text: Twenty-six dams in Maharashtra have reached 'zero storage' level as on May 18, figures provided by the state water conservation department revealed. The affected areas include the Aurangabad Division, as well as some dams in the Nagpur Division, Jalgaon and Pune. Water storage in Maharashtra's 103 large, medium and small reservoirs stood at 11.84%, as compared to 23.73% last year.

headlines: Wanted to feel death, take care of my parents: JNU student to prof
text: In his suicide note, which he emailed to his English professor, Rishi Joshua, a second year MA student at JNU, stated he wanted to "experience the physical state of death from sometime," police said. "By the time you read this, I won't be in physical state...Take care of my parents," it read. Joshua committed suicide by hanging himself in library.

headlines: Man beaten to death after alleged gang-rape of 14-yr-old in Alwar
text: Days after the gang-rape of an 18-year-old woman in Rajasthan's Alwar, another rape case has surfaced from the city where a youth was beaten to death by relatives of the victim. The 14-year-old girl alleged the boy and two of his friends raped her on May 14 when they were attending a wedding. Police have detained the other two accused.

headlines: China holds driverless car race with fake cow, sheep hurdles
text: China's Tianjin city held the third edition of the annual driverless car race using autonomous cars, on a circuit covering an area of about 10 soccer fields. The circuit consisted of bumps and sudden turns, with hurdles including artificial fog and even fake cows and sheep. Several autonomous cars, however, failed to escape a roadblock that narrowed the track.

headlines: Chandrababu Naidu suggests EC to count votes through VVPATs
text: Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu urged Election Commission to count votes through Voter-verified paper audit trail (VVPAT) instead of EVMs. "Officials will count EVMs first then will check 5% of EVMs with VVPAT. If any discrepancy is found, then they'll take VVPAT count as final," he said. Naidu added that he feels counting EVMs is a more complicated process.

headlines: EC notice to Cong candidate in MP for alleged MCC violation
text: Election Commission on Saturday issued a notice to Congress candidate from Khandwa, Madhya Pradesh, Arun Subhashchandra Yadav, for allegedly violating the Model Code of Conduct. "In the complaint filed, BJP leader Neeraj accused Yadav of violating MCC by distributing pamphlets/enrolment forms for NYAY scheme," EC said. Yadav has been asked by EC to file an explanation within a day.

headlines: BJP seeks action against Mayawati for violating MCC
text: BJP on Saturday wrote to UP's Chief Electoral Officer seeking action against BSP chief Mayawati for allegedly violating Model Code of Conduct. BJP claimed that Mayawati is tweeting to influence voters even after the end of campaigning. "Instead of development, PM Narendra Modi and CM Yogi Adityanath's double-engine government has given communal tension, hatred and violence to India," she tweeted.

headlines: Haasan must study for 100 yrs to define Hindu: Giriraj Singh
text: Reacting to Kamal Haasan's 'Hindu word is of foreign origin' remark, BJP's Giriraj Singh on Saturday said, "To define a Hindu, he'll have to read and study for at least 100 years." "Haasan needs to define a Muslim to be identified as an intelligent person," Singh added. He further said Haasan shouldn't be afraid of getting arrested "because he's Muslim".

headlines: Ensure voting in WB without BJPÂ’s intervention: Mamata to EC
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Saturday wrote to Election Commission to ensure "peaceful and impartial" voting in the state. "In the final phase of election [on May 19], I would request you...to kindly ensure that election is completed...without any undue interference of Central government," she added. Mamata also requested EC to "protect democratic institutions and federal structure" of India.

headlines: Imam-ul-Haq escapes elbow injury ahead of World Cup
text: Pakistan's opener Imam-ul-Haq escaped an elbow injury after getting struck by a short ball while playing against England in the fourth ODI on Friday. Imam was struck while trying to play a pull shot on the bowling of Mark Wood. The batsman was taken to hospital for X-rays, where it was reported that his left arm has some swelling.

headlines: Man City need Champions League win to be best: Guardiola
text: Manchester City coach Pep Guardiola has said that in order to be the 'best', the Manchester-based club needs to win the Champions League. "Our standard in that competition has not been as good as the rest of our work, I admit... [I]t is still our dream to win it," Guardiola said about the Champions League.

headlines: CSK announce Kedar Jadhav is fit for World Cup with 'Singham' post
text: CSK took to social media to announce that all-rounder Kedar Jadhav, who had sustained a shoulder injury during IPL 2019, has been declared fit for World Cup. "Singham Kedar...will travel to England for the 2019 World Cup!...To many many crucial runs and wickets! #WhistlePodu," CSK wrote. CSK also shared a photo of Jadhav with MS Dhoni standing alongside.

headlines: I was best player in Europe: Ribery on treble-winning season
text: Franck Ribery, who is set to leave Bayern Munich at the end of the season, recalled the year he won the treble with the German side. Ribery said, "Everyone knows that was our best season. And I was the best player in Europe, it was fantastic." Ribery also spoke about his bond with Bayern defender David Alaba.

headlines: I should be able to play in any condition: Vijay on no. 4 role at WC
text: Speaking about his number four position in India's World Cup batting line-up, Vijay Shankar said, "I need to be in good shape... I should be equipped to play in any condition." "It is really important for me to keep things simple. Other things are not in my control, I should try to control what I can control," Shankar added.

headlines: Privilege to play under Kohli, he backs his bowlers: Bhuvneshwar
text: Indian pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar has said that it is a privilege to play under captain Virat Kohli as he always backs his bowlers. "[Kohli] reads the minds of rival batsmen well and advises us accordingly. He is aggressive and on the ball all the time," Kumar added. The 29-year-old is going to play in his second World Cup.

headlines: Mumbai most vulnerable to cyberattacks, Delhi, B'luru next: Report
text: Mumbai topped the 15-city list of the most vulnerable cities to cyberattacks in 2019, followed by Delhi, Bengaluru and Kolkata, Quick Heal Security Labs revealed. The 'Annual Threat Report 2019' put Maharashtra, Delhi and West Bengal as the top three states at most risk. The report compiled data from several cyberattacks that took place in 2018 on Windows and Android.

headlines: Austria's Vice-Chancellor resigns over video scandal
text: Austria's Vice-Chancellor, Heinz-Christian Strache, resigned today after a secretly-filmed video showed him allegedly offering government contracts in return for campaign support. The video, filmed before the 2017 election, showed Strache meeting a woman who claimed to be a Russian oligarch's niece. She could be seen offering to support the Freedom Party and invest over Â€250 million in Austria.

headlines: I'll play 2023 World Cup if Dhoni is still around, jokes De Villiers
text: Ex-South Africa captain AB de Villiers jokingly said he'll play the 2023 World Cup if MS Dhoni is still around at the time. "How old will I be (in 2023)?...39...If I'm still good enough, who knows eh?" he added. De Villiers further said criticism for picking and choosing international matches was one of the main reasons behind him retiring.

headlines: Late US university doctor sexually abused 177 male students
text: Richard Strauss, an Ohio State University team doctor sexually abused at least 177 male students during 1979-1997, according to an investigative report. Strauss, who committed suicide in 2005, groped or ogled men while treating athletes from around 16 sports. The report added the university officials knew about Strauss' conduct as early as 1979 but failed to take "meaningful action".

headlines: Roy slams ton after spending entire night with hospitalised daughter
text: England opener Jason Roy, who smashed match-winning 114(89) against Pakistan on Friday, revealed he had to take his newborn daughter to hospital the night prior to the ODI. He added he had to be at the hospital from 1:30 am to 8:30 am and got to the ground just before warm-up. "It was a very emotional hundred," he further said.

headlines: Trump says imported cars pose security threat, Toyota responds
text: Japan's largest carmaker Toyota sharply criticised President Donald Trump's declaration on Friday that imported cars and components threaten US national security. The company said it has spent more than $60 billion building operations in the country, including 10 manufacturing plants. Trump's proclamation "sends a message to Toyota that our investments are not welcomed," it added.

headlines: ISRO planning Mars, Venus, Sun, Moon missions besides Gaganyaan
text: ISRO Chairman K Sivan has said the space agency is planning several missions apart from Gaganyaan manned mission and Chandrayaan-2.
