"They would include Mars Orbiter Mission 2, Chandrayaan 3, a mission to Venus, EXPOSat, Aditya L1 (to study Sun's corona)" Sivan said. "There's a lot of interest in Venus...in Indian scientific community and abroad...around 20 payloads are coming," he added.

headlines: 10L shoes, 3.7L toothbrushes found on islands having 600 people
text: Researchers have found 41.4 crore plastic pieces, including nearly 10 lakh shoes and 3.7 lakh toothbrushes that washed ashore on Australia's Cocos (Keeling) Islands, home to only 600 people. The survey estimated the Indian Ocean islands' beaches are littered with 238 tonnes of plastic. "We only sampled a depth of 10 cm and couldn't access some debris hotspots," researchers said.

headlines: Stalker enters cab, stabs B'luru air hostess for refusing proposal
text: A 30-year-old man surrendered to the Bengaluru Police on Friday days after allegedly stabbing a 27-year-old flight attendant, who is now stable. The stalker got into the victim's cab and began demanding she agree to his marriage proposal. When she refused, he ripped off her right ear, stabbed her in the face, and punched her in the stomach, police said.

headlines: PM's Secretary PK Mishra wins UN's Sasakawa Award
text: Dr PK Mishra, Additional Principal Secretary to the Prime Minister, has been conferred the 2019 UN Sasakawa Award for Disaster Reduction by the United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction. "He received the award for his dedication to improve the resilience of communities most exposed to disasters and his personal commitment to social inclusion", the government said in a statement.

headlines: PM Modi meditates inside holy cave in Kedarnath wearing saffron robe
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was on Saturday photographed meditating wearing saffron robe inside a holy cave near the Kedarnath Shrine in Uttarakhand. PM Modi reportedly trekked two kilometres to the cave and will be meditating inside the cave till tomorrow morning. Earlier in the morning, PM Modi reviewed re-development projects in Kedarnath and offered his prayers at the Kedarnath Temple.

headlines: Pain like no other: Prince William on mother Diana's death
text: In a documentary about mental health, UK's Prince William said that the pain of losing his mother Princess Diana was "like no other". "It's going to be very difficult to come across something that's going to be even worse pain than that," he added. Prince William was 15 when his mother died in a car accident in Paris in 1997.

headlines: Akshay's 1st look as transgender in 'Laxmmi Bomb' unveiled
text: Akshay Kumar unveiled his first look from the upcoming horror-comedy 'Laxmmi Bomb', which will also see Kiara Advani in a lead role. A remake of the Tamil film 'Kanchana: Muni 2', the film will see Akshay play the role of a man possessed by the ghost of a transgender woman. Amitabh Bachchan will also reportedly feature in the forthcoming film.

headlines: DonÂ’t want toilets with no doors, water: Mayawati to PM Modi
text: Bahujan Samaj Party supremo Mayawati on Friday targetted PM Narendra Modi and said that women don't want ill-equipped toilets constructed by the government. "Our daughters and sisters don't want toilets with no water and doors," she added. Mayawati further said that during the BSP rule, her government ensured the construction of more toilets as compared to the BJP government.

headlines: Congress of 2019 giving regional leaders more space: Punjab CM
text: Punjab CM Amarinder Singh has claimed that Congress of 2019 is different than Congress of 2014. "The party is giving more importance to regional leaders than it was doing earlier," he said while adding that Congress today has a deeper insight into the aspirations of people across the country. "Within the organisation [also]...there's more transparency and democracy," Singh further said.

headlines: We're with Congress president: JD(S) chief HD Deve Gowda
text: Former PM and JD(S) chief HD Deve Gowda on Saturday reiterated his support to the Congress party in the ongoing general elections. "We're with the Congress president (Rahul Gandhi). A clear picture would emerge after May 23," he said. Earlier, Deve Gowda's son and Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy also said Congress president would be his party's choice for PM's post.

headlines: Zlatan given 2-match ban for grabbing goalkeeper by the neck
text: Former Manchester United and Barcelona forward Zlatan Ibrahimovic has been handed a two-match ban in the MLS on Friday after he grabbed New York City goalkeeper Sean Johnson by the neck. The incident occurred during Los Angeles Galaxy's 0-2 loss to New York City. Ibrahimovic will miss Sunday's home game against the Colorado Rapids.

headlines: Going to do better this time: Nadal ahead of Tsitsipas match
text: Speaking ahead of his semifinal appearance against Stefanos Tsitsipas at the Rome Masters, Rafael Nadal said, "I know what happened last week, and I'm going to try to do it better tomorrow." The Spanish tennis player had been dumped out of the Madrid Masters in the semifinal stage by the same Greek opponent earlier this month.

headlines: Feel proud when people term India's bowling unit as best: Shami
text: Indian pacer Mohammad Shami has said that he feels very proud when the Indian team's bowling unit is addressed as the best in the world. "The best part is that along with variety, we have an attack that can bowl fast. Having skills and pace together is the USP of this side," Shami said about the current bowling attack.

headlines: Delhi HC dismisses ShareChat's copyright case against TikTok owner
text: Delhi High Court has dismissed a case against TikTok owner ByteDance's Helo app by Bengaluru-based social media platform ShareChat, which accused it of copyright infringement. It also alleged ByteDance placed bids on 'ShareChat' keyword on Google's ads platform to increase its own popularity, creating unfair competition. The development came after ByteDance changed Helo's design and interface.

headlines: China builds facial recognition app to distinguish pandas
text: China Conservation and Research Centre for Giant Pandas has co-developed a facial recognition app to distinguish between pandas. The team began research in 2017 and has built a database with over 1,20,000 images and 10,000 video clips. Researchers said it will help improve efficiency and effectiveness in animal conservation, adding they've analysed, marked and annotated about 10,000 panda pictures.

headlines: Kashmir issue a myth created by Congress, NC: Jitendra Singh
text: Union Minister Jitendra Singh on Saturday said that the Jammu and Kashmir issue is a political "myth" created by Congress, National Conference and other such political groups. He added that political leaders rake up the issue for their own political interests. Singh further said that Jammu and Kashmir is very much a part of India like any other state.

headlines: NASA gives SpaceX, Blue Origin, others $45M for Moon lander tests
text: NASA has selected 11 American entities, including billionaire rivals Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos' aerospace startups SpaceX and Blue Origin, to conduct studies and produce prototypes of human landers. The entities will share total amount of over $45 million for NASA's Artemis lunar exploration program. This effort will help put American astronauts on Moon's south pole by 2024, NASA said.

headlines: Musk's Boring Company to get its 1st tunnel contract in Las Vegas
text: Billionaire Elon Musk-led tunnel-digging startup The Boring Company (TBC) is set to receive its contract to build a high-speed underground transit system in Las Vegas for $44 million. However, the city withholds over two-thirds of payments until construction is complete and specifies heavy penalties if it fails to accommodate enough passengers. TBC has built one 1.8-km-long test tunnel to date.

headlines: US air strikes mistakenly kill 17 Afghan policemen
text: US air strikes in Afghanistan mistakenly killed as many as 17 Afghan police officers during fighting with Taliban forces near the capital of Helmand province, Afghan officials said. Fourteen others were injured in the incident. US military personnel had worked with Afghan coordinators who "confirmed that the areas were clear of friendly forces", US officials said.

headlines: Arbaaz Khan to make Malayalam acting debut with Mohanlal
text: Actor Arbaaz Khan will make his acting debut in the Malayalam film industry in the upcoming Mohanlal starrer 'Big Brother'. "Super excited about working with the Legend Mohanlal sir...So looking forward to the shoot in July," Arbaaz tweeted. Directed by Siddique, the film will reportedly see Arbaaz play the role of an enforcement officer named Vedantham IPS.

headlines: Key witnesses scared to come forth due to Nana: Tanushree's lawyer
text: Key witnesses aren't coming forward to record statements in the sexual harassment case filed by Tanushree Dutta against Nana Patekar due to fear of the accused, Tanushree's lawyer said. "Police have recorded statements of almost 15 witnesses, but key eyewitnesses...have not recorded," her lawyer added. He further stated they will feel safe to come forward once the accused are arrested.

headlines: Kejriwal attacked at least 6 times in police presence: AAP MLA
text: After Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal claimed that his personal security officer reports to BJP and the party will get him killed one day, AAP MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj said, "We do not trust Delhi Police." Bharadwaj added, "After becoming CM, he has been attacked at least 6 times in the presence of police. Even after such incidents, no action was taken."

headlines: Cancel Pragya's candidature, she's unfit for civil society: Sheila
text: Delhi Congress' Sheila Dikshit on Friday asked EC to cancel Pragya Singh Thakur's candidature from Bhopal for calling Mahatma Gandhi's killer Nathuram Godse a "patriot". Sheila said, "She's also unfit to be part of civil society." She claimed PM Narendra Modi and BJP chief Amit Shah "handpicked" Thakur as BJP's candidate and should be held "morally accountable" for her statement.

headlines: Shaw plays with bat having 'You'll be a legend one day' msg on it
text: During the North Mumbai Panthers-NaMo Bandra Blasters T20 Mumbai League match, 19-year-old opener Prithvi Shaw was seen playing with a bat having 'You will be a legend one day' message on it. The message was signed by Shaw's Delhi Capitals teammate Shikhar Dhawan. The North Mumbai Panthers opener scored 53 off 31 balls including seven fours and two sixes.

headlines: Google tracks online purchases via Gmail, denies use for ads
text: Google has admitted recently reported claims that it tracks users' online purchases through their receipts on Gmail but said it doesn't use it for personalising ads. It added it does so to let users track their purchases, bookings and subscriptions from a single, privately accessible place. Google had announced it would stop using Gmail data to personalise ads in 2017.

headlines: Bezos' stepfather went to US from Cuba at 16 with 3 shirts, 3 pants
text: World's richest person Jeff Bezos has revealed his stepfather Miguel Bezos came to Miami from Cuba alone aged 16 with three shirts, three pants and three underwear. "Mike's parents were not allowed to enter the airport...He only spoke Spanish...His grit, determination, and optimism are inspiring," said Jeff as Mike was honoured at the opening of Statue of Liberty's new museum.

headlines: My security officer reports to BJP, they'll get me killed: Kejriwal
text: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has said during an interview that his personal security officer reports to the BJP adding that the party will get him killed one day. "I am the only Chief Minister who does not have control over his security," Kejriwal added. "What is my fault? What wrong did I commit?" he further said.

headlines: Gang stabs, robs engineer and gives a shirt before abandoning him
text: A gang of four men allegedly stabbed an engineer and robbed him of his gold ornaments, ATM card and wallet in Bengaluru. The men on two bikes reportedly took the victim to a secluded spot when he was looking for an auto-rickshaw near temple. The accused later took the blood-stained shirt of the victim and gave him another.

headlines: US lawmaker says rape can be consensual, apologises later
text: US Representative Barry Hovis said that rapes can be consensual during a debate on a bill to ban abortions after eight weeks, including in cases of rape and incest. "Sometimes you make a mistake and you own up to it," said Hovis who's a former police officer. However, he later apologised, saying "there is no such thing as consensual rape".

headlines: Boy lowered head-first into pipe to rescue girl stuck 13-feet under
text: A video showing a boy being lowered head-first into a water-filled pipe in Russia to rescue a girl stuck 13-feet under has surfaced online. The girl fell inside the pipe after she stepped on the pipe's cover while running across the lawn. A group of passers-by lowered the boy into the pipe by tying their belts around his feet.

headlines: HDFC digital banking head Nitin Chugh quits, joins Ujjivan as CEO
text: Ujjivan Small Finance Bank has appointed Nitin Chugh as the next Managing Director and CEO for three years starting December 1. Chugh, who has worked with HDFC Bank since April 2001, currently serves as its digital banking head. He will join Ujjivan as President in August and will work closely with current chief Samit Ghosh to ensure a "smooth transition".

headlines: Trade war may cause dumping of Chinese goods in India: India Ratings
text: The US-China trade war could lead to China dumping goods at predatory prices in India, India Ratings said. Products like electronic goods, iron, steel and organic chemicals would be most affected, it said. India may not benefit from the trade war as there's a "stark difference" in the nature of commodities exported by India and China to US, it added.

headlines: Votes shifted towards us due to KejriwalÂ’s bad record: Dikshit
text: Reacting to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's analysis of AAP's performance in Delhi, Congress' Sheila Dikshit said votes shifted towards Congress because of Kejriwal's bad record. "Nobody asked people to just vote for me. They vote for us because our record is such," Dikshit added. Earlier, Kejriwal claimed that 13% of Muslim votes got shifted to Congress at the last moment.

headlines: Chandrababu Naidu meets Rahul to discuss post-poll scenario
text: Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu met Congress President Rahul Gandhi at the latter's residence in Delhi on Saturday to reportedly discuss the roles their parties would play in government formation after the Lok Sabha election results are announced. Naidu will fly to Lucknow later in the day to meet SP chief Akhilesh Yadav and BSP supremo Mayawati.

headlines: Last episode of Mann ki Baat: Akhilesh takes jibe at PM's presser
text: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi not taking any questions in a 50-minute press meet at BJP headquarters, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav tweeted, "Seems like the last episode of 'Mann ki Baat' has been aired on TV instead of the radio." Akhilesh added, "Media persons did not get to ask their questions and the disciplined soldiers remained silent."

headlines: Djokovic saves 2 match points against Del Potro to reach semis
text: Serbia's Novak Djokovic saved two match points against Argentina's Juan Martin del Potro before going on to win the match and reach the semifinals at the ongoing Rome Masters on Saturday. The Serbian, who has won the Rome Masters four times in the past, will now face Argentina's Diego Schwartzman for a place in his second consecutive ATP Masters final.

headlines: Superfast computing invented using light pulses for magnets
text: An international team of researchers has developed "virtually energy-less" superfast computing using short light pulses, the duration of a millionth of a millionth of a second, instead of electricity for using magnets to store data. The new system, different than current systems which consume 2-5% of global electricity consumption, doesn't produce heat which would require more power to cool it.

headlines: No benefit in breaking up Facebook: COO Sheryl Sandberg
text: Facebook COO Sheryl Sandberg, responding to Co-founder Chris Hughes' call to break the firm up, said, "You could break us up...but you actually don't address the underlying issues people are concerned about." "People are concerned about election security, content, privacy and data portability," she said, adding, "The bottom line for us is making sure we get this right."

headlines: NRC should be implemented in Delhi soon: Manoj Tiwari
text: BJP MP Manoj Tiwari on Saturday said that National Register of Citizens (NRC) should be implemented in Delhi as soon as possible. He added that NRC would help throw out illegal immigrants and keep Delhi citizens safe. Tiwari said this after meeting the family of late Dhruv Raj Tyagi who, he said was murdered by the illegal immigrants.

headlines: BJP won't scrap Article 370 even if it rules for 100 yrs: Azad
text: Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad on Friday said that BJP won't remove Article 370 from Jammu and Kashmir even if it rules for 100 years at the Centre. He added that BJP didn't do it even when (former PM) Atal Bihari Vajpayee was in power. Azad further said that Congress aims to win over 273 seats in Lok Sabha elections.

headlines: Delivery startup DoorDash raising $500M at $13B valuation: Report
text: US-based food delivery startup DoorDash is raising at least $500 million in a new funding round that could likely value it at around $13 billion, Bloomberg reported. It last raised $400 million in a Series F funding round at a valuation of over $7 billion in February. Founded in 2013, DoorDash is backed by investors including SoftBank, Sequoia and Temasek.

headlines: N Korea asks UN to address seizure of its ship by 'gangster' US
text: North Korea has asked UN Secretary-General AntÃ³nio Guterres to deal with the seizure of one of its cargo ships by the US. "This act of dispossession indicate(s) the US is a gangster country that doesn't care about international laws," North Korea's ambassador to UN said. The US seized the ship, accusing it of illicit coal shipments in violation of sanctions.

headlines: Top EC officer opts out of meetings over clean chits to PM: Report
text: Election Commissioner Ashok Lavasa has reportedly recused himself from the meetings related to Model Code of Conduct due to his dissent on the clean chits given to PM Narendra Modi and BJP President Amit Shah. According to reports, Lavasa said he'll attend the meetings only after dissent notes are included in the commission's orders, stating "minority decisions are going unreported".

headlines: Difference of opinion not new: CEC amid row over clean chits to PM
text: Stating that difference of opinion in the poll panel isn't new, Chief Election Commissioner Sunil Arora said election commissioners aren't "expected to be clones of each other". This comes amid reports Election Commissioner Ashok Lavasa recused himself from meetings related to Code of Conduct due to his dissent on clean chits given to PM Narendra Modi and BJP's Amit Shah.

headlines: Kim Kardashian shares 1st pic of her 4th baby, names him Psalm West
text: Reality television personality Kim Kardashian took to Twitter to share a picture of a text conversation with her husband Kanye West which included a picture of their newborn son, whom they have named Psalm West. "Beautiful Mother's Day with the arrival of our fourth child. We're blessed beyond measure," Kanye's message read. They welcomed their son last week via surrogacy.

headlines: I wish GoT had more seasons: George RR Martin on final season
text: While speaking about the final season of the television adaptation of his 'Game of Thrones' book series, author George RR Martin said, "I'm a little sad...I wish we had a few more seasons." "The series [hasn't been] completely faithful. Otherwise, it would've...run another five seasons," he added. The finale episode of the series will release on Monday.

headlines: CBFC cuts Gita, Quran references in Arjun's 'India's Most Wanted'
text: The Censor Board asked the makers of the upcoming Arjun Kapoor starrer 'India's Most Wanted' to omit scenes in which Quran and Bhagwat Gita are mentioned. "[W]e respect all religions...That is why when the request came, we decided to remove it," the film's director Raj Kumar Gupta said. After the scenes were removed, the film was granted a U/A certificate.

headlines: EC issues notice to Sunny Deol for violating poll code
text: The Election Commission has issued a notice to BJP candidate Sunny Deol for violating the Model Code of Conduct. Deol reportedly held a public meeting in Punjab's Pathankot on Friday night during the silent period, when election campaigning is banned. The Commission also found that loudspeaker was used in the public meeting which was attended by around 200 people.

headlines: Malik smashes stumps with bat, gets out hit wicket after 16 years
text: All-rounder Shoaib Malik smashed the stumps with his bat while facing England pacer Mark Wood in Pakistan's 47th over in the fourth ODI on Friday, getting out hit-wicket for 41(26). This was the second time in his ODI career that the 37-year-old got out hit wicket, with the previous instance coming against Sri Lanka's Muttiah Muralitharan on May 18, 2003.

headlines: Family lives in toilet after Cyclone Fani destroys home in Odisha
text: A family in Odisha's Kendrapara have been staying in a toilet constructed under Swachh Bharat Mission after their house was destroyed in Cyclone Fani on May 3. The family, which includes a 59-year-old man, his wife and two teenaged daughters, said villagers didn't allow them to take shelter in their pucca houses. The man said Fani also damaged his crop.

headlines: Man reunites with family after 37 years with the help of FB post
text: A Facebook post by a man named Rayeez helped an elderly person reunite with his family in Kozhikode after 37 years. Vayalpidiyil Mohammad, who was living near the Karnataka-Maharashtra border, was last seen in Kozhikode's Madavoor in 1982. After seeing Rayeez's post, one of his Facebook friends sought help from a local leader to trace Mohammad's family.

headlines: 29-year-old wanted in 11 murder cases, 1 rape case held in Lucknow
text: Delhi Police have arrested a 29-year-old, who was wanted in 11 cases of murder, one rape case, an attempt to murder case and several cases of carjacking. Vijay Farmana was held in Lucknow. Out of the 11 murders in which Farmana was allegedly involved, three were triple murders committed in Haryana, while the rape was reported from Delhi's Begampur.

headlines: 3-legged dog finds baby buried alive by 15-year-old mother
text: A disabled dog named Ping Pong found a baby boy who had been buried alive by his 15-year-old mother in Thailand. The canine's sniffing and digging attracted the attention of farmers to the spot in Ban Nong Kham village where the baby was buried. According to Ping Pong's owner, the dog's digging exposed the child's legs.

headlines: Diana Penty makes her debut at the 2019 Cannes Film Festival
text: Actress Diana Penty made her debut appearance at the 72nd Cannes Film Festival on Friday. The actress was seen at a party organised by luxury jewellery brand Chopard in a gold fringed dress and matching thigh-high boots by fashion designer Celia Kritharioti. Priyanka Chopra and her husband Nick Jonas as well as Kangana Ranaut were also seen at the event.

headlines: Whatever happened in my life has brought me where I am: Salman
text: When asked whether he would want to erase or repeat any phase of his life, actor Salman Khan said, "It is a difficult question for me." "Whatever has happened in my life has brought me here," the actor added. Salman further said that the various "chapters" of his life have shaped him as a person.

headlines: Open to alliance with anti-BJP parties, including TRS: Naidu
text: Telugu Desam Party chief Chandrababu Naidu on Friday said that his party is ready for an anti-BJP grand alliance with any party, including Telangana Rashtra Samithi. He added that he would be meeting various Opposition leaders to discuss a possible alliance post elections. Naidu met AAP convener Arvind Kejriwal and Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Friday for the same.

headlines: PM's defeat from Varanasi to be more historic than win: Mayawati
text: BSP chief Mayawati on Saturday said that PM Narendra Modi's defeat from Varanasi Lok Sabha seat will be more historic than his win. "Will Varanasi repeat what Raebareli did in 1977?" she asked, referring to then PM Indira Gandhi's defeat from Raebareli constituency. Earlier, Mayawati had claimed that PM Modi is bribing and threatening Varanasi voters to ensure his victory.

headlines: Don't know what Kejriwal's saying: Sheila on 'Muslim votes' remark
text: After Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal claimed "the complete Muslim vote got shifted to Congress" at the last minute during the Lok Sabha polls in the capital, Delhi Congress chief Sheila Dikshit responded, "Don't know what is he trying to say." Sheila added that everyone has a right to vote for whichever party he or she supports.

headlines: PM Modi should state clearly his stand on Godse: Priyanka
text: After PM Narendra Modi said he won't forgive BJP leader Sadhvi Pragya for insulting Mahatma Gandhi, Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi on Friday said that PM Modi should clear his stand on Nathuram Godse. "It's not enough to say that in your heart, you won't forgive them," she added. Priyanka further said that PM Modi should've taken action against Pragya.

headlines: Pragya is 100% RSS, a kind of terrorist only: Siddaramaiah
text: After BJP's Bhopal candidate Sadhvi Pragya called Mahatma Gandhi's assassin Nathuram Godse a "patriot", Congress leader and former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah on Saturday said, "Pragya is 100% RSS, a kind of terrorist only." "If people who murder such Mahatmas are called patriots then all terrorists can be called the same," he added. Pragya had later apologised for her statements.

headlines: 5 dead, 30 injured in accident on Lucknow-Agra Expressway
text: At least five people were killed and more than 30 people were injured in a bus accident on the Lucknow-Agra Expressway near Uttar Pradesh's Unnao district on Saturday. The incident occurred when the bus overturned after ramming into a truck trolley. The injured have been referred to a trauma centre in Lucknow for further treatment.

headlines: Daughters of labourer, carpenter top Haryana Class 10 Board exams
text: Daughters of a labourer and a carpenter have topped Haryana Class 10 Board exams with 497 marks out of 500. The labourer's daughter Isha Devi's teacher said she is a disciplined girl and always focused on study. "I owe it to my teachers and family members as they extended all support to me," the carpenter's daughter Sanju Rani said.

headlines: Pregnant woman, 3 kids killed over land dispute in Bihar
text: A 30-year-old pregnant woman and her three children were killed allegedly over a property dispute in Bihar's Araria district, police said on Friday. According to reports, some people entered the house when the woman's husband was out and killed the whole family by slitting their throats. A complaint has been registered against four people, police added.

headlines: Ex-CIA officer who sold defence info to China jailed for 20 years
text: An ex-CIA officer has been sentenced to 20 years in prison for spying for China. Kevin Mallory was convicted under the Espionage Act for selling classified US defence information to a Chinese intelligence agent for $25,000 during trips to Shanghai in 2017. "Your object is to gain information, my object is to be paid," Mallory wrote in a 2017 message.

headlines: LeviÂ’s celebrates 146 years of the original blue jean
text: In 1873, Levi's invented the blue jean. Paying homage to the 501 as the ultimate canvas of self-expression, Levi's is celebrating 501 Day on May 18. The event at Famous Studio in Mumbai will have special customization offerings, featuring art installations on equality and sustainability with a hip hop line up headlined by Bas, Oddisee and DJ Qbert.

headlines: I understand marriage rumours as my peers are now married: Arjun
text: Speaking about rumours of his wedding with actress Malaika Arora, Arjun Kapoor said, "Where my marriage is concerned, speculation is understandable because that's the nature of the business." "There seems to be this buzz that I should also just (get married) because some of my peers have," Arjun further said. Malaika and Arjun have reportedly been dating since 2016.

headlines: SC issues notice to director Kazmi over alleged rape of actress
text: The Supreme Court issued a notice to filmmaker Hyder Jamilhussain Kazmi, who recently got bail after spending six months in judicial custody for allegedly raping an actress. This comes after the actress approached the apex court seeking cancellation of bail. The actress claimed Kazmi first raped her in 2012, further, accusing his sister of filming the act to threaten her.

headlines: PM Modi flew 1.5 lakh km, attended 142 rallies for campaigning: Shah
text: During PM Narendra Modi's first press conference since taking office, BJP President Amit Shah said PM Modi flew 1.5 lakh km and addressed 142 rallies. He called it the "most extensive" campaign for a Lok Sabha election since Independence. "PM...held four roadshows and, according to conservative estimates, he directly addressed about 1.5 crore people in these rallies," Shah added.

headlines: TIME writer from Pak political family: PM on 'Divider in chief' cover
text: After TIME magazine ran a cover story on PM Narendra Modi, terming him 'India's Divider in chief', PM Modi said, "TIME magazine is foreign, the writer has...said he comes from a Pakistani political family." "That's enough for his credibility," he added. The article was written by Aatish Taseer, son of Indian journalist Tavleen Singh and late Pakistani politician Salmaan Taseer.

headlines: Pakistan will be unstoppable in WC if they find momentum: Miandad
text: Ex-Pakistan captain Javed Miandad has said Pakistan will be unstoppable in 2019 World Cup if they find early momentum. "No one gave us a chance to win 1992 World Cup but we were victorious then, and same happened at Champions Trophy in 2017," he added. "Pakistan, despite recent setbacks, is a good side with some excellent players," he further said.

headlines: I hope to learn Bumrah bhaiÂ’s yorkers: Navdeep Saini
text: RCB's 26-year-old fast bowler Navdeep Saini, who will travel with Team India to 2019 World Cup as a net bowler, has said that he wants to learn Jasprit Bumrah's yorkers. "Bhuvi bhai's swing, Bumrah bhaiÂ’s yorker and the way Shami bhai seams after pitching on the length is just amazing. I hope I'll learn these things...and become better," he added.

headlines: Dhoni will be back in yellow next year: CSK CEO Kasi Viswanathan
text: CSK CEO Kasi Viswanathan has said that he is confident that MS Dhoni will play for the Chennai-based IPL side next year. "In the last two years, there were talks that he is not batting well, but statistically, he has had two great years. He had a stellar last season, and this time he did even better," he added.

headlines: Kohli first cricketer to have 100 million followers on social media
text: Team India captain Virat Kohli has become the first ever cricketer to have 100 million followers on social media. The 30-year-old has 33.5 million followers on Instagram, 37 million on Facebook and 29.5 million on Twitter. Kohli is the third Indian after Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Priyanka Chopra to have over 100 million followers on social media.

headlines: CRPF jawan shoots himself dead at Lalu Yadav-Rabri Devi's house
text: A 29-year-old CRPF constable, posted at the residence of Bihar's former CMs Lalu Prasad Yadav and Rabri Devi, allegedly committed suicide by shooting himself in the neck on Friday. The jawan's body will be sent to his native place in Karnataka after post-mortem, police said. Reportedly, his colleagues said family issues, work pressure and leave problems could be the reason.

headlines: Will review all Tesla expenses to cut costs: CEO Musk to staff
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said he will personally review all of the electric carmaker's expenses in a new cost-cutting plan, Reuters has reported. "Going forward, all expenses of any kind anywhere in the [world], including parts, salary, travel expenses, rent, literally every payment that leaves our bank account must [be] reviewed," Musk wrote in the email to employees.

headlines: Doctors repair baby's spine in womb; 1st keyhole surgery in UK
text: In a UK first, doctors have used keyhole surgery to successfully repair the spine of a baby with spina bifida while it was still inside the womb. Sherrie Sharp and her son Jaxson had the operation 27 weeks into the pregnancy. The routine 20-week pregnancy scans showed the baby's spine and spinal cord were not forming correctly.

headlines: I would love to be on Bigg Boss: Viral Lucknow poll officer Reena
text: PWD officer Reena Dwivedi, who went viral after being photographed at a Lucknow polling station with an EVM, said she'd love to be on Bigg Boss' Season 13 if she gets a chance. "My family is supportive and happy that I'm getting recognition," Reena said. She said she loves dressing up and there's no harm in being well turned out.

headlines: Sex cult head, held in 2018, had meetings with naked women: Witness
text: The founder of an alleged US sex cult, who was arrested last year, held meetings in which female "slaves" gathered naked around him while he lectured them on philosophy, one of the women testified at his trial. When 58-year-old Keith Raniere was unable to attend the meetings in person, the women would take naked photos and text it to him.

headlines: Aramco to supply extra 2 mn barrels a month to Indian Oil from July
text: Saudi Aramco will supply Indian Oil an extra 2 million barrels of crude every month during July-December (1.6 million tonnes in total). Indian Oil has a term deal to buy 5.6 million tonnes from Aramco in 2019-20 and an option to buy additional 2 million tonnes. India is looking to make up for loss of Iranian oil after US sanctions.

headlines: Shatrughan must respect Cong like Rahul respects him: Cong leader
text: Accusing Congress' Shatrughan Sinha of not following "party dharm", Congress' Lucknow candidate Acharya Pramod Krishnam has said, "It's the large-heartedness of Rahul Gandhi that he gave respect to Shatrughan Sinha but Shatrughan should also give respect to the party." Acharya has previously criticised Shatrughan for campaigning for his wife Poonam, who is the SP's Lucknow candidate.

headlines: NYAY scheme will re-monetise what PM Modi demonetised: Rahul
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Friday said that NYAY scheme (Nyuntam Aay Yojana) is "going to re-monetise what Prime Minister Narendra Modi demonetised". "PM Modi sucked the money out of the economy (through)...demonetisation, Gabbar Singh Tax," he added. "The most anti-national thing you can do is destroy the economy and PM Modi has done it," Gandhi further said.

headlines: Chandrababu Naidu meets Kejriwal, Sisodia in Delhi
text: Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu met Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia and senior AAP leader Sanjay Singh at Kejriwal's residence in Delhi on Friday. The AAP termed it a "courtesy visit". According to reports, the leaders discussed the roles their parties would play in government formation after the Lok Sabha results are declared.

headlines: HP spinoff to buy supercomputer maker Cray for $1.3 billion
text: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) has agreed to buy supercomputer manufacturer Cray for about $1.30 billion. HPE said Cray investors will get $35 a share in cash, a premium of over 17% to Cray's Thursday closing price of $29.81. It added it expects to incur one-time integration costs that will be absorbed within its fiscal year 2020 free cash flow outlook.

headlines: 'Modi lahar' has turned into 'Modi qahar': Shatrughan Sinha
text: Talking about PM Narendra Modi, Congress leader Shatrughan Sinha on Friday said that "Modi lahar (wave)" in India has turned into "Modi qahar (havoc)". Sinha further said that he didn't speak against PM Modi but against his policies. Sinha, who quit BJP in April, added that he spoke against policies of NDA government even when he was part of BJP.

headlines: Nestle in talks to sell skin health unit for $10 billion
text: Nestle has entered exclusive talks to sell its skin health business for $10.1 billion to a consortium led by EQT Partners, a unit of the Abu Dhabi Investment Authority and PSP Investments. The move comes as the food group shifts its portfolio in response to changing consumer demands. Nestle put the skin health unit up for sale last September.

headlines: 20-yr-old woman gives birth to baby, did not know she was pregnant
text: A 20-year-old woman in Scotland gave birth to a healthy baby girl despite not knowing that she was pregnant. Stacey Porter delivered her daughter on her bathroom floor without any assistance or pain relief, while her partner David was sleeping downstairs. Stacey revealed that she had gone to the toilet with stomach cramps not knowing she would give birth.

headlines: Filmfare Editor criticised for 'mocking' Hina's Cannes appearance
text: Filmfare Editor Jitesh Pillai has apologised to Hina Khan after being criticised for his "Cannes has suddenly become Chandivali studios kya" remark on the TV actress' Cannes appearance. Pillai said that his comments were "grossly misconstrued". Many TV fraternity members accused Jitesh for "looking down upon" Hina, with actress Divyanka Tripathi writing, "They can't imagine journey TV people go through".

headlines: Mumbai's Chitra Cinema shuts down after 70 yrs over poor business
text: Dadar's Chitra Cinema, one of Mumbai's first AC theatres, shut down after seven decades following its last screening of 'Student of the Year 2' on Thursday. "We used to get 10-15% business but spend a lot on maintenance. Thought people will come for last show but it didn't happen," third-generation owner Dara Mehta said on the 550-seater theatre.

headlines: Will decide on PM's post after poll results are out: Rahul Gandhi
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Friday said that a decision on the prime ministerial post of a non-BJP government at the Centre would be taken after the Lok Sabha election results are out on May 23. "I don't want to prejudge the judgment of Indian people. We will take the decision on the basis of what people decide," he added.

headlines: PM Modi shedding crocodile tears over Pragya's remark: Digvijaya
text: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh has accused PM Narendra Modi of shedding crocodile tears over Pragya Singh Thakur's statement that Nathuram Godse, who killed Mahatma Gandhi was a "patriot". "PM Modi's the one who had made Pragya the party's Lok Sabha candidate from Bhopal. The PM's crocodile tears won't work. He must take away her candidature and voting right," he added.

headlines: We used to jokingly call Dhoni a terrorist: Bihar teammate Satya
text: MS Dhoni's close friend and ex-Bihar teammate Satya Prakash has revealed they used to jokingly call the ex-India captain 'atankwadi' (terrorist). "He used to hit 40-50 runs in 20 balls. But he became a saint when he played for India and changed his approach. He's a good learner," he added. "We friends never really gauged his potential," he further said.

headlines: WhatsApp may no longer allow downloading profile pics of users
text: WhatsApp has removed the possibility to save profile pictures of individuals in latest Android beta updates and WhatsApp Business beta for iOS, WABetaInfo reported. The beta version does not show the profile sharing button, among other sharing options such as Facebook, Instagram, and other apps. However, the feature reportedly does not block users from taking screenshots of the profile picture.

headlines: JNU student commits suicide, had emailed suicide note to professor
text: A JNU student on Friday committed suicide by hanging himself from a ceiling fan in a study room at the university, police said. Rishi Joshua, a second year MA student, emailed a suicide note to his English professor before hanging himself, they added. The deceased was undergoing some treatment, as per preliminary enquiry, police further said.

headlines: Congress leader Reshma Padeknur found dead near river in K'taka
text: Karnataka Congress leader Reshma Padeknur was found dead near the Krishna river in Vijayapura on Friday. Padeknur was last seen with All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM) party leader Toufik in his car on Thursday. Police said that Padeknur's husband has blamed Toufik, alleging that they had a property dispute.

headlines: 2.7L stateless Rohingya get ID cards, 1st documentation for many
text: Over 2.7 lakh Rohingya refugees in Bangladesh have been registered by the United Nations, several getting identity cards as their first-ever proof of documentation. The Rohingya Muslims living in Myanmar have not been able to acquire formal citizenship, leaving them stateless and deprived of basic rights. The cards are aimed at improving the accuracy of data on refugees in Bangladesh.

headlines: 23-year-old Sikh denied entry into US restaurant for wearing turban
text: A 23-year-old Sikh man was denied entry into a restaurant in US' Port Jefferson for wearing a turban. "Throughout my life, I've faced verbal abuse and bullying about appearance...However, my basic freedoms of entering public accommodations were never infringed upon," Gurvinder Grewal said. The restaurant apologised, saying it doesn't allow headwear on weekends "to more capably identify people".

headlines: BJP, TMC like 2 choices of poison for Bengal: CPI(M) leader
text: CPI(M) leader Brinda Karat on Friday said BJP and TMC are like offering West Bengal voters two choices of poison. "You can't think you can taste this poison or that," she added. Karat, while talking about recent clashes in Kolkata, said, "EC must release the unedited official footage of the procession and subsequent events. All citizens must know the truth."

headlines: Don't address media during silence period: EC to politicians
text: The Election Commission has asked star campaigners and other political leaders to refrain from addressing the media during the silence period. The silence period begins 48 hours prior to voting day and comes to a conclusion after the end of polling. Notably, the campaigning for the final phase of Lok Sabha elections, scheduled for May 19, ended today.

headlines: EC manipulating poll diaries in South Delhi, alleges AAP
text: Aam Aadmi Party has alleged that Election Commission got polling diaries manipulated by presiding officers in South Delhi constituency. "These diaries contain sensitive information and we want to know why Election Commission asked presiding officers to modify the information," AAP's Saurabh Bharadwaj said. South Delhi returning officer denied any such happening and said it's a "misinformation".

headlines: Indira credited for 1971 war, why not PM for Balakot: BJP leader
text: BJP's Jitendra Singh on Friday said that if former PM Indira Gandhi is credited for 1971 war's victory, "why shouldn't PM Narendra Modi be credited for Balakot airstrike". "On what basis can Congress and allies dissuade common masses from crediting PM Modi," he added. Singh alleged that by defaming PM, Congress is "indirectly or directly echoing the interests of Islamabad".

headlines: Maria Sharapova withdraws from French Open 2019
text: Russian tennis player Maria Sharapova has withdrawn from the French Open 2019 as she is recovering from a shoulder injury. The two-time French Open champion has not played since January and has undergone surgery. "I have returned to the practice court, and slowly building the strength back in my shoulder. I'll really miss you Paris, until next year," wrote Sharapova.

headlines: World no. 1 Osaka withdraws from Italian Open due to injury
text: World number one Naomi Osaka pulled out of the ongoing Italian Open ahead of her quarterfinal stage clash with world number four Kiki Bertens. Osaka told reporters in Rome that she felt no pain in her right hand during the week, but woke up on Friday with pain and swelling at the base of her right thumb.

headlines: Intel CPU flaw fix may reduce Mac performance by 40%: Apple
text: Apple has said tests of its 'full mitigation' option to fix a recently disclosed vulnerability, existing in nearly all Intel CPUs made since 2011, reduced the performance of its Mac computers by up to 40%. Apple also added several pre-2011 Macs could stay vulnerable to future security exploits as Intel is not likely to issue updates for those chips.

headlines: RIL to disrupt e-comm, Paytm Mall's model unsustainable: Forrester
text: E-commerce platforms like Paytm Mall, Snapdeal and ShopClues will face difficulty in raising funds to subsidise discounts, market research firm Forrester claimed. It said Paytm Mall's business model is no longer sustainable, adding it will find it difficult to survive in the long term even if it raises funds now. Reliance Industries' entry will disrupt Indian e-commerce, it further said.

headlines: Can't share black money details given by Switzerland: Govt
text: In its reply to an RTI query, the Finance Ministry declined to share information on black money cases received from Switzerland. "The information shared by Switzerland...is governed by confidentiality provisions," the Ministry said in its reply. They added that India and Switzerland share information on black money on a case to case basis as per the investigations being carried out.

headlines: Strong govt can hold elections, IPL together: PM Modi in 1st presser
text: PM Narendra Modi today addressed his first-ever press conference since taking office in 2014. "In last two elections, even IPL couldn't be held. When government is strong, IPL, Ramzan, school exams and others take place peacefully," he said. PM Modi was accompanied by BJP national president Amit Shah in the press conference that took place at BJP headquarters in Delhi.

headlines: 'Grumpy Cat', whose facial expression inspired memes, dies aged 7
text: 'Grumpy Cat', the feline whose facial expression inspired memes on social media, has died aged seven, her owners announced on Friday. "Grumpy encountered complications from a recent urinary tract infection that unfortunately became too tough for her to overcome," a statement read. According to her owners, her facial expression was caused by feline dwarfism and an underbite.

headlines: Excellent: Rahul on PM not taking any questions in 1st press meet
text: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi not taking any questions in a 50-minute press meet at BJP headquarters, Congress President Rahul Gandhi tweeted, "Congratulations Modi Ji...Excellent Press Conference!" "Showing up's half the battle. Next time [Amit] Shah may even allow you to answer a couple of questions. Well done!" he added. The press conference was PM Modi's first since taking office.

headlines: Imaging black hole like listening to a broken piano: MIT scientist
text: MIT computer scientist Katie Bouman, who helped design algorithm to piece together data from eight telescopes to image the black hole has said the process was like listening to a piano with missing keys. She added that just as human brain can understand a song with missing notes, the algorithm filled in missing pieces of information to make the image.

headlines: Air Force Chief flies MiG-21, says it is a formidable war machine
text: Indian Air Force Chief BS Dhanoa on Friday flew the supersonic jet MiG-21 at Air Force Station in Tamil Nadu's Sulur. Post his solo sortie, he said, "MiG-21 is a formidable war machine." Dhanoa was on an official visit to the station, where he also interacted with various teams including Sarang, Flying Daggers and The Knights among others.

headlines: Any threat to Sri Lanka is a threat to us: India
text: Any threat to Sri Lanka is seen as a threat to India, High Commissioner of India to Sri Lanka Taranjit Singh Sandhu has said. "We will fight this jihadist ideology and jihadist terror together, shoulder to shoulder with you," he said assuring Sri Lanka of India's support in the aftermath of the Easter Sunday serial blasts which killed 257 people.

headlines: Some things must remain sacred or we become Taliban: Mahindra
text: Taking a veiled dig at BJP's Pragya Thakur over her "Nathuram Godse is a patriot" remark, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra tweeted that India has been the land of Mahatma Gandhi for 75 years and a beacon when the world lost its morality. "Some things must remain sacred. Or we become Taliban, destroying statues that sustain us," the billionaire said.

headlines: US govt asked Congress to reimburse Taliban for travel expenses
text: The US government had asked the Congress to reimburse the Taliban for the travel expenses incurred while attending peace talks, a congressional aide said. However, a Capitol Hill committee denied the request as it'd have amounted to support for terrorists. The Taliban and the US have been participating in the talks with an aim to end the war in Afghanistan.

headlines: Cross-party Brexit talks collapse as leaders fail to reach deal
text: The Brexit talks between the Labour and Conservative parties aimed at arriving at a compromise have collapsed without reaching a deal. Delay in Brexit had prompted talks between UK PM Theresa May and Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn to see if the parties could come to a Brexit agreement. The two parties have differed on issues including holding second Brexit referendum.

headlines: Boeing completes software update for grounded 737 MAX planes
text: Boeing on Thursday said it had completed a software update for its 737 MAX jets, which have been grounded worldwide since March after they were involved in two fatal crashes. The US planemaker said it has flown the 737 MAX with updated software for more than 360 hours on 207 flights. Boeing now awaits approval from US Federal Aviation Administration.

headlines: Etihad's nominee on Jet Airways board Robin Kamark resigns
text: Grounded carrier Jet Airways Friday said that Etihad's nominee director on the airline's board, Robin Kamark, has quit the company with immediate effect. After Kamark's exit, only Ashok Chawla and Sharad Sharma remain on Jet Airways board. Recently, four senior executives, including CEO Vinay Dube and Chief Financial Officer and Deputy CEO Amit Agarwal quit the carrier.

headlines: Not right to link religion with terror: Navjot Kaur Sidhu
text: While referring to actor-politician Kamal Haasan's "first Hindu terrorist" remark, Congress leader Navjot Kaur Sidhu on Friday said it's not right to link a particular religion with terrorism. "The whole world believes that main terror groups are linked to religion. This isn't right," she said. "It's not correct to link religion with terror because both are completely different," Kaur added.

headlines: PM Narendra Modi has become Ravana: SP leader
text: Samajwadi Party leader Ram Govind Chaudhary on Friday said PM Narendra Modi has become Ravana. "The way Ravana held all the Gods and Goddesses hostage, PM Modi has taken control over the CBI, ED and RBI," he said. Chaudhary further said, "Ram Mandir is a religious place for us, but for BJP it's a topic to shell out votes."

headlines: Really excited about my first World Cup: Yuzvendra Chahal
text: Speaking about the upcoming World Cup 2019, Indian spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said, "Really excited, it will be my first World Cup. Everyone wants to be part of the World Cup to play for the country." "Last year when we played in England, the wicket was slow so we have prepared accordingly," Chahal said about the team's preparation.

headlines: Federer withdraws from Rome Masters due to leg injury
text: Switzerland's Roger Federer has withdrawn from the ongoing Rome Masters after he suffered a leg injury at the tournament. Federer had reached the last-8 stage after beating Borna Coric and Joao Sousa. Federer, who had complained about the footing at the clay-court tournament, was set to play Greece's Stefanos Tsitsipas in the last-8 stage on Friday.

headlines: England will not walk off pitch for racist abuse: Coach Southgate
text: Speaking about English players reacting to racist abuse, England football team coach Gareth Southgate has said that after discussions with players and staff they have decided that they will not walk off the pitch on facing racist abuse from supporters. Southgate said that the players agreed that walking off would shift the focus to them rather than racism.

headlines: Former Apple retail chief & Burberry CEO joins Airbnb board
text: US-based home-renting platform Airbnb has appointed Angela Ahrendts, former Senior Vice President of Retail at Apple, as its third independent non-affiliated board member. Ahrendts joined Apple in 2014 after serving as CEO of the British fashion house Burberry for eight years. Notably, Ahrendts had been one of the highest-paid employees at Apple with total compensation of $26.5 million in 2018.

headlines: Tesla to pay $13mn to worker left disabled in car accident at work
text: Tesla has reached a $13-million settlement with former contract janitor Teodora Tapia, who was left permanently disabled after being struck by a Model S at a Tesla factory in August 2014. Joseph Aguilar, who was driving the Model S, was an employee of West Valley Staffing Group (WVSG), Tesla revealed. Earlier, Tesla had agreed it shared liability for Aguilar's conduct.

headlines: Former Infosys CEO Vishal Sikka joins BMW supervisory board
text: German luxury automaker BMW Group has appointed former Infosys CEO Vishal Sikka to its supervisory board. Sikka had quit as the MD and CEO of Infosys in 2017 in just three years after a clash with Founder NR Narayana Murthy over corporate governance issues. Sikka, an AI PhD alumnus from Stanford, was reportedly working on an AI startup after Infosys.

headlines: 29-mn-yr-old glass found in Egypt made by meteorite impact: Study
text: Australia-based researchers have discovered that 29-million-year-old green-yellowish 'Libyan Desert Glass' found in Egypt was made by a meteorite impact. This contradicts past beliefs that it was formed after an asteroid exploded in Earth's atmosphere. Presence of mineral called reidite, which forms only under high pressure, helped turn down the asteroid-explosion theory, researchers said.

headlines: BJP suspends leader for calling Mahatma Gandhi father of Pak
text: The BJP has suspended Anil Saumitra, Madhya Pradesh BJP convener and media relations in-charge, from primary membership of the party over his social media post calling Mahatma Gandhi 'father of Pakistan'. The party has asked him to reply within seven days. Saumitra had also said that crores of people were born in India like Gandhi.

headlines: Karan Oberoi's bail plea rejected in rape and extortion case
text: A Mumbai court rejected a bail plea filed by actor Karan Oberoi, who was arrested earlier this month for alleged rape and extortion. The actor was accused of raping a female astrologer on the pretext of marriage, and filming the act. Karan's lawyer claimed that the woman filed the case to seek revenge after the actor didn't reciprocate her feelings.

headlines: BJP, RSS not God-ke lovers, but God-se lovers, tweets Rahul Gandhi
text: After BJP's Pragya Thakur called Nathuram Godse a "patriot", Congress President Rahul Gandhi tweeted, "I finally got it. The BJP and the RSS...Are not God-Ke Lovers. They are God-Se Lovers." PM Narendra Modi on Friday said he will never forgive Sadhvi Pragya for insulting Bapu while BJP President Amit Shah promised action against three party leaders over remarks on Godse.

headlines: Re-polling in Delhi booth as officer forgot to delete test votes
text: The Election Commission has ordered re-poll at a polling booth in Delhi's Chandni Chowk parliamentary constituency on May 19. The poll body declared re-poll at polling station number 32 of Chandni Chowk segment after the presiding officer forgot to delete the test votes before the actual polling on May 12. The counting of votes will take place on May 23.

headlines: Every religion has its own terrorist: Kamal Haasan
text: Amid a controversy over his remarks on Nathuram Godse, actor-politician Kamal Haasan said, "Every religion has its own terrorist, we cannot claim that we are sanctimonious. History shows that all religions have their extremists." He added that he is not afraid of getting arrested. Earlier, he'd reportedly said, "Free India's first extremist was a Hindu, his name is Nathuram Godse."

headlines: PlayStation maker Sony partners with rival Xbox maker Microsoft
text: Technology giants and gaming rivals Sony and Microsoft have announced a partnership to build future cloud solutions supporting both gaming and content streaming alongside AI solutions. PlayStation maker Sony will use Xbox maker Microsoft's data centres and Azure cloud computing service for its existing game and streaming platforms. In return, Microsoft will gain access to Sony's image sensors.

headlines: Amazon removes products with images of Hindu Gods after criticism
text: A day after #BoycottAmazon was trending on Twitter, e-commerce major Amazon has taken down products like doormats, shoes, and toilet seat covers from its site which had images of Hindu Gods on them. "All sellers must follow our selling guidelines and those who do not will be subject to action including potential removal of their account," Amazon said.

headlines: Walmart Q1 income falls 38% over $16 bn Flipkart integration
text: Declaring 2019's first quarter earnings, Walmart said its international operating income dipped 38% in constant currency "largely due to dilution from Flipkart". "The decline was expected, partially offset by deconsolidation of Brazil," Walmart added. Walmart bought 77% stake in Flipkart for $16 billion last May and had lowered its profit forecast for the fiscal ending January 2019.

headlines: Businessman sponsors boy who spoke 10 languages in viral video
text: A businessman has sponsored the studies of a Cambodian boy who became an internet sensation last year, after a video showing him speaking at least 10 different languages went viral. In the video, Salik was seen speaking the languages while trying to sell souvenirs to a tourist in Cambodia. He is studying at the Hailiang Foreign Language School in China.

headlines: Harvard mag prints fake bikini pic of Holocaust victim; apologises
text: Harvard University magazine The Harvard Lampoon has apologised for publishing an image of Holocaust victim Anne Frank depicting her face on body of a bikini-clad woman. The image was accompanied by the headline, "Gone Before Her Time: Virtual Aging Technology Shows Us What Anne Frank Would Have Looked Like if She Hadn't Died." Frank died in 1945 at age 15.

headlines: US toddler lost in woods for 3 days found; rescuers heard his cries
text: A nearly two-year-old US toddler survived in the woods alone for around three days after he went missing last week. Rescuers found Kenneth, whose cries led them to him, on Wednesday nearly 1,800 feet from his house. The child, who has been admitted to a hospital, was dehydrated but in good condition, according to police officials.

headlines: Economist Thomas Piketty to study Kerala model, meets CM Vijayan
text: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan met French economist Thomas Piketty in Paris on Thursday during his 4-nation European tour. "The renowned economist has expressed a desire to conduct an in-depth study on Kerala's Growth Model," Kerala Chief Minister's Office tweeted. Lucas Chancel, who has conducted studies on income inequality in India, was also part of the discussions.

headlines: Making conscious effort to do socially relevant films: Kareena
text: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan has said that she is making a conscious effort to take up films that are socially relevant and deal with subjects that can "touch hearts". "Even if my part is smaller, I want to blend in films that are relevant," the actress added. Kareena further said her recent films covered important topics and broke boundaries.

headlines: I used to be scared to dance in front of people: Nora Fatehi
text: While revealing that she hasn't received formal dance training, actress Nora Fatehi said that she used to be scared to dance in front of people. "I come from a...conservative Arab family. I'd practice at home in my room and...watch videos of people I...admired," she added. "But now I have a whole nation that loves how I dance," Nora further said.

headlines: Russian man shooting for Telugu movie dies of heatstroke
text: A 38-year-old Russian man working as an extra in the upcoming Telugu movie 'Sye Raa Narasimha Reddy' died following a heatstroke in Hyderabad on Tuesday. The deceased, Alexander, was on a tourist visa and was playing a Britisher in the film. Although he was not carrying his passport, stills from the sets of the movie were found in his camera.

headlines: Women voters outnumber men at 3 out of 7 LS seats in Delhi
text: Women voters outnumbered male voters in East Delhi, New Delhi and South Delhi Lok Sabha constituencies of Delhi where polling was held on May 12. Across the seven Lok Sabha constituencies in Delhi, 60.8% male voters and 60.1% female voters cast their votes, an Election Commission official said. East Delhi recorded the maximum turnout of the third gender at 35.4%.

headlines: PM Modi bribing, threatening voters in Varanasi: Mayawati
text: BSP chief Mayawati on Friday alleged that PM Narendra Modi, with the help of "outsiders", is bribing and threatening Varanasi voters "in a bid to ensure that he wins from Varanasi". "How can free and fair elections be held in such an atmosphere?" she tweeted. "Like West Bengal, why is EC not focussing on Varanasi?" Mayawati added.

headlines: Unfair to make me go to Bathinda, know no one there: Navjot Kaur
text: Calling Amritsar her home seat, Congress' Navjot Kaur Sidhu said, "It's not fair to tell me to go Bathinda when I don't know anyone there." She claimed Punjab CM Amarinder Singh and Congress' Asha Kumari denied her the Amritsar ticket claiming the Dussehra train tragedy had hampered her image. However, Amarinder said she refused to contest from Amritsar or Bathinda.

headlines: Ab ki baar, 300 paar, phir ek baar Modi sarkar: PM Modi
text: Addressing his last election rally of the 2019 Lok Sabha elections, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, Â“From Kashmir to Kanyakumari, from Kutch to Kamrup, the whole nation is saying, 'Ab ki baar, 300 paar, phir ek baar Modi Sarkar.'Â” PM Modi told the audience, Â“After decades you will elect a majority government for the second time in a row.Â”

headlines: PM locked his cabinet ministers during demonetisation: Rahul
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Friday alleged, "PM Narendra Modi locked his cabinet ministers inside the 7 Racecourse Road residence during the time of demonetisation." He further targetted PM on his recent Balakot airstrike statement and said PM was living in his own dream world. "See how much knowledge PM has. He told IAF not to get nervous," Gandhi added.

headlines: Rampur officials want to kill my husband, son: Azam Khan's wife
text: Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan's wife Dr Tazeen Fatima has accused Rampur district officials of plotting against her and her family, and claimed, "They want to kill my husband and my son." Earlier, three Rampur officials wrote to the Superintendent of Police alleging recce of their offices and residences while refuting allegations of being involved in such a plot.

headlines: Naga People's Front to review alliance with BJP in Manipur
text: The Naga People's Front (NPF) will convene a meeting of its leaders on Saturday to decide if it would continue to stay in coalition with BJP in Manipur or withdraw support. NPF state chief Awangbou Newmai claimed that BJP "looks down" on its alliance partners. Denying the allegation, the BJP said it has extended all possible cooperation to its partners.

headlines: BJP tarnishing image of Mamata through demonic ways: Naidu
text: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu has said that BJP is tarnishing West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's image through their demonic ways. "They are trying to bring disrepute to the West Bengal government," he added. Naidu further said that the violence which took place in West Bengal during BJP President Amit Shah's rally was orchestrated by the BJP.

headlines: Won't forgive Pragya for insulting Bapu: PM on 'Godse patriot' remark
text: After BJP's Bhopal candidate Sadhvi Pragya called Mahatma Gandhi's assassin Nathuram Godse a "patriot", PM Narendra Modi said he'll never forgive her for insulting Bapu. Pragya had said, "People calling Godse a terrorist should instead look within, such people will be given befitting reply in these elections." She made the remark after Kamal Haasan called Godse 'Independent India's first terrorist'.

headlines: Deepika is doing roles I had wanted 15-20 years ago: Hema
text: Praising Deepika Padukone for her career in Bollywood, Hema Malini said, "[S]he's doing the roles that I'd have liked to do 15-20 years ago like Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Bajirao Mastani' and 'Padmaavat'." "She has a long and fruitful career ahead. Marriage...won't make any difference to [her career]," Hema added. The actress further said that Deepika is very "down to earth".

headlines: Godse killed 1, Kasab 72 and Rajiv Gandhi 17,000: BJP MP Kateel
text: BJP MP Nalinkumar Kateel on Thursday tweeted, "(Nathuram) Godse killed one, (terrorist involved in 26/11) Kasab killed 72, (former PM) Rajiv Gandhi killed 17,000. You judge who is more cruel in this?" The statement comes amid controversy over BJP leader Pragya Singh Thakur's 'Godse is a patriot' remark, following which she was asked to apologise by the party.

headlines: I miss you papa: Tej Pratap on not getting to speak at Rahul's rally
text: Jailed RJD supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav's son Tej Pratap on Friday tweeted 'I miss you papa' after he wasn't given a chance to speak at Congress President Rahul Gandhi's rally in Bihar on Thursday. "I was not given a chance to speak as my father wasn't there," Tej wrote, sharing a caricature of both of them walking together.

headlines: 3 BJP leaders to explain their Godse remarks within 10 days: Shah
text: BJP President Amit Shah has said that the party's disciplinary committee has sent a notice to three party leaders to explain their remarks on Nathuram Godse within 10 days. The notice is issued to Pragya Singh Thakur for her 'Godse is a patriot' remark, Nalinkumar Kateel for 'Godse killed 1, Rajiv Gandhi 17,000' statement and Anantkumar Hegde for his tweet.

headlines: Milk tops list of unsafe food items in Delhi: Report
text: Milk and milk products are more likely to be unsafe or substandard than other food products sold in Delhi, according to test reports of food samples analysed by the Delhi food safety department, Hindustan Times reported. Of the 2,880 food samples tested between January 2018 and April 2019, milk products accounted for 161 of the total 477 failed tests.

headlines: Wall decor falls inches away from passengers at Lucknow airport
text: The passengers and staff at Lucknow airport had a close shave after a portion of the wall decor at the airport fell on Friday morning. While no injuries have been reported, a passenger said he was just inches away when it fell off. The incident's photo shows a damaged luggage trolley with a part of the decoration on it.

headlines: US-based IT firm sues US govt for denying visa to Indian techie
text: A Silicon Valley-based IT company has filed a lawsuit against the US government for denying H-1B visa to an Indian engineer, terming the renunciation "arbitrary" and a "clear abuse of discretion". The techie currently holds a valid H-4 dependent status through his wife and has a Master's of Science degree from the University of Texas at Dallas.

headlines: After serving jail time, man held again for posing as NIA officer
text: The son of an ex-Army man was caught in Hyderabad for allegedly impersonating as a police official working with National Investigation Agency. The 25-year-old has earlier served jail time for posing as an IPS officer, an Indian Air Force officer and a NIA Commandant on different occasions. He had aspired to be an IPS officer but failed to clear exams.

headlines: US to replace green cards with 'Build America' visa system
text: US President Donald Trump has announced plans to replace green cards with a new 'Build America' visa system. Under the new merit system, permanent residency would be given based on points for age, skills, employment and civic sense, besides learning English and passing a Civics test. The system seeks to increase the quota for skilled workers from 12% to 57%.

headlines: Ajay Devgn, Tabu starrer 'De De Pyaar De' hits theatres
text: Ajay Devgn and Tabu starrer 'De De Pyaar De', which released today, is "a very beautiful looking film with very beautiful looking people," wrote Koimoi. "Tabu excels in this one too," Times of India (TOI) said. Bollywood Hungama called the film "entertaining and also quite progressive and mature." It was rated 3/5 (Koimoi), 3.5/5 (TOI) and 4/5 (Bollywood Hungama).

headlines: SRK's passion, drive and love for work remains same: Katrina
text: While speaking about working with Shah Rukh Khan in the 2018 film 'Zero', actress Katrina Kaif said, "His crazy passion...his drive and focus and love for his work...remains the same." "I know SRK much better now. I know him better as a person," the actress added. Katrina further said that Shah Rukh pushes his co-stars to perform better.

headlines: Better to have elected Amitabh as PM than PM Modi: Priyanka
text: Calling PM Narendra Modi the "greatest actor", Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi on Friday said that it would have been better to have elected actor Amitabh Bachchan as PM. "Eventually, none of them would have done anything for you," she added. Urging voters to vote responsibly, Priyanka further said that this election is a fight to save democracy.

headlines: 2 teams jointly win $10 million in Elon Musk-backed XPRIZE
text: Two teams have jointly won $10-million prize of Global Learning XPRIZE, which counts Elon Musk among supporters and benefactors. Kitkit School, from the US and South Korea and Onebillion from the UK and Kenya, both developed tablet apps to aid student learning. Bengaluru's Chimple was among five finalists in 2017, which received $1 million and tested their technology in Tanzania.

headlines: Like khaki shorts, Godse an identity of RSS: Azam Khan
text: Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan on Thursday said that Mahatma Gandhi's assassin Nathuram Godse is the identity of RSS the same way "khaki nikkar (shorts)" is. He added that people will decide if they want the nation to be an identity of "humanity or khaki nikkar". This comes after BJP's Sadhvi Pragya Thakur said that Godse was a patriot.

headlines: Starbucks China rival Luckin Coffee raises $561 mn in US IPO
text: China-based coffee chain Luckin Coffee has raised about $561 million after setting its US IPO price at $17 apiece, gaining a valuation of nearly $4 billion. It added it may raise up to around $650 million if underwriters purchase additional 'greenshoe' shares after the listing. Luckin previously said it aims to displace Starbucks as China's largest coffee chain this year.

headlines: Amazon leads $575 mn investment in UK food delivery startup
text: US e-commerce giant Amazon has led a $575 million investment in UK-based food delivery startup Deliveroo. Existing investors including T Rowe Price, Fidelity Management and Greenoaks also participated in the Series G funding round. Founded in 2013, Deliveroo was last valued at over $2 billion in its last funding round in 2017 and has raised over $1.5 billion till date.

headlines: Stopped Googling myself after seeing pics of my bare back: Aditi
text: Actress Aditi Rao Hydari, during her appearance on 'Feet Up with the Stars' season 2, revealed she stopped Googling herself after coming across "not so pleasant" pictures of her bare back all over the internet. She explained the pictures were from her first film 'Yeh Saali Zindagi'. "After that, I consciously decided to never Google myself again," said Aditi.

headlines: 19-year-old pregnant woman killed, baby cut out of her womb in US
text: Police in Chicago have charged three people in connection with the murder of a pregnant teenager whose unborn baby was cut out of her womb after her death. Police said 19-year-old Marlen Ochoa-Lopez was lured to the home of someone she knew in April with the promise of free baby supplies. Ochoa-Lopez's body was found in garbage earlier this week.

headlines: I was 1st choice to star with Deepika in Chhapaak: Rajkummar
text: Rajkummar Rao revealed that he was originally approached to star opposite Deepika Padukone in 'Chhapaak', the upcoming biopic based on acid attack survivor Laxmi Agarwal. "I loved that script but my dates were...messed up...I kept telling [director Meghna Gulzar] and Deepika that it's my loss," the actor explained. Actor Vikrant Massey will be seen opposite Deepika in the forthcoming film.

headlines: Nana's team is behind rumour that he got clean chit: Tanushree
text: Tanushree Dutta denied reports that suggested Nana Patekar was given a clean chit by Mumbai Police in the sexual harassment case filed by her against the actor. "[Nana's]...public relations team is responsible for spreading this false rumour...this is their attempt at...fixing public image," Tanushree said. Earlier reports said police could not get statements of witnesses supporting her allegations against Nana.

headlines: Will resign if Congress gets wiped out in Punjab: CM Amarinder
text: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh on Thursday said he will "take responsibility and quit if Congress is wiped out in the state in these Lok Sabha elections." Amarinder added, "The party high command had decided to hold the ministers and legislators accountable for the victory/defeat of Congress candidates. I am ready to take the same responsibility for the state."

headlines: In an attempt to save a cow, car in RSS chief's convoy overturns
text: A vehicle that was part of RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's convoy overturned in an attempt to save a cow standing in the middle of the road in Maharashtra's Chandrapur. "The driver tried to avoid the cow and braked hard, which resulted in a tyre burst and the vehicle toppling over," police said. A CISF personnel was injured in the accident.

headlines: Assam actress held in blast case, 20kg explosive found in her house
text: Assamese TV actress Jahnabi Saikia and a leader from the pro-talks faction of United Liberation Front of Assam (ULFA) have been arrested in connection with grenade blast outside a Guwahati mall on Wednesday. Police said the duo was arrested from the 40-year-old actress' rented accommodation, where they also recovered live cartridges, ULFA pads, bomb-making machines and 20 kg gun powder.

headlines: Doctor arrested over derogatory post on BJP's Sadhvi Pragya
text: Mumbai Police has arrested a 38-year-old homoeopathic doctor for allegedly posting derogatory remarks against BJP's Bhopal candidate and Malegaon blast accused Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur on a social media platform. The post also talked about the involvement of Hindus and Brahmins in terrorism. An activist had lodged a complaint against the doctor over his remarks.

headlines: Indian admits stalking woman in UK for 18 months, gets 29-month jail
text: A 28-year-old Indian citizen has been jailed for 29 months after he pleaded guilty of stalking a woman over a period of 18 months in UK. The convict, Rohit Sharma, met the woman in 2017 when she served in a shop in London and asked her to marry him the same day. Sharma used to call her 40 times daily.

headlines: 25-yr-old doctor from Andhra drowns while taking selfie at Goa beach
text: Utukuru Ramya Krishna, a 25-year-old doctor from Andhra Pradesh, lost her life after drowning at the Colomb beach in Goa. Ramya was standing on a rock with her friend while trying to take a selfie when the waves pulled them into the sea. While the locals managed to rescue her friend, they couldn't find Ramya right away.

headlines: SC withdraws ex-Kolkata Police chief's protection from CBI arrest
text: The Supreme Court on Friday vacated interim protection given to former Kolkata Police Commissioner Rajeev Kumar from arrest by CBI over his alleged role in destroying evidence in Saradha chit fund case. The SC has given seven days to Kumar to seek legal remedies. West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee had staged a dharna after CBI raided Kumar's residence in February.

headlines: Taiwan becomes 1st Asian country to legalise same-sex marriage
text: Taiwan has become the first Asian country to legalise same-sex marriage following a vote on Friday. In 2017, the island's constitutional court ruled that same-sex couples had the right to legally marry. Taiwan's parliament was given a two-year deadline and was required to pass the changes by May 24.

headlines: Shameful that harassment cases are often seen in Air India: CMD
text: Air India CMD Ashwani Lohani has strictly warned employees that sexual harassment in the airline won't be tolerated. "It's shameful that sexual harassment cases are being often witnessed in Air India. We need to come down very very heavily on such offenders," Lohani said. His warning comes after a female Air India pilot recently said a commander sexually harassed her.

headlines: SRK's love is so genuine: Neetu Kapoor on pic with SRK, Rishi
text: Neetu Kapoor took to Instagram to share a picture of herself and her husband Rishi Kapoor with Shah Rukh Khan, who visited the couple in New York. "To make people feel good about themselves is a rare quality!!! Shahrukh is all of that his love...is...so genuine," she captioned the picture. Rishi is currently undergoing treatment for cancer in New York.

headlines: Deepika, Priyanka, Kangana attend Cannes Film Festival 2019
text: Deepika Padukone, Priyanka Chopra and Kangana Ranaut were seen attending the 2019 Cannes Film Festival on Thursday. While Deepika wore an ivory Peter Dundas gown with a high slit and bow, Kangana was seen in a Falguni and Shane Peacock corset under a gold saree. Priyanka made her debut appearance at Cannes in a glittering black gown by Roberto Cavalli.

headlines: Instead of real issues, PM talks on how to eat mango: Rahul
text: Addressing a rally in Bihar, Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said that PM Narendra Modi avoids speaking on real issues but talks with pride about how he eats mangoes. He further asked why PM Modi has made the state the centre of unemployment. "PM Modi has failed in all things but tops in speaking lies," Rahul added.

headlines: PM promised to turn Varanasi into Kyoto but failed: Akhilesh
text: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Thursday attacked PM Narendra Modi for not fulfilling his promise of transforming Varanasi into a smart city like Japan's Kyoto. "If Varanasi has not been made into Kyoto, then the PM has to be changed," he said. Akhilesh further said that BJP failed to clean river Ganga as their intentions were not clean.

headlines: Sidhu's wife Navjot Kaur refused ticket for Amritsar: Punjab CM
