text: After Congress' Navjot Singh Sidhu's wife Navjot Kaur claimed she was denied a ticket by Punjab CM Amarinder Singh and Punjab Congress in-charge Asha Kumari, Amarinder responded, "She had been offered ticket from Amritsar and Bathinda but she refused the same." Amarinder added that Congress' high command in Delhi didn't accept her application for a ticket to contest from Chandigarh.

headlines: EC orders re-polling at 4 booths in Kerala on May 19
text: The Election Commission on Thursday ordered re-polling at four booths in north Kerala's Kannur and Kasargod constituencies following complaints of bogus voting during Lok Sabha polls on April 23. The four polling booths will go for re-polling on May 19. The Election Commission has allowed parties to campaign in the booth areas till Friday.

headlines: Does only PM have right to hold public meetings? Mamata
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday asked if PM Narendra Modi is the only one who has the right to hold public rallies and no one else. "Why they (Election Commission) stopped the meeting for us?" Mamata added. This comes after the poll panel cut short the campaign period in the state by a day.

headlines: Mamata has no affection, should change her name: BJP leader
text: BJP National Vice President Shyam Jaju on Thursday said that West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee should change her name as "she lacks affection". "Her behaviour and method of politics don't match her name," he added. Jaju further said that Mamata has lost her mental balance as she is worried about her party Trinamool Congress' defeat.

headlines: Don't mind dating older man if we complement each other: Rakul Preet
text: On being asked about her opinion on dating an older man, actress Rakul Preet Singh said what matters is how two people complement each other. "It's not about the age but it's about the person. If I'm attracted to an older person who has the same wavelength as I do then I don't have a problem with that," she added.

headlines: British people get drunk more times than anyone else: Survey
text: British people get drunk more times than any other nationality, the 2019 Global Drug Survey revealed. Respondents from the UK said they got drunk 51.1 times on an average in a 12-month period. The UK is second behind Australia in how many people sought emergency treatment following alcohol use in the period, revealed the survey which covered over 36 countries.

headlines: You boast of 56-inch chest but where's your heart: Priyanka to PM
text: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, while addressing a rally in Uttar Pradesh on Thursday, asked PM Narendra Modi, "You boasted about your 56-inch chest, but where is your heart?" She added, "PM talks about Pakistan while speaking on nationalism. Employment and farmer issues are not nationalism to him." Priyanka called PM arrogant and accused him of focussing on marketing.

headlines: Kyrgios kicks bottle, throws chair in outburst at Italian Open
text: World number 36 Nick Kyrgios forfeited his second-round match at Italian Open after walking off court against Norway's Casper Ruud. Kyrgios was serving at 1-1 in third set when the referee gave a point against him for unsportsmanlike conduct for swearing. He responded by smashing his racquet, arguing with line judge, kicking water bottle and throwing chair on the court.

headlines: Rahul must be in India XI at WC, could be no. 4 option: Vengsarkar
text: Ex-India captain and ex-chief selector Dilip Vengsarkar has said KL Rahul should be in India's playing XI at World Cup. "I feel that KL Rahul could be an option at No 4. He has the technique and can complement the top three well," he added. "Also in a long tournament, if required he can open the innings," he further said.

headlines: Did we win Ranji and Irani Cup: Vidarbha captain on India A snub
text: Faiz Fazal, who led Vidarbha to back-to-back Ranji and Irani Cup titles, took to Twitter to express his disappointment over his non-selection in the India A squads. "Did we win Ranji Trophy and Irani Cup back to back?" he wrote. Earlier, Kerala all-rounder Jalaj Saxena also expressed his displeasure for not making the cut in the India A team.

headlines: Sir Andy Murray receives knighthood at Buckingham Palace
text: Three-time Grand Slam champion Sir Andy Murray today received his knighthood at Buckingham Palace, more than two years after he was awarded the honour. The 32-year-old said that he would have liked to bring his children to the ceremony, but felt that his daughters were too young. Murray received his knighthood from Prince Charles.

headlines: CoA member should have presented IPL 2019 trophy: Diana Edulji
text: Diana Edulji has said one of the CoA members should've presented IPL 2019 trophy to Mumbai Indians instead of BCCI acting president CK Khanna. She added Khanna had "disregarded the protocol" by not presenting the award during the ODI against Australia in Delhi. Edulji alleged that "few people in BCCI worked behind the scenes" to stop her from presenting.

headlines: England clear favourites to win Ashes 2019: Michael Vaughan
text: Former England captain Michael Vaughan has said that England are "clear favourites" to win the upcoming Ashes because of ECB's decision to revert to older Dukes ball. "I think the fact that they have the ball sorted will give England captain Joe Root confidence, but they will also know that this Australian team is very, very dangerous," he added.

headlines: Architect behind Paris' Louvre pyramid dies aged 102
text: IM Pei, the architect behind buildings including the glass pyramid outside the Louvre in Paris, has died aged 102. Pei was born in Guangzhou, China and moved to the US at the age of 17 to study architecture at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and Harvard University. His other work includes Dallas City Hall and Japan's Miho Museum.

headlines: It's disturbing: Andhra CM on EC's WB campaigning decision
text: Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu on Wednesday termed Election Commission's action on campaigning in West Bengal as "disturbing". "Integrity of EC and...democratic process of elections is at stake," he tweeted. "It's high time EC acts on complaints made by the opposition parties to restore its credibility and fulfill its constitutional mandate of conducting free and fair elections," he added.

headlines: Ganga Maa will punish BJP for not keeping promises: Mayawati
text: BSP supremo Mayawati criticised the BJP for not keeping its poll promises and said that "Ganga Maa" will "punish" and "throw" the party out of power. She added, "Ganga Maa helped you (BJP) by ensuring your victory in 2014, but you didn't take benefit of her blessing." She said the BJP only cared about "rich businessmen" and not the poor.

headlines: Scary Opp'n scenario will lead to its rout in LS polls: Jaitley
text: Union Minister Arun Jaitley has said that the "frightening and scary" scenario about a leader or programme that the Opposition promises will be responsible for its "rout" in the Lok Sabha elections. He added there's a "complete absence of any confusion" about leadership in the NDA. Jaitley said the electorate wonders if the Opposition can ever provide a "cogent alternative".

headlines: IPL and WC different, won't affect my performance: Kuldeep
text: India spinner Kuldeep Yadav, who took four wickets in nine IPL 2019 matches, said IPL is very different from World Cup and his IPL performance won't affect his performance in the World Cup. Kuldeep added that there are players who perform well in IPL but struggle at the international level. "I've matured as a bowler", the chinaman bowler further stated.

headlines: People's love for me grows with increase in rivals' abuses: PM
text: PM Narendra Modi has said that the love of people grows for him with the increase in "rivals' abuses" for him. Addressing a rally, he added that all the "mahamilawatis", including SP and BSP, are in low spirits seeing their impending defeat in the general elections. He said the Opposition has only put a "model of lies" before the country.

headlines: WhatsApp warns clones to stop bulk text services in India
text: WhatsApp has warned Indian firms which claimed they can help send bulk messages to stop operations. Reuters had reported apps like 'GBWhatsApp' and 'JTWhatsApp' were being used to bypass WhatsApp forwarding restrictions amid ongoing Lok Sabha elections. "We ban approximately two million accounts and sent cease and desist letters to companies claiming to offer such services," said WhatsApp.

headlines: Apple to not debut its own 5G chip before 2025: Reports
text: Apple's plans to introduce its own 5G chips could take up to six years, as per reports. Apple has reportedly said, in interviews with prospective hires for the team developing the chips, that it expects the 5G chips to be developed by 2025. Apple recently ended the two-year-long patent dispute with Qualcomm, gaining access to the chipmaking giant's chips.

headlines: US student finds new rhino species from 5-mn-year-old fossils
text: A study led by Texas A&M University doctoral candidate Rachel Short has identified a new ancient species of rhinoceros from 5-million-year-old fossilised remains found in USA's Tennessee. Represented by two nearly complete skeletons and others' partial remains, the species had longer front legs and lacked nasal horn. "Habitat is most likely a major factor in the unique features," Short said.

headlines: Bedbugs evolved 100 mn years ago during dinosaur era: Study
text: A study by international scientists has revealed bedbugs evolved over 100 million years ago, walking the Earth at the same time as dinosaurs like Tyrannosaurus rex. The study is based on bedbugs collected from wild sites and museums around the world over a 15-year period. "It shows evolutionary history of bedbugs is far complex than previously thought," researchers said.

headlines: Osmania University to hold convocation after 6 years in June
text: Osmania University in Hyderabad will hold its convocation ceremony on June 17, after a six years hiatus. The last convocation was held in February 2013 amidst the Telangana statehood agitations. Candidates, who passed examinations between July 2012 to June 2018 and the ones who obtained their PhD degrees up to June 11, 2019, are eligible to apply for the convocation.

headlines: 5 banks fined $1.2 billion by EU for currency rigging
text: The European Union has imposed a combined fine of $1.2 billion on Barclays, Citigroup, JP Morgan, MUFG and Royal Bank of Scotland over foreign exchange rigging. Individual traders at the banks had allegedly formed two cartels to manipulate the spot foreign exchange market for 11 currencies. They exchanged sensitive information including client orders and their open risk positions.

headlines: Microsoft unveils world's first whisky developed with AI
text: Microsoft has unveiled world's first whisky developed with artificial intelligence (AI). The software giant worked with Finnish technology firm Fourkind and Sweden-based distillery Mackmyra. "With [Mackmyra's] dataset, the AI can generate over 70 million recipes that it predicts will be popular and of the highest quality based on what kind of cask types there are in warehouse," Microsoft said.

headlines: Indian YouTuber 'CarryMinati' among TIME's Next Generation Leaders
text: India's 19-year-old YouTuber Ajey Nagar, who runs the YouTube channel 'CarryMinati', has been named among TIME Magazine's 10 Next Generation Leaders for 2019. Nagar, whose channel has over 68 lakh subscribers, uploads commentaries, roasts and reaction videos. The list also features Sweden's 16-year-old climate change activist Greta Thunberg and America's 35-year-old actor-singer Tessa Thompson.

headlines: Shreyas Iyer better captain than Kohli in IPL 2019: Manjrekar
text: Commentator and former India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has rated Delhi Capitals skipper Shreyas Iyer as a better captain than Royal Challengers Bangalore captain Virat Kohli in the IPL 2019. Manjrekar gave 8/10 to Iyer, while Kohli got 6/10 for his captaincy. Delhi Capitals were knocked out in the playoffs, while Royal Challengers Bangalore finished last in the tournament.

headlines: Proud to be called anti-national if Godse is nationalist: Mufti
text: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti on Thursday tweeted, "I take pride in being called an anti-national when a Hindu fanatic who gunned down Gandhiji is hailed as a nationalist." This comes after BJP Lok Sabha candidate Sadhvi Pragya said Nathuram Godse was a patriot. "BJP should be ashamed for endorsing a candidate who praised Bapu's assassin," added Mufti.

headlines: Gandhi's contribution can't be forgotten: Pragya on 'Godse' remark
text: After saying Mahatma Gandhi's assassin Nathuram Godse was a "patriot", BJP's Bhopal candidate Sadhvi Pragya Thakur has said, "It was my personal opinion as the Opposition was talking about saffron terror." She added, "What Gandhi Ji has done for the country cannot be forgotten. My intention was not to hurt anyone's sentiments. My statement has been twisted by the media."

headlines: BJP's line is my line: Sadhvi Pragya on apologising for Godse remark
text: After apologising for calling Mahatma Gandhi's assassin Nathuram Godse a 'patriot', BJP's Bhopal candidate Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur said that her "party's line is her line". She added that she is loyal to the BJP. Earlier in the day, the BJP condemned Sadhvi Pragya's remark and asked her to apologise publicly.

headlines: Irfan Pathan only Indian among 536 players in CPL 2019 draft
text: All-rounder Irfan Pathan has become the first-ever Indian cricketer to be part of Caribbean Premier League (CPL) players' draft. The 34-year-old, who didn't play last two IPL seasons, is included in CPL 2019 players' draft with 535 other players from 20 countries. If selected, Irfan will be the first male Indian cricketer to feature in a major overseas T20 league.

headlines: Rafael Nadal is my polar opposite, he is super salty: Nick Kyrgios
text: Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios has said that world number two Rafael Nadal is his polar opposite. "He is super salty...When he wins, it's fine. He won't say anything bad, he'll credit the opponent...But as soon as I beat him, it's just like, 'He has no respect for me, my fans and no respect to the game'," he added.

headlines: World's first living organism with fully redesigned DNA made
text: In a first, Cambridge University researchers have completely redesigned the DNA of E. coli bacterium (commonly found in human gut) and created cells with a synthetic version of the altered genome. The artificial genome holds 4 million base pairs (G, A, T, and C), which when printed on A4 sheets runs to 970 pages, making it the largest-ever synthetic genome.

headlines: Policeman rescues Chinese man from jungle, have ice cream together
text: Sub-inspector Komal Kuntal on Tuesday rescued a Chinese national named Xing Fu, who lost his way into a jungle near Greater Noida. Kuntal reunited Xing with his group, which was staying at a society around six to seven km away. Kuntal revealed Xing was hungry while he was dropping him and they had ice cream together from a roadside cart.

headlines: Punjab woman declared dead found alive in morgue, dies later
text: A 65-year-old woman, declared dead by doctors at a private hospital in Punjab's Kapurthala, was found alive when her relatives visited the morgue to check her gold chain. Found breathing in the fridge, a doctor was called who made her drink water. However, her condition deteriorated at home and she passed away this Wednesday after being shifted to a hospital.

headlines: Good time to grow portfolio now as land prices fall: Anand Piramal
text: Piramal Realty Founder Anand Piramal has said now is a good time to grow the company's portfolio as land prices have reduced by 10-15% in the last five years. He added that land prices are "rational" after a long time. "Earlier landowners outside real estate sector wanted to sell. Now developers are more in the market to sell," Piramal said.

headlines: All planemakers will suffer from 'lose-lose' trade war: Airbus CEO
text: Airbus CEO Guillaume Faury has warned any further escalation of trade tensions would damage aerospace firms globally, including the European planemaker's US rival Boeing. "The trade tensions that we see, we believe they are lose-lose tensions," he said. The US and European Union have each threatened to impose billions of dollars of tit-for-tat tariffs over subsidies to Airbus and Boeing.

headlines: Shah not God but Mamata 'no saint' either: Shiv Sena
text: Criticising West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's "not God" remark on BJP President Amit Shah after clashes erupted during his Bengal roadshow, Shiv Sena said that Shah isn't God, but Mamata is also not a "saint". In its mouthpiece 'Saamana', Sena accused Mamata of provoking violence in Bengal. It added that Bengal is "suffering" and it is "dangerous" for the country.

headlines: Instagram to shut down its standalone Direct messaging app
text: Instagram has confirmed it is "rolling back the test of the standalone Direct (messaging) app". User conversations will automatically move to the Instagram app, as per an app notification shared on Twitter by social media consultant Matt Navarra. The notification also states that Instagram will end support for Direct, which first appeared in 2017, in the coming month.

headlines: Rajasthan govt includes IAF airstrike, pilot Abhinandan in books
text: Rajasthan government has introduced Balakot airstrike and IAF Wing Commander Abhinandan Varthaman as topics in Class 9 Social Science textbooks. Rajasthan Board of Secondary Education included it in a chapter titled 'Rashtriya suraksha evum shaurya parampara'. The content deals with India's Balakot airstrike on Jaish-e-Mohammed terror camp and Abhinandan's role in the IAF operation the next day.

headlines: Jaguar CEO denies holding talks over sale to Peugeot
text: Tata Motors-owned Jaguar Land Rover's CEO Ralf Speth has denied the carmaker is in talks with French automaker Peugeot over a possible sale. This comes after a media report recently claimed a "post-sale integration document" is in circulation among senior executives of the two companies. Tata Motors had also last week stated there's "no truth" to the report.

headlines: NASA orbiter completes 60,000 trips around Mars in 13 years
text: NASA has revealed its Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter (MRO) has completed 60,000 trips around Mars, 13 years after entering its orbit. Launched in 2005, MRO takes 112 minutes to complete one trip at a speed of about 3.4 kilometres per second. The $720-million spacecraft helped find water ice and flowing salty water besides finding a landing spot for the Curiosity rover.

headlines: Govt should allow Aadhaar for insurance KYC: IRDAI Chairman
text: IRDAI Chairman Subhash Chandra Khuntia has said the insurance regulator plans to lobby the government to allow use of Aadhaar to simplify online KYC process. Khuntia further urged insurers to focus on loss reduction by using technology for data collection and better risk underwriting. Insurers need to develop processes for assessing emerging risks like cyber-security and driverless cars, he added.

headlines: ExxonMobil, GAIL may partner for green energy space in India
text: US oil major ExxonMobil may partner with state-owned GAIL to establish a green energy platform in India. "The discussions are on. We are likely to make an announcement in a fortnight or so," GAIL's Chairman and Managing Director BC Tripathi said. ExxonMobil had in March signed an agreement with GAIL to collaborate on natural gas market development opportunities in India.

headlines: Shreya Ghoshal criticises airline for not allowing music instrument
text: Singer Shreya Ghoshal has criticised Singapore Airlines for not allowing her to carry a musical instrument with her on the flight. "I guess @SingaporeAir doesn't want musicians or any body who has a precious instrument to fly with on this airline. Well. Thank you. Lesson learnt," she tweeted. The airline, in its reply, wrote that they are sorry about it.

headlines: PM, Shah should apologise: Digvijaya on Sadhvi's 'Godse' remark
text: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh on Thursday asked PM Narendra Modi and BJP President Amit Shah to apologise for BJP Lok Sabha candidate Sadhvi Pragya's statement calling Nathuram Godse a "patriot". "Nathuram Godse was a killer. Glorifying him is not patriotism, it is sedition," added Digvijaya. BJP has condemned Pragya's statement and has asked her to publicly apologise for her remark.

headlines: Rahul says 'Modilie' new English word, Oxford Dictionaries responds
text: A day after Congress President Rahul Gandhi claimed 'Modilie' is a new word in English Dictionary and shared a snapshot of the entry, Oxford Dictionaries replied to him on Thursday. "We confirm the image is fake and 'Modilie' doesn't exist in any of our Dictionaries," it tweeted. The snapshot shared by Rahul defined 'Modilie' as 'To constantly modify the truth'.

headlines: Djokovic has a sick obsession with wanting to be liked: Kyrgios
text: Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios has said he feels world number one Novak Djokovic has a sick obsession with "wanting to be liked". Adding he can't stand Djokovic, Kyrgios said, "This whole celebration thing (blowing kisses to the crowd) that he does...It's very cringeworthy." "No matter how many grand slams he wins...he'll never be the greatest for me," he added.

headlines: Intel says nearly all CPUs made since 2011 exposed to hacking
text: Intel has disclosed a new set of security flaws existing in almost all of its processors made since 2011, which could let hackers read nearly all data flowing through them. While Intel classified the threat as "medium", security researchers said the vulnerability is much more serious. Intel said fixing it in existing chips could slow them by up to 19%.

headlines: Amazon sells shoes, doormats with images of Hindu Gods; criticised
text: Amazon faced a social media backlash in India on Thursday after toilet seat covers, shoes, doormats, yoga mats and other items with images of Hindu Gods were spotted on its US website. In 2017, Amazon removed doormats resembling India's flag from its Canadian site after External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj threatened to rescind visas of the US company's employees.

headlines: India's fastest train completes 1 lakh kms without missing single trip
text: India's fastest train Vande Bharat Express has completed one lakh running kilometres without missing a single trip, officials said on Thursday. The train, which can achieve a top speed of 160 kmph, was flagged off by PM Narendra Modi from New Delhi to Varanasi on February 15. The train has been manufactured by the Integral Coach Factory in Chennai.

headlines: If Godse is a patriot, is Mahatma Gandhi anti-national? Omar
text: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM Omar Abdullah on Thursday tweeted, "If the killer of the father of the nation is a patriot does that make Mahatma Gandhi anti-national?" This comes after Sadhvi Pragya, BJP's Lok Sabha candidate from Bhopal, called Nathuram Godse a patriot. Controversy over Godse began after actor-politician Kamal Haasan said that Godse was Independent India's first extremist.

headlines: Insult to country, Gandhi ideology: Cong on Pragya's Godse remark
text: Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala criticised BJP's Bhopal candidate Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur's "patriot" remark on Nathuram Godse, saying that her comment is an insult to the country and Gandhi ideology. Surjewala added that Godse's mindset was against those who had participated in the freedom movement. He further said that today it's clear that BJP people are Godse's real descendant.

headlines: Sedition law will be made more stringent: Rajnath Singh
text: Criticising the Congress for promising to abolish sedition law in its poll manifesto, Union Minister Rajnath Singh has said that the BJP will make the legislation more stringent after returning to power at the Centre. He further claimed that inflation has been controlled during the BJP's five years rule. Singh said India won't let any nation acquire its land.

headlines: Rahul more suitable as PM than PM Modi: Tejashwi Yadav
text: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Thursday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has shown a "great maturity" in his leadership style and is more suitable as PM than PM Narendra Modi. He added Rahul mounted a "very spirited" criticism of PM Modi-led government's policies. Yadav said that Rahul will play a "central role" in the formation of the new government.

headlines: Google Translatotron can translate speech in speaker's voice
text: Google is developing a new translation model called Translatotron that can directly convert speech from one language into another while maintaining a speaker's voice. It skips the usual step of translating speech to text and back to speech. Translatotron uses a sequence-to-sequence network model that processes voice input as a spectrogram and generates a new spectrogram in the target language.

headlines: Facebook, Amazon back pact to fight extremist content online
text: Facebook, Microsoft, Google, Twitter and Amazon at a meeting in Paris signed up for Christchurch Call, a commitment by governments and technology companies to eliminate terrorist and violent extremist content online. They also committed to nine-point plan to address abuse of technology to spread terrorist content. A March terror attack on two mosques in New Zealand's Christchurch claimed 51 lives.

headlines: Wikipedia blocked in China in all languages, confirms owner
text: The Wikimedia Foundation, that runs Wikipedia, has confirmed that the free community-edited encyclopaedia is currently blocked in China in all languages. The Chinese language version of the site was previously banned in the country, wherein reportedly about 10,000 sites are banned. In late April, Wikimedia had determined that Wikipedia was no longer accessible in China, Wikimedia said.

headlines: Mind-controlled hearing aid made to help focus on one voice
text: Columbia University scientists have developed an experimental mind-controlled hearing aid that mimics the brain's natural ability to focus on a single voice in noisy environments. Scientists solved the issue of background noise, called 'cocktail party effect', by separating voices using an algorithm. The device amplifies the speaker whose voice pattern most closely matches the user's brain waves.

headlines: New 'bio-glue' can seal beating heart wounds in 20 seconds
text: China-based researchers have developed a new 'bio-glue' hydrogel that can stop bleeding from punctured arteries even in beating hearts in about 20 to 30 seconds. The non-toxic hydrogel is made of water, gelatin and a mix of proteins and other chemicals, and solidifies under UV light, researchers said. It was tested on a pig's carotid artery and a rabbit's liver.

headlines: Jain woman seeks to embrace death by opting 'Santhara' in Gujarat
text: A Jain woman in Gujarat has decided to embrace death by opting Jainism's practice called 'Santhara'. The woman's son said, "When a person feels that no medicine is working to heal...disease and death is near, we do Santhara". In Jainism, Santhara is a religious practice of fasting until death with a belief that an individual's soul leaves the body wilfully.

headlines: CA Exam postponed as centres were holding UPSC exams: ICAI
text: The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI) on Wednesday clarified that June 2 exam was postponed to June 4 as the designated examination centres were holding UPSC tests on the same day. "Paper on 4th June was postponed to 13th June so that Group I of (CA) Final Exams is completed before commencing Group II papers," the ICAI added.

headlines: Philippines recalls its envoy as Canada fails to take trash back
text: The Philippines has recalled its ambassador after Canada missed the deadline to take back the garbage it had sent to the Southeast Asian nation. A Canadian company sent around 100 shipping containers including tonnes of household waste wrongly labelled as recyclable to the Philippines between 2013 and 2014. Canada said last month it's working to arrange for the containers' return.

headlines: IndiGo parent shares fall 10% amid reports of promoters rift
text: Shares of IndiGo's parent, InterGlobe Aviation, dropped up to 10% on Thursday amid reports of a rift between the carrier's promoters, Rahul Bhatia and Rakesh Gangwal. The promoters are reportedly in dispute over differences in management control and appointment of executives. Bhatia and Gangwal, who hold 38% and 37% in InterGlobe respectively, have reportedly hired law firms to settle differences.

headlines: Himalaya Men announces Kohli & Pant as brand ambassadors
text: Himalaya Men announced Virat Kohli, captain of the Indian cricket team, and Rishabh Pant, "ICC Emerging Player of the Year 2018", as the official brand ambassadors for Himalaya Men Face-Wash range. Commenting on the association, Virat said, "I have been a patron of Himalaya products for a long time now. I look forward to a long association with Himalaya Men."

headlines: Ayushmann didn't give up, he also didn't make up: Tahira on marriage
text: Ayushmann Khurrana's wife Tahira Kashyap, while talking about the low phase of their marriage, said, "I had given up many times but he did not...he also didn't make up." "There was this disconnect that we were not there for each other," she added. Ayushmann earlier revealed there was trouble in his marriage due to his onscreen kiss in 'Vicky Donor'.

headlines: Haven't finished writing GoT books: George RR Martin denies claim
text: Author George RR Martin has denied rumours that said he has secretly finished writing the last two books in his 'A Song of Ice and Fire' series. He said, "Why would I sit for years on completed novels?" Speculation began spreading online after actor Ian McElhinney, who played Ser Barristan Selmy, claimed Martin has already written books six and seven.

headlines: NASA spots Israeli spacecraft crash site on Moon, shares pic
text: NASA's Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter has spotted the impact site of the Israeli Beresheet spacecraft on Moon's "Sea of Serenity". LRO cameras captured a 10-metre-wide dark smudge but couldn't ascertain if an impact crater was formed. Aiming to be the first private Moon lander, Beresheet had lost signal 150 metre from Moon's surface and crashed at 500 kmph on April 11.

headlines: Moon has a mantle, confirms China lander on Moon's far side
text: China's Chang'e-4, the first-ever lander on the Moon's far side, has found materials believed to have been part of its mantle, the layer beneath the surface. It was believed meteorite strike on Moon's far side likely penetrated to the mantle and brought up the said materials to the surface, researchers said. Now we have proof of the same, they added.

headlines: Woman who accused CJI of sexual harassment to file appeal to CJI
text: A former Supreme Court staffer who accused CJI Ranjan Gogoi of sexual harassment is set to file an appeal to CJI Gogoi against her dismissal from the apex court. The 36-year-old woman, who was posted at the home office of the CJI, claimed CJI's behaviour changed after she resisted his advances. She was served a suspension order on November 27.

headlines: Assam auto driver defies curfew, takes pregnant woman to hospital
text: An auto driver named Maqbool drove a pregnant woman to a hospital in Assam's Hailakandi, where a curfew was imposed several days ago following communal clashes. The woman had gone into labour but her husband was unable to call an ambulance, following which Maqbool offered to help. She gave birth to a baby boy, whom the couple later named Shanti.

headlines: Maharashtra couple faces social boycott for opposing virginity test
text: A couple from Kanjarbhat community in Maharashtra's Thane district has approached police after it faced social boycott for opposing the practice of virginity test for women. "The community members went to such an extent that when my grandmother died on Monday, they did not come for her funeral," the husband said. Following the complaint, the police booked four persons.

headlines: Woman in UP dies after explosion in her mouth during treatment
text: A woman died after an explosion in her mouth during treatment at JN Medical College in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh on Wednesday. The woman was brought to the hospital after she allegedly consumed poison. In all probability, the woman had consumed sulphuric acid, which after coming in contact with oxygen through the suction pipe, exploded, a team of doctors said.

headlines: 400 test HIV+ in Pak after doctor accused of using infected syringe
text: Pakistan's health officials have said over 400 people, including children, in a village have tested HIV positive in recent weeks allegedly after being infected by a doctor using a contaminated syringe. "They are coming by the dozens," a doctor at the makeshift clinic said. "I curse [the doctor] who has caused all these children to be infected," a resident said.

headlines: Doctor accused of poisoning and saving 50 patients to impress others
text: A French doctor has been accused of poisoning over 50 patients in order to impress his colleagues by saving them. Anesthesiologist Frederic Pechier has already been charged with poisoning seven patients from 2008 to 2017, two of whom died while the others were revived. Investigators later found traces of potassium in their bloodstreams five times the lethal dose.

headlines: Rothschild withdraws from advising Adani on Australia coal project
text: French investment bank Rothschild & Co has decided not to advise Adani Group in the financing or development of the $4 billion Carmichael coal mine in Australia. The controversial coal mine, which has been in planning since 2010, is awaiting final approvals. Rothschild's decision comes as financial institutions are facing increasing pressure to stop their activities in the coal sector.

headlines: China opposes US move to blacklist telecom giant Huawei
text: China on Thursday criticised the US government's decision to put telecom giant Huawei on a blacklist and said it will take steps to protect its companies. The country added it strongly opposes other countries imposing unilateral sanctions on Chinese entities. China, which recently imposed retaliatory tariffs on American goods, said the US should avoid further impacting Sino-US trade relations.

headlines: MCC has become Modi's Code of Misconduct: Congress' Surjewala
text: After EC invoked Article 324 to cancel campaigning from 10 PM onwards on Thursday in nine West Bengal constituencies, Congress' Randeep Surjewala said, "EC has become a toothless commission under PM Modi and Amit Shah." He asked, "Has MCC now become 'Modi Code of Misconduct' to be applied to BJP's political opponents with total immunity for Modi and BJP's president?"

headlines: FIR against Computer Baba for violating MCC by performing yagna
text: Following Deputy District Election Officer's complaint, Bhopal police registered an FIR against Computer Baba for violating Model Code of Conduct (MCC). Last week, the BJP had filed a complaint against him for allegedly performing "yagna" in Bhopal to "ensure" Congress' Digvijaya Singh's win in general elections. Replying to the notice, he had said he didn't invite Singh to the event.

headlines: Self-obsessed Modi indulges in theatrics: Amarinder Singh
text: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh on Thursday called PM Narendra Modi "a self-obsessed man only interested in publicity." Singh added, "We have seen Modi indulging in theatrics since he took over as the Prime Minister... His famous hugs of world leaders, playing the drums in Japan - all were photo ops engineered by him with an eye on publicity."

headlines: Bengal can make statue, what about 200-yr-old heritage: Mamata
text: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's promise that Ishwar Chandra Vidyasagar's statue will be re-built, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said, "Bengal has money to make the statue. Can PM give back 200-year-old heritage?" "We've proof and you say that TMC did this. Aren't you ashamed?" she added. "Prove allegations otherwise we'll drag you to jail," Banerjee further said.

headlines: WhatsApp will never be secure: Telegram CEO Pavel Durov
text: Telegram Co-founder and CEO Pavel Durov, in a blog post titled 'Why WhatsApp will never be secure', said the Facebook-owned platform isn't open-source, which makes it difficult for security researchers to check for existing backdoors. "No wonder dictators seem to love WhatsApp," he said, adding, "Its lack of security allows [criminals and authoritarian governments] to spy on their own people."

headlines: Akhilesh shares meal with UP CM Yogi's lookalike on a plane
text: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav posted a photo on Twitter where he's seen sharing a meal with Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath's lookalike on a plane. Apparently taking a dig at Yogi, Yadav said, "The day he cleansed...CM's residence with Gangajal after I left, was the day I decided to treat him pooris." They are seen having poori-sabzi in the photo.

headlines: India joins 'Christchurch Call' to curb extremist content online
text: India has joined a global initiative by New Zealand that encourages social media platforms and countries to curb the spread of extremist content online. The non-binding 'Christchurch Call' agreement has been named after the New Zealand city where a gunman attacked two mosques and live-streamed the killings online. The US has declined to join the initiative citing freedom of speech.

headlines: Russia not fire brigade, can't save everything: Putin on Iran deal
text: Russia is not a fire brigade that can save the Iran nuclear deal all by itself, Russian President Vladimir Putin has said. He further blamed the US for the probable collapse of the deal. "The Americans have withdrawn from the deal, the agreement is crumbling and European countries are unable to do anything to save it", he added.

headlines: Growth strategy unchanged: IndiGo CEO amid alleged promoters row
text: IndiGo CEO Ronojoy Dutta, in an email to his employees, has said the carrier's growth strategy remains unchanged and the airline's management has the full backing of the company's board of directors to implement it. His statement comes after media reports of alleged disagreements between the airline's two promoters, Rahul Bhatia and Rakesh Gangwal.

headlines: Godse was a patriot, is a patriot, will always be one: Sadhvi Pragya
text: Bharatiya Janata Party's Bhopal candidate Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur on Thursday said, "Nathuram Godse was a patriot, is a patriot and will remain a patriot." She added, "People calling him (Godse) a terrorist should instead look within, such people will be given a befitting reply in these elections." This comes after Kamal Haasan called Godse 'Independent India's first terrorist'.

headlines: Jha's remark was about the sex scene, not on me, clarifies Aahana
text: Actress Aahana Kumra, who earlier said a remark by filmmaker Prakash Jha made her uncomfortable while filming a sex scene for 'Lipstick Under My Burkha', has now clarified that the comment was about the scene and not about her. "Mr. Jha has been extremely respectful of all of us actors at every time that we have met him," she added.

headlines: Over 3 lakh people sign petition demanding GoT season 8 remake
text: Over 3 lakh people have signed a petition on change.org titled 'Remake Game of Thrones Season 8 with competent writers', ahead of the series finale. The petition, started by Dylan D, has been addressed to HBO. He wrote in the petition, "This series deserves a final season that makes sense. Subvert my expectations and make it happen, HBO!"

headlines: Visiting WB for rally, let's see if Didi lets my chopper land: PM
text: Referring to West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, PM Narendra Modi said, "I am going to West Bengal for a rally in Dum Dum. Let us see if Didi allows it. If she has her way she will not allow the helicopter to land." His remarks came two days after clashes broke out at BJP chief Amit Shah's roadshow in Kolkata.

headlines: PM came as Ganga's son in 2014, will go as Rafale agent: Sidhu
text: Addressing an election rally in Himachal Pradesh's Bilaspur, Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu said, "(Prime Minister) Narendra Modi came in 2014 as the son of Ganga and he will go in 2019 as an agent in Rafale." Sidhu added, "I challenge Narendra Modi to debate on 'Na khaunga na khane dunga'. If I lose, I will quit politics forever."

headlines: Sadhvi Pragya should apologise for calling Godse patriot: BJP
text: The BJP on Thursday condemned Sadhvi Pragya, its Bhopal Lok Sabha candidate, for calling Mahatma Gandhi's assassin Nathuram Godse a "patriot" and said she should publicly apologise for the statement. The party said it does not agree with Pragya's statement and it will ask her for clarification. This comes after actor-politician Kamal Haasan said Godse was Independent India's first extremist.

headlines: Rahul Gandhi is a cannon, I'm AK-47: Sidhu asks PM Modi for debate
text: After challenging PM Narendra Modi for a debate anywhere in India, Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu said, "Rahul (Gandhi) ji is a big thing. He's a cannon and I am AK-47." Adding that he wants to debate on "Na khaunga na khane dunga", Sidhu stated, "I want to ask Narendra Modi whether he took brokerage in Rafale deal or not."

headlines: What have I done so terribly wrong? Jalaj Saxena on India A snub
text: After failing to make the cut in recently announced India A squads, Kerala all-rounder Jalaj Saxena tweeted, "What have I done so terribly wrong...to deserve this?" The 32-year-old, who won four BCCI awards from 2015 to 2018, also shared his statistics. Notably, Saxena is the only Indian to score a century and take eight-wicket haul in a first-class match twice.

headlines: Warren Buffett's Berkshire reveals $861 million Amazon stake
text: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway on Wednesday revealed it owned $861 million of Amazon shares as of March. Earlier this month, Buffett said the Amazon investment was made by one of his portfolio managers, Todd Combs or Ted Weschler, and that he had been "an idiot" for not investing in Amazon himself. The Amazon stake would now be worth $904 million.

headlines: Amazon, Flipkart reduce discounts on most products over FDI norms
text: E-commerce platforms have reduced discounts on most products and are not selling them below cost price to comply with FDI policy. Puma India MD said discounts were down by 11-14% in January-March but the company's sale still increased by 16% on Flipkart and 21% on Amazon. Traders' body CAIT had termed the discounts "predatory pricing", alleging it upsets market dynamics.

headlines: Teacher asks kids to slap girl 168 times over incomplete work, held
text: A government school teacher in Madhya Pradesh was arrested for allegedly directing Class 6 students to slap their classmate 168 times for not completing her homework last year. The girl's father said she didn't do her homework as she wasn't well, following which the 35-year-old teacher asked 14 girls to slap her two times every day for six days.

headlines: Mastermind of CRPF camp attack among 3 terrorists killed in J&K
text: Jaish-e-Mohammed commander Khalid Bhai, who had masterminded the 2017 attack on a CRPF camp in Lethpora in which five jawans were martyred, was among the three terrorists killed in an encounter in Jammu and Kashmir on Thursday, said police sources. An Army jawan was martyred in the encounter, which broke out in Pulwama district in the early hours of Thursday.

headlines: BMC official among 15 held in midnight raid at dance bar in Mumbai
text: As many as 15 persons, including a senior official of the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC), were arrested following a midnight raid on Wednesday on a dance bar in south Mumbai. Police arrested nine members of the hotel management staff and six customers. The action was taken under different IPC sections and the Maharashtra hotels establishment Act, a police officer said.

headlines: Old man dies after being pushed off bus by woman he asked to be nice
text: A 74-year-old man in Las Vegas, US, succumbed to his injuries a month after he was pushed off a bus by a 25-year-old woman. The deceased Serge Fournier had asked the woman to behave nicely after he heard her swearing at others. The accused, Cadesha Michelle Bishop, has been charged with the murder of an elderly-vulnerable person.

headlines: US deports 50 Pakistanis, arranges special plane to fly them back
text: The US arranged a special chartered flight to send back over 50 Pakistanis who were deported over immigration violations, criminal conduct and other serious charges. The US last month imposed sanctions on Pakistan under laws according to which countries refusing to take back deportees and visa over-stayers will be denied American visas.

headlines: Former Australian Prime Minister Bob Hawke dies aged 89
text: Former Australian Prime Minister Bob Hawke passed away on Thursday at the age of 89, his wife Blanche d'Alpuget said in a statement. Hawke, who served as Australia's Prime Minister from 1983 to 1991, was the country's third longest-serving leader after Robert Menzies and John Howard. Hawke is survived by his wife and his four children.

headlines: German startup shows world's 1st electric 5-seater air taxi
text: Munich-based startup Lilium unveiled what it claims is the world's first all-electric, jet-powered, five-seater air taxi prototype after successfully completing the full-scale prototype's maiden test earlier this month. The air taxi will have a 300 km range with a top speed of 300 kmph. Lilium intends to be operational in cities globally by 2025, providing an app-based air taxi service.

headlines: Tesla to update battery software after 2 car fire cases
text: Tesla has said it is rolling out a battery software update for its Model S and Model X electric cars. This comes after a recent video of a Model S catching fire in Hong Kong surfaced weeks after another one showed it exploding in Shanghai. Tesla said it hasn't found the fire's cause or any battery pack issues yet.

headlines: Saudi Arabia allows expats to own property for the 1st time
text: Saudi Arabia has for the first time approved a scheme that gives permanent residency to certain expatriates, allowing them to own property in the country. The 'Privileged Iqama' system will be offered to highly skilled foreigners and investors. The scheme will attract investors and enhance the economy's competitiveness, Saudi Minister of Commerce and Investment Majid Al-Qasabi said.

headlines: ArcelorMittal resolution plan violates IBC: Ruia to NCLAT
text: Cash-strapped Essar Steel's promoter Prashant Ruia has told the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) that ArcelorMittal's resolution plan is in violation of the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC). The plan, if approved, negates the right of 'Subrogation of the Guarantor', he claimed. Subrogation is the substitution of one person or group by another in respect of a debt.

headlines: Censor Board replaces alcohol bottle with bouquet in Devgn's film
text: The Censor Board has replaced a visual of actress Rakul Preet holding an alcohol bottle with that of her holding a flower bouquet in the upcoming film 'De De Pyaar De'. It has also deleted two dialogues from the film. The Ajay Devgn starrer, which has been given a U/A certificate, is scheduled to release on May 17.

headlines: OnePlus launches new brand campaign featuring Robert Downey Jr.
text: OnePlus has unveiled its latest brand campaign featuring Robert Downey Jr. Commenting on the association, Robert said, "It's cool to see a young brand disrupting the tech landscape...In checking out the upcoming OnePlus 7 Pro the attention to detail coupled with the innovative design was truly impressive." "Nobody could represent what we stand for better," added OnePlus founder, Pete Lau.

headlines: upGradÂ’s digital marketing learner gets 120% salary hike
text: Gourav Choudhary, a learner from upGrad and MICA's PG Certification in Digital Marketing & Communication gets a successful career transition with a 120% salary hike. The online course is taught by MICA faculty and experts from Facebook, Razorpay and more, with 15+ case studies and live projects. upGrad's 360-degree career support services have enabled over 100 such career transitions.

headlines: Shahid unveils his 1st wax statue at Madame Tussauds Singapore
text: Actor Shahid Kapoor unveiled his first wax statue at Madame Tussauds Singapore on Thursday and took to Instagram to share a picture. "#Twinning," he captioned the picture which shows him posing with the wax statue. Commenting on the picture, fans wrote "Which one is real?" and "Awesome....took me seconds to differentiate".

headlines: Witness statements don't support Tanushree's #MeToo claims: Reports
text: Mumbai Police have been unable to get a statement supporting Tanushree Dutta's allegations of sexual harassment against Nana Patekar, as per reports. They have reportedly recorded 12 to 15 statements of witnesses who were present on the sets of the 2009 film 'Horn 'Ok' Pleassss'. Reacting to these reports, Tanushree said, "They're Nana's friends, why will they corroborate my story?"

headlines: Hina Khan makes her debut at Cannes Film Festival 2019
text: Actress Hina Khan made her debut at the 72nd Cannes Film Festival on Wednesday. The actress is reportedly at Cannes for the screening of her short film, 'Lines', which is based on the Kargil War. She wore a sparkly silver see-through floor-length gown with a plunging neckline, by designer Ziad Nakad.

headlines: My grandmom watched my orgasm scene with a straight face: Kiara
text: Kiara Advani, while speaking about her grandmother's reaction while watching her orgasm scene in 'Lust Stories', said, "She was watching it with a straight face, like deadpan." "She's part British, so there were certain jokes that she didn't get," Kiara added. The actress further said her parents were "completely unfazed" by the scene as she had already told them beforehand.

headlines: EC is BJP's brother, ready to go to jail for saying this: Mamata
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said, "EC is BJP's brother...everyone in the country says EC has sold out to BJP." "I'm ready to go to jail for saying this. I'm not scared to say the truth," she added. She also alleged that BJP complained to EC so that TMC can't hold any meeting after PM Narendra Modi's meeting.

headlines: Why allow PM Modi's rallies and ban others in WB: Opp'n to EC
text: After the Election Commission decided to end campaigning in West Bengal from 10 pm on Thursday, CM Mamata Banerjee and CPI(M)'s Sitaram Yechury asked if the time was set to allow two rallies of PM Narendra Modi before that. "Now, permit Modiji's rallies on 16th & ban all others," Congress' Randeep Surjewala tweeted, calling it a "shameful fall" for EC.

headlines: Slippers thrown at Kamal Haasan's car at Tamil Nadu rally; 1 held
text: Slippers were hurled towards the car from which actor-politician Kamal Haasan was campaigning in Tamil Nadu's Tirupparankundram on Wednesday. Police said they have detained one person in connection with the incident, adding that the slippers did not hit Haasan and fell into the crowd. This comes amid controversy over Haasan's 'Nathuram Godse was free India's first Hindu terrorist' remark.

headlines: Bus carrying BJP workers overturns in Kullu district, 7 injured
text: Seven people were injured after a bus carrying BJP workers overturned in Kullu district, Himachal Pradesh on Thursday. The police said, "45 BJP workers were travelling in the bus when the accident occurred in Nagni village. The injured have been shifted to a local hospital." The cause of the accident is not known yet.

headlines: India's Chandrayaan-2 to carry NASA payload too in July: ISRO
text: India's second Moon mission, Chandrayaan-2, that's planned for a July launch will have 13 payloads and one passive experiment from American space agency NASA, ISRO said on Wednesday. The spacecraft with a 3.8-tonne mass has three modules- orbiter, lander, and rover. Eight of the 13 Indian payloads will be on orbiter, three will be on lander and two on rover.

headlines: Man in Nagpur finds lizard in Haldiram's vada sambar, outlet shut
text: A man allegedly found a dead lizard in vada sambar served at Haldiram's Ajni square outlet in Nagpur, a Food and Drug Administration (FDA) official said. The FDA, which found deficiencies in the outlet's kitchen on inspection, has shut down the outlet until they complete the compliance. The customer and the woman accompanying him were admitted to a nearby hospital.

headlines: 2 Indian climbers die at 26,246-ft altitude on 3rd highest mountain
text: Two climbers from Kolkata died at an altitude of around 8,000 metres (26,246 feet) near the summit of world's third highest mountain, Mount Kanchenjunga in Nepal. The climbers were identified as 48-year-old Biplab Baidya, who died on the way down from 8,586-metre Kanchenjunga due to altitude sickness, and 46-year-old Kuntal Kanrar, who passed away while trying to climb the peak.

headlines: 3 BTech students arrested with 10 kg ganja in Andhra Pradesh
text: The Andhra Pradesh police on Wednesday arrested three BTech students for allegedly transporting ganja in a car from Araku Valley to Visakhapatnam. The police also seized 10 kg of ganja, three cell phones and a new Ford car. The police said, "They are addicted to luxuries and started ganja smuggling to make more money easily."

headlines: IPS officer Deven Bharti to head Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad
text: The Maharashtra government on Wednesday appointed senior IPS officer Deven Bharti as the chief of the state's Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS). Bharti, a 1994-batch IPS officer, has investigated several high-profile cases including the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks and the murder of senior crime journalist J Dey. He is also known for his crackdown on terror outfit Indian Mujahideen.

headlines: Army jawan martyred, 3 terrorists killed in Pulwama encounter
text: An Army jawan was martyred and two others were injured in an encounter in the Pulwama district of Jammu and Kashmir on Thursday morning. Three terrorists were gunned down by security forces in the encounter. Security forces had launched an operation following a tip-off about militants holed up in a house in the Dalipora area.

headlines: Canada's most wanted fugitive reveals location to media, gets caught
text: Jessie Dean Kowalchuk, a fugitive on Canada's most wanted list, was arrested by police after he revealed his location in a Facebook message to a media outlet, which was publicising his case. "News flash morons I'm in Edmonton and not coming back," the 27-year-old had written. Kowalchuk was wanted for violating his probation related to three crimes in 2015.

headlines: Trump declares national emergency over threats against US telecom
text: US President Donald Trump has declared a national emergency to protect the country against foreign adversaries that are taking advantage of technological vulnerabilities to threaten US communications systems. The order bars US companies from using foreign telecoms believed to pose national security risks. This comes amid US' campaign against Chinese manufacturer Huawei over espionage concerns.

headlines: Big China investment in India may be imminent: Mahindra on trade war
text: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra said that a wave of Chinese investment in India may be imminent as US-China trade war intensifies. Commenting on possible meeting between US and Chinese Presidents, Mahindra tweeted, "Even if they settle, a Chinese firm with large exports to US would be wise to hedge & invest in Indian subsidiary & transfer its scale-manufacturing skills."

headlines: Engineer interview platform Karat gets $28 mn led by Tiger Global
text: US-based interview platform Karat has raised $28 million in a Series B funding round led by Tiger Global Management. Existing investors Norwest Venture Partners and 8VC also participated in the round. Founded in 2014 by Mohit Bhende and Jeffrey Spector, Karat offers help to firms by conducting human-powered technical rounds of engineering job interviews online for them.

headlines: Qatar Airways asks India to allow additional flights to Doha
text: Qatar Airways said it has asked Indian aviation authorities to allow additional flights on routes connecting Indian cities with Doha on a temporary basis. This comes amid a reduction in flights following temporary suspension of Jet Airways' operations. Without additional flights, Indian flyers would be forced to choose expensive last-minute tickets or complicated re-routings, Qatar Airways said.

headlines: Watch Zidane's left-footed volley that won Real Madrid the CL
text: Former midfielder Zinedine Zidane scored through a left-footed volley to help Real Madrid win the Champions League final against Bayer Leverkusen on May 15, 2002. Zidane pulled it off in the 45th minute by bundling a Roberto Carlos looping cross into the goal's top-left corner after hitting it from near the edge of the box. Madrid won the match 2-1.

headlines: Driver mistakenly plays porn sounds on London train's sound system
text: The driver of a South Western Railway train in London mistakenly played porn sounds on the announcement system for several minutes. A passenger uploaded a video of the incident on Twitter, tagged Transport for London, and wrote, "Amazing multitasking here." Responding to him, Transport for London tweeted, "Oh dear. Thankfully not one of our trains or drivers".

headlines: EC orders Twitter to remove all tweets on Lok Sabha exit polls
text: Ahead of the last phase of the 2019 Lok Sabha elections on May 19, the Election Commission has ordered Twitter India to remove all the tweets related to exit polls. This comes amid leaks of exit polls being shared on the platform. The seven-phase election began from April 11 and the results are to be announced on May 23.

headlines: Sick of seeing same dumb comments: NZ player deletes tweet on Dhoni
text: New Zealand all-rounder Jimmy Neesham said he deleted his tweet about MS Dhoni's run-out in IPL 2019 final as he's "sick of seeing the same dumb comments" in his feed "200 times a day". In the deleted tweet, Neesham had said it "astounded" him how fans claimed Dhoni was not-out. "Please don't bother tweeting me about it again," he added.

headlines: Dad helped me get here, feels good to see him happy: Shubman Gill
text: On being asked about his father doing bhangra after he scored fifty in an IPL 2019 match, KKR batsman Shubman Gill said it felt so good to him. "He has made me work so hard, helped me get here and to know he's happy and enjoying my game [feels good]. What better than this for...father from a son," he added.

headlines: Kolkata Police broke door, arrested me at 2 am: BJP's Bagga on clash
text: BJP spokesperson Tajinder Bagga has claimed that Kolkata Police broke his hotel room door and arrested him at 2 am on CM Mamata Banerjee's orders over the violence during Amit Shah's rally. Bagga added that he was later released due to lack of evidence. TMC leader Derek O'Brien called Bagga an "outside goon" and accused him of causing violence.

headlines: All my passwords had references to Tendulkar: InMobi Co-founder
text: Naveen Tewari, the Co-founder of India's first billion-dollar startup InMobi has said, "I connect cricket a lot to the journey of an entrepreneur." "Think of the rhythm of a bowler bowling and a batsman batting. Entrepreneurship is that rhythm," the Harvard Business School graduate said. Tewari also said at one point all of his passwords had references to Sachin Tendulkar.

headlines: Woman RJ sits through Cyclone Fani in Odisha to give live updates
text: Radio jockey Rojalin Pradhan sat through Cyclone Fani at a radio station in Odisha's Puri district on May 3 even as wind speeds reached up to 200 kmph, to give live updates from India Meteorological Department's website. After the internet service went down, she stretched her show by informing over 100 villages about safe shelters till the phone lines worked.

headlines: Taco Bell names Dabur's Burmans as national franchise partner
text: Yum Brands-owned Mexican style fast-food chain Taco Bell announced Dabur owner Burman family's Burman Hospitality as its master franchise partner in India, with plans to open 600 outlets by 2029. Taco Bell currently has 35 outlets in India, with some operated by Burman Hospitality. Taco Bell entered India in 2010 and signed up with Burman Hospitality in 2015.

headlines: Unprecedented decision: Mamata on EC's campaign ban in WB
text: After the Election Commission (EC) announced a ban on campaigning in nine West Bengal constituencies from 10 PM tomorrow, state CM Mamata Banerjee said it's an "unprecedented decision". She alleged that the EC is running under the BJP. She said, "Yesterday's violence was because of (BJP President) Amit Shah. Why has EC not issued...show-cause notice to him or sacked him?"

headlines: Digvijaya Singh calls PM Narendra Modi 'shani' and 'nalayak'
text: Congress' Digvijaya Singh in his public addresses called PM Narendra Modi "nalayak" and "shani". "They say 'Hindu religion's in danger'...You useless people, when Muslims who ruled our country for five centuries couldn't deter us from our faith, how can it happen now?" he said. Calling the PM 'shani', he added 'shani's effect' will go away from [India] after May 23.

headlines: Cong allies jail WB people for chanting Jai Shri Ram: Irani
text: Addressing a rally in Himachal Pradesh, Union Minister Smriti Irani criticised West Bengal's TMC government saying that Congress' allies are putting state people in jail for chanting Jai Shri Ram. She added that for the first time in history a PM is being "abused" by Congress. Irani said the PM remains committed to the "path of development" despite facing obstacles.

headlines: PM mocks VIP treatment but his own brother wants it: Vadra
text: Robert Vadra on Wednesday in a Facebook post wrote PM Narendra Modi mocks everyone about VIP Treatment but his own brother is demanding escort vehicle. "Those who live in glass houses shouldn't throw stones! This holds true for our PM," Vadra added. On Tuesday, PM Modi's brother sat on a dharna outside a police station seeking a separate escort vehicle.

headlines: Morgan banned for an ODI after 2nd minor over-rate offence
text: England captain Eoin Morgan has been banned for an ODI and fined 40% of his match fee after maintaining a slow over-rate in the third ODI against Pakistan at Bristol. This was Morgan's second minor over-rate offence in the last 12 months, with the previous one coming against Windies in February. England are currently leading the five-match series 2-0.

headlines: Flipkart in talks with Nokia, Motorola to make TVs: Report
text: Flipkart is in talks with international original equipment manufacturers to make electronics for sale on its platform, as per reports. It's reportedly in advanced-stage talks with Nokia and Motorola, which plan to introduce TV models in India by next year. Flipkart also aims to collaborate with Sansui to launch smaller home appliances such as juicers, grinders and other kitchen appliances.

headlines: iPhone price may rise 3% over US-China trade war: Report
text: Tariffs on the iPhone's China-made batteries and other components would increase its manufacturing cost by 2% to 3%, a report said, adding Apple would need to increase iPhone prices by a similar amount to make the same profit. The US raised tariffs on $200 billion worth of Chinese products and China retaliated with tariffs on $60 billion of US goods.

headlines: WeWork owner launches $2.9B real estate acquisition platform
text: US-based co-working space startup WeWork's parent The We Company has launched ARK, its global real estate acquisition and management platform. ARK will initially deploy $2.9 billion in total equity capital, with reportedly $1 billion from IvanhoÃ© Cambridge, a unit of Canada-based investor, CDPQ. Founded in 2010, The We Company also operates WeLive and WeGrow.

headlines: Defence Space agency to come up at Bengaluru: Reports
text: India will set up its military space agency headquartered at Bengaluru with fighter pilot Air Vice Marshal SP Dharkar as its likely head, as per reports. The space agency is likely to command all space assets of the Army, Air Force and Navy. The final decision on the capabilities and assets to be given hasn't been taken yet, reports added.

headlines: Fossils of new 'most bird-like' dinosaur found after 150 yrs
text: Germany-based researchers have unearthed fossils of a new "most bird-like" flying dinosaur species 'Alcmonavis poeschli'. Crow-sized feathered dinosaur Archaeopteryx, discovered in 1861, was widely considered to be the oldest bird-like one for over 150 years. However, a flapping trait likely existing in the new species is present in more recent birds, but not Archaeopteryx, researchers said.

headlines: Kochhar's brother-in-law seeks cancellation of lookout circular
text: Former ICICI Bank CEO Chanda Kochhar's brother-in-law Rajiv Kochhar has moved a Delhi court seeking cancellation of lookout circular against him. Chanda Kochhar, her husband Deepak Kochhar, and Rajiv have been named in an alleged bank loan fraud and money laundering case. Rajiv, the Founder of Singapore-based Avista Advisory, has been questioned by the ED and CBI in the case.

headlines: 12% GST on dues if home completion certificate issued by Mar: Govt
text: Homebuyers must pay 12% GST on balance due to builders if the housing project has been granted completion certificate by March 31, the CBIC said. The GST Council in March allowed developers to shift to 5% GST rate for residential units and 1% for affordable housing without the benefit of input tax credit (ITC) from April 1, 2019.

headlines: RBI aims to boost digital transactions to 15% of GDP by 2021
text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has said it aims to boost digital transactions to about 15% of GDP over next two years from nearly 10% now. The central bank added it aims to achieve a "highly digital" and "cash-lite" economy model. Notably, cash as a percentage of GDP is at 11.4% compared to 11.8% before note ban in 2016.

headlines: Woh meri biwi thodi na hai: Dhawan on need to be in touch with Rohit
text: On being asked if he has been constantly talking to his opening partner Rohit Sharma ahead of the 2019 World Cup, Shikhar Dhawan jokingly said, "Baatein karke kya hoga? Woh meri biwi thodi na hai." "If you play with someone for years, you'll know him inside out. With Rohit, there's nothing special that we do," he added.

headlines: We've acted too, not just kissed: Shahid on kissing scenes with Kiara
text: Actor Shahid Kapoor, while responding to a journalist who kept asking him and his co-star Kiara Advani about their kissing scenes in their upcoming film 'Kabir Singh', said, "We have done a lot of acting as well in the film." He added, "Have you not had a girlfriend for a long time? Why can't you ask questions apart from kissing?"

headlines: Kangana Ranaut loses 5 kg in 10 days for Cannes Film Festival
text: Actress Kangana Ranaut has lost 5 kilograms in 10 days, ahead of her red carpet appearance at Cannes Film Festival, her trainer revealed. The actress worked out twice a day after shooting for 'Panga' for 10-11 hours daily and switched to a calorie-deficit diet. Kangana, who plays a kabaddi player in 'Panga', was supposed to gain weight for the film.

headlines: Rahul Gandhi drives tractor while campaigning in Punjab
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi drove a tractor in Ludhiana on Wednesday while campaigning for the seventh phase of the Lok Sabha elections. Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh and Ludhiana MP Ravneet Singh Bittu who's contesting again, sat beside Rahul on the tractor. The Congress party posted a video of Rahul driving the tractor on its official Twitter account.

headlines: Make my meme, gift it to me, will not file FIR: PM Modi to Mamata
text: Addressing a rally in West Bengal, PM Narendra Modi said, "Didi, you can make the worst possible meme on me and come to gift to me at my residence". Modi added, "I will gracefully accept it and will not file an FIR." This comes after BJP worker Priyanka was arrested for sharing a meme of the WB CM Mamata Banerjee.

headlines: Croatian World Cupper Stimac named Indian men's football team coach
text: The All India Football Federation (AIFF) has appointed Igor Stimac as the head coach of the senior men's team on a two-year deal. The 51-year-old, who was part of Croatia's squad that came third in the 1998 World Cup and coached Croatian national team in 2012-2013, replaces Stephen Constantine who was at the helm for nearly five years.

headlines: No one can match Hardik Pandya talent-wise in Team India: Sehwag
text: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has said that there's no one who can match Hardik Pandya talent-wise in Team India. "There is no one even closer to Pandya's talent with both bat and ball. If there was someone even closer to him...Pandya would not have made it back into the team," he added. The 25-year-old has played 45 ODIs so far.

headlines: Regret telling Team India players to have sex before match: Upton
text: Ex-mental conditioning coach Paddy Upton has revealed his "biggest professional error" was the sex dossier he created for Team India in 2009, wherein he asked players to have sex before matches. He added it was "just a joke" which was taken out of context in the media. He further said he apologised to then coach Gary Kirsten for the controversy.

headlines: Aus footballer comes out as gay months after breakup with girlfriend
text: Andy Brennan has become Australia's first professional male footballer to come out as gay. The 26-year-old, who broke up with his girlfriend around a year ago, in an Instagram post, wrote, "It's taken me years to get comfortable saying this - I'm gay." Adding that he couldn't be happier, Brennan said, "It's been a big lift off my shoulders."

headlines: Terrorists planned to bomb Bal Thackeray's house in 1989: Rane
text: Terrorists had planned to bomb Thackeray family's Mumbai house in 1989, former Shiv Sena member Narayan Rane has claimed. This forced Shiv Sena Founder Bal Thackeray to direct the family to shift to a safer place for a few days, Rane added. The then Maharashtra CM Sharad Pawar had called Uddhav and informed him about the threat, Rane said.

headlines: Rahul Gandhi tweets 'Modilie', says it's new in English dictionary
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi has tweeted that he found a new word 'Modilie' in the English dictionary. The morphed image showed the word's meaning as "to constantly Modify the truth". This comes after PM Narendra Modi claimed to have used a digital camera and e-mail in 1987-88 and also said cloud cover hid IAF jets from radar during Balakot airstrike.

headlines: Grenade explosion outside a mall near Guwahati's Zoo road, 6 injured
text: As many as six people have been injured after a grenade explosion took place outside a mall on Zoo road in Assam's Guwahati at 8 pm on Wednesday. The area has been cordoned off, while the injured people have been taken to Guwahati Medical College and Hospital. Terror outfit ULFA has claimed responsibility for the attack, reports said.

headlines: Kolkata woman jumps onto molester's bike, gets him arrested
text: After a 28-year-old man named Subodh Sharma touched her inappropriately, a 21-year-old Kolkata college student jumped onto his bike and punched him while covering his eyes. The girl kept shouting for help despite the accused biting fingers of both her hands. Around five people came to her rescue and grabbed the accused by the collar after which he was arrested.

headlines: Nuclear test ban agency offers 'Observer' status to India
text: The Comprehensive Nuclear Test Ban Treaty Organization (CTBTO) has offered India an 'Observer' status and access to data from the International Monitoring System. The CTBT is a legally-binding treaty that aims to ban all nuclear explosions across the world. It has been signed by 184 countries but not come into force as eight countries including India have not ratified it.

headlines: Pak moves to create new South Punjab Province by bifurcating Punjab
text: The Pakistan government has introduced a bill in the lower house of the Parliament to create the new province of South Punjab by bifurcating Punjab. South Punjab will comprise Multan, Bahawalpur and Dera Ghazi Khan Divisions. Bifurcating Punjab province to form South Punjab was an electoral promise made by Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan's Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf party.

headlines: PM very good with publicity, believes in advertising: Priyanka
text: Addressing a rally in Uttar Pradesh, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi on Wednesday criticised PM Narendra Modi saying that the PM is "very good with publicity" and instead of development believes in advertising only. Priyanka further accused PM Modi of doing politics based on "lies and publicity". She claimed that development in Varanasi wasn't the same as advertised by the PM.

headlines: Vandalisation of Vidyasagar's statue despicable: CPM
text: Communist Party of India (Marxist) on Wednesday condemned the vandalisation of Ishwar Chandra Vidyasagar's statue and said the act was "despicable". "Vidyasagar was an icon of Bengal Renaissance. He...gave a thrust to our national freedom. This is a serious matter," CPM General Secretary Sitaram Yechury said. The statue was vandalised during the clashes on Tuesday at Amit Shah's Kolkata roadshow.

headlines: New species of vine snake found in India after 113 years
text: A recently published study has revealed a new species of vine snake has been discovered after around 113 years in India. The species 'Ahaetulla laudankia' was spotted by IISc Bengaluru Professor Sushil Dutta and Zoological Survey of India scientist Dr Pratyush Mohapatra in Odisha's Similipal Biosphere Reserve in 2009. The last vine snake species, 'Ahaetulla anomala', was discovered in 1906.

headlines: April trade deficit widens to five-month high of $15.33 bn
text: India's trade deficit widened to a five-month high of $15.33 billion in April, the trade ministry said on Wednesday. The gap between the country's imports and exports had stood at $13.72 billion in April last year. Merchandise exports remained almost flat at $26.07 billion in April compared with a year earlier, while imports were up 4.5% at $41.40 billion.

headlines: Photo of snow leopard's 'camouflage' in Himachal goes viral
text: An image of a snow leopard captured by wildlife photographer Saurabh Desai went viral on the internet after many people found it difficult to spot the animal on a rocky mountain filled with patches of snow. "Art of camouflage," Desai captioned the picture. He took the picture when he was visiting the Spiti Valley in the Himalayan mountain range.

headlines: Mamata, TMC leaders put Vidyasagar's pic as Twitter DP after clashes
text: A day after Bengali reformer Ishwar Chandra Vidyasagar's statue was vandalised during BJP President Amit Shah's rally in Kolkata, TMC leaders, including CM Mamata Banerjee, have put Vidyasagar's photo as their Twitter and Facebook display picture. Several people were injured in the clashes that broke out between BJP and TMC workers at University of Calcutta and Vidyasagar College on Tuesday.

headlines: Faulty Pixel smartphone owners to get up to $500 from Google
text: As part of $7.25-million lawsuit settlement, Google will pay up to $500 to the owners of Pixel and Pixel XL devices with faulty microphones. Owners who got another defective smartphone in replacement of a defective Pixel could get $500, while owners of a single defective device could get $350. Users who experienced no issues could also get up to $20.

headlines: Bezos rides front loader to drop dirt for $1.5B Amazon delivery hub
text: World's richest person, Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos took to Twitter to announce an investment of $1.5 billion in a three million square feet air hub in Kentucky, US for faster deliveries. "It's going to create 2,000 jobs," he said. He shared a video of the groundbreaking ceremony, adding, "If you're guessing that driving a front loader was fun, you're right."

headlines: Policeman flashes private parts to women on balcony, arrested
text: Police constable Harishchandra Lahane was arrested for allegedly flashing his private parts before two women on the balcony of his house in Mumbai's Nehru Nagar, police said on Tuesday. The women were talking on the common balcony when Lahane arrived, hurled abuses at them and returned naked. He has been granted bail and an inter-departmental inquiry will be initiated.

headlines: Sherpa climbs Mount Everest for 23rd time, breaks own record
text: Nepalese mountaineer Kami Rita Sherpa has scaled the Mount Everest for the 23rd time, breaking his own record for the most successful attempts of climbing the mountain. He has scaled several other peaks, including K-2, Cho-Oyu, Manaslu and Lhotse. Rita first scaled the Everest in 1994 and says that he will try and climb the peak two more times.

headlines: Want to fully restore ties with US: Russian President Putin
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said that he wants to fully restore his country's ties with the US. Putin's statement came as he met US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo in Sochi on Tuesday. Putin reiterated that Russia did not interfere in the 2016 presidential elections, further denying any collusion with the Trump campaign.

headlines: Tata Chemicals to transfer salt, spices biz to Tata Global Beverages
text: Tata Chemicals on Wednesday said it will transfer consumer products business to Tata Global Beverages, one of the biggest branded tea sellers with Tetley and Tata Tea. Tata Global Beverages will now add branded salt, spices, pulses, protein foods, snacks, natural sweeteners and detergents to its portfolio. The company will be renamed Tata Consumer Products.

headlines: Can't get why Mamata behaving like Saddam Hussein: Vivek Oberoi
text: Following clashes at BJP President Amit Shah's roadshow in West Bengal, actor Vivek Oberoi criticised state CM Mamata Banerjee saying that he can't understand why is she behaving like former Iraq President Saddam Hussein. He added, "Ironically, democracy is under threat and in danger by Dictator Didi herself." Further condemning actions against BJP leaders, he said, "Yeh Didigiri nahi chalegi."

headlines: People will vote out Namo-Namo, bring in Jai Bhim: Mayawati
text: BSP supremo Mayawati on Wednesday said, "I'm confident that voters will vote out 'Namo-Namo' (PM Narendra Modi)...and bring in 'Jai Bhim' (BSP)." Mayawati also claimed that Congress' NYAY scheme is not a permanent solution to eliminate poverty. "If voted to power, our government will provide permanent jobs in government and non-government sectors for the poorest in the society," she added.

headlines: FIR against Amit Shah 'mockery of democracy': Rajnath Singh
text: Union Minister Rajnath Singh has said that the FIR filed against BJP President Amit Shah for the attacks on his roadshow in West Bengal is a "mockery of democracy". He added that the TMC is "misusing the state machinery to stifle democratic rights of the people".
