Singh said state CM Mamata Banerjee "should own the responsibility" of state's prevailing situation.

headlines: Without made in Ludhiana, can't challenge made in China: Rahul
text: Addressing a rally in Punjab's Ludhiana, Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said that "without made in Ludhiana, India cannot challenge made in China". He also accused PM Narendra Modi of "destroying the strength" of the economy and the people by implementing demonetisation. Rahul further said that the people have to understand how much "the chowkidar has looted" from them.

headlines: Told UP officers to change Muharram timings, not Durga Puja: Yogi
text: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday said that last year, though Muharram procession and Durga Puja fell on the same day, he didn't allow any change in puja timings. "I said they can change Muharram procession timings but not puja timings," he added. Yogi further said, "I warned if there'll be any violence on Muharram, it'll be their last procession."

headlines: Brought me to tears: Detained Huawei CFO on staff's support
text: Huawei CFO Meng Wanzhou in a letter to the Chinese company's 1,88,000 employees said she was brought to tears after seeing them staying up all night to follow her case in distant time zones, adding it has filled her "with power". Meng has been detained in Canada since December, where she is fighting US extradition for allegedly violating Iran sanctions.

headlines: 10,000-year-old chewing gums reveal oldest Scandinavian human DNA
text: A recently published study conducted at Sweden's Stockholm University claims to have found the oldest human DNA ever sequenced from Scandinavia in ancient chewing gums spat out 10,000 years ago. Made from birch bark pitch, they contained DNA from two females and one male. The pieces came from a site on the Swedish west coast, excavated in the 1990s.

headlines: PIL claims wrong Q&As in JEE Main 2019, Guj HC seeks govt reply
text: Gujarat High Court has sought a reply from the government over a PIL claiming wrong question and answers in JEE Main 2019. The concerned Q&As appeared in Physics and Mathematics papers for Gujarati medium students on April 9 in the first shift. The court asked the MHRD and National Testing Agency (NTA) to file a reply by May 20.

headlines: Jha's remark made me uncomfortable during sex scene: Aahana
text: Speaking about her comfort with female directors, Aahana Kumra revealed while filming a sex scene for 'Lipstick Under My Burkha', the film's producer Prakash Jha visited the sets and made a remark which made her uncomfortable. Without disclosing the remark, Aahana added she approached the director Alankrita Shrivastava. She said it was "nice" of Jha to leave after Alankrita's request.

headlines: People say I'm living off Shilpa, brother-in-law: Shamita on career
text: Speaking about her failed Bollywood career, actress Shamita Shetty said, "Sometimes, there are comments on social media about how I'm being taken care of by my sister (Shilpa Shetty) and brother-in-law...Let me make it clear...I take care of myself." Talking about being compared to Shilpa, Shamita added, "I'm lucky to be compared to someone who's respected for what she does."

headlines: Students in graduation robes sell pakodas near PM's rally, held
text: Police on Tuesday detained around 12 college students for selling pakodas, wearing graduation robes near the venue of PM Narendra Modi's rally in Chandigarh. The students were selling the pakodas named after PM Modi and their degrees- Engineer, BA and LLB. "We are here to welcome Modi ji for giving us new employment under pakoda yojana," a protester said.

headlines: Mamata warned of revenge 2 days ago, fulfilled agenda in 24 hrs: PM
text: Addressing a rally in West Bengal's Basirhat on Wednesday, PM Narendra Modi blamed TMC for clashes at BJP President Amit Shah's rally and said, "Mamata didi had declared publicly two days ago that she will take revenge." He added, "She fulfilled her agenda within 24 hours." "Mamata Banerjee is high on power and wants to strangle democracy," he further said.

headlines: Time for PM Modi to pick up his 'jholi' & leave: Shatrughan Sinha
text: Taking a dig at PM Narendra Modi, former BJP and now Congress leader Shatrughan Sinha said, "It is time for him (PM Modi) to pick up his 'jholi' (bag) and go away." "Our honourable PM believes in shoot-and-scoot policy. When we ask him about employment, he talks about Pulwama...Why isn't he answering the questions people want to know," Sinha asked.

headlines: Advani ji was in tears, but didn't stop me from leaving BJP: Sinha
text: Actor-turned-politician Shatrughan Sinha, who left BJP after over 20 years and joined Congress before Lok Sabha elections, has claimed BJP veteran LK Advani had tears in his eyes when he was leaving but Advani didn't stop him. Sinha said the difference between former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee's time and PM Narendra Modi's time is the difference between democracy and autocracy.

headlines: Media loves to make tangy rumours: Kuldeep on remark about Dhoni
text: Spinner Kuldeep Yadav took to Instagram to criticise media for fabricating his remark about ex-India captain MS Dhoni. Kuldeep, who had jokingly said at an award ceremony that Dhoni goes wrong with his tips a lot of times, said that issue has been proliferated by some. "I didn't give any inappropriate statement about anyone. Much respect, Mahi bhai," he wrote.

headlines: EC a mute spectator in West Bengal, claims Amit Shah
text: A day after clashes broke out at his roadshow in Kolkata, BJP chief Amit Shah accused the Election Commission in West Bengal of having "double standards" and showing partiality towards the TMC. Shah added, "Attempts at election rigging are happening in West Bengal but the Election Commission has remained a mute spectator. It should intervene."

headlines: During polls, parties ask us to probe candidates: Detective Rajani
text: India's first female private detective, Rajani Pandit, has said whenever parties find "one of their own candidates or an opposition candidate suspicious", they ask her to investigate them. "Often we're asked to look into their finances and how they procured money to fund campaigns," she added. Pandit said her team has been busy "integrating" themselves into political parties since January.

headlines: BJP holds silent protest at Jantar Mantar after WB clashes
text: A day after clashes broke out at BJP chief Amit Shah's roadshow in Kolkata, the BJP staged a silent protest at Jantar Mantar in Delhi. Union ministers Nirmala Sitharaman, Jitendra Singh, Vijay Goel and Harsh Vardhan wore black bands and put fingers on their lips while sitting on the podium. Vardhan carried a placard saying "save Bengal, save democracy".

headlines: 31-year-old man dies after car falls into pit in Thane
text: Thirty-one-year-old Sachin Kakodkar died on Wednesday after his vehicle fell into a 15-foot-deep pit that was dug up to lay a drainage pipeline, officials said. Kakodkar was on his way home at night after meeting his friends, and when he did not return till morning, his wife traced him using GPS. He was rushed to a hospital but declared dead.

headlines: Haryana Class 12 topper had no teachers in school, scored 497/500
text: Deepak Kumar, a 17-year-old student of Government Sr Secondary School in Bhiwani, topped Haryana Board Class 12 exams after scoring 497/500. The son of a labourer said his school didn't have teachers for Physics, Chemistry and Math, adding he joined tuitions and studied for at least 10 hours every day. Deepak added he wants to be an engineer in future.

headlines: Maj Gen Dhingra appointed 1st chief of Armed Forces Special Ops
text: Sri Lanka Civil War veteran Major General AK Dhingra has been appointed as the first Chief of the Armed Forces Special Operations Division. The formation will have Special Forces commandos from the Army's Parachute Regiment, Navy's MARCOS and Air Force's Garud Commando Force. The forces will be trained together and will be tasked in dealing with specific operations.

headlines: Website morphs pic of US Sikh Mayor, shows him as dictator
text: A local website in the US photoshopped a picture of Hoboken Mayor Ravi Bhalla, superimposing it on an image of Sacha Baron Cohen's character in the movie 'The Dictator'. It accused Bhalla of "summoning all the powers" of his office to reinstitute a tax increase that was not approved by the city council. Sikh activists called the image racist.

headlines: Selena Gomez makes debut appearance at Cannes Film Festival
text: Actress-singer Selena Gomez made her debut appearance at the 72nd Cannes Film Festival, which started on May 14. She attended the screening of her upcoming film, 'The Dead Don't Die', along with fellow actors Bill Murray and Tilda Swinton, among others. Selena wore a thigh-high white slit dress by luxury brand Louis Vuitton.

headlines: Opp'n has assets worth crores, what's their source of income: PM
text: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said what is Opposition's source of income as they have assets worth crores. "Be it Congress' Naamdaar family or Bihar's corrupt family, their assets are in hundred-thousand crores. From where did the money come?" he added. "If they cared for the nation and the poor, they would not have indulged in corruption," PM further said.

headlines: TMC undemocratic, nationalist govt will rule WB after May 23: Yogi
text: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday said that West Bengal's TMC government is "undemocratic" and a nationalist government will be formed and rule Bengal after May 23. Yogi also criticised violent clashes during BJP President Amit Shah's roadshow in West Bengal and called it "murder of democracy". He alleged that state CM Mamata Banerjee is "emboldening goons" in Bengal.

headlines: I don't invest in companies but founders: Innov8 Co-founder
text: Angel investor and New Delhi-based co-working space startup Innov8 Co-founder Ritesh Malik, on being asked what qualities he looks for before investing in startups, said, "I don't invest in companies but founders." "I truly believe what can change the Indian startup ecosystem is founders investing in founders," he said, adding this was the primary reason for Silicon Valley to bloom.

headlines: Supercomputer 'brain' designed for yet to be largest telescope
text: International scientists led by Cambridge University have finished the engineering design of the 'brain', or one of two supercomputers, of the world's largest radio telescope Square Kilometre Array (SKA) after five years. The supercomputers will process data produced by SKA's telescopes. The SKA will consist of up to 3,000 dishes on completion, which will be co-hosted in Africa and Australia.

headlines: Jet Airways shares tank nearly 7% after top executives quit
text: Shares of Jet Airways fell as much as 6.8% on Wednesday, a day after three senior executives stepped down from the crisis-hit airline. Jet's CEO Vinay Dube, head of finance Amit Agarwal and head of human resources Rahul Taneja quit within a span of 24 hours. This came after Jet's lenders failed to find a majority investor for the airline.

headlines: Technical expertise not needed to transition to Analytics, says GL
text: 40% of Great Learning's PGP Business Analytics & Business Intelligence learners hail from non-technical backgrounds. But they've been able to transition into analytics and data science roles with a 48% average salary hike. PGP-BABI is India's No. 1 analytics program, offered in affiliation with UT Austin's McCombs School of Business, which is globally ranked No. 2 for analytics.

headlines: Kangana's lawyer threatened me with rape case: Aditya Pancholi
text: Actor Aditya Pancholi, who had filed a defamation case against Kangana Ranaut, has alleged the actress' lawyer threatened him with a rape case in January if he didn't take his case back. Pancholi claimed he had video recordings to prove this. Kangana's sister Rangoli had filed a complaint last month, accusing Pancholi of assaulting and exploiting Kangana 13 years ago.

headlines: Was tortured in jail, won't apologise: BJP worker in Mamata meme case
text: BJP Youth Wing Convenor Priyanka Sharma, who was arrested for sharing a meme on West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, on Wednesday said that she was "tortured" in jail. Even though the Supreme Court ordered her release on Tuesday, Sharma said she wasn't released for another 18 hours. Adding that she will fight this case, Sharma stated that she won't apologise.

headlines: Amit Shah blames TMC for roadshow violence, shows 3 pics as proof
text: BJP President Amit Shah on Wednesday accused the TMC of orchestrating violence during his roadshow in Kolkata, presenting three photographs as proof. He further alleged that TMC workers vandalised Ishwar Chandra Vidyasagar's statue inside a college. Shah held up the images showing that the college gate was intact and asserted TMC workers were inside the college, while BJP workers outside.

headlines: India frees 19 Pakistani prisoners accused of spying, illegal stay
text: As many as 19 Pakistani prisoners returned back to their country from the Attari-Wagah border after being released by Indian authorities on Tuesday. They had been put in Indian jails on charges ranging from espionage to staying in the country illegally. This comes after Pakistan released 60 Indians, including 55 fishermen, at the Wagah border on April 30.

headlines: I am a Punjabi bahu, feel at home here: Priyanka Gandhi
text: During a rally in Bathinda on Tuesday, Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra called herself a "Punjabi bahu", stating that she felt at home in Punjab and among its people. Priyanka also asked the audience, "Do you want a Prime Minister who does politics over martyrs or want to make a martyr's son the Prime Minister?"

headlines: Woman bludgeons 19-year-old daughter to death after argument
text: A woman allegedly bludgeoned her 19-year-old daughter to death with a stone in Pune following an argument, said police. The daughter had eloped with a man against her parents' wishes but later returned home following constant fights. She accused her mother of not making an effort to unite the couple, following which they argued and her mother allegedly killed her.

headlines: Indian man dies mid-flight, plane makes emergency landing in UAE
text: A Delhi-Milan flight made an emergency landing in the UAE on Monday, following the death of a 52-year-old Indian man onboard, Indian Embassy officials said. The man, who was from Rajasthan, was travelling with his 26-year-old son. A UAE hospital has issued the death certificate and the man's body will be repatriated to India hopefully by Wednesday, an official said.

headlines: Hafiz Saeed's brother-in-law and 26/11 co-conspirator Makki arrested
text: Jamaat-ud-Dawah (JuD) chief Hafiz Saeed's brother-in-law and co-conspirator of the 26/11 Mumbai attacks, Abdul Rehman Makki, has been arrested in Gujranwala for making hate speeches and criticising Pakistan government's action against banned outfits. Makki heads JuD's political and international affairs wing and is also in-charge of Falah-e-Insaniat Foundation. He has been lodged in a Lahore jail.

headlines: McDonald's in Austria to serve as mini-embassies for US tourists
text: US fast-food chain McDonald's outlets throughout Austria will help American citizens from Wednesday to get in touch with their embassy under a new partnership. "(McDonald's) staff will assist them in making contact with the US Embassy for consular services," the embassy wrote on Facebook. Consular services include reporting a lost or stolen passport or seeking travel assistance, the post said.

headlines: Teen holds Insta poll to die or live, kills self as 69% choose death
text: A 16-year-old Malaysian girl killed herself after 69% respondents voted for death on her Instagram poll asking people if she should die or not. She reportedly jumped to death from the third floor of a shop. Police said the girl was apparently suffering from depression and had posted a message on Facebook which said: 'Wanna quit f**king life I'm tired.'

headlines: US orders its non-emergency staff in Iraq to leave immediately
text: The US State Department on Wednesday ordered its non-emergency government employees in Iraq to leave the country immediately. Visa services at both the US Embassy in Baghdad and the US Consulate in Erbil will be temporarily suspended. This comes amid heightened tensions between Iran and the US, with America increasing its military presence in the Gulf.

headlines: Neither BJP nor NDA will form govt at Centre: Ghulam Nabi Azad
text: Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad on Wednesday claimed that neither the BJP nor the NDA will form the government at the Centre after the Lok Sabha elections. He added the sole objective of the Congress is installing a non-NDA government at the Centre. Azad further alleged that the BJP government has followed a "pro-rich" policy.

headlines: How can national security not be a poll issue? PM Modi
text: PM Narendra Modi criticised the Opposition saying that "mahamilavatis" say national security isn't an election issue and asked, "How can it not be one when so many people lose their lives in terrorist attacks?" Addressing a rally, he asserted that terrorism could be wiped out by an aggressive strategy. He said people's love has made him confident of a victory.

headlines: Facebook restricts live-streaming over New Zealand terror attack
text: Facebook said it's tightening rules for Live service citing the terror attack on two mosques in New Zealand's Christchurch, which claimed 51 lives. It'll apply a 'one strike' policy to prevent users who violate its most serious policies from using Live for set periods from their first offence. New Zealand's PM Jacinda Ardern called Facebook's move a "good first step".

headlines: Huawei willing to sign 'no-spy' pacts with govts: Chairman
text: Huawei Chairman Liang Hua has said the company is willing to sign 'no-spy' agreements with governments, including Britain. The UK is deciding the extent to which it will allow Huawei, the world's biggest telecoms equipment supplier, to participate in building its 5G networks. This comes amid US pressure on European countries to boycott the Chinese technology giant over espionage concerns.

headlines: Myntra-Jabong hires former YouTube exec as marketing head
text: E-commerce major Flipkart-owned fashion e-tailer Myntra-Jabong has appointed former YouTube executive Harish Narayanan as head of marketing. Narayanan will be taking over from Mithun Sundar, who currently heads revenue and marketing, and will report directly to Myntra-Jabong head Amar Nagaram. The IIM Lucknow alumnus headed B2B marketing for YouTube Asia-Pacific for over 2.5 years.

headlines: PM's legacy as Gujarat CM black spot on him & BJP: Mayawati
text: BSP supremo Mayawati criticised PM Narendra Modi saying that his legacy as Gujarat CM is "a black spot" not only on himself but also on the BJP and a "burden on the communal history of the country". Terming demonetisation the biggest scam, she said it's also an issue which needs investigation. Mayawati said the PM is "honest only on paper".

headlines: Ola invested $60 million in 15 months for international operations
text: Bengaluru-based Ola invested about $60 million in its international business over the last 15 months, as per Ola Singapore's regulatory filings. The invested amount reportedly only reflects costs of local operations, marketing and incentives as its technology, people and call centres are present in India. Ola Singapore controls Australia, New Zealand, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh and US operations.

headlines: 3 ULFA (I) militants apprehended in Assam, arms seized
text: Three ULFA (I) militants were apprehended in the Tinsukia town of Assam on Tuesday. Security forces found sophisticated arms and ammunition in their possession in the Tarani Reserve Forest. Notably, ULFA was labelled a terrorist organisation and banned by the Indian government in the year 1990.

headlines: Opposition to Thyssenkrupp JV a speed breaker: Tata Steel MD
text: Tata Steel MD and CEO TV Narendran has said the group will continue exploring business options including a merger to make its European business stronger. The European Commission's feedback on the proposed JV with Germany's Thyssenkrupp was a "speed breaker", he added. Tata Steel and Thyssenkrupp recently called off their proposed JV, expecting it to be rejected by European Commission.

headlines: Leading data scientists join Springboard's AI/ML course as mentors
text: Springboard has launched Artificial Intelligence Career Track in India after meeting 100% job guarantee for 3 years in the US. Each learner gets a personal mentor with whom they have weekly online call (1:1) to discuss their projects and progress. Springboard's mentors are from leading companies like Amazon, PhonePe, Swiggy, InMobi, Flipkart, Paytm, Myntra, and provide practical insights to learners.

headlines: PM's brother sits on dharna, seeks separate vehicle for own security
text: PM Narendra Modi's brother Prahlad Modi, who was travelling to Jaipur on Tuesday, sat on a dharna outside a police station demanding a separate vehicle for policemen escorting him, police said. An officer said two security personnel were at the police station and were supposed to sit with him, but Prahlad wasn't ready to take them along in his vehicle.

headlines: 5,000 people were at my wedding, I knew only 40-50 personally: Kapil
text: Comedian Kapil Sharma, who married Ginni Chatrath on December 12 last year, said approximately 5,000 people attended his wedding but he knew only 40-50 people personally. "You know, there were only 40 people at Saina Nehwal-Parupalli Kashyap's wedding, 40 at Virat-Anushka's wedding and 40 at Deepika-Ranveer's," said Kapil. "Are they the same 40 people who attended all weddings?" he joked.

headlines: Deepika shares meme showing her outfit as combination of Ranveer's
text: Actress Deepika Padukone on Tuesday shared a meme on her Instagram story which showed her Met Gala after party outfit as a combination of two of her husband Ranveer Singh's outfits. She wrote 'Say wha...!?' as the caption of the story. Deepika had worn a yellow dress by designer Zac Posen, paired with a jacket for the after party.

headlines: Ads are of elaichi, not tobacco: Devgn on cancer patient's appeal
text: Speaking about a fan requesting him to stop endorsing tobacco products, Ajay Devgn said, "I've...maintained in my contracts that I'm not promoting tobacco. Whatever the ads are, they are of elaichi." "If the...company is selling something else, I don't know what to do," he added. Earlier, a 40-year-old cancer patient from Rajasthan had made a public appeal to Devgn.

headlines: Game of Thrones latest episode most watched in series' history
text: The latest episode of 'Game of Thrones' is the most watched in the history of the series, with an initial tune-in figure of 12.48 million viewers, beating the previous record of 12.07 million viewers held by season seven finale. The final season has delivered four of the five most-watched episodes in Game of Thrones history, in terms of initial tune-in.

headlines: Guests ignore bride, groom to watch IPL final at wedding, video viral
text: A video of guests at a wedding ignoring bride and groom to watch the IPL 2019 final on the big screen near the stage has gone viral. In the video, guests can be seen celebrating wildly after Mumbai Indians' victory on the last ball of the match. Mumbai Indians also shared the viral video on Twitter, writing, "Cricket. Meri. Jaan."

headlines: Just f*ck off: Congress' senior leader Aiyar abuses journalist
text: After a journalist questioned senior Congress leader Mani Shankar Aiyar about his "neech" jibe at PM Narendra Modi, Aiyar abused the journalist saying, "Just f*ck off." The incident's video shows Aiyar calling PM Modi a "coward" and telling the journalist to ask questions from the PM. The journalist could be heard apologising to Aiyar, asking him not to be mad.

headlines: CRPF bans troops from playing PUBG, says it deprives them of sleep
text: The CRPF has recently instructed its commanding officers to ban troops from playing the online multiplayer game, PUBG Mobile, reportedly stating that the game's addiction has affected the jawans' operational capabilities. A senior official said jawans have stopped socialising with fellow personnel because of the game, which is also leading to sleep deprivation because of reduced physical activity.

headlines: India repatriates 13 Pak nationals through Attari-Wagah border
text: India on Tuesday released 13 Pakistani prisoners, including nine civil prisoners and four fishermen, Pakistan's High Commission to India said in a statement. The prisoners were handed over to the Pakistani authorities through the Attari-Wagah border. This comes after Pakistan last month released a total of 360 Indian prisoners.

headlines: 4 inmates of juvenile home break windows, escape; 8 staffers held
text: Four inmates have escaped from a juvenile remand home in Bihar's Nalanda district by breaking the window panes in their rooms. At least eight staff members have been arrested for negligence of duty in connection with the matter. Reportedly, the boys were involved in a series of serious crimes, including murder, rape and kidnapping.

headlines: Doctors remove bike handle piece from woman's uterus; husband held
text: Doctors at a hospital in Madhya Pradesh have removed a six-inch piece of plastic of a bike handle from a 36-year-old woman's uterus that her husband had allegedly inserted two years ago, police said. According to her complaint, her husband had inserted the piece in a fit of rage. The accused, who works with a music band, has been arrested.

headlines: Doctors remove 116 iron nails, wire from man's stomach in Rajasthan
text: Doctors at the Bundi government hospital in Rajasthan have removed 116 iron nails, long wire and an iron pellet from the stomach of a 42-year-old man. A surgeon said most nails measured 6.5 cm and it took an hour-and-a-half to remove all the objects. The patient couldn't narrate how he happened to swallow the objects, the surgeon said.

headlines: 5 Christian families face social boycott, ration denial in Jharkhand
text: Five families in Latehar district of Jharkhand are facing social boycott and are reportedly denied ration and other government benefits for embracing Christianity in 2012. In a Gram Sabha held last month, the village head asked them to reconvert to Sarnaism, an indigenous tribal religion characterised by nature worship, but they refused, following which the decision was taken.

headlines: Senior sub-inspector found dead at police training camp in Delhi
text: A senior sub-inspector (SSI) of the Delhi Police was found dead inside a police training centre in the capital city on Tuesday night. According to the preliminary investigation, the 51-year-old police officer died due to a heart attack. However, a post-mortem will be conducted to ascertain the cause of death.

headlines: Commander asked me if I need sex every day: Air India female pilot
text: A female Air India pilot has accused a commander of the same airline of sexually harassing her in Hyderabad. Mentioning that the incident happened when they went for dinner at a restaurant, she added, "He...asked me how I coped with my husband living away and whether I didn't need...sex every day." The airline has initiated an inquiry into the matter.

headlines: Don't meddle in next US Prez polls, it's unacceptable: US to Russia
text: On his first trip to Russia as US Secretary of State, Mike Pompeo on Tuesday said he warned Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov against any Russian meddling in next US Presidential elections. "I made clear...that interference in American elections is unacceptable. If the Russians were engaged in that...it would put our relationship in an even worse place," Pompeo asserted.

headlines: I call myself gareebo ka Hrithik Roshan: Tiger Shroff
text: Actor Tiger Shroff, when asked about working with Hrithik Roshan in their upcoming film, said he is intimidated by Hrithik as he is his idol. "I am facing my hero...I call myself gareebo ka Hrithik Roshan, so there is already a comparison there," he added. Tiger further said it's an honour to stand in the same frame as Hrithik.

headlines: Only a Bengali will be CM if BJP wins West Bengal: Amit Shah
text: Addressing a gathering of intellectuals in the outskirts of Kolkata, BJP chief Amit Shah said, "If BJP comes to power, a Bengali gentleman or lady is going to be CM." He added, "Neither I nor (BJP National General Secretary) Kailash Vijayvargiya is going to contest elections here...All our MPs will be those carrying the fragrance of the soil of Bengal."

headlines: 680 kg of poppy straw seized in J&K's Kathua, one arrested
text: The Jammu and Kashmir police on Tuesday seized 680 kg of poppy straw from a truck in Kathua and arrested the truck driver. An FIR under the relevant sections was registered against the driver, who was identified as Kulvinder Singh from Punjab. Meanwhile, the police termed the seizure a major success.

headlines: Japan takes India to WTO over mobile phone import duties
text: Japan has complained at the World Trade Organization (WTO) about India's duties of 20% on mobile phones. Japan's complaint said India sought to foster domestic production by adjusting taxes including customs duties, especially since the launch of 'Make in India' campaign. India violated its WTO membership terms which specify a zero percent tariff on mobile phones, Japan further claimed.

headlines: India to decide on Iran oil imports after elections: Reports
text: India reportedly told Iran it will decide on its oil imports after elections at the end of this month. This comes after External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj held talks on the issue with her Iranian counterpart Javad Zarif on Tuesday. India has suspended imports of Iranian oil after its waiver from US sanctions on Iran ended in May.

headlines: RBI appoints ex-Deputy Governor R Gandhi to Yes Bank board
text: Yes Bank on Tuesday said the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has appointed former Deputy Governor R Gandhi as an additional director on the private lender's board. Gandhi, who served as RBI Deputy Governor from April 2014 to April 2017, has been appointed for a period of two years. He joined digital payments major Paytm as an advisor last year.

headlines: Mahamilawatis will give free license to tukde-tukde gang, naxals: PM
text: Addressing a rally in Bihar's Buxar, PM Narendra Modi while referring to Opposition, said, "The mahamilawatis, if elected to power, will give free licenses to stone-pelters, naxals and tukde-tukde gang." He claimed that it was his government that took on the terrorists on both sides of India-Pakistan border. PM added that Congress and RJD will push 21st-century India into darkness.

headlines: BJP leader shoots cousin thrice for voting for Congress in Haryana
text: Dharmender Silani, a mandal-level BJP leader from Haryana's Jhajjar, shot at his own cousin Raja Singh after he voted for the Congress party. Silani, who is absconding, shot at Singh thrice, twice on his legs and on his stomach, with an unlicensed weapon. Polling in Haryana took place on May 12 in the 6th phase of 2019 Lok Sabha elections.

headlines: Punjab CM denied Amritsar Lok Sabha ticket to me: Sidhu's wife
text: Congress leader Navjot Kaur Sidhu, the wife of Punjab minister Navjot Singh Sidhu, said she was denied the ticket to contest from Amritsar Lok Sabha constituency because of Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh and party in-charge for Punjab Asha Kumari. She added that they think she cannot win the election after the Dussehra train tragedy in Amritsar last year.

headlines: Hamilton sends F1 car, trophy to 5-yr-old fan dying from cancer
text: Mercedes' British driver Lewis Hamilton sent his Mercedes race car to the home of five-year-old English boy Harry Shaw, who has a rare form of bone cancer and was given one week to live. Hamilton, who won Spanish Grand Prix on Sunday, said he dedicated the victory to Harry Shaw after being so inspired by him.

headlines: Liverpool fans cheer as Mo Salah's daughter scores goal at Anfield
text: The crowd at Anfield, Liverpool's home ground, gave Mohamed Salah's daughter an ovation after she charged down the field and knocked ball into an empty goal. In a video, that went viral on social media, Salah can be seen watching his daughter score, from the touchline while holding his Golden Boot trophy. Salah scored 22 goals in Premier League 2018/19.

headlines: Don't compare Kohli's IPL and India captaincy records: Ganguly
text: Ex-India captain Sourav Ganguly has insisted that Virat KohliÂ’s IPL captaincy will not have an impact in the 2019 World Cup. "DonÂ’t compare Virat KohliÂ’s IPL captaincy record with that of India. His captaincy records for India is very good actually. HeÂ’s got him (Rohit) in his team as the vice-captain. Dhoni is there. So, heÂ’s well supported," Ganguly added.

headlines: I don't have time for negativity in my life: Dhawan on criticism
text: Talking about criticism of his technique and form, India opener Shikhar Dhawan said that he is not that sort of a guy who feels the pressure. "I have the ability to remain unfazed. And critics? Woh apna kaam kar rahein hain (They are doing their job)," he added. "I don't have time for negativity in my life," he further said.

headlines: Aiyar's 'neech' remark an attempt to make news headlines: Congress
text: Congress has condemned senior leader Mani Shankar Aiyar's recent justification of "neech" remark against PM Narendra Modi in an article, saying it was an attempt to make news headlines. "Hatred, violence and abuse are the modus operandi of Shri Narendra Modi and BJP...not Congress," said spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala. Aiyar was temporarily suspended by Congress in 2017 over the remark.

headlines: Woman tries to take pic of Merkel's plane, rams van into aircraft
text: German Chancellor Angela Merkel's plane was grounded in Dortmund after a woman rammed her van into the aircraft as she jumped out to take a photo of the plane but forgot to put the handbrake on. The windshield of the van shattered and the nose of the jet was damaged. Merkel had to return to Berlin by helicopter.

headlines: Punjab Minister calls PM Narendra Modi 'circus ka sher'
text: Punjab Minister Manpreet Singh on Tuesday called PM Narendra Modi "circus ka sher". "PM Modi calls himself 'hindustan ka sher', he must be but lions are also of two kinds. One is the lion of a jungle and the other one is of a circus," Singh said. "So hume toh yeh circus ke sher lagte hain," the Minister added.

headlines: I will die but never insult his mother, father: Rahul to PM
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said, "PM Narendra Modi talks with hatred. He insults my father, grandmother, great grandfather...I'll die but will never insult his mother and father." He further said Congress will defeat PM Modi "with love". "This is because I'm not from RSS or BJP, but from Congress...We'll defeat Modiji with love and hugs," he added.

headlines: Congress annoyed that 'chaiwala' bringing reforms: PM Modi
text: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that the Congress was annoyed that a "chaiwala" was bringing about reforms in the country. He added, "When inflation was breaking the back of the middle class, the Congress was thinking 'hua to hua'." He said that the Congress has "always insulted the middle class" while the BJP government has given "respect" to them.

headlines: MS Dhoni most tweeted about player in IPL 2019, Virat Kohli second
text: Chennai Super Kings captain MS Dhoni was the most tweeted about player during Indian Premier League 2019, as per Twitter data. Dhoni was followed by Royal Challengers Bangalore captain Virat Kohli and Mumbai Indians captain Rohit Sharma. Further, this year, Twitter saw a record breaking 27 million tweets related to IPL, a 44% increase over 2018Â’s IPL-related tweets.

headlines: RSS people were doing 'chamchagiri' of Britishers: Priyanka
text: Addressing a rally in Punjab, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi said that when Punjab was fighting for the country's independence, RSS people were doing "chamchagiri" (flattery) of Britishers. She added that the RSS "never fought in the independence movement". She said that the people should defeat PM Narendra Modi-led government and previous Akali Dal government in Punjab in the general elections.

headlines: Bengal will never forgive: TMC to Shah on roadshow violence
text: Trinamool Congress on Tuesday alleged that BJP goons were responsible for violence during BJP President Amit Shah's Kolkata roadshow. "How little you know about Bengal, its rich history, its culture. Bengal will never forgive for what you did today," TMC's Derek O'Brien tweeted. During the violent clashes, Ishwar Chandra Vidyasagar's statue inside the Vidyasagar College was also vandalised.

headlines: Imran Tahir signs for Surrey for English T20 tournament
text: South African leg-spinner Imran Tahir will be Surrey's second overseas player in this summer's T20 Blast competition. "Surrey are a massive club and it will be great if I can contribute to helping them win another trophy," Tahir said. The 40-year-old, who was part of the Chennai Super Kings in IPL 2019, has taken over 300 wickets in T20 cricket.

headlines: Imam 1st Pak batsman to score 150 runs in an ODI in England
text: Opener Imam-ul-Haq became the first Pakistani batsman to score 150 runs in an ODI in England after registering a 131-ball 151 against England in the third ODI today. This was the 23-year-old's sixth ODI ton, helping Pakistan put up 358/9 in the first innings. Imam was dismissed on the second ball of the 46th over.

headlines: Mumbai-based VC firm InnoVen to get $200M from Temasek, UOB
text: Mumbai-based venture lending firm InnoVen Capital has received a $200-million commitment from existing shareholders, Singapore government investment firm Temasek and United Overseas Bank. InnoVen Capital has so far supported over 200 startups with over $500 million in debt funding. Temasek had acquired Indian venture debt business of Silicon Valley Bank in 2015, the spin-out of which was InnoVen.

headlines: Class 12 student raped by minor in Bihar's Gaya
text: A Class 12 student was allegedly raped by a minor boy in Bihar's Gaya district on Tuesday, police said. The police added that the girl was returning after attending tuition class when the accused dragged her to a secluded place and allegedly raped her. Police are conducting raids to nab the culprit who is absconding, SSP Rajeev Mishra said.

headlines: Gujarat bans cake smearing in public places on birthdays
text: Gujarat Police on Monday issued prohibitory orders regarding smearing cake, adhesive tapes, throwing foam or chemicals during birthday celebrations in public spaces. The order was issued after instances of people getting thrashed for fun during celebrations in public places came to light. The police emphasised that they can arrest any person found violating this notification.

headlines: India fears trade war could cause dumping of Chinese steel: Reports
text: India fears China could start dumping excess steel into its market after the US raised tariffs on Chinese products, reports said. India's steel industry has asked the government to levy duties of 25% to protect it from growing imports. These would be imposed on steel that government determines has been dumped in India at prices below the cost of production.

headlines: No petrol for bikers without helmets in Noida from June 1
text: Two-wheeler riders without helmets won't get fuel at filling stations in Noida and Greater Noida from June 1, district administration has announced. The order is set to be rolled out in rural areas of Gautam Buddh Nagar afterwards. The district administration also warned legal action, including suspension of driving licence, and arrest if riders misbehave with staff at petrol pumps.

headlines: Student eats free KFC for a year posing as head office employee, held
text: A 27-year-old student at the University of KwaZulu-Natal in South Africa has been arrested after he ate free KFC for a year. He used to eat free meals by claiming he's a food quality inspector from the head office. He visited KFC outlets wearing a suit and often in a limousine, driven by a friend working as part-time limousine driver.

headlines: Googling 'Bad Writers' shows GoT writers after latest episode
text: A Google search for 'Bad Writers' shows 'Game of Thrones' creators David Benioff and DB Weiss after the latest episode. This was after Reddit users named a thread as 'Bad Writers' alongside an image of Weiss and Benioff and asked users to like it, making it show up on top of a Google search. This effect is called 'Google bombing'.

headlines: Actress Chhavi Hussein gives birth to boy in 10th month of pregnancy
text: Television actress Chhavi Hussein gave birth to a baby boy on Monday after entering the tenth month of pregnancy. "I'm still in...hospital recovering, and will be sharing my birth story soon," she wrote on Instagram. On Mother's Day, Chhavi had shared a post in which she had written, "There's still no sign of labour...We might have to artificially induce it."

headlines: How dare you? Huma to website over article calling her Sohail's ex
text: Actress Huma Qureshi has criticised an entertainment news website for an article calling her Sohail Khan's ex-girlfriend and adding that Sohail and his wife ignored her during a film screening. The article said that Sohail's rumoured closeness to Huma had created trouble in his marriage. "You need to apologise to all of us!!...How dare you malign my reputation?" she tweeted.

headlines: News channels showed PM Modi for 722 hours in April, Rahul 252: BARC
text: PM Narendra Modi received about three times more airtime than Congress President Rahul Gandhi during the April 1-28 period, Broadcast Audience Research Council revealed. PM Modi was shown by top 11 Hindi news channels for over 722 hours, while Rahul was shown for around 252 hours. This was despite PM Modi addressing one rally less than Rahul during the period.

headlines: Video of boy crying over MS Dhoni's run-out in IPL final goes viral
text: A video of a boy from Tamil Nadu crying over CSK captain MS Dhoni's run-out dismissal in the IPL 2019 final has gone viral. In the video, the boy can be heard telling his mother, "Third umpire will commit suicide for the wrong decision." The boy's mother can be seen calming him down by saying it could be "match-fixing".

headlines: Hardik's 'my brother' tweet for Dhoni named IPL 2019's Golden Tweet
text: Mumbai Indians all-rounder Hardik Pandya's tweet acknowledging Chennai Super Kings captain MS Dhoni as his friend and source of inspiration has been named as the Golden Tweet of IPL 2019. "My inspiration, my friend, my brother, my legend," Pandya had captioned his photo with Dhoni after the Qualifier 1. The tweet has received over 16,000 retweets so far.

headlines: US player to miss French Open after dentist discovers she has cancer
text: American tennis player Nicole Gibbs has withdrawn from the French Open after a visit to her dentist resulted in cancer diagnosis. The 26-year-old revealed that her dentist had alerted her about a growth on the roof of her mouth, which was later found out to be a rare salivary gland cancer. She added that she will undergo surgery on Friday.

headlines: Each team to have dedicated anti-corruption officer at World Cup
text: In a first, each of the 10 participating teams at the upcoming Cricket World Cup will have a dedicated anti-corruption officer attached with it to deliver a corruption-free tournament. The official will be assigned from the warm-up matches to the end of the competition and will be staying in the same hotel as the players.

headlines: US runner wins 400m hurdles after Superman-like dive at finish line
text: American college hurdler Infinite Tucker won the 400-metre hurdles by executing a Superman-like dive at the finish line. The 20-year-old clocked 49.38 seconds and won the race by 0.09 seconds against second-placed Robert Grant. "I closed my eyes over hurdle 10...opened it, saw my ma at the finish, and...jumped to give her a hug, that's all it is," he said.

headlines: Tiger Woods, girlfriend sued over employee's drunk driving death
text: American golfer Tiger Woods and his girlfriend Erica Herman have been sued by the family of an employee of his restaurant who died in a drunk driving crash. The lawsuit claims the employee was over-served before the crash happened. The management ignored the employee was an alcoholic and "fueled" it by letting him drink to the point of severe intoxication.

headlines: Jet Airways CEO, CFO, HR Head, Company Secretary quit in a day
text: Jet Airways CEO Vinay Dube, CFO Amit Agarwal, Chief People Officer Rahul Taneja, and Company Secretary and Compliance Head Kuldeep Sharma have all quit within a day. The airline has also lost hundreds of pilots, cabin crew and engineers to rivals and seen its slots reallocated to rivals. Jet stopped flying from April 17 after it ran out of cash.

headlines: Frustrated TMC goons attacked roadshow: Shah on WB clashes
text: After violent clashes erupted at BJP President Amit Shah's roadshow in West Bengal, Shah claimed that seeing the people's response towards the roadshow, TMC goons got "frustrated" and attacked it. He added that he condemns the violence that Mamata Banerjee's party is doing. Shah said, "It's necessary to oust TMC once to put an end to violence in Bengal."

headlines: Sachin meets BCCI ombudsman in conflict of interest case
text: Former Indian cricketer Sachin Tendulkar appeared before the BCCI Ombudsman and former Justice DK Jain in Delhi on Tuesday in regards to a conflict of interest case. Earlier this month, Tendulkar had rejected the conflict of interest charges levelled against him and wrote a letter to BCCI, asking about the details of the charges.

headlines: Apple faces consumer lawsuit over 30% commission on App Store
text: The US Supreme Court has ruled against Apple on a case involving if iPhone users can file a lawsuit over its 30% commission fee on App Store sales. The consumers said Apple is unfairly using its monopoly alleging the commission is charged from users. Apple said App Store only provides a platform for app developers and didn't sell apps itself.

headlines: Breaking up Facebook won't solve issues: Zuckerberg to Co-founder
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg, responding to Co-founder Chris Hughes' call to break up the social media giant, said, "What he's proposing that we do isn't going to do anything to help solve issues." Mark has too much power and no accountability for mistakes, Hughes had said, adding his "focus on growth led him to sacrifice security and civility for clicks".

headlines: Twitter shares iOS user location with ad partner, apologises
text: Twitter has apologised saying it has fixed a bug that caused it to inadvertently collect and share some users' location data with one of its advertising partners. It affected some people who had used more than one account on its iOS app. Twitter said the partner has deleted the information and user identities were not compromised.

headlines: Moon shrinking like raisin, likely causing Moonquakes: Study
text: A new study based on NASA's Apollo mission data suggests the Moon continues to gradually cool and shrink. NASA said as the Moon shrinks, 'like a raisin', it forms "thrust faults" where one section of the crust is pushed up over a neighbouring part. "Our analysis gives the first evidence that these faults are still active...likely producing Moonquakes," scientists said.

headlines: Below normal Monsoon likely to hit Kerala on June 4: Skymet
text: Weather forecasting company Skymet on Tuesday said that Monsoon 2019 is likely to be "below normal" and is likely to hit Kerala coast on June 4. Skymet added that the country is likely to receive 93% rainfall of the long period average for the four-month period from June to September. The Monsoon delivers about 70% of India's annual rainfall.

headlines: India FY20 sugar output to decline 8.4%: US Agriculture Dept
text: India's FY20 sugar production is expected to fall 8.4% to 30.3 million tonnes, the US Department of Agriculture attachÃ© in New Delhi said. The output is expected to fall as the area under harvest contracts and the average sugar recovery rate is declining, he said. Further, ethanol production is becoming an increasingly attractive option for cane mills, he added.

headlines: India postpones retaliatory tariffs on US goods to June 16
text: The government on Tuesday again deferred the imposition of retaliatory tariffs worth $230 million on US products by a month to June 16. India had announced higher tariffs on 29 US products including apples and walnuts to counter the US move to raise duties on Indian steel and aluminium products. The tariffs have been delayed several times since June 2018.

headlines: OnePlus 7, OnePlus 7 Pro launched globally
text: OnePlus has unveiled the new OnePlus 7 Series at the Bangalore International Exhibition Centre, Bengaluru. Featuring a curved display, triple rear camera setup and UFS3.0 flash storage, OnePlus 7 Pro comes with a 200% more powerful vibration motor than the past OnePlus engines. Further, the smartphone's notch-less HDR10 AMOLED display received the highest A+ rating by DisplayMate.

headlines: Shocked at student suicide over marks, IAS shares own school marks
text: Awanish Sharan, an IAS officer posted in Chhattisgarh, shared his Class 10th, Class 12th and graduation marks online after a student committed suicide because of unexpected result in the exam. The IAS officer secured 44.5% in Class 10th, 65% in Class 12th and 60.7% marks in graduation. "Don't take the result very seriously! It's just a number game," he said.

headlines: Didn't want to accept award: Saif as troll says he bought Padma Shri
text: Responding to a troll who said he bought his Padma Shri, Saif Ali Khan said, "There are so many senior, talented people in the industry who don't have it that I didn't feel like accepting it...I wanted to give it back." "My father told me 'I don't think you are in a position to refuse the Indian government'," he added.

headlines: His knee cap is our cup: CSK on Watson's bloodied knee in IPL final
text: After it was revealed that opener Shane Watson played the IPL 2019 with a bloodied knee, CSK dedicated a Twitter post to him. "The emotions that all the #yellove hearts are going through makes us #believe in one thing! Watto's knee cap is our cup!" CSK wrote. The 37-year-old received six stitches after the final, in which he top-scored.

headlines: IBM fires 300 India employees in a bid to 're-invent' itself
text: American IT giant IBM has fired around 300 employees from its India software services division. "This is in accordance with IBM's strategy to re-invent itself," IBM said, adding it's shifting its focus to emerging technology areas like Artificial Intelligence. It further added that fired employees willing to be retained in these areas will be given the option to do so.

headlines: Uber trials first come, first served PIN service at US airport
text: Uber is piloting a new feature at US' Portland International Airport that will give riders a one-time code in an effort to speed up pickups and reduce traffic. The user can book a ride following which a PIN would be generated. The rider can show the PIN to the first available driver in the pickup lane to avail the trip.

headlines: Bird on Indian Ocean island lost ability to fly twice: Study
text: A study has shown that the last surviving flightless species of a bird, presently found in Indian Ocean's Aldabra island had reappeared after going extinct over 1,36,000 years ago. The white-throated rail had evolved to become flightless but went extinct after their island submerged in the ocean. Scientists found fossils showing it became flightless again around 1,20,000 years ago.

headlines: Sri Lanka blasts suspect was under India's surveillance: Report
text: Aadhil Ameez, a Sri Lankan engineer suspected of being a key planner of the Easter Sunday serial blasts, was reportedly under the surveillance of Indian agencies over his links with Islamic State operatives. He's also been named in two chargesheets filed by the NIA against the suspected operatives as being one of their contacts, Reuters said quoting Indian officials.

headlines: Bought 36 Rafales instead of 126 due to financial position: Gadkari
text: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari in an interview has said that the NDA government bought 36 Rafale jets instead of 126 that the previous UPA government decided because of "financial availability". "Suppose, [afterwards] if there is an availability of new technology, new plane with a cheaper price then we are free to purchase that, why we should purchase Rafale?" added Gadkari.

headlines: Oil prices rise after explosive-laden drones attack Saudi pipeline
text: Oil prices rose on Tuesday after explosive-laden drones attacked two pumping stations belonging to Saudi state oil company Aramco, in what the kingdom said was an act of terrorism that targeted the global oil supply. Oil production or exports have not been disrupted due to the attacks. Earlier, two Saudi oil tankers were attacked off the UAE's eastern coast.

headlines: US is a piggy bank that everyone wants to raid: Trump
text: Criticising China amid the ongoing trade war between the two countries, US President Donald Trump tweeted that his country is a "piggy bank that everyone wants to raid and take advantage of". He added the US is "in a fantastic position" in trade negotiations with China. Trump's remarks come after China raised tariffs on US goods in a tit-for-tat move.

headlines: Will 'clean up' economic data gathering if we win: Congress
text: Senior Congress leader P Chidambaram has said his party will "clean up" economic data collecting and data interpreting process if it wins the election. A government study found that 38% of companies in the database used in GDP calculations could not be traced or were wrongly classified. The government said that extent of GDP overestimation "in all likelihood is marginal".

headlines: SP, BSP are thieves, like to loot in dark: UP CM Adityanath
text: Addressing a rally in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia, CM Yogi Adityanath alleged that the SP and BSP ensured that there's no electricity in Ballia because they're "thieves" and it's convenient for them to "loot in dark". Yogi said that with the Balakot airstrike, PM Narendra Modi showed how to safeguard the nation. Yogi added PM Modi has changed India's face globally.

headlines: TMC removed posters before Amit Shah's Kolkata roadshow: BJP
text: Ahead of Amit Shah's roadshow in Kolkata on Tuesday, party's posters and flags were removed by TMC workers, BJP alleged. After this, BJP workers, led by party leader Kailash Vijayvargiya, staged protests against Mamata Banerjee government's "anarchy" rule in the state. "Mamata ji's goons and police removed all the posters and flags. They escaped soon after we reached," alleged Vijayvargiya.

headlines: Daniele De Rossi to leave AS Roma after 18 years at club
text: AS Roma midfielder Daniele De Rossi is set to end his 18-year-long playing career at the club at the end of this season, the club said in a statement on Tuesday. De Rossi, who who joined the club in 2000, has made 615 appearances and scored 63 goals in all competitions. Rossi's last match will be against Parma.

headlines: Australia pick 16-year-old Mary Fowler for World Cup
text: Australia women's football team coach Ante Milicic has selected 16-year-old forward Mary Fowler to represent the nation at next month's World Cup in France. "This is a special group of Australian footballers because, as a unit, they have accumulated a wealth of international experience despite the average age of the team being quite young," Milicic said.

headlines: You're too short to talk: Ronaldo to opponent who later scored
text: Juventus' Cristiano Ronaldo taunted Roma's Alessandro Florenzi, saying, "You're too short to talk", following which Florenzi scored his side's first goal in Roma's 2-0 win over Juventus on Monday. After his altercation with Ronaldo in the 58th minute, Florenzi celebrated his 79th-minute goal with a gesture inspired by 'Spiderman'.

headlines: Our roads will be same as Facebook, Amazon: Uber CEO on IPO
text: Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi, in a note to employees, said Facebook and Amazon had faced post-IPO trading issues similar to what the ride-hailing giant is facing now. "Look at how they've delivered since," he said, adding, "Our roads will be the same". Uber's market capitalisation fell to around $62.2 billion on Monday, down from IPO-price valuation of over $82 billion.

headlines: US lawsuit accuses seven Indian drug makers of fixing prices
text: Seven Indian drug makers, including Sun Pharmaceutical Industries, Dr Reddy's Laboratories and Zydus Cadila, have been named in a price-fixing lawsuit in the US. The antitrust lawsuit, which accuses Israel's Teva Pharmaceutical Industries of orchestrating a conspiracy to raise medicine prices, was recently filed by over 40 US states. It is based on a five-year investigation of the firms.

headlines: Services restored at Kolkata airport 9 hours after breakdown
text: Services at the Kolkata airport were restored nine hours after several passengers were left stranded due to technical glitches in the airport's check-in system, an official said on Tuesday. The snag affected the operations of Flight Information Display System and cameras. Around 30 flights were delayed by an average of 20-25 minutes as boarding passes had to be issued manually.

headlines: Vikas Oberoi plans to sell stake in prime Mumbai project
text: Oberoi Realty Chairman Vikas Oberoi plans to sell his 50% stake in an upcoming project in Mumbai's prime Worli area, to investors. "The thought is to elegantly get out [of the project] in a way there is absolute transparency," Oberoi said. The project, comprising a luxury shopping mall, hotel and office building, is being built over a 4-acre land parcel.

headlines: Jet Airways CEO Vinay Dube resigns with immediate effect
text: Jet Airways CEO Vinay Dube has resigned from the grounded airline with immediate effect due to "personal reasons". The development comes just a day after Deputy CEO and Chief Financial Officer of the company Amit Agarwal resigned, also citing personal reasons. Jet Airways, which suspended its operations indefinitely, has only received a bid from Etihad Airways for a minority stake.

headlines: Wearing whatever the hell I want to: Malavika Mohanan to trolls
text: Actress Malavika Mohanan has responded to trolls commenting on a photo which shows her wearing tank top and shorts. "So many comments and opinions about how 'a respectable girl should dress'," she wrote while sharing another picture in the same outfit. "Take one more picture of me sitting very respectably wearing whatever the hell I want to wear," she added.

headlines: Cong claims PM's 'cloud radar' interview was scripted, shares video
text: Congress leader Divya Spandana shared a video clip from PM Narendra Modi's interview, wherein he made "clouds can save jets from radar" remark, and claimed that the interview was scripted. The clip shows PM Modi reading out his poem from a paper that had the interviewer's question, which he asked a few seconds ago, already written on it.

headlines: India's GS Lakshmi becomes first ever female ICC match referee
text: India's GS Lakshmi has become the first ever woman to be appointed to the ICC International Panel of Match Referees and will be eligible to referee international games with immediate effect. The 50-year-old first officiated as a match referee in domestic women's cricket in 2008/09. Lakshmi has overseen three women's ODI matches and three women's T20I matches.

headlines: CRPF's Pulwama survivor feeds his lunch to paralytic child, video viral
text: A CRPF Head Constable named Iqbal Singh fed his lunch to a paralytic child in Srinagar on Monday, a video of which has gone viral on the internet. He was driving a vehicle in the CRPF convoy on February 14 at the time of Pulwama terrorist attack. He has been awarded DG's Commendation Disc and Commendation Certificate for his act.

headlines: Kerala teacher writes exam for Class 12 students, 3 suspended
text: A teacher from Kerala's Neeleswaram Government Higher Secondary School has been suspended for writing the English papers for two Class 12 students. He also corrected the Computer Science answer sheets of students of his school to help them secure higher scores. Another teacher, who was the Deputy Chief of examination at the school, and the principal were also suspended.

headlines: Indian origin woman convicted of killing 9-yr-old stepdaughter in US
text: An Indian origin woman in her mid-fifties, Shamdai Arjun, was on Friday found guilty of murdering her nine-year-old stepdaughter in 2016 by a jury in Queens, New York. Arjun, who strangled the child and left her naked body in a bathtub, has been charged with second-degree murder. She faces a sentence of up to 25 years in jail.

headlines: Iran's Foreign Minister meets Swaraj in India amid US sanctions
text: Iran's Foreign Minister Javad Zarif met his Indian counterpart Sushma Swaraj in Delhi on Tuesday during his two-day visit to the country. His visit comes amid increased tensions with the US in the wake of renewed sanctions. India has reportedly stopped imports of Iranian oil after the US withdrew waivers granted to nations on the imports.

headlines: NZ 1st country to measure its success based on citizens' well-being
text: New Zealand has claimed that it is set to become the world's first country to measure its success based on the well-being of its citizens. Under the first 'well-being budget' to be presented later this month, the New Zealand government will give special emphasis to mental health. Notably, Bhutan also measures its citizens' happiness levels while calculating its success.

headlines: Zuckerberg made his 1st messaging program ZuckNet at age 12
text: Facebook Co-founder and CEO Mark Zuckerberg had created his first messaging system called 'ZuckNet' at the age of 12, which was used by his family to communicate within the house. It was also used by his father in his dental office to let his receptionist inform him about a patient without shouting. The Harvard University dropout turns 35 today.

headlines: Prove that I'm corrupt: PM challenges 'mahamilavati' leaders
text: PM Narendra Modi challenged the Opposition saying that if they've "guts" then "mahamilavati" leaders should prove his involvement in any corruption scam. PM Modi added, "Prove that I've any property in any foreign land, bungalows worth crores, high-end cars worth lakhs...crores of rupees." PM Modi said that the welfare of the poor is more important than his life for him.

headlines: Every Kashi resident contesting for and as Narendra Modi: PM
text: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday released video message for the people of Varanasi. In the video, PM Modi said that after his Varanasi roadshow, he was sure that "every Kashi (Varanasi) resident is fighting elections for and as Modi". "In moulding me and giving direction to my political and spiritual being, Kashi has a huge influence on me," he added.

headlines: WWE does not need me: John Cena on his wrestling career
text: John Cena, 16-time WWE world champion, said, "The WWE does not need me. I need it and I love it, and I love every single moment I'm associated with it." "I'm older now. I just turned 42, I watch WWE on a regular basis and the talent is getting faster and more precise," Cena said about the WWE.

headlines: Dutch GP to return to Formula One after 35 years
text: The Dutch Grand Prix is set to return in 2020 after an absence of 35 years. The Dutch circuit of Zandvoort will be the second new track to be added to the calendar in 2020, following the announcement of a race in the Vietnamese capital Hanoi. Notably, five races are out of contract at the end of this season.

headlines: Valencia leaves Manchester United after 10 years at the club
text: Club captain Antonio Valencia played his final game for Manchester United against Cardiff City, ending his 10-year-long stint at the club. Valencia made 339 appearances for the club, winning the Premier League twice and claiming the Europa League title with the club once. Valencia had made his debut under Sir Alex Ferguson.

headlines: Nitish, BJP involved in sending my father to jail: Tejashwi
text: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Tuesday alleged that Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and BJP were involved in sending his father Lalu Prasad Yadav to jail. "The court will decide whether he will come out of jail rather than [Nitish] Kumar or PM Narendra Modi," he added. Lalu is currently imprisoned in multi-crore fodder scam cases.

headlines: Pak can take India's help to wipe out terrorism: Rajnath
text: Union Minister Rajnath Singh said that Pakistan should announce that terrorism will be "wiped out completely" from their country and if needed, it can take India's "help" for this. He added if such a statement comes, then India will believe that Pakistan PM Imran Khan wants to normalise relations with India. He said India will "wholeheartedly support" Pakistan's such step.

headlines: 'Beti darao, balatkari bachao' is BJP govt's agenda: Cong
text: Congress spokesperson Jaiveer Shergill said that agenda of BJP government is not "Beti bachao, beti padhao" but rather "Beti darao, balatkari bachao". He said this in reference to a woman from Uttar Pradesh who set herself on fire after allegedly being gangraped and turned away by police. Shergill further accused BJP of not providing help to the woman on time.

headlines: Wholesale inflation eases to 3.07% in April
text: India's inflation measured by the Wholesale Price Index (WPI) eased to 3.07% in April from 3.18% in the previous month, driven by a fall in prices of fuel and manufactured items. However, inflation in food articles stood at 7.37%, up from 5.68% in March. This comes after India's retail inflation in April rose to a 6-month high of 2.92%.

headlines: India Today Group presents comic web series on news industry
text: 'Prime Time News on Fire' spoofs the gimmicky, ill-founded news reporting. Part of India Today Group's appeal to #SaveNews, the series offers twists and turns around slanging matches, forced opinions, swinging stands, circling issues and hyper leaning arguments. Curated by Anuvab Pal and Rohan Sippy, it features Kunal Roy Kapoor and Gopal Dutt among others.

headlines: Was I not prophetic: Congress' Aiyar on 'neech' remark against PM
text: Referring to his 'neech aadmi' remark against PM Narendra Modi, Congress' Mani Shankar Aiyar in an article wrote, "Remember how I described him on 7 December 2017? Was I not prophetic?" He also wrote PM Modi is "guilty of anti-national activity in trying to ride on the sacrifices of martyrs". Aiyar was temporarily suspended by Congress for 'neech aadmi' remark.

headlines: Priyanka Gandhi jumps over barricade to meet public after rally
text: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Monday jumped a barricade to meet supporters after her rally in Madhya Pradesh's Ratlam. A video of the incident shows, Priyanka hopping off the barricade in saree, followed by her security personnel and meeting hundreds of people. People could be seen hugging her and clicking her pictures in the video.

headlines: Aap apni jagah, main meri: Priyanka to people chanting 'Modi, Modi'
text: During her first political visit to Madhya Pradesh, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra stopped her convoy to greet BJP supporters who were chanting 'Modi, Modi' on the roadside. Priyanka shook hands with the BJP supporters and told them, "Aap apni jagah, main meri jagah. All the best." Responding to Priyanka, a BJP supporter said, "Very good."

headlines: Fitting end to most foul-mouthed PM: Congress' Aiyar on PM Modi
text: Stating that PM Narendra Modi would be "ousted" on May 23, Congress' Mani Shankar Aiyar in an article wrote, "That would be a fitting end to the most foul-mouthed prime minister this country has seen." Referring to PM Modi's 'cloud radar' remark, Aiyar said, "This is to insult our brave airmen and, above all, the Chief of Air Staff."

headlines: WhatsApp asks 1.5 billion users to update app on finding spyware
text: Facebook-owned WhatsApp is urging its 1.5 billion users to update to the latest version after it fixed a spyware vulnerability. Hackers could call users and infect the device even if the call wasn't answered, and the malicious calls would frequently disappear from logs. The spyware was allegedly developed by Israeli cyber intelligence company NSO Group, which has denied the claims.

headlines: Have sex 6 times in 6 days, suggests Alibaba Founder Jack Ma to staff
text: Alibaba Founder Jack Ma, at a mass wedding, told his employees they should have sex six times in six days. Ma, who had recently defended '9am to 9pm, six days a week' work schedule, said, "At work, we emphasise the spirit of '996'. In life, we should follow '669'." In Mandarin, the number nine also means "long-lasting" or "long duration."

headlines: SC grants bail to BJP worker over Mamata's meme on Priyanka's pic
text: The Supreme Court on Tuesday granted bail to BJP worker Priyanka Sharma, who was arrested for posting a meme of West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee over a picture of Priyanka Chopra from Met Gala. It had earlier granted Sharma conditional bail and asked her to apologise to Mamata. However, the court later modified its order and waived off the condition.

headlines: Man makes deepest dive of 10.92km in Pacific Ocean, finds waste
text: Retired US naval officer Victor Vescovo has found plastic waste on the Pacific Ocean floor after he broke the record of deepest-ever dive made by a human inside a submarine. Vescovo descended nearly 10.927 km in the ocean's Mariana Trench, which is the deepest place on Earth. His dive went 16 metre lower than the previous deepest descent in 1960.

headlines: Seaplanes carrying tourists collide mid-air in US; 5 killed
text: Two seaplanes collided in mid-air on Monday in Alaska, US, killing at least five of those on board, injuring 10 others and leaving one person missing, authorities said. The passengers were from the cruise ship Royal Princess and were on sightseeing flights. The Coast Guard has dispatched helicopters and boats for search and rescue operations.

headlines: Enough of sevak, chowkidar, now country needs real PM: Mayawati
text: BSP supremo Mayawati said that many leaders, till date, have donned various avatars, like that of sevak, chaiwala and chowkidar, to dupe the public, but now the country needed a real Prime Minister. Apparently criticising the BJP, she added the people have been cheated a lot by such "dual characters". She said it's clear that people won't accept cheating further.

headlines: Many BJP MLAs will join Cong after 23 May: Cong Gen Secy
text: Congress General Secretary KC Venugopal on Monday claimed that several BJP MLAs will join Congress after Lok Sabha polls results are declared on May 23. He added that Congress won't have to poach MLAs from BJP as they would switch parties on their own. Venugopal further said that Karnataka has been witnessing BJP's horse-trading mentality for the past one year.

headlines: KL Rahul should bat at number 4 in the World Cup: Gambhir
text: Ex-India cricketer Gautam Gambhir has said KL Rahul should bat at number four position at the upcoming World Cup. "He is best suited among the others...He has been in good form in the IPL and I'm sure, he's going to carry that form," Gambhir added. Rahul has batted at number four thrice for India in ODIs, scoring 26 runs.

headlines: McGregor's criminal charges dropped after settlement with victim
text: The criminal charges levelled against former UFC champion Conor McGregor have been dropped after he chose to settle with the victim outside the court. McGregor had allegedly smashed a fan's phone outside a Miami hotel in March. "My client is relieved, obviously he feels he should not have been arrested," McGregor's attorney said.

headlines: Amazon rolls out machines that pack orders and replace jobs
text: Amazon is installing two machines each at its US warehouses to pack orders, which would amount to over 1,300 job cuts across 55 US fulfilment centres. "We are piloting this new technology with the goal of increasing safety, speeding up delivery times," Amazon said. This comes after Amazon offered its employees up to $10,000 to quit and start delivery services.

headlines: Congress announces candidates for Telangana Council bypolls
text: Congress on Monday announced the names of candidates for the ensuing bypolls to Telangana Legislative Council. Congress leaders Enagala Venkatram Reddy will be contesting from Warangal, Komatireddy Laxmi from Nalgonda and Uday Mohan Reddy from Ranga Reddy seats respectively. The polling for these three seats will be held on May 31.

headlines: China announces retaliatory tariffs on $60 bn of US goods
text: China on Monday announced it will impose additional tariffs on $60 billion of American goods in retaliation to the increase of US duties on $200 billion of Chinese imports. The country will impose tariffs on a total of 5,140 US products from June 1. China earlier said it "will never surrender to external pressure" in trade war with the US.

headlines: Beardo products available with up to 50% off during FUKAKA sale
text: Men's luxury grooming brand Beardo is live with Beardo Fukaka sale from May 14-16, wherein it's offering up to 50% off on various products on its website. Beardo aims to create a wave of uber cool machismo with its innovative products exclusively for men, and with Fukaka, Beardo plans to take grooming to the next level.

headlines: Watson played with bloodied knee in IPL final without telling anyone
text: CSK opener Shane Watson, who top-scored in IPL 2019 final with 80(59), played with a bloodied knee after injuring himself in the third over. CSK off-spinner Harbhajan Singh revealed that Watson continued to bat without telling anyone and got six stitches after the match. "What dedication?! This is God level! You are one of a kind, champ!" CSK tweeted.

headlines: I'm too shy for politics, uncomfortable around a crowd: Ajay Devgn
text: Actor Ajay Devgn, when asked about joining politics, said, "I'm too shy for politics. I am uncomfortable around a crowd; almost claustrophobic." "Though I'm at ease in front of the camera, I'm an introvert otherwise," he added. "Politics is a people-profession. You need to constantly interact with those who have placed their trust in you," Ajay further said.

headlines: PM Modi has come on radar: Priyanka on 'cloud-radar' remark
text: After PM Narendra Modi said he authorised Balakot airstrikes thinking that the clouds on the day of the strike can help Indian jets escape Pakistan's radars, Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi mocked him saying, "He has come on radar bahano bhaiyo." Priyanka further said, "Whether it's rainy weather or clear daylight, now everyone has understood the truth behind PM's politics."

headlines: Weight of BSP's elephant will puncture SP's bicycle: UP CM
text: Talking about the alliance of Samajwadi Party and Bahujan Samaj Party in the state, Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday said that BSP's elephant will puncture SP's bicycle. He said this while referring to the parties' poll symbols. Yogi further said that both the parties are stooping to a new low by targetting PM Narendra Modi over his caste.

headlines: MS Dhoni goes wrong with his tips a lot of times, jokes Kuldeep
text: Spinner Kuldeep Yadav, during an award ceremony, jokingly said that wicketkeeper and ex-India captain MS Dhoni goes wrong with his tips "a lot of times". "But you can't say that to him," he added. "Zyada baat nahi karte woh [he doesn't speak much]. He speaks only between overs if he thinks he needs to point out something," Kuldeep further revealed.

headlines: Rajasthan to change Veer Savarkar's biography in school syllabus
text: Rajasthan's Congress government has announced that changes will be made in RSS icon Veer Savarkar's biography to teach the "correct" history. Rajasthan Education Minister Govind Dotasra said that Savarkar has been glorified in the textbooks to suit the "political gains" of the RSS. The new syllabus will reportedly teach that Savarkar had said sorry to the British government.

headlines: Man repairing lift dies after falling into lift shaft from 15th floor
text: A man died after falling in an elevator shaft from the 15th floor of a Mumbai residential tower while repairing an elevator on Monday. The 45-year-old was part of a team of two, undertaking maintenance activities of the elevator. Fire Brigade personnel brought him out from the shaft and rushed him to a hospital, where he was declared brought dead.

headlines: GST official jumps from 30th floor of Mumbai World Trade Centre; dies
text: A 51-year-old GST superintendent, Harinder Kapadia, allegedly committed suicide by jumping from the 30th floor of Mumbai's World Trade Centre on Monday. Locals rushed him to a hospital but was declared brought dead. An officer reportedly said Kapadia was "fed up with his illness" as he had a brain stroke a few months ago and was suffering from dementia.

headlines: Over 20 flights delayed as server goes down at Kolkata airport
text: Several passengers were left stranded at Kolkata airport after internet servers crashed at the airport causing delays in schedules of over 20 flights. Flight Information Display System and cameras turned non-operational after which airlines started issuing boarding passes to passengers manually. Airport authorities said that the IT team is working to resolve the issue.

headlines: Man stabbed to death for protesting vulgar remarks against daughter
text: A 51-year-old businessman was stabbed to death after he objected to some boys making vulgar remarks and gestures at his daughter in Delhi on Sunday, police said. The man had allegedly gone to complain to the boys' father, following which he and his 19-year-old son were repeatedly stabbed. The accused include a rickshaw puller and his three sons.

headlines: Woman publicly thrashed after refusing sexual advances for salary
text: A video which has surfaced online shows a female employee of a Greater Noida unisex salon being dragged by her hair and beaten publicly by her employer and his aides over salary dispute. She alleged she was thrashed after refusing their sexual advances when she asked for salary. "The issue...worsened to the extent that they got into fighting," said police.

headlines: Jet Airways CFO Amit Agarwal resigns due to personal reasons
text: Debt-ridden carrier Jet Airways' Chief Financial Officer (CFO) and Deputy Chief Executive Officer Amit Agarwal has resigned from his positions at the airline, the company said in a statement on Tuesday. "[He] has resigned from services of the company due to personal reasons, with effect from May 13," the airline said. Agarwal had joined the airline in December 2015.

headlines: Odisha to get air-conditioned vote counting halls
text: Odisha Chief Electoral Officer Surendra Kumar on Monday said that in view of the prevailing heat wave condition in the state, for the first time, all vote counting halls in the state will be air-conditioned.
