He further said that vote counting in Odisha will require more time as it will be done both for Assembly and Lok Sabha polls.

headlines: 'Modi wave' coming from each home in India: PM
text: Addressing a poll rally in Madhya Pradesh, PM Narendra Modi on Monday said that the "Modi wave" is coming from "each home" in the country and dismissed claims by "pundits and planted reports from Delhi" that there is no such wave. He added that the mothers and sisters have decided to elect the PM who provided cooking gas and electricity.

headlines: Bolton to start next League One season with 12-point penalty
text: Former Premier League side Bolton Wanderers will begin the next League One season with a 12-point penalty after they went into 'administration' as they have been unable to pay Â£1.2 million in taxes. The club has failed to find a new owner and has been relegated to the third tier after two years in the Championship.

headlines: iPhone 6, iPhone SE, others won't get iOS 13 update: Report
text: Apple's upcoming iOS 13 update will reportedly not support compatibility with devices including the iPhone 5s, iPhone SE, iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus, according to a report. Further, the update will not be available for the iPad mini 2 and iPad Air. Apple is reportedly expected to announce iOS 13 at its annual Worldwide Developers Conference in June.

headlines: Facebook must consider break up: US Senator Kamala Harris
text: Indian-origin US Democratic Senator Kamala Harris in an interview said, "I think we have to seriously take a look at [breaking up Facebook], yes". "It is essentially a utility that has gone unregulated...as far as IÂ’m concerned thatÂ’s gotta stop,Â” the presidential candidate added. Earlier, Facebook Co-founder Chris Hughes in an NYT article said, it's time to break up Facebook.

headlines: Google tests car crash detection in Android Q: Report
text: Google is testing car crash detection functionality for its Pixel devices, XDA Developers reported. A string within new Google app named 'Safety Hub', featured in Android Q Beta 3, suggests the function will "automatically launch an alert activity when the device detects you are in a car crash," the report stated. Unclear how detection would be achieved, the report added.

headlines: Be assured women are safe in BJP: Sitharaman to Mayawati
text: Responding to BSP chief Mayawati's comments on women leaders in BJP, Union Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said, "Please be assured, we're all absolutely safe in our party." She further said that it's disappointing that Mayawati made such remarks. Mayawati had said that women in BJP fear that their husbands may leave them like PM Narendra Modi left his wife.

headlines: Ban Haasan for 5 days over Hindu terrorist remark: BJP to EC
text: BJP leader Ashwini Upadhyay on Monday moved the Election Commission seeking a 5-day ban on actor-politician Kamal Haasan for saying that free India's first terrorist, was a "Hindu", naming Nathuram Godse. The complaint said that Haasan's statement was made deliberately in the presence of a Muslim majority crowd for electoral gain and was intended to outrage religious feelings of Hindus.

headlines: 4 die of suffocation while cleaning well in UP's Ghazipur
text: Four people died of suffocation while cleaning a well in Uttar Pradesh's Ghazipur on Monday, police said. They went in to clean the well as polluted water from an adjacent hand pump was dirtying it. They were pulled out of the well by villagers and were later declared brought dead at the district hospital.

headlines: Repolling at Haryana booth where agent was caught influencing voters
text: The Election Commission has said that fresh polling will take place at a polling station in Haryana's Faridabad parliamentary constituency on May 19 which coincides with the seventh phase of Lok Sabha elections. A polling agent was arrested for trying to influence voters at the booth after a video of him doing the purported act went viral.

headlines: Didn't you have one? Shahid to reporter asking him about heartbreak
text: Shahid Kapoor, while interacting with a journalist who asked him about heartbreak during the trailer launch of his film 'Kabir Singh', responded, "Tera nahi toota kya? Sabka toota hai I'm sure. (Didn't you have a heartbreak? I'm sure everyone has had heartbreaks.)" "Of course everyone's heart breaks at some point, but the aim is to get over it," he added.

headlines: I've made mistakes, wish I was like Akshay and Ajay: Suniel Shetty
text: Actor Suniel Shetty has said when he sees actors like Akshay Kumar and Ajay Devgn, he feels proud of them and wishes he was more like them. "Even today, they inspire me by what they have achieved, I am not jealous, I have made mistakes that is why where I am, I am," he added while speaking about his career.

headlines: There'll be new bakra in 48hrs: Rohit on Akshay's citizenship row
text: Commenting on the row over Akshay Kumar's Canadian citizenship, filmmaker Rohit Shetty said, "In 48 hours, there will be a new 'bakra' on Facebook and Twitter." "It's just a matter of few days. Akshay Kumar will always be Akshay Kumar," he added. Rohit further pointed out Akshay does a lot of charity work for the country which he never publicises.

headlines: SC refuses to reschedule voting time in Lok Sabha poll due to Ramzan
text: The Supreme Court on Monday dismissed a petition seeking to prepone voting time from 7 am to 5 am for the Lok Sabha election's last phase. The petition, filed by lawyer Mohammad Nizam Pasha, sought an early start on account of heat wave and the beginning of the month of Ramzan. The Election Commission had earlier declined the lawyer's plea.

headlines: Speechless: Bumrah as Sachin calls him best bowler in the world
text: Mumbai Indians mentor Sachin Tendulkar called Jasprit Bumrah the best bowler in the world following the team's victory in the IPL 2019 final. Commenting on Sachin's video shared by IPL, the 25-year-old fast bowler wrote, "I am speechless. Thank you, Sachin sir." Bumrah, who took 19 wickets in 16 IPL 2019 matches, had an economy rate of 6.63.

headlines: Govt plans compulsory QR code payment option at all shops: Report
text: Government is looking to make QR code payments option via UPI compulsory at all shops and the GST Council has already given the proposal a go-ahead, as per a report. The move will provide GST benefit to both shopkeepers and consumers, an official said. The government is said to have roped in NPCI for a nationwide rollout of the plan.

headlines: Told Pitroda he should be ashamed, apologise for 1984 remark: Rahul
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi has said he has told Sam Pitroda he should be ashamed and apologise publicly for his "hua to hua" remark on 1984 anti-Sikh riots. "What Sam Pitroda said about 1984 is absolutely wrong and he should apologise to the nation...I told him this over the phone, I told him what he said was wrong," Rahul added.

headlines: Dad would've replied to you 7 yrs ago: Riteish to Goyal on remarks
text: Actor Riteish Deshmukh took to Twitter to respond to Piyush Goyal's remarks that his late father and ex-Maharashtra Chief Minister Vilasrao Deshmukh was "concerned about getting a film role for Riteish during 26/11 attacks". Denying the accusations, Riteish said, "It's wrong to accuse someone who isn't here to defend himself. A bit late...7 years ago he would've replied to you."

headlines: Take climate change seriously: 16-yr-old Swedish activist to PM Modi
text: Sweden's 16-year-old student-activist Greta Thunberg has asked PM Narendra Modi to take climate change seriously and act on it urgently. PM has a big responsibility and if he doesn't do something, he'll be blamed for this crisis, she added. Greta, who encouraged students to skip school and protest for action on climate change, is a Nobel Peace Prize nominee.

headlines: 42-yr-old Indian woman dies after hip replacement surgery in Dubai
text: A 42-year-old Indian woman chef has died in Dubai due to complications allegedly arising after a hip replacement surgery at a private hospital in Dubai. Betty Rita Fernandes was admitted for the two-hour left hip replacement surgery at the Al Zahra Hospital on May 9. The Dubai Health Authority (DHA) is looking into a complaint filed by Fernandes' husband.

headlines: It was a mixed kind of season for me: Shubman Gill
text: Kolkata Knight Riders' Shubman Gill, IPL 2019's Emerging Player of the Year awardee, said, "I think it was mixed kind of season for me." "[W]henever I tried to do extra, it didn't really pay off well, but whenever I was myself and tried to have some fun and played my game it paid off for me," Gill added.

headlines: 'Tapasvi' PM Modi is full of arrogance, says Priyanka Gandhi
text: Addressing a rally in Madhya Pradesh, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi on Monday criticised PM Narendra Modi calling him a "tapasvi" full of "arrogance". She added that PM Modi's arrogance has grown that big that he doesn't have time to visit his constituency but is campaigning across the country. She further said that a tapasvi does not make "fun of tribals".

headlines: Congress lowered political discourse: Rajnath Singh
text: Union Minister Rajnath Singh accused the Congress of lowering the political discourse, saying never before has the chief (referring to Congress' Rahul Gandhi) of the main Opposition party hurled abuses at the Prime Minister. He added Congress shouldn't have stooped so low. Singh said PM Narendra Modi is young and visionary, so there's no question of any successor for him.

headlines: Robin van Persie given guard of honour in his final match
text: Former Arsenal and Manchester United forward Robin van Persie was given a guard of honour and a standing ovation in his final professional career appearance in Feyenoord's last home league match of the season. The 35-year-old managed to hit the woodwork in the first half and was substituted off in stoppage time. Feyenoord is Persie's childhood club.

headlines: Around 20 lakh trees uprooted due to Fani in Odisha: Report
text: According to a forest department's report, around 20 lakh trees uprooted due to cyclone Fani that hit Odisha's Puri district on May 3. It will take a long time to revive the greenery of these areas just like before the cyclone, an official said. Spending money and providing the manpower for the efforts will be a challenging task, he added.

headlines: WomanÂ’s severed head found 50km away from body in UP: Police
text: An unidentified woman's severed head was found 50 kilometres away in Uttar Pradesh's Anoopshahr, a day after the body was recovered from a village in the state, police said. The post-mortem report has ruled out any form of sexual violence, the police added. The police have circulated helpline numbers and missing person complaints are being tallied.

headlines: ED quizzes Chanda Kochhar, husband Deepak Kochhar for 9 hrs
text: Former ICICI Bank CEO Chanda Kochhar and her husband Deepak Kochhar were on Monday questioned for nearly nine hours by the Enforcement Directorate (ED). The agency has been probing Chanda Kochhar in connection with the alleged conflict of interest in the loan extended to Videocon Group. The Kochhars may be questioned again on Tuesday, as per reports.

headlines: LIC Mutual Fund appoints Dinesh Pangtey as CEO
text: LIC Mutual Fund on Monday appointed Dinesh Pangtey as the company's Chief Executive Officer (CEO). Pangtey, who joined LIC as a direct recruit officer in 1984, was Director and CEO at LIC Group's private equity division LIC HFL AMC. He has also served as Regional Manager Marketing channel in Western Zone spanning the states of Maharashtra, Gujarat and Goa.

headlines: Consumer retail inflation rises to 2.92% in April from 2.86% in March
text: The consumer retail inflation rose to 2.92% in April from 2.86% a month ago. However, it remained within the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) medium-term target of 4% for the ninth month in a row. The vegetable price inflation grew 2.87% in April, while overall food and beverages inflation stood at 1.38% during the month.

headlines: Rohit becomes most successful player in IPL history with 5 titles
text: Mumbai Indians captain Rohit Sharma on Sunday became the most successful player in IPL history after winning his fifth title. Rohit won his first IPL title with Deccan Chargers in 2009, and led MI to four IPL titles in 2013, 2015, 2017 and 2019. The 32-year-old is followed by Ambati Rayudu and Harbhajan Singh, who have won four titles each.

headlines: Who won the Orange Cap and Purple Cap awards in IPL 2019?
text: SunRisers Hyderabad opener David Warner, who smashed 692 runs in 12 IPL 2019 matches, won the Orange Cap award for the third time in his IPL career after 2015 and 2017 editions of the tournament. Chennai Super Kings' 40-year-old South African leg-spinner Imran Tahir took 26 wickets in 17 matches to become the oldest cricketer to win Purple Cap award.

headlines: Defamation case against Manoj Tiwari for saying Kejriwal slap staged
text: A Delhi court has admitted a criminal defamation case against BJP leaders Manoj Tiwari and Harish Khurana for allegedly claiming that the recent attack on Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal was staged. The case was filed by AAP member Sushil Chauhan who alleged that the duo defamed him and AAP as they claimed that the attack was carried out by him.

headlines: I didn't watch last ball of IPL 2019 final: MI owner Nita Ambani
text: After Mumbai Indians defeated Chennai Super Kings by one run on the last ball in the IPL 2019 final, their owner Nita Ambani said that she did not watch the last ball. "I was just going by the cheers of the fans to know what's happening," she added. Mumbai Indians won their record fourth IPL title on Sunday.

headlines: Sachin bowls to Kambli in nets, ICC asks him to watch his front foot
text: Ex-India cricketer Sachin Tendulkar took to Twitter to share a video of himself bowling to Vinod Kambli in the nets. The official Twitter account of ICC pointed out that Tendulkar had bowled a delivery from way outside the crease and jokingly asked him to watch his foot. The ICC also shared a picture of ex-umpire Steve Bucknor signalling 'no-ball'.

headlines: SoftBank loses $9 bn in m-cap despite strong profit as Uber IPO fails
text: Despite reporting more than tripled operating profit last week, Japanese conglomerate SoftBank has lost $9 billion in market value after Uber received an underwhelming response on its IPO. On Thursday, SoftBank booked a $3.8 billion gain from its stake in Uber. However, on Uber's Friday IPO, SoftBank slid 5.4% and fell again on Monday, dropping as much as 4.9%.

headlines: Woman walks naked to police station after in-laws attack, strip her
text: A woman in Rajasthan's Churu walked to the police station naked to report the matter after being assaulted and forcibly stripped by her in-laws. Instead of helping the woman, onlookers took photographs of her, police said. The victim alleged that she was continuously tortured by her in-laws in absence of her husband, who works as daily wage labourer in Assam.

headlines: Won't sell F-21s to any other country if India buys 114 jets: Lockheed
text: America's Lockheed Martin said it won't sell its F-21 fighter jets to any country if India orders its 114 planes. Last month, the Indian Air Force issued an initial tender to acquire 114 jets at a cost of around $18 billion. The top contenders include Lockheed's F-21, Boeing's F/A-18, Dassault Aviation's Rafale, Eurofighter Typhoon, Russian aircraft MiG-35 and Saab's Gripen.

headlines: SL imposes nationwide curfew after riots over attacks that killed 258
text: Sri Lanka has announced a nationwide curfew after anti-Muslim riots spread to districts just north of the capital Colombo, police said. Christian groups attacked Muslim-owned shops in the wake of the ISIS-led Easter Sunday terror attack in which 258 people were killed. The curfew will start from 9 pm tonight and will end at 4 am on Tuesday.

headlines: PM candidate from gathbandhan will build new India: Akhilesh
text: Former Uttar Pradesh CM Akhilesh Yadav on Monday said that the gathbandhan will give a new Prime Minister, who will make a new India. He further accused the BJP of taking the nation backwards and added that the gathbandhan will ensure that the country moves forward. Yadav further said that in the last five years, "development has come to halt".

headlines: Mayawati's ethics, discourse stoop to all-time low: Jaitley
text: Union Minister Arun Jaitley criticised BSP supremo Mayawati for her personal remark on PM Narendra Modi saying that "firm on becoming a PM", Mayawati's "governance, ethics and discourse stoop to an all-time low". Jaitley added Mayawati's remark "exposes her as unfit for public life". Jaitley also criticised West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee saying, "Democracy has become a casualty in Bengal."

headlines: IPL the best league in the world: SRH's David Warner
text: SunRisers Hyderabad's David Warner, who won the Orange Cap in IPL 2019, said that the tournament is the best in the world and he is "grateful" to be part of it. "It's the leading tournament throughout the world," he added. "Big credit to our curators at Hyderabad, they prepare great wickets," said Warner, who scored 692 runs in the tournament.

headlines: Mamata has turned 'sonar Bengal' into 'kangal Bengal': Shah
text: Addressing a poll rally in West Bengal, BJP President Amit Shah criticised state CM Mamata Banerjee saying she has turned "sonar Bengal" into "kangal Bengal". Shah added that earlier people used to hear the music of Rabindranath Tagore in Bengal, but now, the voices of bomb blasts are heard in the state. He alleged that "infiltrates scare" Mamata in Bengal.

headlines: 2 yrs after WannaCry, 1 mn devices still at risk: Report
text: Two years after WannaCry ransomware attack, over 1 million internet-connected endpoints are still vulnerable to the exploits, according to Shodan, a search engine for internet-connected devices. TechCrunch said the number is likely higher as Shodan's data only accounts for devices directly connected to the internet. WannaCry ransomware had reportedly encrypted computers in about 150 countries.

headlines: Haasan's new theory on Godse a flop story: Sena's Sanjay Raut
text: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut criticised actor-turned-politician Kamal Haasan for his comment that Nathuram Godse was independent India's first Hindu terrorist, saying his theory on Godse is a "flop story". Calling his remark "useless", Raut added there's no difference between Congress leader Digvijaya Singh and Haasan. He said Hindus will not tolerate when their religion is linked with terrorism.

headlines: SpaceX loads 60 internet satellites in rocket, Elon Musk shares pic
text: Elon Musk tweeted an image showing SpaceX's first 60 Starlink satellites loaded into Falcon rocket's fairing, ahead of launch tentatively set for this week. "Much will likely go wrong on 1st mission...6 more launches of 60 [satellites] needed for minor coverage, 12 for moderate," he tweeted. SpaceX plans to deploy low-orbit satellites to beam internet connectivity to Earth from space.

headlines: India registers worst passenger vehicle sales fall in 8 yrs
text: The domestic passenger vehicle sales fell 17% to 2.47 lakh units in April, the worst decline in almost eight years, according to data released by the Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM). A steeper decline was last seen in 2011 when sales plunged 20%. The fall came amid rising insurance costs and petrol prices, SIAM's director general Vishnu Mathur said.

headlines: Share your stories of Apollo 11 Moon landing: NASA to people
text: To celebrate the 50th anniversary of Apollo 11 Moon landing on July 20, NASA invited the public to share audio recordings of stories like those related to Apollo 11. Selected stories will be featured in NASA's oral history project dubbed 'NASA Explorers: Apollo' or on its website or social media. Apollo 11 landed the first two humans on the Moon.

headlines: SC Collegium recommends Justice DN Patel's name for Delhi HC CJ
text: The Supreme Court Collegium has recommended the appointment of Justice DN Patel as the next Chief Justice of the Delhi High Court. The resolution was passed in view of the impending retirement of current Chief Justice Rajendra Menon in June 2019. Patel has served as the Acting Chief Justice of the Jharkhand High Court four times between 2013 and 2018.

headlines: Govt seeks applications for MD posts at IIFCL, IFCI, EXIM Bank
text: The Finance Ministry has invited applications from eligible candidates to fill the vacancy of Deputy Managing Directors of state-owned financial institutions IIFCL, IFCI and EXIM Bank. IIFCL and IFCI require to fill one post each while EXIM Bank has two such vacancies. The maximum permissible age for eligible candidates is 55 years as on the date of vacancy.

headlines: Trump warns China not to retaliate against tariff hike
text: US President Donald Trump on Monday warned China not to retaliate against a hike in tariffs the country imposed last week. "If you don't make a deal...companies will be forced to leave China for other countries," he added. "[There] is no reason for the US Consumer to pay the Tariffs, which take effect on China today," Trump further tweeted.

headlines: ITC appoints Sanjiv Puri as Chairman after YC Deveshwar's death
text: ITC Managing Director Sanjiv Puri was on Monday appointed as Chairman after the demise of Yogesh Chander Deveshwar on Saturday. Padma Bhushan awardee and an IIT Delhi alumnus, Deveshwar, who was diagnosed with cancer a few years ago, passed away aged 72 after a prolonged illness. Reportedly, Puri was mentored by Deveshwar for the role of Chairman and Managing Director.

headlines: Surveen Chawla shares first photo of her newborn daughter
text: Actress Surveen Chawla on Monday took to Instagram to share the first photo of her newborn daughter Eva. "To love ...I know now....," she wrote in the caption. Surveen got married to businessman Akshay Thakker in 2015 and they had kept their marital status a secret for a couple of years. They welcomed their first child on April 15.

headlines: Fans question whether Dhoni's run-out in IPL final was out or not
text: CSK captain MS Dhoni was declared run-out by third umpire in IPL 2019 final against MI after Ishan Kishan pulled off a direct hit at non-striker's end. A replay showed Dhoni was on the line, while other angles showed him to have just sneaked in. Several fans questioned the run-out, with some saying Dhoni should've been given "benefit of doubt".

headlines: CO2 in atmosphere over 415 parts per million 1st time in human history
text: The carbon dioxide in the atmosphere has exceeded 415 parts per million (ppm), reaching 415.26 ppm for the first time in human history, according to sensors at the Mauna Loa Observatory in Hawaii. The carbon pollution in the atmosphere soared past 400 ppm in 2016, and 410 ppm in 2017. As recently as 1910, atmospheric CO2 stood at 300 ppm.

headlines: Major fire breaks out in Shimla's 1st hotel built during British era
text: A major fire broke out at Grand Hotel in Shimla in the early hours on Monday, completely gutting the three floors of the reception block, however no casualties were reported. The flames were brought under control with the help of five fire tenders. Notably, the Grand Hotel was the first hotel to be built in Shimla during the British era.

headlines: Digvijaya not voting is a sign of Cong's arrogance: PM Modi
text: PM Narendra Modi on Monday said that Congress' Bhopal Lok Sabha candidate Digvijaya Singh not casting his vote on Sunday is a sign of Congress' arrogance. "[Digvijaya] didn't care about democracy, he was only thinking about himself," he added. PM Modi further said that not voting is a sin and Digvijaya is setting a wrong example for first-time voters.

headlines: We have to look at recreating the side: CSK coach Fleming
text: Following Chennai Super Kings' loss in the IPL 2019 final, CSK coach Stephen Fleming said, "We do understand that we are an ageing team. So at some point, we just have to look at recreating the side." "I think if you win one title and reach the final next time, you have had good two years," Fleming said about CSK.

headlines: Want to lift the World Cup now : Hardik after MI's IPL title
text: Speaking after winning the IPL title with his side Mumbai Indians, Indian all-rounder Hardik Pandya said, "[N]ow all the focus goes to World Cup. I want to lift that World Cup trophy as well." "I used to have MI Wallpaper on my phone, it's a dream as I said," Hardik added. India begin their World Cup campaign on June 5.

headlines: Rahul Chahar stands out, he was fabulous: Sachin Tendulkar
text: Former Mumbai Indians captain Sachin Tendulkar praised Rahul Chahar, saying, "Rahul Chahar stands out. I shared my opinion (with Mahela Jayawardene) before he played his first game and I thought he was fabulous." "Rahul Chahar was brilliant and created the pressure throughout for us," Jayawardene said about Chahar, who bowled 13 dot balls in the final against Chennai Super Kings.

headlines: After 80 rallies, Congress star campaigner Sidhu damages vocal cords
text: Congress' star campaigner Navjot Singh Sidhu has damaged his vocal cords after addressing 80 rallies in 28 days and is currently on steroid medication and injections. According to a statement released by his office, Sidhu damaged his cords to the extent that they bled at times. Sidhu has been advised full rest for two days by doctors.

headlines: MI captain Rohit celebrates MI's 4th IPL title with daughter
text: Mumbai Indians captain Rohit Sharma celebrated his side's fourth IPL title with his daughter Samaira and his wife Ritika. Rohit was seen sitting on the ground with the toddler in his arms. Rohit, who first won the IPL with Deccan Chargers in 2009, has now become the most successful player in IPL, having won the title five times.

headlines: James Anderson suffers knee injury on county duty
text: Lancashire's English pacer James Anderson suffered a knee injury after he was hit on the inside of his knee by a drive from James Fuller during Lancashire's four-wicket loss to current champions Hampshire in Sunday's One-Day Cup semi-final. Anderson, who is England's all-time leading Test wicket-taker, will next take the field for England in the Ashes series in August.

headlines: PM Modi left his own wife for political gains: Mayawati
text: BSP chief Mayawati on Monday asked how can PM Narendra Modi respect daughters and sisters of others when he left his own wife for political gains. She further said that in BJP, women leaders get scared if their husbands go near PM Modi. "They fear that their husbands may also leave them like PM Modi left his wife," Mayawati said.

headlines: Vivek Oberoi criticises Haasan for 'Hindu' terrorist remark
text: Actor Vivek Oberoi has criticised actor-turned-politician Kamal Haasan for saying that independent India's first terrorist was a 'Hindu'. Oberoi asked Haasan if his remark was "because he was speaking in a Muslim dominated area". Calling Haasan a "great artist", Oberoi further said, "Just like art has no religion, terror has no religion either" and "let's not divide this country".

headlines: BJP worker arrested for sharing Mamata meme moves Supreme Court
text: BJP worker Priyanka Sharma has moved the Supreme Court against her arrest for allegedly sharing a morphed image of West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on social media. The Court has agreed to hear the matter on Tuesday. Priyanka had allegedly shared on Facebook a photo in which Mamata's face was superimposed over Priyanka Chopra's picture from this year's Met Gala.

headlines: Paytm Mall ropes in EY to probe cashback fraud: Report
text: Paytm Mall roped in accounting firm Ernst & Young (EY) to reportedly investigate cashback fraud involving its employees. Some employees reportedly colluded with third-party vendors to create fake orders involving certain vendors and customer profiles to steal cashback offers and received kickbacks for assistance. Paytm Mall said it's building technology-driven fraud prevention system with EY.

headlines: Will stop sharing water if Pak doesn't stop terror: Gadkari
text: Water Resources Minister Nitin Gadkari said that if Pakistan continues to support terrorist organisations, India will have no option but to stop sharing water with Pakistan. "In place of love...we are getting bombs and they are attacking innocent people of India," he added. Gadkari further said that now is the appropriate time for Pakistan to stop its support to terrorism.

headlines: Etihad to infuse equity to maintain 24% Jet stake: Reports
text: Etihad Airways, which holds 24% in Jet Airways, has reportedly said it would infuse further equity in the airline to the extent that its stake is maintained at the current level once a majority buyer comes in. Etihad submitted its bid for the crisis-hit airline on Friday. The Abu Dhabi-based airline hasn't offered a revival plan for Jet, reports said.

headlines: RIL moves registered offices of five subsidiaries to Gujarat
text: Mukesh Ambani's Reliance Industries (RIL) has moved registered offices of five of its subsidiaries, comprising four telecom arms and one investment unit, to Gujarat's Ahmedabad. "Gujarat is where RIL began its journey...we should give something back to the state," a senior company official said. The subsidiaries, which include Reliance Jio Digital Services, had their registered offices in Mumbai.

headlines: Chanda Kochhar, husband Deepak Kochhar appear before ED
text: Former ICICI Bank CEO Chanda Kochhar, along with her husband Deepak Kochhar, appeared before the Enforcement Directorate on Monday for questioning in connection with the ICICI Bank-Videocon loan case. Chanda Kochhar's statement will reportedly be recorded under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA). Her brother-in-law Rajiv Kochhar was also recently questioned by ED for over four days.

headlines: Great Learning alumnus transitions to Data Science with 71% hike
text: Aishwarya transitioned with 71% salary hike at Uber after completing Great Learning's PG Program in Data Science and Engineering. The program has had 850+ learners, and imparts skills relevant to current industry requirements, offering dedicated placement assistance with 200+ hiring partners. The full-time program is suited for recent graduates and early career professionals.

headlines: Telangana 10th Board results declared, 92.43% students pass
text: The Telangana board Secondary School Certificate (SSC) or Class 10 exam result was declared on Monday. This year, more than 5 lakh students appeared for the SSC examination, out of which 92.43% have passed. Girls outperformed boys with a pass percentage of girls being 93.68% against 91.18%. In 2018, the pass percentage among class 10 students was 83.78%.

headlines: UK govt threatens Indian woman in coma with forcible deportation
text: The UK government's Home Office has threatened a 31-year-old Indian woman in coma with forcible deportation. Bhavani Espathi has been in a vegetative state for a week and a half after undergoing a major operation. Her fiancÃ© appealed against the decision, providing medical letters from her doctors stating that her life would be at risk if she were to travel.

headlines: PM Modi claims he used digital camera, email in 1987-88; mocked
text: PM Narendra Modi, in a recent interview, claimed he was one of the first people in India to use digital camera. He added he used it to click LK Advani's picture in 1987-88 and also used email. He was mocked for his statement, with social media users pointing out email and digital camera didn't exist in India at the time.

headlines: Short film 'Kamali' on 9-yr-old TN skateboarder qualifies for Oscars
text: 'Kamali', a short film on Tamil Nadu's nine-year-old skateboarder girl Kamali Moorthy, has qualified for the 2020 Academy Awards shortlist. The 24-minute film directed by filmmaker Sasha Rainbow from New Zealand won the Best Documentary Short at Atlanta Film Festival in April. Born in a fishermen colony, Kamali has toured across India with professional skateboarding teams to promote the sport.

headlines: Video shows poll agent trying to influence voters; arrested
text: A video shows a poll agent walking up to a polling booth in Faridabad to either point to a party symbol on the EVM or to press a button for at least three voters. Election Commission officials said the man has been arrested. Polling agents are appointed by the candidates contesting election to oversee the process.

headlines: Extreme case of abuse, mental torture: RCB fangirl after going viral
text: RCB fangirl Deepika Ghose, whose pictures while cheering from stands in an IPL match went viral on social media, said her "identity, privacy and life have been hacked in an instant". Adding that her "overnight followers" on Instagram have been "crude, vulgar, vicious and entirely disrespectful", Deepika said, "It has been an extreme case of abuse, trauma and mental torture."

headlines: Pollard tosses bat, stands at wide line to protest umpire's decision
text: MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard has been fined 25% of his match fee for showing dissent at the umpire's decision during IPL 2019 final against CSK on Sunday. The 32-year-old tossed his bat in the air and then stood at the wide line after the umpire didn't signal wide despite CSK all-rounder Dwayne Bravo's delivery going wide outside the tramline.

headlines: Drug smugglers in IPS officer's house didn't step out for months
text: Two Nigerians arrested for running a narcotics manufacturing unit from a Greater Noida house owned by an IPS officer stocked food and water and didn't step out for months as they didn't want to be seen in the neighbourhood. Most locals said they never interacted with them, said an officer. "A maid...was called once in 2-3 weeks," the officer added.

headlines: Man flashes private part to girl at ATM; arrested with help of video
text: A 38-year-old man allegedly flashed his private part at a 23-year-old woman when she was withdrawing money from an ATM in Mulund, Mumbai. The woman confronted the accused and recorded a video of the act. She wrote on Twitter that after recording the video, she approached a nearby police van and showed them the video, following which he was arrested.

headlines: Home Ministry cancels Infosys Foundation's registration
text: Home Ministry has cancelled NGO Infosys Foundation's registration for allegedly violating Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Act (FCRA) in receiving foreign grants. The foundation failed to submit annual income and expenditure statement on foreign funding for up to six years, officials said. However, Infosys Foundation said its de-registration followed a request it made to the ministry.

headlines: UK man who stabbed Indian-origin wife 59 times jailed for life
text: A UK man has been sentenced to life imprisonment for stabbing to death his Indian-origin wife following a row in December last year. The 47-year-old, who was charged with murder, used two kitchen knives to stab his 41-year-old wife at least 59 times in her neck and chest. "Your attack on her was ferocious...This was a brutal assault," officials said.

headlines: Over 63% voter turnout in 6th phase of Lok Sabha polls: EC
text: Over 63% voter turnout was recorded in the sixth phase of the 2019 Lok Sabha elections, Senior Deputy Election Commissioner Umesh Sinha said on Sunday. West Bengal recorded the highest voter turnout at 80.35% while Delhi recorded a voter turnout of 59.73%. The 6th phase of the Lok Sabha polls covered 59 seats across seven states and Union Territories.

headlines: Shah denied permission to hold rally in WB's Jadavpur: Reports
text: BJP President Amit Shah was denied permission to hold a rally in West Bengal's Jadavpur district, reports said on Monday. Authorities also reportedly denied permission for Shah's chopper to land, even though it was granted permission earlier. This is the second time this year that Shah's chopper was denied permission to land in West Bengal.

headlines: Hummingbird-inspired robot could help in rescue missions
text: Purdue University researchers engineered a hummingbird-inspired robot, trained by machine learning algorithms based on techniques the bird uses. The robot, which currently needs to be tethered to an energy source while flying, can sense by touching surfaces. It can essentially create a map of surroundings without seeing, which could be helpful for search-and-rescue missions, a researcher said.

headlines: Huawei accused of enlisting professor to get startup's tech
text: US-headquartered startup CNEX has accused Huawei of enlisting a Chinese university professor working on a research project to improperly access its technology, Reuters said citing court documents. CNEX alleged the professor asked for its circuit board and after they gave it, CNEX's products' technical details ended up with Huawei. CNEX has reportedly been in dispute with Huawei since 2017.

headlines: Mayawati suffering from political depression: UP Deputy CM
text: Uttar Pradesh Deputy CM Dinesh Sharma said that BSP chief Mayawati is suffering from "political depression" because she fears her party's defeat in the Lok Sabha elections. He claimed the symptoms of her "depression" will become more evident in coming days and she will make "anaap shanaap (loose)" remarks. Sharma further said that Mayawati needs a "political health tonic".

headlines: Ex-Maha CM was busy getting film role for son during 26/11: Goyal
text: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Sunday said that former Maharashtra CM Vilasrao Deshmukh was concerned about getting a film role for his son Riteish Deshmukh during the 26/11 Mumbai attacks. "[Deshmukh] had brought a film producer outside Oberoi Hotel while shooting and bombing was going on inside," he added. Goyal further termed the then Congress government as "weak".

headlines: India's first terrorist, Nathuram Godse, was a Hindu: Haasan
text: Addressing an election campaign in Tamil Nadu's Aravakurichi, Makkal Needhi Maiam (MNM) chief Kamal Haasan on Sunday said, "Free India's first terrorist was a Hindu, his name is Nathuram Godse." "I'm not saying this because this is a Muslim-dominated area, but I am saying this before a statue of (Mahatma) Gandhi," he added. Gandhi was assassinated by Godse in 1948.

headlines: Odisha CM announces pucca houses for Fani-hit families
text: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Sunday announced that all the families whose houses were completely or substantially damaged due to Cyclone Fani will be sanctioned pucca houses. He added that house damage assessment will begin from May 15 and work orders will be given from June 1. As per preliminary assessment, over 5.08 lakh houses were damaged in the cyclone.

headlines: 3 killed by chemical leak at industrial unit in Maharashtra
text: Three workers were killed due to a chemical leak at an industrial unit in Maharashtra's Palgarh district on Sunday, police said. The incident occurred when the work of filling the chemical was underway, and the workers apparently died due to the reaction of the chemical. However, the exact cause of death will be ascertained after post-mortem, police added.

headlines: Loan defaulter has no right to lawyer's aid in in-house trial: SC
text: The Supreme Court has said a person has no "right" to be represented by a lawyer in "in-house" proceedings initiated by banks or financial institutions to declare them willful defaulters. The question whether a default was "intentional, deliberate, and calculated" can be dealt with by the borrower or lender, the apex court said. A lawyer's assistance wasn't required, it added.

headlines: Thyssenkrupp to seek new partner after Tata Steel JV fails
text: Thyssenkrupp CEO Guido Kerkhoff has said the company will continue to seek partners for its steel operations. This comes after the German company abandoned the merger of its steel business with Tata Steel's European operations due to opposition from EU regulators. Kerkhoff further resolved to transform the steel-to-submarines group into a holding company and list its elevators business.

headlines: Uber is taking fans closer to the action this ICC World Cup
text: Ahead of ICC Cricket World Cup 2019, Uber is offering users a chance to score runs with every Uber ride. The more runs you earn, the higher your chances of winning tickets to the World Cup in England and other prizes like the official ICC merchandise and exclusive Uber ride offers.

headlines: MI defeat CSK on last ball to win their record fourth IPL title
text: Playing in their fifth IPL final, Mumbai Indians on Sunday defeated Chennai Super Kings by one run on the last ball to clinch their fourth IPL title. With this, Mumbai Indians set the record for winning the most number of Indian Premier League titles. Notably, Mumbai Indians defeated Chennai Super Kings in each of their four encounters in IPL 2019.

headlines: Amy Jackson shares photo from pregnancy photoshoot
text: Actress Amy Jackson on Saturday took to Instagram to share a picture of herself from her pregnancy photoshoot for a magazine. "Thinking about you lil one," the actress wrote in the caption. Sharing another picture from the shoot, Amy wrote, "Love to the village it took to get The Bump and I camera ready."

headlines: Tahir sets record for most wickets by a spinner in an IPL season
text: CSK leg-spinner Imran Tahir has set the record for taking most wickets by a spinner in an IPL season. The 40-year-old achieved the feat by taking two wickets in IPL 2019 final against Mumbai Indians. Tahir, who took 26 wickets in IPL 2019, broke the record (24 wickets) jointly held by Sunil Narine (IPL 2012) and Harbhajan Singh (IPL 2013).

headlines: Gambhir asked to smear Atishi, claims woman; BJP calls it AAP's ploy
text: A woman from Delhi has claimed on Facebook that cricketer-turned-politician Gautam Gambhir approached the agency where she works to make a video smearing AAP's East Delhi Lok Sabha candidate Atishi. She said two other videos highlighting Gambhir's achievements and social work were also asked to be made. Delhi BJP's spokesperson Praveen Shankar Kapoor has called it AAP's "new gimmick".

headlines: India in my heart: Vadra after tweeting Paraguay's flag post voting
text: Robert Vadra, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi's husband, posted a clarification on social media after goofing-up in a tweet by putting Paraguay's flag emoji along with his photo showing inked finger. "India lives in my heart & I salute Tiranga. Using a Paraguay flag in my post was an aberration," wrote Vadra. "You decided to play up my mistake," Vadra added.

headlines: KKR all-rounder Carlos Brathwaite gifts himself a Range Rover
text: KKR all-rounder Carlos Brathwaite took to Instagram to share pictures of his Range Rover car which he gifted to himself. "It's been quite a journey for me! I've received blessings upon blessings and have worked hard over the years to be able to cherish and spoil myself! Meet my new baby...HereÂ’s to the newest member of the family," he wrote.

headlines: Toughest title of my career: Guardiola on Man City's 4th PL win
text: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola has said that his team's 2018/2019 Premier League success is the toughest title of his career. "We have to say congratulations to Liverpool and thank you so much -- they pushed us to increase our standards," he added. Manchester City won the title on the last day of the season after defeating Brighton 4-1.

headlines: Fan tries to flirt with 18-yr-old Jemimah on Twitter, she responds
text: India Women's 18-year-old Jemimah Rodrigues responded to a fan who tried to flirt with her on Twitter. "I like Jemimah. Very cute. Are you seeing anyone?" the fan had tweeted, to which Jemimah responded, "After this match? I'm definitely seeing a bright future for Women's Cricket!" Jemimah scored 123 runs in three Women's T20 Challenge matches for champions Supernovas.

headlines: Djokovic defeats Stefanos Tsitsipas to win 3rd Madrid Open title
text: World number one Novak Djokovic defeated world number nine Stefanos Tsitsipas 6-3, 6-4 to win his third Madrid Open title on Sunday. With the victory, the 31-year-old Serbian tied world number two Rafael Nadal's record of winning most Masters 1000 trophies (33). Further, it was Djokovic's second title of the season after his Australian Open triumph.

headlines: Lucky to call her mom: World's richest person shares video with mom
text: To mark the Mother's Day on Sunday, the world's richest person and Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos shared a video of himself with his mother Jacklyn Bezos from his childhood. The video showed Bezos riding a bicycle and being helped by his mother. "I'm lucky enough to call her my mom. She's kind, patient and supportive," said Bezos.

headlines: Man who faked suicide to avoid abuse charges arrested 3 yrs later
text: A US man who faked suicide to avoid child abuse charges has been arrested after nearly three years on the run. The 58-year-old was found living in an unlocked storage container while police were responding to a burglar alarm in Florida. In 2016, he had left a suicide note stating his intention to jump to death in a rental car.

headlines: 109 babies were named Tesla in the US in 2018
text: In 2018, 109 babies born in the US were named Tesla, down from 143 in 2017, Mashable said quoting the country's Social Security Administration's annual data of baby names. Further, 3,250 male babies were named Bentley and 413 male babies were named Ford. Notably, 2,545 female babies were named Arya in 2018, which is a 'Game of Thrones' character's name.

headlines: For Congress, OROP means One Rahul, One Priyanka: Amit Shah
text: Addressing a rally, BJP President Amit Shah criticised the Congress saying that for the party OROP (One Rank One Pension) meant "One Rahul, One Priyanka", referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi. Shah added the BJP agreed for the OROP in "just over a year after coming to power". He said the BJP has ensured India's national security.

headlines: Will PM hang himself if Cong gets more than 40 seats: Kharge
text: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Sunday alleged that PM Narendra Modi keeps on saying that the Congress will not win even 40 seats and asked if he'll "hang himself at Delhi's Vijay Chowk" if the party wins more than 40 seats. He also alleged that PM Modi's campaigns are self-centred. Kharge further said that PM Modi "keeps speaking against Congress".

headlines: Dynasty can make you party chief, but it doesn't bring vision: PM
text: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday criticised Congress President Rahul Gandhi saying that dynasty can make Rahul party chief, but it "doesn't bring vision and wisdom". Addressing a poll rally in Madhya Pradesh, PM Modi added that a mechanism would be put in place to strengthen start-ups. Exuding confidence about his re-election, the PM said that there's "pro-incumbency" in the country.

headlines: Peaceful voting in Haryana due to decisive intervention: DGP
text: Haryana DGP Manoj Yadava on Sunday said that the state witnessed peaceful and incident-free general polls voting due to "excellent police arrangements, decisive intervention and energetic patrolling" across the state. He added that peaceful voting resulted in the high number of voter turnout in the state. Yadava said round-the-clock monitoring of polling situation was conducted by senior officers.

headlines: Liquor shops witness rush after LS polling ends in Delhi
text: Delhi liquor shops witnessed rush soon after the sixth phase polling ended for the general elections. The situation arose as the Election Commission ordered to close shops at 6 pm on Friday after campaigning in Delhi ended and asked to reopen only after the polling ended at 6 pm today. The demand was high in East, North and West Delhi.

headlines: Apple mkt value falls $75B in 1 week amid US-China trade war
text: Apple lost about $75 billion of its market value in a single week, Bloomberg reported. This came amid the US hiking trade tariffs on $200 billion worth of goods from China. Notably, the technology company's supply chain and production are linked to China, a region which accounted for nearly 20% of its 2018 revenue, as per data compiled by Bloomberg.

headlines: Majority of ASAT debris in space now decayed: DRDO
text: DRDO Chairman G Satheesh Reddy said, "As per the information that we have already got, most of the debris [created by the anti-satellite (ASAT) missile test in March] have decayed." The remaining pieces will be decaying in a short period of time, he added. Earlier, NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine had said ASAT missile test created 400 pieces of orbital debris.

headlines: Crisis in NBFC sector imminent: Corporate Affairs Secretary
text: Corporate Affairs Secretary Injeti Srinivas has said there is an "imminent crisis" in the Non-Banking Financial Companies (NBFCs) sector. "There is a credit squeeze, over-leveraging, excessive concentration, massive mismatch between assets and liabilities, coupled with some misadventures by some very large entities," he added. "[This] is a perfect recipe for disaster," Srinivas further said.

headlines: Man City win their 4th PL title as title race goes till last day
text: Manchester City clinched their fourth Premier League title after winning the 2018/2019 season on the last day of the league that started on August 11, 2018. Manchester City registered a 4-1 victory against Brighton to accumulate 98 points in 38 matches with 32 victories, while Liverpool, who were also in the title race till today, finished second with 97 points.

headlines: US actress urges 'sex strike' in protest against abortion law
text: US actress and #MeToo activist Alyssa Milano has urged women to take part in a "sex strike" to protest against a legislation restricting abortion in the state of Georgia. "Until women have legal control over our own bodies we just cannot risk pregnancy," she tweeted. The law bans abortions as soon as a foetal heartbeat can be detected.

headlines: Finally did what mom wanted, shaved after 2 yrs: Madhavan
text: Actor R Madhavan shared a picture of himself on the occasion of Mother's Day on Sunday. "HAPPY MOTHERS DAY MAA...I finally did what you have been asking me to...Shaved after 2 YEARS," he wrote. Referring to his upcoming biographical film 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect', Madhavan added, "The YOUNGER NAMBI NARAYANAN is ready to go to France and win them over."

headlines: Movie mafia a** licker: Rangoli to Richa for statement on Kangana
text: Kangana Ranaut's sister Rangoli has reacted to Richa Chadha's remark wherein she said unlike Kangana, she wouldn't engage in war of words on a public platform. "Kangana slogged for 14 years to earn her freedom...And here are some jobless actors, movie mafia a** lickers," Rangoli tweeted. "The truth is if you could, you would [indulge in public fights]," she added.

headlines: Vadra tweets after casting vote, mistakenly puts Paraguay's flag
text: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi's husband Robert Vadra took to Twitter to share a picture of himself after voting in the Lok Sabha elections. Robert mistakenly put Paraguay's flag emoji instead of India's in his tweet while urging others to vote. Vadra, who had tweeted at 1:29 pm, deleted the tweet around four hours later.

headlines: Priyanka Gandhi reveals why her 19-year-old son did not vote
text: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Sunday said her 19-year-old son, Raihan, could not vote in the Lok Sabha elections because he had gone back to London for his exams. Raihan would have been a first time voter in this election. He and his sister Miraya, were earlier seen with Priyanka during some of her campaigns in Uttar Pradesh.

headlines: Wrestler Silver King dies in ring, fans thought it was part of show
text: Former World Championship Wrestling star Silver King died in the ring after collapsing during a fight against Warrior Youth in London on Saturday night. The wrestler, whose real name is Cesar Barron, is said to have died from a heart attack. The crowd and other wrestlers believed the "collapse" was part of the show until people raced into the ring.

headlines: Surrounded by remarkable women in life: Bill Gates on Mother's Day
text: On the occasion of Mother's Day on Sunday, the world's second-richest person Bill Gates shared a picture with his mother, late Mary Maxwell Gates, and tweeted, "All my life I've been surrounded by remarkable women." "I was moved when Melinda (wife) decided to write about two of them Â— my mother and grandmother Â— in her new book," he added.

headlines: Boyfriend refuses to delete selfie, girl sends gang to abduct him
text: A 20-year-old girl from Chennai hired three men to attack her boyfriend after he allegedly refused to delete a selfie from his phone. An argument broke out between the two over the selfie after which the boyfriend hit the girl with a helmet. The three-man gang abducted the boyfriend and abandoned him after robbing him of his watch and cellphone.

headlines: Unilever may offer $1 bn for skincare firm Drunk Elephant: Report
text: Consumer goods giant Unilever is considering a $1 billion offer to buy US skincare brand Drunk Elephant, as per reports. The skincare brand hired investment banks in January this year to explore a sale, the reports added. Founded in 2012 by Texan mother-of-four Tiffany Masterson, the brand makes skincare products with natural and non-toxic ingredients.

headlines: 104-year-old Suraj Kaur casts her vote in Haryana
text: 104-year-old Suraj Kaur cast her vote on Sunday as all ten Lok Sabha constituencies of Haryana went to polls in the sixth phase of the general elections. Kaur, a resident of Bhiwani district, reached the polling booth accompanied by her family members. Earlier in the day, 111-year-old Delhi's oldest voter, Bachan Singh cast his vote in the national capital.

headlines: Hope you make this day extra special: Sachin on Pollard's b'day
text: Wishing former Mumbai Indians teammate Kieron Pollard on his 32nd birthday, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Wishing you a very Happy Birthday @KieronPollard55! Hope you can make this day extra special. You know what I mean." Pollard has featured in all the games for Mumbai Indians this season, managing 238 runs in 13 innings at an average of 29.75.

headlines: There is no bigger riot-monger than PM Modi: Mamata Banerjee
text: Addressing a rally in West Bengal, state CM Mamata Banerjee criticised PM Narendra Modi saying that "there's no bigger riot-monger" than PM Modi in the country. Referring to the 2002 Gujarat riots, Mamata added that former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee had instructed PM Modi to follow "raj-dharma". She said Vajpayee also warned PM Modi that he'll "dissolve the Gujarat government".

headlines: I couldn't go to vote to Rajgarh and I regret it: Digvijaya
text: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh on Sunday said that he regrets that he couldn't go to Rajgarh in Madhya Pradesh to cast his vote in the Lok Sabha elections. Singh was in Bhopal from where he is contesting the elections against BJP's Sadhvi Pragya. Earlier in the day, Singh told reporters that he will try to reach Rajgarh to cast vote.

headlines: I don't know how you bowl to Jos Buttler: Mickey Arthur
text: Speaking about Jos Buttler, who scored England's second-fastest ODI ton against Pakistan on Saturday, Pakistan coach Mickey Arthur said that he and his bowlers have no idea on how to bowl to Buttler. "I don't think we're going to stop him, so we've got to try to get him out," Arthur said about Buttler.

headlines: Liverpool's Van Dijk wins PL Player of the Season award
text: Liverpool defender Virgil van Dijk has been named the Premier League Player of the Season. Van Dijk becomes the first defender to win the Player of the Season award after Manchester CityÂ’s Vincent Kompany in 2011-12. "ItÂ’s a great honour and IÂ’m very proud. Without everyone here at Liverpool, fans and players, it wouldnÂ’t be possible," Van Dijk said.

headlines: Feature film on Michael Schumacher to release in December
text: A feature film made on former Formula One driver Michael Schumacher is set to release in December, the trailer of which will be publicly shown for the first time at the upcoming Cannes Film Festival. The film has received the full backing of his family, including his wife of 24 years, Corinna, and the couple's two children.

headlines: Lewis Hamilton wins Spanish Grand Prix, Bottas finishes second
text: Mercedes' British driver Lewis Hamilton clinched the title at the Spanish Grand Prix, also winning the extra point for the fastest lap at the race on Sunday. The race saw Mercedes' Valtteri Bottas finish second in the race, with Red Bull's Max Verstappen finishing in the third spot. This was the fifth straight 1-2 finish for Mercedes.

headlines: ICC satisfied England did not tamper ball in 2nd ODI vs Pakistan
text: The ICC are satisfied that the ball was not tampered with in the second England-Pakistan ODI on Saturday. Video footage showed England cricketer Liam Plunkett moving his fingers over the ball while preparing to deliver it. "There was no attempt by Liam Plunkett to change the condition of the ball or any evidence of this," ICC said in a statement.

headlines: Foldable laptops are at least some 2 years away: Intel
text: Joshua Newman, who is the GM of Mobile Innovation Segments at Intel, told the Nikkei Asian Review that foldable laptops are at least two years away from reaching consumers. "[W]e are trying to understand the capability and the limitation of the [foldable] technology," Newman explained. Intel is researching the technology with Samsung Display, LG Display, among others, he added.

headlines: Stop sale of mobile signal boosters on e-comm sites: COAI to DoT
text: Telecom lobby group COAI in a letter to Department of Telecom asked for government intervention to stop the sale of mobile signal boosters on certain e-commerce platforms despite restrictions. Earlier, COAI wrote directly to platforms asking they stop the sale of boosters. "Amazon operates an online marketplace in India. Sellers...are solely responsible for...product compliance," Amazon had said.

headlines: Act now or face far worse terms: Donald Trump warns China
text: US President Donald Trump has said it would be wise for China to "act now" to finish a trade deal. He added that "far worse" terms would be offered after the next election. "China felt they were beaten so badly in negotiations that they may...wait for next election...The only problem is that they know I'm going to win," Trump said.

headlines: Emirates Chief Commercial Officer resigns after profit falls
text: Emirates Chief Commercial Officer Thierry Antinori has resigned, a company spokesperson said on Sunday, days after the Gulf airline announced its weakest profit in a decade. Emirates posted a 69% fall in 2018-19 profit amid rising fuel costs and slow passenger growth. Antinori, who joined Emirates in 2011, was responsible for commercial operations, the frequent flyer program and cargo division.

headlines: Glenn McGrath once sledged Sarwan asking him about Lara's d**k
text: Ex-Australian pacer Glenn McGrath sledged ex-Windies batsman Ramnaresh Sarwan during a Test on May 12, 2003, asking the latter, "What does Brian Lara's d**k taste like?" Sarwan responded, "I don't know. Ask your wife." McGrath, whose wife was suffering from cancer at the time, then said, "If you f**king mention my wife again, I'll f**king rip your f**king throat out."

headlines: Uber's first employee, now a billionaire, was hired through a tweet
text: Uber's first-ever employee Ryan Graves, a billionaire due to his equity in the company, was hired through a tweet. In 2010, Uber Co-founder Travis Kalanick had tweeted, "Looking 4 entrepreneurial product mgr/biz-dev", to which Graves replied, "email me", and became Uber's first employee on March 1 that year. Uber made its IPO at the New York Stock Exchange on Friday.

headlines: Sidharth, Taapsee cast their votes in Lok Sabha elections in Delhi
text: Sidharth Malhotra and Taapsee Pannu were among the actors who cast their votes during the sixth phase of Lok Sabha elections in Delhi. Sharing a picture on Instagram, Sidharth wrote, "Took a quick break and came to Delhi for this. I've done my bit, it's time you do yours!" Taapsee also shared a photo with her mother after voting.

headlines: 46 yrs ago, my grandmom played Big B's mom in Zanjeer: Emraan
text: Emraan Hashmi on Sunday tweeted that 46 years ago, his grandmother had played the role of Amitabh Bachchan's mother in 'Zanjeer'. "An uncanny coincidence: yesterday was my first scene with Mr Bachchan and in the course of our conversation just realised.. yesterday was also 46 years of #zanjeer," he tweeted. Emraan is working with Bachchan in the upcoming film 'Chehre'.

headlines: CSK captain MS Dhoni to play his ninth IPL final in 12 seasons
text: CSK captain MS Dhoni will become the first cricketer to play nine IPL finals when he takes the field against MI in IPL 2019 final tonight. The 37-year-old has led CSK in seven finals, winning thrice, and played for RPS in IPL 2017 final. He has scored 178 runs in eight previous finals at a strike rate of 142.4.

headlines: If you have no work, come for a meal: Sheila Dikshit to Kejriwal
text: Claiming Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal was spreading rumours about her health, Delhi Congress chief Sheila Dikshit tweeted, "If you have no work, come for a meal. You'll see how I'm doing...and learn to fight elections without spreading rumours." However, Kejriwal said he never commented on her health. "When should I come to your home for the meal?" he asked.

headlines: Zuckerberg has too much power, no accountability: Facebook Co-founder
text: Days after suggesting 'It's time to break up Facebook', Facebook Co-founder Chris Hughes said CEO Mark Zuckerberg has "too much power and no accountability for mistakes." "One company, one person has outsized power...2.4 billion people...and Facebook owns WhatsApp, Instagram," Hughes said. "There's a board but because Mark owns 60% of voting shares...he's not accountable really to that board," he added.

headlines: Science is real, don't embarrass India: Dadlani on PM's cloud remark
text: Singer-composer Vishal Dadlani on Sunday criticised Prime Minister Narendra Modi over his "clouds can save jets from radar" remark. "Science is real. Please consult someone qualified before you speak, so you don't embarrass India in the eyes of the world. At least until results are announced, you're our PM. Have some concern for how India is regarded," he tweeted.

headlines: Trapped in snow at 15,000 feet, 300 yaks starve to death in Sikkim
text: Around 300 yaks have starved to death due to cold and excessive snowfall at an altitude of around 15,000 feet in North Sikkim, forcing authorities to rush medical teams to save the remaining animals. To save themselves from the cold, families which earn their living by selling yak milk and cheese came down to lower altitudes, leaving the flock behind.

headlines: Facing 'unprecedented' pressure from US sanctions: Iran President
text: Renewed US sanctions have led to worse economic conditions than during the country's 1980-88 war with neighbouring Iraq, Iranian President Hassan Rouhani said, adding that the country is facing "unprecedented" pressure. Rouhani called for political unity to face down sanctions. His comments came amid rising tensions with the US, which last week deployed warships and warplanes to the Gulf.

headlines: Looking for more matches, teams in next Women's T20 challenge: Kaur
text: After clinching the maiden Women's T20 Challenge title, Supernovas' skipper Harmanpreet Kaur said, "We are looking for more matches and more teams in the next Women's T20 Challenge." "[I]t was [a] great tournament for me, I learnt a lot from it and the same goes for other players also... [T]hat's what we were expecting," Kaur added.

headlines: Chief Election Commissioner Sunil Arora casts vote in Delhi
text: Chief Election Commissioner Sunil Arora cast his vote at Delhi's Nirman Bhawan polling booth on Sunday. "Every vote counts and I appeal to voters to vote ethically and fearlessly," Arora said after casting his vote. Election Commissioner Sushil Chandra and his wife also cast their vote at New Moti Bagh polling station of New Delhi parliamentary.

headlines: I'll see, will try to reach: Digvijaya on not reaching city to vote
text: Congress' Digvijaya Singh, who was seen in Bhopal today, said "I will see, I will try to reach" on being asked when he will go to Rajgarh to cast his vote. Singh is contesting Lok Sabha elections from Bhopal against BJP's Sadhvi Pragya, an accused in the 2008 Malegaon blast case. Notably, Rajgarh is about 140 km away from Bhopal.

headlines: Raj tantra has turned into 'goonda tantra' in Bengal: Naqvi
text: Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi criticised Mamata Banerjee-led TMC government in West Bengal saying that "raj tantra" has turned into "goonda tantra" in Bengal. Condemning attacks on BJP leaders in Bengal, Naqvi added the BJP wants action against "growing anarchy, booth capturing incidents and violence in the state". Naqvi said Mamata's "ego and intellect will choo-mantra (vanish)" on May 23.

headlines: Delhi's oldest voter casts vote, hasn't missed voting since 1951
text: Delhi's oldest voter, 111-year-old Bachan Singh who according to his youngest son hasn't missed out voting in elections since 1951, on Sunday cast his vote in a polling station in Delhi's Tilak Vihar. Singh, who suffered paralytic attack recently, reached the booth in a car along with poll officers. "I will vote for those who worked for us," Singh said.

headlines: TMC indulging in violence due to frustration: Javadekar
text: Union Minister and BJP leader Prakash Javadekar on Sunday said that Trinamool Congress (TMC) is indulging in violence due to "frustration". "TMC is feeling the heat because people are against it and voting for BJP," he added. This comes after BJP's Ghatal candidate Bharati Ghosh alleged that she was manhandled by TMC workers at a polling booth in the constituency.

headlines: Royole patent shows smartwatch with foldable display
text: A patent filed by the maker of the world's first commercial foldable smartphone Royole, which has an office in China, shows a smartwatch having a foldable display. The wristband will have a flexible, touch-sensitive panel that can open to provide access to a larger display surface, the patent states. When folded, the display will be held together using magnets.

headlines: Germany opens first 'electric highway' test track for trucks
text: Germany has opened its first electric highway test route for hybrid trucks in Hesse. The trucks are equipped with electric motor, diesel engine and batteries that can be charged from overhead power lines. The government has funded the pilot project's construction with Â€14.6 million along with Â€15.3 million available for conducting field trials in Hesse, which will run till 2022.

headlines: I'm no longer managing company's affairs: Foxconn Chairman
text: Foxconn Technology Group Chairman Terry Gou has said he will not continue to lead the company's board once a new lineup is elected at an annual shareholders' meeting next month. "I am sure, 100%...I am no longer managing [the company's] affairs," the 69-year-old said. Gou, a billionaire, had announced last month that he will contest Taiwan's 2020 presidential election.

headlines: PM Modi condoles deaths of 15 people in Andhra road accident
text: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday condoled the deaths of 15 people killed in a road accident in Andhra Pradesh's Kurnool district. The accident took place on Saturday after an SUV, in which all the victims were travelling, collided with a speeding bus. The PM called the accident "deeply unfortunate" and hoped for quick recovery of the injured.

headlines: GMR eyes strategic partners to monetise 1,500-acre Hyd land
text: GMR Infrastructure is planning to bring in strategic partners to develop around 1,500 acres in Hyderabad, a top company executive said. The project is part of the company's plan to monetise land and pare debt, he added. The Delhi-based company is looking to develop GMR Airport City near the Hyderabad airport, which would comprise office buildings, hotels and warehousing parks.

headlines: No interest in answering: Ranbir on Kangana calling him 'apolitical'
text: Ranbir Kapoor, when asked about Kangana Ranaut criticising him for not sharing his opinion on political matters, said, "I don't have any interest in giving answers to these questions." "People can say whatever they want. I know who I am and what I say," he added. Kangana had earlier said it's "irresponsible" of actors to not speak on political issues.

headlines: Virat Kohli casts his vote in Gurugram, urges others to vote
text: India captain Virat Kohli cast his vote in Lok Sabha elections at a polling booth in Gurugram's Pinecrest School. In a video shared by ANI, Kohli can be seen standing in a queue before casting his vote and posing for a photograph for voter awareness programme. "Voting is your right and responsibility towards nation building. Go vote," Kohli later tweeted.

headlines: Fan's 'How to tackle CSK' letter for MI goes viral, CSK share it
text: A fan took to social media to share a letter with Mumbai Indians titled 'How to tackle CSK in the final', which went viral. In the letter, the fan listed out eleven points for MI to get the better of CSK. The Chennai-based side shared the letter on Twitter, writing, "Bringing the infor-MI-tion to your notice, Super Coach Stephen Fleming."

headlines: Home guard accidentally fires bullet, Bihar polling official killed
text: An election official was killed after being hit by a bullet inadvertently fired from a home guard's rifle at a polling booth in Bihar's Sheohar district. The official was identified as Shivendra Kishor, a government teacher belonging to the state's Sitamarhi district. A police official said that the home guard mistakenly fired the bullet while he was cleaning his rifle.

headlines: Single, unhappy with career, man seeks permission for mercy killing
text: Upset with an unstable career and lack of marriage prospects, a 35-year-old man from Pune wrote to Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis' Office seeking permission for euthanasia. "The youth is well educated and is from a well to do family...He felt that he is not able to do anything for [his parents]...We counselled him," a senior police officer said.

headlines: Thought 'There are clouds, jets can escape radar': PM on air strikes
text: PM Narendra Modi has said in a recent interview that he gave a go-ahead to Balakot air strikes despite bad weather as he assumed cloud cover could help Indian jets escape Pakistan's radar. "This was my raw wisdom," he added. He was trolled on social media for his comment, as users pointed out that radar technology can penetrate cloud cover.

headlines: TN to implement Economically Weaker Section quota soon, issues order
text: Tamil Nadu government has issued an order to district collectors for issuing income and asset certificates to persons belonging to general category for availing reservation under the Economically Weaker Section (EWS) quota. The order said a person should not own five acres of agriculture land and above. For calculating the income, family members' income from all sources will be considered.

headlines: Harvard professor to be removed as dean for representing Weinstein
text: Harvard University law professor Ronald Sullivan Jr, who joined the legal team defending #MeToo accused Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein, is being relieved of his position as faculty dean of an undergraduate house. The Ivy League university's move follows protests over his representation of Weinstein. Sullivan and his wife Stephanie Robinson are the first black faculty deans in Harvard's history.

headlines: Pilot lands plane carrying 89 with no front wheel in Myanmar
text: A pilot landed a plane carrying 89 people with no front wheel in Myanmar's Mandalay on Sunday after the aircraft's landing gear failed. All the passengers and crew members inside the Myanmar National Airlines flight were safe. The touchdown was the second instance of a malfunctioning flight in less than a week within the country.

headlines: Those asking my caste certificate, my caste is poverty: PM
text: Alleging that Opposition in Uttar Pradesh is raising questions about his caste, PM Narendra Modi on Saturday said, "Those asking for my caste certificate, my only caste is poverty." He added that although he was born poor, he worked relentlessly to remove poverty. He further said that SP and BSP leaders gathered crores of rupees in the name of caste.

headlines: BJP's Bharati Ghosh breaks down on being manhandled at poll booth
text: BJP's Ghatal candidate Bharati Ghosh broke down after she was allegedly manhandled by a group of women at a polling booth in the constituency on Sunday. Her convoy was also attacked when she was going to visit another polling booth. West Bengal Chief Electoral Officer has sought a report from West Medinipur district magistrate about the incident.

headlines: Love is going to win: Rahul Gandhi after casting his vote
text: After casting his vote in Delhi, Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Sunday said, "PM Narendra Modi used hatred, we (Congress) used love. And, I think love is going to win." He further said that people will decide if Congress will emerge victorious in the elections. Congress' candidate from New Delhi constituency Ajay Maken had accompanied him to the polling booth.

headlines: EC must check vehicles of PM, Union Ministers, says Mamata
text: Alleging that the BJP is using money to buy votes, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee demanded that the Election Commission (EC) should check all vehicles, including helicopters, used by PM Narendra Modi and other Union Ministers. She also asked the EC to check her car and helicopter if needed. Mamata further urged the EC to maintain "proper democracy" in Bengal.

headlines: Don't be surprised if DC soon become IPL champions: Gavaskar
text: Former Indian cricketer Sunil Gavaskar praised Delhi Capitals and stated, "Delhi is the team to watch out for and don't be surprised if they get their hands on the trophy sooner than later." Gavaskar also spoke about the upcoming IPL 2019 final, saying, "Mumbai will clearly start as favourites having beaten Chennai... in their three meetings so far this season."

headlines: Your chest is 56 inch, how can I slap you? Mamata to PM Modi
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Saturday said that she doesn't want to slap or touch PM Narendra Modi, adding, "Your chest is 56 inch, how can I slap you?" She further said that if she slaps him, her hand will break. This comes days after Mamata said that she wants to give PM Modi a "tight slap of democracy".

headlines: Even Rahul doesn't know who is Congress' PM candidate: Yogi
text: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Saturday said that even Congress President Rahul Gandhi doesn't know who is his party's PM candidate. "Since they know their party is not coming to power, so there is no point in declaring a PM candidate," he added. He further said that the SP-BSP-RLD alliance is confused about their candidate for the PM post.

headlines: Sonia Gandhi, Priyanka, Robert Vadra cast their votes in Delhi
text: UPA Chairperson Sonia Gandhi, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi and her husband Robert Vadra on Sunday cast their votes in Delhi during the ongoing sixth phase of the general elections. After casting her vote, Priyanka said that she has cast her vote to "safeguard democracy". The Congress General Secretary added that PM Narendra Modi-led BJP government will "definitely lose this time".

headlines: Windies beat Ireland by 5 wickets, set ODI run-chase record
text: The Windies registered their highest-ever successful run-chase to defeat Ireland by five wickets with 13 balls to spare in the fourth ODI in Dublin on Saturday. Sunil Ambris hit his maiden ODI hundred ending with a 126-ball 148. Earlier in the match, Andy Balbirnie had hit a 124-ball 135. The Windies have now reached the final of the tri-nation series.

headlines: Surveillance cam to capture objects 45-km away made in China
text: China's Science and Technology University researchers have developed a new AI-based camera that can click images of objects as far as about 45 kilometres away. It uses a specially-developed low-power infrared laser, capable of penetrating through smog and fog, to create super-high-resolution shots. The camera was set up on 20th floor of a building in Shanghai for the test image.

headlines: UP Cong leader resigns alleging humiliation by Priyanka
text: Congress's Bhadohi district president Neelam Misra and some other office bearers resigned from the party on Saturday alleging humiliation by Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi. Misra said that Priyanka not only ignored her and the office bearer's grievances but also used "strong words" against her publicly. She added that now they will support SP-BSP alliance candidate Rangnath Misra.

headlines: Elon Musk's brain tech startup Neuralink raises $39 million
text: Neuralink, an American neurotechnology startup co-founded by Elon Musk, has raised $39 million of a planned $51 million funding round, Bloomberg said quoting a filing with the SEC. As per its LinkedIn, Neuralink is developing ultra-high bandwidth brain-machine interfaces to connect humans and computers. Notably, billionaire Elon Musk is the CEO of Tesla and SpaceX.

headlines: UP man commits suicide by jumping from 6th floor of Mumbai airport
text: A 31-year-old man named Akshay Saraswat from Ghaziabad allegedly committed suicide by jumping from the sixth floor of Mumbai International Airport building on Saturday, police said. A suicide note was found from his bag saying, "No one is responsible for my death." The family of the deceased claimed that he was mentally disturbed for the last two years, police added.

headlines: Bitcoin jumps to 9-month high, rises 11% to over $7,500
text: Bitcoin surged by over $1,000 to the highest level since August 2018, as cryptocurrencies extended their rebound from a slump last month. The biggest cryptocurrency rose up to 11% to $7,543 on Sunday, according to Bitstamp. The price of Bitcoin has more than doubled since its fall in December 2018 and is now rising for the sixth-straight day on Bitstamp.

headlines: Voting begins in Delhi, 6 other states in 6th phase of elections
text: Voting for the sixth phase of the 17th Lok Sabha elections has begun today. The phase covers 59 constituencies across seven states and union territories including Delhi, UP, Haryana, West Bengal, Bihar, Jharkhand and Madhya Pradesh. Over 1,13,167 polling booths are in place for smooth conduct of polls, while 10.18 crore registered voters will decide the fate of 979 candidates.

headlines: Same people love Avengers: SOTY 2 actor on film's student life criticism
text: Reacting to audience criticism over "unrealistic" portrayal of student life in 'Student of the Year 2', film's actor Aditya Seal said, "They're exactly who will watch Avengers, love it and believe superheroes exist, but they will give us flak for it." "This is fantasy," he added. "We're trying to create a world...people want to be a part of," he added.

headlines: My 7-yr-old son was embarrassed because I was bald: Tahira on cancer
