text: Recalling getting bald during her cancer treatment, actor Ayushmann Khurrana's wife Tahira Kashyap has revealed that her seven-year-old son was embarrassed because she was bald. "He told me not to come in front of his friends. But I didn't want that. So I went & met all his friends, they gaped for a bit, but were normal later," she added.

headlines: Supernovas defeat Velocity on last ball to win Women's T20 Challenge
text: Harmanpreet Kaur-led Supernovas chased down the target of 122 on the last ball against Mithali Raj-led Velocity on Saturday to win the Women's T20 Challenge. Supernovas were helped by Harmanpreet, who slammed 51 off 37 balls including three sixes and four fours. The final took place at Sawai Mansingh Stadium in Rajasthan's Jaipur.

headlines: Partition would not have happened if Jinnah was PM: BJP Candidate
text: Guman Singh Damor, BJP candidate from Madhya Pradesh's Ratlam Lok Sabha constituency, on Saturday said that the partition would not have happened had Muhammad Ali Jinnah become the first Prime Minister of India. "Had Jawaharlal Nehru not been so obstinate during Independence, India would not have been divided," he added. "Jinnah was an advocate and a learned man," Damor said.

headlines: BJP worker found dead in West Bengal's Jhargram a day before polls
text: A BJP worker was found dead in West Bengal's Jhargram on Saturday night. Jhargram, 167 km from Kolkata, is voting today in the sixth phase of the Lok Sabha elections. BJP leader Kailash Vijayvargiya alleged that Trinamool Congress workers entered the BJP worker's home and killed him. The Trinamool Congress has however denied any links to the worker's death.

headlines: The way Ponting talks, it's just like a song or a rap: Shreyas Iyer
text: Delhi Capitals captain Shreyas Iyer has said that the way their team head coach Ricky Ponting talks, it's just like a song or a rap. "Ponting is definitely a legend. Whenever he talks in the dressing room, no one has to talk after that. Because if someone does that, it's of no use," he added.

headlines: Dhoni's daughter Ziva teaches Hindi vowels to Pant in viral video
text: In a video posted on Chennai Super Kings captain MS Dhoni's daughter Ziva's Instagram account, she can be seen teaching Delhi Capitals wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant Hindi lessons. In the video, Rishabh can be seen repeating Hindi vowels after Ziva. After receiving the lessons, Pant can be heard saying to Ziva, "Thank you, madam".

headlines: Ex-SA cricketer Gibbs was once fined for smoking marijuana
text: Former South African cricketer Herschelle Gibbs was fined South African rand 10,000 on May 11, 2001 for smoking marijuana in a hotel room in Antigua during the tour of Windies. Gibbs admitted to smoking marijuana during celebrations after winning the Test series. Other South African cricketers Paul Adams, Roger Telemachus, Andre Nel, Justin Kemp and Craig Smith were also fined.

headlines: Trescothick falls twice running between wickets, video goes viral
text: A video of Somerset's 43-year-old batsman Marcus Trescothick falling twice while running between the wickets has gone viral on social media. The ICC also shared the video, writing, "That's not what captains normally mean when they ask for 'two slips'." Former England captain Michael Vaughan wrote on Instagram, "This will not be bettered this year."

headlines: No way we can send our team to Sri Lanka: BCB chief
text: Bangladesh Cricket Board president Nazmul Hasan has dismissed the possibility of sending Bangladesh cricket team to Sri Lanka in the wake of the terror attack. "There's no way we can send our team there with the prevailing security situation and we're taking these things into consideration," he said. Bangladesh were scheduled to tour Sri Lanka for three ODIs in July.

headlines: Cyclone Fani creates four new mouths in Odisha's Chilika Lake
text: Cyclone Fani, the strongest storm to hit India since 2014, has created four new mouths connecting to the Bay of Bengal in Odisha's Chilika Lake, Asia's largest brackish water lagoon. Officials at Chilika Development Authority (CDA) have started assessing the impact of the rise in salinity in the lake. Chilika had only two active mouths before the cyclone.

headlines: Pak couple caught living with fake Aadhaar cards in B'luru deported
text: A Pakistani couple, convicted of illegally entering India and creating Aadhaar cards using fake documents while living in Bengaluru, was deported to Pakistan on Saturday. The husband and wife were handed over to Pakistani authorities at the Wagah-Attari border. The couple was arrested in May 2017 along with another Pakistani woman who had married an Indian.

headlines: 66 out of 82 members of Allahabad's biggest family to vote tomorrow
text: As many as 66 members, including eight first-time voters, of Allahabad's biggest family will vote in the 17th Lok Sabha elections tomorrow. The family, headed by 98-year-old Ram Naresh Bhurtia, has a total of 82 members. "We are all registered at one polling station and even the polling officials welcome us when we go to vote," he said.

headlines: Bugs crawl out of US girl's backpack in school; mother arrested
text: A US mother has been arrested on felony neglect charges after police said her five children were living in filthy conditions, including a girl whose backpack allegedly had bugs crawl out of it at school. A school worker had alleged the 33-year-old's daughter had bugs in her bag and that she wore the same clothes to school for a week.

headlines: You've most perfect ti**ies: US woman shares texts from delivery boy
text: A woman based in US' Philadelphia shared vulgar messages that she received from the person who delivered her food order. "You are gorgeous...you have the most perfect ti**ies," the messages read. "I can't even eat my FU**ING pizza fries in my own home without some piece of shit man making me feel uncomfortable and unsafe...I felt so violated," she tweeted.

headlines: Didn't quit JD(S), was expelled by HD Deve Gowda: Siddaramaiah
text: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah on Saturday clarified that he didn't quit JD(S) but was expelled by former PM and party supremo HD Deve Gowda. "BJP asks why I quit Janata Dal (Secular) and joined Congress. I didn't quit JD(S) but was expelled...by Deve Gowda for my AHINDA activities," he said. AHINDA in Kannada stands for minorities and backward castes.

headlines: Djokovic beats Thiem to reach Madrid Open final
text: Novak Djokovic defeated Austria's Dominic Thiem in straight sets to reach the final of the Madrid Open. Djokovic is into his third Madrid Open final, a tournament that he has won twice in the past. The Serbian is aiming to tie Spaniard Rafael Nadal's record of 33 ATP Masters 1000 titles to his name.

headlines: Zlatan Ibrahimovic fined for diving in MLS
text: Former Barcelona and Manchester United forward Zlatan Ibrahimovic has been fined an undisclosed amount after being found guilty of diving during his team LA Galaxy's loss against Columbus Crew in the Major League Soccer. The incident occurred after a collision with Crew goalkeeper Zack Steffen. Zlatan has scored nine goals in nine games in the MLS so far this season.

headlines: Why award-wapsi gang silent on Alwar rape? PM Modi
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday said, "I want to ask the 'award-wapsi' gang why they are silent on the rape of Alwar's daughter. The Congress too has not taken up the issue." He accused that the state government (Congress) and police tried to cover up the incident. "This is the truth of the Congress 'nyay' (justice)," the PM added.

headlines: Some deep-sea fish adapted to see colour in darkness: Study
text: An international team of researchers has discovered that a unique genetic adaptation in some deep-sea fishes lets them see colour in near-total darkness. The fishes have several genes for the light-sensitive photopigment 'rhodopsin', which likely enables them to detect bioluminescent signals, researchers said. Nearly all vertebrates, including humans, are colour-blind in darkness, they added.

headlines: Namrata criticises troll who wrote 'Use makeup, are you depressed?'
text: Actress Namrata Shirodkar criticised a troll who commented on her Instagram picture that she should put some makeup and asked if she was suffering from depression. "You might love women with make-up...maybe you should follow someone who is always made up and suits your criteria! You are not going to find it on this page!" she responded.

headlines: First interaction with Yuvraj wasn't good, he showed attitude: Rohit
text: MI captain Rohit Sharma has revealed his first interaction with Yuvraj Singh didn't go well, adding the veteran all-rounder showed him attitude. He said that he unknowingly took Yuvraj's seat in the team bus after which Yuvraj told him, "Do you know whose seat is this?" and they had an eye-to-eye contact. "Yuvraj means attitude and all that," Rohit added.

headlines: Buttler has now smashed England's top two fastest ODI hundreds
text: Wicketkeeper-batsman Jos Buttler on Saturday smashed the second-fastest hundred by an England cricketer in ODI cricket off 50 balls, against Pakistan in the second ODI at Southampton. The 28-year-old also holds the record for smashing the fastest ODI hundred for England, achieving the feat off 46 balls against Pakistan in 2015. Buttler scored 110*(55) including nine sixes today.

headlines: Pregnant teacher dies at workshop after school allegedly denies leave
text: Sudharani, a 32-year-old teacher working at a school of the Sri Chaitanya Educational Institutions in Andhra Pradesh, bled to death after collapsing at a workshop in Kurnool. As per reports, she was three months pregnant and had sought for sick leave as she was unwell. However, the school allegedly turned down her request and sought her presence at the workshop.

headlines: Dabbawalas to gift Lord Hanuman locket to Prince Harry, Meghan's son
text: Mumbai's Dabbawalas are gifting anklets, waistband and a pendant with Lord Hanuman's idol to UK Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's newborn son Archie Harrison Mountbatten-Windsor. "Lord Hanuman is the symbol of strength and intellect. We want Archie to absorb these characteristics," they said. They had gifted traditional Maharashtrian wedding outfits to the couple when they got married last year.

headlines: Pakistan bans 11 outfits linked to Hafiz Saeed and Masood Azhar
text: Pakistan has banned 11 outfits linked to 26/11 Mumbai attacks mastermind Hafiz Saeed's Jamaat-ud-Dawa (JuD), its charity wing Falah-e-Insaniat Foundation (FIF) and Masood Azhar's Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM). Pakistan announced a ban on JeM earlier this month after Azhar was designated as a global terrorist by the United Nations Security Council. It had banned JuD and FIF in March.

headlines: Pak offers India halt on artillery fire to ease tensions along LoC
text: Pakistan has offered India a moratorium on the artillery fire from both sides in a bid to ease tensions along the LoC, a senior Indian official said. "Terror infrastructure in close vicinity of the LoC has been temporarily closed due to overall pressure being maintained on Pakistan," said a report sent to PMO and seen by Hindustan Times.

headlines: Ex-BBC RJ compares Harry, Meghan's baby with chimpanzee; probed
text: Former BBC Radio 5 Live presenter Danny Baker, who compared UK Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's newborn to a chimpanzee, is being investigated by the police. Baker's tweet showed an image of a couple holding hands with a chimpanzee dressed in clothes with the caption "Royal Baby leaves hospital". The 61-year-old said "it was a genuine, naive and catastrophic mistake".

headlines: Woman on honeymoon at 5-star SL hotel dies 6 days after wedding
text: A 31-year-old British woman, Usheila Patel, died during her honeymoon on April 25 after suspected food poisoning at Sri Lanka's 5-star hotel Amari Galle, six days after her wedding. Usheila and her 33-year-old husband Khilan Chandaria suffered vomiting and fever shortly after checking into the hotel. Chandaria can't leave Sri Lanka until a government report into the death is prepared.

headlines: Ujala maker Jyothy Labs' MD retires, daughter Jyothy to take over
text: Jyothy Laboratories, which sells products under brands like Ujala, Pril and Margo, has appointed MR Jyothy as its MD with effect from April 1, 2020. Jyothy is the elder daughter of MP Ramachandran, the Founder, Chairman and MD of the company. Jyothy, who has 15 years of work experience, is currently a whole-time director and the Chief Marketing Officer.

headlines: Ex-Congress leader Raj Kumar Chauhan joins BJP
text: Former Delhi minister and Congress leader Raj Kumar Chauhan joined BJP on Saturday. He quit Congress over not getting a ticket from the party for contesting 2019 Lok Sabha polls. "A ticket, cleared by the election board comprising top leaders of the party, got rejected and was given to somebody else," Chauhan, a four-time MLA, said.

headlines: Mahamilavati govts can't take strategic decisions: PM Modi
text: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday targeted the SP-BSP alliance and claimed that 'mahamilavati' government can't take strategic decisions. He referred to the 1998 Pokhran nuclear tests and said it "proves what strong political willpower can do for national security." "India always had such ability but governments before Atal Bihari Vajpayee didn't have the courage to take such decision," he added.

headlines: Read newspapers or watch TV: Punjab CM to BJP's Sunny Deol
text: Referring to a video where BJP's Gurdaspur candidate Sunny Deol said he's unaware of Balakot airstrike, Punjab CM Amarinder Singh on Saturday said Deol must read newspapers or watch TV. "When you don't know what's happening in our country then why do you want to enter politics?" he asked. Singh alleged that BJP must have "pressurised" Deol to join them.

headlines: Godse is BJP's leader, they forgot Netaji: Mamata Banerjee
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Saturday said, "Nathuram Godse is now BJP's leader. They've forgotten Netaji (Subhas Chandra Bose) who gave the Jai Hind slogan." She accused BJP of dismantling key institutions and creating riots. "Instead of giving food, shelter and clothing, BJP dismantled Planning Commission with Niti Aayog and...started cow vigilantism and lynching syndicates," she added.

headlines: Yusuf Pathan defends Gautam Gambhir in pamphlet row
text: Indian cricketer Yusuf Pathan came out in defence of his former teammate Gautam Gambhir in the row over the alleged pamphlets being used against AAP candidate Atishi. Yusuf tweeted, "He is a man of honour, @GautamGambhir won't do something to disrespect women." Gambhir has challenged Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal to provide proof against him.

headlines: Qualcomm CEO gets $3.5-mn worth bonus post Apple settlement
text: Steve Mollenkopf, CEO of American chipmaking giant Qualcomm, was awarded $3.5-million worth of shares as bonus for settling a two-year-long multi-billion dollar legal battle with Apple, regulatory filings revealed. The total awards to the team amount to nearly $8.8 million, calculated as per Friday's closing share price of $85.84. Notably, Qualcomm shares are up around 50% since the settlement.

headlines: Vaping consumer body asks K'taka to lift ban on e-cigarettes
text: Consumer rights group Association of Vapers India (AVI) has asked the Karnataka government to lift the state ban on e-cigarettes, claiming it is anti-consumer and risks the lives of over 1.8 crore smokers. The ban "criminalises citizens who are trying to avoid tobacco-related death and disease," AVI Director said on Friday. The state government had banned e-cigarettes in 2016.

headlines: T'gana Cong leaders clash while protesting against KCR govt
text: Congress leaders in Telangana on Saturday entered into a scuffle while protesting against K Chandrashekar Rao-led Telangana Rashtra Samithi government. Congress' V Hanumantha Rao and Nagesh Mudiraj, reportedly, clashed over the seating arrangement on the dais during the protest. The protest was held against the alleged irregularity in the state board examination results.

headlines: Russia complains of alcohol smell on ISS post SpaceX docking
text: Russia has sent a complaint to NASA over a strong smell of isopropyl alcohol aboard the International Space Station (ISS) after SpaceX's Crew Dragon spacecraft's March docking. It said unusually high concentration of the alcohol was noticed, smell of which reportedly disappeared after the spacecraft left. NASA acknowledged the issue, adding it was not dangerous to the station and crew.

headlines: I disagree on timing: Uber CEO on Elon Musk's robotaxi plan
text: Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi, responding to queries about Tesla CEO Elon Musk's plans to launch 10 lakh robotaxis in 2020, said, "I don't think his vision is by any means wrong. I just think we disagree on timing." "It will be quite a few years beyond [2020]," he said, adding, "If he can do it, more power to him."

headlines: Armed gunmen attack 5-star hotel in Pakistan's Balochistan
text: Armed gunmen attacked the Pearl-Continental 5-star hotel in Gwadar, Balochistan in Pakistan on Saturday. Preliminary reports suggest there are three armed gunmen inside the hotel, where gunshots have been heard. Pakistan media citing authorities said majority of guests were taken out safely from the hotel as armed militants are still holed up in one of the floors.

headlines: Karan Oberoi denies rape claims, says woman sent pics to seduce him
text: A day after being sent to judicial custody for allegedly raping and blackmailing a female astrologer, actor Karan Oberoi denied allegations of non-consensual sex and filed for bail. Submitting copies of texts exchanged between them, Karan claimed that his accuser tried to "seduce" him by sending photographs. Karan also alleged that the woman threatened to use black magic on him.

headlines: Won't have kids, don't want child to care for old parents in 20s: Kavita
text: Actress Kavita Kaushik, known for her portrayal of Chandramukhi Chautala on sitcom 'F.I.R.', has mutually decided with her husband Ronnit Biswas to never have a child. "If I have a child in my 40s...we would've touched old age in his/her 20s," 38-year-old Kavita said. "I don't want our child to take care of old parents in his/her 20s," she added.

headlines: Delhi CM Kejriwal sends legal notice to Gambhir over 'filth' remark
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has sent a legal notice to BJP's Gautam Gambhir in reference to his tweets on May 9. Gambhir called Kejriwal "filth" and said he was ashamed to have a CM like him. The notice seeks Gambhir's apology in writing and asks him to publish the same in newspapers and on social media within 24 hours.

headlines: Delhi's oldest voter, 111-year-old Bachan Singh, to cast vote tomorrow
text: Delhi's oldest voter, 111-year-old Bachan Singh, will cast his vote tomorrow in the sixth phase of Lok Sabha elections. "Not a single vote should go waste," added Bachan, who stays at Sant Garh near Tilak Nagar in West Delhi. Bachan was just three years old when Delhi became British India's capital.

headlines: Yes, I made a mistake: Priyanka Gandhi on joining politics 'too late'
text: Congress General Secretary for Uttar Pradesh East, Priyanka Gandhi, has said that she made a mistake by joining politics "very late". She added that she committed a mistake by earlier declining the offer by party President Rahul Gandhi to take up a role in Congress. "People learn from experience. So, I learnt from that," she further said.

headlines: Louis Vuitton unveils handbags with built-in flexible display
text: French luxury fashion house Louis Vuitton unveiled two handbag prototypes, each with single or dual built-in flexible displays, during its Cruise 2020 runway show in New York City. The bags displayed random city view videos and a likely demo of an internet browser. "The idea is to think of the handbag as an extension of the smartphone," the brand said.

headlines: Uber falls below $70bn value on 1st trading day, CEO blames trade war
text: Uber ended its first day of trading with a market cap of $69.7 billion, below its last private valuation of $76 billion. CEO Dara Khosrowshahi said US-China trade tensions played a role in the stock's weak performance, adding, "You can't pick when you go public". Uber priced its IPO at $45 per share, valuing the company at $75.5 billion.

headlines: Japan tests world's fastest bullet train capable of 400 kmph speed
text: Japan has started testing world's fastest bullet train, the 'ALFA-X' version of the Shinkansen train, capable of reaching 400 kmph speed. It will be tested twice a week after midnight between Sendai and Aomori, which are around 280 kilometres apart. On entering operation, it will run at up to 360 kmph, outpacing China's Fuxing train, which runs 10 kmph slower.

headlines: TIME article author a Pakistani: BJP on 'Divider in chief' cover
text: The BJP has criticised a TIME magazine article which called PM Narendra Modi "India's divider in chief". BJP said that the article's author was a Pakistani, adding that it was an attempt to malign PM Modi's image. The article has been written by Aatish Taseer, son of Indian journalist Tavleen Singh and late Pakistani politician and businessman Salmaan Taseer.

headlines: Vajpayee wanted to sack PM Modi post Godhra, Advani stalled it: Sinha
text: Former BJP leader Yashwant Sinha on Friday claimed that after Gujarat communal violence, then PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee had decided that then-state CM Narendra Modi should resign. "Atal ji had made up his mind that the Gujarat government would be dismissed if Modi ji refused to resign," said Sinha. "According to my information, Advani ji had opposed this," added Sinha.

headlines: 186 nations, excluding US, agree to regulate export of plastic waste
text: A total of 186 countries, except the US, on Friday, signed a legally-binding agreement aimed to reduce the export of plastic waste. The nations party to the agreement will now have to obtain consent from the countries they export plastic waste to. The agreement updates the 1989 Basel Convention on the control of hazardous waste to include plastic.

headlines: Ex-news presenter shot dead by unidentified gunman in Afghanistan
text: Mina Mangal, an ex-journalist and a cultural advisor in Afghanistan's Parliament was shot dead by an unidentified gunman in Kabul on Saturday. Eyewitnesses said a gunman on a motorcycle fired shots in the air to disperse people in the market and then fired two shots that hit Mangal in the chest. No group has yet claimed responsibility for the attack.

headlines: Boy calls 911 saying he's lonely & wants a friend; police respond
text: A 6-year-old boy in Florida, US, called 911 asking for a friend because he was lonely, the Tallahassee Police Department wrote on Facebook. A police officer arrived at his home and told him that he will always be his friend. The boy received a stuffed animal toy from the police department and also got to sit in a patrol car.

headlines: Overwhelmed seeing support for Sunny in Punjab: Dharmendra
text: Veteran actor Dharmendra said that he was overwhelmed to see the immense support his son and BJP candidate from Gurdaspur Sunny Deol received from the people of Punjab. "I knew people loved Sunny but did not expect they loved him this much," the actor added. Dharmendra further said that he would accompany Sunny to ensure that the people are served.

headlines: PM showed he has 76-inch chest: BJP leader on airstrikes
text: Reacting to Opposition's criticism for BJP on Balakot airstrike, Union Minister Harsh Vardhan said, "People used to say 56-inch ka seena kahan hai (before Balakot airstrike), PM Narendra Modi showed 76 inches." Vardhan also said there's nothing to politicise about airstrikes. "Everybody...talks about it, feels proud of armed forces, Air Force...PM Modi showed valour and strength," he added.

headlines: Thiem saves match points to beat Federer in Madrid
text: Austrian tennis player Dominic Thiem saved two match points to hand former world number one, Roger Federer, his first loss on his return to clay. Federer was playing his first clay-court tournament in three years. This was the 21st time that Federer held a match point(s) and lost the match. Thiem will now face Novak Djokovic in the semi-final.

headlines: Big Bash clubs can now sign six overseas players
text: Australia's Big Bash League has introduced a new rule that will allow the clubs to sign up to six overseas players across a season. Previously, Big Bash clubs were allowed to hand contracts to up to four overseas players over the course of a season. The maximum number of overseas players permitted in a club's squad will remain at two.

headlines: 8 days without power, protests erupt in cyclone-hit Odisha
text: Protests broke out in several places of Odisha on Friday over lack of electricity and water supply, eight days after Cyclone Fani hit the state. The cyclone uprooted 1.56 lakh electric poles in Bhubaneswar alone, police said. While 100% electricity will be restored in Bhubaneswar by May 12, Puri would get power only after a month, officials said.

headlines: 1 dead, 14 injured in communal clashes in Assam's Hailakandi
text: At least one person was killed and 14 others were injured after communal clashes broke out in Assam's Hailakandi on Friday, officials said. The clashes broke out when some people protested against prayers being held on a road in front of a mosque, officials added. The district administration has also sought the Army's help to maintain peace in the area.

headlines: Priyanka gets private jet to airlift kid with tumour to AIIMS
text: Congress' Priyanka Gandhi arranged for a charter plane to airlift a two-and-a-half-year-old girl in UP suffering from tumour. After the girl's parents contacted Gandhi to express their inability to bear the treatment expenses, she directed senior party leaders to arrange for the child to be taken to AIIMS Delhi. Gandhi said she'll personally take care of the girl's treatment expenses.

headlines: Irrfan is the biggest Khan for me: Kareena on Angrezi Medium
text: Speaking about working with Irrfan Khan in the upcoming film 'Angrezi Medium', Kareena Kapoor Khan said, "I've worked with all the Khans - Shah Rukh, Salman, Aamir and Saif." "But for me, it's an honour and privilege to work with Irrfan...he's the biggest Khan for me," she added. Kareena will play policewoman in the film, which also features Radhika Madan.

headlines: Anil Kapoor, Shabana's acting guru Roshan Taneja passes away at 87
text: Roshan Taneja, who trained actors such as Anil Kapoor, Shabana Azmi and Naseeruddin Shah, passed away at the age of 87 on Friday after a prolonged illness. He is survived by his wife Mithika and sons Rohit and Rahul. "He was my Guru at FTII and the only person whose feet I touched," wrote Shabana in her condolence tweet.

headlines: Dia Mirza named among 17 'SDG Advocates' by United Nations
text: Actress Dia Mirza was named among 17 global public figures appointed by United Nations Secretary-General AntÃ³nio Guterres as 'Sustainable Development Goals Advocates'. "I will strive to convey the importance of achieving sustainable development for Peace, Planet, Prosperity," Dia tweeted. Executive Chairman of Alibaba Group Jack Ma and actor Forest Whitaker were also appointed as advocates.

headlines: A Wednesday's producer jailed for 4 months over non-payment of dues
text: The Bombay High Court has sentenced Bollywood movie A Wednesday's producer Anjum Rizvi to four months in prison after he failed to follow court orders on more than one occasion in a case. A company had accused Rizvi of not paying dues. Rizvi continued to make excuses and gave false assurances which led the HC to sentence him.

headlines: BJP candidate accused of sexually assaulting minor in WB, booked
text: West Bengal child rights body has accused BJP's Diamond Harbour Lok Sabha candidate Nilanjan Roy of sexually assaulting a 17-year-old girl and filed a case against him. The child rights body said the police is "inactive in the case". Meanwhile, BJP's state Vice-President JP Majumdar called it a "false case", stating Roy is contesting against CM Mamata Banerjee's nephew Abhishek.

headlines: PM like bride who makes noise with bangles but doesn't work: Sidhu
text: Taking a dig at PM Narendra Modi, Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu said, "Modiji is like a bride who makes less chapattis but more noise with her bangles so that neighbours think she's working." Sidhu also called the PM "liar-in-chief, divider-in-chief and business manager of Ambani and Adani", in reference to TIME magazine's cover calling PM Modi "Divider in chief".

headlines: Parents went to watch Devdas when Sachin got out in 2002 final: Kaif
text: Recalling the 2002 NatWest final against England, ex-cricketer Mohammad Kaif revealed his parents went to watch Shah Rukh Khan's Devdas in theatre when Sachin Tendulkar got out. "They locked the house and didn't watch their son bat live," added Kaif, who scored 87*(75). He further said people went to theatre to tell his parents he had won India the match.

headlines: 4-year degree not necessary for coding: Apple CEO Tim Cook
text: Apple CEO Tim Cook has said he believes that a four-year degree is not really necessary to excel at coding. "I think that's an old, traditional view," Cook told TechCrunch. "If we can get coding in the early grades...by the time you graduate kids...they're already writing apps that could be put on the App Store," he added.

headlines: Swamy calls DCW 'dumb', asks Gautam Gambhir to ignore its notice
text: BJP leader Subramanian Swamy on Saturday asked BJP's East Delhi candidate Gautam Gambhir, "Why is Gambhir so defensive about a bogus self-generated Naxalite promoted anonymous letter?" Swamy added, "He should ignore it. If a dumb Commission issues notice just ignore that." Earlier, the Delhi Commission for Women issued a notice to Delhi Police over Gautam Gambhir-Atishi's pamphlet controversy.

headlines: What are the features of IAF's new Apache Guardian helicopter?
text: The IAF on Saturday received the first of its 22 Apache Guardian attack helicopters from Boeing in the US, which has significant capability in mountainous terrain. The helicopter can carry out precision attacks at standoff ranges and operate in hostile airspace with threats from the ground. It can also transmit and receive battlefield picture to and from the weapon systems.

headlines: Woman jumps before Delhi metro, survives as train passes over her
text: A 50-year-old woman tried to commit suicide at the Seelampur Metro Station in Delhi by jumping before an approaching train but survived as she fell between the tracks and the train passed over her. The woman was taken to a hospital and didn't seem to suffer any external injuries. The metro service had resumed after minor delay, officials said.

headlines: Woman asks for salary dues, gets beaten to death by ex-boss: Police
text: A 22-year-old woman was beaten to death by her former employer and his son in Ghaziabad when she came to take her pending salary from him, police said. The two allegedly also poured hot water on her face when she became unconscious. After an eyewitness informed the police, they rushed the woman to hospital but she succumbed to her injuries.

headlines: 2-year-old Syrian girls loses parents, 2 siblings in air strike
text: A two-year-old Syrian girl lost her mother, father and two siblings after a Russian air strike hit their home in the Idlib province, civilian rescue group White Helmets has said. The girl was pulled out of the rubble by the White Helmets rescuers. The Syrian government and its ally Russia have intensified their bombing campaign on rebel-held Idlib.

headlines: US to send missile defence system to Middle East amid Iran tensions
text: The US is sending a Patriot missile defence system and a warship to the Middle East amid escalating tensions with Iran. The US has said that Iran may be planning an attack on American forces in the region. Intelligence showed that the Iranians have loaded military equipment and missiles on to boats, a US official said.

headlines: Victoria's Secret says TV no longer 'right fit' for lingerie show
text: The annual Victoria's Secret Fashion Show will no longer be aired on network television, the lingerie brand's parent company L Brands Inc stated. In a memo sent out to the employees, the company's CEO Les Wexner stated, "Going forward we don't believe network television is the right fit." In 2018, the fashion show had recorded its lowest ever television ratings.

headlines: Nobel winner Feynman solved physics problems in strip clubs
text: Richard Feynman, whose 101st birth anniversary is observed today, won the 1965 Physics Nobel for his work on quantum electrodynamics. The Caltech physicist was known to frequent topless bars, doing calculations on napkins. Feynman was recruited to build the atom bomb at the age of 24 and later lead the investigation of Space Shuttle Challenger disaster that killed seven astronauts.

headlines: Marlboro maker stops ad campaign after young influencers exposed
text: Marlboro maker Philip Morris International has suspended a global social media marketing campaign following Reuters' inquiries into its use of young influencers to sell its new "heated tobacco" device. The company's internal "marketing standards" call for influencers to be 25+ years of age. Reuters reported that an Instagram influencer from Moscow promoting the product listed her age as 21.

headlines: EC not strict against leaders abusing women: Mayawati
text: BSP chief Mayawati on Saturday said that the Election Commission is not taking strict action against leaders who use derogatory or abusive language against women. She added that the Supreme Court should take strict action against these leaders and set an example for the future. Earlier, Mayawati had also accused the Election Commission of being anti-Dalit.

headlines: SP, BSP, Cong hinder development by dividing society: Yogi
text: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Saturday accused SP, BSP and Congress party of hindering the state's development by dividing the society for their benefits. "Arson, riots, mob violence, clashes used to happen daily under previous governments," he added. Yogi further said his government allowed goons at only two places in UP - "either a jail or Ram naam satya hai".

headlines: PM Modi brought back dead leaders for political gains: Naidu
text: Telugu Desam Party chief and Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu on Saturday accused PM Narendra Modi of bringing dead political leaders into politics for his political gains. Naidu added that PM Modi doesn't hesitate to bring religious wars or even kill politicians. This comes after PM Modi said that late PM Rajiv Gandhi's life ended as "Corrupt No. 1".

headlines: Musk to face trial for calling Thai cave rescuer 'pedo'
text: A defamation lawsuit against billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk will go to trial on October 22, court filings revealed. British diver Vernon Unsworth, who helped rescue 12 boys from a Thai cave last year, had sued Musk for calling him a 'pedo guy'. The remark had come after Unsworth called Musk's mini-submarine plan to help in rescue effort a "PR stunt".

headlines: Uber shares fall over 7% on first day of public trading
text: Ride-hailing giant Uber's shares fell on the first day of its Wall Street debut to close at about $41.57 apiece, an over 7.6% fall from its IPO price. Uber had priced its IPO at $45 per share, raising $8.1 billion at a valuation of over $82 billion. Shares were priced close to the bottom of its targeted $44-50 range.

headlines: Yemen's Houthi rebels to withdraw from 3 ports seized in civil war
text: Iran-backed Houthi rebels have offered to withdraw from three ports in Yemen, including the Hodeidah port, seized during the course of the ongoing civil war, the United Nations said. The Saudi-led coalition claims the Houthis are using the ports to smuggle weapons, while the rebels say they would be deprived of essential supplies if the coalition held control over them.

headlines: Jet Airways gets notice for not depositing PF amount from March
text: The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation has issued a notice to beleaguered Jet Airways for not depositing provident fund (PF) of employees since March 2019. The regional PF commissioner said that if the dues are not paid, there could be an enquiry, an FIR and a fine along with interest. Jet suspended operations on April 17 after running out of cash.

headlines: Putin falls on face after scoring 9 goals in ice hockey match
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin fell on his face after scoring nine goals in an exhibition ice hockey game at Sochi's Bolshoy Ice Dome. Putin fell after tripping over a red carpet placed on the ice for post-match celebrations while he was waving to the crowd during a victory lap. Putin played for the Hockey Legends team which won 14-7.

headlines: OnePlus 7 Pro to feature 200% more powerful vibration engine
text: OnePlus founder Pete Lau revealed in an interview that OnePlus 7 Pro will feature a 200% more powerful vibration motor than the past engines. The report stated that users will be able to alter the strength of vibrations to "Light", Â“MediumÂ”, and "Strong". The custom settings will be available for vibrations during calls and other notifications, the report added.

headlines: ITC's Non-Executive Chairman YC Deveshwar passes away aged 72
text: ITC's Non-Executive Chairman YC Deveshwar passed away on Saturday at the age of 72. The Padma Bhushan awardee, who spearheaded the diversification of ITC to an FMCG company, stepped down as chief executive of ITC in 2017. Between 1991 and 1994, he led state-owned carrier Air India as the Chairman and Managing Director.

headlines: I don't support kissing and nudity in films at all: Ajay
text: Ajay Devgn said that he doesn't support kissing and nudity in films as it doesn't cater to a family audience. "I like watching films with my family. I'm sure others too enjoy watching movies with their entire family. On-screen intimacy can therefore be uncomfortable," he added. Ajay further said that as far as possible he avoids kissing in his films.

headlines: Actress Bruna Abdullah expecting 1st child with fiancÃ© Allan
text: Brazilian actress-model Bruna Abdullah, best known for featuring in films like 'I Hate Luv Stories' and 'Grand Masti', is expecting her first child with her fiancÃ© Allan Fraser. "The baby is 22 weeks old and we're waiting with bated breath for him/her to arrive. Allan and I are grateful," Bruna said. The couple got engaged in July last year.

headlines: Actor Arunoday Singh announces separation from wife Lee Elton
text: Actor Arunoday Singh took to Instagram on Friday to announce that he and his Canadian wife Lee Elton have separated after more than two years of marriage. "Despite our best efforts, professional counselling, and...trial separation, nothing seems to have helped bridge the fundamental differences....between us," his post read. The couple tied the knot in Bhopal in December 2016.

headlines: BJP worker posts meme with Mamata's face on Priyanka's pic, held
text: BJP youth leader Priyanka Sharma was arrested in West Bengal's Howrah for allegedly sharing morphed picture of CM Mamata Banerjee as a meme on social media, police said on Friday. In the post, the CM's face was superimposed over Priyanka Chopra's picture from this year's Met Gala. Sharma violated community guidelines by sharing the picture, a cyber cell official said.

headlines: Actress Anne Hathaway receives star on Hollywood Walk Of Fame
text: Oscar-winning actress Anne Hathaway on Thursday was honoured with a star on the Hollywood Walk Of Fame in Los Angeles, US. Thanking her fans, she said, "I'm really very moved by every aspect of this." Anne was accompanied by her husband actor-producer Adam Shulman, her mother actress Kate McCauley, as well as her co-stars from her upcoming film 'The Hustle'.

headlines: Actor Arun Bakshi joins BJP, says he is highly impressed with PM
text: Actor Arun Bakshi today joined the BJP in the presence of party leader and former Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Raman Singh. "I have never seen a personality like our PM Narendra Modi. I am highly impressed with him. He has never taken an off and sleeps just for 3-4 hours," he added. Bakshi has worked in over 100 Bollywood films.

headlines: Modi ji kale hai toh kya hua dilwale hain: BJP on Sidhu's remark
text: After Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu called BJP "kale angrez", BJP leader Sambit Patra said, "Modi ji kale hai toh kya hua dilwale hain." Sidhu had urged voters in Madhya Pradesh's Indore to free the country from the rule of "kale angrez" and "chowkidars". Sidhu had also said that Congress helped India get Independence from Britishers.

headlines: Indore will get India rid of 'Kale Angrez': Navjot Singh Sidhu
text: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu targeted the BJP in Madhya Pradesh's Indore on Friday and said that people of Indore will get India rid of "Kale Angrez" and "Chowkidars". "Congress is the party that gave freedom to the country, it is the party of Maulana Azad and Mahatma Gandhi," said Sidhu. They got India rid of the Britishers, he added.

headlines: What if someone links you to Godhra riots: Punjab CM to PM Modi
text: Hitting out at PM Narendra Modi, Punjab CM Amarinder Singh said, "It's wrong of Modi to connect (former PM) Rajiv Gandhi with the anti-Sikh riots of 1984. What if someone starts linking Modi with (2002) Godhra (riots)?" "Modi should not forget that the names of several BJP and RSS leaders had figured in the 1984 riots FIR," the CM stated.

headlines: Tirupati temple has over 9,000 kg of gold reserves: Temple's trust
text: The Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams, the trust which manages the affairs of the Sri Venkateswara Temple has said it has 7,325 kg of the yellow metal deposited with two banks and around 1,934 kg gold in its treasury. According to officials, devotees make offerings in the form of cash, gold and silver jewellery, property deeds and even demat shares.

headlines: IAF gets its first Apache attack helicopter at Boeing plant in US
text: US aircraft manufacturing company Boeing has handed over first of the 22 AH-64E Apache Guardian attack helicopters to the Indian Air Force, nearly three-and-half years after the choppers' deal was sealed. It has the capability to carry out precision attacks at standoff ranges and can transmit and receive the battlefield picture to and from the weapon systems through data networking.

headlines: Minor violation: IAF releases plane that entered from Pak air space
text: Hours after the Indian Air Force fighter jets forced a Delhi-bound Georgian Antonov An-12 cargo plane coming from Pakistani air space to land at Jaipur airport, it was released later on Friday. "It was a minor route violation, the plane was made to land in Jaipur due to security concerns. It wasn't a serious violation," the Jaipur ACP said.

headlines: Jailed murder accused allowed to take Manipur Civil Service exam
text: Delhi High Court has allowed a man lodged in jail, facing prosecution in a murder case, to take the Manipur Civil Service examination. The court said the accused should be taken to Imphal by economy flight for the May 12 exam. While the prisoner will pay for his tickets, Delhi government will bear the cost of officers' travel and lodging.

headlines: He's barely used, what's he worth? Father tries to sell baby at shop
text: A US father walked into a pawn shop, put his baby on the counter and said, "He's barely used, seven and a half months old, what do you think he's worth?" After the man left along with the kid, the pawn shop owner called the police, saying he was concerned for the child's well-being. Police then reached the man's residence.

headlines: Indian-origin doctor gets 9-year-jail for healthcare fraud in US
text: A 66-year-old Indian-origin doctor named Pawankumar Jain has been sentenced to 9 years in prison by a US court for committing healthcare fraud and illegally distributing prescription painkillers. "Doctors who betray our trust and put their financial gain ahead of the well-being of patients by prescribing narcotics without medical justification are directly fuelling opioid crisis," the court said.

headlines: North Korea's recent missile launches not breach of trust: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump has said he doesn't consider North Korea's recent launch of short-range ballistic missiles "a breach of trust", calling the missile tests "very standard stuff". However, Trump further said at some point he may consider such launches as a breach of trust, adding he might eventually lose faith in his friendly relationship with North Korea's Kim Jong-un.

headlines: We are taking forward RK Studio's legacy with our work: Kareena
text: Speaking about the sale of RK Studio, which was founded by her grandfather Raj Kapoor, actress Kareena Kapoor said that her family's work in Bollywood will take the studio's legacy forward. "The legacy of RK has already been taken ahead with...Karisma (Kareena's sister) and I. Now we have Ranbir (her cousin)," she added. The studio was acquired by Godrej Properties.

headlines: Making 'Golmaal' feels like a responsibility: Rohit Shetty
text: While speaking about the 'Golmaal' film franchise, the series' director Rohit Shetty said, "Now, making 'Golmaal' feels like a responsibility." "The...series is very close to my heart. When we started shooting... it was a normal comedy film...we never thought it'll become such a huge household brand," he added. The series featured Ajay Devgn, Arshad Warsi, and Tusshar Kapoor, among others.

headlines: Over 1.43 cr voters to cast vote in Delhi on May 12: EC
text: Delhi Chief Electoral Officer Ranbir Singh said that more than 1.43 crore voters will cast vote in the national capital on May 12. "Elaborate arrangements have been made for the conduct of elections across 2,700 polling locations housing 13,819 polling booths," Singh added. All seven Lok Sabha seats in Delhi will go to polls on Sunday.

headlines: Amit Shah to hold 4 rallies in Bihar, Jharkhand
text: BJP President Amit Shah is going to hold four rallies in Bihar and Jharkhand on Saturday, a day ahead of the 6th phase of Lok Sabha polls. While three rallies will be held in Bihar's Kaimur, Bhojpur and Patna, one will be held in Jharkhand's Pakur. Congress President Rahul Gandhi will also address three rallies in Madhya Pradesh on Saturday.

headlines: EC orders re-polling at 2 booths in West Bengal on May 12
text: The Election Commission on Friday ordered re-polling at polling station number-116 in Barrackpore constituency and polling station number-110 in Arambagh constituency of West Bengal. The commission declared the polls held in these booths on May 6 void and has scheduled the re-polls for May 12. It also ordered West Bengal Chief Electoral Officer to ensure wide publicity of the re-polls.

headlines: 4 injured after leopard attacks them in UP's Bahraich
text: A leopard attacked four people in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich after it strayed into the village in search of water, forest department officials said. The leopard was then captured by the forest officials and released into Dudhwa National Park. Villagers, however alleged that the officials reached the spot over two hours after they informed them about the leopard.

headlines: Hyundai transitions to 'Smart Mobility Solutions Provider'
text: Committed to leading the future of mobility in India, Hyundai constantly aims to come up with smarter solutions that makes life easier, healthier and convenient for customers. Providing cars that are shared, connected with urban infrastructures, clean and eco-friendly, it seeks to become a leading Smart Mobility Solutions Provider, and not just a car company.

headlines: Kim Kardashian, Kanye West welcome their fourth child via surrogacy
text: Reality television personality Kim Kardashian and her rapper husband Kanye West have announced that their fourth child and second son was born via a surrogate. "He's here and he's perfect!" tweeted Kardashian. "He's also [her daughter] Chicago's twin lol I'm sure he will change a lot but now he looks just like her," added Kardashian.

headlines: Shikhar Dhawan trolls Ajinkya Rahane over his 'watching TV' pic
text: Team India opener Shikhar Dhawan trolled batsman Ajinkya Rahane after the latter shared a picture of himself watching TV with the caption, "Any guesses what I'm watching right now?" Reacting to the picture, Dhawan replied, "Tv aur kya? (What else other than television)." Rahane had intended to ask what he was watching on the television.

headlines: 1984 riots a terrible tragedy, Sam Pitroda was out of line: Rahul
text: Reacting to Congress leader Sam Pitroda's 'hua to hua' remark on 1984 anti-Sikh riots, Congress President Rahul Gandhi said, "I think what Sam Pitroda Ji said is completely out of line and he should apologise for it." "We all have made our position very clear - that 1984 was a terrible tragedy and should never have happened," he added.

headlines: World no. 3 Halep beats Bencic to reach 4th Madrid Open final
text: World number three Simona Halep defeated Belinda Bencic to reach her fourth Madrid Open final. Halep won the match with a scoreline of 6-2, 6-7(2-7), 6-0 in one hour and 57 minutes. The final will also be Halep's first of 2019. Bencic had defeated world number one Naomi Osaka in the quarter-finals.

headlines: PSG's Neymar banned for three matches for punching a fan
text: PSG forward Neymar has been banned for three matches by the French Football Federation after an investigation into his altercation with a spectator following his team's French Cup defeat against Rennes. Neymar had punched a fan while on his way to collect his runner-up medal. PSG have said that they would appeal against the punishment, which they described as "severe."

headlines: Carbon from nuclear tests found in ocean creatures 11 km deep
text: Radioactive carbon-14 dubbed "bomb carbon" has been found in muscle tissues of crustaceans that inhabit Earth's deepest ocean trenches, including the Mariana Trench which goes up to 11 kilometres deep. Thermonuclear weapons tests during the 1950s and 1960s doubled the amount of carbon-14 in the atmosphere, which mixed into the oceans and have entered into the food chain, scientists noted.

headlines: New heat-sensing snake species found, named after Arunachal
text: Pune-based Indian Institute of Science Education and Research (IISER) team found a new species of reddish-brown pit viper snake with a unique heat-sensing system, the first in past 70 years in India. The species is named 'Trimeresurus arunachalensis' after Arunachal Pradesh, where it was discovered. This makes Arunachal Pradesh the only state to have a pit viper named after it.

headlines: EC issues notice to Navjot Sidhu for calling PM anti-national
text: The Election Commision has issued a show cause notice to Punjab minister and Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu for his personal references against PM Narendra Modi at a rally. Sidhu has been asked to reply by 6 pm tomorrow. Sidhu had accused PM Modi of being a "traitor", and alleged corruption in the Rafale deal.

headlines: Pieces of AI plane's tyre found on runway; 6 planes warned mid-air
text: Pieces of a plane's tyre were found on a Delhi airport runway this week, following which pilots of six aircraft that took off minutes earlier were asked to take precautions when landing at their destinations. The runway was closed for 15 minutes to clear the pieces. The aircraft was later identified as a Rome-bound Air India Boeing, which landed safely.

headlines: Youth relates to Salman's 'don't care' attitude: Director Ali
text: While speaking about actor Salman Khan, director Ali Abbas Zafar said that he feels that the actor's "don't care attitude" makes him relatable to a younger audience. "He can go on a talk show and say what he wants, without caring about what people will think," the director added. Ali further said that people relate to Salman's off-screen personality.

headlines: Indian govt snatches jobs from 27,000 youth in 24 hrs: Rahul
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Friday said that while China provides its people 50,000 jobs in 24 hours, Indian government snatches jobs from 27,000 youth in 24 hours. "PM Narendra Modi talked about Make in India, Startup India but the unemployment is at an all-time high in 45 years," Gandhi added. He also alleged that Startup India initiative completely failed.

headlines: If PM had family, he would have vacationed too: Cong leader
text: Congress' Anand Sharma on Friday targeted PM Narendra Modi for alleging Rajiv Gandhi used INS Viraat for vacation and said if PM Modi had family, he would've vacationed too. "He goes alone because he has no connect with family or any respect for family values," Sharma added. PM Modi also alleged that Rajiv Gandhi took his in-laws on INS Viraat.

headlines: BJP can never be only PM Modi or Shah's party: Nitin Gadkari
text: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Friday said BJP can never be "individual-centric" party as it is based on ideology. "BJP neither became Atal (Bihari Vajpayee) or (Lal Krishna) Advaniji's party in the past, nor it can ever be only Amit Shah or PM Narendra Modi's party," he added. Gadkari also said BJP and PM Modi are "complementary to each other".

headlines: Just look at how Liverpool beat Barca: Viv Richards to CSK
text: Ahead of Chennai Super Kings' match against Delhi Capitals, former West Indies cricketer Viv Richards advised CSK to take inspiration from Liverpool's win against Barcelona in the Champions League semi-final stage. "[I]n these knockout games, teamwork often makes all the difference," Richards stated. CSK are looking to win their fourth IPL title.

headlines: Petition against Amit Shah for remarks on NRC, Citizenship Bill
text: An intervention application has been filed in the Supreme Court seeking action against BJP President Amit Shah for his remarks on Assam's National Register of Citizens (NRC) and Citizenship (Amendment) Bill, 2016. The petition said that Shah had stated that Citizenship Bill would come before NRC. Shah is creating confusion over updating of NRC by misleading statements, the petition added.

headlines: 17 held for killing tigers, using body parts for black magic
text: Madhya Pradesh and Maharashtra forest departments have arrested 17 people for allegedly killing and selling tigers' body parts for black magic. Claws and paws of two tigers, a cub, and a leopard were recovered from them. The accused used to approach a sorcerer to convince people that occult ritual with tigers' body parts will help them become rich, officials said.

headlines: Former MP CM Shivraj Chouhan helps road accident victims
text: Former Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Friday stopped his convoy to help two road accident victims in Bhopal. He also ordered one of the vehicles from his convoy to take the victims to the nearest hospital for medical treatment. The victims were hit by a vehicle and were bleeding when Chouhan reached there.

headlines: 3 activists accused of insulting Thai King go missing: Report
text: Three activists accused of insulting the monarchy in Thailand have gone missing after reportedly being arrested in Vietnam, the Human Rights Watch said. The three activists were reportedly turned over to the Thai authorities by Vietnam. They are accused of operating online anti-monarchy radio programmes and of mobilising supporters to hold demonstrations against the monarchy.

headlines: CSK defeat DC in Qualifier 2 to reach IPL final for 8th time
text: Chennai Super Kings today defeated Delhi Capitals in the Qualifier 2 to reach Indian Premier League final for the eighth time. CSK, who had also entered final of IPL in their previous two seasons (2015 and 2018), will face Mumbai Indians in the summit clash on Sunday. Notably, CSK have won three of the seven IPL finals they have played.

headlines: Man complains of itchy ear, doctors find spider building web inside
text: Doctors in China found a spider building a web inside a man's ear after he complained of itchiness inside. They failed to notice anything abnormal with their bare eyes, but with the help of a microscope, they saw a spider in his ear canal. The doctors injected a saline solution to drive the spider out of the man's ear.

headlines: Rock band Guns N' Roses sues brewery over 'Guns 'N' RosÃ©' beer
text: American rock band Guns N' Roses has filed a lawsuit against a brewery for trademark infringement over a beer named 'Guns 'N' RosÃ©'. The Oskar Blues Brewery started selling the beer in 2018 without the band's approval, court documents said. The band argued it has suffered damage to its trademarks and consumers might think the beer is affiliated with it.

headlines: Supernovas beat Velocity to reach Women's T20 Challenge final
text: Supernovas' 18-year-old Jemimah Rodrigues scored an unbeaten 77 off 48 balls as her team defeated Velocity by 12 runs in the Women's T20 Challenge. Supernovas, Velocity and Trailblazers finished the pool stage with two points each, however, Supernovas and Velocity reached the finals after finishing first and second respectively due to better run-rate. The final will take place on Saturday.

headlines: Didn't know age at U-14 trials, did what others told me to: Afridi
text: Former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi has said that the reason for his age being messed up in the records is that when he first appeared for Under-14 trials, he did not know his exact age. "So when the selectors asked me about my age and details I said what others told me to do," he added.

headlines: Roger Federer beats GaÃ«l Monfils in Madrid to claim 1,200th win
text: Roger Federer on Thursday became the second player in Open Era (since April 1968) to record 1,200 match wins. The 20-time Grand Slam champion saved two match points against France's GaÃ«l Monfils before clinching the match after a final-set tiebreak to reach quarterfinals of Madrid Open. Notably, the 37-year-old is playing in his first tournament on clay since May 2016.

headlines: India orders probe on Google for using Android to block rivals
text: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has ordered an investigation into Google for allegedly abusing the dominant position of its Android OS to block rivals. Google responded saying it looks forward to working with CCI "to demonstrate how Android has led to more competition and innovation, not less". Google was fined $5 billion in Europe last year over Android abuse.

headlines: Wife of Indian killed in London came to stay with him 25 days ago
text: Pregnant wife of Mohd Nadeemuddin, the 24-year-old Indian man who was stabbed to death in a London mall's parking lot, had left for London to stay with him only 25 days ago, Nadeemuddin's family friend said. He added that Nadeemuddin's wife, who is a doctor, cannot come back to India as rules do not permit her to travel.

headlines: Plane landed in drain as pilot didn't listen to younger co-pilot
text: An investigation into an Air India Express plane ending up in an open drain after landing in Kochi has revealed the senior male pilot refused to take suggestions of his female co-pilot, 30 years younger to him. The 2017 accident had resulted in three passengers getting injured and "serious" damage to aircraft. Earlier, poor weather was blamed for the accident.

headlines: 81-year-old woman meets her 103-year-old mother for 1st time
text: An 81-year-old Irish woman has said she has never been happier after meeting her 103-year-old mother for the first time. Eileen Macken grew up in an orphanage and had never met her birth mother, Elizabeth, whom she started searching for when she was 19. "There was such a bond between the two of us...She's the most beautiful lady," Eileen said.

headlines: Indian jailed in UK for sexually assaulting sleeping woman on plane
text: A 35-year-old Indian national named Hardeep Singh has been jailed in the UK for a year for sexually assaulting a sleeping woman on a flight from Mumbai to Manchester. Singh assaulted the woman when other passengers were also asleep. The woman eventually managed to break free and informed the cabin crew and Singh was arrested when the flight landed.

headlines: 900 child soldiers fighting Boko Haram freed in Nigeria
text: Nearly 900 child soldiers, including 106 girls, used in the war against Boko Haram, were freed by a regional militia allied with Nigerian government forces, UNICEF said. Over 3,500 children were recruited and used by non-state armed groups between 2013 and 2017. The war against two militant groups in Nigeria, including the Boko Haram, has left over 30,000 people dead.

headlines: India's industrial output falls for the first time in 21 months
text: India's industrial output contracted for the first time in 21 months, falling 0.1% in March, government data showed on Friday. Manufacturing output with a 78% weightage in the Index of Industrial Production (IIP) contracted 0.4% during the month. Notably, the Indian economy grew 6.6% in the December quarter, the slowest in five quarters.

headlines: PepsiCo withdraws lawsuits against Indian potato farmers
text: PepsiCo Inc has formally withdrawn lawsuits against nine Gujarat farmers that the snacks and beverages maker had accused of infringing its patent by cultivating the FC5 potato variety, used in Lay's. "It's a victory for us, but PepsiCo's decision to file lawsuits against the farmers has sullied their reputation and the company now must apologise," the farmers' lawyer said.

headlines: Tata Steel expects joint venture with Thyssenkrupp to fail
text: Tata Steel and Germany's Thyssenkrupp on Friday said they do not expect regulators to approve the planned joint venture of their European steel activities. The companies said they weren't prepared to offer further concessions to satisfy European competition regulators. The joint venture would have created the region's second-largest steel producer, behind ArcelorMittal, the world's top steelmaker.

headlines: Rishabh Pant is this generation's Sehwag: Sanjay Manjrekar
text: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has said that Delhi Capitals' Rishabh Pant is this generation's Virender Sehwag. "Batsman who needs to be treated differently... which is to just let him be. You either pick him or drop him but never try and change him," Manjrekar tweeted. Notably, Pant was not included in the India squad for the upcoming World Cup.

headlines: How will Gambhir ensure women safety: Atishi on pamphlet row
text: After alleging that BJP's Gautam Gambhir distributed pamphlets with derogatory remarks against her, Aam Aadmi Party's East Delhi candidate Atishi on Friday said, "If BJP and Gautam Gambhir can do this with an empowered woman then how will they ensure security to rest of the women?" Earlier today, Atishi filed a complaint with Delhi Commission for Women regarding the same.

headlines: Bencic knocks out world number 1 Osaka from Madrid Open
text: Swiss tennis player Belinda Bencic knocked out top seed and world number one Naomi Osaka in the quarterfinals of the Madrid Open on Thursday. Osaka, who has two Grand Slams to her name, lost the match 6-3, 2-6, 5-7. The win was Bencic's second over Osaka this season, having defeated Osaka at the Indian Wells Masters in March.

headlines: Luis Suarez to miss Barcelona's Copa del Rey final
text: Barcelona's Uruguayan forward Luis Suarez is set to be out of action for over four weeks and will miss the Copa del Rey final against Valencia on May 25 after undergoing a knee surgery. Suarez, who was part of the Barcelona side that lost to Liverpool in the Champions League, has scored 21 goals in La Liga this season.

headlines: Can vouch for Gambhir's integrity: VVS Laxman on 'pamphlet' row
text: After AAP's Atishi accused BJP's Gautam Gambhir of calling her a 'prostitute' in a pamphlet, ex-India cricketer VVS Laxman said he was "shocked to hear about yesterday's developments". "Having known Gambhir for nearly 2 decades, I can vouch for his integrity, character and the respect he has for women," he added. Earlier, CSK spinner Harbhajan Singh had also backed Gambhir.

headlines: Will be staggered if Archer misses Ashes, WC: Ex-Eng captain
text: Former England captain Michael Vaughan has said that he will be "staggered" if Jofra Archer is not a part of the upcoming Ashes series and the ODI World Cup. "He's just got a gift and when you get that kind of quality you have to get those players involved in all formats of the game," Vaughan added.

headlines: This is England's best chance ever: Stuart Broad
text: Speaking about England's chances at the upcoming World Cup, Stuart Broad said, "ItÂ’s the menÂ’s best ever chance to win a 50-over World Cup... I've never seen an ODI team go in with the quality this one has got." "This England side have got all the tools required to win," former England captain Michael Vaughan said.

headlines: Bengaluru's Wooplr halts operations amid cash crunch: Report
text: Bengaluru-based social commerce startup Wooplr has temporarily shut down its operations amid cash crunch after negotiations with Snapdeal for a merger fell through, as per reports. Wooplr has made massive job cuts since April and has reached out to commerce platforms LimeRoad and Club Factory for an acqui-hire deal, YourStory reported. Wooplr had raised $8 million in 2017.

headlines: China's Ctrip removes products calling South Tibet as Arunachal
text: China-based travel platform Ctrip has said it took down products calling South Tibet as 'Arunachal Pradesh' after backlash from Chinese citizens. Ctrip didn't confirm or deny that such information refers to the depiction of the Sino-Indian border, Chinese state media reported. China claims Arunachal Pradesh as part of southern Tibet while India firmly maintains Arunachal is its integral part.

headlines: Not party's opinion: Congress after Pitroda said '1984 hua to hua'
text: The Congress has stated that party leader Sam Pitroda's "hua to hua" remark on 1984 anti-Sikh riots is not Congress' opinion. "We believe that justice should be done to 1984 riots victims as also to 2002 Gujarat riots victims," Congress said, adding it has "punished leaders accused of violence in 1984 unlike the BJP which has fielded a terror-accused candidate".

headlines: Meant to say 'jo hua bura hua': Pitroda apologises for 1984 remark
text: Congress overseas chief Sam Pitroda has apologised for his "hua to hua" statement on 1984 riots, saying it was taken out of context because his Hindi isn't good. "What I meant was 'jo hua vo bura hua', I couldn't translate 'bura' in my mind," Pitroda said. "I feel sorry it was misrepresented...This has been blown out of proportion," he added.

headlines: AAP's Atishi files complaint with DCW over pamphlets against her
text: AAP's East Delhi candidate Atishi Marlena has filed a complaint with Delhi Commission for Women over "derogatory and casteist" pamphlets against her which AAP has alleged were circulated by BJP's Gautam Gambhir. After filing the complaint, Atishi said, "If BJP and Gautam Gambhir can do this with an empowered woman then how will he ensure the security of...women?"

headlines: Air India to offer 40% discount on seats 3 hours prior to departure
text: Air India has decided to give at least 40% discount for seats available three hours prior to departure. "The last-minute traveller who generally travels due to an emergency is often faced with very high ticket prices. Such high prices are a deterrent," Air India explained. "This rare decision will be a big boon to the last minute travellers," it added.

headlines: I'll hang myself in public if Kejriwal proves accusations: Gambhir
text: BJP leader Gautam Gambhir has said that if Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal can prove that he had anything to do with "derogatory" pamphlet calling AAP's Atishi "prostitute", he will hang himself in public. "Otherwise...Arvind Kejriwal should quit politics. Accepted?" he further wrote. Earlier today, Gambhir sent a defamation notice to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia and Atishi.

headlines: IAF forces cargo plane entering from Pak air space to land at Jaipur
text: The Indian Air Force jets forced a Delhi-bound Georgian Antonov An-12 cargo plane coming from Pakistani air space to land in Jaipur after it deviated from its flight path. The plane entered Indian air space from an unscheduled point in North Gujarat and was intercepted by IAF air defence aircraft. The questioning of pilots is going on, according to reports.

headlines: Still TV9 CEO, nobody will arrest me: Ravi Prakash on forgery case
text: Hours after Cyberabad Police charged him for forgery and criminal conspiracy, TV9 CEO Ravi Prakash appeared on the channel on Thursday evening and denied the allegations. "Nobody arrested me. Nobody will arrest me. There has been false propaganda...since morning that I am absconding. I am very much on duty and I am speaking as the CEO of TV9," he said.

headlines: Filmmaker shot dead making documentary on violence in Colombia
text: A Colombian filmmaker has been shot dead while producing a documentary on the victims of violence in the north-east of the country, officials said. Mauricio Lezama was conducting interviews in the town of Arauquita when he was shot by gunmen who arrived on a motorbike. Authorities blamed members of FARC rebel group who rejected a peace deal signed in 2016.

headlines: Trainee pilot flies plane unconscious for 40 minutes in Australia
text: A trainee pilot flew unconscious for about 40 minutes in Australia's Adelaide during an incident in March. The Australian Transport Safety Bureau (ATSB) released its report saying that the trainee pilot began to feel a headache and engaged the autopilot. Another plane nearby then spotted the aircraft, reporting that the pilot had regained consciousness and escorted him while returning.

headlines: World lives on hope so there is hope till 6pm: SBI on Jet Airways
text: SBI on Friday said it has received two unsolicited bids for Jet Airways, nearly a month after the airline grounded operations. Chairman Rajnish Kumar also said that a binding bid is expected from one of the four interested parties that had earlier submitted their expressions of interest. Â“This world lives on hope so there is hope till 6pm,Â” he added.

headlines: McDonald's looking for new partner for north, east India business
text: McDonald's on Thursday said it's actively searching for a new partner for its north and east India business. This comes after the fast-food chain settled with former partner Vikram Bakshi, acquiring full ownership in their joint venture Connaught Plaza Restaurants. The two also agreed to withdraw all litigation against each other, including a case in London Court of International Arbitration.

headlines: Existing shareholder Etihad submits bid to buy stake in Jet Airways
text: Etihad Airways has submitted a binding bid to buy a stake in Jet Airways under the ongoing sale process, the Abu Dhabi airline said on Friday. Etihad currently owns a 24% stake in the Mumbai-based airline, which has temporarily grounded operations. Etihad, however, added that "additional suitable investors would need to provide the majority of Jet Airways' required recapitalisation".

headlines: Won't play role in film unless I am convinced: Patralekhaa
text: Actress Patralekhaa has said that the "tough" phase during her acting career taught her not to take up roles in films unless she is convinced. "I think for a performer, for an actor, the conviction is one of the most important elements," the actress added. "[I]f I am not fully convinced, it shows in my performance," Patralekhaa further said.

headlines: Better off fighting polls alone: Kejriwal on Cong tie-up
text: AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal said he wished Congress alliance had happened but also thought that AAP is better off fighting the polls alone. "We could've let Congress fight from three seats out of seven...or we could contest all seats and try winning them all," he added. "Now, in hindsight, it looks like the second option was better," Kejriwal further said.

headlines: Will Pitroda say 'hua to hua' if his family is killed? Badal
text: Responding to Congress' Sam Pitroda's remark on 1984 Anti-Sikh riots, Union Minister Harsimrat Kaur Badal on Friday asked if Pitroda's family is killed tomorrow, will he still think 'hua to hua'. She added that she was "shocked and ashamed" over the remark. Pitroda had earlier said, "Talk about what you (BJP) did in five years. Whatever happened in 1984, happened."

headlines: EC holding workshops on vote counting for Returning Officers
text: Election Commission (EC) started workshops on vote counting process for Returning Officers and Assistant Returning Officers throughout India. "EC directed that the process must be carried out without any mistakes and in the most transparent manner. For that, workshops are conducted," said Telangana's Chief Electoral Officer Rajat Kumar. An EC representative will attend workshops as an observer.

headlines: Yaya Toure retires from football, to pursue coaching career
text: Former Barcelona and Manchester City midfielder Yaya Toure's agent announced that the Ivorian has retired from football, saying, "Yaya decided to end his career as a champion." Toure won three Premier League titles, two La Liga titles and one Champions League title in his career. Toure's manager also revealed that Toure is determined to pursue a career in coaching.

headlines: DC's investment in youth has been rewarded this year: De Villiers
text: Former Delhi Daredevils cricketer AB de Villiers has stated that the Delhi Capitals' investment in youth has rewarded the team in this year's edition of the Indian Premier League. "It's a classic clash between youth and experience, between the fiery youngsters of DC and the ice-cold veterans of CSK," De Villiers wrote about the upcoming IPL 2019 Qualifier 2.

headlines: Former SL cricketers suspended for corrupt practices in T10 league
text: Former Sri Lankan international cricketers Nuwan Zoysa and Avishka Gunawardene were handed provisional suspensions by the ICC on charges of indulging in corrupt practices in a T10 league in the UAE. The ICC has given the two 14 days to respond to the charges. Notably, Zoysa is already under suspension for a previous corruption allegation.

headlines: Steve Smith hits 91* as Australia beat New Zealand XI
text: Australian batsman Steve Smith hit an unbeaten 91 to help his side beat New Zealand XI in the team's last warm-up match before heading for World Cup 2019. Smith had earlier hit 89* in the second warm-up match between the sides. David Warner, who has also returned to the Australian side after a year-long ban, got dismissed for two.

headlines: Google will never sell personal info to third parties: CEO Pichai
text: Google CEO Sundar Pichai, in a New York Times article, wrote, "Google will never sell any personal information to third parties." "I believe [privacy is] one of the most important topics of our time," he wrote, adding that it's Google's policy to let users decide how their information is used. "Privacy should not be a luxury good," he further added.

headlines: I don't accept that statement: Punjab CM on Pitroda's 1984 remark
text: Being asked about his views on Congress leader Sam Pitroda's "hua to hua" remark on 1984 anti-Sikh riots, Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh said, "I don't accept that statement." "It's duty of the successive governments to find out how it happened, who all were responsible, it must be found, doesn't matter how many years have passed," Congress leader Singh added.

headlines: Elon Musk tweets edited pic of rival Bezos' 1st Moon lander
text: SpaceX Founder and CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to share an image of rival Jeff Bezos' aerospace startup Blue Origin's first lunar lander edited to read 'Blue Balls' instead of its name 'Blue Moon'. "Oh stop teasing, Jeff," the billionaire jokingly captioned the image. Musk had earlier also called Amazon CEO Bezos a 'copycat' over Amazon's Internet satellite plans.

headlines: Netflix unveils posters of Sacred Games 2 shot on OnePlus 7 Pro
text: Netflix collaborated OnePlus to unveil the first-look of characters Sartaj Singh and Ganesh Gaitonde from Sacred Games 2, shot on OnePlus 7 Pro. The platform released a behind-the-scenes video, also shot on the smartphone. "Through incredible devices like the OnePlus 7 Pro, consumers increasingly are able to enjoy an amazing viewing experience on Netflix," said Jerome Bigio, Director-Partner Marketing, Netflix.

headlines: Nat Geo to release special edition magazine shot on OnePlus 7 Pro
text: National Geographic revealed its cover for the upcoming special-edition magazine, shot on the OnePlus 7 Pro. Notably, all images of the magazine will be shot on the smartphone. "With the OnePlus 7 Pro, you have a whole camera bag in your pocket which...allowed us to be able to shoot a whole magazine issue on a smartphone," said photographer Krystle Wright.

headlines: Harbhajan backs Gambhir on Atishi row, says he is above all this
text: CSK off-spinner Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter to back cricketer-turned-politician Gautam Gambhir after the latter was accused of calling AAP's Atishi a "prostitute" in a pamphlet. "I know him well and he can never talk ill for any woman. Whether he wins or loses is another matter but the man is above all this," Harbhajan wrote.

headlines: Congress has no value for human life: PM Modi on '1984 hua to hua'
text: PM Narendra Modi has condemned Congress leader Sam Pitroda's "Hua to Hua" remark on 1984 anti-Sikh riots. "Three words that sum up Congress' arrogance were uttered yesterday by...guru of Congress President Rahul Gandhi. They have no value for human life," PM Modi said. Pitroda had said whatever happened in 1984, BJP should talk about their last five years in power.

headlines: Debate with me, I'm also Gujarati: Sam Pitroda challenges PM Modi
text: Challenging PM Narendra Modi on various issues, Congress leader Sam Pitroda said, "Have a debate with (Congress President) Rahul Gandhi...if not him, then debate with me. I am also a Gujarati." "(PM) Modi has misused the public money on self-promotion and advertisement," Pitroda added, alleging that "half of the budget of Beti Bachao, Beti Padhao" was spent on advertisement.

headlines: Fan tweets women cricket is bullshit, gets blocked by ICC
text: The official Twitter account of ICC blocked a fan who termed women cricket as bullshit and said that women cricketers are ugly. The fan was commenting on a tweet by ICC, wherein India Women vice-captain Smriti Mandhana had said that she doesn't see herself as a woman cricketer but simply as a cricketer. "It's 2019. Be better. Bye!" wrote ICC.

headlines: Couple shoots sex video in a Tesla on Autopilot, Musk responds
text: Reacting to a video of two people having sex in a Tesla car operating on Autopilot mode, CEO Elon Musk tweeted, "Turns out there's more ways to use Autopilot than we imagined." "Shoulda seen it coming," the 47-year-old billionaire added. The video went viral on Pornhub last week and made 'Tesla' the trending search term on the site.

headlines: Facebook rejects breakup call, asks for govt regulation of internet
text: Facebook has rejected a call from Co-founder Chris Hughes to split the social media giant into Facebook, WhatsApp, and Instagram. "We accept that with success comes accountability.
