It can only be achieved through painstaking introduction of new rules for the internet," Facebook said. "I believe we need a more active role for governments and regulators," CEO Mark Zuckerberg earlier said.

headlines: 1984 anti-Sikh riots hua to hua, what did BJP do in 5 yrs: Pitroda
text: Indian Overseas Congress chief Sam Pitroda brushed off BJP's suggestion that 1984 anti-Sikh riots took place on orders of ex-PM Rajiv Gandhi. "What about 1984 now? What have you done in last five years, talk about that. 1984 mein hua to hua," Pitroda said. "You were voted to create 200 smart cities. You haven't even done that," he added.

headlines: PMO directly gave instructions to kill Sikhs in 1984: HS Phoolka
text: Senior advocate HS Phoolka has claimed instructions to kill Sikhs during 1984 anti-Sikh riots came directly from Prime Minister's Office. He added President and Home Minister wanted to call the Army but Prime Minister's Office did not allow. Phoolka further said 2,000 lives could've been saved as enough Army personnel were available but government chose not to use them.

headlines: Uber raises $8.1 billion in IPO, valued at $82 billion
text: Ride-hailing giant Uber priced its IPO shares at $45 apiece to raise $8.1 billion at a valuation of over $82 billion. Shares were priced close to the bottom of its targeted $44-50 range. Uber, which was earlier said to be seeking a valuation of $120 billion, has reportedly taken a conservative stance over its rival Lyft's post-IPO share falls.

headlines: It's time to go back to Moon, to stay: Bezos unveils Moon lander
text: World's richest person, Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos has unveiled a two-storey-tall prototype of his aerospace startup Blue Origin's lunar lander, Blue Moon, to carry humans. "It's time to go back to the moon, this time to stay," Bezos reiterated NASA Administrator's statement. He added Blue Origin can meet 2024 lunar landing goal as the project was started three years ago.

headlines: Indian stabbed to death outside London mall as shoppers looked on
text: A 24-year-old Indian man, Mohd Nadeemuddin, who worked at a supermarket in a London mall, was recently stabbed to death in the outlet's parking lot as shoppers looked on. Police is yet to identify the murderer. Meanwhile, Nadeemuddin's family has sought Union Minister Sushma Swaraj's help to get an early visa to London in order to help his pregnant wife.

headlines: Law forces cancer-suffering teacher to pay for substitute; criticised
text: A California law forcing a teacher, who is suffering from breast cancer, to pay for her substitute at a school has been criticised. After the 10 annual sick leaves that each teacher is allotted, California allows 100 days of extended leave, during which teachers are paid their regular salary minus the cost of a substitute.

headlines: Call me: Trump tells Iran amid rising tensions
text: US President Donald Trump on Thursday told Iran to call him in a bid to defuse the tensions between the two countries. The US deployed an aircraft carrier and bombers to the Middle East amid the tensions. Iran suspended some of its obligations under the 2015 nuclear deal, a year after the US announced its withdrawal from the agreement.

headlines: US hikes tariff on $200-billion Chinese imports, China to retaliate
text: The US on Friday raised tariffs on $200 billion worth of Chinese products from 10% to 25%. "The Chinese side deeply regrets that it will have to take necessary countermeasures," China's Commerce Ministry said. This comes amid ongoing talks between the US and China to end the nearly one-year-long trade war.

headlines: Don't know how I would define myself minus my acting: Tabu
text: While speaking about her career in Bollywood, actress Tabu said, "I don't know how I would define myself minus my acting. People know me because of...my career." "There has been immense growth and progress in my personality through my work," the actress added. Tabu further said that she is drawn to films that motivate her and keep her mentally stimulated.

headlines: Pankaj Kapur to release debut novel based on his play 'Dopehri'
text: Veteran actor Pankaj Kapur will release his debut novel 'Dopehri', based on a play of the same name which he wrote and directed several years ago. "I'll wait eagerly to see how readers react to this book which is very close to my heart," Kapur said. Originally written in Hindi, an English translation of the book will also be released.

headlines: Hilary Duff gets engaged to boyfriend Matthew Koma, shares pic
text: American singer-actress Hilary Duff got engaged to her boyfriend singer-songwriter Matthew Koma, the couple revealed on Instagram. Sharing a picture with Matthew, in which she is seen holding up her hand with her engagement ring, the actress wrote, "He asked me to be his wife." The couple welcomed their first child together, a daughter, in October last year.

headlines: 20 Cong MLAs unhappy, may decide soon: K'taka BJP chief
text: Karnataka BJP chief BS Yeddyurappa on Friday claimed that over 20 Congress MLAs are not happy with the current state government and might take a decision soon. Currently, a coalition of Congress-JD(S) is in power in the state. This comes days after PM Narendra Modi had claimed that 40 TMC MLAs will desert TMC if BJP wins the General Elections.

headlines: Would RSS let Modi be PM if he was backward by birth? Mayawati
text: Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) chief Mayawati on Friday asked if RSS would have allowed Narendra Modi to be the Prime Minister if he belonged to the backward caste by birth. "He isn't an OBC by birth, he hasn't suffered from the atrocities of casteism," she added. Earlier, Mayawati had accused PM Modi of calling himself backward for political gains.

headlines: Visually-impaired student scores 82% in Class 12 Board exams
text: A visually-impaired student from Chhattisgarh, R Prajapati scored 82% in CBSE Class 12 Board examinations. "There were no facilities for me in our village school so I insisted my guardians to search for a suitable school," Prajapati said. The district collector said that authorities are willing to provide Prajapati with all necessary means to further his academic aspirations.

headlines: Larsen and Toubro acquires crucial 26% stake in Mindtree
text: L&T on Thursday said it has bought an additional 2% in Mindtree, acquiring the crucial 26% holding in the IT firm. L&T had bought 20% in Mindtree from CafÃ© Coffee Day Founder VG Siddhartha and 6% from open market. A stake of over 25% in a company gives the shareholder power to block special resolutions taken by the company's board.

headlines: Protein Drink Horlicks Protein+ now comes with no added sugar
text: Catering to the consumers who are getting more and more conscious of added sugar in their diet, Horlicks launched its Protein+ drink with no added sugar. Tailormade for adult nutrition, Horlicks Protein+ contains a triple blend of whey, casein and soy protein, which provides a sustained release of all the essential Amino Acids needed to support muscle maintenance & growth.

headlines: SC gives mediators in Ayodhya case time till Aug 15 to find solution
text: The Supreme Court on Friday granted time till August 15 to the three-member mediation panel in Ayodhya land dispute case after the panel sought more time to find an "amicable solution". Talking about the progress made by the panel so far, Chief Justice Ranjan Gogoi said, "We're not going to tell you what progress has been made, that's confidential."

headlines: My parents don't let me watch entire show: GoT child actor
text: Child actor Bella Ramsey, who portrays the character 'Lyanna Mormont' on 'Game of Thrones', has revealed that her parents don't let her watch the entire show as it contains nudity and violence. Adding that sometimes her parents stand in front of her to block her from seeing anything too gruesome, she said, "I'll probably watch it all when I'm 18."

headlines: TV actor's 2-year-old daughter dies after swallowing a piece of toy
text: TV actor Pratish Vora's two-year-old daughter died on Wednesday night after she swallowed a piece of toy while playing at her home. The toy got stuck in her throat and blocked her air pipe, reports claimed. Vora, who plays the role of Nandu Gupta in the show 'Pyaar Ke Papad', has left for Rajkot to conduct her last rites.

headlines: Rao should be wary as Janhvi is obsessed with him, jokes Ishaan
text: While appearing on a talk show with actor Rajkummar Rao, Ishaan Khatter jokingly advised Rajkummar to be wary of actress Janhvi Kapoor as she is "obsessed" with him. "She's a keen learner....she genuinely is very fond of [Rajkummar's] work, as am I," Ishaan further said. Rajkummar and Janhvi will feature together in the upcoming horror-comedy film 'Rooh Afza'.

headlines: 'De De Pyaar De' not intended to be sexist: Tabu on criticism
text: Defending her upcoming film 'De De Pyaar De' after it faced criticism for allegedly promoting sexism, actress Tabu said, "The movie hasn't been made with an intention to be sexist." "[T]he female characters in the film are strong, they take a stand and make their own decisions," she added. Tabu further urged people to watch the film before criticising it.

headlines: Don't know why I did it: Man who slapped Delhi CM expresses regret
text: Suresh, the man who slapped Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal during a roadshow on May 4, has said, "I don't know why I slapped him. I regret it." He stated that he's not affiliated to any political party and no one asked him to slap Kejriwal. "Police didn't misbehave with me. They only said what I did was wrong," Suresh added.

headlines: Delhi Metro services to start at 4 am on polling day
text: Delhi Metro services will begin from 4 am, two hours earlier than regular timings, on May 12 so that staff deployed for election duty can avail the facility for travelling, officials said. The trains will run at 30-minute intervals till 6 am. However, trains going from Dwarka Sector 21 towards Vaishali will begin operations from 4.30 am.

headlines: Arsenal to face Chelsea in all-English Europa League final
text: A day after Tottenham set up an all-English Champions League final against Liverpool, London clubs Arsenal and Chelsea defeated Valencia and Eintracht respectively to reach Europa Cup final. Chelsea beat Eintracht 4-3 on penalties, while Arsenal registered a 7-3 aggregate win. This is the first time all finalists in Champions League/European Cup and Europa League/UEFA Cup are from one country.

headlines: Odisha gets notice over relief supply not reaching Fani-hit areas
text: The NHRC has sent a notice to Odisha government after taking suo motu cognizance of a media report claiming that relief material is not reaching some Cyclone Fani-hit areas. There seems to be a necessity to identify areas which require immediate relief and rehabilitation, NHRC stated. The panel has asked the Chief Secretary to submit his response within six weeks.

headlines: Delhi will be free of air, water pollution in 3 yrs: Gadkari
text: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Thursday said that Delhi will be free of air and water pollution in the next three years. "We have started the Eastern and Western Peripheral Expressways, which have reduced pollution in Delhi by 32.38%," he added. Gadkari further said that he had warned AAP that the odd-even formula would not work to curb pollution.

headlines: Tihar jail mate is a murder accused, smokes ganja: Christian Michel
text: Christian Michel, the alleged middleman in the AgustaWestland chopper scam, has complained in court that he shares his prison with a murder accused, who smokes ganja. The judge responded that Michel cannot be put in jail with only white-collar criminals, adding, "He (murder accused) might be a reformed person." Michel is currently lodged in Delhi's Tihar jail.

headlines: Mom skips own convocation to attend son's, gets degree at his college
text: A US mother skipped her own convocation to attend her son's graduation in Michigan. Sharonda Wilson was given her cap and received her bachelor's degree during her son's graduation ceremony. The president of her son's university contacted his counterpart at the university from where Sharonda was graduating and urged him if his school could confer her the degree.

headlines: US seizes North Korean cargo ship for violating sanctions
text: The US has seized a North Korean cargo ship it accused of illicit coal shipments in violation of US and UN sanctions. The seizure of the ship named 'Wise Honest' comes after North Korea fired two short-range missiles on Thursday, its second such test in less than a week. The ship was first detained by Indonesia in April 2018.

headlines: I'm married to a GoT family, we try & watch it together: Priyanka
text: Actress Priyanka Chopra, while revealing that her husband Nick Jonas' family enjoys watching the TV show 'Game Of Thrones', said, "I am married to a Game of Thrones family." "Whenever we are in town together we try and [watch] it together," the actress added. Priyanka's sister-in-law Sophie Turner plays the character 'Sansa Stark' in the TV show.

headlines: Tiger, Ananya starrer 'Student Of The Year 2' hits theatres
text: Tiger Shroff, Ananya Panday and Tara Sutaria starrer 'Student Of The Year 2', which released today, "is brainlessly breezy fare wrapped in gloss that wears off quickly," wrote NDTV. "[T]here was a lot more scope for comedy," the Times of India (TOI) said. Koimoi called the film a "needless sequel". It has been rated 1.5/5 (NDTV, Koimoi) and 3/5 (TOI).

headlines: Still feel Neha is girlfriend: Angad on 1st wedding anniversary
text: Opening up about his marriage with actress Neha Dhupia on the occasion of their first wedding anniversary, actor Angad Bedi said, "I still feel she is my girlfriend." "This one year has been very blissful...for us, we continue from the same place where we started," the actor added. The couple is currently celebrating their anniversary in Mauritius with their daughter.

headlines: Ayushmann's 'Article 15' to premiere at London Indian Film Fest
text: The upcoming Ayushmann Khurrana starrer 'Article 15' will premiere worldwide during the opening night of the London Indian Film Festival on June 20. The investigative drama film, which will release in India on June 28, has been directed by filmmaker Anubhav Sinha. Nawazuddin Siddiqui starrer 'Photograph', directed by Ritesh Batra, will be screened during the closing night of the festival.

headlines: You'll always be 6 for me: Aamir on daughter Ira's 21st b'day
text: Aamir Khan took to social media on the occasion of his daughter Ira Khan's 21st birthday and shared a picture taken when Ira was 6-years-old. "Happy 21st Ira!!! Can't believe you got there so fast! You'll always remain 6 for me!" he wrote in the caption. Aamir is seen sporting long hair and a moustache in the picture from 2005.

headlines: AAP opened doors for PM Modi in 2014 LS polls: Rahul
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said that AAP "opened the doors" for PM Narendra Modi in the 2014 Lok Sabha elections. "AAP gave a slogan (in 2014) 'Arvind Kejriwal for CM and Narendra Modi for PM'," Rahul added. He further said that one would not hear the "chowkidar chor hai (watchman is a thief)" slogan at the AAP office.

headlines: Amazon accused of storing kids' data via smart speaker
text: A child protection and privacy groups' coalition conducted tests and alleged it found that Amazon's Echo Dot Kids Edition stores kids' voice recordings even after parents attempt to delete it. The coalition urged the US' Federal Trade Commission to investigate whether Amazon is violating Children's Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA) via the device. The device complies with COPPA, Amazon said.

headlines: BJP stands for 'Bahut Jhoothi Party': Congress
text: Congress spokesperson Abhishek Singhvi on Thursday said that BJP stands for "Bahut Jhoothi Party", while Modi stands for "Master of Dis-Information". He further said that PM Narendra Modi can hold a Guinness World Record for lies and propaganda. This comes after PM Modi accused late PM Rajiv Gandhi of using INS Viraat for his "personal holiday trips".

headlines: NHRC notices to Delhi govt, police over septic tank death
text: Taking suo moto cognisance of media reports of the death of two labourers, National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) has issued notices to the Delhi government and Commissioner of Police. The labourers died after apparently inhaling toxic gas while cleaning a septic tank on Tuesday. NHRC also condemned the attitude of onlookers who didn't help the victims, terming them "untouchables".

headlines: Gambhir sends defamation notice to Kejriwal over 'pamphlet' row
text: Cricketer-turned-BJP leader Gautam Gambhir has sent a defamation notice to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia and AAP's East Delhi candidate Atishi after they accused him of distributing "casteist and derogatory" pamphlets against Atishi. The legal notice demands that the noticees apologise and withdraw their statements or face legal action. The pamphlets had called her a "prostitute".

headlines: I'm working 350 days a year & want to take break now: Pankaj
text: Actor Pankaj Tripathi has said he wants to take a break and assess his career as he has been working 350 days a year. "I want to...take a holiday and enjoy life. I want to take a break next year," he added. Pankaj further said he needs time off as he doesn't want his performances to seem "repetitive" and "monotonous".

headlines: Mark used word 'domination' to describe FB's ambition: Co-founder
text: Facebook Co-founder Chris Hughes has written in New York Times, "From our earliest days, [Facebook CEO] Mark Zuckerberg used the word 'domination' to describe our ambitions, with no hint of irony or humility." Chris added, "Over a decade later, Facebook has earned the prize of domination." Hughes, who was Zuckerberg's roommate at Harvard, left Facebook in 2007 making $500 million.

headlines: 28-year-old who posed as billionaire's daughter jailed for 4 years
text: A 28-year-old German woman, who posed as daughter of a billionaire and defrauded hotels, restaurants, a private jet operator and banks out of over $200,000 in the US, has been sentenced to four to 12 years in prison. The actual amount of time Anna Sorokin will serve behind bars depends on factors such as her behaviour. She's also fined $24,000.

headlines: RCom board suspended, resolution professional takes over management
text: A bankruptcy court has suspended Anil Ambani-led Reliance Communications' (RCom) board and appointed a new interim resolution professional to run the company's operations. The National Company Law Tribunal allowed a consortium of 31 banks, led by SBI, to form a committee of creditors. As per the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code, the resolution process has to be completed within 270 days.

headlines: McDonald's closes north and east India outlets temporarily
text: McDonald's has closed its restaurants in north and east India to conduct a "comprehensive assessment of operational protocols and employee training". This comes after McDonald's India reached a settlement with former partner Vikram Bakshi, acquiring full ownership in their joint venture. The fast-food chain added that existing managers and crew "will be actively involved in activities to re-open the restaurants".

headlines: Pacers to have difficult time in England once shine wears off: Lee
text: Ex-Australia fast bowler Brett Lee has said that once the shine goes from the ball, it is going to be hard work for the fast bowlers in the World Cup in England. "It is in June and July and the wickets over there aren't really conducive for fast bowling at that time of the year," he added.

headlines: India's top-ranked female tennis player in ITF event last 8
text: India's top-ranked female tennis player Ankita Raina defeated China's Yue Yuan 6-2, 6-3 to enter the quarterfinals of ITF W60 women's event in China. World number 175 Raina took one hour and twelve minutes to beat unseeded Yuan. The 26-year-old Raina, who is seeded second at the $60,000 event, will face Hong Kong's Eudice Chong on Friday.

headlines: Pant is the best finisher among the young players: Shaw
text: After Delhi Capitals' wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant scored a match-winning 21-ball 49, including five sixes and two fours, in IPL 2019 Eliminator against SRH, his teammate Prithvi Shaw said, "He is the best finisher among the young players." "He always opens up the game for us," Shaw added about Pant, who has scored 450 runs in 15 IPL 2019 matches.

headlines: Google search for dating surpass matrimony search in India
text: Google on Thursday released its 'Year in Search: Insights for Brands Report' for India, which noted, "Dating related searches in India are growing much faster than matrimony queries". India also saw a 75% increase in "Near Me" queries, the report added. "India has become the fastest internet consuming country in the world," Google India Country Director said.

headlines: Google to launch 53 ambiguously gendered emojis to Android Q
text: Google is launching 53 updated, ambiguously gendered emojis as part of a beta release for Pixel smartphones this week and Android Q later this year, Fast Company said. "WeÂ’re not calling this...gender neutral. Gender neutral is what you call pants,Â” creative director for Google emoji Jennifer Daniel said. "It is an impossible task to communicate gender in...single image," Daniel added.

headlines: MIT system tracks health from bounced-back radio signals
text: MIT scientists have developed a movement-tracking system 'Marko' based on wireless radio-frequency signals, which collects health and behaviour data after the signals bounce off a human. The system is trained using sensors worn by users for a few days. In one test case, researchers used Marko to analyse a patient with dementia and found they became agitated after family visits.

headlines: Maruti Suzuki cuts production for three consecutive months
text: India's largest passenger vehicle maker Maruti Suzuki has said it has slashed its production by around 10% in April. This will be the third consecutive month when the company reduced production as sales continued to remain subdued since September 2018. The automaker reported a 19.6% year-on-year decline in domestic passenger vehicles sales at 1.3 lakh units in April.

headlines: China's Chery in talks with Tata Motors for India JV: Report
text: China's state-owned carmaker Chery is in advanced discussions with Tata Motors for a potential alliance in the Indian market, as per reports. The nature of the partnership and the time for Chery's entry into India is yet to be finalised, reports said. Notably, Tata Motors-owned Jaguar Land Rover and Chery have an equal joint venture in China since 2012.

headlines: Only one-third of world's longest rivers flow freely: Study
text: A study, led by Canada's McGill University's GÃ¼nther Grill, analysing 246 global rivers which are 1,000 kilometres or longer has revealed just around one-third, or 90 of them are still free-flowing. Such fragmentation of the world's major rivers, caused mainly by dams, threatens the ecosystem services that both people and wildlife depend on for survival, the researchers said.

headlines: 163-mn-year-old fossils reveal new bat-wing dinosaur species
text: Fossils found in China, dating back to about 163 million years ago, have led to the discovery of a new species of a small dinosaur with bat-like feathered wings. The dinosaur, Ambopteryx longibrachium, is only the second feathered dinosaur found with signs of large membranes on its wings, researchers said. The fossil was found in 2017 by a local farmer.

headlines: 'Royal boat' unearthed at 220-year-old Chhatar Manzil in UP
text: Uttar Pradesh State Archaeological Department (UPSAD) officials unearthed a 42-feet-long and 11-feet-wide traditional, flat-bottomed boat at Lucknow's 220-year-old Chhatar Manzil. While officials haven't denied the possibility of it being a "royal boat", UPSAD director AK Singh said it's a mystery how it got there. "We're yet to find if it was due to floods or some other reason," he added.

headlines: MCA may refer Jet Airways to SFIO for fund diversion probe
text: The Ministry of Corporate Affairs (MCA), based on a report from Registrar of Companies (RoC), is reportedly examining alleged fund diversion in Jet Airways' books. The RoC has found violations of Companies Act and some unexplained funds trail in Jet's books, reports said. The report could be referred to Serious Fraud Investigation Office (SFIO) to probe fraud allegations, reports added.

headlines: Taiwan looking to improve ties with India, says top official
text: Taiwan will strengthen its ties with India's new government, the representative of Taipei Economic and Cultural Centre in India, Chung Kwang Tien, said. "Our relations are pretty good. One of our projects [is] to promote visits of high-ranking officials," he said. Tien's statements come amidst China's claim that Taiwan does not qualify for formal diplomatic ties with any country.

headlines: GoT gave Starbucks $2.3B in free ad, cup wasn't from Starbucks: Report
text: Starbucks earned $2.3 billion in free advertising after a cup appearing to be from the company appeared on a 'Game of Thrones' episode, a CNBC report has said. The amount was calculated after counting 10,627 mentions of Starbucks and 'Game of Thrones' across the internet, TV and radio. It was revealed the cup didn't belong to Starbucks, the report added.

headlines: It was Joe's idea: Priyanka Chopra on Sophie's surprise wedding
text: Priyanka Chopra, while speaking about the surprise wedding of her brother-in-law Joe Jonas and actress Sophie Turner after the Billboard Awards, said, "Joe...had this idea that he wanted to do this." "He had these little black cards that we all got. We were randomly inviting our friends," she added. Priyanka also said the couple will have another formal wedding later.

headlines: 'You there, Shastri, Kohli?': Rishi asks why Pant is not in WC squad
text: After Rishabh Pant smashed 49(21) including five sixes and two fours to help Delhi Capitals defeat SunRisers Hyderabad in IPL 2019 eliminator, actor Rishi Kapoor asked why was Pant not included in World Cup squad. "You there, Ravi Shastri, Virat Kohli?" he added. The 21-year-old wicketkeeper-batsman has smashed 450 runs in 15 matches of IPL 2019.

headlines: Sob story: Kangana on Hrithik's statement on postponing Super 30
text: After Hrithik Roshan released a statement saying he's postponing his film 'Super 30' to save himself from "personal trauma", Kangana Ranaut said she doesn't know why he wrote a "sob story". "I'm glad 'Mental Hai Kya' is getting a solo release," she added. "Hrithik, Madhu Mantena and Ekta Kapoor had collectively decided Hrithik would push Super 30's release," she stated.

headlines: Congress urges Big B to clear Rajiv Gandhi's name in INS Viraat row
text: After PM Narendra Modi accused late PM Rajiv Gandhi for misusing INS Viraat, Congress social media cell head Divya Spandana requested Amitabh Bachchan to "set the record straight". She also shared a National Herald article wherein Lakshadweep's ex-administrator stated Amitabh and Jaya Bachchan and other friends of Gandhi were present on islands but took a personal helicopter for their travel.

headlines: Mishra ji & run out, epic love story: Irfan on obstructing the field
text: After Delhi Capitals' 36-year-old spinner Amit Mishra got out obstructing the field against SunRisers Hyderabad in the IPL 2019 Eliminator, all-rounder Irfan Pathan tweeted, "Mishra ji and run out...epic love story." Reacting to Mishra's dismissal, a user tweeted, "Amit Mishra a typical Delhiite - changing lanes in traffic and hoping there are no consequences."

headlines: Barmy Army photoshop 'cheats' on Warner's jersey in WC portrait
text: Barmy Army, a semi-organised group of English cricket fans, targeted Australia opener David Warner, who recently returned to the national side after serving one-year ban over ball tampering. Barmy Army photoshopped Warner's World Cup portrait by replacing 'Australia' with 'Cheats'. In the picture, Barmy Army also photoshopped images of sandpaper into the hands of bowler Mitchell Starc and Nathan Lyon.

headlines: WB woman killed by husband for protesting IPL betting, claims family
text: A 32-year-old woman was killed by her husband and his four family members after she protested against betting on IPL matches in West Bengal's Malda, her family alleged. The woman's father claimed his daughter opposed her husband's gambling habit and had a fight with him on Wednesday. He added that they forced his daughter to drink acid that killed her.

headlines: Facebook Co-founder says it's time to break up the company
text: Chris Hughes, who co-founded Facebook with Harvard roommate CEO Mark Zuckerberg in 2004, has called for the break up of the social network. "Mark's power is unprecedented and un-American...Mark's a good, kind person. But I'm angry that his focus on growth led him to sacrifice security and civility for clicks," said Chris, who quit Facebook in 2007 making $500 million.

headlines: You took Canadian citizen Akshay on INS Sumitra: Congress to PM Modi
text: Congress' social media chief Divya Spandana on Thursday shared pictures of actor Akshay Kumar onboard INS Sumitra and tweeted, "PM Narendra Modi you took a Canadian citizen Akshay Kumar with you onboard INS Sumitra." "Was this okay?" she questioned. This comes a day after PM Modi alleged that late PM Rajiv Gandhi enjoyed family holiday on INS Viraat.

headlines: Fake asteroid destroys New York City in NASA simulation
text: NASA scientists have revealed the outcomes of its asteroid impact drill where they simulated an asteroid heading towards Denver, US. The world's space powers collaborated to hit and deflect the 180-metre-wide asteroid. However, a 60-metre chunk broke off and hit New York City at 69,000 kmph destroying everything in a 15-km radius as political disagreements failed in nuking the rock.

headlines: Trump jokes after supporter at rally suggests shooting migrants
text: During a rally in Florida on Wednesday, US President Donald Trump smiled in response to a supporter's suggestion to shoot migrants who enter the country illegally through the border with Mexico. Trump smiled and pointed to the crowd member who said it, before joking, "That's only in the Panhandle you can get away with that statement".

headlines: 1,000 guns seized from home near Playboy Mansion in US
text: More than 1,000 guns and thousands of rounds of ammunition were seized from a home near the Playboy Mansion in Los Angeles, US, on Wednesday. Authorities acted on an anonymous tip that a person was manufacturing illegal firearms inside the home and selling them to gang members. A 56-year-old man was arrested from the scene.

headlines: Woman kisses BJP's Sunny Deol on cheek during roadshow
text: A woman kissed actor-turned-politician Sunny Deol on the cheek during a roadshow in Punjab's Batala. The woman climbed Deol's vehicle, gave him a garland, kissed him on the cheek and then got off the vehicle. Deol, who recently joined the BJP, is party's candidate from Punjab's Gurdaspur Lok Sabha constituency.

headlines: EC notice to Computer Baba for fanning communal sentiments
text: The Election Commission of India on Thursday issued a notice to Namdas Tyagi aka Computer Baba. The notice was issued after a complaint by BJP alleging that Tyagi was campaigning for Congress' Bhopal candidate Digvijaya Singh and fanning communal sentiments. The EC has asked Computer Baba to give a reply on the notice within 24-hours.

headlines: Prove coal mafia allegations or do 100 sit-ups: Mamata to PM
text: Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said that PM Narendra Modi has to do 100 sit-ups holding his ears if he fails to prove TMC candidates were involved with coal mafia. "If you can prove [this]...I'll withdraw all my 42 candidates," she added. Earlier, the PM alleged TMC has established coal mafia and deprived mine workers of their remuneration.

headlines: Hackers take down US city's networks, demand $76,000 in bitcoin
text: Hackers on Tuesday infected Baltimore city's government computers with ransomware, demanding 13 Bitcoins worth about $76,000 for releasing government files they held hostage. Baltimore has shut down most of its servers due to the infection, but services including police, fire and 311 still work, Mayor Bernard Young said. The US city has quarantined the ransomware, Young's spokesman revealed.

headlines: We want Google Co-founder to address walkout demands: Staff
text: Google employees demanded that Co-founder Larry Page publicly address demands of the walkout, organised about six months ago to protest Google's handling of sexual harassment cases. "Larry controls AlphabetÂ’s board...has the individual authority to make changes," they said in a Medium post. Recently, employees staged a sit-in protest over Google's alleged retaliation against walkout participants.

headlines: Tata Motors denies report of JLR sale to French automaker PSA
text: Tata Motors on Thursday said there was "no truth" to a report which claimed the automaker would sell Jaguar Land Rover to French automotive group PSA. The report had said a "post-sale integration document", which outlines benefits of the companies "joining forces", is in circulation. The sale of Tata Motors' UK-based luxury carmaker could be "imminent", it further claimed.

headlines: MIT model predicts breast cancer risk up to 5 yrs in advance
text: MIT and Massachusetts General Hospital (MGH) researchers have created a deep-learning model that can predict if patient is likely to develop breast cancer up to five years in future, from a mammogram. It was trained on over 60,000 MGH patients' mammograms and known outcomes. It accurately placed 31% of cancer patients in highest-risk category, compared to 18% for traditional models.

headlines: India, China to resolve market access issue 'expeditiously'
text: The government has said India and China have agreed to resolve market access issues "expeditiously" to promote more balanced trade. This comes after Commerce Secretary Anup Wadhawan met Chinese trade officials on Thursday. The trade deficit between the two countries has widened in favour of China by nearly 75% to $63 billion since 2014.

headlines: Jet Airways director Gaurang Shetty quits after 23 years
text: Jet Airways on Thursday said whole-time director Gaurang Shetty has stepped down from the airline. Shetty, considered close to Founder Naresh Goyal, joined Jet in 1996 as General Manager of Marketing and served as its acting CEO for two months in 2016. His resignation comes after ex-Chief Election Commissioner, Nasim Zaidi, resigned as a director from Jet's board in April.

headlines: Gambhir blames Kejriwal for 'derogatory pamphlets' on Atishi
text: After AAP's Atishi accused BJP's Gautam Gambhir of distributing pamphlets calling her "prostitute", Gambhir denied the allegations and blamed Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal for it. "I abhor your act of outraging a woman's modesty...and that too your own colleague," Gambhir tweeted. He added he'll withdraw his candidature if proven guilty and asked if Kejriwal would quit if accusations aren't proved.

headlines: I will file defamation case against them: Gambhir on pamphlet row
text: After AAP accused BJP's Gautam Gambhir of distributing derogatory pamphlets against AAP candidate Atishi and others, the former said that he will "definitely file a defamation case against them". "You can't tarnish someone's image just like that, if you don't have the proof," Gambhir said. "I'll quit politics if this is proven," he added.

headlines: OnePlus to host Â‘Experience Pop-UpÂ’ event in Delhi on May 17
text: OnePlus will be hosting one-of-its-kind 'OnePlus Experience Pop-Up' event on May 17 in Delhi, wherein users will get to experience the OnePlus 7 Pro. Early bird visitors will stand a chance to receive exclusive goodies including OnePlus Type-C Bullets, back cases, tote bags and 'Never Settle' T-shirt. Similar events will be held in 7 cities across India as well.

headlines: McDonald's India settles 6-year-old dispute with Vikram Bakshi
text: McDonald's has purchased estranged India partner Vikram Bakshi's 50% stake in Connaught Plaza Restaurants (CPRL), settling a 6-year-old dispute. Launched in 1995 as a joint venture, CPRL operates 169 McDonald's outlets in north and east India. In 2017, the US fast-food company terminated CPRL's franchise agreement citing non-payment of royalties and asked suppliers to stop dealing with the latter.

headlines: If Kangana is not trolled, she won't speak against Super 30: Rangoli
text: Rangoli Chandel, while speaking about her sister Kangana Ranaut being targetted for the clash between her film 'Mental Hai Kya' and Hrithik Roshan's 'Super 30', said, "If Kangana isn't trolled, she won't speak against Super 30." She earlier accused Hrithik of orchestrating tweets against Kangana. "Just because [Hrithik] can't say anything to Ekta, he made Kangana...punching bag," Rangoli wrote.

headlines: Hrithik postpones Super 30 after KanganaÂ’s sisterÂ’s tweets on him
text: Hrithik Roshan has postponed release date of 'Super 30', which was scheduled for July 26 with Kangana Ranaut's 'Mental Hai Kya'. Hrithik said he did so to save himself from personal trauma and toxic mental violence. Earlier, Kangana's sister claimed on Twitter that Hrithik created bad publicity for Kangana and made her a "punching bag" over clash of their films.

headlines: Beckham banned from driving for 6 months for using phone at wheel
text: Ex-England football team captain David Beckham has been banned from driving for six months for using his mobile phone while driving his Bentley in London last November. The Bromley Magistrates' Court also imposed a fine of Â£750 on the 44-year-old. Beckham was seen by a member of the public looking at his lap and using the phone, the prosecutor said.

headlines: Hot 'superionic water ice' existing on Neptune recreated on Earth
text: US-based scientists have used powerful lasers to freeze water into its exotic superionic phase and have identified its atomic structure for the first time. First predicted in 1988 and believed to occur naturally on Uranus and Neptune, it was created by firing laser beams on a thin layer of liquid water to extreme pressures and high temperatures (1,650-2,760 degrees Celsius).

headlines: BBC radio host posts chimp's pic for Harry, Meghan's baby; gets fired
text: The British Broadcasting Corporation has fired Danny Baker, the 61-year-old host of BBC Radio 5 Live, for posting a picture of a chimpanzee in a suit to welcome the Duke and Duchess of Sussex's newborn baby on Wednesday. "Royal baby leaves hospital," Baker had captioned the now-deleted post. Meghan Markle and Prince Harry welcomed a baby boy on Monday.

headlines: N Korea fires short-range missiles in 2nd launch within a week
text: North Korea fired two short-range missiles on Thursday, marking the second such launch within a week, the South Korean military said. The missiles were fired from the Kusong region in North Pyongan Province. Last week, North Korea had tested several short-range missiles from the Hodo peninsula in the east of the country.

headlines: I like to operate, it's a de-stresser for me: Bhutan's doctor PM
text: Bhutan's Prime Minister Lotay Tshering who is a practising urologist said that operating is a de-stresser for him. Tshering gives medical advice to trainees and doctors and attends to patients two days a week. Tshering entered politics in 2013 and became the Prime Minister of Bhutan last year.

headlines: Rajan among top contenders for Bank of England Governor: Bloomberg
text: Former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan is "moving up in the race" to be the next Bank of England Governor, according to a Bloomberg survey of economists. The University of Chicago professor is now in second place, behind Andrew Bailey, CEO of the UK's Financial Conduct Authority. Canadian Mark Carney became the first foreign Governor of Bank of England in 2013.

headlines: Put on weight post wedding, have dark circles & it's okay: Sonam
text: While speaking about the pressure women face, actress Sonam Kapoor said, "In India, there's so much pressure on girls...Whether it's about who you're getting married to...[or] why is your skin looking like that." "After my wedding, I've put on weight, my skin goes bad, I've really bad dark circles and I want all...girls to know that it's okay," she added.

headlines: Why would I slap PM: Mamata on 'slap of democracy' remark
text: At a rally in West Bengal on Thursday, state's CM Mamata Banerjee gave clarification on her "slap of democracy" remark on PM Narendra Modi. "Why should I be slapping you (the PM)...Slap of democracy means the mandate people will give by casting their votes," she said. Earlier, Banerjee said she wanted to give PM Modi a "tight slap of democracy".

headlines: Mamata insults Constitution by not accepting me PM: PM Modi
text: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee is continuously abusing him because of the anxiety of losing elections. He added that she's also insulting the Constitution "by publicly saying that she's not ready to accept the country's current PM". "But she feels proud in acknowledging Pakistan PM as that country's prime minister," PM Modi further said.

headlines: Small margins are frustrating: SRH captain on last over loss
text: After DC beat SRH by two wickets with one ball remaining in IPL 2019 Eliminator, SRH captain Kane Williamson said, "It's a bit frustrating when the margin is small." Last season the team was on the "right side" of such close encounters, Williamson added. "Some learning for the next year...but disappointing to depart from the competition," the 28-year-old stated.

headlines: FB hires PayPal employees, may test its crypto in India: Report
text: Facebook's blockchain unit headed by former PayPal President David Marcus now consists of 50 employees, several of whom previously worked at PayPal, Bloomberg reported. The unit, set up last year, is developing a cryptocurrency 'stablecoin', to be tested in India at first, the report added. The product may eventually allow users to transfer money via WhatsApp Pay.

headlines: Uber starts e-bike trial in India, partners Bengaluru startup Yulu
text: Uber has partnered Bengaluru-based dockless bicycle sharing startup Yulu as part of a pilot test for e-bike services in India. "As part of the deal, Uber will redirect its riders looking for micro-mobility rides to our Yulu app," Yulu Co-founder and CEO Amit Gupta said. Yulu was launched by Gupta along with RK Misra, Hemant Gupta and Naveen Dachuri.

headlines: Pope makes it mandatory for Catholic priests to report sexual abuse
text: Pope Francis issued a law on Thursday requiring all Catholic priests and nuns around the world to report clerical sexual abuse and cover-up, to church authorities. The new law will come into force on June 1 and will be re-evaluated after a three-year trial period. It also provides whistleblower protections for anyone making a report.

headlines: RBI's credit registry will affect private credit bureaus: US
text: The US has objected to the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) move to create a Public Credit Registry (PCR) on the grounds that it will be anti-competitive for private credit bureaus. The PCR, which is a repository of loan information of individuals and corporate borrowers, seeks to curb bad loans. Notably, US-based TransUnion and Equifax operate credit bureaus in India.

headlines: ED probes Etihad investment in Jet Privilege
text: The ED is reportedly probing Etihad Airways' investment in Jet Airways' frequent-flyer programme, Jet Privilege. The agency is investigating whether Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) norms were violated when the Abu Dhabi-based carrier took a stake in the programme, reports said. Queries raised by the erstwhile FIPB to both the airlines immediately after the deal had gone unanswered, reports added.

headlines: Groww launches UPI for Mutual Funds
text: Investment platform Groww launched UPI for Mutual Funds on 27th April, and since then their daily investments have more than doubled. Enabling single-click investment opportunity, it solved the biggest pain in investing for customers. Notably, last month Groww crossed 1.5 million users.

headlines: India takes part in naval drill in S China Sea claimed by China
text: India, Japan, the US and the Philippines held naval drills in the South China Sea, nearly 90% of which is claimed by China. India deployed a destroyer, the INS Kolkata, and a tanker, the INS Shakti, in the nearly week-long multilateral drill, the US Navy said. Southeast Asian nations including Vietnam and Malaysia also lay claims over the sea.

headlines: My real name Alia, Salman told to change it due to Alia Bhatt: Kiara
text: Actress Kiara Advani, during her appearance on 'Feet Up with the Stars' season 2, revealed Alia is her first name. Kiara added, "Salman suggested me to change it because of Alia Bhatt because there can't be two actresses with...same name in Bollywood." "Kiara is the name...I chose. Now even my parents have started to call me Kiara," she said.

headlines: Weird that dusky actresses are called sexy, not beautiful: Esha
text: Actress Esha Gupta has said she finds it weird when actresses with a slightly darker complexion are called 'sexy' and not 'beautiful'. She added, "I...get irritated when people associate beautiful women with fairness. Why can't a brown-skinned woman be beautiful?" "Why not dark and lovely, why only fair and lovely," Esha further said.

headlines: Woman detained for trying to throw slipper at Navjot Sidhu
text: A woman has been detained for allegedly attempting to throw her slipper at Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu during a public meeting in Rohtak, Haryana. In a video of the incident, the woman is seen telling police personnel that she threw the slipper because "Sidhu spoke against (Prime Minister Narendra) Modi."

headlines: It's like Modi's fighting 1989 polls against Rajiv Gandhi: Omar
text: After PM Narendra Modi said "Rajiv Gandhi died as corrupt number 1", National Conference leader Omar Abdullah on Wednesday tweeted, "It's almost as if he's fighting the 1989 general election & Rajiv Gandhi is his principal rival!" Omar questioned whether PM Modi had found a time machine, and added, "Oh to be 19 again."

headlines: CES re-awards prize to sex toy which it called 'immoral'
text: The world's biggest tech event CES, held in Las Vegas, has re-awarded a Robotics Innovation Award to a "female-focused" sex toy developed by startup Lora DiCarlo. CES withdrew the award saying the product was "immoral, obscene, indecent or profane", following which Founder Lora Haddock accused the organisers of sexism and bias. "We did not handle this award properly," organisers said.

headlines: We won't allot rooms to any Pakistani national: Uttar Pradesh hotel
text: Hotel Milan Palace in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj has put up a notice stating 'Entry of Pakistani nationals restricted'. On being asked about the note, the hotel manager said, "We had put up the notice after Pulwama attack. No Pakistani national has come here...even if they come, we won't allot them rooms." "We're protesting in a way we can," he added.

headlines: SC rejects pleas opposing release of Rajiv Gandhi killing convicts
text: The Supreme Court has rejected the petitions which opposed Tamil Nadu government's decision to release seven convicts in Rajiv Gandhi assassination case. The pleas were filed by families of those killed along with the former prime minister in a suicide attack in 1991. The state government had taken the decision on early release of the convicts in 2014.

headlines: BSF apprehends Pakistani intruder near J&K's Samba sector
text: An alleged Pakistani intruder was arrested by BSF near Jammu and Kashmir's Samba sector on Wednesday. "The alleged intruder was apprehended by the patrol party... He has been identified as Muhammad Afzal... and is a resident of Narowal in Nihar district of Pakistan," BSF said. It is yet to be revealed if anything suspicious has been recovered from him.

headlines: 3 kids die, 24 people fall sick after eating stale meat in Telangana
text: At least three children aged between one and three died and 24 other people were hospitalised in a case of suspected food poisoning in Telangana's Adilabad district on Wednesday. The incident happened after guests at a wedding feast ate left-over mutton curry and started vomiting. The affected people were taken to the health centre, where two of the three succumbed.

headlines: Kerala minister sends ambulance in 2 hrs as man seeks help on Facebook
text: Kerala Health Minister KK Shailaja helped a man to save a newborn's life after he posted a comment on the minister's official Facebook page. Within two hours, the minister informed an ambulance was on its way to shift the newborn, suffering heart valve problems, to a speciality hospital. "I'm writing this message because there's no other option," the man wrote.

headlines: NR Jagdale, man behind India's first single-malt whisky, dies
text: Bengaluru-based Amrut Distilleries' MD and Chairman Neelakanta Rao Jagdale passed away on Thursday at the age of 66 after a brief illness. Amrut's Fusion Single Malt Whisky, India's first single-malt whisky, was ranked the third best in the world in 2010 by whisky expert Jim Murray. Jagdale was also known for his involvement in the promotion of swimming among youth.

headlines: Complaint against Sunny for disrespecting Sikh holy scarf
text: A Sikh body approached the Akal Takht to lodge a complaint against actor and BJP candidate from Gurdaspur Sunny Deol for allegedly dishonouring siropa (Sikh holy scarf) during a political rally. Earlier, a picture went viral where a siropa and a photograph of Lord Shiva were seen near Sunny's feet. Congress demanded an FIR against Sunny for hurting Hindu sentiments.

headlines: Trying to merge healing & work: Irrfan on acting post cancer
text: In a note addressed to the media, Irrfan Khan opened up about returning to work after undergoing treatment for cancer and wrote, "Last few months have been...a road to recovery." "I'm...taking baby steps to merge my healing with work and trying to experiment the amalgamation of both," he added. Irrfan further thanked the media for their support throughout his journey.

headlines: It started with transition from pizza to salad: Sara on losing weight
text: Opening up about her weight loss journey, actress Sara Ali Khan said, "The transition from pizza to salad and from lethargy to cardio is how I kickstarted my fitness journey." "[I]t all started in New York. I weighed 96kg," the actress added. Sara further said she works out almost every day for an hour and a half to stay healthy.

headlines: Karan Oberoi sent to 14-day judicial custody in rape case
text: TV actor Karan Oberoi has been sent to 14-day judicial custody by an Andheri Court, after being accused of rape and blackmail by a female astrologer. He was arrested on May 6 following an FIR, stating that he not only raped her and filmed the act but also demanded money. She alleged they met through a dating app in 2016.

headlines: BSP leader made death threats against me, my family: UP minister
text: UP minister Upendra Tiwari has accused BSP leader Satish Chaudhary Naga of abusing him and threatening to kill him and his family during a phone call on Tuesday night. The police said a case was registered following Tiwari's complaint and an investigation is underway. Satish is a former minister.

headlines: Not choosing class monitor, lots at stake: PM on LS polls
text: When asked why the 2019 Lok Sabha polls have been so polarising, Prime Minister Narendra Modi responded, "You have to understand that we are not choosing a class monitor here. We are deciding the direction this country takes." He added, "We are deciding the future of 130 crore Indians... A lot is at stake."

headlines: Google to add option to let users pay for apps with cash
text: Google, in its 2019 I/O developers conference, announced it's launching "pending transactions" feature, which offers users the option to receive a code to pay for apps with methods like cash at nearby convenience stores. Users will then receive their purchase and email with proof of payment. Google said it's in the process of rolling out support for UPI in India.

headlines: Huawei CFO to seek extradition stay citing Trump's comments
text: Huawei CFO Meng Wanzhou intends to seek a stay of extradition proceedings in part based on "intimidating and coercive" statements by US President Donald Trump about the case, her lawyers said. The statements disqualify the US from pursuing the matter in Canada, they added. The 47-year-old is accused of conspiring to violate US sanctions on Iran.

headlines: Former Punjab Home Secretary SS Channy joins BJP
text: Former Punjab Home Secretary and retired IAS officer of 1982 batch, Sarwan Singh Channy on Thursday joined the Bharatiya Janata Party. He joined the party in the presence of senior BJP leader and Union Minister Nitin Gadkari. In the past, Channy has held various key positions in Punjab government including Chief Information Officer, NRI Affairs, Deputy Commissioner Ludhiana, among others.

headlines: People thought I got pregnant with Ananya before marriage: Bhavana
text: Actress Ananya Panday's mother Bhavana Pandey, while revealing that Ananya is a "honeymoon baby", said, "People were actually calculating if I conceived her before or after marriage." "She has been with us from our first anniversary," she added. Bhavana got married to actor Chunky Panday in January 1998 and Ananya was born in October in the same year.

headlines: AAP's Atishi says Gambhir distributed pamphlets calling her prostitute
text: Atishi, AAP's candidate from East Delhi Lok Sabha constituency, broke down on Thursday, accusing BJP candidate Gautam Gambhir of distributing "casteist and derogatory" pamphlets calling her a "prostitute". "Atishi's father is a UP jat, mother Punjabi and husband a Christian from Andhra," pamphlet shared by AAP read. "The language is so abusive that everybody will feel ashamed," Manish Sisodia said.

headlines: I call you Didi, your slap a blessing for me: PM Modi to Mamata
text: After West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said she feels like giving PM Narendra Modi "a slap of democracy", PM Modi responded, "Your slap will be a blessing for me." He added, "Mamata Didi, I call you Didi and will continue to keep doing so." He further said that he can "digest all the abuses...in the dictionaries all over the world."

headlines: SC dismisses plea by Tej Bahadur against rejection of his nomination
text: The Supreme Court today dismissed the plea of ex-BSF constable Tej Bahadur Yadav against the rejection of his nomination from Varanasi Lok Sabha constituency as an SP candidate. "We don't find any merit to entertain this petition," a bench headed by CJI Ranjan Gogoi dismissing the plea said. The Election Commission had rejected his papers citing discrepancies.

headlines: Video: Irani asks MP people if Cong waived loans, crowd chants 'yes'
text: Congress has shared a video, showing Union Minister Smriti Irani asking people during a rally in Madhya Pradesh, that if they have received farm loans waivers promised by Congress-led state government. Following this, people can be seen chanting, "Yes, we have. Yes, we have." "Now even people have started to respond directly to these lies," Congress tweeted with the video.

headlines: Police pushed me at IPL match: Activist with disability posts video
text: TMN Deepak, a professor and activist with disability, has tweeted a video, alleging that policemen pushed and insulted him when he went to watch the IPL match in Chennai on Tuesday. He claimed he was "demeaned" when he sought clarity on a designated parking spot for persons with disabilities. "Should v not ask parking? R v not citizens," Deepak tweeted.

headlines: Thank god Godse not alive: Mufti over Pragya's verified Twitter page
text: After BJP leader Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur got a verified Twitter account, former J&K CM Mehbooba Mufti tweeted, "Sadhvi Pragya has a verified Twitter account thanks to @TwitterIndia." "Ridiculous that a terror accused is given a platform to sow seeds of hatred. Thank god Godse's isn't alive anymore," she added. Thakur is out on bail in 2008 Malegaon blast case.

headlines: Will be hard to spot Pak on map if it doesn't stop terror: Giriraj
text: Stating that Pakistan was exposed after the Balakot air strikes, Union Minister Giriraj Singh said, "If Pakistan does not stop terrorism...it will be difficult to find Pakistan on the map one day." Referring to Union Minister Nitin Gadkari's statements about diverting water flowing into Pakistan, Singh added, "There will not just be air strikes...there will not just be water strikes".

headlines: Uber drivers complain of low cash incentives, more working hours
text: As Uber drivers planned a global strike on Wednesday ahead of its upcoming IPO, drivers in India have complained of inability to pay monthly EMIs towards car and home loans. "When I joined Uber, things were just going fine. Now, with low cash incentives, I have to drive for longer hours to make ends meet," said a driver named Santosh.

headlines: Gene-edited virus used to treat drug-resistant bacteria in a 1st
text: London-based scientists have used genetically modified viruses to treat a patient with an antibiotic-resistant infection in a first. Isabelle Carnell-Holdaway, now aged 17, was diagnosed with cystic fibrosis when she was 11 months old and underwent double lung transplant in 2017, which caused bacteria Mycobacterium abscessus to take hold. The virus that was used had come from a rotting eggplant.

headlines: Uncle allegedly rapes 18-month-old at wedding, leaves her in bushes
text: An uncle of an 18-month-old baby has been booked for allegedly raping her at a wedding in Uttar Pradesh's Agra. The baby was found lying unconscious in bushes around 400 metres away from the wedding venue. Reportedly, the baby's mother was asked to leave the wedding with her as the family tried to suppress the case.

headlines: Girl made Dy Commissioner for 6hrs on getting Rank 4 in ISC exam
text: Richa Singh, who came fourth nationally in the ISC Class 12 examination with 99.25%, was on Wednesday made a Deputy Commissioner of Kolkata Police from 6 am-12 noon in appreciation of her achievement. She's the daughter of an additional officer-in-charge of a police station. When asked about orders for her father, Richa said, "I'll order him to return home early".

headlines: 13 Indians rescued from burning ship carrying 120 vehicles in UAE
text: As many as 13 Indians onboard a burning cargo ship were rescued on Wednesday by a team of firefighters at Khalid Port in UAE. The vessel was loaded with 6,000 gallons of diesel, 120 exported vehicles and 300 vehicle tyres, all of which were gutted in the fire. The cause of the fire is yet to be ascertained.

headlines: Fed only boiled vegetables, lost 16 kg in Tihar jail: Christian Michel
text: Christian Michel, the alleged middleman in the AgustaWestland chopper scam, has complained to the CBI court alleging that he has lost 16 kilograms of weight after being given only boiled vegetables to eat in Tihar jail. The CBI court has sought the jail authority and doctor's reply in the matter. Michel was extradited to India from UAE in December 2018.

headlines: Australian $50 note with spelling mistake printed 46 million times
text: Around 46 million of Australia's new $50 notes have been printed with a spelling mistake, the country's central bank confirmed. The word 'responsibility' has been misspelt as 'responsibilty' several times in the first speech of Australia's first female member of parliament that features on the note. The bank said the spelling will be corrected at the next print run.

headlines: Avengers sank Titanic: Titanic maker as Endgame beats revenue record
text: The director of 'Titanic' James Cameron congratulated the makers of 'Avengers: Endgame' after the film beat 'Titanic' to become the second most successful film at the global box office. "[A]n iceberg sank the real Titanic. It took the Avengers to sink my Titanic," Cameron tweeted. The filmmaker shared an image of the Titanic sinking as it hit the Avengers logo.

headlines: Paresh to feature in Varun's 'Coolie No. 1' remake: Reports
text: Paresh Rawal has reportedly joined the cast of the upcoming adaptation of the 1995 film 'Coolie No. 1', which will see Varun Dhawan and Sara Ali Khan in lead roles. Paresh will be essaying late actor Kader Khan's role from the original film and will play Sara's father, as per reports. The film is slated to release in May 2020.

headlines: Nawazuddin to feature in Housefull 4 song as exorcist: Reports
text: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui will reportedly be seen portraying the role of an exorcist in a song in the upcoming fourth instalment of the 'Housefull' film franchise, starring Akshay Kumar. The whole cast of the film will feature in the song with Nawazuddin, as per reports. The film will also see Kriti Sanon, Riteish Deshmukh, and Kriti Kharbanda in lead roles.

headlines: Baseless: Soni on rumours of daughter Alia marrying Ranbir
text: Actress Soni Razdan has denied reports that suggest her daughter Alia Bhatt will be tying the knot with actor Ranbir Kapoor in Lake Como, Italy. "It is a totally baseless rumour!" the actress said. Reports had earlier suggested that Alia and Ranbir, who are on a vacation in Lake Como, were also set to secretly get married there.

headlines: 70% Indian Firms to deploy AI before 2020: Intel IDC
text: Intel IDC report anticipates a huge demand for qualified AI professionals by 2020. Working professionals can leverage this opportunity by upskilling in AI and Machine Learning with Great Learning's PG Program in AIML. The program is offered in collaboration with The University of Texas at Austin, and offers hands-on learning with GPU labs and 12+ industry projects.

headlines: Mishra 2nd player in IPL history to get out obstructing the field
text: DC's 36-year-old spinner Amit Mishra on Wednesday became the second player in IPL history to get out obstructing the field after Yusuf Pathan in 2013. Mishra started running across the pitch to survive run-out when SRH pacer Khaleel Ahmed's throw hit him on fourth delivery of the last over. DC required two runs off three balls before Mishra got out.

headlines: Road journey became a nightmare: TV actress on escaping Cyclone Fani
text: TV actress Rachana Parulkar, while narrating her experience of escaping Cyclone Fani during a family trip, said, "Our entire road journey became a nightmare." Rachana, who was travelling to Cherrapunjee from Guwahati, added, "We witnessed four landslides on the way...It took us almost five hours to get to a safer place." "It was a near-fatal encounter," Rachana further said.

headlines: Man approaches Swara and records video, says 'Aayega Modi hi'
text: Actress Swara Bhasker has shared on Twitter that a man had approached her for a selfie at an airport and "sneakily" shot a video. "Ma'am, aayega Modi hi," the man can be heard saying in the video. "I don't discriminate people who want selfies based on their politics...Tacky & underhand tactics," Swara wrote on Twitter.

headlines: Iyer decides to withdraw run-out appeal, Pant convinces him not to
text: DC captain Shreyas Iyer decided to withdraw run-out appeal after SRH batsman Deepak Hooda fell down on the pitch after a collision with pacer Keemo Paul in the last over. However, wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant, who ran Hooda out at non-striker's end, intervened and convinced Iyer to not withdraw the appeal as Hooda was running in the middle of the pitch.

headlines: Shreyas Iyer attempts running catch near rope, throws ball for six
text: DC captain Shreyas Iyer attempted a catch near the boundary but threw the ball beyond the ropes for a six against SRH on Wednesday. The incident happened in SRH's 19th over when Vijay Shankar slammed Trent Boult towards wide long-off. Iyer caught the ball after covering some distance but lost his balance and failed to throw it back into play.

headlines: Not necessary for PM Modi to speak against Rajiv Gandhi: BJP leader
text: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's 'Rajiv Gandhi died as corrupt number 1' remark, BJP leader Srinivasa Prasad said, "It wasn't necessary for [PM Modi] to speak against Rajiv Gandhi." Adding that former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee also spoke many good things about Gandhi, Prasad asserted, "LTTE planned and assassinated Rajiv Gandhi. He didn't die due to corruption allegations."

headlines: SC dismisses plea against Rahul Gandhi's alleged British citizenship
text: Supreme Court has dismissed the petition seeking to direct EC to debar Congress President Rahul Gandhi from contesting Lok Sabha polls over a complaint that he's a British citizen. "Some company in some form has mentioned him as British citizen, so does he become British citizen? Dismissed," the CJI said. Rahul was earlier sent a notice by the Home Ministry.

headlines: Tottenham post comeback win in 96th min, reach CL final for 1st time
text: After being 0-3 down on aggregate in Champions League semi-final second leg against Ajax, Tottenham midfielder Lucas Moura completed a second-half hat-trick in 96th minute (injury time) to help his team reach the final on away goals. Tottenham, who became the fifth English club to reach CL final, will play Liverpool in the summit clash in Madrid on June 1.

headlines: 16 viewing points being built on Dal Lake in Srinagar
text: The Jammu and Kashmir government is building 16 viewing points on the banks of Dal Lake in Srinagar for the convenience of tourists. The Director of Kashmir Tourism, NA Wani said, "There are around 16 points that we call 'ghats', which are being developed with a blend of modern and traditional architecture."

headlines: Neutron star collision made 0.3% of Earth's gold, platinum: Study
text: Two US-based astrophysicists have identified a collision of two neutron stars 4.6 billion years ago as the likely source of about 0.3% of Earth's heavy elements including gold, platinum and uranium. "This means that in each of us we would find an eyelash worth of these elements, mostly in the form of iodine," the study's co-author Imre Bartos said.

headlines: NASA shares images of power outage in Odisha after Cyclone Fani
text: US space agency NASA has shared before and after images of Odisha cities like Bhubaneswar and Cuttack, showing the areas where the lights went out following the Cyclone Fani. The images, which are data visualisations, show city lighting on April 30 and on May 5, two days after Fani made landfall at the coast of Puri.

headlines: 7 Maoists killed in encounters in Odisha, Chhattisgarh
text: At least seven Maoists were killed in two separate encounters in Koraput district of Odisha and Dantewada district of Chhattisgarh on Wednesday. In Koraput, one of the five Maoists killed was reportedly Swaroopa. Swaroopa was a key accused in the double murder of sitting Araku MLA Kidari Sarveswara Rao and former MLA Siveri Soma in Andhra Pradesh in September 2018.

headlines: 4 suffocate to death after fire breaks out in saree shop in Pune
text: At least four people were killed on Thursday in a fire that engulfed a saree shop in Maharashtra's Pune. The fire was reported at around 5 am, when the workers were asleep in a room above the shop. The fire spread from the shop to the room above and the workers were suffocated to death, police said.

headlines: I was bullied & called hunchback in school as I'm tall: Ananya
text: Ananya Panday revealed she was bullied in school and called 'hunchback' because she had to bend down to hear people talk as she was very tall. "In school, I'd always be uncomfortable because my skirt would expose my thin, chicken legs," she added. "This is the reason trolls don't affect me, as I've been bullied in school," Ananya further said.

headlines: Ayushmann to play gay man in Shubh Mangal Saavdhan 2: Report
text: Ayushmann Khurrana will play the role of a gay man in the upcoming sequel to the 2017 film 'Shubh Mangal Saavdhan', as per reports. The film, which is reportedly titled 'Shubh Mangal Zyada Saavdhan', is about a father coming to terms with his son's sexuality. Scheduled to release next year, casting for the film is currently underway, reports further suggested.

headlines: Federer plays clay match after 3 yrs, wins in straight sets
text: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer returned to clay court after three years and defeated France's Richard Gasquet 6-2, 6-3 at Madrid Open on Tuesday. Federer, who last played on clay against Dominic Thiem at 2016 Rome Masters, took 53 minutes to beat Gasquet. "I would have...regrets not being on...clay in 2019," the world number three said after the win.

headlines: Alibaba-backed Chinese AI startup Megvii raises $750 million
text: Alibaba-backed Chinese AI startup Megvii, commonly known for its facial recognition brand Face++, has raised $750 million in its latest funding round. The funding raises Megvii's valuation to over $4 billion as it prepares for its IPO in Hong Kong planned for later this year, Reuters reported. Bank of China Group Investment reportedly led the funding round with $200 million.

headlines: Facebook may pick London as WhatsApp Pay base amid India test
text: Facebook plans to use London to drive the global expansion of WhatsApp's mobile payments service, a company spokesperson confirmed. WhatsApp dispatched engineers to Britain late last year to recruit about 100 people in London and Dublin to support its payments initiative, the spokesperson added. Facebook started its test for the service in India over a year ago.

headlines: After 2 years, Steve Singh to step down as Docker CEO
text: US-based software platform Docker has announced Steve Singh is stepping down from his current role of Chief Executive Officer (CEO) after having served for over two years. Singh will continue as the Docker's Board Chairman, while former Hortonworks CEO Rob Bearden will join as the new CEO. Notably, Singh has also served as Mumbai-based Cleartrip's Chairman for around 3 years.

headlines: In a first, electricity generated from coldness of universe
text: In a first, an international team of scientists claims it has demonstrated it is possible to generate a measurable amount of electricity in a diode directly from the coldness of the universe. By pointing its device toward space, the team could find an optimum temperature difference between Earth and space to generate power through an early design.

headlines: Mumbai-London Air India flight diverted, delayed by 24 hours
text: A Mumbai-London Air India flight was diverted to Vienna due to a technical snag in its engine, following which it was delayed by over 24 hours at the Vienna airport. The flight, which was carrying over 300 passengers, reached London on Wednesday. "A technical team was sent to Vienna to rectify the glitch," the airline said.

headlines: Amrapali projects' ownership may be given to Noida authorities: SC
text: The Supreme Court has said it may give ownership rights of all 15 residential properties of cash-strapped Amrapali Group to Noida and Greater Noida authorities. It said the authorities can then engage any builder to finish the stalled projects. "We may throw you out from these properties and transfer it lock, stock and barrel," the court added.

headlines: DC eliminate SRH from IPL 2019, to face CSK in Qualifier 2
text: Delhi Capitals on Wednesday eliminated 2018 runners-up SunRisers Hyderabad from IPL 2019 after defeating them in the last over of the Eliminator. Delhi Capitals will now face Chennai Super Kings in the tournament's Qualifier 2 on Friday. The winner of the Qualifier 2 will lock horns with three-time champions Mumbai Indians in the final on Sunday.

headlines: Looked at my pic & got scared: Parineeti on decision to lose weight
text: Parineeti Chopra, while speaking about her decision to take a break from films and lose weight, said, "One day I saw a picture of myself and I got really scared...I didn't recognise myself." Recalling her thoughts, she added, "This is not a 26-year-old girl. I have no right to look like this, especially if I'm an actress."

headlines: Hrithik making Kangana punching bag: Rangoli on clash of their films
text: Talking about her sister Kangana Ranaut's 'Mental Hai Kya' clashing with Hrithik Roshan's 'Super 30', Rangoli Chandel said that Hrithik is creating bad publicity for Kangana. She added that release date of 'Mental Hai Kya' was decided by Ekta Kapoor and "just because [Hrithik] can't say anything to Ekta", he made Kangana a "punching bag".

headlines: Gambhir challenges Kejriwal to debate but asks for some time
text: Cricketer-turned-politician Gautam Gambhir on Tuesday challenged Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal for a debate, however he said, "Give me half the time (that you have spent in politics) and then, you decide the place and time." Gambhir added that Kejriwal is only good at "debate, dharna and drama". Gambhir is fighting Lok Sabha polls on a BJP ticket from East Delhi.

headlines: Hang on, let me do ritual: Manjrekar as Iyer tosses coin in hurry
text: During the coin toss ahead of IPL 2019 Eliminator today, commentator Sanjay Manjrekar stopped Delhi Capitals captain Shreyas Iyer after he hurriedly tossed the coin even before Manjrekar introduced both the captains. "Hang on...let me do the ritual...Very eager to kick off," he later said. "That doesn't count, right?" Manjrekar then asked the referee before Iyer tossed the coin again.

headlines: Liverpool manager calls team 'f***ing giants' after win vs BarÃ§a
text: After Liverpool overturned a three-goal first-leg deficit to beat Barcelona 4-3 on aggregate in Champions League semi-final, Liverpool manager JÃ¼rgen Klopp called his team "f***ing giants". "These boys are f***ing mentality giants! It's unbelievable. It's unbelievable. Fine me. Fine me if you want but I'm not native so I don't have better words for it," he said.

headlines: Why should there be labels? Mandhana on 'woman cricketer' tag
text: Indian women's cricket team vice-captain Smriti Mandhana has said that she "no longer" sees herself as a woman cricketer but simply as a cricketer. "Why should there be labels when none are required," she added. "It would get frustrating when my male counterparts were questioned about their game or performance whereas I was fielding questions on gender stereotypes," she stated.

headlines: Flintoff urges England to drop anyone and get Archer for World Cup
text: Ex-England all-rounder Andrew Flintoff has suggested England should call up all-rounder Jofra Archer to their World Cup squad at any cost. "Who would I get rid of [to include Archer]? Anyone. He's brilliant," he said. "I was watching him bowl...and found it so frustrating that a bloke can bowl so fast with what looks like so little effort," Flintoff added.

headlines: Australia's 22-year-old fast bowler Jhye Richardson ruled out of WC
text: Cricket Australia on Wednesday announced that 22-year-old fast bowler Jhye Richardson has been withdrawn from their 15-member squad for the 2019 World Cup that begins on May 30. Richardson will miss the quadrennial tournament owing to a dislocated right shoulder. Fast bowler Kane Richardson has been named as replacement for Jhye, who had made his debut in January last year.

headlines: Pandya shouldn't be put under pressure: Kapil Dev on comparisons
text: India's 1983 World Cup-winning captain Kapil Dev has said all-rounder Hardik Pandya shouldn't be put under pressure. "He's a young player and should be allowed to play his natural game. There should be no comparisons at this point," Dev added. He further said that India's pace attack is fantastic and English conditions will help them a lot in World Cup.

headlines: Cyclone Fani death toll rises to 41 in Odisha, 21 lakh cattle killed
text: The number of deaths due to Cyclone Fani rose to 41 in Odisha, confirmed state Information and Public Relations Secretary SK Singh on Wednesday. Over 21 lakh livestock was also killed in the cyclone, said Special Relief Commissioner's office. Odisha government is trying to restore electricity in the worst affected Puri and parts of Khordha district, including capital Bhubaneswar.

headlines: Mumbai-bound flight from Paris makes emergency landing in Iran
text: A plane flown by a subsidiary of Air France heading from Paris to Mumbai has made an emergency landing in central Iran. The Airbus A340 flown by the low-cost carrier Joon landed in the city of Isfahan on Wednesday. Joon said in a statement the plane, operating as flight number AF218, landed out of precaution over a malfunctioning ventilation circuit.

headlines: I can make a Liverpool-style comeback on Brexit issue: UK PM
text: UK PM Theresa May said on Wednesday that she could make a comeback on the Brexit issue in a way similar to Liverpool's victory against Barcelona in the Champions League semi-final. Liverpool's victory "shows that when everyone says it's over; that your European opposition have got you beatÂ— actually we can still secure success if everyone comes together", she added.

headlines: It took 1,500 hrs to create Priyanka Chopra's Met Gala gown
text: Luxury brand Dior, which designed Priyanka Chopra's 2019 Met Gala gown, revealed a team of 10 workers worked on the gown for around 1,500 hours. The couture gown, featuring embroideries of hand-cut feathers and silver strass, was custom made by Dior's creative director Maria Grazia Chiuri. The Met Gala is an annual fundraising event held in New York.

headlines: 'Chowkidar chor hai' not coined by me or Congress: Rahul Gandhi
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said it's not him or Congress party who came up with 'chowkidar chor hai' slogan. "I was speaking once about false promises chowkidar (PM Narendra Modi) made and while speaking I said 'chowkidar', 10-15 young people from the audience said 'chor hai'," he added. He attributed the slogan to Indian youth, farmers and labourers.

headlines: Gandhi family used INS Viraat as taxi for vacation: PM Modi
text: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday alleged that INS Viraat was used as "personal taxi" by Rajiv Gandhi for a 10-day vacation. "The Gandhi family insulted the Indian warship by using it to carry their relatives for vacation," he said. "Rajiv Gandhi's in-laws were also present. Wasn't allowing foreigners on INS Viraat playing with India's security?" he added.

headlines: Smith hits 89*, Warner 0 as Australia lose WC warm-up match
text: Australia batsmen Steve Smith and David Warner, who recently returned to the national side after serving their bans over ball-tampering, scored 89* and 0 respectively against New Zealand XI in a warm-up match on Wednesday. Will Young's century helped the Kiwis chase down the 278-run target in 47.2 overs. Returning from injury, Mitchell Starc, registered bowling figures of 5-0-14-2.

headlines: Instagram to roll out in-app option to appeal post takedowns
text: Instagram is going to start rolling out a new in-app option to let users request a review of taken-down content, as per a media briefing in the US. To ensure thorough inspection, appeals will be sent to a different reviewer than the one who made the original decision. Instagram will restore posts if it realises a mistake, the platform said.
