headlines: IndiGo in process of seeking approvals to fly to China
text: Budget carrier IndiGo on Wednesday said it is in the process of securing necessary approvals for entering China. "With our existing fleet and the arrival of new A321 Neos, we... [can] serve China, Middle East and Southeast Asia," the Gurugram-based airline said. IndiGo has reportedly already received approval to fly to China's Chengdu and Guangzhou.

headlines: RBI retracts circular asking banks to declare IL&FS exposure
text: The RBI on Wednesday withdrew its April 24 circular which mandated banks to disclose their exposure to IL&FS and its group entities in their notes to financial statements. RBI had also directed lenders to reveal provisions required to be made against it. This comes after the NCLAT last week allowed banks to declare defaulting loans of IL&FS as bad loans.

headlines: Girl who lost father, brother day before Class 10 exams scores 92.4%
text: Ghaziabad's 15-year-old Tiya Singh, who lost her father and 11-year-old brother in a road accident a day before the beginning of CBSE Class 10 exams, has scored 92.4%. They had gone to buy dinner on motorcycle but were run over by a speeding truck. "After exam, she returned to perform last rites of her father and brother," Tiya's mother said.

headlines: Priyanka still hasn't called me: Bharat producer on her quitting film
text: 'Bharat' producer Atul Agnihotri, while speaking about Priyanka Chopra quitting the project, said, "Priyanka still hasn't texted me. She never spoke to me about walking out of Bharat." "It was a message I received on the set. I was like, 'It's okay...Let's now fix it'," he added. "I understand she was getting married and was in love," Atul further said.

headlines: Rape not tool to make character stronger: Actress on GoT episode
text: Actress Jessica Chastain has criticised the latest episode of 'Game of Thrones' for allegedly justifying rape. "Rape is not a tool to make a character stronger," she tweeted. The episode featured a dialogue by the character 'Sansa' wherein she says she'd have remained a "little bird" if she hadn't faced hardships, including rape.

headlines: Rape accuser had texted Karan Oberoi, 'Can we have sex?': Pooja Bedi
text: Actress Pooja Bedi, while defending actor Karan Oberoi who has been accused of raping a female astrologer, read out a message that she claimed the accuser had sent to Karan. "I'm being open...Can we have sex, without thinking about the future, emotions and anything else," she quoted the message. Pooja further said it's clear the relationship was one-sided.

headlines: Swara Bhasker to campaign for AAP's Raghav Chadha
text: Actress Swara Bhasker took to Twitter to announce she is going to campaign for AAP's Lok Sabha candidate from South Delhi constituency, Raghav Chadha, on Thursday. Earlier, Bhasker campaigned for the party's East Delhi candidate Atishi and CPI's Kanhaiya Kumar in Begusarai, Bihar. Raghav Chadha is contesting against BJP MP Ramesh Bidhuri and boxer-turned-politician Congress' Vijender Singh.

headlines: Great lineup but sadly on paper only: Mallya on RCB finishing last
text: Fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya, former owner of Royal Challengers Bangalore, has said that the team has "a great lineup but sadly on paper only". "Devastated with the wooden spoon," he further said referring to RCB finishing last on the IPL 2019 points table. RCB finished last on the table with five victories from 14 matches.

headlines: Privacy can't be a luxury, must be available to all: Google CEO
text: Google CEO Sundar Pichai, in a New York Times article, wrote, "Privacy cannot be a luxury good offered only to people who can afford to buy premium products and services." "Privacy must be equally available to everyone in the world," Pichai said, adding, "We're also working hard to challenge the assumption that products need more data to be more helpful."

headlines: Rahul Gandhi lookalike puts on 20 kg to not look like Rahul Gandhi
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi's lookalike Prashant Sethi has revealed he has put on 20 kg and changed his hairstyle to not look like him. "I don't wish to be known as a lookalike of Rahul Gandhi. Of course...he's a national leader and I respect him, but I'm a BJP supporter and I favour PM Narendra Modi," the Surat-based businessman added.

headlines: Woman delivers stillborn after doctors don't attend her in time
text: A woman delivered a stillborn baby on the floor of the district hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich after allegedly not being attended to by the staff in time. "Woman's family was late in bringing her to hospital...Baby was born dead because they were late. The baby came out before we could shift her to labour room," a doctor said.

headlines: Alwar gangrape survivor alleges police told her to come after polls
text: The family of 18-year-old woman who was allegedly gangraped in Rajasthan's Alwar on April 26, has claimed the police kept them waiting for a week citing "election workload". On being informed the suspects were trying to extort them over the crime's video, the now-suspended SHO allegedly said, "we'll add it in the FIR if they upload it on social media."

headlines: Man wearing Donald Trump mask robs shops in Australia
text: A man was caught on camera robbing shops in Australia while wearing a Donald Trump mask. The man broke into a shopping centre early on Sunday morning by smashing a glass door, according to a statement by the police. He then smashed the glass display windows of a jewellery shop and an electronic store before stealing watches and other items.

headlines: Prince Harry, Meghan Markle reveal name of their first child
text: UK's Prince Harry and wife Meghan Markle have named their first child Archie Harrison Mountbatten-Windsor, the couple said on their Instagram account. The name was announced after Queen Elizabeth II met her eighth great-grandchild for the first time at the Windsor Castle on Wednesday. Earlier in the day, the couple made their first public appearance with their son.

headlines: Pak's ex-PM Sharif takes part in roadshow as he returns to jail
text: Pakistan's former PM Nawaz Sharif took part in a roadshow as he returned to jail after the six-week bail granted to him ended on Tuesday. Sharif surrendered at the Kot Lakhpat jail in Lahore, where he was accompanied by a procession of his supporters. Pakistan's Supreme Court had refused to extend the bail granted to Sharif for his medical treatment.

headlines: CIA warns activist Saudi Arabia may target him: Report
text: Palestinian-born activist Iyad el-Baghdadi has claimed that he was taken to a secure location in Norway after the US' intelligence agency CIA warned about a possible threat from Saudi Arabia, the Guardian claimed. El-Baghdadi is a vocal critic of Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman. "If they don't want to kill me, then I'm not doing my job," he tweeted.

headlines: Father not bidding for Jet: Goyal's daughter after UK man's claim
text: After British entrepreneur Jason Unsworth claimed he submitted a bid for Jet Airways with five others including Founder Naresh Goyal, his daughter Namrata called it "completely misleading and mischievous". "I'm Goyal's daughter and this is to clarify that he's not part of any consortium," she tweeted. Goyal had said he hoped that a successful bidder will emerge by May 10.

headlines: Don't vote for development but national security: Amit Shah
text: BJP President Amit Shah on Wednesday said, "Don't vote for development works BJP candidate Bidyut Baran Mahto did in Jamshedpur, vote for him because PM Narendra Modi made the country's border secure." Targeting Congress, Shah said they were upset after the airstrikes. "Everybody was celebrating but there was widespread hopelessness in Pakistan and in the Congress camp," Shah added.

headlines: If Cong maligns my image, then I'll question ex-PM: PM Modi
text: Referring to his remark on late PM Rajiv Gandhi, PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said, "If Congress can do anything to malign [my] image, then I'll question ex-PM too." "India would want answers for Bhopal Gas Tragedy, 1984 anti-Sikh riots...if they abuse present PM," he added. He accused "so-called" liberals and intellectuals of not speaking when current PM gets abused.

headlines: PM Modi's acche din are over, bure din starting: Mayawati
text: BSP chief Mayawati on Wednesday said PM Narendra Modi won't win the elections and his "acche din are over and bure din have started". She further said, "PM is doing everything to break the SP-BSP alliance but voters must remain aware." "We've not forged this alliance just to oust [PM Modi] but also his disciple Yogi Adityanath," Mayawati added.

headlines: $40M worth bitcoins stolen from 4th largest crypto exchange
text: Cryptocurrency exchange Binance has revealed hackers stole over 7,000 bitcoins worth around $40 million in a single transaction on May 7. It said the affected cryptocurrency wallet contained 2% of total bitcoins that it holds, adding, "All our other wallets are secure and unharmed." Binance is presently world's fourth-largest cryptocurrency exchange, as per coinmarketcap.com data for past 30 days.

headlines: No choice or Tesla would die: CEO Musk on working 90 hours a week
text: Billionaire Elon Musk, responding to a Twitter user's query if he works around 80-90 hours per week, said, "In recent years, hours were much higher...But no choice or Tesla would die." "Don't recommend though...bad for health and happiness," the Tesla Co-founder and CEO further wrote. Musk had earlier said people can change the world by working 80 hours a week.

headlines: New Zealand bill aims for zero carbon emissions by 2050
text: A bill was introduced in New Zealand's Parliament that aims to reduce greenhouse gases, except biogenic methane, to net zero by 2050. It aims for 10% reduction of biogenic methane till 2030 from 2017 levels and 24%-47% provisional reduction by 2050. "This...makes a start on tackling climate change because...alternative is...catastrophic cost of doing nothing,Â” the country's PM Jacinda Ardern said.

headlines: Chinese trade officials coming to US to make a deal: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump has said Chinese trade officials, led by Vice-Premier Liu He, will come to Washington to "make a deal". "We'll see but I'm very happy with...$100 billion a year in tariffs filling US coffers...not good for China!" he added. The US recently announced tariffs on $200 billion Chinese imports would more than double on Friday.

headlines: Zee denies rumours, says audit by Deloitte in progress
text: Zee Entertainment Enterprises has said audit of its financial statements by Deloitte was "very much in progress", refuting rumours about auditor concerns. The audited books will be considered for approval in the board meeting on May 27, it added. Promoters led by Subhash Chandra are currently looking to sell 50% of their stake in the company to reduce debt.

headlines: MRPL to operate plant at 50% capacity due to water shortage
text: Mangalore Refinery and Petrochemicals (MRPL) has said it will operate its refinery at about 50% capacity from Thursday due to "acute shortage" of water in Netravati river in absence of summer showers. The refinery added it is maximising sewage water to sustain operations "to an extent possible". MRPL will meet all commitments for fuel supply despite the shutdown, it said.

headlines: Rise Above The Rest with Louis Philippe
text: In a world filled with predictable formats to success, only a visionary leader creates impact and leaves a mark of greatness. A discerning leader invests a lot of thought behind every decision, including his sartorial choices that help make an impact. Louis Philippe promises to give the finest, most luxuriant products created with superior craftsmanship, truly worthy of a leader.

headlines: 1st rule of Fight Club...: US girl gets full marks for 1-line essay
text: A US college student scored full marks in an essay by quoting the iconic dialogue of the movie 'Fight Club'. Allison Garrett decided to write on 'Fight Club' in an assignment that required students to review a movie they had seen, and only wrote one line, "The first rule of fight club is: you do not talk about fight club."

headlines: French school enrols 15 sheep as it faces closure over less students
text: A school in France's CrÃªts en Belledonne village has enrolled 15 sheep amid concerns that some classes may shut down due to the falling number of students. The pupils' parents got the sheep enrolled in a symbolic move after they were told that one of the classes would be closed as the number of students fell from 266 to 261.

headlines: He'd never do it: Actor Sudhanshu on rape claims against Karan Oberoi
text: Defending actor Karan Oberoi, who was accused of raping a female astrologer, singer-actor Sudhanshu Pandey said, "[W]e know, he would never do this." "He doesn't smoke or drink and never parties....and among us, Karan was the most chivalrous," he added. Sudhanshu, who was earlier in a band with Karan, further said he has never seen the actor mistreat women.

headlines: Crossed all limits: Sushma on Mamata's 'slap of democracy' remark
text: External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj on Tuesday tweeted, "Mamataji, you have crossed all limits today. You are the chief minister of a state while Modiji is the prime minister of the country." It came after West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said she wanted to give PM Narendra Modi a "tight slap of democracy". PM Modi had accused TMC of extortion.

headlines: "Modi Modi yes papa," Rashtriya Janata Dal pens poem on PM Modi
text: The Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) on Wednesday shared a poem on PM Narendra Modi saying that in the future, the children of "Modi bhakts" will learn this poem. "Modi Modi yes papa...Any development? No papa...Farmer happy? No papa...Women safe? No papa...10 crore job? No papa...15 lakhs? No papa...Only jumla? Ha ha ha," the RJD tweeted.

headlines: Mumbai Police share video of Liverpool goal to promote road safety
text: Mumbai Police today used reference of Liverpool defender Trent Alexander-Arnold's trickery in the semi-final, which helped his side score their fourth goal to knock Barcelona out of Champions League, to promote road safety. "Be it the road to a final, or way back home...being distracted cost dear even to the mightiest. It can cost you dearly too," Mumbai Police wrote.

headlines: 3 on life support die due to power cut at TN govt hospital: Relatives
text: Three patients who were on life support at the Government Rajaji Hospital in Tamil Nadu's Madurai died due to lack of oxygen supply when the hospital faced power outage, their relatives claimed. The relatives said that the deaths were due to the ventilators not functioning. The hospital, however, said that the patients died of natural causes.

headlines: 55-yr-old Mumbai doctor held for allegedly raping 21-yr-old actress
text: A 55-year-old Mumbai doctor has been arrested for allegedly raping a 21-year-old model and actress after they came into contact while she was working in a serial. The police told the doctor rented a house in Versova for the woman. The complainant said the doctor took some pictures of her and used them to blackmail her against approaching the police.

headlines: 170 terrorists killed in Balakot strike, claims Italian journalist
text: Italian journalist Francesca Marino has claimed around 130-170 Jaish-e-Mohammed terrorists were killed in IAF airstrikes on Pakistan's Balakot at 3:30 am, February 26. She added Pakistan Army reached the spot around 6 am and took the injured to a nearby camp, where around 45 terrorists are still being treated. Those killed reportedly included 11 trainers in bomb-making and weapons training.

headlines: Trump lost $1 bn over a decade, avoided paying taxes for 8 yrs: NYT
text: US President Donald Trump's businesses, mainly casinos, hotels and apartment buildings, lost $1.17 billion from 1985 to 1994, according to The New York Times. Trump lost so much money that he was able to avoid paying income taxes for eight of the 10 years, the newspaper added. Trump reportedly posted losses of over $250 million in both 1990 and 1991.

headlines: Some things better left incomplete: AndhaDhun maker on sequel
text: Director Sriram Raghavan has said that there will be no sequel to his comedy-thriller film 'AndhaDhun'. "Kuch cheezein adhuri hi hone se poori hoti hai (some things are better left incomplete)," the director added, explaining his decision. The film, which saw Ayushmann Khurrana, Radhika Apte and Tabu in lead roles, released in October last year.

headlines: Ex-Miss World Manushi to make B'wood debut in Akshay's film: Report
text: Miss World 2017 Manushi Chhillar will reportedly make her acting debut opposite Akshay Kumar in an upcoming period-drama film which will see the actor play the role of Indian king Prithviraj Chauhan. Manushi will portray one of Prithviraj Chauhan's wives Sanyukta in the forthcoming film, as per reports. Directed by Chandraprakash Dwivedi, shooting for the film will commence this year.

headlines: Avatar sequel's release pushed to 2021, 12 yrs post 1st film
text: The producers of the upcoming sequel to the 2009 fantasy science-fiction film 'Avatar' have postponed its release to December 17, 2021, twelve years after the first film. The release dates of the third, fourth and fifth instalments of the film franchise have also been delayed as a result of this move. 'Avatar 2' was originally scheduled to release next year.

headlines: Cong wants full freedom for those insulting India: PM Modi
text: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday alleged that by promising to revoke sedition law and Armed Forces Special Powers Act (AFSPA), "Congress wants 'tukde-tukde' gang, who insulted India...be given full freedom." "They're openly talking about freedom for stone-pelters and terrorism supporters," he added. The PM also said this promise will take away the security of army personnel posted in sensitive areas.

headlines: My inspiration, friend, brother, legend: Hardik on pic with Dhoni
text: MI all-rounder Hardik Pandya took to Twitter on Wednesday to share a picture of himself shaking hands with CSK captain MS Dhoni following the IPL 2019 Qualifier 1, which MI won by six wickets. "My inspiration, my friend, my brother, my legend," Hardik captioned the picture. MI have now won four consecutive matches against CSK.

headlines: Kejriwal not such a big leader that BJP needs to bother: Gambhir
text: After Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal accused the BJP for attack on him, BJP's East Delhi candidate Gautam Gambhir has said the AAP chief is not such a big leader that BJP needs to think about him. After being slapped during a roadshow on Saturday, Kejriwal said, "Delhi's the only place where CM's security is in hands of an opposition party".

headlines: Velocity defeat Trailblazers despite losing 5 wickets for 0 runs
text: Mithali Raj-led Velocity defeated Smriti Mandhana-led Trailblazers by three wickets despite going from 111/2 to 111/7 during their run chase of 113 runs in the Women's T20 Challenge's second match. Trailblazers spinner Deepti Sharma registered bowling figures of 4-0-14-4, while Velocity's Danielle Wyatt top-scored with 46 runs off 35 balls. Velocity will next face Supernovas on May 9.

headlines: Apple may open its 1st India retail store in Mumbai: Report
text: Apple has reportedly zeroed in on several upscale locations in Mumbai to open its first retail store in the country. The iPhone maker reportedly plans to make a final decision in the next few weeks. Earlier, Apple was unable to open India retail stores as it didn't meet certain local sourcing norms set by the government, the report added.

headlines: Mumbai's Wadhwani AI to receive $2 million Google grant
text: Mumbai-based Wadhwani Institute for AI is among 20 organisations that will share $25-million grants from Google.org under Google AI Impact Challenge. Wadhwani AI will receive $2 million to create technologies that will help reduce crop losses in cotton farming via integrated pest management. Grantees will go to San Francisco next week for a six-month programme run by Google Developers Launchpad.

headlines: Google Assistant drops need to say 'Hey Google' repeatedly
text: Google, in its 2019 I/O developers conference, announced its AI-based Assistant is now up to 10 times faster, adding it no longer requires users to repeatedly say 'Hey Google' to perform multiple tasks. Google has also added new Assistant shortcuts for health, finance, food and ridesharing. Users will now be able to directly order food or book cabs via Assistant.

headlines: 'Google Map for scientists' by IITians' startup helps spot diseases
text: Biotech startup Elucidata has made a cloud-based data analytics platform 'Polly' to help reduce time to find life-saving drugs. "We're a Google Map for scientists to help them detect diseases," IIT Delhi alumnus and Co-founder Swetabh Pathak said, adding, "[We] help reduce drug discovery timeline by a month...sometimes more". Pathak co-founded Elucidata along with IIT Bombay alumnus Abhishek Jha.

headlines: Uber rival Lyft posts $1.14 billion loss in Q1 after IPO
text: Uber's US rival Lyft has posted net loss of nearly $1.14 billion in its first quarterly financial reports since going public in March. Further, Lyft posted revenue of $776 million, displaying revenue growth compared to $397.2 million in the first quarter of 2018. "We anticipate 2019 will be our peak loss year", nearly seven-year-old Lyft's CFO Brian Roberts said.

headlines: RCom resolution professional asks for 13-month exclusion
text: Anil Ambani's Reliance Communications (RCom) has, through the resolution professional, sought 13-month exclusion in its insolvency process. The professional sought exclusion from April 30, 2018 to May 30, 2019 as the initial proceedings were stayed by the NCLAT and Supreme Court. The IBC allows 270 days to complete resolution, which has already passed for RCom if the exclusion isn't granted.

headlines: OnePlus 7 Pro set to launch with Android Q beta
text: OnePlus has announced that OnePlus 6/6T users are eligible to download the latest Android Q beta release starting today while it will be available for OnePlus 7 Pro on May 14. Notably, Android Q Beta will allow users to experience the latest technologies, including the new gesture-based navigation, Dark Theme and privacy enhancements which contribute to a burden-less experience.

headlines: Cockroach Challenge in which people put cockroach on face goes viral
text: 'Cockroach Challenge' that dares people to post a selfie on social media with a cockroach on their face has gone viral. According to reports, the challenge was started by a Myanmar teenager and has spread to other countries including the Philippines and Indonesia. Some participants put multiple cockroaches on their face and some even put it in their mouth.

headlines: It takes a village: Robert shares pic of entire Avengers cast & crew
text: Hollywood actor Robert Downey Jr on Wednesday took to Instagram to share a picture of the entire cast and crew of 'Avengers: Infinity War' and 'Avengers: Endgame'. "Infinity war / Endgame cast and crew fully assembled... #TeamStark #thankyou Where's #waldo? It takes a village," he wrote. Robert can be seen posing with a doll representing the character 'Rocket Raccoon'.

headlines: Knocked chairs, got stepped on: Lilly on meeting Deepika at Met Gala
text: YouTuber Lilly Singh took to social media to share a picture with Deepika Padukone from the 2019 Met Gala. "Knocked over 6 chairs with my dress, got stepped on by 16 people and got a cramp...to find my sister [Deepika] and give her a hug," Lilly wrote. While Lilly wore a Moschino gown, Deepika sported a dress by Zac Posen.

headlines: Anupam Kher walks out of shop as man asks about BJP's work in 5 yrs
text: Anupam Kher, while campaigning for his wife and Chandigarh BJP candidate Kirron Kher walked out of a shop when the shopkeeper showed him BJP's 2014 manifesto. "How many promises has BJP fulfilled in last 5 years?" the shopkeeper asked. Meanwhile, Anupam tweeted the act was planned by the Opposition and he walked out on seeing a person shoot a video.

headlines: Police seen wearing saffron scarves at Congress rally, DIG denies
text: Some police personnel at Congress candidate Digvijaya Singh's roadshow in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal were seen wearing saffron scarves on Wednesday. A policewoman said, "We've been made to wear this." However, Bhopal's DIG said, "We and the organisers of the event enrolled volunteers and we've no say in as to what volunteers wear. No police personnel wore scarves of any colour."

headlines: Cong MLC posts letter in blood by Amethi man over PM's Rajiv remark
text: Congress MLC Deepak Singh shared a letter written in blood by a man from Amethi asking EC to direct PM Narendra Modi to stop insulting ex-PM Rajiv Gandhi. He wrote Amethi citizens feel the same way about people who insult Gandhi as they feel about his killers. He added he wrote after elections so his letter had no political overtones.

headlines: Qantas operates world's first zero-waste flight
text: Australia's Qantas Airways on Wednesday made the first-ever commercial flight from Sydney to Adelaide that produced no landfill waste. The flight would produce 34 kilograms of waste that will be disposed off via compost, reuse or recycling, Qantas said, adding it produces waste equivalent to 80 fully-laden Boeing 747 jumbo jets, in the process of flying 50 million passengers annually.

headlines: IÂ’m not English gentleman: Minister who knocked off officerÂ’s phone
text: A day after a video showing him knocking a phone from a government officer's hand went viral, Goa Deputy Chief Minister Vijai Sardesai said, "I am not an English gentleman like that. I am an aggressive person." Sardesai, who has apologised for the incident, added, "He is a good officer, he has done good revenue recovery. He knows my habit."

headlines: Prince Harry, Meghan Markle make 1st appearance with newborn son
text: UK's Prince Harry and his wife Meghan Markle on Wednesday made the first public appearance with their newborn son. "It's magic, it's pretty amazing. I have the two best guys in the world so I'm really happy," Meghan said. The newborn, whose name has not yet been revealed, is seventh in line to the throne.

headlines: Tata Steel says US, China have two days left to make trade deal
text: Tata Steel Europe has said demand will fall if the US-China trade war "doesnÂ’t get sorted out by the day after tomorrow". US President Donald Trump said tariffs on $200 billion of Chinese goods would increase on Friday to 25% from 10%. The US and China will hold a critical round of trade talks in Washington on Thursday and Friday.

headlines: Ajay is one of the most bankable actors in Bollywood: Tabu
text: Praising Ajay Devgn for his commitment towards his craft as an actor, actress Tabu said, "[H]e's one of the most bankable and finest actors in this industry." "He has...a brilliant career graph...he's not only a great actor but also an amazing director and producer," she added. Ajay and Tabu have worked together in several films, including 'Vijaypath' and 'Drishyam'.

headlines: Was told I'm so tall, men will look shorter than me in films: Aahana
text: Speaking about facing criticism in Bollywood, actress Aahana Kumra said, "I was told all the time that I'm so tall, all the men will look shorter in front of me." "I still get comments like 'you don't look conventional'. You get to hear that everyday," she added. Aahana further said she usually has limited choice when it comes to scripts.

headlines: Priyanka wasting time by campaigning against AAP: Kejriwal
text: Stating that Congress' Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has been conducting rallies in Delhi against AAP and in UP against BSP-SP, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said, "She is wasting her time, why doesn't she campaign in Rajasthan and Madhya Pradesh?" Kejriwal added, "Both the brother and sister are not going to those places where there is a direct fight with BJP."

headlines: Congress' Sanjay Nirupam calls PM Modi 'modern-day Aurangzeb'
text: Congress leader Sanjay Nirupam has called PM Narendra Modi a "modern-day Aurangzeb" and claimed hundreds of temples have been destroyed in Varanasi. Nirupam added, "He has succeeded in destroying those temples which the people of Banaras defended even during the peak of Aurangzeb's cruel regime...The irony is Narendra Modi talks about protecting Hindu beliefs and rights and breaks temples."

headlines: Google Lens now lets people split bills using phone camera
text: Google has added a new feature to its image recognition software Google Lens to split bills by pointing the phone's camera at the receipts. The feature, which uses an in-camera calculator, also lets users calculate tips. Further, Google has added another feature to Lens that automatically highlights the most popular dishes at a restaurant when pointed at its menu.

headlines: WhatsApp to end support for all Windows phones after December 31
text: Facebook-owned messaging platform WhatsApp has announced it is ending support for all versions of Windows Phone operating system after December 31. Facebook had previously ended support for its main app, Messenger and Instagram on April 30 for Windows phones. The move had come over Microsoft's announcement to end support for all versions of its Windows Phone in December 2019.

headlines: PUBG fails China approval, Tencent launches 'patriotic' alternative
text: Chinese gaming giant Tencent has ended the test version of PUBG in China after it failed to get approved. Tencent has launched a "patriotic" PUBG alternative, an anti-terrorism-themed game titled 'Heping Jingying' (Elite Force for Peace). PUBG Mobile, licensed from South Korean developer Krafton, failed to get China approval likely due to politics over its South Korean IP, reports said.

headlines: Gaming startup MPL buys Pune startup in first acquisition
text: Mobile e-sports platform Mobile Premier League (MPL) has acquired Pune-based Crevise Technologies, which provides technology consultation, for an undisclosed sum, marking its first acquisition. Crevise's founders Mukta Aphale and Atul Aphale will lead the 10-member MPL team from Pune. Bengaluru-based MPL was founded by IIT Kanpur alumnus Sai Srinivas Kiran G and BITS Pilani alumnus Shubh Malhotra.

headlines: Over 40 booked for assaulting Bhima Koregaon accused Milind
text: Over 40 people have been booked for allegedly assaulting Milind Ekbote, an accused in the Bhima Koregaon violence case, in Pune district. Police said, "The accused are members of a Gau raksha organisation which Ekbote's also a part of." Ekbote had filed a complaint of corruption against a gaushala run by an accused, following which the incident occurred.

headlines: Terrorist hideout busted in J&K, arms and ammunition seized
text: Following inputs about the presence of terrorists, a joint team of the Indian Army and Jammu and Kashmir police launched a search operation and busted a terrorist hideout in a village in Ganderbal district on Wednesday. Two wireless walkie-talkie sets and ammunition, including AK-47 rifles, eight detonators and two grenade pins, were recovered from the site.

headlines: Tata Global Beverages appoints Shikha Sharma as director
text: Kolkata-based Tata Global Beverages on Wednesday announced the appointment of former Axis Bank MD and CEO Shikha Sharma as an additional and independent director on its board. Sharma, who had earlier headed ICICI Prudential Life Insurance, retired from Axis Bank in December 2018. She has been appointed for a period of five years.

headlines: Driver's daughter Neha Verma tops PSEB Class 10 exam with 99.54%
text: Punjab School Education Board on Wednesday declared the results for Class 10 board exams, with as many as 85.56% students passing the exam. Ludhiana's Neha Verma, whose father is a driver and mother a homemaker, topped the exam with 99.54%. As many as three girls shared the second spot with 99.23%, while seven students came jointly third with 99.08%.

headlines: Nobody asked why I left industry: Sameera on B'wood ignoring her
text: Actress Sameera Reddy, while speaking about being ignored by Bollywood after she disappeared from the limelight following her pregnancy, said, "Nobody asked me why I left the film industry and what has happened to me." "Everyone vanished, nobody was there. But it's fine as our industry is such and I think even I moved away from them," she added.

headlines: SC rejects Cong plea against clean chits to PM Modi, Amit Shah by EC
text: The Supreme Court disposed of the petition by Congress MP Sushmita Dev, which sought action against the Election Commission's clean chit to PM Narendra Modi and BJP President Amit Shah for allegedly violating the Model Code of Conduct. Adding that Dev can file a fresh petition, the court said, "Rightly or wrongly, decision has been made. Challenge it in court."

headlines: Google to add Incognito mode to Search and Maps for privacy
text: Google CEO Sundar Pichai on Tuesday announced its Chrome browser-famed Incognito mode would be expanded to Maps and Search this year. However, Incognito mode for Maps would not disable location tracking but that activity will not be linked to the user's profile and will not affect future searches. Google recently announced support for auto-deleting location history.

headlines: 16-yr-old escapes after held captive, raped for 51 days by 3 men
text: A 16-year-old girl managed to escape from a place in Noida, where she was allegedly held captive and repeatedly raped by three youths for a period of 51 days. She identified two of the accused as her neighbours. The girl was kidnapped on March 2 and her family claimed that after her return, police initially refused to lodge the complaint.

headlines: IAF plane overshoots runway at Mumbai airport; many flights delayed
text: An Indian Air Force transport aircraft, AN-32, overran the runway while leaving from the Mumbai airport to the Yelahanka Air Force Station near Bengaluru. While no injuries have been reported in the incident, it, however, caused a delay in many flights by around half an hour. "A recovery team has arrived...the aircraft will be cleared shortly," an official said.

headlines: Man refuses security check and flees twice from B'luru metro station
text: Bengaluru Police are in search of a suspicious man who refused to be frisked at Kempegowda Metro Station for regular security check on Monday and fled. The man tried to enter the station from another entrance but failed and fled again. He had also offered money to a station housekeeping staffer for a "job".

headlines: Dressed as policemen, Maoists shoot jeweller & daughter in Bihar
text: Jeweller Raju Shah and his 20-year-old daughter were shot at by Maoists dressed as policemen in Jamui, Bihar on Tuesday. Their relative said, "Around 100-150 Naxals surrounded Raju's home while 15-20 Naxals came inside and started looting valuables. When Raju protested against this, Naxals shot at them." The two are injured and are undergoing treatment in a hospital.

headlines: Super proud of my boy who got 60% in Class 10: Mom's post goes viral
text: A Facebook post by a mother celebrating her son's 60% in CBSE Class 10 boards has gone viral. "Super proud of my boy who scored...60% in Class 10. Yes it isn't a 90, but that doesn't change how I feel," she wrote. "Chart your own course in big, wide ocean...And keep your innate goodness, curiosity and wisdom alive," she added.

headlines: Complainant in CJI sexual harassment case gave 30 proofs: Bhushan
text: Supreme Court lawyer Prashant Bhushan said the woman who accused Chief Justice Ranjan Gogoi of sexual harassment "is very dejected" as she gave a very detailed complaint backed by at least 30 pieces of documentary evidence. "It's rather strange the committee could arrive at a conclusion so quickly without examining various witnesses, without going through all the evidence," he added.

headlines: Iran partially withdraws from nuclear deal a year after US' exit
text: Iranian President Hassan Rouhani has announced that the country will stop complying with two of its commitments under the 2015 nuclear deal, a year after the US quit the pact. Iran would begin to build up its stockpiles of low enriched uranium and of heavy water. Rouhani gave the remaining signatories 60 days to meet their commitments to the deal.

headlines: Pak Christian woman cleared of blasphemy leaves country for Canada
text: Asia Bibi, the Pakistani Christian woman acquitted of blasphemy, has left the country for Canada, her lawyer said on Wednesday. Bibi's acquittal last year had sparked protests across Pakistan by hardline Islamists who had called for her execution. She had been in protective custody in Pakistan since she was released from prison.

headlines: Hamdard Pakistan offers to help after Rooh Afza shortage in India
text: Following reports of Rooh Afza shortage during Ramzan in India, Hamdard Pakistan has offered to supply the drink through Wagah border "if permitted by Indian government". Hamdard India said a shortage of herbal ingredients led to production slowdown. Unani practitioner Hakeem Hafiz Abdul Majeed founded Hamdard India, while the Pakistani one was started by his son who migrated after partition.

headlines: So much to learn from him: Tiger on working with Hrithik
text: While speaking about working with Hrithik Roshan in their upcoming action film, Tiger Shroff said, "There's so much to take back from that man." "Working with Hrithik...has been a gratifying experience. I've gotten to know so much about the craft and also so much about him," he added. Directed by Siddharth Anand, their forthcoming film will also feature Vaani Kapoor.

headlines: Vidya confirmed to star in mathematician Shakuntala Devi's biopic
text: Vidya Balan confirmed that she will be starring in the upcoming biopic based on late mathematician Shakuntala Devi, who was also known as the 'human computer'. "[I'm] thrilled to bring to life the true story of...a small-town...girl, who took the world by storm," Vidya wrote on Twitter. Scheduled to release in 2020, the film is being directed by Anu Menon.

headlines: Why get married when I'm bald now? Jokes Arjun on wedding rumours
text: Denying rumours of his marriage with Malaika Arora, Arjun Kapoor jokingly said, "[A]s an actor, why would I want to get married when I'm sporting a bald look?" "There would be pictures of it everywhere!" he added. Arjun, who shaved his head for his upcoming historical-drama film 'Panipat', further said that his personal life should be respected by the public.

headlines: Cong is a cry baby: Jaitley says MCC, free speech must co-exist
text: Claiming political parties have developed a tendency to accuse their opponents of violating the Model Code of Conduct, Finance Minister Arun Jaitley on Tuesday tweeted, "In the ongoing Lok Sabha elections, the Congress Party as the 'Cry Baby' of this election, is leading the pack." He added, "The MCC and the Right to Free Speech have to co-exist."

headlines: Rohit Bal showcases Indian heritage at Blenders Pride Fashion Tour
text: As the theme for 2019 Blenders Pride fashion Tour was to delve into the idea of 'Pride' through one's choice, style and legacy, designer Rohit Bal showcased his 'Gul-Dastah' collection as a celebration of India's rich culture and heritage. His creations were successfully brought to life by Diana Penty & Siddharth Malhotra who donned his collection as showstoppers.

headlines: Great Learning offers Data Science Program for beginners
text: Great Learning's PG Program in Data Science & Engineering is designed for professionals with less than 3 years of experience to launch their careers. The full-time classroom program has curriculum designed by industry experts and trains learners through real-world projects. PGP-DSE learners have received a 65% average salary hike through exclusive placement drives with 100+ hiring partner companies.

headlines: Rahul gives unconditional apology for 'SC said Chowkidar chor' jibe
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi has tendered an unconditional apology in a fresh affidavit to the Supreme Court for attributing 'Chowkidar chor hai' remark to the apex court, in connection with the Rafale case. This comes after the court pulled up Rahul for only expressing "regret" and not apologising in the 22-page affidavit submitted by him earlier in the contempt case.

headlines: Oh my God: Brad as photographer asks if he's dating ex-wife Jennifer
text: A video shows Hollywood actor Brad Pitt saying 'Oh my God' after a photographer asks if he's getting back with ex-wife Jennifer Aniston. "I got to ask you, everyone wants to know," the photographer can be heard saying. Brad divorced Jennifer in 2005, after which he started dating Angelina Jolie, with whom he was married to from 2014 to 2016.

headlines: Karan told me a girl was harassing him: Friend on rape allegations
text: Sonali Singh, a friend of actor Karan Oberoi who was arrested on Monday for allegedly raping a female astrologer, has said Karan told her in 2018 that a girl was harassing him. "I don't know her...All I know is...she was forcing him to marry her," Sonali added. "Karan cannot commit this crime. I know him...since a long time," said Sonali.

headlines: Assam minister Himanta, WB BJP chief Ghosh's convoy attacked
text: The convoy of West Bengal BJP chief Dilip Ghosh and Assam minister Himanta Biswa Sarma was attacked in East Midnapore district on Tuesday evening allegedly by TMC supporters. The leaders escaped unhurt but their vehicles were damaged. Himanta tweeted, "While reinforcement from CRPF has arrived, the violent TMC goons are not allowing the forces to rescue us...Scene here is scary!"

headlines: Liverpool pull off greatest CL semi comeback to knock Barcelona out
text: Liverpool produced the greatest semi-final comeback in Champions League era by overturning a three-goal first-leg deficit to beat Barcelona 4-3 on aggregate to reach the final. Forward Divock Origi and midfielder Georginio Wijnaldum scored twice each for the home side. Liverpool are the first English side to reach back-to-back Champions League finals since Manchester United in 2008 and 2009.

headlines: Selfish Afridi ruined many careers for his own good: Imran Farhat
text: Pakistani batsman Imran Farhat has said that former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi is a "selfish man" who has ruined careers of other players. Farhat further urged the players who have been "named and shamed" in Afridi's book must speak up and tell the truth about him. "He sure is talented enough to become a politician," Farhat further said.

headlines: Food delivery boy beaten up by 5 men for half hour late delivery
text: Bengaluru police have arrested five persons who had allegedly beaten up a 28-year-old online food delivery agent, accusing him of delivering food half an hour late on Saturday. The agent was found unconscious on the side of a road and taken to hospital by passers-by. Police said the accused assaulted him as they didn't want to pay for the food.

headlines: Indian technician towing Kuwait Airways plane crushed to death
text: An Indian technician working with Kuwait Airways was crushed to death at Kuwait City Airport on Monday under the wheels of an aircraft. The accident occurred when an empty Kuwait Airways Boeing 777 was being towed by Anand Ramachandran and the tow bar reportedly broke killing him on the spot. Ramachandran's body is being sent to his home state Kerala.

headlines: US woman pulls out alligator from pants at traffic stop by police
text: A woman in US' Florida pulled out a one-foot-long baby alligator from her pants after she was pulled over by police for a check. The police said after they recovered 41 three-stripe turtles from her vehicle and asked her if she has anything else, she pulled out the live alligator. The case is now being investigated by the wildlife authority.

headlines: It's just like 1st time: Nick on 2nd Met Gala with Priyanka
text: While speaking about attending his second Met Gala with his wife and actress Priyanka Chopra, American singer Nick Jonas said, "It's just like the first time, but this time we're married." Priyanka intervened and added, "We were a lot more awkward the first time." The couple was seen on the red carpet this year in outfits by Dior.

headlines: Riyan Parag is an absolute potential superstar: Dean Jones
text: Talking about Rajasthan Royals' 17-year-old all-rounder, Australian commentator Dean Jones said that he is an absolute potential superstar. "I reckon he plays amazing shots to all parts of the ground. Just like AB de Villiers he gives himself access to the ball to hit it 360 degrees," he added. Parag is the youngest cricketer to score a fifty in IPL.

headlines: Smart suitcase that warns blind users before collision made
text: International researchers have made a smart suitcase that warns blind users before a collision, aimed at helping people with visual disabilities safely navigate airport terminals independently. It sounds an alarm beginning five seconds before collision and issues a stop sound when collision is imminent. They also modified an app that gives audio navigation directions to users for airport use.

headlines: IIT team's self-cleaning glass purifies water using sunlight
text: IIT Mandi scientists have developed a self-cleaning glass that can remove bacteria and other microbes and also organic pollutants like dyes, detergent and drugs from wastewater, using only sunlight. Scientists said the glass is easy to manufacture and is also cost-efficient. "It could be used in washing machines to clean the water at the discharge point itself," they added.

headlines: New plastic material that can be recycled repeatedly made
text: Researchers at the US Department of EnergyÂ’s Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory have developed a new recyclable plastic. Called PDK, it can be disassembled at the molecular level and then reassembled into a different shape, texture, and colour repeatedly "without loss of performance or quality". The researchers believe PDK could be a good alternative to non-recyclable plastics in use today.

headlines: Stake sale process of Zee at an advanced stage: Essel Group
text: Essel Group on Tuesday said its stake sale process of Zee Entertainment Enterprises is "in steady progress" and "at an advanced stage". Zee Entertainment had last year announced that its promoters, led by Subhash Chandra, plan to sell up to 50% of their stake in the company to a strategic partner. Essel Group is selling assets to repay lenders.

headlines: US begins return of $200 million in 1MDB funds to Malaysia
text: The US has begun returning to Malaysia nearly $200 million allegedly misappropriated from scandal-hit state fund 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB). US authorities have so far returned $57 million linked to Hollywood firm Red Granite Pictures. The firm had used the funds to finance Oscar-nominated film The Wolf of Wall Street, the US Department of Justice said.

headlines: MI defeat CSK to enter IPL final for the fifth time
text: Mumbai Indians on Tuesday defeated Chennai Super Kings in the Qualifier 1 at Chennai to reach Indian Premier League final for the fifth time. Chennai Super Kings will now play the winner of the Eliminator, to be played between SunRisers Hyderabad and Delhi Capitals on Wednesday. Notably, Mumbai Indians have won three of the four IPL finals they have played.

headlines: I'd always study in makeup room: Actress with 93% in Class 10 exams
text: TV actress Ashnoor Kaur, who scored 93% in Class 10 board exams, said, "It was hectic to manage and remember dialogues with my studies." "I would always study in my makeup room and would also wake up early around 5:30 am before leaving for sets and study," she added. Ashnoor is known for appearing on the show 'Patiala Babes'.

headlines: Preity Zinta jokingly warns MS Dhoni of kidnapping his daughter Ziva
text: Kings XI Punjab owner Preity Zinta took to Twitter to share a picture of herself with Chennai Super Kings captain MS Dhoni and wrote he has many fans, including her. "But of late my loyalties are shifting to his little munchkin Ziva. Here I am telling him to be careful - I may just kidnap her," she added.

headlines: After admitting mistake, HBO removes Starbucks cup from GoT episode
text: HBO has digitally removed the stray Starbucks coffee cup that appeared in a scene of the latest episode of 'Game of Thrones'. This comes after HBO admitted that the cup was a "mistake". Reacting to the gaffe, a user had tweeted, "They took 2 years to shoot 6 episodes and left a Starbucks cup in a scene."

headlines: Sorry to let fans down, I will come back stronger: Jaydev Unadkat
text: RR fast bowler Jaydev Unadkat, who took 10 wickets in 11 IPL 2019 matches, took to Twitter to share a message for his "real fans". "I'm sorry to let you guys down with the expectations you had," he wrote. "I've been able to come back stronger from every downfall...I will do that once again. Introspect, Learn and Improve," he added.

headlines: I am just 21, it's difficult to think like a 30-year-old: Rishabh Pant
text: Wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant has said he is just 21 years old and his mind will be stronger and there'll be a lot of maturity in due course of time. "Things don't change overnight...It's difficult to think like a 30-year-old," he added. "I take any criticism positively. Finishing matches is important. I will learn to do it consistently," he further said.

headlines: Warner should open with Finch in World Cup: Mark Waugh
text: Ex-Australia national selector Mark Waugh has said David Warner should open for Australia at World Cup with captain Aaron Finch. "He's the most dangerous when...field is up and...field restrictions are in place and he can get the team off to a flyer," Waugh added. Warner batted at number three during a warm-up match against New Zealand XI on Monday.

headlines: Ending conference in 2 hrs over Barca vs Liverpool match: Google CEO
text: Addressing Google I/O 2019 keynote in California on Tuesday, Google CEO Sundar Pichai said, "We're going to keep the keynote under two hours." "It's especially because the Barcelona kicks off against Liverpool at noon...It should be an amazing game," he added. Special Augmented Reality search results, updated Google Assistant and one-tap access to privacy settings were unveiled at the keynote.

headlines: Imran Tahir becomes 4th spinner to take 300 wickets in T20 cricket
text: Chennai Super Kings leg-spinner Imran Tahir has become the fourth spinner to take 300 wickets in T20 cricket. The 40-year-old achieved the feat during the IPL 2019 Qualifier 1 against Mumbai Indians, wherein he registered bowling figures of 4-0-33-2. Sunil Narine, Shakib Al Hasan and Shahid Afridi are the other three spinners to have taken 300 T20 wickets.

headlines: Congress dumps farm loan waiver documents at ex-MP CM's home
text: Congress on Tuesday dumped loads of documents outside ex-Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan's residence as proof of 21 lakh farmers' loan waiver. Senior Congress leader Suresh Pachouri along with state minister PC Sharma and other leaders had brought cartons of documents in two vehicles to Chouhan's home. However, Chouhan rejected the Congress' claims, calling it a "bundle of lies".

headlines: Snake bites farmer in Gujarat, he bites back, both die
text: A 70-year-old farmer in Gujarat died from snakebites, however after he was bitten, he bit the snake back and killed it too. Reports said when the snake surfaced, others fled while he kept standing claiming he had caught snakes earlier. When he grabbed the snake, it bit him on face and hands after which he tried to eat the snake.

headlines: Portuguese pilot captured by Libyan forces after jet shot down
text: A Portuguese pilot was captured by the Libyan National Army (LNA) on Tuesday after it shot down his jet in Tripoli. Video posted on social media showed the pilot saying that he was hired on a civilian contract to destroy roads and bridges. This comes amid the ongoing offensive in Libya between the LNA and the UN-backed government.

headlines: Money raised from note ban given to 15 people by PM: Rahul
text: Addressing an election rally in Jharkhand's Chaibasa, Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi of giving away money raised after demonetisation to "15 people" (industrialists) of the country. Rahul further said that in the last five years, PM Modi left "chowkidari" and started "chori". The 48-year-old added that poor people do not need a "chowkidar".

headlines: Wanted to give PM tight slap of democracy: Mamata Banerjee
text: Trinamool Congress supremo Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday said she wanted to give PM Narendra Modi "tight slap of democracy". "Money doesn't matter to me. That's why when PM Modi...accused [TMC] of being tolabaaz (toll collector), I wanted to give him a tight slap of democracy," she added. Mamata further said she never came across a lying PM like PM Modi.

headlines: Don't know if Kejriwal is CM or 'dharna mantri': UP CM Yogi
text: Addressing a poll rally in Delhi, Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath took a dig at Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal saying it's difficult to understand if he's a Chief Minister or a "dharna mantri". He added whenever a development scheme comes to Delhi, Kejriwal sits on a "dharna". He asked, "Is it appropriate for a CM to sit on a protest?"

headlines: Piramal, Canadian pension fund set up $600 mn energy trust
text: Ajay Piramal-led Piramal Enterprises on Tuesday said it has signed a pact with Canada Pension Plan Investment Board (CPPIB) to co-sponsor a $600-million Infrastructure Investment Trust (InvIT) focused on renewable energy. CPPIB will initially contribute $360 million to the fund with Piramal adding $90 million. The remaining amount will be raised from other investors, the Mumbai-based company said.

headlines: It'll be dignified: Mental Hai Kya makers on clash with Super 30
text: Issuing a clarification on their decision to postpone their film's release, the makers of upcoming Kangana Ranaut starrer 'Mental Hai Kya' wrote, "We've...been advised to shift the release...purely for business prospects." Addressing the clash in release dates with Hrithik Roshan's 'Super 30', they further said, "[W]e did everything in our purview...to ensure... it will be a dignified release."

headlines: PM Modi's remark against Rajiv Gandhi didn't violate model code: EC
text: Election Commission has disposed off the complaint against PM Narendra Modi over 'Corrupt no. 1' remark against ex-Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi. "Prima facie...we didn't figure out any literal violation of MCC as given in Election Commission instructions," the EC said. "[Rajiv Gandhi] was termed 'Mr. Clean' by his courtiers...but his life ended as 'Corrupt No. 1'," PM Modi had said.

headlines: Destroy them like suicide bombers: Afridi on orders for India matches
text: Talking about India-Pakistan rivalry in his book, former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi said that their orders for India matches were simple: "Go and destroy them, almost like a suicide bomber does. Let nothing remain unresolved, untried or undecided." "We used to take on everyone, pick a fight (a panga) with anyone who got in the way," he further said.

headlines: Indian publishers made me an old man, I wasn't born in 1975: Afridi
text: Ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi has blamed Indian publishers of his book 'Game Changer' for confusion in his age, saying they made him an old man and that he wasn't born in 1975. Afridi added the publishers realised their mistake and the e-copies of the book have his real age. The book's co-author WS Khan added Afridi was born in 1977.

headlines: Family wants to kill us: 19-yr-old in relation with SC boy moves court
text: A 19-year-old law student named Priyanka Shete, in a relationship with her coursemate for three years, a boy from the Scheduled Caste, approached the Bombay High Court alleging her family is threatening to kill them. "I ran away from house...I wasn't getting help from the police," Priyanka said. The Bombay HC on Tuesday directed police to ensure the couple's safety.

headlines: Obama used his race to convince PM Modi on Paris deal: Ex-aide
text: US' ex-President Barack Obama had used his race and personal chemistry to convince PM Narendra Modi to get India on board the Paris climate deal, Ben Rhodes, Obama's former aide said. Rhodes added that when PM Modi raised concerns over India's energy needs, Obama had said in response, "I'm black...I know what it's like to be in an unfair system".

headlines: After 165 in Pollachi, 160 arrested from rave party in Mahabalipuram
text: After 165 youngsters were caught at an illegal rave party in Tamil Nadu's Pollachi, 160 people, including a foreign national and seven women, were arrested from a rave party at a three-star resort at Mahabalipuram. The participants were in the age group of 18 to 28, police said. Police seized liquor bottles, LSD stamps and MDMA tablets among others.

headlines: Heat wave claims 3 lives in Andhra, 433 diagnosed with heatstroke
text: Since the last week, three deaths have been officially recorded in Andhra Pradesh as a result of heatstroke, as per Andhra Pradesh State Disaster Management Authority. So far, 433 persons have been diagnosed with heatstroke in the state, with 179 of them from Kadapa. The government has set up 47,250 temporary shelters for hawkers and NREGA workers.

headlines: He's a great man, I love him: Pamela Anderson visits Assange in jail
text: Actress Pamela Anderson, who is rumoured to be dating WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange, met him in prison on Tuesday in the UK. "He's a good man, he is an incredible person. I love him, I can't imagine what he has been going through," Anderson said about Assange who has been jailed for 50 weeks for skipping bail in 2012.

headlines: US warns India against tariffs over scrapping of trade benefits
text: US Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross has warned that retaliatory tariffs by India in response to the US' planned withdrawal of some trade privileges won't be "appropriate" under WTO rules. "So the American companies are showing...a very cooperative attitude towards 'Make in India' and the other programmes. But there's a limit to how far the discriminatory behaviour can go," Ross added.

headlines: Pooja Hegde's team denies her involvement in drunk driving row
text: Actress Pooja Hegde's team denied reports that suggested her car was seized by Hyderabad Police after her manager was caught driving it while he was drunk. Earlier, reports suggested that Pooja was present in the car along with her manager and team when the incident occurred. A team-member stated that Pooja wasn't in Hyderabad when the incident allegedly took place.

headlines: Nushrat denies reports of not wanting to work with Kartik
text: Nushrat Bharucha, who has worked with Kartik Aaryan in four films, has denied reports stating she's not keen on working with him. "IÂ’m more than happy to work with him...We have grown with these films... we'll never forget the experience we have had together," she added. Nushrat further said her bond with Kartik remains intact, despite having different career graphs.

headlines: NCP alleges Election Commission being 'swayed' by PM Modi
text: The NCP on Tuesday alleged that the Election Commission is being "swayed" by PM Narendra Modi. The party's comment came after the Supreme Court dismissed a review petition filed by 21 opposition parties seeking verification of 50% EVMs and VVPAT machines during general elections votes' counting. "The NCP is trying to ensure people repose faith in...democracy," NCP's Nawab Malik said.

headlines: Unsure on Galaxy Fold shipping, will cancel US pre-orders: Samsung
text: Samsung on Tuesday said it cannot confirm the shipping dates for its $1,980 foldable device Galaxy Fold. It further apologised to US customers who had pre-booked the device, adding that their orders will automatically be cancelled if the device doesn't ship by May 31, unless informed otherwise. Samsung had delayed Fold after several issues with its screen were reported.

headlines: Amazon faces 7 lawsuits by pregnant workers it fired: Report
text: Amazon faced at least seven lawsuits from pregnant warehouse workers, fired over the last eight years, alleging wrongful termination, a CNET investigation has found. The women alleged the company failed to accommodate requests including longer bathroom breaks. "It is absolutely not true that Amazon would fire any employee for being pregnant," a company spokeswoman said.

headlines: 5 faint while cleaning septic tank in Delhi, 2 die later
text: Two labourers died and three were hospitalised on Tuesday after they fainted while cleaning a septic tank at a house in Prem Nagar area of Delhi's Rohini. All the five labourers were admitted to a hospital where two of them died during treatment. A case of negligence will be registered and necessary action will be taken, a police official said.

headlines: India's oil imports from Iran plunged 57% in April: Report
text: India's oil imports from Iran fell about 57% year-on-year in April, according to data seen by Reuters. India, Iran's top oil client after China, shipped in about 277,600 barrels per day (bpd) of oil from the OPEC member in April. The country was allowed to load Iranian oil till April under a six-month waiver from sanctions imposed by the US.

headlines: Saudi Aramco to supply additional oil to India: Reports
text: Saudi Arabia's state-run oil producer Saudi Aramco will reportedly supply additional crude to oil-starved Asian refiners including those in India for June loading. The shipments will be in addition to those scheduled under long-term crude contracts, reports said. Refiners in India are set to receive as much as 200,000 barrels per day of incremental supplies under the plan, reports added.

headlines: GoT makers admit Starbucks cup in episode was a mistake
text: The Twitter account of 'Game of Thrones' has tweeted that the Starbucks coffee cup that appeared on the latest episode was a "mistake". Bernie Caulfield, the show's executive producer said in an interview, "I can't believe (it). Our onset prop people...are so on it a 1,000 percent." "We're sorry! Westeros was the first place to actually have Starbucks," Bernie joked.

headlines: Got drunk once & told Vicky that I'll sleep in the garden: Taapsee
text: Actress Taapsee Pannu, during her appearance on 'BFFs With Vogue', revealed that she and actor Vicky Kaushal got drunk during the wrap-up party of their film 'Manmarziyaan' and added, "We were lying in the garden. I was like, 'This is where I will sleep tonight'." "I had to say 'Main jaa raha hoon' to convince her to leave," Vicky added.

headlines: I do not know much about Balakot airstrikes: Sunny Deol
text: Actor Sunny Deol, the Bharatiya Janata Party's candidate from Punjab's Gurdaspur constituency in the 2019 Lok Sabha elections, has said he "does not know much" about the Balakot airstrikes. "I am here to serve people, if I win maybe I will have an opinion, right now I don't have one," he added.

headlines: False rape charge can ruin a man's life: Pooja defends Karan Oberoi
text: Actress Pooja Bedi has defended actor Karan Oberoi, who has been accused of raping a female astrologer and said, "A false charge can ruin a man's life." "Karan...is one of the...most decent [person]," she added. "I am a huge supporter of women's right but we also have to stand up for men's rights," Pooja further said.

headlines: What should Dhoni do if he wins toss? IIT asks students in exam
text: The ICC took to Twitter to share a picture of a question paper of IIT Madras, wherein it was asked what should CSK captain MS Dhoni do if he wins the toss in IPL Qualifier. The question included multiple references to dew factor and humidity. "Shout out to Professor Vignesh...for making exams relevant to important, real-life issues!" ICC wrote.

headlines: My right to get copy of report: Woman who accused CJI of harassment
text: The former woman Supreme Court staffer who accused Chief Justice of India Ranjan Gogoi of sexual harassment has said that it's her right to have a copy of the Supreme Court inquiry order giving a clean chit to CJI in the case. The inquiry found "no substance" in her claims. The complainant added that she was "shocked" at the outcome.

headlines: Missing Kashmiri student from Noida is in Pak jail, claims father
text: A 23-year-old Kashmiri student at a private college in Noida, who had gone missing last year, is lodged in a Pakistani jail, claimed his father. Syed Bashid Hasan's father said that another person from their district who was recently released from a Pakistani jail met him there. Hasan was arrested by Pakistani authorities after his visa expired, his father added.

headlines: UN honours Indian killed in crash for sacrifice in line of duty
text: Shikha Garg, a United Nations consultant killed in the Ethiopian Airlines plane crash, was honoured by the world body for sacrifice in the line of duty. Garg was travelling on the plane to attend a United Nations Environment Programme meeting in Nairobi. Indian police officer Jitender Kumar who was martyred during a UN mission in Congo was also honoured.

headlines: Images suggest China may be building its largest aircraft carrier
text: China may be building its third and largest aircraft carrier, according to satellite images analysed by the US-based Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS). China's first two carriers can carry only up to 25 aircraft. "Once completed, it will outclass any warship from any Asian country, including India and Japan," a security analyst said.

headlines: SpaceX's billionaire moon tourist says has no money, selling art
text: Japanese billionaire Yusaku Maezawa, who was chosen as SpaceX's first private passenger to fly around the moon, said he plans to sell paintings worth millions of dollars. "Yes, I have no money. I spend it so quickly," he tweeted when asked about his finances. Maezawa, online fashion retailer Zozo's Founder, had made a large down payment for the moon flight.

headlines: IndiGo talking to Airbus to buy yet-to-be-released A321 XLR jets
text: IndiGo is in talks with Airbus to add new planes including its long-distance A321neo LR and the yet-to-be-released A321 XLR. "When we order, we'll order in bulk for sure. I can't give you a tentative number, but it'll be large," CEO Ronojoy Dutta said. "We'd like to be one of the biggest, largest, profitable airlines in the world," he added.

headlines: Britannia broke rules by not reporting Wadia's arrest: InGovern
text: Proxy advisory firm InGovern has alleged that Britannia Industries violated listing regulations by not reporting the arrest of its promoter and director Ness Wadia. It added that Wadia must step down in the interest of larger corporate governance. Wadia received a two-year suspended prison term for possessing drugs during a skiing holiday in March in Japan.

headlines: BJP wanted to destroy my party, says SBSP's OP Rajbhar
text: Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party (SBSP) President Om Prakash Rajbhar said that the BJP wanted to "destroy" his party by "pressurising" him to contest the general elections on their symbol. He also accused the BJP of postponing the decision on seat-sharing in Uttar Pradesh. Rajbhar said that the BJP didn't respect its allies even though it "used them to win elections".

headlines: PM will be defeated because of his ego like Duryodhana: Priyanka
text: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi compared PM Narendra Modi to Mahabharata's Duryodhana saying that the PM will be defeated in the general polls because of his "ego" like Duryodhana. Addressing a rally, she added that the Mahabharata is proof that the country has never forgiven "ahankaar" (ego). She alleged that BJP tries to divert the country's attention to hide their failures.

headlines: South India got step-motherly treatment under BJP: Tharoor
text: Congress' Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday alleged that under BJP, South India received "step-motherly" treatment and said, "South (India) will play an instrumental role in deciding the political fate of the country." "Particularly in the context of voting out [BJP]," Tharoor added. He further said Rahul Gandhi's decision to contest from Wayanad has sent a message of equal concern for all.

headlines: EC notice to AAP's Manish Sisodia for tweet on Atishi's caste
text: Election Commission on Tuesday issued a notice to Delhi's Deputy CM Manish Sisodia over his tweet about AAP's East Delhi candidate Atishi's caste leading to violation of the model code. "I'm sad that Congress and BJP are spreading lies about...Atishi...Atishi Singh is her full name. She's a Rajputani. A pure Kshatrani," he tweeted. "She'll win and make history," Sisodia added.

headlines: ThereÂ’s a way back for everyone: Vaughan post Hales' WC snub
text: After England opener Alex Hales was dropped from the World Cup squad for failing drug test twice, ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said it will be a long road back for Hales especially as a person. "I believe there's a way back for everyone...He needs good people around him to get his life back on track," he added.

headlines: Indian students' team comes 2nd at Microsoft competition
text: Manav Rachna Institute of Research and Studies, Faridabad students' team placed second at Microsoft's 2019 Imagine Cup World Championship. It created a smart automated anti-pollution and drug delivery mask named Caeli, specifically designed for asthmatic and chronic respiratory patients. A US team that created cloud-powered, non-invasive blood glucose monitoring method for diabetic patients, won.

headlines: Apple features Warren Buffett in its 1st game since 2008
text: Apple has featured the world's fourth-richest person, Berkshire Hathaway CEO Warren Buffett, in its first game since 2008. Apple released the 'Warren Buffett's Paper Wizard' game after CEO Tim Cook had recently jokingly suggested it in a short film in Berkshire Hathaway's annual meeting. Notably, Warren Buffett had worked as a paper delivery boy when he was 13 years old.

headlines: Smart bag creator accused of using crowdfunded money for self
text: The US Federal Trade Commission took legal action against a US startup and its founder Douglas Monahan for allegedly using part of the over $800,000 raised via four crowdfunding campaigns for products like smart backpacks, for "personal expenses". Consumers complained on crowdfunding platforms on not receiving promised products. Monahan allegedly threatened consumers contacting him with concerns.

headlines: 2,000-year-old Buddhist pillar found in Andhra village
text: A 2,000-year-old Buddhist pillar, believed to be dating back to 1st century AD, was found in Chandaluru village of Andhra Pradesh's Prakasam district. According to a Buddhist Scholar, village locals came across the pillar while carrying out work for building a Shiva temple. He said the pillar is carved on Palnadu limestone, which is typically used in Buddhist structures.

headlines: P&G renames Merck as Procter & Gamble Health
text: Global personal healthcare firm Procter & Gamble (P&G) on Tuesday announced it has renamed India-listed pharmaceutical firm Merck as Procter & Gamble Health. This follows the completion of P&G's global acquisition of the consumer health business of Germany-based Merck KGaA in December 2018. Procter & Gamble Health will be part of P&G's personal healthcare business unit led by Uta Kemmerich-Keil.

headlines: India absolutely needed as permanent UNSC member: France
text: Seeking to enlarge UN Security Council, France said countries like India, Germany, Brazil, and Japan are "absolutely needed" as permanent members of a reformed UNSC to better reflect the world as it is. Currently, US, France, Russia, UK and China are the council's permanent members. France had also backed India's case to list Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Masood Azhar as global terrorist.

headlines: Stop objectifying women: Divya to troll commenting on her body parts
text: Actress Divya Dutta responded to an Instagram troll who commented on her photo, "Big t*ts." "Yes man!! Big t*ts!! So?? Shut up. N stop being obsessed n objectifying women...there's so much more to a woman," she wrote. Speaking about the incident, Divya said, "Respecting women and treating them right is something that needs to be taught at home and school."

headlines: 200 DU teachers condemn PM Modi's remarks against Rajiv Gandhi
text: Over 200 Delhi University teachers have issued a statement condemning PM Narendra Modi for his 'Rajiv Gandhi's life ended as corrupt number 1' remark. "Narendra Modi has lowered the dignity of the [PM] office...by making derogatory and untrue remarks about the late Rajivji," the statement read. The former PM had lost his life in an attack by a suicide bomber.

headlines: If Lord Ram's name not taken in India, will it be taken in Pak? Shah
text: BJP President Amit Shah on Tuesday alleged that West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee isn't allowing people to chant 'Jai Shri Ram' in the state. He questioned, "If Shri Ram's name is not taken in India, will it be chanted in Pakistan?" He further said, "Lord Ram is part of the culture of India...Can anybody stop people from taking his name?"

headlines: Shivraj doesn't take bath after campaigning for Pragya: Digvijaya
text: Congress candidate from Bhopal, Digvijaya Singh has remarked that former Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh doesn't care to take a bath after campaigning for BJP leader Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur. Digvijaya claimed that Shivraj remarked that he has to take a bath every time he takes Digvijaya's name. Digvijaya Singh and Sadhvi Pragya are contesting from Bhopal against each other.

headlines: Woman removed from NZ flight for refusing to watch safety video
text: A woman was removed from an Air New Zealand flight after she allegedly refused to watch the safety video before takeoff. The airline contacted the police who escorted her from the flight. "The [woman] will receive an infringement notice under Civil Aviation Authority rules relating to the use of a cellphone," a police spokesperson said.

headlines: MNS workers make man do sit-ups for criticising Raj Thackeray
text: A video has emerged wherein MNS workers are seen forcing a man to do 25 sit-ups and apologise with folded hands for allegedly criticising party chief Raj Thackeray on a WhatsApp group. The man is holding his ears while performing the sit-ups and says, "The message was posted by mistake from my mobile, but I'm apologising to Raj Thackeray Sahab."

headlines: Floating restaurant where U'khand CM held meeting overturns in water
text: 'Floating Marina' restaurant where Uttarakhand CM Trivendra Singh Rawat held a Cabinet meeting in May 2018, overturned in the state's Tehri lake on Tuesday. The floating restaurant was defunct for the past few months. Tehri's District Magistrate said, "Our officials are at the spot, we will see why it happened."

headlines: Bengaluru driver creates mini garden inside bus; pictures viral
text: The pictures of a mini garden created by a Bengaluru bus driver in his vehicle to spread awareness about keeping the environment green have gone viral. Narayanappa said he has been doing it for last 3 to 4 years. His mini garden consists of several potted plants which are placed on the dashboard and on a shelf behind his seat.

headlines: Nick compares his Met Gala look to GoT's Littlefinger, shares pic
text: American singer Nick Jonas took to Instagram to share a collage comparing his look from the 2019 Met Gala to the character of Lord Petyr Baelish, also known as Littlefinger from 'Game Of Thrones'. "Sansa...We must protect the vale," Nick captioned the image. Sansa's character in the television show is played by Nick's sister-in-law Sophie Turner.

headlines: PM Modi took money out from your wallets: Rahul Gandhi
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday accused PM Narendra Modi of "stealing" money from the common people. "Check your wallets, you'll know that most of your money has been taken by PM Modi," he said while addressing a rally in Jharkhand. Gandhi also alleged that PM Modi has stripped "Adivasis of Jharkhand of their jal (water), jungle and zameen (land)".

headlines: Fight polls in 'Bofors accused' PM's name: PM Modi to Cong
text: Referring to former PM Rajiv Gandhi, PM Narendra Modi on Monday challenged Congress to fight the Lok Sabha polls in the name of the "Bofors accused" Prime Minister. He further accused Congress of patronising corrupt leaders in the Opposition. This comes days after PM Modi said that Rajiv Gandhi's life ended as "corrupt number one".

headlines: 252 FIRs registered for model code violation in Delhi: EC
text: The Election Commission on Monday said that by far it has registered 252 FIRs in connection with violation of Model Code of Conduct in Delhi. Delhi Chief Electoral Officer Ranbir Singh said that 28 of these were against AAP, 36 were against BJP and 20 were against Congress. A record of 1,412 kg of narcotics has also been seized.

headlines: Cong brought Shehzadi after Shehzada failed: Yogi Adityanath
text: Addressing a rally in Delhi, Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said that the Congress brought in their "Shehzadi" (Priyanka Gandhi) after their "Shehzada" (Congress President Rahul Gandhi) "failed". Referring to the viral video of children abusing PM Narendra Modi in front of Priyanka, he added she was teaching abuses to "innocent" children of Amethi. Yogi said Congress has "failed completely".

headlines: Discussed national politics with KCR, not PM candidate: Vijayan
text: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan met his Telangana counterpart K Chandrashekar Rao and said that they discussed the national political scenario and there was no discussion about the PM candidate. He added that the regional parties will play a prominent role at the Centre after the general elections as KCR thinks both the BJP and Congress may not get a majority.

headlines: Countdown has begun for Modi, 5 horrible yrs to end: Khurshid
text: Amid the ongoing Lok Sabha polls, Congress leader Salman Khurshid on Tuesday tweeted, "The countdown has begun for (Prime Minister Narendra) Modi: 16 days and no more. Soon rats will jump the sinking ship. Five horrible years to end." Khurshid added, "Jai Ho Democracy. He did his best to debase and defile it but truth prevails. We shall overcome!"

headlines: Sadhvi not guilty but scapegoat of saffron terror: Shivraj
text: BJP leader Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Tuesday said that his party feels that Malegaon blast accused Sadhvi Pragya Thakur is not guilty but was made a scapegoat of "saffron terror". "She was tortured and despite being a woman she was beaten up mercilessly," he added. Shivraj further said that Congress coined the term "saffron terror".

headlines: Facebook fact-checkers to review Instagram posts in test
text: Photo and video-sharing platform Instagram said it will test-use fact-checking partners contracted by its parent firm Facebook. Instagram said the posts that are deemed false won't be removed, but they won't appear in the Explore tab or in the hashtag result pages. It added it is also considering adding pop-ups that appear when people search for misinformation, like anti-vaccine content.

headlines: India, US to engage regularly to resolve trade issues
