text: The government has said India and the US will "engage regularly" to resolve outstanding trade issues after Commerce Minister Suresh Prabhu met US Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross on Monday. The two countries have been engaged in disputes over tariffs and price caps on imported US medical devices. Ross earlier said he planned to hold discussions on India's new e-commerce rules.

headlines: 2 top ISC Class 12 exam with 100%, Class 10 toppers score 99.6%
text: As many as 98.54% students passed the ICSE Class 10 exam, while 96.52% passed the ISC Class 12 exam, as per the results declared by CISCE today. Dewang Kumar Agarwal from Kolkata and Vibha Swaminathan from Bengaluru topped ISC Class 12 exam with 100%. Mumbai's Juhi Rupesh Kajaria and Muktsar's Manhar Bansal jointly topped Class 10 exam with 99.60%.

headlines: Hollywood actor wears half-tuxedo, half-dress at Met Gala 2019
text: Hollywood actor Michael Urie wore a half-tuxedo and half-dress outfit by American designer Christian Siriano at the Met Gala 2019 red carpet. He also sported two different make-up looks, with one side of his face featuring a bearded look and another side showing a feminine look. Other celebrities who attended the event included Kim Kardashian, Cardi B and Priyanka Chopra.

headlines: PM has good figure, happy if his chest becomes 112 inches: Mamata
text: Taking a jibe at Prime Minister Narendra Modi during a rally in Kotulpur, West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said, "He has a good figure, I want it to get better; I will be happy if 56-inch becomes 112-inch." Mamata added, "I want everybody to be in good health." She also called PM Modi cunning.

headlines: SC rejects review plea by 21 parties to verify more votes in 60 secs
text: The Supreme Court on Tuesday took 60 seconds to dismiss a review petition filed by 21 opposition parties seeking verification of 50% EVMs and VVPAT machines during the counting of Lok Sabha election votes on May 23. After the first phase of voting, many EVMs were found defective, the petition claimed. "We won't review our order," CJI Ranjan Gogoi said.

headlines: EVMs, VVPATs found in Bihar hotel during polling; probe ordered
text: During phase 5 of Lok Sabha elections on Monday, 2 balloting units, a control unit and 2 VVPAT machines were found from a hotel in Bihar's Muzaffarpur. Officials said those were reserved machines given to a sector officer for use in case any faulty machines needed to be replaced. Meanwhile, a probe has been ordered into the incident.

headlines: Congress' Digvijaya Singh performs puja in Computer Baba's presence
text: Congress party's Bhopal candidate for Lok Sabha elections, Digvijaya Singh, along with his wife, performed a 'puja' in Computer Baba's presence on Tuesday. Computer Baba, who was granted the status of a minister in BJP government, was already at the venue camping along with thousands of sadhus to undertake Hat Yog. Later, he was also seen campaigning for Singh.

headlines: Odisha CM donates one year's salary in wake of Cyclone Fani
text: Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik on Monday donated one year's salary to the Chief Minister's relief fund in the wake of Cyclone Fani. Patnaik said, "For me and my government, every life is precious and we have worked with that goal." The Odisha government has been praised by the UN agency for disaster reduction for its handling of Cyclone Fani.

headlines: Woman gangraped by 5 men, husband thrashed in Alwar
text: A woman was allegedly gangraped and thrashed while her husband was beaten up by five men in Alwar, Rajasthan. The police said, "The accused made a video recording of the incident and threatened the victims that they would kill them if they complained to the police." The couple remembered three of the accused's names from the latter's conversation among themselves.

headlines: Protest outside SC over procedure used in CJI case, Sec 144 imposed
text: Section 144 was imposed outside the Supreme Court following a protest by lawyers and women activists against the procedure adopted to deal with sexual harassment case against Chief Justice Ranjan Gogoi. This comes after the CJI was given a clean chit by the three-judge in-house inquiry panel, stating it found "no substance" in the allegations by an ex-top court employee.

headlines: Swaraj asks for report on abduction of Indian sailors in Nigeria
text: Stating that she has seen news reports claiming five Indian sailors were abducted by pirates in Nigeria, External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj on Monday tweeted, "I am asking Indian High Commissioner to take this up at the highest level with Government of Nigeria". Family members of the sailors said they have been unable to contact them for several days.

headlines: CBI finds house where Unnao rape survivor was allegedly held captive
text: The CBI, which is investigating the 2017 Unnao gangrape case in which BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar is the accused, has claimed they "traced the house in Kanpur where the girl was kept after kidnapping". Allegedly, the girl was gangraped by three men between June 11 and 20 after the MLA raped her at his residence on June 4.

headlines: Female protestor throws egg at Australian Prime Minister's head
text: A female protestor hit Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison on the head with an egg while he was campaigning ahead of the nation's general election. The egg bounced on Morrison's head but did not break. Morrison praised his security staff for intervening quickly and described the egg thrower, who was arrested immediately after the incident, as "cowardly".

headlines: Iran to resume nuclear programme after US exit from nuclear deal
text: Iran will restart part of its nuclear programme it had halted under the 2015 nuclear deal with other world powers, the state media said quoting sources. Iran's move is in response to the US' withdrawal from the deal last year. Iran had agreed to restrictions on its nuclear programme in exchange for the lifting of economic sanctions under the deal.

headlines: We can't ensure cheaper oil sales to India after Iran sanctions: US
text: US Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross on Monday said that his country cannot ensure the sale of oil to India at cheaper rates to compensate for the loss of Iranian oil. "Oil is owned by private people, so the government cannot force people to make concessionary prices," Ross said. The latest US sanctions barred India from importing oil from Iran.

headlines: Arjun Kapoor backs homemade food delivery startup FoodCloud
text: Bollywood actor Arjun Kapoor has co-invested an undisclosed amount in homemade food delivery startup FoodCloud that aims to empower women. "My aim...is to contribute towards a larger societal purpose...of empowering the homemakers to contribute towards their family income," the 33-year-old actor said. Delhi-based FoodCloud was founded by Sanjhi Rajgarhia, Shamit Khemka and Vedant Kanoi.

headlines: In photos: Red carpet looks from Met Gala 2019
text: Kendall Jenner and Kylie Jenner were seen wearing coordinated feathered gowns by Versace on the 2019 Met Gala red carpet. While Kim Kardashian wore a latex Thierry Mugler dress with beading that looked like water droplets, Katy Perry was seen in a chandelier costume by Moschino. Ezra Miller, who was dressed in Burberry, had five eyes painted on his face.

headlines: Deepika to star opposite Salman in 'Kick' sequel: Reports
text: Actress Deepika Padukone will star opposite Salman Khan in the upcoming sequel to the 2014 film 'Kick', as per reports. The film's producer Sajid Nadiadwala is working on developing Deepika's role in the forthcoming film, reports further suggested. The first installation of the film series saw actress Jacqueline Fernandez in a lead role with Salman.

headlines: Ranveer to stay with Kapil Dev in Delhi to prepare for '83: Reports
text: To prepare for his role as former Indian cricket team captain Kapil Dev in the upcoming film '83, Ranveer Singh will reportedly live with the former cricketer for 10 days in Delhi. The actor will train with Kapil Dev before going to London for the film's shooting. The film is based on India's first victory at the Cricket World Cup.

headlines: He took a U-turn: Rahul blames Kejriwal for alliance failure
text: Congress chief Rahul Gandhi on Monday blamed Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal for the failure in Congress-AAP alliance talks. Rahul said, "I clearly told Kejriwalji we've to win all seven seats in Delhi. You contest on four seats and we will contest on three. First, he agreed...But then he brought in talks on Haryana and Punjab. Then he took a U-turn."

headlines: Delhi to have 17 women-staffed polling booths
text: As many as 17 polling booths for Lok Sabha polls in Delhi will be staffed only by women, Delhi Chief Electoral Officer Ranbir Singh said on Monday. "The purpose of this exercise is to showcase their abilities and engender a sense of woman empowerment," he added. A total of 13,819 polling stations will be established at 2,696 locations in Delhi.

headlines: 11yrs, hell of a journey: Ramsey cries on Arsenal farewell
text: Arsenal midfielder Aaron Ramsey, who spent eleven years at the London-based club broke down at his farewell, saying, "It's been hell of a journey, 11 years of my life, so much of happened in that." Ramsey, who scored 64 goals for Arsenal and will join Juventus, was given a guard of honour by his teammates after the match against Brighton.

headlines: Microsoft unveils new platform to make elections more secure
text: Microsoft has unveiled a free open-source software development kit, 'ElectionGuard', which can be incorporated into voting systems, aimed at making voting more secure. It enables end-to-end election verification, opens results to third-party organisations for validation, and lets voters confirm their votes were correctly counted. It'll be ready for testing during the 2020 elections in the US.

headlines: Delhi HC quashes domestic violence FIR against Somnath Bharti
text: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday quashed an FIR filed against Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA Somnath Bharti in a domestic violence case by his wife Lipika Mitra. In 2015, the Delhi Police lodged the FIR against Bharti on charges of abusing his wife. The court quashed the criminal case, noting Bharti and his wife are living happily together.

headlines: Lady Gaga changes 4 outfits in front of photographers at Met Gala
text: Singer Lady Gaga changed four different outfits and stripped down in front of photographers at Met Gala 2019 red carpet. She walked in a fuchsia pink gown by Brandon Maxwell, changed to a black gown and a hot pink body fitted gown, before finally stripping down to just black lingerie. She reportedly also wore diamond jewellery worth nearly $2 million.

headlines: Video fabricated: EC denies Irani's claim of booth capturing by Cong
text: After BJP's candidate from Amethi Smriti Irani alleged that Congress President Rahul Gandhi was ensuring booth capturing in the constituency, the Election Commission dismissed her allegations. Referring to the video shared by Irani of an elderly woman claiming she was forcibly made to vote for Congress, the EC said the charges in the video clip were "fabricated" and "baseless".

headlines: Take money from other parties but vote for AAP: Kejriwal
text: During a roadshow in support of AAP South Delhi candidate Raghav Chadha on Monday, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal asked voters not to refuse money given to them by other political parties but still vote for AAP. Kejriwal said, "What will you do? Take it, don't deny it, but vote for jhadu."

headlines: It took Pak leader to remember Tipu Sultan: Tharoor praises Pak PM
text: After Pakistan PM Imran Khan tweeted about Tipu Sultan on his death anniversary, Congress leader Shashi Tharoor praised Khan's "genuine and far-reaching" interest in the "shared history of the Indian subcontinent". "It is disappointing, though, that it took a Pakistani leader to remember a great Indian hero on his punyathithi," the Congress leader added.

headlines: Eduwhere to conduct free mock test for CLAT - UG 2019 & Law aspirants
text: Eduwhere is conducting Free National Mock Test for CLAT and Law aspirants on May 13th and 14th, 2019. The Artificial Intelligence-based test analyses attempt at every question and provides detailed analysis and national rank among enrolled students. Conducted by National Law University Odisha this year, CLAT is the entrance exam for India's 21 NLUs and around 45 private law universities.

headlines: Guj trader, who gifted cars to staff, to remove illegal road he built
text: Gujarat-based diamond trader Savji Dholakia, who's known for gifting cars to his employees, has said he'll remove a 'kutcha' road built by him across the dry Narmada river to reach his farmhouse. This comes after government officials visited the spot on learning about the illegal structure. Meanwhile, Dholakia said his only intention was to enable people to reach the island.

headlines: Army-run J&K schools get 100% pass percentage in Class 10 results
text: Indian Army-run Goodwill Schools in Jammu and Kashmir secured a 100% pass percentage in the CBSE Class 10 results, announced on Monday. Under Project Sadbhavana, the Northern Command is currently running over 40 Army Goodwill Schools, of which 3 are affiliated to CBSE, and provides education to nearly 15,000 students. The schools have around 1,000 teaching and non-teaching staff.

headlines: BSF officer, 2 civilians injured in ceasefire violation by Pak
text: A BSF sub-inspector and two civilians were injured after the Pakistan Army violated ceasefire along the Line of Control (LoC) in Mankote and Krishna Ghati sectors of Poonch district, Jammu and Kashmir. This was the second day in a row that Pakistan violated ceasefire, officials said. Several schools in Poonch and Rajouri districts were closed following the continuous ceasefire violations.

headlines: Private jet leaving Las Vegas crashes in Mexico; 13 killed
text: A private jet flying from Las Vegas crashed in Mexico, killing all 13 on board. The wreckage of the aircraft, identified by Canada's Bombardier as a Challenger 601, was found via aerial surveillance in the northern municipality of Ocampo. The passengers had reportedly been to a boxing match between Mexican boxer Saul "Canelo" Alvarez and US' Daniel Jacobs.

headlines: Drunk US man kills 8 people, police arrest bartender who served him
text: Police in US' Texas last week arrested a 27-year-old bartender for serving drinks to a man, who went on to kill his ex-wife and seven others at her home during a party in 2017. The man was shot dead by police on the scene. The bartender is charged with violating Texas Alcoholic Beverage Code titled 'Sale to Certain Persons'.

headlines: Jared Leto carries replica of his own head on Met Gala red carpet
text: Hollywood actor Jared Leto was seen carrying a prosthetic replica of his own head as an accessory on the 2019 Met Gala red carpet. The actor wore a red high-neck gown with shoulder pads and a jewel-encrusted body chain by luxury fashion house Gucci. Gucci's Fall/Winter 2018 runway show saw models walking the ramp with similar prosthetic heads as accessories.

headlines: Yami Gautam joins cast of Ayushmann and Bhumi starrer 'Bala'
text: Actress Yami Gautam has joined the cast of the upcoming Ayushmann Khurrana and Bhumi Pednekar starrer 'Bala'. "I'm excited to be working on [the film]. It's a great script, and a relevant concept and an amazing team working on it," Yami said. Directed by Amar Kaushik, shooting for the film commenced this week.

headlines: You say Jai Shri Ram, did you build even 1 Ram temple: Mamata to PM
text: After PM Narendra Modi dared WB CM Mamata Banerjee to imprison him for chanting 'Jai Shri Ram', Mamata responded, "You BJP babu, you say 'Jai Shri Ram' but have you built even one Ram temple in your tenure?" She added, "At the time of elections, Ramchandra becomes your party agent." Earlier, Mamata confronted people chanting the slogan at her convoy.

headlines: 260 workers in Hyderabad analysed users' FB posts since 2014: Report
text: Over the past year, up to 260 Facebook contract workers in Hyderabad analysed millions of Facebook photos, status updates and other content posted since 2014, Reuters reported. The team labels both publicly and privately shared posts to help Facebook develop new features. The posts are reportedly categorised as per five "dimensions" including subject of the post, occasion and author's intention.

headlines: Had given resignation from UP Cabinet on Apr 13: OP Rajbhar
text: Suheldev Bharatiya Samaj Party (SBSP) chief Om Prakash Rajbhar on Monday claimed that he resigned as minister from the Uttar Pradesh Cabinet on April 13, but it's yet to be accepted. "I have nothing to do with the government now," he added. Rajbhar further alleged that BJP was misusing his party's name and flag in the election campaign.

headlines: Hemant Karkare never used 'Hindu terror' phrase: Maha CM
text: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis on Monday said that former Mumbai ATS chief Hemant Karkare, who was martyred in 26/11 terror attack, never used the phrase "Hindu terror". "The BJP considers Karkare a martyr not only of Maharashtra but the entire country," he added. This comes days after BJP leader Sadhvi Pragya Thakur said that Karkare died because she "cursed him".

headlines: AIADMK expels 2 party members for supporting DMK candidate
text: AIADMK on Monday expelled MC Murugesan and M Savithri for allegedly supporting DMK candidate in the by-elections in Tamil Nadu's Ottapidaram Assembly constituency. A statement was issued by AIADMK coordinator O Panneerselvam and Tamil Nadu CM K Palaniswami regarding the same. AIADMK has fielded P Mohan against DMK's MC Shanmugaiah in Ottapidaram, where by-elections will take place on May 19.

headlines: PM has lost mental balance due to lack of sleep: Baghel
text: Responding to PM Narendra Modi's remark that former PM Rajiv Gandhi's life ended as "corrupt number one", Chhattisgarh CM and Congress leader Bhupesh Baghel on Monday said that PM Modi has lost his mental balance. "Those who don't get enough sleep tend to lose their mental balance," he added. Baghel further said that PM Modi needs medical treatment.

headlines: PM Modi got no sanskar as he fled home at young age: Kharge
text: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Monday said that PM Narendra Modi did not get "sanskar (cultural grooming)" as he fled from his home at a young age. Kharge said this after PM Modi said that former PM Rajiv Gandhi's life ended as "corrupt number one". He further said that PM Modi lacked political knowledge and his remark reflected his frustration.

headlines: US-China trade war would be bad for the whole world: Buffett
text: World's fourth-richest person Warren Buffett on Monday said a trade war between the US and China would be "bad for the whole world". His statement comes after US President Donald Trump tweeted that he will raise tariffs on $200 billion worth Chinese imports. Major stock markets fell worldwide following this, which Buffett said was a "rational" response to Trump's tweet.

headlines: Found no merit in taking Jet Airways' Boeing 777s: Air India
text: Air India has decided not to pursue its plan to take five Boeing 777s from Jet Airways. "The engineering unit has done their work around the B777s and found no merit in taking them," an airline official said. The national carrier's proposal to take the aircraft was earlier discussed between Air India Chairman Ashwani Lohani and SBI Chairman Rajnish Kumar.

headlines: Why are you here, don't you have job? Kashyap to media outside clinic
text: A video of director Anurag Kashyap has surfaced online, showing him asking the media outside a doctor's clinic, "Why are you here? Don't you have a job?" He added, "Yeh koi kaam hai? Look at yourself in the mirror." A photographer posted the video and wrote, "A humble request to Anurag Kashyap on not guiding us on our jobs."

headlines: Reuters journos jailed in Myanmar for 500 days freed from prison
text: Two Reuters journalists jailed in Myanmar for breaking the country's Official Secrets Act walked free from prison on Tuesday after spending more than 500 days behind bars. The duo received a presidential pardon. Wa Lone and Kyaw Soe Oo, who revealed the massacre of 10 Muslim Rohingya men, had been convicted in September and sentenced to seven years in jail.

headlines: People give 5-stars to Delhi 'Mountain of Garbage' on Google Maps
text: Several people are locating East Delhi's Ghazipur's 'Mountain of Garbage' on Google Maps and leaving 5-star reviews, bringing its average rating to 4.1 stars. In 2018, the landfill stood at a height of 65 metres, eight metres less than the Qutub Minar. "This place has a beautiful aroma which you can only find here," one of the sarcastic reviews read.

headlines: Will tell kids how I met their father: Priyanka on pic with Nick
text: Ahead of Met Gala 2019, Priyanka Chopra shared on Instagram story a picture of herself with husband Nick Jonas from the 2017 Met Gala. "The story I'll definitely tell our future kids...How I MET your father," she wrote. Priyanka and Nick, who weren't dating each other at that time, had made their first public appearance together at Met Gala 2017.

headlines: Mandhana's Trailblazers beat Harmanpreet's Supernovas on last ball
text: Smriti Mandhana-led Trailblazers defeated Harmanpreet Kaur-led Supernovas on the last ball of the first match of Women's T20 Challenge in Jaipur on Monday. Requiring 19 runs off the last over, Supernovas' captain Harmanpreet Kaur slammed four boundaries off the first five deliveries before Lea Tahuhu got run-out off the last ball. Trailblazers will next face Velocity on Wednesday.

headlines: What are the matchups for the IPL 2019 playoffs?
text: Mumbai Indians and Chennai Super Kings finished as top two teams on the IPL 2019 points table and will play the Qualifier 1 on Tuesday. The winner will reach the final while the loser will play the winner of the Eliminator between Delhi Capitals and SunRisers Hyderabad. The winner of the Qualifier 2 will qualify for the final.

headlines: Pakistan Science Minister says Pakistan sent Hubble to space, trolled
text: Fawad Chaudhry, Pakistan's Federal Minister for Science & Technology, is being trolled online for claiming Hubble Space Telescope was sent to space by Pakistan's SUPARCO, not NASA. SUPARCO (Space and Upper Atmosphere Research Commission) is Pakistan's aeronautics and aerospace research agency. "Hubble...the biggest telescope...was sent...by SUPARCO, which is installed in a satellite," Fawad said.

headlines: Dejected: Complainant as CJI gets clean chit in harassment case
text: After Supreme Court gave CJI Ranjan Gogoi clean chit in sexual harassment case, the complainant said she was disappointed and dejected. "I feel...gross injustice has been done to me as a woman citizen of India," she added. "Today, my worst fears have come true, and all hope of justice and redress from the committee have been shattered," she further said.

headlines: I don't consider Modi PM: Mamata on refusing review meet over Fani
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has said she didn't respond to requests of PM Narendra Modi to hold a review meeting over Cyclone Fani as she doesn't consider him the Prime Minister. "I don't want to be seen with him on the same platform. I'll speak to the next PM. We can take care of cyclone damage ourselves," she added.

headlines: Grabbed people by collar, kicked them out: Burning plane air hostess
text: Recalling the crash-landing of Aeroflot passenger plane which claimed the lives of 41 people in Moscow, air hostess Tatyana Kasatkina said that she kicked the plane's door open and physically pushed passengers onto to the emergency slide. Â“Just to hurry them up I grabbed each of them by the collar from the back and kicked them," she added.

headlines: Plane struck by lightning: Pilot of Russian plane fire that killed 41
text: The pilot of the Russian Aeroflot passenger plane that caught fire on the runway while making an emergency landing at Moscow's Sheremetyevo airport on Sunday, said the aircraft lost communication and needed to switch to emergency control mode "because of lightning". He did not specify if the plane was struck directly. The incident led to the loss of 41 lives.

headlines: Deepika Padukone, Priyanka-Nick attend Met Gala 2019
text: Priyanka Chopra and her husband American singer Nick Jonas, as well as actress Deepika Padukone were seen walking the carpet at the 2019 Met Gala in New York. The theme of this year's event was 'Camp: Notes on Fashion'. While Priyanka and Nick wore outfits by Dior, Deepika was seen in a pink strapless gown by Zac Posen.

headlines: EC allows MCC relaxation for Maharashtra drought relief works
text: The Election Commission (EC) has permitted relaxation in the Model Code of Conduct (MCC) in Maharashtra for conducting drought relief works in the state. The relaxation was made after state CM Devendra Fadnavis wrote to the EC on the issue. The EC further directed that government staff involved in vote counting shouldn't accompany ministers on any tour during this period.

headlines: BJP trying to force everyone to chant Jai Shree Ram: Mamata
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee criticised the BJP and said that the party is trying to force everyone to chant 'Jai Shree Ram'. She asked, "Does Ramchandra become BJP's election agent when the election comes?" She said that the slogan of Bengal people is "Vande Mataram" and will not chant the name of "rotten [PM Narendra] Modi or rotten BJP".

headlines: IBM-backed project makes WiFi network for natural disasters
text: Project OWL, which won IBM-hosted Call for Code competition last year, has created a network of WiFi-enabled IoT devices in rubber casings to help connect victims with first responders during natural disasters. In March, they tested their devices in Puerto Rico. They hope to get their network ready in small capacity for hurricane season in America's East Coast, beginning July.

headlines: Apple overstated iPhone battery life, claims UK consumer group
text: Apple overstated its iPhones' battery life, UK consumer advocacy group 'Which?' said after conducting its own tests on nine iPhone models, all falling short of time claims. The iPhone XR battery lasted over 16 hours, while Apple claimed it would last 51% more at 25 hours, Which? found. As per the group, Nokia, Samsung and Sony underestimated their talk time.

headlines: Microsoft unveils its own blockchain service
text: Microsoft has unveiled its own fully-managed blockchain service Azure Blockchain Service that allows for consortium blockchain networks' formation, management and governance. Unrelated to cryptocurrency, it'll let businesses build applications on top of blockchain technology. Microsoft partnered with JP Morgan to make Ethereum-based open source blockchain platform Quorum its first support ledger.

headlines: UK startup turns 100 plastic bags into Bluetooth speakers
text: UK-based startup Gomi creates Bluetooth speakers using non-recyclable plastic wastes collected from local companies and residents. Each speaker is made with the equivalent of 100 plastic bags, which are melted in ovens, kneaded to form "marble dough" and then placed into moulds to be made into a speaker's shape. Gomi was founded by Tom Meades, Pawan Saunya and Rishi Gupta.

headlines: SpaceX delivers 2,500-kg supplies to International Space Station
text: Two days after its launch from Florida, the SpaceX Dragon cargo spacecraft delivered nearly 2,500 kg of research, crew supplies and hardware to the International Space Station. The spacecraft will remain attached to the space station for approximately one month. Recently, SpaceX confirmed its Crew Dragon capsule was destroyed during a test last month.

headlines: 1 million species on Earth at risk of extinction: UN Report
text: Roughly one million of an estimated eight million animal and plant species on Earth are threatened with extinction, many within decades, more than ever before in human history, a UN report found. "This loss is a direct result of human activity", the report's co-chair said. Compiled over past three years, it stressed that "transformative change" was needed to protect nature.

headlines: CBDT claims 19% rise in ITR e-filing, denies reports of dip
text: The Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) has refuted media reports which claimed that income tax e-filings dropped by more than 6.6 lakh in FY19. It further said the figures for ITRs e-filed during FY19 are "not directly comparable" with those in FY18. It also clarified that the total number of ITRs e-filed increased by nearly 19% in FY19.

headlines: Students who missed NEET due to train delay to get another chance
text: Karnataka students, who missed NEET on Sunday due to a train delay will get another chance, Human Resource Development Minister Prakash Javadekar said. National Testing Agency has proposed to hold the examination for the affected candidates on May 20. Around 500 candidates missed the exam after their train reached Bengaluru hours after the scheduled reporting time for NEET.

headlines: NEET 2019 exam for cyclone-hit Odisha to take place on May 20
text: The national medical entrance exam, NEET, which was postponed for candidates in Odisha amid Cyclone Fani, will now be held on May 20, the National Testing Agency has announced. The exam will be held from 10 am to 1 pm. Earlier, the exam was scheduled to take place in Odisha on May 5 along with rest of India.

headlines: Royal couple Prince Harry, Meghan Markle become parents to baby boy
text: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex, Prince Harry and his wife Meghan Markle, became parents to a baby boy on Monday, the Buckingham Palace announced. The newborn is the first mixed-race baby in the British monarchyÂ’s modern history and the seventh in line to the throne. The duo had announced in October that they were expecting their first child.

headlines: Bombay HC declares 14-yr-old girl & 52-yr-old man's marriage valid
text: The Bombay High Court has declared a now 56-year-old advocate's marriage with a 14-year-old girl valid after she expressed willingness to live with him after turning 18 in September 2018. The advocate filed a petition to quash a rape case against him for marrying the minor. "As she's married...no one in society would accept her as wife," the court said.

headlines: Kylie saved up, built her own business : Kris on 'self-made' title
text: Kris Jenner, while defending her daughter Kylie Jenner for being named the youngest 'self-made billionaire' by Forbes in 2018, said, "She saved up her own money and built this amazing business." "My girls, you can say that certain things have been handed to them. But it takes a lot of work to do what they're all doing," she added.

headlines: Fans claim spotting Starbucks cup in GoT episode, share pic
text: Many Twitter users have claimed they spotted a Starbucks coffee cup in the latest episode of 'Game of Thrones'. "Starbucks has opened up a branch in #Winterfell," a user commented. "Before a long day of conquering Westeros and defeating Cersei, Dany needs a morning Starbucks," read another comment. Users also joked the makers missed it because of the dark lighting.

headlines: Karan Oberoi filmed female astrologer during rape for money: Police
text: Actor Karan Oberoi has been arrested for allegedly raping a female astrologer on the pretext of marriage. "Oberoi not only raped the woman and filmed the act but also demanded money...threatening to release the video if she didn't pay up," said police. He is known for being part of 'A Band of Boys' and working in 'Jassi Jaisi Koi Nahin'.

headlines: Ranbir has a secret account, showed me how Instagram works: Katrina
text: Actress Katrina Kaif has revealed that her rumoured ex-boyfriend Ranbir Kapoor has a secret Instagram account to stalk people. "And, Ranbir, by the way, was the person who showed me how Instagram works," she added. She further denied having a secret account of herself on the platform. The actress had officially joined Instagram in 2017.

headlines: Rayudu, Shankar end IPL 2019 league stage with identical numbers
text: In a coincidence, Chennai Super Kings batsman Ambati Rayudu and SunRisers Hyderabad all-rounder Vijay Shankar ended IPL 2019 league stage with identical batting statistics. Both the players scored 219 runs in 14 matches. Notably, Shankar was included in India's squad for the upcoming World Cup as a number four batting probable instead of Rayudu.

headlines: Arrogant MP failed to appear in Amethi on voting day: Smriti on Rahul
text: Union Minister Smriti Irani, BJP's candidate from Uttar Pradesh's Amethi Lok Sabha constituency, questioned Congress President and rival candidate Rahul Gandhi's absence from Amethi on the voting day on Monday. Calling Rahul a "missing MP", Irani added that he has become "arrogant". "Since morning, their people are saying Rahul is coming to Amethi. What's the point of lying?" she added.

headlines: Proud that daughter got 82% in Class 10 despite challenges: Irani
text: Union Minister Smriti Irani today took to Twitter to reveal her daughter Zoish Irani scored 82% marks in CBSE Class 10 exams. "Proud that inspite of challenges she has done well. Way to go Zoe," Irani wrote. Last week, Irani revealed that her son Zohr scored 91% marks in Class 12 exams and won bronze medal in World Kempo Championships.

headlines: 4th richest man Buffett says Tesla can't sell insurance, Musk responds
text: After world's fourth-richest person Warren Buffett claimed carmaker Tesla cannot sell insurance, Tesla's CEO Elon Musk responded with a series of tweets on Sunday. In his first tweet, Musk urged users to buy Tesla Model 3, claiming it's cheaper than a Honda Accord. "Also 1000 times more fun!" and "That's a direct quote from Warren Buffett," his next tweets read.

headlines: I used to study for 4-5 hours daily: CBSE Class 10 joint-topper Taru
text: Jaipur's Taru Jain, one of the 13 students who secured the highest total of 499 out of 500 in CBSE Class 10 exams, said that she used to study for 4-5 hours daily. "I feel really good. I want to pursue Economics (Hons) from Delhi University. I had support from parents, teachers and principal," she further said.

headlines: No error in marks of 22 students who committed suicide: Telangana Board
text: The Telangana State Board of Intermediate Education (TSBIE) has said the 22 student suicide cases were not linked with any error in the publication of results. As many as 22 students committed suicide and three attempted to take extreme steps allegedly after results were announced. "Nobody failed because of error in the results as they were rectified instantly," TSBIE said.

headlines: Little thing is absolutely to die for: Prince Harry on son's birth
text: Speaking to the media following the birth of his son, Duke of Sussex Prince Harry said that it has been the most amazing experience he could ever have possibly imagined. "How any woman does what they do is beyond comprehension," he added. "This little thing is absolutely to-die-for, so IÂ’m just over the moon," he further said.

headlines: I'll never hesitate to fly on 737 MAX: Buffett on crashes killing 346
text: World's fourth-richest person, Warren Buffett, has said that he will "never hesitate even for a second to fly on a Boeing 737 MAX plane" which was involved in two crashes that claimed the lives of 346 people. He was responding to a question about damage to Boeing's reputation after the crashes. "Planes have never been so safe," Buffett added.

headlines: Black women hold all 3 major US beauty pageant titles for 1st time
text: For the first time in history, black women are holding all three major US pageant titles simultaneously. Last week, Cheslie Kryst won the Miss USA contest, and Kaliegh Garris won Miss Teen USA. They joined 25-year-old Nia Franklin who was crowned as the 2019 Miss America in September last year.

headlines: Rahul seeks PM's apology for using Army's 'blood' in politics
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi demanded an apology from PM Narendra Modi for allegedly politicising the armed forces and using the "blood" of the Army while campaigning. Addressing a rally in Haryana, Rahul added the Army doesn't belong to PM Modi but to the "mothers of Bhiwani". He said servicemen give up their life for India, not for PM's "political strategy".

headlines: PM Modi's remark on Rajiv Gandhi despicable: Punjab CM Singh
text: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh criticised PM Narendra Modi for his 'Corrupt Number 1' remark on former PM Rajiv Gandhi saying his remark was "outrightly despicable". He added PM Modi must be "ashamed" of making such comments on a person who "sacrificed his life" for the country. Singh said the PM had lost "sense of decency" in his election campaign.

headlines: 56-inch boxer punched his coach LK Advani in face: Rahul
text: Addressing a rally in Haryana, Congress President Rahul Gandhi criticised PM Narendra Modi saying that a "boxer with 56-inch chest" was elected during 2014 elections to fight the country's problems but he instead punched his own "coach" BJP veteran, LK Advani. Rahul added he also punched small shopkeepers, farmers, afterwards. Rahul said PM Modi "failed" to fight unemployment and corruption.

headlines: Shiv Sena condemns slap attack on Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal
text: The Shiv Sena in its mouthpiece 'Saamana' condemned the slap attack on Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal saying that there shouldn't be any lapse in his security. It added, "Such acts of insulting senior politicians in the country should be stopped at once." It said "political and social intolerance is growing" in India and such acts won't solve the problems.

headlines: Infibeam terminates EY affiliated auditor citing data breach
text: E-commerce conglomerate Infibeam Avenues' board recommended terminating services of its auditor SRBC & Co, affiliated to Ernst & Young. Infibeam alleged that the auditor had shared its Unpublished Price Sensitive Information (UPSI) with personal email accounts of their team and third party multiple times. However, the auditor refuted all allegations and said it is open to regulatory inspection.

headlines: Dust storms may have blown some of Mars' water: Scientists
text: Dust storms like the one which put NASA's Opportunity rover out of commission may have blown away some of Mars' ancient water, scientists suggested. They found that global dust storms appear to loft water vapour to higher elevations of at least 80 km above Martian surface. A scientist said water in higher parts of atmosphere blows away much easier.

headlines: Ex-bosses at French telco on trial over workers' suicides
text: French telco Orange's ex-CEO Didier Lombard, along with six other former executives, will go on trial on Monday over a series of staff suicides between 2008-2010. Prosecutors listed around 18 suicides and 13 suicide attempts by employees, including an incident where a worker stabbed himself during a meeting. Job cuts and stressful working conditions led to the suicides, prosecutors said.

headlines: SC gives clean chit to CJI Gogoi in sexual harassment case
text: The three-judge in-house Supreme Court inquiry panel dismissed the complaint of sexual harassment against CJI Ranjan Gogoi on Monday. "The...Committee has found no substance in the allegations contained in the Complaint...of a former employee of the Supreme Court of India," a notice posted on SC website said. The female employee had accused the CJI of sexually harassing her in 2018.

headlines: Bhogle clarifies after mistakenly snubbing Hardik Pandya's handshake
text: Commentator Harsha Bhogle took to Twitter to clarify after mistakenly snubbing MI all-rounder Hardik Pandya's handshake during post-match presentation on Sunday. "Was good to chat with Hardik at post-game presentation. I find him very easy to talk to. I had to turn to camera at the end and completely missed his handshake. Hope it didn't look too odd!" he wrote.

headlines: Bigbasket raises $150 mn from Mirae-Naver, Alibaba Group and others
text: Online grocery startup Bigbasket on Monday announced it has raised $150 million in fresh funding from a group of investors including South Korea-based Mirae-Naver and China's Alibaba Group. The UK government's development finance institution, CDC Group, also invested in the funding round. Last year, Alibaba became the biggest shareholder in Bigbasket after leading a $300 million funding round.

headlines: 97 students get top 3 ranks in CBSE Class 10; 57,256 get over 95%
text: As many as 97 students are the top three rank holders in CBSE Class 10th board exams with 13 students securing the first rank with 99.8%, 25 students second with 99.6% and 59 students securing the third rank with 99.4%. While 57,256 candidates scored above 95%, 2,25,143 candidates scored 90% and above. Around 18 lakh candidates appeared for the exams.

headlines: Trivandrum records highest pass percentage in both Class 10, 12 exams
text: Trivandrum is the top performing region with pass percentage of 99.85% in the CBSE Class 10 results, which were declared today. Trivandrum is followed by Chennai (99%) and Ajmer (95.89%). Interestingly, Trivandrum had emerged as the best performing region in the CBSE Class 12 results as well, with a pass percentage of 98.2%.

headlines: Brunei to not enforce laws punishing gay sex with death by stoning
text: Brunei has backtracked on enforcing laws introduced last month that would have made sex between men and adultery punishable by stoning to death. This comes amid global criticism, including boycotts and celebrity protests, over the laws which were rolled out last month. Notably, no executions have been carried out in the country since 1957.

headlines: I was surprised by the question: New Zealand PM on wedding proposal
text: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern said on Monday she was surprised when her long-time partner Clarke Gayford proposed to her recently. Adding she has no idea when their wedding will be, Ardern further said, "It was very romantic." Ardern revealed the proposal was made when they were at a "beautiful little lookout" on Mokotahi hill on the Mahia peninsula.

headlines: Install jammers at EVM strongrooms to curb tampering: Chavan
text: Maharashtra Congress President Ashok Chavan on Monday demanded installation of jammers in and around strongrooms where the Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) are stored to curb tampering with the machines. He claimed that the EVMs can be tampered using wireless networks like mobile phone towers and Wi-Fi networks. Chavan said, "These jammers should be installed during the counting process as well."

headlines: Akhilesh urges voters to vote intelligently not emotionally
text: Former Uttar Pradesh CM Akhilesh Yadav on Monday urged the voters to exercise their right to vote in the fifth phase of the Lok Sabha elections intelligently and not emotionally. He also appealed to the voters that they should play a "judgmental role in this democratic exercise". Voting is underway across 51 constituencies in seven states including Uttar Pradesh.

headlines: Priyanka takes her husband's name less, my name more: Irani
text: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Monday said that Congress' Priyanka Gandhi takes "her husband's (Robert Vadra) name less and my name more". "She (Priyanka) didn't know my name five years back, now she keeps taking my name, such an accomplishment," Irani added. Irani is contesting Lok Sabha elections from Amethi, currently represented by Priyanka's brother and Congress President Rahul Gandhi.

headlines: PM asks Mamata to put him in jail for chanting Jai Shree Ram
text: A day after three people were detained by the police for allegedly chanting 'Jai Shree Ram' during a convoy of West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, PM Narendra Modi asked Mamata to put him in jail for chanting the slogan. Addressing a rally, he added that if Mamata puts him in jail then he'll serve the "innocent" people lying in jail.

headlines: Ex-Pak captain Younis rejects PCB's offer to coach U-19 team
text: Former Pakistan captain Younis Khan has rejected the offer to coach Pakistan's U-19 team. Khan, the only Pakistan batsman to score 10,000-plus Test runs, reportedly wanted the dual role of head coach and chief selector of U-19 side, which PCB declined citing 'conflict of interest'. "The idea was to have a high-profile cricketer work with the juniors," an official said.

headlines: Online pharmacy startup Medlife buys B'luru's Myra Medicines
text: Online pharmacy startup Medlife has acquired Bengaluru-based online medicine delivery startup Myra Medicines for an undisclosed sum. Medlife will reportedly absorb Myra co-founders Faizan Aziz and Anirudh Coontoor and its 45-member team. Founded by Tushar Kumar and Prashant Singh in 2014, Bengaluru-based Medlife acquired digital healthcare platform and diagnostics startup MedLabz in January.

headlines: Dalit man beaten for eating alongside upper caste men, dies
text: A 23-year-old Dalit man succumbed to his injuries on Sunday, nine days after he was allegedly beaten up by upper caste men in Uttarakhand's Tehri district, police said. The man was allegedly assaulted for sitting on a chair and eating in front of upper caste men at a wedding reception. A case has been registered against seven people, police added.

headlines: Maoists kill man in Maha on suspicion of being police informer
text: Maoists allegedly killed a person in Gadchiroli district of Maharashtra on suspicion of him being a police informer, police said. The victim, Sudhir Sarkar, was abducted by Maoists from Bande village in Etapalli tehsil on Sunday evening. This comes a day after another man was similarly abducted from Mardhar village and murdered by Maoists.

headlines: India warns WTO about EU's proposal for new e-commerce rules
text: India has warned the World Trade Organisation (WTO) against the proposal made by the European Union to create new e-commerce rules. India said the high standards being proposed could affect the goods and services tariff rules under the WTO, impacting the country's domestic industry and job creation. Most developing countries are not ready for binding rules in e-commerce, it added.

headlines: China is a big opportunity for Sun Pharma: Founder Shanghvi
text: India's largest drugmaker Sun Pharma is looking for a partner to facilitate expansion in China. "There is a big opportunity for us [in China]," Founder Dilip Shanghvi said, adding that the company will start scaling up its China business in six to nine months. The unit is expected to contribute significantly to Sun Pharma's $4-billion overall sales within three years.

headlines: Boeing admits some 737 MAX planes had safety alert issue
text: Boeing on Sunday revealed some of its 737 MAX planes were accidentally delivered with a cockpit safety alert as an optional addition, rather than a standard feature. The planemaker added it didn't inform the US aviation regulator FAA about this for 13 months despite being aware of the situation. Boeing further insisted that the missing display represented no safety risk.

headlines: Cognizant may cut jobs as it slashes growth forecast by half
text: American IT giant Cognizant announced it is considering job cuts, after the company nearly halved its 2019 revenue expectations from the 7-9% range to around 3.6-5%. The company's headcount growth had outstripped revenue growth in the past two quarters, it said. The job cuts are most likely to hit employees working at the middle level, as per reports.

headlines: Fan asks Unadkat to join academy to learn how to bowl, he responds
text: RR pacer Jaydev Unadkat took to Twitter to respond to a cricket fan, who asked him to enrol into an academy and learn how to bowl. "Yes boss...already enrolled into one and will forever be enrolled, till the time I keep playing this game passionately. Because learning never stops....Hope you guys learnt something from hurling abuses to me," he wrote.

headlines: 13 students score 499/500 marks in CBSE Class 10th board exams
text: A total of 13 students have secured 499/500 marks in the CBSE Class 10th board exams, the results of which were announced today. While seven of these students are males, six of the students who scored 499/500 marks are females. As many as 91.1% of students passed the CBSE Class 10th board exams.

headlines: OnePlus confirms HDR10+ display for OnePlus 7 Pro ahead of launch
text: OnePlus has revealed the OnePlus 7 Pro will feature HDR10+ display, which makes the screen compatible with high resolution content from streaming services like Youtube and Netflix. HDR10+ technology produces 4000 nits of peak brightness, an increase of about 3000 nits compared to HDR10. It also delivers frame-by-frame adjustments for better representation of contrast from the HDR source content.

headlines: Siddharth said he isn't ready: Madhu on son's wedding being cancelled
text: Priyanka Chopra's mother Madhu Chopra, while speaking about her son Siddharth Chopra's wedding being called off, said, "My son Siddharth said he was not ready for marriage yet." "He explained he needed more time," she added. Madhu had earlier said that Siddharth's wedding to Ishita Kumar has been "mutually called off".

headlines: Know real from reel: Abhay shares his photoshopped and real pics
text: Actor Abhay Deol on Monday shared a collage of his photoshopped and real pictures on Instagram. He wrote, "On the right - the real deal. On the left - the photoshopped fantasy. God bless technology but know the real from the reel!" Commenting on the picture, a user wrote, "Real looks so much better than photoshop version."

headlines: 42-yr-old Australian DJ dies in Bali while helping injured friend
text: Australian DJ Adam Neat, aged 42, passed away in Bali after reportedly crashing through a glass door while trying to help an injured friend on Saturday. The female friend had fallen from the balcony of the resort they were staying at, reports added. Local police said alcohol was involved, reports further wrote.

headlines: Want to be known for who I am, not just as Mahesh's wife: Soni
text: Actress Soni Razdan has said although she's happy to be known as Mahesh Bhatt's wife or Alia Bhatt's mother, she'd like to be known for who she is. "I'm also a person, who in her own right, has gone through...odds," she added. "I've always been known as Mahesh's wife...This has always been a struggle," said Soni.

headlines: She was asleep when I hit 50: Rohit on dedicating knock to daughter
text: MI captain Rohit Sharma dedicated his fifty against KKR on Sunday to his daughter Samaira after celebrating it by rocking his bat in his arms. "My daughter has been coming here every day to watch me play, but I didn't get lot of runs earlier. It was nice to get some runs today, but she was sleeping!" he later said.

headlines: Grenade attack on Pulwama polling booth; no casualties
text: Militants on Monday hurled a grenade towards a polling station in Pulwama district of Jammu and Kashmir where polling is underway for the Anantnag Lok Sabha constituency, police officials said. There were no reports of any casualties in the blast, police officials added. They further said that security forces cordoned off the area.

headlines: Ex-BSF jawan moves SC after nomination rejected from Varanasi
text: Dismissed BSF jawan Tej Bahadur Yadav has moved Supreme Court after his nomination as Samajwadi Party candidate from Varanasi was rejected by the Election Commission (EC). Tej's nomination was rejected after EC issued a notice to him over a discrepancy in his affidavit. Yadav was dismissed from service after he released a video on quality of food served to soldiers.

headlines: Man arrives to vote after performing father's last rites in MP
text: A man in Madhya Pradesh's Chhatarpur arrived to vote after performing his father's last rites on Monday. Polling is underway for the fifth phase of Lok Sabha elections in 51 constituencies across seven states including J&K, Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, Bihar, Madhya Pradesh, Jharkhand and West Bengal. The 5th phase is smallest of all phases in terms of number of seats.

headlines: Fish adapts to pollution via genes from species 2,400km away: Study
text: Researchers in the US found that Gulf killifish were able to live in water with toxins, possibly deadly to other species, by acquiring other species' DNA. The fish population survived in the polluted Houston Ship Channel after mating with killifish species, which lived over 2,400 km away on Atlantic coast. Humans are suspected to have accidentally helped bring Atlantic killifish.

headlines: Policeman runs into burning house to drag LPG cylinders out
text: A policeman was captured dragging LPG cylinders out from a house which had caught fire in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida on Friday. "Sub Inspector Akhilesh Kumar Dixit covered his body with a blanket and entered the house, and came back with the cylinders, preventing any bigger damage," senior police officials said. Nobody was injured in the fire.

headlines: Los Angeles renames street after former President Barack Obama
text: The US city of Los Angeles has renamed a nearly 4-mile stretch of road from 'Rodeo Road' to 'President Barack Obama Boulevard', in honour of the country's first African-American President. "For every child who'll...see the name of the first Black President of our country, this boulevard will serve as a physical reminder that no dream is too big," authorities said.

headlines: BJP will form govt with support of NDA allies: Ram Madhav
text: In an interview, BJP General Secretary Ram Madhav has said that with the support of its NDA allies, the BJP will form the government at the Centre. He added, "With NDA, we'll have a comfortable majority." Madhav said that BJP will overcome the expected losses in the northern states by gaining seats in the Northeast, West Bengal and Odisha.

headlines: BJP's Arjun Singh alleges attack by TMC 'goons' in WB
text: BJP candidate from West Bengal's Barrackpore, Arjun Singh alleged that he was attacked by Trinamool Congress (TMC) "goons" during the 5th phase of Lok Sabha polls in the state. Singh said that he was attacked while he was escorting BJP supporters who were being prevented from casting their votes. Meanwhile, some locals also reportedly alleged that Singh's supporters attacked them.

headlines: Failed sapphire glass supplier for iPhone charged with fraud
text: GT Advanced Technologies and its ex-CEO Thomas Gutierrez were charged with misleading investors about the company's ability to supply "sapphire glass" for Apple's iPhones and misclassifying over $300 million-debt to Apple. In 2013, Apple agreed to give GT $578 million in four instalments for sapphire glass that met certain standards. In 2014, GT filed for bankruptcy and later exited it.

headlines: Bitcoin is like a seashell, not an investment: Warren Buffett
text: Berkshire Hathaway CEO Warren Buffett, while talking about Bitcoin said, "It doesn't do anything. It just sits there. It's like a seashell or something, and that is not an investment to me." Buffett also called Bitcoin a "gambling device", which has many frauds connected with it. However, he acknowledged that blockchain technology holds promise, adding that it didn't need Bitcoin.

headlines: US Air Force successfully shoots missiles with laser in test
text: The US Air Force in a test has successfully shot down air-launched missiles in flight with a ground-based laser system. Called the Self-Protect High Energy Laser Demonstrator (SHiELD), it's intended to eventually be mounted on an aircraft. In 2017, the US Air Force Research Lab awarded Lockheed Martin $26.3 million for design, development and production of high power fibre laser.

headlines: Rajiv Gandhi died as India's biggest mob lyncher: Shiromani Akali Dal
text: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) national spokesman Manjinder Singh Sirsa on Sunday alleged that former PM Rajiv Gandhi died as "India's biggest mob lyncher". He added that Gandhi was the only PM in the world who "organised mob lynching against a particular community". Sirsa further said that PM Narendra Modi was right in saying that Gandhi was "corrupt number one".

headlines: Man who slapped Kejriwal sent to 2-day judicial custody
text: Suresh Chauhan, the man who slapped Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal during a roadshow in Delhi has been sent to two-day judicial custody. Earlier on Saturday, Delhi police had registered an FIR under IPC Section 323 (punishment for voluntarily causing hurt) against him. Suresh had climbed on the bonnet of a vehicle that Kejriwal was riding on and had slapped him.

headlines: Saudi prince freed 850 jailed Indians after my request: PM Modi
text: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said that Saudi Arabia Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman accepted to release 850 Indians lodged in its jails after he requested him. "I requested him to release prisoners so they can come home for Ramadan. He...released them even before Ramadan," PM Modi added. Saudi Crown Prince had ordered the release of prisoners on February 20.

headlines: Voting begins for 51 seats in 5th phase of 17th Lok Sabha elections
text: Voting for the fifth phase of the 17th Lok Sabha elections has begun today. The phase covers 51 Lok Sabha constituencies across seven states including Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, West Bengal, Bihar, Jharkhand and J&K. Over 96,088 polling booths are in place for smooth conduct of polls, while 8.76 crore registered voters will decide the fate of 674 candidates.

headlines: Death toll in Russian passenger plane fire rises to 41
text: Forty-one people on board a Russian Aeroflot passenger plane were killed on Sunday, including two children, after the aircraft caught fire as it made an emergency landing at Moscow's Sheremetyevo airport. Aeroflot said the aircraft's engines caught fire after the emergency landing. "The crew did everything to rescue passengers...Unfortunately, it was not possible to save everyone," it added.

headlines: At least 13 killed as passenger plane catches fire mid-air in Russia
text: At least 13 people on board an Aeroflot passenger plane were killed on Sunday when the plane caught fire mid-air and made an emergency landing at an airport in Russian capital Moscow. The plane was said to be carrying as many as 78 passengers, with many of them escaping via emergency slides. Officials are investigating the incident.

headlines: As a mother, I had to be strong: Soni on Shaheen's depression
text: Actress Soni Razdan, while speaking about her daughter Shaheen Bhatt who suffered from depression, said as a mother she had to be strong to "take the right action to help Shaheen and to heal her". "Whether it is Alia or Shaheen, at any point in time, if they are suffering, I am the one who gets affected badly," she added.

headlines: Endgame fastest movie to gross $2 billion, achieves feat in 11 days
text: 'Avengers: Endgame' has become the fastest film to gross $2 billion, taking just 11 days to achieve the feat. The previous record was set by 'Avatar', which surpassed the $2-billion mark in 47 days from its release. Overall, 'Avengers: Endgame' is the fifth film to gross $2 billion after 'Avatar', 'Avengers: Infinity War', 'Star Wars: The Force Awakens' and 'Titanic'.

headlines: SRH 1st team to reach IPL playoffs with 12 points as MI beat KKR
text: Mumbai Indians defeated Kolkata Knight Riders by nine wickets on Sunday to finish the league stage of an IPL edition on top of the points table for the third time. With the defeat, Kolkata Knight Riders got eliminated from IPL 2019, while SunRisers Hyderabad became the first ever team to advance to playoffs in an IPL edition with 12 points.

headlines: No change in poll timings during Ramzan, says Election Commission
text: The Election Commission has rejected a plea seeking rescheduling of the commencement of voting from 7 am to 4:30 am/5 am during the month of Ramzan, calling the move "infeasible". On Thursday, a Supreme Court bench had asked EC to decide on the plea seeking change in poll timings for the fifth, sixth, and seventh phase of Lok Sabha elections.

headlines: Afridi may be 36, 37 years old, but he is 16 mentally: Gambhir
text: Cricketer-turned-politician Gautam Gambhir has said ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi may be 36, 37 years old but he is 16 mentally. Further, reacting to Afridi's remarks that he doesn't have any great records, Gambhir said, "My records are in open. People will decide what I've done for India." Earlier, Gambhir had said he would take Afridi to a psychiatrist in India.

headlines: US farming startup starts selling vegetables grown by robot
text: Iron Ox has said it has started selling lettuce and basil grown by its robots at a nearby California-based store. The startup, which launched last October, said robot farms can be located nearer to customers and save transportation cost because of their smaller physical footprint. Iron Ox uses AI-powered robot arms to tend crops, however, seeds are sown by humans.

headlines: NASA lander captures blue Mars sunset, sunrise; shares pics
text: NASA has released images of sunrise and sunset on Mars captured by its InSight lander in April. The events would appear blue to the human eye as fine Martian dust is the right size to let blue light penetrate the atmosphere more efficiently. The Sun on Mars appears to be only two-thirds the size compared to when viewed from Earth.

headlines: Rajasthan man returns home after spending 6 years in Pakistan jail
text: A man named Jugraj Bheel returned to his home in Bundi district in Rajasthan six years after he mistakingly crossed the international border along with Pakistan. He got lost in a jungle bordering Pakistan and was arrested after he crossed the international border. Since early June last year, there was no information about his whereabouts.

headlines: We picked Ishant based on his tremendous Test form: Kaif
text: Delhi Capitals' assistant coach Mohammad Kaif said that pacer Ishant Sharma has been a 'big' factor in the side's success this year and that he was picked based on his 'tremendous' Test form for India. Sharma had gone unsold last season after having managed to pick a total of seven wickets in his last four IPL seasons.

headlines: Country's security 'supreme priority' for BJP: Amit Shah
text: Addressing a rally in Haryana's Panipat, BJP President Amit Shah said the country's security will remain the saffron party's "supreme priority". Terming infiltrators as "termites", Shah added that the BJP government was committed to "throw out" all infiltrators. He further said that the BJP-led government will make Haryana "number one state" in North India in ease of doing business.

headlines: Cong suspends Shakeel Ahmad for contesting polls independently
text: The Congress on Sunday suspended its ex-MP Shakeel Ahmad from the party for contesting independently from Bihar's Madhubani parliamentary constituency. Ahmad had filed his nomination in two sets as a Congress candidate and an independent and withdrew the former after the party declined his request for allotting its symbol. The Congress also suspended Benipatti MLA Bhavana Jha from the party.

headlines: Not here for vendetta politics, but to serve people: Sunny Deol
text: Actor and BJP candidate from Punjab's Gurdaspur parliamentary constituency Sunny Deol on Sunday said that he has joined politics to serve the people and not for vendetta politics. He added that he wouldn't give any importance to settling scores but to developmental issues. The 62-year-old further said that his focus will be to usher in multi-faceted development of the constituency.

headlines: Chelsea reach third spot with win over Watford
text: Chelsea reached the third spot in the Premier League table after beating Watford 3-0 at the Stamford Bridge on Sunday. The win came after goals from Ruben Loftus-Cheek, David Luiz, and Gonzalo Higuain, with assists for the first two goals coming from Eden Hazard. Chelsea are a place and point above Tottenham Hotspur.

headlines: Diaz scores brace for Real Madrid in win vs Villarreal
text: Mariano Diaz scored a brace in Real Madrid's 3-2 win over Villarreal in the La Liga on Sunday. The match also witnessed Jesus Vallejo score his first goal for Real Madrid, who were playing without Karim Benzema. Real Madrid have now registered five wins in a row at their home stadium.

headlines: No crime in Huawei leak: UK police after defence secy sacked
text: The British police has said the leak of information from UK's National Security Council that recently led to defence secretary Gavin Williamson's firing didn't constitute a crime, and declined to investigate the matter. The leak claimed that China's Huawei had been allowed to develop UK's 5G network. Williamson denied leaking discussions and had sought police investigation to clear his name.

headlines: IMF official replaces fired Pak central bank Guv amid rescue talks
text: Pakistan on Sunday named International Monetary Fund (IMF) economist Reza Baqir as the Governor of the State Bank of Pakistan. Tariq Bajwa, who had previously held the post, was fired along with the head of the tax collection body on Friday, owing to their "performance". The appointment comes amid Pakistan's bailout negotiations with the IMF.

headlines: People are mean, obnoxious: Actress on man calling Pandya 'Kaalu'
text: After actress Krystle D'Souza shared a picture of herself with cricketer Hardik Pandya on Instagram, a user named Sameer commented, "Kaalu bhai. Aap West Indies team ke world cup squad main select kyun nahi huye?" "People are so mean and obnoxious and just because they're sitting behind a screen typing, they think they can get away with anything," Krystle responded.

headlines: Stop it, you don't need to explain: Kher to Akshay on citizenship row
text: Following Akshay Kumar's tweet wherein he wrote he has never hidden the fact that he holds a Canadian passport, actor Anupam Kher supported the actor and wrote, "Stop it!...You are a doer. You don't need to explain to anybody." "Their real profession is to make people like you & me feel defensive for talking in favour of India," he added.

headlines: KXIP beat CSK as RCB finish last in IPL for 2nd time in 3 years
text: KXIP defeated CSK by six wickets in the IPL 2019 on Sunday. The match witnessed KXIP opener KL Rahul slam the third fastest fifty of the season off 19 balls despite opening his account on the sixth delivery he faced. With KXIP's victory, RCB slipped to the eighth position, finishing last in IPL for second time in last three years.

headlines: Windies record ODI cricket's first-ever 350+ run opening stand
text: Windies' John Campbell and Shai Hope recorded ODI cricket history's first-ever 350-plus run opening stand after sharing 365 runs for the first wicket against Ireland on Sunday. The previous highest opening stand in ODI cricket of 304 runs was recorded by Pakistan's Fakhar Zaman and Imam-ul-Haq against Zimbabwe last year. Overall, it was ODI cricket's second-highest partnership for any wicket.

headlines: Feminists can say what they want: Afridi on no cricket for daughters
text: Former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi, in his book, said that he has given permission to his four daughters to play any sport as long as they are indoors. "Cricket is not for my girls," he added. "The feminists can say what they want; as a conservative Pakistani father, I have made my decision," he further said.

headlines: Facebook bans breast cancer fundraising ads over nudity, criticised
text: Facebook was criticised after it banned Breast Cancer Network Australia's fundraising ads featuring topless cancer survivors covering themselves with baked goods, citing nudity rules. Facebook said it rejected the ads because they didn't contain messages like educating people about the disease. "It's not nudity...it's a reality for so many...I will never be ashamed of my scars," said a survivor.

headlines: 165 arrested from rave party in Coimbatore; ganja, hashish seized
text: As many as 165 youngsters were arrested for using drugs at a rave party which took place at a resort near Pollachi in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore district. The police confiscated ganja, MDMA, cocaine, hashish and banned sedative tablets from the venue. The police revealed the party had been convened over social media and was pitched as a 24-hour weekend celebration.

headlines: Robbing them of future: Israel shares pics of kids with toy guns
text: Amid the cross-border violence between Israel and Palestinian militant group Hamas, Israel Defence Forces (IDF) shared images of Palestinian children with toy guns in a kindergarten, which they claimed was run by Hamas. "Hamas is robbing the children of Gaza of their future," IDF captioned the pictures. Since Saturday, Hamas militants have fired more than 400 rockets at Israel.

headlines: Plane on fire makes emergency landing in Russia, all 78 evacuated
text: A Russian Aeroflot Sukhoi Superjet aircraft made an emergency landing at Moscow's Sheremetyevo International Airport on Sunday while being on fire. According to officials, all 78 passengers were evacuated from the plane, while five people were reported to be injured. Russian state TV showed footage of the plane with black smoke rising above its tail.

headlines: Who is Ajit Jain, possible successor to Buffett's $500bn company?
text: Odisha-born Ajit Jain is a former McKinsey executive who joined Berkshire Hathaway in 1986 and currently heads the insurance division of the $500-billion company. The 67-year-old holds a B.Tech from IIT Kharagpur and MBA from Harvard. Berkshire's 88-year-old CEO Warren Buffett recently said Jain, promoted to Board last year, would join him to answer shareholders' questions in the near future.

headlines: I've learnt a lot from Kohli, ABD: RCB's Hetmyer after win vs SRH
text: Royal Challengers Bangalore's Windies cricketer Shimron Hetmyer, who hit a match-winning 75 runs off 47 balls against SunRisers Hyderabad, said that he has learnt a lot from Virat Kohli and AB de Villiers. "I am just trying to take my game one step at a time and just try to move up in whatever way I can," Hetmyer added.

headlines: SP-BSP alliance will decide new PM of India: Akhilesh Yadav
text: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav asserted confidence that the SP-BSP alliance will decide the next Central government and the new Prime Minister of India after the general elections. Criticising PM Narendra Modi, Yadav said, "He's 180 degrees PM and...does just the opposite of whatever he says." He accused BJP of using central agencies to target opponents.

headlines: Cong accuses BJP of misusing govt vehicles for campaigning
text: The Congress approached the Election Commission accusing the BJP of misusing government vehicles for campaigning in Uttar Pradesh's Raebareli. Raebareli Congress in-charge KL Sharma said, "A government vehicle was caught in Bachhrawan police station area in which there was publicity material of BJP candidate Rita Bahuguna." The administration isn't taking adequate actions on complaints, he added.

headlines: Sylvester Stallone happy to share UFC equity with McGregor
text: Hollywood actor Sylvester Stallone has said that he would be happy to share his UFC equity with Irish MMA fighter and wrestler Conor McGregor. McGregor had earlier jokingly offered to fight Hollywood actor Mark Wahlberg and US talk show host Conan O'Brien for their UFC shares. McGregor hasn't fought in the UFC since his UFC 229 defeat to Khabib Nurmagomedov.
